column2: IN: Haryana Power System Improv Project
column4: Procurement Of Plant Supply & Installation Testing And Commissioning Of New Ht Lines For Hvds System Strengthening & Segregation Of Industrial Load From Mixed Load Feeders (bifurcation Of 11 Kv Feeders) Under Three (3) Packages
column12: vidyut Sadan Vidyut Nagar
column18: INVITATION FOR BIDS (IFB) INDIA (INTERNATIONAL COMPETITIVE BIDDING) DATE OF ISSUANCE OFIFB : 16.12.2011 Project ID. P110051. IFB No. WB/2009/G-05 (Packages A B & C) 1.0 Govt. of India has received a loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction andDevelopment (IBRD) in various currencies towards the cost of "Haryana Power SystemImprovement Project (HPSI)". It is intended that part of the proceeds of this loan will be applied to eligible payments underthe contract for plant supply installation testing & commissioning of new HT lines for HVDS and System Strengthening and Segregation ofindustrial load frommixed load feeders by Bifurcating existing 11 kV feeders in FaridabadCity (Haryana-India). 2.0 Dakshin Haryana Bijli Vitran Nigam (DHBVN) now invites sealed bids from eligible bidders for theconstruction and completion of following works:- Procurement of plant supply & installation testingand commissioning of new HT lines for HVDS System Strengthening & Segregationof Industrial load from Mixed load feeders(Bifurcation of 11 kV Feeders) under three (3) packages explained as under: Package G-05 (A) Supply and Installation of new HT line for HVDS (9 nos. feeders) andSystem strengthening (Bifurcation of overloaded 27 nos. 11 kV feeders and Segregation of industrialload from mixed load feeders) under jurisdictional area of NIT Division in Faridabad City using Aerial Bunched Cables and/or ACSRas per site requirements. Package G-05 (B) Supply and Installation of new HT line for HVDS (13 nos. feeders)andSystem strengthening (Bifurcation of overloaded 34 nos. 11 kV feeders and Segregation ofindustrial load from mixed load feeders) under jurisdictional area of Old Faridabad Division in Faridabad City using Aerial BunchedCables and/or ACSR as per site requirements. Package G-05 (C) Supply and Installation of new HT line for HVDS (10 nos. feeders)andSystem strengthening (Bifurcation of overloaded 35 nos. 11 kV feeders and Segregation ofindustrial load from mixed load feeders) under jurisdictional area of Ballabhgarh Division in Faridabad City using Aerial BunchedCables and/or ACSR as per site requirements. 3.0 Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information from and inspect the bidding documentsat the office of Chief Engineer /Planning & Design Vidyut Sadan Vidyut Nagar Hisar (Haryana) India Tel.-01662-223187 & Fax: 01662 ? 223181 Bidders may note that the bids are being invited on a slice and package basis. Bidders can bid for PackageG-05(A) or Package G-05(B) or Package G-05(C) or any two or all the three Packages G-05(A) G-05(B) & G-05(C). 4.0 A complete set of bidding documents in English may be purchased by interested bidders on the submission of a written application to TheBidding Documents can also be downloaded from the DHBVN website www.dhbvn.com. In this case the cost of Bidding Document should be submitted in separate envelope in theshape of demand draft of a non-refundable fee of INR 15000 or US $ 300 payable to Accounts Officer/cash Dakshin Haryana BijliVitran Nigam (DHBVN) Hisar while submitting the bid. In casethe bid is submitted by the bidder along with the required bid security but without the bid cost then the bids of such bidderwillalso be opened and the bidder would be asked to submit the required bid cost promptly. 5.0 The provision in the instructions to bidders and in the General Conditions of Contract are the provisions of the bank standard bidding document: Procurement of Plant Design Supply and Installation. 6.0 Bids duly filled in must be delivered to the office of Chief Engineer / Planning & Design Vidyut SadanVidyut Nagar DHBVN Hisar on or before 10.30 hrs (IST) on 17.02.2012and must be accompanied by the bid security of 7.0 Bids will be opened at 11.00 A.M on 17.02.2012 in the presence of bidders representatives who choose toattend in the o/o Chief Engineer / Planning & Design Vidyut Sadan VidyutNagar Hisar (Haryana) India Tel.-01662-223187 & Fax: 01662 ? 223181 8.0 All correspondence with regard to the above shall be addressed to the Chief Engineer / Planning & Design DHBVN at the address mentioned below: (By Post/In Person) Chief Engineer/ Planning & Design Vidyut Sadan Vidyut NagarHISAR (Haryana) India Tel.-01662-223187 & Fax: 01662 ? 223181 rkbatradhbvn@gmail.com

B.RajagopalReddy Chief Engineer (R&B) CRN & Managing Director APRDC ======================================================= Procurement Notice GOVERNMENT OF ANDHRA PRADESH ANDHRAPRADESH ROAD SECTOR PROJECT INVITATION FOR BIDS (IFB) INTERNATIONAL COMPETITIVE BIDDING(ICB) Loan No: 7792-IN SPN No. 6 /APRDC/ APRSP-W&S/ MJ-04/2011 Dt: 09.08.2011. This invitation for bids follows the General Procurement Notice (GPN)for thisproject which was published in the UNDB online on 20 th December 2005 andupdated on June 18 2010. The Government of Andhra Pradesh through the Government of India has received aloan from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) towards the cost of the Andhra Pradesh Road SectorProject and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan to payments under the contract for Widening and Strengthening of Mydukuru-Jammalamadugu r oad from Km.177/400 to Km.194/670 in Kadapa district A.P  Package No: APRDC/APRSP/ICB/MJ-04. The Chief Engineer (R&B) Core Road Network & ManagingDirector Andhra Pradesh Road Development Corporation Hyderabad now invites sealed bids from eligible biddersfor the followingwork. PackageNo. Name of Work Length APRDC/ APRSP/ICB/MJ-04 Widening and Strengthening of Mydukuru-Jammalamadugu r oad from Km.177/400 to Km.194/670 in Kadapa district A.P. 17.270 Kms The road works consist of widening and strengthening of existing Intermediate/ two lanes to standard 4-Lane road dividedcarriageway 7.25m (CW) + 2.5m earthen shoulder (ES) and 1.2m wide median with over all roadway width of 20.70 m with longitudinaldrain on both sides and newconstruction in realigned sections roadway. The work also consists ofwidening the existing intermediatelane to 2 lane and forming a 2-lane by-pass / re-alignment having carriageway of 7.00 m (CW) + 2.5m earthen shoulder (ES) and overall roadway width of 12.00 m with longitudinal drains on both sides. The cross drainage works include reconstruction and wideningof culverts and bridges. Some new structures may alsobe constructed based on requirement. The items of work include EarthworksGranular Sub-base Wet Mix Macadam Dense Bituminous Macadam Bituminous Concrete Plain/ Reinforced Cement Concrete Wellfoundations Protection works Concrete Lined Drains Road Furniture and other miscellaneous works. Miscellaneous works includesprovision of protection measures for cut slope construction of retaining walls breast walls and wing walls road furniture etc.Environmental and Social management aspects also form a component of the project. Theconstruction period is 24 months. Bidding will be conducted through the International Competitive Bidding (ICB)procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDACredits May 2004 revised October 2006 & May 2010 and is open to bidders from all countries as defined in theguidelines. Bidders are advised to note the minimum qualification criteria specified inSection III of bidding documents to qualify for award of the contracts. Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information from and inspect thebidding documents at the Office of the Chief Engineer (R&B) CRN & Managing Director A.P. Road Development Corporation5 th floor R&B complex Mahavir Marg A.C.Guards Hyderabad Andhra Pradesh  India from10:30 A.M to 5:00 P.M on working days from 22-08-2011 to 10-10-2011. A complete set of bidding documents (and additional copies) in English may be purchased by interested eligible bidders on the submission ofa written application to the addressgiven below and upon payment of a non refundable fee through two separate DD/Bankers cheque one for Rs.25000/- or US $ 560 in favour of PAO(W&P) Hyderabad towards cost of bid document and another towards sales tax(VAT) @ 10.3% ( Rs.2575/- or US $ 60) drawn in favour of CTO Khairatabad Hyderabad. This mode of payment shall be in the form of DD for domesticbiddersand in the form of Bankers cheque in case of foreign bidders. Bidding documents requested by mail will be dispatched byregistered/speed post/courier on payment of an extra amount of Rs.1000/- for domestic shipping and Rs.5000/- or US$115 for overseas shipping per each document through a DD/Bankers chequedrawn in favour of Chief Engineer (R&B) CRN & Managing Director APRDC payableat Hyderabad . The Chief Engineer (R&B) CRN & Managing Director APRDC will not be held responsible for the postal/courier delay if anyin the delivery of the documents or non-receipt of the same. Bids must be delivered in sealed envelopes to the address below on orbefore12:30 P.M on 11-10-2011 . All bids must be accompanied by a Bid Security ofRupees (INR) 6530000 or USD 145000. Late bids will be rejected. Bids will be opened at 1:00 PM in the presence of biddersrepresentatives who wish to attend the opening of bids at the address below A pre-bid meeting will be held on 12-09-2011 at 11:30 A.M at theOffice of The Chief Engineer (R&B) CRN & Managing Director A.P.R.D.C. 5 th floor R&B complex Mahavir Marg A.C.Guards Hyderabad Andhra Pradesh India to clarify the issues and to answer questions on any matter that maybe raised at that stage as stated in Clause 7.4of Instructions to Bidders of the bidding document. Other details can be seen in the bidding documents. Copies of the bidding documents are also available for referenceat the office of the Project Director at the address given below. Address of Bid Submission: Office of The Chief Engineer (R&B) CRN & Managing Director A.P. Road Development Corporation 5 th floor R&B complex Mahavir Marg A.C.Guards Hyderabad- 500 004 Andhra Pradesh  India. Tel No : 91-40-23300462 Fax No: 91-40-23301196. E-mail: mdaprdc@yahoo.com Sd/- B.Rajagopal Reddy Chief Engineer(R&B) CRN & Managing Director APRDC

ROAD DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION Procurement Notice GOVERNMENT OF ANDHRA PRADESH ANDHRA PRADESH ROAD SECTOR PROJECT INVITATION FOR BIDS (IFB) INTERNATIONAL COMPETITIVE BIDDING(ICB) Loan No: 7792-IN SPN No. 22/APRDC/ APRSP-W&S /KR-7/2012 Dt: 30.3.2012. This invitation for bids follows the General Procurement Notice (GPN)for this project which was publishedin the UNDB online on 20 th December 2005 and updated on June 182010. The Government of Andhra Pradesh through the Government of India has received a loan from the InternationalBank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) towards the cost of the Andhra Pradesh Road Sector Project and it intends to applypart of the proceeds of this loan to payments under the contract for Widening and Strengthening of Kakinada-Rajahmundry road in East Godavari district A.P  Package No: APRDC/APRSP/ICB/KR-07. The Chief Engineer (R&B) Core Road Network &Managing Director Andhra Pradesh Road Development Corporation Hyderabad now invitessealed bids from eligible bidders for thefollowing work. Package No. Name of Work Length APRDC/ APRSP/ICB/ KR-07 Widening and Strengtheningof Kakinada ? Rajahmundry Road from Km0/0to 61/600 in East Godavari district A.P. 61.600 Kms The road works consist of widening and strengthening of existing two lanes to standard 4-lane divided carriageway with 2.5mearthen shoulders and 2-Lane+ 1.5m paved shoulders +1.0m earthen shoulder (ES) with longitudinal drain on both sides and newconstruction in realigned and bye pass sections of roadway . The cross drainage works includereconstruction and widening of culverts and bridges. Some new structures may also beconstructed based on requirement. The items of work include Earthworks Granular Sub-base Wet Mix Macadam Dense BituminousMacadam Bituminous Concrete Plain/ Reinforced Cement Concrete Open and Pile foundations Protection works Lined Drains RoadFurniture and other miscellaneous works. Miscellaneous works includes provision ofprotection measures for cut slope construction of retaining walls breast walls and wing wallsroad furniture etc. Environmentaland Social management aspects alsoform a component of the project. The construction periodis 36 months. Bidding will be conducted through the International Competitive Bidding (ICB) procedures specified in theWorld Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits May 2004 (revisedOctober 2006) and is open to bidders from all countries as defined in the guidelines. Bidders are advised to note the minimum qualification criteria specified in Section III of biddingdocuments to qualify for award of the contracts. Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information from and inspect the bidding documents at theOffice of The Chief Engineer (R&B) CRN & Managing Director A.P. Road Development Corporation 5 th floor R&B complex  Mahavir Marg  A.C.Guards Hyderabad Andhra Pradesh  India from 10:30 A.M to 5:00 P.M on working days from 10.04.2012 to 25.05.2012. Acomplete set of bidding documents (and additional copies) in English may bepurchased by interested eligible bidders on the submission ofa written application to the address given below and upon payment of anon refundable fee through DD/Bankers cheque Rs. 28625/- ( Towards cost of Bid document Rs. 25000/- & towards sales tax (VAT) @ 14.5 % Rs. 3625/-) or US$573/- (Towardscost of bid document US $ 500 & towards sales tax (VAT) @ 14.5% US $ 73) in favourofPay and Accounts Officer (Works &Projects) Hyderabad payable at Hyderabad. This mode of payment shall be in the form of DD for domestic biddersand in the form of Bankers cheque in case of foreignbidders. Bids must be delivered in sealed envelopes to the address below on orbefore 12:30 P.M on 26.05.2012 . All bids must be accompanied by a Bid Security ofRupees (INR) 28700000/- or USD 574000. Late bids will be rejected. Bids will be opened at 1:00 PMin the presence of bidders representatives who wish to attend the opening of bids at the address below. A pre-bidmeeting will be held on 01.05.2012 at 11:30 A.M at the Office of The Chief Engineer (R&B) CRN & Managing Director A.P.R.D.C. 5 th floor R&Bcomplex Mahavir Marg  A.C.Guards Hyderabad AndhraPradesh  India toclarify the issues and to answer questions on any matter that maybe raised at that stage as stated in Clause 7.4 of Instructions to Bidders of the bidding document. column18: GOVERNMENT OF ANDHRA PRADESH REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTINGSERVICES- FIRMS SELECTION) COUNTRY : INDIA PROJECTNAME : ANDHRA PRADESH MUNICIPAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT(APMDP) Loan No. : 7816-IN Assignment Title : "To Set Up Project Management Unit (PMU) To Plan Implement andMonitor E- Governance Projects in Urban Local Bodies in AndhraPradesh". REOI No.7 Dated: 9 th March 2012. The Government of India hasreceived financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Andhra Pradesh Municipal Development Project(APMDP) andintends to apply part of the proceeds for consulting services. The consulting services ("the Services") include consultancy for the following consultancyassignment: "TO SET UPPROJECT MANAGEMENT UNIT (PMU) TO PLAN IMPLEMENT AND MONITOR E- GOVERNANCE PROJECTS INURBAN LOCALBODIES IN ANDHRA PRADESH". (Note: The Assignment is of 36 months duration. There aretotal of 149 Urban Local Bodies in this assignment spread over the entire state.) The Commissioner and Director of Municipal Administration MA&UD Department Govt. of AndhraPradesh Hyderabad now invites eligible consulting firms ("Consultants") to indicate theirinterest in providing the Services. Interested consultants should provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Service. The short listing criteria are: The firm should have atleast 10yearsstanding in the field of consultancy. Relevant experience in the last5 years with clear documentary evidence of the leadfirm. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to the paragraph 1.9of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers May 2004 revisedOctober 2006 & May 2010 ( "Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policy onconflict of interest. Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a joint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the Quality and CostBased Selection (QCBS) method set out in theConsultant Guidelines. Further information can be obtained at the address below during office hours i.e.1030 to 1700hours. This Invitation for Bids follows the General Procurement Notice - wb2018 for this Project that appeared in Development Business date:08.05.2010. 2. The Andhra Pradesh Pollution ControlBoard Hyderabad now invites sealed bids from eligible and qualified bidders for supply installationand commissioning oflaboratory equipments. 4. column18: REQUEST FOREXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) Country : India Name of theproject : Capacity Building for Industrial Pollution Management Project (CBIPMP) Loan No.7924-IN/Credit No.4755-IN Assignment Title: Inventorization and characterization of Hazardous Waste categories Reference No. (As per Procurement Plan): 1A1.1 The Government ofIndia Ministry of Finance has received financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Capacity Building for Industrial Pollution Management Project (CBIPMP) and intends toapply part of the proceeds for consulting services. Brief description of the consulting services: The Andhra Pradesh Pollution Control Board proposes to addto the project the creation of an Inventory of all the industries and an inventory of Hazardous waste generating industries in theState of Andhra Pradesh which should be geo-referenced. The main aim of the project is to (i)create a database and introduceor apply a categorization system of industry types which takes into account their outputs mainrequired resources and main waste types andquantities generated; (ii) understand the spatial distribution of these industriesacross the State of Andhra Pradesh; (iii) create analytical algorithms to define the overall pollution potential of differentdistricts of Andhra Pradesh and (iv) advanced create an application ofthis database that enables optimum routing of solid wastestreams effluent treatment plants including common effluent treatment plants transport of effluents and use of commoninfrastructure for e.g. waste orwastewater treatment. This data is useful for effective decision making of the Board. The assignment shall be for a period of 12months. The Andhra Pradesh PollutionControl Board (APPCB) now invites eligible consulting firms ("Consultants") to indicate theirinterest in providing the Services. Interested Consultants should provide information demonstrating that they have the requiredqualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services. The shortlisting criteria are: 1).Background of the firm 2). Experience of the firm 3). Details of similar projectshandled 4).Qualification and experience of thekey experts. The attention ofinterested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loansand IDA Credits & Grants] by World BankBorrowers January 2011 ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict ofinterest Consultants mayassociate with other firms in the form of a joint venture or a sub consultancy to enhance their qualifications. A Consultant willbe selected in accordance with the Quality ? And Cost ? Based Selection (QCBS) method set out in the ConsultantGuidelines. Furtherinformation can be obtained at the address below during office hours 10.30 am to 05.00 PM. Expressions ofinterest must be delivered in a written form to the address below (in person or by mail or by fax or by e-mail) by 15 days fromdate of publication. Andhra PradeshPollution Control Board World Bank aided Capacity Building for Industrial Pollution Management Project(CBIPMP) A-3 Industrial Estate Sanathnagar Hyderabad- 500 018 Andhra Pradesh India. Attention : Project Director CBIPMP & Member Secretary APPCB Tel : 040-23887500 Facsimile : 040- 23887502 / 040- 23815631 E-mail: apcbipmp@gmail.com jces@pcb.ap.gov.in

column18: ROADS & BUILDINGS DEPARTMENT A.P. ROAD DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION Procurement Notice GOVERNMENTOFANDHRA PRADESH ANDHRA PRADESH ROAD SECTORPROJECT INVITATION FOR BIDS (IFB) INTERNATIONAL COMPETITIVE BIDDING (ICB) LoanNo: 7792-IN SPN No. 09/APRDC/ APRSP-W&S /KD-02/2014 Dt:22. 02.2014 Thisinvitation for bids follows the General Procurement Notice (GPN) for this project which was published in the UNDB online on 20 th December 2005 and updated on June 182010. The Governmentof Andhra Pradesh through the Government of India has received a loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction andDevelopment (IBRD) towards the cost of the Andhra Pradesh Road Sector Project and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of thisloan to payments under the contract for Widening and Strengthening of Kurnool-Devanakonda road (Balance Work) inKurnool district A.P Package No: APRDC/APRSP/ICB/KD-02. The Chief Engineer (R&B) Core Road Network &Managing Director Andhra Pradesh Road Development Corporation Hyderabad now invites sealed bids from eligiblebidders for thefollowing work. PackageNo. Name ofWork Length APRDC/APRSP/ICB/ KD-02 Widening and Strengthening of Kurnool ?Devanakonda Road from Km. 4/400 to 65/300 in Kurnool district A.P. (Balance Work) 4/4 to 42/0 = 37.60 Km 46.6 to 52/0 = 5.40 Km 55/6 to 65/3 = 9.70 Km. TOTAL = 52.70Km. The road work consists of widening andstrengthening of existing Single/Intermediate lane/two lanes to standard 2-lane carriage way 7.00m with 1.5m paved shoulder + 1.0mearthen shoulder / 2-lane carriageway 7.00 m with 2.5m earthen shoulder with longitudinal drain on both sides and new constructionin realigned sections roadway. The cross drainage works include reconstruction andwidening of culverts and bridges. Some new structures may alsobe constructed based on requirement. The items of work includesEarthworks Granular Sub-base Wet Mix Macadam Dense Bituminous Macadam Bituminous Concrete Plain/ Reinforced CementConcrete Protection works Concrete Lined DrainsRoad Furniture and othermiscellaneous works. Miscellaneous works include provision of protection measures for cut slope construction of retaining wallsbreast walls and wing walls road furniture etc. Environmental and Social management aspects also form a component of the project.The construction period is 30 months. Bidding willbe conducted through the International Competitive Bidding (ICB) procedures specifiedin the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits May 2004(revised October 2006) and is open to bidders from all countries as defined in the guidelines. Bidders areadvised to note the minimum qualification criteria specified in Section III of bidding documents to qualify for award of thecontracts. Interestedeligible bidders may obtain further information from and verify the bidding documents at the Office of The Chief Engineer (R&B)CRN & Managing Director A.P. Road Development Corporation 5 th floor  R&B complex  Mahavir Marg  A.C.GuardsHyderabad Andhra Pradesh Indiafrom 10:30A.M to 5:00 P.M on working days from 10.03.2014 to 24.04.2014. A complete set of bidding documents (and additional copies) in English maybe purchased by interested eligible bidders on submission of a writtenapplication to the address given below and upon payment of a non- refundable fee through DD/Bankers cheque Rs. 28625/- (towards cost of Bid document Rs.25000/- & towards sales tax (VAT) @ 14.5 % Rs. 3625/-) or US$573/- (towards cost of bid document US $ 500 & towards salestax (VAT) @ 14.5% US $ 73) in favour of Pay and Accounts Officer (Works&Projects) Hyderabad payable at Hyderabad. The mode of payment shall be inthe form of DD for domestic bidders and in the form of DD/Bankers cheque incase of foreign bidders. Bidding documents requested by mail willbe dispatched by registered/speed post/courier on payment of an extra amount of Rs. 2000/-for domestic shipping and Rs.5000/- or US$ 100 for overseas shipping per each document through a DD/Bankers cheque drawn in favour of Chief Engineer (R&B) CRN & Managing DirectorAPRDC payable at Hyderabad. The Chief Engineer (R&B) CRN & Managing DirectorAPRDC will not be held responsible for the postal/courierdelay if any in the delivery of the documents or non-receipt of the same. Bids must bedelivered in sealed envelopes to the address below on or before 12:30 P.M on 25.04.2014.All bids must beaccompanied by a BidSecurity of Rupees (INR) 11500000/- or USD192000. Late bids will berejected. Bids will be opened at 1:00 PMin the presence of bidders representatives who wish to attend the opening of bids at the address below. A pre-bid meeting will be held on 02.04.2014 at 11:30 A.M in the Office of The Chief Engineer(R&B) CRN & Managing Director A.P.R.D.C. 5 th floor R&B complex Mahavir Marg A.C.Guards HyderabadAndhra Pradesh India to clarify the issues and to answer questions on anymatter that may be raised at that stage as stated in Clause 7.4 of Instructions toBidders of the bidding document. Other details can be seen in thebidding documents. Copies of the bidding documents are also available for reference at the office of the Project Director at theaddress given below. On behalf of the PSU the PMC will coordinate its work with various agencies/teams such as the Design andSupervision Consultants procured by the Rural water supply department at District and State level Social Consultants / NGOsprocured by the project as well as with the District Collectors until November2014. 4. column18: GOVERNMENT OF ANDHRA PRADESH Roads & Buildings Department AMENDMENT NOTICE1 Amendment No.: 1/5/APRSP/RMS/GOODS/MFVSE dated May 25 2013 To IFB No.:5/APRSP/RMS/GOODS/MFVSEpublishedin UNDB Online on April 22 2013 The following amendment is issued in respectof the procurement notice IFB No.: 5/APRSP/RMS/GOODS/MFVSE published on April 222013 in UNDB Online for the "Procurement of Multi-Function Vehicle Mounted Survey Equipment (MFVMSE) and Falling Weight Deflectometer Equipment (FWD)forthe establishment of a Road Management System on the Andhra Pradesh State Road Network" under Andhra PradeshRoad Sector Project reproduced below. The last date of Issue of Bid documents is extended upto 5.00 P.M. on June 18 2013 Last date of receipt of Bids is on or before 3.00 P.M. on June 19 2013 Time and Date of Bid opening is 03.30 P.M. on June 19 2013 The remaining contents of the IFB remainunaltered. Country: India Name of Project: Andhra Pradesh Road SectorProject Loan / Credit Number: Loan 7792-IN IFB Title: Procurement of Multi-Function VehicleMounted Survey Equipment MFVMSE) and Falling Weight Deflectometer Equipment (FWD) for the establishment of a Road Management Systemon the Andhra Pradesh State Road Network. IFB Number:5 /APRSP/RMS/.GOODS/MFVSE/Dt.15-04-2013. 1.This Invitation for Bids follows the General Procurement Notice for this Project that was published in UNDB online on 20-12-2005and updated on 18-6-2010. 2. The Governmentof India has received a loan No. 7792-IN from the InternationalBank for Reconstruction and Development towards the cost of theAndhra Pradesh Road Sector Project and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan to payments under the Contract forProcurement of Multi-Function Vehicle Mounted Survey Equipment (MFVMSE) and Falling Weight Deflectometer Equipment (FWD) for theestablishment of a Road Management System on the Andhra Pradesh State Road Network. 3. The Chief Engineer (R&B) CRN & MDAPRDC on behalf of the Government ofAndhra Pradesh now invites sealed bids fromeligible and qualified bidders for the supply to the Purchasers offices in Hyderabad of the following road network datacollection equipment and related services with their respective Lot numbers: Lot1: 1 each. Multi-Function Vehicle Mounted SurveyEquipment (MFVMSE); including vehicle in which to mount the equipment auxiliary instruments and related services;and Lot2: 1 each. Falling Weight Deflectometer (FWD);including mounting trailer towing vehicle and related services. 4. Bidding will be conducted through the International Competitive Bidding (ICB) procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDACredits May 2004(revised October 2006) and is open to all bidders from All Countries as defined intheGuidelines. 5. Interestedeligible bidders may obtain further information from theChief Engineer (R&B) CRN & MD APRDC Hyderabad and inspect the Bidding Documents at the address given below from 10.30 A.M. to 5.00 P.M. on all working days from 20.04.2013 to 05.06.2013 Acomplete set of Bidding Documents in English may be purchased by interested bidders on the submissionof a written application tothe address given below and upon payment of a non-refundable fee through DD/Bankers cheque Rs. 11450/- (towards cost of bid document Rs. 10000/- and towardssales tax (VAT) @ 14.5% Rs. 1450/-) orUS $ 220/- (towards cost of bid document US $ 192/- and towards sales tax (VAT) @ 14.5% US $ 28/-) infavour of Pay and Accounts Officer (Works &Projects) Hyderabad payable at Hyderabad. This mode of payment shall be in the form of DD for domestic bidders and inthe form of Bankers cheque in case of foreign bidders. Bidding documents requested by mail will be dispatched byregistered/speed post/courier on payment of an extra amount of Rs. 2000/- for domestic shipping and Rs.5000/- or US $ 100 for overseasshipping per each document through a DD/Bankers cheque drawn in favour ofChief Engineer (R&B) CRN & Managing Director APRDC payable at Hyderabad. TheChief Engineer (R&B) CRN & Managing Director APRDC will not be held responsible for thepostal/courier delay if anyin the delivery of the documents or non-receipt of the same. 6. A pre-bid meeting will be held on 13.05.2013 at 11.30 AM at the venue: Office of Andhra Pradesh Road Development Corporation (APRDC)5 th Floor R&B Complex Mahaveer Marg AC Guards Hyderabad to clarify the issues and to answer questions on anymatter that may be raised at that stage asstated in Clause 7.1 ofInstructions to Bidders" of the Bidding document. 7. Qualifications requirements include: Financial Turnover and Experience ? The Bidder shall furnish documentary evidence that it meets the followingfinancial requirement(s): (i) The Bidder shall have achieved a minimum average annual turnover of INR 150 million or US$ 3 million in the last 3 yearsnamely 2010-2011 to 2012-2013 (ii) The bidder shall have supplied installed andcommissioned satisfactorily a minimum 3 numbers of equipment similar to the type specified under Lot 1 and Lot 2 in the Schedule of Requirements duringthe last three years namely 2010-2011 to2012-2013 which must be in satisfactory operation for at least 6 months on the date of bidopening. (iii) The bidder shall have the experience of providing annual maintenance services in at least one centre of theequipmentinstallations for minimum one year. Amargin of preference for certain goods manufactured domestically shall not be applied. Additional details are provided in theBidding Documents. 9. Bids must bedelivered in sealed envelopes to the address below at or before 3.00 PM on 06.06.2013. All bids must be accompanied by a Bid-Security of Rs.(INR) 630000/- OR US$12600.Electronic bidding will not bepermitted. Late bids will be rejected. Bids will beopened at 3.30 PM on 06.06.2013in the presence of the bidders representatives who wish to attend the opening of the bids at the addressbelow. 10. The address(es) referred toabove is(are): The Chief Engineer (R&B) CRN & MD APRDC Address: 5th Floor R&B Complex Mahaveer Marg AC Guards City: Hyderabad ZIP Code: 500 004 Country: Andhra Pradesh India Telephone:+91 (40) 23300462 Facsimile number: +91 (40) 23301196 Electronic mail address: mdaprdc@yahoo.com

column18: e-Procurement Notice ARMOOR MUNICIPALITY Andhra Pradesh MunicipalDevelopment Project INVITATIONS FOR BIDS (IFB) INTERNATIONAL COMPETITIVE BIDDING (ICB) Loan No. 78160-IN IFB No. 324/13/APMDP/Armr Mplty Dt: 30-03-2013 1. This invitation for bids follows the General ProcurementNotice (GPN) for this Project which was published in the UNDBonline Dated 31 st July 2009 of Notice No. WB2838-755. 2. TheGovernment of Andhra Pradesh through Government of India has received a loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction &Development (IBRD) in various currencies towards the cost of Andhra Pradesh Municipal Development Project (APMDP). It is intendedthat part of the proceeds of this loanwill be applied to eligible payments under the contract forproviding Comprehensive Water supply Service Improvements in ArmoorMunicipality (Package-I). 3. TheCommissioner Armoor Municipality invites item rates bids from the eligible bidders in electronic procurement system for theconstruction and completion of Comprehensive Water supply Service Improvements in Armoor Municipality (Package-I) consisting of the following main components.  Construction of 10 m dia. intake well cum pump house in Sri Ram Sagar Lake  Construction of 11.5 MLD WTP at Yanamgutta  500 mm dia. DI Raw Water Pumping main from Intake well to WTP oftoatal length 19 Kms.  Construction of 3 no. of ELSRs of total capacity 1350KL  Distrubution& Feeder pipelines (DI/HDPE) of total length 150Kms. 4. "Bidding will be conducted through the International Competitive Bidding procedures asspecified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement of Goods Works and Non-Consulting Services under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits& Grants January 2011 by World Bank Borrowers ("Procurement Guidelines") andis open to all eligible bidders as defined in the Procurement Guidelines. In addition please refer to paragraphs 1.6 and 1.7setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict of interest." 5. Bidders are advised to note theminimum qualification criteria specified in Section III of the Bidding document toqualify for the award of contract. 6. Interested eligible biddersmay obtain furtherinformation from the e-procurement portal http://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/app in TenderSearch by entering key word APMDPand also from the Project website www.apmdp.gov.in by navigating through eProcurement (Goods & Works) 7. Thecomplete set of bid documents is available onlinefrom 30-03-201311:00 AM (IST) onwards. The bids may be viewed downloaded andsubmitted online through the portal http://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/app. Bids submitted manually will not beaccepted. The bidders would be required to register in the web-site. Bidders who are not registered may obtain the User ID andPassword for participating in the bids by registering in the website: http://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/app free of charge. 8. Forsubmitting bids the bidders are required to have Digital Signature Certificate (DSC) issued from any of the authorized CertifyingAuthorities. Foreign bidders from eligible countries may obtain Class-II DSC from the Certifying Authorities following theprocedure described in the Downloads option in the e-procurement portalhttp://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/app. 9. BidSecurity: INR 8.68 million (USD 174000) Bid security will have to be in any one of the forms as specified in the bidding document and shall have tobe valid for 45 days beyond the validity of the bid. 10. Thebidders are required to submit (a) original bid security in approved form and (b) original power of Attorney authorizing the person to sign the bids on behalf of the bidderas per Clause 20 of ITB of bidding document in the Office of theCommissionerArmoor Municipality Armor Dist.Nizamabad Pin code 503 224 Andhra Pradesh (India)on or before the date and time ofopening of Bids either by registered post or by hand failing which the bids shall be declarednon-responsive. i) The above documents may besubmitted in one envelope. The bidders shall not write their names or addresses on this envelope. ii) The number mentioned on acknowledgement of online submission of the bid bythe biddershall be mentioned on envelope containing the documents as detailed above. 11. A pre-bid meeting will be held on 10-04-2013 at 11:00 AM (IST) at the office of Commissioner Armoor Municipality Armoor Andhra Pradesh (India) toclarify the issues and to answer questions on any matter that may be raised at that stage as stated in Clause 7.4 of Instructionsto Bidders of the bidding document. 12. The last Date and time for receipt of bids through the e-procurement portal http://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/app is 15-05-2013 upto 5:00 PM (IST). Bids will be opened in thepresenceof the bidders representatives who choose to attend on 20-05-2013 at 11:00 AM (IST) in the office of Commissioner Armor Municipality Armoor Andhra Pradesh (India). If the office happens to be closed onthe date of opening of the bids as specified thebids will be opened on the next working day at the same time andvenue. 13. Thereis no margin of preference to the domestic bidders. 14. Other details can be seen in the bidding documents. The Employer shall not be held liable for any delays due to systemfailure beyond its control. Even though the system will attempt to notify the bidders of any bid updates The Employer shall not beliable for any information not received by the bidder. It isthe bidders responsibility to verify the website for the latestinformation related to the tender. 15. The address for communication is as under: Name & Designation of Officer:Commissioner Office Address: Armoor Municipality ArmoorPIN ? 503224 Dist. Nizamabad Andhra Pradesh-INDIA. Telephone: +918463222231 Email:municipality_armoor@rediffmail.com

column4: Consulting Services- For Capacity Building In Road Safety Management
column12: Chandmari Guwahati- 781 003
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST For Consulting Services- for Capacity Building in Road SafetyManagement No.CE/ASRP/16/2010/41 Dated:September102012 India: Assam State Roads Project(ASRP) IBRD Loan No. 8136 IN The Government of Assam has applied for financingfrom the World Bank toward the cost of the Assam State Roads Project and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consultingservices. The consulting services include development of the organization functioning and capacity building of theroad safety cell of the Public WorksDepartment (PWD) as well as Govt. of Assam multi-sectoral road safetycommittee of theGovernment to ensure their effectiveness; implementing a training and skills development program for PWD staff; comprehensivelysurveying the legislation statutes regulations and other sources of mandatory prescription and empowerment; planning and managingthe implementation of the safe corridors demonstration (pilot) program; initiating new forms of public promotion communicationsand reportingon road safety matters in the State; facilitating initiation of a dedicated state-level funding for road safetyprograms and initiatives. The services are expected to be required for about 3 years. The Chief Engineer PWD (ARIASP & RIDF) Govt.of Assam now invites eligible consulting firms ("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the Services. InterestedConsultants should provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to performthe Services. The short listing criteria are: similarexperience of the firm in last five years availability ofappropriate skills among staff turnover in the last three yearsetc. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn toparagraph 1.9 of theWorld Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employmentof Consultants [under IBRD Loans and IDACredits & Grants] by World Bank Borrowers January 2011 ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth theWorld Banks policy on conflict of interest. Consultants may associate with other firms in theform of a joint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications. Further information can be obtained at the addressbelow during office hours i.e. 1000 to 1700 hours. Expressions of interest must be delivered in awritten form to the address below (in person or by mail or by fax or by e-mail) by the October 162012. Chief Engineer PWD (ARIASP & RIDF) Assam Chandmari Guwahati-3 Telephone No.:+91.361.2665745 Fax No.:+91.361.2661879 E-mail: cea.apwd@nic.in

The Government of India has received grant from the Global Environment Facility [GEF] towards thecost of Sustainable Urban Transport Project[SUTP] and it intends to applypart of the proceeds ofthis Grant No: GEF GRANT NUMBER TF 095549-INto payments under the agreement(s) resulting from this IFB No.: GEF-SUTP/AICTSL/2013/ITSRFP. 3. TheAtal Indore City Transport Services Limited (AICTSL) serves as theimplementing agency for the project and now invites sealed bids from eligible Bidders for DesignSupply Install Integrate Commission Test Operate andMaintain the Intelligent Transportation System components for AICTSL in Indore Madhya Pradesh India . 4. Biddingwill be conducted using the International Competitive Bidding (ICB) procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines:Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits May 2004 revised October 2006 edition and is open to all Bidders eligible as defined in theseGuidelines. The Bidder must meet the followingqualification criteria as on the last date of submission of this bid: I. Experience in Automatic Fare Collection System (AFCS) a.Shall have satisfactorily designedand deployed at least one qualifying AFCS Project which is maintained by the bidder for at least 3 years;and b.Shall havesatisfactorily designed and deployed at least twoqualifying AFCS Projects which are maintained by the bidder for at least 1year. A qualifying AFCS Project is defined as "An AFCS project consisting of an application for Automatic Fare Collection for public transitintegrated with at least 20 fare gates distributed over a minimum of 10 transit stations. The solution should be supporting at least 1000 active smart card accounts apartfrom one of the following payment media: RFID based smart tokens machine readable paper tickets (Magnetic Stripecard or Bar-coded tickets or similar). The AFCS project should have beencompleted within the past 7 (seven) years from the date of submission of the bid and should have been in commercial operations forat least one year after successful system acceptance." II. Experience in Automatic Vehicle Location System (AVL) a.Shall havesatisfactorily designed and deployed at least onequalifying AVL Project which is maintained by the bidder for at least3 years;and b.Shall havesatisfactorily designed and deployed at least twoqualifying AVL Projects which are maintained by the bidder for at least 1year. A qualifying AVL Projectis defined as "An AVLproject for a intra-city public bus transport with a fleetof at least 100 buses integrated with Passenger Display System. The AVLproject should have been completed within the past 5 (five) years from the date of submission of the bid and should have been incommercial operations for atleast one year after successful system acceptance." III. Experience inmanaging at least 2 (two) qualifying Operations Projects satisfactorily A qualifyingOperationsProject isdefined as "An Operations project involvingRevenueCollection by the bidder on any public transport systems such as Bus/BRT/Metro/Tram or a Toll Road projectby deploying biddersman-power such as revenue collectors technicians operations and managerial staff. The operations project should have been completed within the past 5 (five) yearsfrom the date of submission of the bid and should have been in successful commercial operations for at least oneyear." IV. The Bidder shall have a minimum average annual turnover of INR 750Million (or equivalent in foreign currency) and a minimum average annual positive net-worth of INR 75 Million (or equivalent inforeign currency) over the past three financial years i.e. years 2012-132011-12 & 2010-11 V. Incase of a JV at least 50% of the turnover andnet-worth criteria shallbe met by the lead partner and the remaining can be satisfied by the other JV partners. Inascertaining the turnover and the net-worth therespective financial year applicable in the country of the JV partnershall beused. None of the member of a given Joint Venture can be a member of another Joint Venture forsubmitting this same bid otherwise all the bids comprising the same member shall stand disqualified. Bids from Joint Venture of up to three membersare accepted provided the JV as a whole meetsall the criteria mentioned above. 5. Interestedeligible Bidders may obtain further information from AICTSL Indore andinspect the bidding documents at the address given belowfrom 11:00 hrs to 16:00hrs (IST) on all working days (Monday to Friday). A pre-bid meeting which potential Bidders may attend will be heldon 17 th October 2013 at 10:30 hrs (IST) inthe Conference Room Atal Indore CityTransport Services limited Plot. No. 30- Residency Area A.B. Road Opp. M.G.M. Medical College Indore452001 6. A completeset of bidding documents in English language may be downloaded from http://www.citybusindore.com/showtender.aspx.The downloadable version of the bidding documents and any addenda to it will be the binding one. As an alternative a hard copy set of the bidding documentsmay be purchased byinterested Bidders on submission of a written application to the address below and upon payment of a non-refundable fee of INR 10000. The method of payment will be demand draft in favor of CEO AICTSL payable atIndore India. In case of biddingdocuments that are downloaded a non-refundable fee of INR 10000 in the form of a demand draft favoring "CEO AICTSL" payableat IndoreIndia should be submitted along with the bid. 7. Bids must be delivered to the address below on or before15:00 hrs (IST) on 22 nd November 2013. Bidsneed to be secured by a bid security. The amount of Bid Security required is INR 10 Million. Late bids will be rejected. The Bids will be opened in thepresence of Bidders representatives who choose to attend at the address below at 15:30 hrs (IST) on 22 nd November 2013. 8. The attention of prospective Bidders is drawn to (i) the fact thatthey will be required to certify in their bids that all software is either covered by a valid license or was produced by the Bidderand (ii) that violations are considered fraud which can result in ineligibility for the award of World Bank-financedcontracts. Address: Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Atal Indore City transport Services Limited (AICTSL) Plot No. 30- Residency Area A.B. Road Opp. M.G.M. Medical College Indore Madhya Pradesh 452001 Ph: +91 - 0731- 2904488 E-mail:ceo@citybusindore.com

Within the stipulated date & time the Bidder can submit their Bids either through e-tender or manual tender by following detailed procedure detailed in the Bid document. Submission of Bid by both e-tender and manualtender will result in rejection of Bid. Bids must be delivered to the address indicated above following the relevant proceduredetailed in Bid document on or before the last date & time for submission of Bid. Electronic bidding will be permitted. In case of manual tendering late bidswill be rejected. Bids will be opened on the specified date and time in the presenceof Biddersrepresentatives who choose to attend. Only the Bids which fulfillthe stipulated eligibility criteria will be considered for acceptance. In the event of the date specified for bid submission or bid opening being declared as a closedholiday for the employers office the date for bid submission and opening of bids will be the following working day at theoriginal appointed time. Bidder participating in multiple slices (contracts listed in Sl No. 2) under the package shall indicate the discountsoffered for the award of more than one contract. The lowest evaluated Bid Price will be determined when evaluating this contract inconjunction with other contracts to be awarded concurrently taking into account any discounts offered by the bidders for the awardof more than one contract. The methodology to determine the lowest evaluated price of the slice (contract) combinations shall be asspecified in Section III Evaluation and Qualification Criteria. Evaluation of several successful bids submitted by theBidder willalso include an assessment of the Bidders capacity to meet the aggregated requirements regarding ? Experience Financialsituation Current contract commitments Cash flow capacity Equipment to be allocated and Personnel to befielded. The successful bidderwould be required to give a performance bank guarantee of 10% of the contract amountplus additional security for unbalanced bid amount from a Nationalized / Schedule Indian Bank / a foreign bank located in Indiaacceptable to Employer with jurisdiction at Bangalore as specified towards guarantee for completion of assignment within thestipulated period. Applications /requisitions from joint venture Firms are acceptable. In case of e- bidders List of documents to support qualification of bidder is to be uploaded to the e-tenderwebsite www.mytenderwizard.com/BWSSB Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board reserve the right to cancel or annul theentire or part of this process of invitation at any time without assigning anyreason

column4: Consultancy Services For Social And Community Development Expert In Berhampur Municipal Corporation
column12: Ganjam Dist.
column18: This notice has been cancelled as of 25-Feb-2014. Please do not respond. ? BERHAMPUR MUNICIPALCORPORATION No.2031E.ll/111/37/13 Dt. 21/02/2014 Request for Expression ofInterest (REol) ForConsultancy services for Socialand Community Development Expert in Berhampur Municipal Corporation for World Bankfunded Project. The BeMC Berhampur under Odisha Disaster Recovery Project (ODRP) funded by the World Bank requires Consultancy services for Social and Community Development Expert in Berhampur Municipal Corporation. The detailed terms and conditions for submission of REOlare indicated inDraft Terms of Reference and REOlthat shall be available on our web site www.berhampur.gov.in with effect from 22-02-2014. Interest consultants arerequiredto submit their REOl with the required details andsupporting documents latest by 10-03-2014 up to 4.00 PM atthe addressed mentioned in REOl. Please visit the website www.berhampur.gov.in for any clarification Municipal Commissioner Berhampur MunicipalCorporation =============================================================== Odisha Disaster Recovery Project? P148868 Community Infrastructure Investments in Berhampur "Consultancy services for Socialand Community Development Expert in Berhampur Municipal Corporation" DRAFT TERMS OF REFERENCE 1. Background of project 1.1 General The Governmentof India has applied for financing from the World Bank towards cost of the Odisha Disaster Recovery Project (ODRP) and Berhampur municipal Corporation intends to apply part ofthe proceeds forconsulting servicesfor"Project Management Supervision and Qualitycontrol Consultancy in the Project Implementation Unit (PIU)" based inBerhamapur and in Project Management Unit (PMU) based inBhubaneswar. Component 2:Community Infrastructure Investments in Berhampur of the ODRPwill be implemented by the BeMC under the aegis of the Housing and Urban DevelopmentDepartment of Government ofOdisha. Berhampur city is thefourth mostpopulous urban area in the state ofOrissa. Itis mainly a trading centre for Southern Orissahavingits influence overeightdistricts. It is the oldest city of Ganjam District. The city ofBerhampur isgoverned by the Berhampur Municipal Corporation(BeMC). BeMCs jurisdiction covers anarea of about 37sq.km. and has a population ofover 378000. Berhampur slums:Thereare 254 slum settlements accommodating 28270 households and apopulation of 126541. Slum population is thus33.41 % of the total population. Many of them arelocated around the 47 water bodies in the city mainly inthe form of tanks and along thenatural or built drains. In the absence of sewerage systemin the citythesewater courses also carryseptic tankeffluents or the untreated humanwaste. The slums aretherefore vulnerable to both flood and health hazards. Shelters in slumsvaryinconstructionfrom reeds and mud walls withthatched roofsto brick walls with ACor GI sheets asroof.The latter are vulnerable to strong windsand the former toheavyrains. Government of Odisha intends to improve the shelters under Government ofIndia programs including RajivAwas Yojna (RAY). The BerhampurMunicipal Corporation proposes to undertake various urban infrastructure projectsin particular the slumimprovementworks with a view to provide better facilities to the people livingin slum areas. The works spread over entire Municipal Corporationarea. 1.2 It is proposed to engage qualified consultants with proven relevant experienceof providing project management supportfor the projects of similarnatureand size including for the supervisionand quality control of proposed/ ongoing works. The proposed works involveconstruction / up gradation /renewal of various urbaninfrastructureinvestments including some city levelinfrastructure. 1.3 Component 2of ODRP 1. Sub-component 2.1: Upgrading of slums - US$15 million. For infrastructure to improve theliving conditionsof households inslumsin the city of Berhampur. These improvementsinclude streetsaccess to improved water and sanitation drainage septic management and street lighting. The level of service to be provided willbe determined bythe available trunk infrastructurethephysical conditions size of the settlements and theavailable resources. The project will be carried out in about 80 settlements covering about 30000 population. 2. Sub-component 2.2: Public service infrastructure -US$11.7 million. For priorityinfrastructure at the city level to improve service delivery and living conditions. The BeMC hascarried out anassessment of damage and needs after Cyclone Phailin from whichan investment plan isbeing prepared. Investments include priorityroads and trunkwater supply infrastructureamong others. 3. Subcomponent 2.3: Community participation - US$1.7 million. This component willhelpfacilitate community participation ensuring a participatory approach in the planning of settlement level infrastructure. 4. Sub-Component 2.4: Technical Assistance - US$1.7 million. Forproviding supportto the BeMC towards preparationof improvedcity-wide sectoral master plansand priorityDetailed Project Reports (DPRs). These willinclude drainage sewerage streetlighting and other relevant areasidentified. 2. Objective of theAssignment The main objective of theassignment is to provide support to BeMC and assist in community mobilization and consultation and preparation of DPRs for Component 2 under ODRP. Key tasks: ODRP recognisesthatcommunity participation is key to the success of the implementation. The beneficiary communities will be consultedthroughout the project cycle for their inputand recommendations. For effective participation communities are required to be well versed with the Project. The community developmentexpertwillbe expected towork closely with officersat municipalleveland civil society actors as necessary. Theexpert willassist in mainstreaming of cross-cutting issues during project implementation. Theexpert will review theconsultation and stakeholder engagement processes that already existand then developstrategies to strengthen participatory engagement during BeMC implementationand to ensurelong-term sustainability after theterminationof ODRP; develop generic training materials for formation and capacity building of local community actors;assist in preparation of RAPsand other required reports and follow up on the implementation of the recommendationsand also assist in preparation of workplans and progress reports forsocial/community development activities. S/he will also:  Assist in organizing stake holder consultants and prepare documentation necessary for identification of works location etc.  Carry out social and environmental screening and preparing required social/environment assessment including preparing detailed resettlement actionplan/environment management plan where necessary.  Assist to continue the process ofstake holder consultation and involvement.  Assist in preparing periodic monitoringreports progress reports compliance reports etc.  Attendmeetings and support in preparing necessary information notes etc.  Assist inthe preparation of terms ofreference request for proposals and evaluation oftender documents submitted by bidding firms forengineering related assignments.  Work and coordinate withotherexperts as required. 3. Duration:The contract is for 6 months with provision for further extension. 4. Key Qualifications: Post graduation in social sciences with minimum of 7 years of relevant experience. Sd\21.02.14 Municipal Commissioner Berhampur Municipal Corporation

P148868 Community Infrastructure Investments in Berhampur "Consultancy services for Environment Expert inBerhampur Municipal Corporation" ? 1. Background of project 1.1 General ? DRAFT TERMS OF REFERENCE ? The Government of India has applied for financing from the World Bank towards cost of the Odisha Disaster Recovery Project(ODRP) and Berhampur Municipal Corporation intends to apply part of the proceeds for consulting services for "Project Management Supervision and Quality control Consultancy in the Project ImplementationUnit (PIU)" based inBerhamapur and in Project Management Unit (PMU)based in Bhubaneswar. Component 2: Community Infrastructure Investments in Berhampur of the ODRP will beimplemented by the BeMC under the aegis of the Housing and Urban Development Department of Government ofOdisha . Berhampur city is the fourth most populous urban area in the stateof Orissa. It is mainly a trading centre for Southern Orissahaving its influence over eight districts. It is the oldest city of Ganjam District. The city of Berhampur isgoverned by the Berhampur Municipal Corporation (BeMC). BeMCs jurisdiction covers an area of about 37 sq.km. and has a population of over 378000. Berhampur slums : There are 254 slum settlements accommodating 28270 households and a population of 126541. Slum population is thus33.41 % of the total population. Many of them are located around the 47 water bodies in the city mainly in the form of tanks and alongthe natural or built drains. In the absence of sewerage systemin thecity these water courses also carry septic tank effluents or the untreated human waste. The slums are therefore vulnerableto both flood and health hazards. Shelters in slums vary in construction from reeds and mud walls with thatched roofs to brick walls with AC or GI sheets as roof. The latter are vulnerable to strong winds and the former to heavy rains. Government of Odisha intends to improve the shelters under Government of India programs including Rajiv Awas Yojna (RAY). The Berhampur Municipal Corporation proposes to undertake various urban infrastructure projects in particular the slumimprovement works with a view to provide better facilities to the people living in slum areas. The works spread over entireMunicipal Corporation area. 1.2 It is proposed to engage qualified consultants with proven relevant experience of providing project management support forthe projects of similar nature and size including for the supervision and quality control of proposed/ ongoing works. The proposedworks involve construction / up gradation / renewal of various urban infrastructure investments including some city levelinfrastructure. 1.3 Component 2 of ODRP 1. Sub-component 2.1: Upgrading of slums - US$15 million. For infrastructure to improve the living conditions of households in slums in the city of Berhampur. These improvementsinclude streets access to improved water and sanitation drainage septic management and street lighting. The level of service tobe provided will be determined by the available trunk infrastructure the physical conditions size of thesettlements and theavailable resources. The project will be carriedout in about 80 settlements covering about 30000 population. 2. Sub-component 2.2: Public service infrastructure - US$11.7 million. For priority infrastructure at ? the city level to improve service delivery and living conditions. The BeMC has carried out an assessment of damage and needsafter Cyclone Phailin from which an investment plan is being prepared. Investments include priority roads and trunk water supplyinfrastructure among others. 3. Subcomponent2.3: Community participation - US$1.7 million. This component will help facilitate community participation ensuring a participatory approach in the planning ofsettlement level infrastructure. 4. Sub-Component 2.4: Technical Assistance - US$1.7 million. For providing support to the BeMC towards preparation of improved city-wide sectoral master plans and priority Detailed Project Reports (DPRs). These will include drainage sewerage street lighting andother relevant areas identified. 2. Objective of the Assignment The main objective of the assignment is to provide support to BeMCand assist in developing an Environmental Management Framework and preparation of DPRs for Component 2 under ODRP. Key tasks: Assist to develop an Environmental Management Framework (EMF) identify critical issues that need to be addressed during thecourse of the project and include mitigation strategies for any potential negative impacts identified. The EMF should be integratedinto the Final Design Report of works to be undertaken- for standalone implementation andalso to influence design decisions. Theexpert will also review DPRs and works construction from environment angle and provide feedback andreports. The environment expertwill also assist in sub-sectoral master plans. S/he will also assist in the preparation of terms of reference request forproposals and evaluation of tender documents submittedby bidding firms for engineering related assignments. S/he will work andcoordinate with other experts as required. 3. Duration: The contract is for 6 months with provision for further extension. 4. Key Qualifications: Post graduation in environment engineering /sciences minimum of 7 years of relevant experience. Sd\21.02.14 Municipal Commissioner Berhampur Municipal Corporation

column4: [brds] - Cs-1-recruitment Support Agency
column12: Old Secretariat
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES? FIRMS SELECTION) INDIA BIHAR INTEGRATED SOCIAL PROTECTION STRENGTHENING PROJECT Project No.: P118826 Assignment Title:Recruitment Support Agency ReferenceNo. (as per Procurement Plan): CS-1 The Bihar RuralDevelopment Society (BRDS) under the Department of Rural Development Government of Bihar has applied for financing from the WorldBank toward the cost of the Bihar Integrated Social Protection Strengthening Project and intendsto apply part of the proceeds forconsulting services. The Bihar RuralDevelopment Society (BRDS) now invites eligible consulting firms ("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing theServices. Interested Consultantsshould provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevantexperience to perform the Services. The shortlisting criteria are: - Availability ofqualified experts in fields relevant to staffing positions on selection panel. - Experience of havingsuccessfully managed a similar assignment in Bihar. - Two similarcontracts for hiring of professional or administrative staff (at least 150 professionals) in the any of the last five years whichincludes screening applicants and deriving long and short list and conducting verification / reference checks of selectedcandidates - An annual turnoverof Rs.1.00 crore or more in the last three financial years. (Audited financial statements of last three years should be attached toEOI). - Absence of litigationwhich mayadversely impact delivery of services in the state of Bihar. The consulting services("the Services") include those of a Recruitment Support Agency (RSA) which willsupport BRDS in contracting in various grades offinance professionals and accountants at the District and Block levels with the overall aim to strengthen the financial managementsystem of BRDS. The expected numbers are around 540 accountants at the block level and 220 finance professionals at the districtlevel. All personnel (100%) areto be competitively recruited by July 2014. The RSA will be retained for a period of one year effective from the contract signingdate. The contract end date may further be extended for next one year subject to the client requirement and satisfactoryperformance of the agency. Any change in the period of assignment will only be made after mutual review byboth the parties. Thedraft Terms of Reference for the Recruitment Service Agency is available atwww.rdd.bih.nic.in The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection andEmployment of Consultants underIBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers(January 2011) ("ConsultantGuidelines") setting forth the World Bankspolicy on conflict of interest. In addition please refer to the following specificinformation on conflict of interest related to this assignment: conflict between consulting activities and procurement of goodsworks or non-consulting services; conflict among consulting assignments; and relationship with Borrowers staff. Consultants may associatewith other firms in the form of a joint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications. The type of associationshould be clearly stated in the submission. A Consultant will beselected in accordance with the QCBS method set out in the Consultant Guidelines. Further information canbe obtained at the address below during office hours 1000 to 1800 hours. Expressions of interestmust be delivered in a written form to the address below through registered post/speed post/ courier/ by hand by 25th of November 2013 till 1700 hrs. Bihar Rural Development Society (BRDS) Department of RuralDevelopment Old Secretariat Patna -800023 Attn: CEO Bihar RuralDevelopment Society cum Project Director BISPS Tel:+91-612-2217496 Fax: +91-612-2217857 E-mail:rlrsec-bih@nic.in

column4: Designing Developing And Establishing Decision Support System
column12: Vidyut Bhawan Annex-IIBailey Road
column18: INDIA-BIHAR RURAL LIVELIHOODSPROJECT Credit No.: 4323-IN Project ID :P090764 REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST DESIGNINGDEVELOPING AND ESTABLISHINGDECISION SUPPORT SYSTEM Reference No. (as per Procurement Plan): A3.6 (Selection of Consultant forMIS) Bihar RuralLivelihoods Project (JEEViKA) ispromoted by Government of Bihar to address rural poverty in the state. This project is implemented by Bihar Rural LivelihoodsPromotion Society (BRLPS) an autonomous body under the Department of Finance Govt. of Bihar. The BRLPS has been designated asState Rural Livelihoods Mission by the Department of Rural Development Govt. of Bihar under overall Framework of National RuralLivelihoods Mission to scale up the JEEViKA model of poverty alleviation through-out the state of Bihar in a phased manner. TheGovt. of Bihar has received a credit from the International Development Association for financing BRLPS and intends to apply a partof the proceeds towardspayment under the contract for the said assignment. Presentlythe Project is operational in around 4200villages across 151 blocks of 21 Districts. Under the 3-tier Community Managed Institutional Structure the project has mobilized8 00000 HHs into 70000 SHGs federated these SHGs in 4500 Village Organizations (VOs) and taken 1670 VOs under the fold of 51Cluster level federations (CLFs). Over a periodof 10 years the Society will mobilize 1.25 crores rural HHs into 10 Lakhs SHGs65000 VOs and 1600 CLFs. The Project has placed an automated system/software for capturing the data of these Community Institutionsand through NIC developed software for mapping the Community BasedOrganizations (CBOs) of the entire state promoted by differentAgencies. The BRLPS requires to integrate & establish a robust system for timely decision making. In pursuance to this BRLPS intends to hire anAgency/ Association of Agencies for Modification in existing Application & "DESIGNING DEVELOPING & ESTABLISHING DECISION SUPPORT SYSTEM" for CBOs HRD Processes Financial Transactions Procurement and Project BusinessProcesses so that Real Time Information is generated of: a. Community Institutions-Tracking Individual MemberSocial ? Economical Changes Weekly Transactions of SHGs Fortnightly Transactions of VOs Monthly Transactions of CLFs capturing transactions ofother communityInstitutions Producer Groups andCompanies Training and Learning Center & Micro Plans of the Institutions. b. Community based Interventions-Tracking theProgress made by each of the Interventions: Institutional Financial Inclusion Vulnerability Reduction Convergence and Entitlements & IncomeEnhancement. c. Partners-Tracking the Progress made by thePartners on the agreed assignments. d. Project-Tracking of the Performance made by theProject Staff Ranking/ Grading of the CBOs Integration with the current MISIntegration with Project Accounting & Banking Software Integration with otherProgrammes/Interventions taken up by theSociety Interface with similar Livelihoods Projects and NRLM MIS Capture Business Processes Capacity Building of Project Staff& Generate alerts for timely decision making. The System should map Individual HHs with the GIS. The main assignment will be for a period of 3 yearsand the maintenance and support assignment will be for another 1 year after the completion of the main assignment which is subjectto extension and is open for both individual firm as well as association of agencies. Interested agencies/Association of agenciesmust provide the following information substantiating that they are qualified to perform the services including: a. Organizational profile/brochures structure of thefirm/organization. b. Detailed descriptions of similar assignmentscarried out by Agency/Association of agencies in last three years. c. 10 years of Experience in software designing anddeveloping capacity building data analysis etc. d. Availability of appropriate Professional team withhigh level of competenciesto handle tasks & responsibilities. e. Intended Agency/Association of agencies shouldhave Annual Average Turnover of Rs 50 crore or more in the last three financial years. Audited financial statements of thelast three years should be attached. f. Intended Agency/Association of agencies shouldhave financial capability to carry out the assignment smoothly. g. Name address (Local & Nodal) facsimilenumber and email/website link ofthe Agency. h. Agency with ISO 9001 and/or at least CMM level 4certification will be preferred. The Agencywill be selected in accordance with theWorld Bank procurement guidelines "Selection and employment of Consultants under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits and Grants January 2011". The Information of eligibilitycriteria must be furnished in the prescribed tabularformat which may be downloaded from the website http://brlp.in/cservices.php . Short listedfirms will be asked to submit technicaland financial proposals. Interested Agency may obtain any further information from the office during normal office hours i.e. 10AM to 5 PM on every working day. The EOI may be delivered at the address given above by December 20 2012 till 05.00 PM in a sealedenvelope. The envelope should bear the name ofthe assignment for which EOI is being submitted. column4: Project Management Consultant - Bihar
column12: 3rdFloor Land Development Bank Bhudha Marg
column18: Request for Expressionof Interest For ProjectManagement Consultancy (PMC) for Rural Roads Constructions Work in Bihar Bihar Rural Road Development Agency [ Rural Works Department Bihar] 1. This Request forExpressions of Interest follows the general procurement notice forthis project that appeared in Development Business on September14 2010. 2. The Govt. of India Ministry of Rural Development has received a credit of US $ 1500 million from the InternationalDevelopment Association for above project supporting rural roads development under the Prime Minister Rural Roads Program(PMGSY).The project will support construction of about 24000 km rural roads in 8states covered under the project. The project will also include a technical assistance program to build capacity of theimplementing agencies improve their business procedures and improve overall maintenance management. The program is beingimplemented through the Rural Road Development Agencies of the respective states. Each of the state will be supported through aproject management consultant. Bihar is a beneficiary State and about 2300 kms of rural roads are to be constructed in the stateunder the project. Bihar Rural Roads Development Agency (BRRDA) intend to apply part of the proceeds of thecredit to payment underthe contract for Project Management Consultant. 3. The PMC Consultant is to provide high quality technical advice and implementation support (Through a small team ofexperts) to the implementing agencies to effectively implement the Project right from the cost effective engineering designsquality assurance improved overall maintenance management management of social &Environmental issues and contract administration. The implementation period will be two years. 4. The BRRDA now invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultantsmust provide information indicating that they are competent to perform the Services (Brochures Description of Similar assignmentsexperience in similar condition and availability of appropriate experienced staff) .Consultants may associate to enhance their qualification. [ The Association may takethe form of a joint venture (with jointand several liability ) or of a sub- Consultancy]. 5. A consultant willbe selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Bank guidelines:Selection and Employment of consultants by World Bank Borrowers  May 2004  revised October 2006 revised May 2010 (Consultant Guidelines ) .The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World BanksGuidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers May 2004  revised October2006 revised May 2010 (Consultant Guidelines )  setting forth the World Banks s policy on conflict of interest. In addition please refer to thefollowing information on conflict of interest related to this assignment : NRRDA hasalready selected Lea Associates as Project Audit Consultants hence they are ineligible to participate in thisassignment. 6. InterestedConsultants may obtain further information at the address given below from 10.00 hours to 16.00hours on all workingdays. 7. Expression of interest must be delivered to the address below by not laterthan 10.01.2014 up to 13.00Hours. If theoffice happens to be closed on the date of receipt of Expression of Interest as specified the Expression of Interest shall bereceived on the next working day at the same time and venue. Address:-Bihar Rural Roads Development Agency(BRRDA) 3 rd Floor Land DevelopmentBank Bhudh Marg. Patna-800001 Phone:- 0612-2233198 Fax:- 0612-2233199 E- Mail- reobihar@yahoo.com ( R Lakshmanan IAS ) Addl. CEO- Cum-Secretary-Cum Empowered officer BRRDA

FirmsSelection) Country : India Name of Project : Financing Energy Efficiency at MSMEs Grant No. : TF No. 097126 Project ID No. : P100530 Reference No. : CS-08 (BEE) The Bureau of EnergyEfficiency (BEE) a statutory body under the Ministry of Power Government of India is executing a project "Financing EnergyEfficiency at MSMEs" which is a part of the Global Environment Facility (GEF) Programmatic Framework for Energy Efficiency inIndia. The GEF implementation agency for this project isthe World Bank. The project is being jointly executed by BEEand Small Industries Development Bank of India(SIDBI). The objective of this project is to increase demand for energyefficiency investments in five target Micro Small and Medium Enterprise (MSME) clusters in thesectors of forging foundrylimekiln chemicals and one mixed industry cluster centered around the Indian cities of Pune Kolhapur Tirunelveli Ankleshwar andFaridabad repectively.The focus would be to build the capacity of the MSME clusters to access commercial finance for energyefficiency interventions. The consulting services("the Services") include the development of a Knowledge Management platform for building capacity and awareness amongst the MSMEsand allied stakeholders including manufacturers / vendors of energy efficient technological products and solutions. The services tobe provided for developing the Knowledge Management Platform would include i) development of a web based portal and ii) setting upof a toll-free support desk (outbound and inbound) duly integrated with the web portal to address queries provide informationcarry out telephonic surveys promotions etc. The shortlisted agency shall also be responsible for the day-to-day maintenanceofthe web portal (including uploading of data andimplementation of software updates/upgrades as required) and operation of the toll-free support desk based on inputs provided byBEE SIDBI and other associated agencies. The above activitieswould be implemented in a phased manner during the period from January 2013 to December 2014(tentatively).
