column18: Request for Expressions ofInterest (Consulting Services ? FirmsSelection) Country : India Name of Project : Financing Energy Efficiency at MSMEs Grant No. : TF No.097126 Project ID No. : P100530 Reference No. : CS-10/11 (BEE) Bureau of Energy Efficiency (BEE) a statutory body under Ministry of PowerGovernment of India is executing a project "Financing Energy Efficiency at MSMEs" which is a part of the Global EnvironmentFacility (GEF) Programmatic Framework for Energy Efficiency in India. The GEF implementation agency for this project is theWorld Bank. The project is being jointly executed by BEEand Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI). The objective of this project is to increase demand for energy efficiency investments in five target Micro Small andMedium Enterprise (MSME) clusters in the sectors offorging foundry limekiln chemicals and a mixed industry cluster centeredaround the Indian cities of Pune Kolhapur Tirunelveli Ankleshwar and Faridabad respectively. The project also aims to build thecapacity of MSMEs in these clusters to access commercial finance. Expected outcomes include enhanced Energy Efficiency (EE)investment proposals both from a technical and commercial perspective as well as an increase in capacity of project developers andbank loan officers / branch managers for appraisal / financing of EE proposals. Deliverables under the project have been identified separately for BEE and SIDBIwith BEE being assigned the responsibility for overall project implementation including project oversight reporting andevaluation implementation of national level outreach and capacity building activities cross cutting knowledge managementactivities etc. The consulting services ("the Services") shall cover a detailed review of theproject. The review shall evaluate the project performance vis--vis the objectives and key indicators as identified in the PADand indicate the extent to which the physical and financialtargets have been achieved. The reviews shall also cover the factorsthat may have facilitated or impeded the progress in achieving the intended outcomes / outputs contract monitoring salientlessons learnteffectiveness / impact of various Knowledge Products as developed under the project (case studies outreachmaterials cutting edge technology demonstrations policy advocacy etc.) extent of involvement of the various stakeholders of theproject (World Bank GEF Industry Associations Banks / Financial Institutions etc.) in project activitieschallenges facedduring implementation efficiency of procurement of the various consultancies contract management etc. The assignment wouldrequire visits to the 5 project clusters and if need be to the clusters covered under the BEE National SME program forassessment of the work undertaken under the project and to interact with the Industry Associations MSMEs and other alliedstakeholders in the clusters.The selected Consultant shall also interact with (a) energy professionals and bankers who have beentrained under this project (b) vendorswho have been covered under the outreach program and (c) the Consultants hired by BEE andSIDBI for specific assignments under the project. Besides the selected Consultant shall also be required to obtain feedback /inputs from the World Bank team that has been involved in monitoring the progress of the project. The above activities would be initiated in July 2014 and are to be completedby end December 2014 (tentatively). The firm schedule shall be advised to the shortlisted consultants at the stage of issue ofRFP. The Bureau of Energy Efficiency now invites eligible consulting firms("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the above-mentioned services. Interested Consultants should provideinformation demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services. column18: Toaccelerate the market transformationfor super-efficient appliances Bureau of Energy Efficiency (BEE) under National Mission forEnhanced Energy Efficiency (NMEEE) is planning to launch Super-Efficient Equipment Programme (SEEP) for Ceiling Fans which isabout promoting super-efficient fans involving incentive framework to the selective fan manufacturers. To undertakefund disbursal to eligiblerecipients validating sale of the product and specified standard of equipment BEE require a Monitoring and Verification Agency/ies (MVA)meeting basic criteria. column4: International Competitive Bidding (icb) For Supplyinstallation Testing Training And Commissioning Of Real Time Water Quality Monitoring Stations-ifb Number Iicb-hp Ii/cpcb/2001-12
column12: Parivesh Bhawan CBD-cum-Office Complex East Arjun Nagar
column18: INDIA-Hydrology Project PhaseII Loan 4749-IN Project Identification Number : P084632 International Competitive Bidding (ICB) for SupplyInstallation TestingTraining and Commissioning of Real time Water Quality Monitoring Stations IFB No : IICB-HP II/CPCB/2001-12 1. This Invitation for Bids follows the General Procurement Notice for this Project thatappeared in Development Business of July 24 2004. 2. The Government of India has received Loan from the International Bankfor Reconstruction andDevelopment toward the cost of Hydrology Project-II and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan to payments under theContract for International Competitive Bidding (ICB) for Supply Installation Testing Training & Commissioning of Real time Water Quality Monitoring Stations. 3. The Member Secretary Central Pollution Control Board (CPCP) now invites sealed bids fromeligible and qualified bidders for Real Time Water Quality Monitoring Stations. 4. Bidding will be conducted through international competitive bidding procedures specified in theWorld Banks Guidelines : IBRD Loans and IDA Credits and is open to all bidders from Eligible Source Countries as defined in theGuidelines. 5. Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information from Member Secretary CPCB Delhi and inspect the bidding document at the address given below from 1200 hours IST to1500 hoursIST on any working day from September 12 2011 to November 14 2011. 6. Qualification requirements are given in Section III of Bidding documents. 7. A complete set of bidding documents in English may be purchased byinterested bidders on submission of a written application to the addressbelow and upon payment of a nonrefundable fee of IndianRupees Three Thousand (Rs.3000.00) only or its equivalent in a freely convertible currency by demand draft/Bankers cheque in favour of Member Secretary Central PollutionControl Board payable at Delhi. The bid documents may be sent by Speed Post or courierservice if requested so on receipt of the cost of the bid document plus Rs.200.00 for national or Rs.1000.00 for internationaldestination. The CPCB office shall not be held responsible for any postal delays if anyin the delivery of the document or non-receipt of the same. 8. Bids must be delivered to the address below at or before 1400 hrs (IST) on November 15 2011. Electronic bidding will not be permitted. Late bids will be rejected. Bids will be opened inthe presence of the bidders representatives who choose to attend in person at the address below at 1430 hrs (IST) on November 15 2011. All bidsmust be accompanied by a Bid Security of INR Two Million andFive Hundred Thousand only (INR 2.5 Million) or its equivalent in afreely convertible currency by demand draft/Bank cheque in favor of Member Secretary Central Pollution Control Board payable atDelhi. 9. A pre-bid meeting with potential bidders will be held on October 142011 at 1400 hrs (IST) in the training hall of CPCB office to clarify the issues and to answerquestions on any matter that may be raised at that stage as statedin Clause ITB 7.2 of Instructions to Bidders of the biddingdocument. 10. The bid document can also be downloaded from the CPCB website (www.cpcb.nic.in) and the cost of the bid document shall bedeposited in Indian Rupees Three Thousand only (Rs.3000.00) or its equivalent in a freely convertible currency by demanddraft/Bankers cheque in favour of Member Secretary CPCB payable at Delhi India at the time of submission of bid. In the event of such downloaded bids submitted without cost of bid document those bids would bedeclared non-responsive and would not be considered further for bid evaluation process. 11. The address referred to above is: MemberSecretary CentralPollution Control Board Parivesh Bhawan CBD-cum-OfficeComplex East Arjun Nagar Delhi 110 032 INDIA Tel No : 91 11 22302188 E-mail : rmbhardwaj@gmail.com Website : www.cpcb.nic.in

column2: Accelerating Universal Access to TB Care
column4: General Procurement Notice
column12: Nirman BhavanMaulana Azad Road
column18: GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE INDIA ACCELERATING UNIVERSAL ACCESS TO EARLY AND EFFECTIVE TUBERCULOSIS CARE GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE Project ID No. P148604 The Government of India has applied for financing in the amount of US$100 Million equivalent from the World Bank toward the cost of above Project and it intends to apply part of the proceeds topayments for goods works related services and consulting services to be procured under this project. The project will include procurement of first and second-line anti-TBdrugs other goods including diagnostic equipment and consumables and a limited number ofconsultancies. Procurement of contracts financed by the World Bank will be conductedthrough the procedures as specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits (current edition) and is open to all eligiblebidders as defined in the guidelines. Consulting services willbeselected in accordance with the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (currentedition). Specific procurement notices for contracts to be bid under the WorldBanks internationalcompetitive bidding (ICB) procedures and for contracts for larger consultancy services packages will beannounced as they become available in UN DevelopmentBusiness and Indian newspapers. The Project is likely to source first line anti-TB drugs from thesource prequalified by World Health Organization (WHO) and interested manufacturers may visitthe website of WHO for details ofprequalification program. The Project is alsolikely to use e-Procurement system of NationalInformatics Centre (NIC) for some of the packages.

column4: Hiring Of Consultant For Technical Assistance And Advisory Services For Contract Management In Project Management Unit (pmu)
column10: Chief Engineer World Bank Projects Odisha
column12: Nirman Soudha Keshari Nagar Unit ? V
column18: OFFICE OF THE ENGINEER-IN-CHIEF (CIVIL) ODISHA NIRMAN SOUDHA KESHARI NAGAR UNIT ? V BHUBANESWAR ? 751001 No. PMU ? WB ? 39 / 2012 / 21762 Dt. 4.07.2012 INDIA ODISHA STATE ROADS PROJECT EXPRESSION OF INTEREST FOR HIRING AN INDIVIDUAL CONSULTANT FOR Contract Management 1. This Request for Expressions of Interestfollows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared in Development Business issue of 29th September2005. 2. The State Government of Odisha (GOO)through the Government of India has signed a loan agreement with the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (WorldBank) amounting to US$250 million equivalent for implementation of Odisha State Roads Project and intends to apply a portion ofthis loan to finance technical assistance and advisory services for Contract Management in Project Management Unit(PMU)Bhubaneswar Odisha. 3. The project consists of broadly twocomponents- Road corridor improvement and a institutional Development . The implementation and monitoring of the project is beingcarried out by the PMU headed by Chief Engineer (World Bank Projects) and assisted by professionals in Engineering Finance LandAcquisition Resettlement and Rehabilitation  Environment etc. Detailed information on the project can be accessed through projectwebsite (www.osrp.gov.in). OWD wishes to engage an experienced and qualified contractManagementspecialist as individual consultant to strengthen the capacity of PMUin contract Management. Various contracts have beenawarded for worksand consultancy as per IBRD procurement guidelines. Contracts for works goods and consultancy are also planned tobe awarded as per IBRD procurement guidelines . The individual consultant for contract management shall render advice to the ChiefEngineer World Bank Projects on contract management issues relating to works/consultancy/goods contracts. This advice shallinclude reviewing and /or provide substantive guidance in drafting various documents/correspondence/reports on all contractmanagement issues including variation orders extension of time  contractual notices termination (if required) as well as disputeresolution/Arbitration. Besides the contract management consultant shall render all other relatedand relevant contract management advice to the PMU/CE as per requirement. 4. Required qualifications & Experience:- The qualification andexperience requirement for the proposed position of contract Management Specialist shall be 1. Graduate in Civil Engineering with minimum 10years of experience in Execution/procurement / Contract Management for highways in Govt. Sector such as State PWD or Ministry ofRoad Transport & Highways (MORTH) roads with and not less than 5 years experience in major projects with FIDIC contractconditions preferably with exposure to law of contract management and dispute/ arbitration. 2. Significant experience at senior Management/leadership level in road infrastructure development and management functions specifically in the state PWD environment inIndia. 3. Sound Knowledge of the current center andState level policy administrative and finance frameworks and process for road infrastructure development and management;and 4. Effective oral and written communication andbriefing skills inter-personal and presentational skills and proven capacity for mobilizing effective teamwork. 5. Period of Service:- The services for the proposed position will be required initially over a period of 18 months which may be extended forfurther 12 months period by mutual consent if required at the end of the primary 18 months" period. 6. The Chief Engineer World Bank Projects Odisha on behalf ofthe Government of Odisha now invites eligible Consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Services. InterestedConsultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified to perform the Services (experience ofsimilar assignmentsundertaken with combination of most of the above listed fields etc.) by submitting the following information: a) Name address e-mail telephone  CV PAN No of theindividual consultant b) Expertise for the proposed services c) Statement of major contract management assignments undertaken in the last fiveyears d) If the individual consultant is seconded by a firm the authorizationof the firm alongwith audited and/or certified Financial statementfor the last three years. 7. The selection of individual consultant shall be made inaccordancewith the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by Bank Borrowersof May 2004 (Revised October 2006 May 2010 & January 2011). 8. Interested Consultants may obtain further information at the addressgiven below from 10.00 to 17.00 Hours on all working days. 9. Request for Proposals the Proposal and consultants contract for theproposed assignment will be issued in English language only. 10. Expression of interest must be delivered to the address belowby no later than 30 th July 2012:- Chief Engineer World Bank Projects Odisha Office of the Engineer-in-Chief (Civil) Odisha Nirman Soudha Keshari Nagar Unit ? V Bhubaneswar ? 751 001 OdishaINDIA Tel : 0674 ? 2396783 ; Email : pmuosrp@gmail.com

column4: Project Management Consultant For Development Of Ict Infrastructure In Hppwd And Hpridc In Himachal Pradesh
column12: HPRIDC Nirman BhawanNigam Vihar
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES) INDIA HIMACHAL PRADESH STATE ROADS PROJECT Loan No: 4860-IN & 8199-IN Reference No.:- 20 (ProcurementPlan) Assignment Title: Project Management Consultant for Development of ICT Infrastructure in HPPWDand HPRIDC in HimachalPradesh The Government of Himachal Pradesh hasreceived financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Himachal Pradesh State Roads Projectand intends to apply part of theproceeds for consulting services. The HPRIDC/HPPWD intends to transfer working of some of its business processes through the use ofinformation technologyand to make it accessible through internet and roll it out to the allthe field offices across theState. 1. The consultant shall commence theassignment with conceptualization for setting the proposed online application and rolling out the application to all HPPWD office in the State. 2. The HPPWD plans to engage SystemIntegrator(s) and other consultants to develop & roll out the proposed online application across the state. The consultantshall provide necessary technical and management support to the HPRIDC/HPPWD in the entire process of selection of SystemIntegrator and any other consultant proposed to be engaged for developing and rolling out application to all HPPWD/HPRIDCoffices. 3. The consultant shall provide proactiveinputs to the department as well as to the consultant firms engaged under the project to ensure that results are achieved as per the desired objectives. 4. Theconsultant shall supervise and monitor as well as provide guidance to the HPRIDC/HPPWD team for ensuring post go-live SystemsOperation by the Departmental staff. These services are expected tobe delivered over a 28 months period. The Himachal Pradesh Road and Other InfrastructureDevelopment Corporation (HPRIDC)now invites eligible consulting firms ("Consultants") toindicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultants should provide information demonstrating that they havethe required qualifications and relevant experience to perform theServices. The short-listing criteria are: Turnover figure of lastfive years Net Profit Figure Past Experience of works of similar nature Overall Experience of Firm Experience as LeadConsultant in similarconsultancy etc. The bio data of key personals working with the firm shall not be evaluated at this stage ofshort-listing. The attention of interested Consultants isdrawn to paragraph 1.9 ofthe World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loans and IDACredits & Grants] by World Bank Borrowers January 2011("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth theWorld Bankspolicy on conflict of interest. Consultants may associate with other firms inthe form of a joint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualification. A Consultant will be selected in accordancewith the Quality-And Cost- Based Selection (QCBS) method set out in the procurement guidelinesof World Bank for the selection ofconsultants. Further information can be obtained at theaddress below during office hours i.e. 1000 to 1700 hours (IST). Expressions of interest must be delivered in awritten form to the address below (in person or by mail or by fax or by e-mail) by October 23 2013. Chief Engineer-cum-Project Director State RoadsProject HPRIDCNirman Bhawan Nigam Vihar Shimla-171002 HimachalPradesh India. Tel:+91-177-2627602; Fax:+91-177-2620663 E-mail: pdsrp-hp@nic.in Dated: September 17 2013

ORIGINAL INVITATION OF BIDS India Karnataka Municipal Reform Project Project ID : P079675 Loan number: 4818 ? IN INTERNATIONAL COMPETATIVE BIDDING KMRP/WM/ICB/CTD-07/2012-13 1. This Invitation for Bids follows the General Procurement Noticefor this Project that appeared in Development Business issueno. 744of January 27 2009. 2. The Government of India has received a loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development toward the cost ofKarnataka Municipal Reforms Project and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan to payments under this contract No.KMRP/WM/ICB/CTD-07/2010-11. 3. The Municipal Commissioner Chitradurga City Municipal Council now invites sealed bids from eligible and qualified biddersfor the following goods on a single contract package "Supply and installation ofcustomer (5571 Nos) and Bulk water meters (17 Nos)in Chitradurga City Municipal Council Karnataka State India"(Package CTD-07). 4. Bidding will be conducted through the International CompetitiveBidding (ICB) procedures specified in the World BanksGuidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits and is open to all biddersfrom Eligible Source Countries as defined inthe Guidelines. 5. Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information fromThe Municipal Commissioner Chitradurga City MunicipalCouncil and inspect the bidding documents at the address given below between 11.00 to 17.00 hours during any working day from March25 2013. 6. Qualifications requirements include: (a) Financial Capability q The Bidder shall have a minimum average Annual Financial Turnover of at least Rs 33.00 Million or equivalent in freelyconvertible currency in the last three years from business related to water meters. q Liquid assets and/or availability of credit facilities of no less than Rs. 4.12 Million or equivalent in freely convertiblecurrency. (b) Experience and Technical Capacity (i) The Bidder shall have manufactured and supplied Multijet class B water meters of not less than 2500 numbers and Bulk watermeters of 9 numbers in single contract in single contract in the last three years and same should be in satisfactory operation for12 months as on date of bid opening; and (ii) The Bidder or his identified sub contractor should have installed customer water meters of not less than 2500 numbers 2500numbers and Bulk water meters of 9 numbers in single contract in the last three years and the same should be in satisfactoryoperation for 12 monthsas on date of bid opening. (c ) A margin of preference for certain goods manufactured domestically "shall " be applied. (d) Additional details are provided in the Bidding Documents. 7. A complete set of bidding documents in English may be purchasedby interested bidders on the submission of a writtenapplication to the address below and upon payment of a nonrefundable fee of Rs.5000 (Indian Rupees Five Thousand only) orequivalent in freely convertible currency. The fee shall be in the form of Demand Draft obtained from any/Nationalized/ScheduledBank in favour of Commissioner Chitradurga City Municipal Council. The bidding documents will be sent by registered/speedpost/courier on payment of an extra amount of Rs.250/- (for domestic bidders) or US$ 40 (for overseas bidders). The MunicipalCommissioner City Municipal Council Chitradurga will not take responsibility for the postal/courier delay if any in the deliveryof the documents or non-receipt of the same. 8. Bids must be delivered to the address below on or before 15.00hrs on May 25 2013. Late bids will be rejected. Bids will be opened in the presence of the bidders ortheir authorized representatives whochoose to attend at the address below at 15.30hrs on May 25 2013. 9. column4: Comprehensive Water Supply Service Improvements In Guntur Municipal Corporation (package-i)
column12: Guntur
column18: e-Procurement Notice GUNTUR MUNICIPAL CORPORATION Andhra Pradesh MunicipalDevelopmentProject INVITATIONS FOR BIDS(IFB) INTERNATIONAL COMPETITIVE BIDDING (ICB) Loan No. 7816-IN IFB (SPN) No. 5693/GMC/APMDP/P-I/2012 Date:11-12-2012 1. This invitation for bids follows the GeneralProcurement Notice (GPN) for this Project which was published in the UNDB online Dated 31 st July 2009 of Notice No. WB2838-755. 2. The Government of Andhra Pradesh throughGovernment of India has received a loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction & Development (IBRD) in variouscurrencies towards the cost of Andhra Pradesh Municipal Development Project (APMDP). It is intended that part of the proceeds ofthis loan will be applied to eligible payments under the contract for providingComprehensive Water supply Service Improvementsin Guntur Municipal Corporation(Package-I). 3. The Commissioner GunturMunicipal Corporationinvites item rates bids from the eligible bidders in electronic procurement system for the construction and completion ofComprehensive Water supply Service Improvements in Guntur Municipal Corporation (Package-I)consisting of the following main components. Construction of Intake well cumpump house in Krishna River near PrakasamBarrage at Undavalli village Laying of 1600 mm dia. MS Raw water Gravity pipeline on from MBR at Undavalli(v) to Water treatment plant at Takkellapadu Premises. Construction of Rapid gravity Water Treatment Plants of capacity 42 MLD and25.2 MLD on Turnkey Contract at Takkellapadu and at Sangam Jagarlamudi respectivelyincl. sumps pump houses and balancing reservoirs Laying of Clear Water Rising mains (200 to 900 mm dia.) with DI K-9 & DI K-7 pipesconstruction of sumps and pump housesreplacement of existing pumps & motors errectionof new pumps and motors and errection ofChlorinators Construction of 18 Elevated Level ServiceReservoirs (capacity varying from 500 to 2300 KL) on turn key contract at variouslocations in town  Providing dedicated electrical feeder mains at Undavalli Raw water pump house and Takkellapadu Water Treatment Plant locations and erection of Distribution Transformers Substation at various locations in the town 1. Bidding will be conducted throughInternational Competitive Bidding (ICB) as per the provisions in the World Bank Standard Bidding Documents: Procurement of works (SBDW) under IBRD loans and Credits March 2012 Edition and is opento bidders from eligible countries as per Section V of Biddingdocuments. 2. Bidders are advised to note the minimum qualification criteria specified in Section III of the Bidding document toqualify for the award ofcontract. 3. Interested eligible bidders may obtain furtherinformation from the e-procurement portal http://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/appin Tender Search by entering key word APMDP and also from the Project website www.apmdp.gov.in by navigating through eProcurement(Goods & Works) 4. The complete set of bid documents isavailable online from 13-12-2012 11:00 AMonwards. The bids may be viewed downloaded and submittedonline through theportal http://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/app. Bids submitted manually will not be accepted. column18: GOVERNMENT OF ANDHRA PRADESH REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST (CONSULTANT SERVICES) COUNTRY : INDIA PROJECT NAME : ANDHRA PRADESHMUNICIPAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT (APMDP) CONSULTING SERVICES : URBAN TOWN PLANNING SECTOR LOAN No. : 7816-IN REOI No.6 Dated: 01 st July 2011. This Request for Expression of Interest follows the General ProcurementNotice for this Project that appeared in UNDB Development Businessprint edition issue number 755 31 July 2009 of Notice No.WB2838-755. The Government of India has received a loan from the World Bank towards the cost of the Andhra Pradesh Municipal DevelopmentProject (APMDP) andintends to apply part of the proceeds of this funding to payments under the contracts for consultant services. The services include consultancies forthe following consultancy assignments: 1. Preparation of GIS Base Maps. GIS Base Maps are to be prepared for 117 Urban Local Bodies. These 117 ULBswould be divided into Three Assignments/Contracts. Duration of each these 3 assignments would be about 11 months and threeseparate shortlists shall be prepared for each of the assignment under"Preparation of GIS Maps for ULBs". 2. Preparation of Property & Utility Maps Developing &Installation of GIS Applications and Training of Staff ( Region wise Contracts # Total Six Assignments ). Each Assignmentgroup may comprise of about 11 to 26 towns. Duration of each of these Assignment would beabout 6 months plus post installation services for one year. Six separate shortlists shallbe prepared for each of the assignment under "Preparation of Property & Utility Maps Developing & Installation of GISApplications and Training of Staff". (Note: EachAssignment is independent.) The Commissioner and Director of Municipal AdministrationMA&UD Department Govt. of Andhra Pradesh Hyderabad now invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest inproviding the services. Interested consultants must provide information indicating thatthey are qualified to perform the service (brochures description of similar assignments experience in similar conditionsavailability of appropriate skills among staff etc.). Consultant may associate to enhance their qualifications. Theassociation may take the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of a sub-consultancy. A consultant will be selected inaccordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and employment of consultants by World Bank BorrowersMay 2004 revised October 2006 & May 2010. Interested consultants may obtainfurther information at the address below during office hours i.e.10.30 to 17.00 hours. Expression of Interest must be deliveredto the address below by 18 th July 2011 upto 17:00 HrsIST. Attention : Katamneni Bhaskar Project DirectorAPMDP 640 KASHANA 5 th floor O/o the Commissioner and Director of Municipal Administration A.C Guards Hyderabad Andhra Pradesh India PIN 500004. ProjectDirector MSU-APMDP

Interested consultants should provideinformation demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform theService. The short listing criteria are:The firm should have at least 10 years standing in the field of consultancy. Relevant experience in the last 10 years with cleardocumentary evidence of the lead firm. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to the paragraph1.9of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World BankBorrowers May 2004 revised October 2006 & May 2010 ( "Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policyonconflict of interest. Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a jointventure or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the Quality andCostBased Selection (QCBS) method set out in the Consultant Guidelines. The Terms of Reference is available on the web sites apmdp.gov.in and cdma.gov.in. Further information if any can be obtained at the addressbelow during office hours i.e.1030 to 1700 hours. The Director National Geophysical Research Institute (CSIR)Hyderabad invites bids from the firms for hiringof helicopters(AS350 B3/B2) for carrying out low altitude the Helicopter-borneGeophysical Surveys in six Pilot Project Areas in India for Aquifer Mapping (AQUIM) with capability of carriage of 650 kg as under slung load at 30m AGL) with skilledpilots as detailed above. Helicopter shall have certification of the manufacturing company andthe same shall be acceptable toDGCA (GOI). Helicopter offered shallbe airworthy duly approved by DGCA at the time of bidding. The bidders are requested to quotefor individual areas separately including mobilization/demobilization charges. The bidder should quote for all 6 areas else theoffer will be treated as non responsive. The evaluation and award would be based on as a single lot consisting of all sixareas 3. Bidding documents (andadditional copies) may bepurchased from the office of Controller of Stores& Purchase CSIR-National Geophysical Research Institute (CSIR) Hyderabadfrom 21.09.2012 to 01.11.2012 on payment of non-refundable fee of Rs.5000/- in the form of Demand Draft on anyNationalized/Scheduled bank payable at Hyderabad in favour of Director NGRI.Interested bidders may obtain further information at the same address. Thebidding document can also be downloaded from CSIR-NGRI website: www.ngri.res.in in which case whilesubmitting the bid the fee towards the cost of bid document should beenclosed in the form of a demand draft as per the particulars given above without which the bid may be treated asnon-responsive. 4. Bids must be accompanied by Bid securityof Rs.30.000 lakhs or USD65000 or equivalent in a freely convertible currency drawn in favourof The DirectorNGRIHyderabad. 5. Bids must be delivered to The Controller of Stores & Purchase CSIR-NGRI UppalRoad HYDERABAD 500007 on or before 14:30HOURS IST on 02.11-2012 and will be opened on the same day at 15.00 HOURSIST at the Lecture Hall?1 ExtensionBuilding Ist Floor CSIR-NGRI Uppal RoadHyderabad 500007  in the presence of the bidders who wish to attend. Ifthe office happens to be closed on the date of receipt of the bids as specified the bids will be received and opened on the nextworking day at the same time and venue. 6. The bidders shall beauthorized to operate in India with a valid license issued by DGCA and a copy of the same shall be enclosed with the bid. 7. A pre-bid meeting will beheld on 05-10-2012 at 1100 hrs IST at the Lecture Hall-I ExtensionBuilding I Floor CSIR-NGRI Uppal Road Hyderabad500007 to clarify the issues andto answer questions on any matter that may be raised at that stageasstated in Clause 10.1 of Instructions to Bidders of the bidding document. 8. Other details can be seen in the bidding documents. - Controller of Stores &Purchase

Chief Engineer (Material Management) DHBVNHaryana ************************************************************** Invitation for Bids (IFB) INDIA Haryana Power System Improvement Supply and Installation of all hardware and software componentsof Automatic Meter Reading (AMR) System in DHBVN with post commissioning operation and maintenance for first one (1) year andmaintenance for next 4 years P-110051 WB/DH/2013/G-04 Date of Issue of IFB- 22 May 2013 1. This Invitation for Bids (IFB) follows the General Procurement Notice (GPN) for this project that appeared in DevelopmentBusiness. 2. DHBVN has receiveda loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction andDevelopment toward the cost of Haryana Power System Improvement and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan to payments under the agreement(s) resulting from this IFB:Supply and Installation of all hardware and software components of Automatic Meter Reading System in DHBVN with postcommissioning operation & maintenance for One (1) year and maintenance for next four(4) years. 3. The Chief Engineer (Material Management) Dakshin Haryana Bijli Vitran Nigam Vidyut Sadan Vidyut Nagar Hisar HaryanaIndia ? 125001 India serves as theimplementing agency for the project and now invites sealed bids from eligible Bidders for Supply and Installation of all hardware and software components of Automatic Meter Reading System(AMR) in DHBVN with post commissioning operation & maintenance for One (1) year and maintenance for next four (4)years. In DHBVN we wish to incorporatethe latest state-of-the-art technology in consumer metering & management through Automated Meter Reading (AMR) on the 3-phaseHT/ LT consumers with connected load above 10kW and Distribution Transformer of Urban Area (except all agricultural consumers and HT Consumers & DistributionTransformer covered in R-APDRP Towns) in different circles (nos. 7)of DHBVN. It would practically mean an amalgamation of following major components i.e.Meters Modems Communication media and the Head-end management and applications and DHBVN desires to award the contract onsingle-source responsibility basis leaving the option to contractors to bid either in isolation or by tying-up with differentfacilitators. 4. Bidding will be conducted using the InternationalCompetitive Bidding (ICB) procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits and isopen toall Bidders from eligible source countries as defined in the Guidelines that meet the following minimum qualificationcriteria: "The bidder must provide evidence of prior experience in the supplyinstallation commissioning and operation and maintenance of Automatic Meter Reading System for electricity distribution companiesas follows: i. Experience (own or through sub-contractors) in the installation at customerspremises and commissioning of at least 40000 meters and communication devices of AMR systems withthe same functionalities of theequipment in the technical proposal in last five years. ii. Own experience in the supply installation commissioning and operation for at leastone (1) year of an Metering DataAcquisition System (MDAS) software with the same functionalities of the MDAS included in thetechnical proposal and managing 40000 or more metered points of supply installed at customers premises in last fiveyears. 5. Interested eligible Bidders may obtain further information from the office of Chief Engineer (Material Management) DHBVNDakshin HaryanaBijli Vitran Nigam Vidyut Sadan Vidyut Nagar Hisar Haryana India? 125001 and inspect the bidding documents atthe address given belowfrom10 AM to 5 PM on any working day. 6. A complete set of bidding documents in Englishmaybe purchased by interested Bidders on thesubmission of a written application to the address below and upon payment of a nonrefundable fee of INR 10000/- from 22.05.2013 to09.07.2013. The method of payment will be Demand Draft drawn on any Scheduled Bank in favour of Accounts Officer / Cash DHBVNHisar Haryana India submitted either by post or in person. The document will be issued either to the authorized representative inperson or shall be sent by Courier at the stated addressin the application. The Bidding Documents can alsobe downloadedfrom the DHBVN website www.dhbvn.com. In this case the cost of Bidding Document should be submitted inseparate envelope in the shape of demand draft of a non-refundable fee of INR 10000 or US $ 200 payable to Accounts Officer/cashDHBVN Hisar Haryana India while submittingthe bid. In case the bid is submittedby the bidder along with the required bid security but without the bid cost then the bids ofsuch bidder will also be opened and the bidder would be asked to submit the required bid cost promptly. Apre-bid meeting which potential bidders may attend will be held at Conference Room Vidyut Sadan Hisar Haryana India on26.06.2013 at 11.30 am. 7. Bids must be delivered to the addressbelow at or before 2.30 pm on 10.07.2013. All bids must be accompanied by a bid security of not less than INR 10.5 million or anequivalent amount in a freely convertible currency. Late bids will be rejected. Bids will beopened at 3.00 pm on 10.07.2013 inthe presence of the Bidders representatives who choose to attend at the address below. 8. This Invitation for Bids (IFB) follows the General Procurement Notice (GPN) for thisproject that appeared in Development Business 1 2. DHBVN has received a loan fromthe International Bank for Reconstruction and Development toward the cost of Haryana Power System Improvement and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan to payments under the agreement(s) resulting from this IFB:Supply and Installation of allhardware and software components of Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) in DHBVN with post commissioning operation &maintenance for 1 year and maintenance for next 4 years. 3. The Chief Engineer (Material Management) DHBVN Hisar serves as the implementing agency for the project and now invites sealed bids fromeligible Bidders for Supply andInstallation of all hardware and software components of Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) in DHBVN with postcommissioning operation & maintenance for 1 year and maintenance for next 4 years. In DHBVN we wish to incorporate the latest state-of-the-art technology in consumermetering & management through Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) on all the 3-phase LT consumers having a connected load upto 50 kW in Faridabad and Gurgaon Operation Circles in three stages (Total consumers are approximately 80000 nos.). It would practically mean an amalgamation of three major componentsi.e. SmartMeters Communication media and the Head-end management and applications and DHBVN desires to award the contract on single-sourceresponsibility basis leaving the option to contractors to bid eitherin isolation or by tying-up with different facilitators. Instage I 5000 nos. consumers in Faridabad Circle will be covered. After the contractor establishes the functionalities as definedin detail in VolumeII a go-ahead will be given to cover 15000 nos. consumers in Gurgaon& Faridabad in stage II. Once thefunctionalities for stage II consumers are established by the contractor as defined in detail in Volume II a go ahead will begiven for the balance 60000 nos. consumers in Faridabad & Gurgaon Circles. 4. Bidding will be conducted using the International Competitive Bidding (ICB) proceduresspecified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits and is open to all Bidders from eligiblesource countries as defined in the Guidelines that meet the following minimum qualification criteria: "The bidder mustprovide evidence of prior experience in the supply installation commissioning and operation and maintenance of Advanced MeteringInfrastructure (AMI) systems for electricity distribution companies as follows: i) Experience (own or throughsub-contractors) in the installation at customers premises and commissioning of at least 20000 meters and communication devices of AMI systems with the same functionalities of the equipment in the technicalproposal ii) Own experience in the supplyinstallation commissioning and operation for at least one (1) year of an MDM software with the same functionalities of the MDMincluded in the technical proposal and managing 20000 or more metered points of supply installed at customerspremises 5. Interested eligible Bidders may obtain further information from the office of ChiefEngineer (Material Management) DHBVN Vidyut Sadan Vidyut Nagar Hisar and inspect the bidding documents at the address givenbelow from10 AM to 5 PM on any working day. 6. The method of payment will be Demand Draft drawn onany Scheduled Bank in favour of Accounts Officer / Cash DHBVN submitted either by post or in person. The document will be issuedeither to the authorized representative in person or shall be sent by Courier at the stated address in the application. The Bidding Documents can also bedownloaded from the DHBVN website www.dhbvn.com. In this case the cost of Bidding Document should besubmitted in separate envelope in the shape of demand draft of a non-refundable fee of INR 10000 or US $ 200 payable to AccountsOfficer/cash Dakshin Haryana Bijli Vitran Nigam (DHBVN) Hisar while submitting the bid. In case the bid is submitted by the bidderalong with the required bid security but without the bid cost then the bids of such bidder willalso be opened and the bidder wouldbe asked to submit the required bid cost promptly. Two (2) nos.pre-bid meetings which potential bidders may attend willbe held at World Bank Project Cell HETRI House IDC Area Mehrauli RoadGurgaon on 01.06.2012 and 15.06.2012 at 11.00 am. 7. Bids must be delivered to the address below at or before 10.30 am on12 th JULY 2012. All bids must be accompanied by a bid security of not less than INR 12 million or an equivalent amount in a freelyconvertible currency. Late bids will be rejected. column18: INDIA-Eastern Dedicated Freight Corridor Project II Project ID : P131765 Request for Expressions of Interest [EOI] for Social and Environmental Safeguard Monitoring and Review Consultant [SESMRC] forEDFC Project Bhaupur-Mughalsarai [APL 2 393 Kms] Dedicated Freight Corridor Corporation of India Limited [DFCCIL] has applied for financing from World Bank towards the cost ofthe Eastern Dedicated Freight Corridor project II for Bhaupur-Mughalsarai Section [APL-2] and intends to apply part of the proceedsfor engagement ofSocial and Environmental Safeguard Monitoring and Review Consultant [SESMRC]. The consulting services includes monitoring and reviewing of various social and environmental safeguards associated with landacquisition compensation R&R policies Environmental Management Plan information disclosure communication etc for EDFCproject between Bhaupur-Mughalsarai Section [393 Kms] for a period of four years. The Dedicated Freight Corridor Corporation of India now invites eligible consulting firms [Consultants] to indicate theirinterest in providing the services. Interested consultants should provide information demonstrating that they have therequired qualifications and relevant experience to perform the services. The short listing criteria are that the consultantsshould have a minimum of seven years experience in the relevant area and having successfully undertaken at least three similarassignments particularly linear projects like Railways Highways Cross country pipelines etc funded by multilateral agencies. The consultant should have qualified and experienced personnel in their team. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to Paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines : Selection and Employment ofconsultants [under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants] by World Bank borrowers January 2011 ["Consultant Guidelines"] settingforth the World Banks policy on conflict of interest. Consultant may associate with other firms in the form of a Joint Venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance theirqualifications. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the "Quality and Cost Based Selection [QCBS]" method set out in the ConsultantGuidelines. Interested consultants may obtain further information at the address given below from 1000 hrs to 1700 hrs on all working days. Expression of interest must be delivered to the address given below no later than 1500 hrs on June 17 2013. Mr. Sharad Kumar Jain General Manager/LA & SEMU [EC] Dedicated Freight Corridor Corporation of India Limited 5thFloor Pragati Maidan Metro Station Building Complex New Delhi 110001 Phone: +91 11 23454690 Fax : +91 1123454701 E-mail: skjain@dfcc.co.in Website: www.dfccil.org Annexure I-Information to be Submitted along with Expression of Interest 1. Company Brochures 2. Profile of the Company [please provide not more than two page note including year ofestablishmenttype of business of the company experience of consultancy works etc.] 3. Annual Turnover of Company forConsultancy Services for Last Five Financial Years 4. Description/Details of similar assignments [refer to Note 1 below]carried out during last seven years. Following details for each assignments [also refer to Note 2] must be provided: a. Name of Work b. Name of Client c. Country [where work is executed] d. Length of RailwayLine/Highways/Pipelines etc e. Brief description of scope of assignment f. Components of assignment [refer to Note3 below] g. AwardDate h. Completion Date [if not completed percentage of workcompleted so far and likely date ofcompletion] i. No. of manmonths j. Consultancy Cost k. If executed in JV %Participation l. Funding of the Project- Government Multilateral/Bilateral [Name of Funding agency to be indicated]. Any other source [details is to be provided] 5. Details of staff [refer to Note 4 below] available with the company on its permanent roll for similar assignments[similar indicated explained in Note 1] [There is no need to provide CV of staff at this stage] 6. Any other informationapplicant may like to submit to indicate that they are qualified to perform the services. Notes : Note 1 : Similar assignments mean the consultancy assignment pertaining to monitoring and review of Social & Environmentalsafeguards of Linear Projects like Highways Railways Pipeline etc. funded by multilateral funding agencies Note 2 : Only those assignments should be included which have been carried out by the applicant. The assignments carriedout by parents/sister companies should not be included Note 3 : Components of assignments should be indicated as: [a] Monitoring and reviewing of implementation of RAP & EMP [b] Any other relevant components. Note 4 : Details of Staff engaged in SESMRC activities

column18: Invitation for Bids(IFB) 04 th July 2011 India Implementation of IT System at DFCCIL Loan Number: 8066-IN Supply & Installation of Integrated ITSystems IFBNumber: DFCCIL/IT/SI/2011 1. This Invitation for Bids (IFB) follows the General Procurement Notice (GPN) for this project that appearedin UNDB online on February 08 2010 2. The Dedicated Freight Corridor Corporation of India Limited hasapplied for a loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development toward the cost of the Eastern Dedicated Freight Corridor Project and it intends toapply part of the proceeds of this loan to payments underthe agreement(s) resulting from this IFB: "Supply & Installation of Integrated IT System". 3. The Dedicated Freight Corridor Corporation of India Limited serves as the implementing agency for theproject and now invites sealed bids from eligible Bidders for design and development of package-based integrated IT Solutionprocurement of hardware and software testing ensuring security deployment and commissioning training to end-users postimplementation Warranty and Operation & Maintenance for a period of three years for IT Project at Dedicated Freight CorridorCorporation of India Limited (DFCCIL) 4. Bidding will be conducted using the International Competitive Bidding (ICB) procedures specified in theWorld Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits edition of January 2011 and is open to all Bidders eligibleas defined in these Guidelines that meet the following minimum qualification criteria a) The Bidder organization should be an IT Services company b) The Bidder organization must have been successfully assessed SEI CMMi Level 5 for ITApplication Services. c) The Bidder should have a minimum total turnover of INR 1 Billion from its IT and ITESoperations for each year during the last 3 financialyears (2007-08 2008-09 and 2009-10). d) The bidder should also be profitable during each of the last three 3 financial years. 5. Interested eligible Bidders may obtain further information from RoomNo 514 Dedicated Freight CorridorCorporation of India Limited FifthFloor Pragati Maidan metro Station Complex between. 1000 hours to 1730 hours. A pre-bid meeting which potentialbidders may attend will be held on 01 st August 2011 6. Bids must be delivered to the address below at or before 26 th September 2011 1500 hours. Bids need to be secured by a BidSecurity. The amount of Bid Security required is INR 2.5 Million. Late bids will be rejected. Bids will be opened in the presence of Bidders representatives who choose to attend at the address below at 26 th September 2011 1530 hours. 9. column4: Wbr 18-heavy Haul Program Development And Management Consultant For Technical Assistance Of Technologies Research And Evaluation Of Heavy Haul Capacity Development Of Mor And Dfccil (hhpdtrem)
column10: Dedicated Freight Corridor Corporation of India Limited
column12: Dedicated Freight Corridor Corporation of India Limited. Room No. 400A 4thfloor Pragati Maidan Metro Station Building Complex New D
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) [COUNTRY] INDIA [NAME OF PROJECT] EASTERN DEDICATED FREIGHT CORRIDOR Loan No./Credit No./ Grant No.: IN-8066 Assignment Title: Consultancy Services for Heavy Haul Program Development and ManagementConsultant for Technical Assistance of Technologies Research and Evaluation of Heavy Haul capacitydevelopment of MoR and DFCCIL (HHPDTREM). Reference No. (As per Procurement Plan): P114338 1. Dedicated Freight Corridor Corporation of India Limited (DFCCIL) has received a Loan No. ? IN ? 8066ofUS$ 975 Million from the World Bank towards the cost of Eastern DFC project-1 and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan for engaging a Consultant for Technical Assistance of Technologies Research andEvaluation for Heavy Haul Rail Transport in India. Theconsulting services ("the Services") include the study will review and analyze Technical Assistance ofTechnologies Research and Evaluationfor IRs freight services as envisaged in Vision 2020 and recommend a strategyand a long-term implementation plan for heavy haul freight activity that willmaximize the utilization of additional capacity for freight transport and the financial benefits of heavy haulbusiness. 2. The objective of the Study is to develop a comprehensive and integrated long-term Plan to 2030 thatwill guide Indias railway planners and service providers to improve the capacity quality competitiveness and utilization ofIndias rail freight transport services in general and heavy-haul services in particular. The plan will contain tangible actionable time-bound and monitorable measures. Although the first DFC will not be operational until about 2018 it is essential to put in place the Technical Assistance forincreasing the technical and material capacity of Indias railways to implement heavy haul freight improvements that will improvethe safety capacity quality competitiveness and utilization of Indias rail freight transport services. To achieve the Programobjective this consulting assignment will in close consultation with HHC and DFCCIL help plan and administer the Program fromits conceptual stage through research and development to the provision of concrete action-oriented strategies and measures forimplementation. The study shall therefore on the basis of detailed investigations and analysisrelevant international experience and evidence and the appraisal of alternatives advisethe HHC on the followingmatters: i. Planning and design of an effective and cost-efficient heavy-haul freight Research and Development Program. ii. Management of the approval Program: as part of this task the Consultant shall assist. HHC/DFCCIL in administration of procurement of any goods works and services within the Program in accordancewith the World Banks procurement policies and rules; iii. Prepare a detailed and cost-effective implementation planfor a world classheavy-haul Research Institute (HHRI) to conduct research and development in heavy-haul railway system creation maintenance andoperation. The Consultant shall prepare a Concept and Implementation Plan on the setting up of the HHRI in accordance with bestinternational practice which shall include inter alia strategic vision mission and objectives of the Institute governacelocation(s) including possible location within or co-location with an existing institution possible partnering or twinningarrangements with an international institute(s) organisation and staffing structure affiliations scopeof R&D activitiesdefining relationships and interfaces with stakeholders like Ministry of Railways RDSO industry other national and internationalresearch bodies etc human resources policies financing model for long term sustenance facilities and costs implementationschedule milestones for decisions and action etc. iv. Consult and work closely with HHC and DFCCIL to familiarize themselves thoroughly with and articulate the specificobjectives of the Program. v. Collect experience of other heavy-haul railways internationally and assess broadly their key features strengths andweaknesses and relevance of India. vi. Deliver a major outreach event involving MOR (IRB) Zonal Railways DFCCILRDSO rail freight users representatives leading academicsin the field etc. to ensure full stakeholder input to theHHRD&AProgram. vii. Consult closely with the Consulting Team responsible for Freight markets long-term commercial freight planning toensure that the planned HHRD&A Program is fully oriented to providing practical application to the specific freight marketscommercial challenges and conditions of India. viii. Prepare a detailed HHRD&A Program in the form of a matrix ofprioritised activities based on the classification system adopted. Demonstrate that the suggested activities to ensure that theHHRD&A Program isconsistent and comprehensive. The Program should encompass but is not necessarily limited to the technicalmatters. ix. Adopt a system engineering approach in which work on the variouselements of the heavy haul system are closely co-ordinated and harmonised to obtain highest possible efficiency. Ensureco-ordinationof the technical integration and consistency of interfaces between the classes of research and development activitiesin the HHRD&A Program: between infrastructure and rolling stock; between train consist and consist control features such asbreaking systems and draw gear; between train consist rolling stock and terminal facilities; and between route and terminalfacilities; and many others. The consultant willensure these interfaces are reflected and addressed in the research and developmentprogram in a complementary fashion. x. For each activity and sub-activity in the prepare a task scoping andspecification and appropriate terms of reference for technical resolution by experts; where the specification requires employmentof external professional services draft the terms of reference in a form suitable for bidding according to World Bank ProcurementPolicies and rules. xi. Similarly for each discrete activity and the total HHRD&A Programprepare cost estimates showing parts of the Program to be funded by the World Bank and parts that are the funding responsibilityof other entities. xii. Prepare and submit a draftproposed HHRD&A Program Report setting out the recommended and fully-documented HHRD&A Program containing a detailedspecification of activities within modules and their deliverables a Program time/workflow diagram critical path identificationdetailed budgets foreach module and activity (allowing for contingencies and allocationsfor activities still to bedefined). xiii. Prepare as an Annex to the HHRD&AProgram a Procurement Plan which provides information on proposed means of procurement of relevant parts of the plan drawn up in accordance with World Bank Procurement Policies and Rules.Note thatthe Consultant will not be eligible to participate in any way in subsequent contracts tendered under the Program but will beeligible to tender for any follow-on contract for Program Management (which TOR shall not be prepared under thiscontract). xiv. Based on comment and feedback on the Inception Report and Recommended Program from IRB DFCCIL World Bank and any otherreviewers consolidate into the Final HHRD&A Program for formal agreement by IRB DFCCIL and World Bank. 3. The Dedicated Freight Corporation of India Limited (DFCCIL) now invites eligible consulting firms("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultants should provide informationdemonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services. The short listing criteria are that the Consultants should have a minimum of Seven years of experience inthe relevant area and having successfully undertaken at least two similar assignments particularly linear projects like Railwaysfunded by multilateral agencies. The consultant should have qualified and experienced qualified personnel in theirteam. 4. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn toparagraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employmentof Consultants [under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits& Grants] by World Bank Borrowers January 2011 setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict ofinterest. 5. Consultants may associate withother firms in the form of a joint venture or a sub consultancy toenhance their qualifications. 6. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedure set out in the World Bank Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loans andIDA Credits & Grants] by World Bank Borrowers January 2011 (http://web.worldbank.org/WBSITE/EXTERNAL/PROJECTS/PROCUREMENT/0contentMDK:20060840~pagePK:84269~piPK:60001558~theSitePK:8426600.html ). 7. Consultants should provide information as included in Annexure-I. Request of EOI will not beconsidered if Annexure-I not submitted in given format) 8. Expression of Interest will not be accepted electronically. 9. Expressions of interest must be delivered in a writtenform to the address below in person along with CD both (in MS Office Word file - EOI & Annexure-I in proper given format both)by 04/10/2013. Request of EOI will not be consider if Annexure-I along with supporting document will not submitted in properformat. 10. column4: Wbr 14-post-heavy Haul Program Development And Management [pkg 2] : Freight Marketing And Commercial Strategies For Heavy Haul Rail Transport In India (hhpdmcs)
column10: Dedicated Freight Corridor Corporation of India Limited
column12: Room No. 5075th Floor Pragati Maidan Metro Station Building Complex
column18: REQUEST FOREXPRESSION OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRM SELECTION) [Country] INDIA [NAME OF PROJECT] EASTERN DEDICATEDFREIGHT CORRIDOR Loan No./Credit No./Grant No.: IN-8066 Assignment Title: Consultancy Services for Heavy Haul Program Development and management Consultant forMarketing andCommercial Strategies for Heavy Haul Rail Transport in India(HHPDMCS). Reference No. (as per Procurement Plan): P114338 1. Dedicated Freight Corridor Corporationof India Limited (DFCCIL) has received a Loan No.8066-IN of US$ 975 Million from the World Bank towards the cost of Eastern DFC project-1 and intends to apply part of the proceedsof this loan for engaging a Consultant for Marketing and Commercial Strategies for Heavy Haul RailTransport in India forDFCCIL. 2. The objective of the Study is to develop a comprehensive and integrated long-term Planto 2030 that will guide Indias railway planners and service providers to improve the capacity quality competitiveness andutilization of Indias rail freight transport services in general and heavy-haul services in particular. The plan will contain tangible actionable time-bound and monitorable measures. Although the first DFC will not be operational until about 2018 it is essential to put in place theCommercialand Marketing strategies that will convert identified potential to effective demand including attracting new users to therailway system. The study shall therefore on the basis of detailed investigations and analysis relevant international experienceand evidence and the appraisal of alternatives advise the HHC on the following matters:  The projected freight market that could be attractedto Indias railways by a successful heavy-haul Commercial and Marketing Planto be progressively implemented over the period to 2030;  A core heavy-haul rail network for India including DFClines feeder lines and other IR lines that might form part of the core heavy-haul network including an optimum program for stagingthe physical construction of infrastructure and provision of transport services on the core system;  Traffic movement and train operating and servicestrategies to derive the maximum competitive advantage from heavy-haul rail capability;  The current costs and financial performance of freighttraffic segments including commodities and key routes and the opportunities for improving train operating efficiencies reducingtraffic costs and improving financial performance through the heavy-haul proposals;  Market-based rail freight pricing strategies that maybetter serve both freightcustomers and service providers and contribute to the maximum profitable exploitation of the capabilitiesof heavy-haul; also the corresponding tariff regulatory/ appeal arrangements which may be necessary to protect user and publicinterests;  The financing needs and broad commercial returns ofthe recommended heavy-haul rail program (infrastructure and rolling stock) the key risks to the recommended program and itssuccessful performance and possible mitigation measures if any;  An effective long-term Commercial and Marketing Planwhich describes all necessary and sufficient elements needed to deliver the recommended network and services and to attract thefreight markets and volumes identified the key decisions and decision-makers and actions and actors and other material aspectswith a timeline to 2030. 3. The Dedicated Freight Corporation of India Limited (DFCCIL) now invites eligibleconsulting firms ("Consultants") to indicate their interestin providing the Services. Interested Consultants should provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications andrelevant experience to perform the Services. The short listing criteria are that theConsultants should have a minimum of Seven years of experience in the relevant area andhaving successfully undertaken at least two similar assignments as defined in Annexure-I particularly linear projects likeRailways preferably funded by multilateral agencies. 4. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the WorldBanks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants[under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants] by WorldBank Borrowers January 2011 setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict of interest. 5. Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a joint venture or a subconsultancy to enhance their qualifications. 6. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedure set out inthe WorldBank Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants] by World BankBorrowers January 2011 (http://web.worldbank.org/WBSITE/EXTERNAL/PROJECTS/PROCUREMENT/0contentMDK:20060840~pagePK:84269~piPK:60001558~theSitePK:8426600.html). 7. Consultants should provide information as included inAnnexure-I. 8. Request of EOI will not accept electronically. 9. Expressions of interest must bedelivered in a written form in sealed cover to the address given below in person along with CD both (in MS Office Word file - EOI& Annexure-I in proper given format both) by 15:00 hrs on March 7 2013. Requestof EOI will not be considered if Annexure-I along with supporting document will notsubmitted in properformat. 10. Further information can be obtained at the address below during office hours i.e. 1000 to 1700hours. Dedicated Freight Corridor Corporation of India Limited Anil K.Singh General Manager (Operations & Safety) Dedicated FreightCorridor Corporation of India Limited. Room No. 5075th Floor Pragati Maidan Metro Station BuildingComplex New Delhi ? 110 001 INDIA Phone : +91 11 23379880 Fax : +91 11 23454882 E-mail: anilksingh@dfcc.co.in Website: www.dfcc.in Annexure - I (Requestof EOI will not be considered if Annexure-I not submitted in given format) 1. Company Brochures 2. Profile of the Company (please provide not more than two page note including year of establishment type of business ofthe company experience of consultancy works etc.) 3. Description/Details of similar assignments 1 (Similar assignments mean theconsultancy assignment pertaining to monitoring of Institutional Strengthening Module for Marketing and Commercial Strategies Component safeguards of Linear Projects like Railways preferably funded by multilateral fundingagencies) carried out during last seven years. Followingdetails for each assignment (Only those assignments should be included which have beencarried out by the applicant. The assignments carried out by parents/sister companies should not be included) must beprovided: a. Name of Work b. Name of Client c. Country (where work is executed) d. Type of Organization like Railways e. Brief description of scope of assignment f. Components of assignment (Components of assignments should be indicated as: Monitoring andreviewing of implementation of Marketing and Commercial Strategies and any other relevant components) g. Award Date h. Completion Date (if not completed percentage of work completed so far and likely date ofcompletion) i. No. of man months j. Consultancy Cost k. If executed in JV % Participation l. Funding of the Project- Government Multilateral/Bilateral (Name of Funding agency to beindicated) any other source (details is to be provided) 4. Any other information applicant may like tosubmit to indicate that they are qualified to perform the services. _______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 1 Similar assignments mean the consultancy assignment pertaining to development andimplementation of Marketing and Commercial Strategies for Linear Projects like Railways preferably funded by multilateral funding agencies. Similar assignments could consistfollowing components:- (a) Consultancy assignments in respect of preparation of critical area for research analysisand outcome reporting in its own right as well as contributing to the Commercial and Marketing Plan (b) Business Plan/Corporate Plan (c) revenue model financial appraisal (d) Identification of line capacity and other works with time frame for implementationFreight traffic costing financialcontribution analysis and identification of more competitive market-based pricing models andfreight traffic policies (e) Network-based traffic and train movement modeling identify optimal heavy-haul trainoperating Origin-Destination movements viability analysis of heavy-haul freight sub-network (f) Identification of locations for development of logistic parks Project development forthe establishment of logistic centers either by PPP or other project delivery structures (g) Developed implementation plan for commercially viable and market-oriented rail freightbusiness including pricing strategies and development of a long-term plan for freight train operations terminals and othernecessary components of the plan (h) Identification of future traffic generators and consumption centres and rail connectivityrequirements

IN ? 8066 of US$ 975 Million fromthe World Bank towards the cost of Eastern DFC project-1 and intends to apply part ofthe proceeds of this loan for engaging a Consultant for developing and assisting with implementation of Institutional StrengtheningProgram for DFCCIL. 2. The objective of the Program is to ensure DFCCIL has the structuralmanagement human resources and business process strategies necessary to be a world-class rail infrastructure entity responsive toIndias specific circumstances and able to meet its multi-faceted commercial social and environmental functions and obligations.Therefore the Consultant shall on the basis of best international and Indian practices in management andoperations of infrastructure companies in general and railway infrastructure entities in particular;  Designand articulate anoverall strategy for DFCCIL capacity strengthening that will guide the detailed components set out herein;  Reviewthe current program control and project management systems and tools and recommend and provide best practice systems to be utilizedby DFCCIL to deliver the DFC network;  Recommend and provide operating manuals for detailed approaches to DFCCILs responsibilities for the operations andmanagement (O&M) of DFC infrastructure;  Developcomprehensive and effective DFCCIL management information systems compatible with MOR systems;  Developsystems for DFCCIL to meet its health safety social and environmental management aims and obligations;  Preparea Technologies Plan to permit the proactive adoption of future efficiency-enhancing approaches;  Identifycommercial and financial management  staff systems and process strengthening measures;  Developa strategy to implement Logistics Parks;  Recommend a long-term human resources plan for DFCCIL from construction through to operating stages consistent with theoverall strategy for institutional strengthening. 3. The Dedicated Freight Corporationof India Limited (DFCCIL) now invites eligible consulting firms ("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing theServices. column4: Selection Of Procurement Agent For Gfatm Funding

column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST (EoI) (Procurement Agent Services for Drugs Equipment Diagnostic Kits and other medical suppliesand Related Services required for Implementation of National AIDS Control Programme) India (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) Ref No.: DAC/PROC/2013/07 This notice follows the General ProcurementNotice published in UN Development Business (UNDB) online. The Government of India has plans toimplement fourth phase of National AIDS Control Project (NACP-IV) supported by various donor partners viz. World Bank GFATM otherdonor partners including funds of Govt.of India. The NACP-IV shall be implemented by Department of AIDS Control Ministry ofHealth and Family Welfare Govt. of India. It is intended that funds of GFATM will be applied to eligible payments under thecontracts for which this Request for Expression of Interest is issued. The Department of AIDS Control (DAC)Government of India now invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Procurement Agent servicesrequired to procure drugs equipment diagnostic kits and other medical supplies for implementation of programme components viz.Basic Services and Care Support and Treatment Services under NACP-IV funded by Global Fund to Fight AIDS Tubercolosis andMalaria (GFATM) Switzerland Geneva. Services of a Consultant organization willbe required for procuring ARV drugs Diagnostic Kits and other medical supplies as well as ensuring the inspection and testing(third party) and supply chain management of the goods/supplies. The Consultant will handle the procurement of goods and relatedservices viz. quality assurance and supply chain management to meet DACs requirements to achieve value for money efficiencytransparency probity and adherence to the Guidelines: Procurement of Goods Works and Non- Consulting Services under IBRD Loansand IDA Credits & Grants by The World Bank Borrowers (January 2011 Edition) and WHOs Interagency Guidelines: A ModelQuality Assurance System for Procurement Agencies. The contract will be initially for 2 years.This is extendable up to another two years on the basis of performance. The Consultant organization must have asubstantial corporate structure and professional base in procurement quality assurance and supply chain management. The EoI andcapability will be assessed against evidence of skills and experience in providing services in the following areas; assistingorganizations in procurement quality assurance and supply chain management; and managing procurement on complex projectspreferably in the HIV/AIDS or health sector. The EoI should be sent along with aCapability Statement including a profile of the lead organization and any collaborating organizations covering relevant technicaland geographical experience along with thefinancial turnover for the last 3 financial years. Experience in assisting organizationsin procurement quality assurance and supply chainmanagement in general and in health sector projects may also be indicated indetail. Individual CVs are not required at this stage. Interested consultants must also provide information indicating as to howthat they are qualified to perform the services (brochures description of similar assignments experience in similar conditionsand availability of appropriate skills among staff etc.). Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a jointventure or a sub-consultancyto enhance their qualifications. Any EoI with inadequate informationthose which do not meet the abovecriteria or those received after the closing date may not be short listed. EoI should be as concise and focused as possible togive evidence of the above requirements including the capability statement and organization profiles. The short listing will bedone on the basis of the above information/documents. A Consultant will be selected in accordancewith the procedures set out in The World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by The World Bank Borrowers(January 2011 Edition). The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of The World Banks Guidelines settingforth The World Banks policy on conflict of interest. The EoIs should be sent to the followingaddress so as to arrive no later than 14.00 Hrs. on 5 th December 2013. The shortlistedorganizations shall be laterinvited to submit detailed proposals. Deputy Secretary(Admn & Proc) Department of AIDS Control 9 th Floor Chandralok Building 36 Janpath NewDelhi -110001 Tel: 011-43509964;Fax: 011-23731746 Web site: http://www.naco.gov.in
