column4: Hiring Of Capacity Building Organization For Minor Irrigation Department (mid)
column12: Superintending Engineer Central Minor Irrigation Circle CampusPlot No-A-8/2 Bhoi Nagar
column18: Department of Water Resources Odisha Community Tank Development ManagementSociety Loan No:75760-IN (OCTMP) Credit No:44990-IN Superintending Engineer Central Minor Irrigation CircleCampus Plot No-A-8/2 Bhoi Nagar Bhubaneswar-751022 Ph-0674-2542252 E. Mail: pd_octmp@yahoo.co.in EXPRESSION OF INTEREST REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST FOR HIRING OF CAPACITY BUILDING ORGANIZATION FOR MINOR IRRIGATIONDEPARTMENT (MID) TheGovernment of Orissa through the Government of India has received a loan and a credit (totaling to US$ 87.8 million) from theInternational Bank for reconstruction and Development (IBRD) and the International Development Association (IDA) for theimplementation of the Orissa Community Tank Management Project (OCTMP) across the State of Orissa. The Government of Orissa intendsto apply part of this loan/credit to finance the hiring of services 2. The proposedproject development objective is for selected tank based producers to improve agricultural productivity and water user associationsto manage tank systems effectively. It is envisaged that the project to be implemented over a period of 5 years will support thephysical rehabilitation/modernization of about 324 tanks with an estimated CCA of about 60000 hectares spread across 12 districtsof the state. 3. The basic objective of thisassignment will be strengthening the capacity of about 530 Junior Engineer/Assistant Engineers/ Assistant Executive Engineers/Executive Engineers/Superintending Engineers/Chief Engineer basically the Civil Engineers who form Project Implementing Team(PIT)of Minor Irrigation Department (MID) working at State Districthead quarter and project level including field level technicalstaff.It aims to immediately help them contribute to overall organizationaleffectiveness for implementing the OCTMP successfullyand beyond the project as successful managers. As an intra-organizational development the project envisages focused training andcapacity building inputs both in the field of general management and engineering aspects which would cover managerial knowledge toimprove engineering skill competency on survey investigation and design ofnew minorirrigation projects improved construction related irrigation engineering technology quality control & quality assurance tools& techniques participatory irrigation management irrigation project management environmental management of irrigationprojects andbasic techno-managerial skills. This will help the project implementing team (PIT) addressing unprecedented andunforeseen challenges of today while implementing a time bound project in a complex and dynamic rural environment effectively andefficiently. 4. OCTDMS now invites eligible premier institutes in the fieldof academic research & development of national and international repute to express their interest in providing the aboveservices. Interested institutes must provide sufficient information indicatingthat they arequalified to perform the Services (year of starting of the institute infrastructure similar nature of work carried outcertificate courses provided in the field of management civil/water resources/irrigation and mechanical engineering subjectsbrochures description of similar assignments undertaken experience in similar conditions details of any centre of excellenceestablished and details of continues training support provided to any project etc). 5. A consultant will be selected following selection based on theConsultants Qualifications (CQS) in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines- Selection andEmployment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers May 2004 and revised October 2006 and May 2010. 6. Interested Consultants/ Organizations may submit proposal in the official address of the ProjectDirector given below by post/hand so as to reach not later than 15 th December 2011 up to 15.00 hrs. Late submission of proposals after due date and time shall not be received. The proposal will beopened on 15 th Dec 2011 at 3.30 PM in the conference hall of the OCTDMS in presence of the Firm /Organisation. Orissa Community Tank Development Management Society Office Campus of the Superintending Engineer CentralMinor Irrigation Circle Campus PlotNo-A-8/2 Bhoi Nagar Bhubaneswar-751022 7. The assignment will be for a period of one year. 8. Interested Consultants may obtainfurther information from the Contact Person: Mr. L N Padhi Social Development Program Officer telephone number: 0674-2542252between 10 AM to 5 PM on all working days. (Smt.Usha PadheeIAS) Project Director OCTMP-cum-Additional Secretary to the Government

column4: Consultancy Services To Prepare Technical Feasibility Reports To Supply Surface Water In The Six Districts Of The State
column10: Department of Water Supply & Sanitation Punjab
column12: State Programme Management Cell Department of Water Supply & Sanitation Punjab Water Works Phase-2
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST INDIA (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMSSELECTION) Punjab RuralWater Supply & Sanitation Project ConsultancyServices to prepare technical feasibility reports to supply surface water in the six districts of the State Credit No. 4251-IN Project IDNo. P 090592 1. This Request for Expressions of Interest follows the General ProcurementNotice for this project that appeared in Development Business on August 132006. 2. The Government of Punjab (GoP) has received a credit from the InternationalDevelopment Association and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this credit to payments under the above contract forconsultant services. 3. The services under this consultancy contractinclude fool-proof method to reduce dependence on ground water for human consumption by making availablesurface water as independent source or in-conjunction with the ground water to bring the chemical contaminants within thepermissible limits for drinking purposes for distribution in the villages through existing water supply systems by suitablymodifying them. The focus of the study is ontechnical feasibility to transfer treated surface water to villages through a networkof supply mains in bulk quantities enabling conjunctive use of ground and surface water in the six affected districts of PunjabState namely Ludhiana Jalandhar Hoshiarpur Sangrur Barnala and Moga. Consultant would assess drinking water demand and identifywater sources in the six districts where quality of Ground water is affected with contaminants. Time frame for the completion ofstudy is five months. 4. The State Programme Management Cell Mohali now invites eligible consultingfirms to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultants should provide information demonstratingthat they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services. The shortlisting criteria are: (i). Financial Strength ofthe Consultant ? minimum annual turnover should be Rs 4 crore for each of the last three financialyears (ii) Experience of similarassignments (iii) Experience of workingin Punjab or states with similar socio-demographic features. (iv) Availability ofappropriate skills among staff Consultants may associate to enhance their qualifications. [The Association may take the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or ofa sub-consultancy] 5. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the Quality and Cost BasedSelection procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants byBank Borrowers "May 2004 revised Oct 2006 revised May 2010". 6. Interested Consultants may obtain further information at the address givenbelow from 9.00 AM to 5.00 PM on working days. 7. The Government ofIndia has applied for a Credit from the World Bank towards the cost of the NACSP and intends to apply parts of the proceeds forconsultant services. The NACSP shall be implemented by Department of AIDS Control (DAC) Ministry of Health and Family WelfareGovt. of India. 3. The NACSP includesimplementing a communication strategy that includes:  Motivating behavioural change in GeneralPopulation and specific target groups including the High Risk Behaviour Groups (HRGs) (CSWs IDUs & MSM) and Bridge Populations(clients of sex workers migrants andtruck drivers) and other key population groups.  Dispelling myths and misconceptions raise awareness levels about risk and the need for behaviorchange  Creating an environment free from stigma anddiscrimination  Promoting use of condoms  Promoting voluntary blooddonation  Generating demand for services such as testingand counseling services for STI and ART Above scope is indicative only. 4. To have maximum impact and reaching target audienceDAC intends to hireprofessional creative agency to perform followingactivities:  Development of 360 degree multimedia communication including audio-visual materials such asPSAs for Radio & TV advertisements for print media activation ideas new technologies etc.  Visibility & Promotionalmaterials for outdoor/ service delivery points- posters hoardings bus shelters illuminated signages pamphlets/ brochures branding materialsexhibition materials etc.  Strategy for ensuring service centres (ICTC/PPTCT STD clinics Blood Donation and ART centres) are made information friendly by adequate display /availability of IEC material.  Support at conferences and exhibitions for venue conference material exhibition displaymaterials etc 5. The contract will be initially for 2 years and is extendable yearly basedon annual performance reviews. 6. DAC invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providingthe services. Interested consultants must providethe following information indicating that they are qualified to perform theservices (brochures description of similar assignments experience in similar conditionsavailability of appropriate skills among staff etc). In view of thelikely size of assignment it is proposed to consideragencies havingadequate financial managerial and technical resources and with proven relevant experience in implementing projectsof similar nature. They may submit the following documents:  Capability Statement including total turnoverof the company along with audited accounts of the last three years.  Agency background and profile Agencybackground and profile of the leadorganization and anycollaborating organizations as the case may be  A current list of clients and briefdescription of services performed for them.  Experience in social communications withpreference on health ? preferably in HIV/AIDS reproductive health and social marketing. (Please do not enclose specimens of work at this stage) 7. Consultants mayassociate with other firms in the form of a joint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications. Any EoI withinadequate information or those received after the closing date may not be considered. EoI should be as concise and focused aspossible to give evidence of the above requirements including the capabilitystatement and organization profiles. The short listingwill be done on the basis of the above information/documents. 8. A consultant will beselected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (January 2011 edition). The attention of interested consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelinessetting forth the World Banks policy on conflict of interest. 9. The EoIs should be delivered to "Deputy Secretary (Admn & Proc) Department of AIDS control 9th Floor Chandralok Building 36 Janpath NewDelhi -110001" by 20 th August 2013 not later than 17.30pmin a sealed envelope with clearly mentioning on the envelope "Expression of Interest forCreative Agency". The shortlistedorganizations shall be later invited to submit detailed proposals.

column4: Wbr 99-af-package Cs-37-establishing And Operating State Health Data Resource Center (shdrc) In Tamil Nadu Under Additional Financing
column12: 692 MHU ComplexIInd Floor Anna Salai RoadCIT Nagar Nandnam
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST (EOI) TO PROVIDE ITCONSULTANCY SERVICES FOR ESTABLISHING AND OPERATINGSTATE HEALTH DATA RESOURCE CENTRE IN TAMILNADU Name of Country : INDIA Name of Project : State Health Data Resource Centre Loan/Credit/Grant No. : Loan /Credit No:4756 -IN HIRING SERVICES OF ITCONSULTANTS FOR CONSULTANCY AND IMPLEMENTING STATE HEALTH DATA RESOURCE CENTRE FOR TAMILNADU This request forExpressions of Interest follows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared in UN Development Business online onSeptember 5 2004 and the Request for Expressions of Interest (REOI) that was published in UNDB online on 22 nd December 2012. The objective of the StateHealth Data Resource Centre is to implement a data warehouse / data mining solution over the health data resources in the state.State of Tamil Nadu captures voluminous health data through Health Management Information System (HMIS) / Hospital ManagementSystem (HMS) and other ICT initiatives in the health sector. State Health DataResource Centre is expected to enable centralized review of state health data Effective evidencebased policy making Implement / Administer health services using data based evidence monitor health service Indicators andprovide immediate and adequate information to all the stakeholders. The main objectiveof this consultancy is to design/ customize/ develop and implement State Health Data Centre covering entire functionality andobjective of the SHDRC. The Consultantswould undertake; l A need assessment study to put in place a DataWarehouse solution strategy to achieve the stated vision of SHDRC. l Design and development/ customization of aDatawarehouse / Data Mining solution to work in conjunction with the current ICTinfrastructure at TNHSP. This shall also entail development of a web portal and integration of state health data from differentdatabases. l Deployment and testing of a complete datawarehouse / data mining solution complete with a web-portal for informationaccess and hosting the entire system atTNSDC. l Institutional Capacity-building for TNHSPstaffs. l Operational assistance l Maintenance and support For and onbehalf of theGovernor of Tamil Nadu the Managing Director ELCOT representing Project Director TNHSP invites eligible Consultants to expresstheir Interest in working with TNHSP and providing consultancy services. Therefore interestedconsultants are requested to submit the following details (4 copies in English) with evidence that they have the capacity toundertake the work in the aforesaid areas and have the required qualities to perform the services. (The Consultant Firms shouldnote that each of following details should be prepared as individual chapters with Table of Contents referring the pagenumbers)  Profile of the Consultancyfirm with Name postal address (Registered Office and Local Office) facsimile number and e-mail address of the Consultancyfirm.  Ownership andorganizational structure of the Firm.  Financial Statement forthelast 2 Audited Financial years.  Details about theexperience in delivering similar projects for Public Sector/ Government organization/ funded project during the last 5 yearsviz.  Consultancy projects threeor more for Data Ware House Solution  Consultancy projects threeor more for Health sector  At least one high volumeData migration projects  Technical and Managerialcapabilities of the Firm SealedEOI Bid may be submitted by individual company/ partnership firm or joint venture of Companies. In case of joint venture a maximumof 2 partners will be allowed. One of the partners should be nominated as a Prime Bidder and Prime bidder should be authorized bythe joint venture partners for acting on behalf of the joint venture. A maximum of one Bid only will be allowed from the joint venturepartners. The partner of one joint venture is not allowed to be a partner of another joint venture. Suitableconsultant firms will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines "Selection andEmployment of Consultants by World Bank Borrower May 2004 and revised October 2006". Interested Consultants may obtain further information if any atthe address given below on any working day between 10.00 A.M. to 5.45 P.M. The expression of interest should be submitted to theaddress given below not later than 3.00 P.M. on 19-06-2013. Sd/- 31-05-2013 Managing Director Address: The Managing Director Electronics Corporation of Tamil Nadu Limited 692 Anna Salai Nandanam Chennai-600035 Email : md@elcot.in FAX :+91-044-42152200 Phone: +91-044-24330612 Also please visit: www.elcot.in Labels: Notice Tenders

Provision ofinfrastructure in terms of buildings and equipments to all the secondary care hospitals in the state is one of the key activitiesof the project. Tamil Nadu Health Systems Project has implemented HMIS/HMS on pilotbasis in 5 hospitals all 43 hospitals in 5 pilot districts including 12 accreditation hospitals under Phase 1 and all the projecthospitals in remaining 24 districts under Phase 2 which is nearing completion. NowTNHSP has proposed to scale up and implement HMS HMIS MIS and CMS activities in Phase 3 at 175+ locations. column4: Hiring Of Consulting Firms For Two Consultancies Viz. A) Capacity Building Of Ksad; And B) Capacity Building For Taluk Panchayats.
column12: Finance Department 1st Floor 3rd Gate MS Building Dr Ambedkar Veedhi
column18: GOVERNMENT OF KARNATAKA (GOK) Public Financial Management Capacity Building Project Trust Fund Number: TF099884 EXPRESSION OF INTEREST The GOK has received a grant from theIBRD (World Bank) and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this grant to payments under the contract for consulting servicesfor the Project. FD GOK invites Expressionof interest from established consulting firms for two consultancies viz. a) capacitybuilding of KSAD; and b) capacity building for Taluk Panchayats. These assignments involves following broad tasks: (i) Study of the existing system including business process and organizational structure (ii) Develop organizational structure with detailed staffing and training requirements; (iii) Develop reports such as business process report IT report; (iv) Developaccounting manual auditing manual and training manuals; and (v) Provide training to keystaff/trainers and support implementation Detailed EOI for both theseconsultancies can be downloaded from http://finance.kar.nic.in/. Interested consultants may obtain further informationregarding theProject from the address below during the period from 1100 hours to 1600 hours on any working day. Separate Expressionof Interest for eachof the assignments must be delivered to the address below by 1700 hours on 26 September 2011. Project Director Project Monitoring Unit Finance Department 1 st Floor 3rd Gate MS Building Dr Ambedkar Veedhi Bengaluru Phone: 080-22032252 Mobile: +91-9590441942 e-mail: bngpmu@kar.nic.in

column2: IN: Bihar Flood Mgmt Information Sys- II
column4: Designing Developing And Deploying Embankment Asset Management System For Bagmati-adhwara Basin
column12: 2nd Floor Jal Sansadhan BhawanAnisabad
column18: Government of Bihar Water ResourcesDepartment Flood Management Improvement SupportCentre 2nd Floor Jal Sansadhan Bhawan Anisabad Patna #800002 India: Bihar Flood Management Implementation Support Project II Request for RevisedExpression of Interest No: FMISC/REOI/02/2011-2012 Dated: 01 st September 2011 The Flood Management Improvement SupportCentre (FMISC) Water Resources Department (WRD) Govt. of Bihar has received a Grant[DFID Grant No. TF096841] from theInternational Development Association and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this Grant to payments under the contracts for "Designing Developing and DeployingEmbankment Asset Management System for Bagmati-Adhwara Basin". 1. The objective of this consultancy is to prepare acomprehensive Embankment Asset Management System (EAMS) for Bagmati-Adhwara basin that ispartially embanked and where substantialinvestments for new embankments are planned. The EAMS would support flood defence functions including maintenance and strengtheningof existing embankments anti-erosion works and other flood defence mechanisms with enough flexibility to include future new floodcontrol structures. The EAMS would be developed allowing for community participationforembankment surveillance as well as updation of embankment safety information. 2. The Consultancy services will involve: (i) Design and development of GIS-based Embankment Asset Management System with user friendly functional modules for variousactions involved in embankment asset management and (ii) Development of UsersManual Technical Reference and Training of designated WRD staff for sustainable effectiveuse of EAMS. 3. The FMISC Patna invites eligible Consultants toindicate their interest in providing the Consultancy Services for the above assignment. 4. Interested Consultants must provide the followinginformation indicating that they are qualified to perform the Services: Brochures Description of similar assignments for flood /irrigation / drainage / road embankments Availability of skills among staff including but not limited to Hydrologist/HydraulicEngineer Geotechnical Engineer Softwarespecialist System Analyst Database Specialist GIS Specialist. 5. The criteria for short listing of the Consultingfirms shall be as follows:  The firms should have been in business for at least 5 years inconsulting business;  The firms shall be financially sound with an average annualturnover of more than INR 10000000 (US$ 220000) during the last five years (2006-07 to2010-11);  The firms should have at least 1 similar experience inembankment asset management system. Experience in GIS-based embankment asset management for flood defense/irrigation/drainage wouldbe given preference and  Availability of skillsamong staff (Hydrologist/Hydraulic Engineer Geotechnical Engineer Software specialistSystem Analyst Database Specialist GIS Specialist). 6. Consultants may associate to enhance theirqualifications. [The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of asub-consultancy]. 7. Aconsultant will be selected in accordance with the Quality and CostBased Selection (QCBS) procedures set out in the World Banks "Guidelines: Selection and Employment of ConsultantsUnder IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers- January 2011". The Guidelines are available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 8. Interested Consultants may obtain further informationat the address given below from 10.00 # 17.00 hours (IST) on all working days. This notice for Revised Expression of Interest hasalso been posted on websites http://fmis.bih.nic.in http://wrd.bih.nic.in http://prdbihar.gov.in and http://tenders.bih.nic.in . 9. Revised Expression of Interest with all relevant information and documents must be submitted and subscribed Revised Expression of Interest for# "Designing Developing and Deploying Embankment Asset Management System forBagmati-Adhwara Basin" on top of a closed envelope and be delivered to the address below by not later than 15:00 hours (IST) on Friday 23 September 2011. In event this last date being declared as holiday by the State Government due date for submission of above REOI willbe the next working day up till the same appointed time. Er. A. K. Samaiyar Joint Director Flood Management Improvement Support Centre 2nd Floor Jal Sansadhan Bhawan Anisabad Patna- 800002. Telefax : +(91)612-2256999. (A. K.Samaiyar) E-mail: fmisc_bihar@yahoo.co.in Joint Director

column2: IN: Bihar Flood Mgmt Information Sys- II
column4: Hiring Of Consultancy Services For Conducting River Cross Section And Embankment Status Survey In Bagmati-adhwara Basin
column12: 2nd Floor Jal Sansadhan BhawanAnisabad
column18: INDIA-Bihar Flood Management ImplementationSupport Project II DFID Grant No. : TF096841 Hiring of Consultancy Services for Conducting River Cross Section andEmbankment Status Survey in Bagmati-AdhwaraBasin Expressions of Interest[EOI] Ref No. :FMISC/EOI/#./2011-2012 The Flood ManagementImprovement Support Centre (FMISC) Water Resources Department Government of Bihar has received a Grant [DFID Grant No. TF096841] from the International DevelopmentAssociation and intendsto apply part of the proceeds of this Grant to payments underthe contracts for "Conducting River Cross Sectionand Embankment Status Survey in Bagmati-Adhwara Basin". 1. The objective of the consultancy is to collect preciselevel data at close intervals across River and Embankments for creating a precise cross section from countryside NSL on one bankto countryside NSL on the other bank. This will be done for all embankments withinBagmati-Adhwara basin from Nepal Border up to Dumri bridge on Kosi River. In additiondetailed modern river/embankment surveys using visual and scientific inspection techniques of the embankment status in theBagmati-Adhwara basin is also to be carried out and reported in a formatsuitable for easy incorporation in EAMS. Data thus collected would be used to create 2D and 3D visualizations for a holistic assessmentwith reference to River and other civil structures. 2. The Consultants services will consist of four parts:(i) Preparationof survey plan along with selection and fixation of additional Bench Marks (ii) Carrying out cross section surveyand engineering properties survey for embankment status using modern and accurate leveling instruments (iii) Data entry in EAMSdata entry module and creation of visualization and plots for verification by FMISC Patna; and (iv) Recommendations on proceduresfor updating data on requisite frequency. 3. The FMISC Patna invites eligible Consultants toindicate their interest in providing the Consultancy Services for the above assignment. 4. Interested Consultants must provide the followinginformation indicating that they are qualified to perform the Services: Brochures Description of Similar Assignments Availabilityof Skill among Staffs etc. 5. Consultants may associate to enhance theirqualifications. [The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of asub-consultancy] and this should be stated clearlyin the submission. 6. A consultant will be selected in accordance withQuality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) procedures set out in the World Banks"Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants Under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits& Grants by World Bank Borrowers- January 2011". The Guidelines are available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 7. Interested Consultants may obtain further informationat the address given below from 10.00 to 17.00 hours (IST) on all working days. This noticefor Expression of Interest has also been posted on websites http://fmis.bih.nic.in http://wrd.bih.nic.in http://www.prdbihar.gov.in and http://tenders.bih.nic.in. 8. Expression of Interest with all relevantinformation and documents must be submitted and subscribed "Expression of Interest for "Conducting River Cross Section and Embankment Status Surveys in Bagmati-AdhwaraBasin" on top of a closed envelope and be delivered to the address below by not later than 15:00 hours (IST) on Tuesday July 5 2011. Inevent this last date being declared as holiday by the State Government due date for submission of above EoI will be the nextworking day up till the same appointed time. Mr. A.K. column18: India Bihar Kosi Flood Recovery Project Cr. 4802 - IN Request for Expression of Interest for Designing Developing and Deploying Embankment Asset Management System for KosiBasin RefNo: BAPEPS/WRD/FMISC/EoI/01/2012-2013 1. The Government of India/Government of Bihar has received a credit ofUS $ 220million equivalent from the International Development Association (IDA) towards the cost of the Bihar Kosi Flood Recovery Projectand intends to apply part of the proceeds for consultancy services. 2. Government of Bihar (GoB) has constituted a society known as Bihar Aapda PunarwasEvam Punarnirman Society (BAPEPS) under the Societies Registration Act 1860 as a separate legal entity to implement the World Bankfinanced Bihar Kosi Flood Recovery Project. Water Resources Department (WRD) Govt. of Bihar is a sub-implementing agency forimplementing the Component "C" of the Project viz Strengthening Flood Management Capacity (having an outlay of IDA finance US $ 30million) with the support of Flood Management Improvement Support Centre (FMISC) under the department. 3. The consultancy services "Designing Developing and Deploying Embankment AssetManagement System for Kosi Basin" include: a) Obtaindata from the concerned Water Resources Department offices. b) Prepare inventory of the asset and classificationof the asset. c) Design anddevelopment of GIS-based Embankment AssetManagement System with user friendly functional modules for various actions involved in the objective. d) Development of UsersManual Technical Reference. e) Training ofdesignated WRD officials for sustainable effective use of EAMS. 4. The Flood Management Improvement Support Centre (FMISC) Water Resources Departmentinvites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Consultancy Services for the above assignment. InterestedConsultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified to perform the Services (brochures description of similarassignments for flood / irrigation / drainage / road embankments in similar conditions availability of appropriate skills amongstaff etc.). The criteria for short listing of the Consulting firms shall be as follows:  The firms should have been in consulting business for at least 10years;  The firms shall be financially soundwith an average annual turnoverof more than INR 110000000 (US$ 2000000) during thelast five years (2006-07 to 2010-11);  The firms should have at least twosimilar experiences in - asset management system for civil works. Experience in GIS-based embankment asset management for flooddefense/irrigation/drainage would be given preference  Availability of skills among staff (Maintenance Manager Design/Construction Engineers Cost Engineers Financial Analysts Geotechnical Engineer System Analyst/Database Specialist/GIS Specialist).  The firms should have working experience on projects funded by internationalfinancing agencies e.g. World Bank ADB etc of similar nature. 5. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 ofthe World banksGuidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [Under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants] by the World Bank Borrowers(Consultant Guidelines) setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict of interest 6. Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a joint venture or a sub-consultancyto enhance their qualifications. 7. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the Quality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS)procedures set out in the World Banks " Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants Under IBRD Loansand IDA Credits& Grants by World Bank Borrowers- January 2011". The Guidelines are available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 8. Interested Consultants may obtain further information at the addressgiven below from 10.00 ?17.00 hours (IST) on all working days. This notice for Expression of Interest has also been posted on websites http:// fmis.bih.nic.in  http://wrd.bih.nic.in  http://prdbihar.gov.in and http://tenders.bih.nic.in 9.Expression of Interest with all relevant information and documentsmust be submitted superscripted " Expression of Interestfor "Designing Developing and Deploying Embankment Asset Management System for Kosi Basin" on top of a closedenvelope to the address below by not later than 15:00 hours (IST) on 17 th August (Friday) 2012 In event this last date beingdeclared as holiday by the State Government due date for submission of above EOI will be the next working day at the sameappointed time. column2: IN: Bihar Flood Mgmt Information Sys- II
column4: Package 22-conducting River Cross Section And Embankment Assetsurvey In Bagmati-adhwara Basin
column12: 2nd Floor Jal Sansadhan Bhawan Anisabad
column18: Govt. of BiharWater Resources Department Flood Management Improvement Support Centre 2nd Floor Jal Sansadhan Bhawan Anisabad Patna? 800002. India : Bihar FloodManagement Implementation Support Project II EXPRESSION OF INTEREST No: FMISC/EOI/03/2011-2012 Dated:16 Dec 2011 The Flood Management Improvement Support Centre (FMISC) Water Resources Department Govt. of Bihar Patnahas received a Grant [DFID Grant No. TF096841] from the International Development Association and intends to apply part of theproceeds of this Grant for payments under the contracts for "Conducting River Cross Section and Embankment Asset Survey inBagmati-Adhwara Basin". 1. The objective of the consultancy is to collect existing data at closeintervals across River and Embankmentsfor creating a precise cross section from countryside NSL on one bank to countryside NSL on the other bank including channel bedprofile and information on assets related to the embankments. This will be done for all embankments within Bagmati-Adhwara basinfrom Nepal Border up to Dumri Bridge on Kosi River. Data thus collected would be used to create 2D and 3D visualizationsfor aholistic assessment with reference to river and other civil structures. The approximate length of rivers to be surveyed is 350Kms. The assignment is to be completed in 150 days. 2. The Consultants services will consist of four parts: (i) Preparationof survey plan along with selectionand fixation of additional Bench Marks (ii) Carrying out survey of (a) River and Embankment cross sections from countryside NSL on one bank to countryside NSL on the other bank referenced to nearest SOIBenchmark  and (b) All assets related to the embankments such as cross drainage works anti flood sluice anti erosion structuressurface (cover) material etc.; using modern surveying techniques (iii) Data entry in relevant EAMS modules (being developed by a parallel consultancy) and creation of visualization and plots for verification byFMISC Patna and (iv) Recommendations on procedures for updating data on requisitefrequency. 3. The FMISC Patna invites eligible Consultants toindicate their interest in providing the Consultancy Services for the above assignment. 4. Interested Consultants must provide the following information indicating that they are qualified to performthe Services:- Brochures Description of Similar Assignments Availability of Skillsamong Staff including but not limited to Survey Specialists with experience in modern surveying and data processing techniques GPSspecialists etc. 5. Consultants may associate to enhance their qualifications. [The "Association" may take the form of a Joint Venture (with joint and several liabilities) or of a Sub-Consultancy. This should be clearly stated in the EOI submission.] 6. The criteria for short listing of the Consulting firms shall be as follows:  The firms should have been insurveying business since at least 5 years;  The firms shall be financiallysound with an average annual turnover of more than INR 5000000 (US$ 110000) during thelast five years (2006-07 to 2010-11);  The firms should have at least 3similar experiences in river cross-section and embankment asset surveys. Experience in GIS-based surveys would be givenpreference;  Availability of skills among staff (Survey Specialists with experience in modernsurveying and data processing techniques GPS Specialists). 7. A consultant will be selected in accordance with Quality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) procedures set out in the World Banks "Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants Under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers- January 2011". TheGuidelines are available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 8. Interested Consultants may obtain further information at the address given below from 10.00 ? 17.00 hours(IST) on all working days. This notice for Expression of Interest has also been posted on websites http://fmis.bih.nic.in http://wrd.bih.nic.in http://www.prdbihar.gov.in and http://tenders.bih.nic.in. 9. Expression of Interest with allrelevant information and documents must be submitted and subscribed "Expression of Interest for - "Conducting River Cross Section and Embankment Asset Surveys in Bagmati-Adhwara Basin" on top of a closed envelope and be delivered to the address below by not later than 15:00 hours (IST) on Wednesday 25 th January2012. In event this lastdate being declared as holiday by the State Government due date for submission of EOI willbe the next working day up till the same appointed time. Er. A. K. column2: IN: Bihar Kosi Flood Recovery Project

column12: 2nd Floor Jal Sansadhan Bhawan Anisabad
column18: India Bihar Kosi Flood Recovery Project Cr.4802 - IN Request for Expression of Interest for Consultancy Services to Develop Flood Forecast & EarlyWarning andInundation Modeling System including Topographic and Cross-section Survey of Flood Plain and river water ways in KosiBasin Ref No: BAPEPS/WRD/FMISC/EoI/03/2013-14 1. The Government of India/Government of Bihar has received acredit of US $ 220 million equivalent from the International Development Association (IDA) towards thecost of the Bihar Kosi FloodRecovery Project and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consultancy services. 2. Government of Bihar (GoB) has constituted a Society known as Bihar Aapda Punarwas EvamPunarnirman Society (BAPEPS) under the Societies Registration Act- 1860 as a separate legal entity to implement the World Bankfinanced Bihar Kosi Flood Recovery Project. Water Resources Department (WRD) Govt. of Bihar is a sub-implementing agency forimplementing the component for Strengthening Flood Management Capacity (having anoutlay of IDA finance US $ 56.50 million) with thesupport of Flood Management Improvement Support Centre (FMISC) under the department. 3. Theconsultancy services "to develop Flood Forecast & Early Warning and Inundation Modeling System including Topographic andCross-section Survey of Flood Plain and river water ways in Kosi Basin "will broadlyinclude the following: (i) Provide comprehensive review of current approachestoground topographic survey floodforecast &early warning system and Inundation Modelling of river basins for better flood management and disaster risk reductionpurposes; (ii) Detail topographic & cross-section survey ofapproximately 17000 sq.km for Kosi riverbasin and its tributaries from Barah-kshetra (Nepal) to Kursela (Bihar) confluence withriver Ganga to develop appropriate Digital Elevation Model (DEM) for Flood Forecastand Inundation modelling. (iii) Development of aFlood Forecast model to provide flood forecasts for any location with longerlead-time (at least 72 hours before) and improved accuracy (compared to currentstatus) from Barah-kshetra to Kursela confluence with river Ganga in Kosi Basin including itstributaries (iv) Design and development of necessary Plans for additionally needed measuringequipment/structures (gauges discharge and sediment) Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) and telemetry optionscompatible with flood forecasting early warning and inundation modelling and also to develop their technical specifications withdetail cost estimates and bid documents of agreed option for procurement. (v) Development of flood Warning System based on the Floodforecast Model of Kosi River Basin. (vi) Development of FloodInundation Model based on DEM and topographic & Cross-section survey data so arrived of Kosi Basin including its tributaries inNorth Bihar as well as in Nepal portion. (vii) Capacity building andTraining The Terms of Reference (ToR) is available on web site ? http://fmis.bih.nic.in http://wrd.bih.nic.in 4. The earlier Request for Expression of Interest for this consultancy withRef No: BAPEPS/WRD/FMISC/EoI/ 02/ 2012-2013 issued vide this office Letter No.FMISC-24/2012-686 dated 28.09.2012 is superseded by this REOI. 5. FloodManagement Improvement Support Centre (FMISC) Water Resources DepartmentGovt. of Bihar re-invites eligible consulting firms toindicate their interest in providing the consultancy services for the above assignment. Interested Consultants must provideinformation indicating that they are qualified to perform the services (brochures description of similar assignments in similarconditions availability of appropriate skills among staff etc.). The criteria for short listing of the Consulting firmsshall be as follows:  The firm should have been in consulting business for at least 10 years.  The firms shall be financially sound with an average annual turnover of more than INR 420.00 million(US$ 7.0 million) during the previous five years.  The firms should have experience of similar studies of comparable magnitude in topographic surveyflood forecast & early warning and Inundation modelling and sub criteria inter alia (cost of study key experts surveyequipments modelling software used in the previous assignments in India or other countries experiencing frequent floods etc) inthe previous assignment.  Availability of skills among staff ( Floodforecast early warning system and Inundation modellers- Project Team Leader Survey and AutoCAD Expert- Co-Teamleader Hydrologist GIS/RS SCADA and Databasespecialists).  The firms should haveworking experience with externally funded project e.g. World Bank ADB etc. of similar nature. 6. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World BanksGuidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [Under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants] by the World Bank Borrowers(Consultant Guidelines May 2010) setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict ofinterest. 7. Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a joint venture or asub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications. This should be clearly stated in the submission. 8. A consultant will be selected in accordance with theQuality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) procedures set out in the World Banks "Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants Under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits &Grants by World Bank Borrowers- May 2004 modified October 2006 and May 2010". TheGuidelines are available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 9. InterestedConsultants may obtain further information at the address given below from 10.00 ? 17.00 hours (IST) on all working days. Thisnotice for Expression of Interest has also been posted on websites http://fmis.bih.nic.inhttp://wrd.bih.nic.in http://prdbihar.gov.in and http://tenders.bih.nic.in 10. Expression of Interest with all relevantinformation and documents must besubmitted superscripted "Expression of Interest for Consultancy Services "to develop Flood Forecast& Early Warning and Inundation Modelling System including Topographicand Cross-section Survey of Flood Plain and river water ways in Kosi Basin"on top of a closed envelope to the address below by not later than 15.00 hours(IST) on 12 March 2014 (Wednesday). In event this last date being declared as holiday by the State Government duedate for submission of above EoI will be the next working day at the same appointed time. Joint Director (A. K. Samaiyar) Flood Management Improvement SupportCentre JointDirector 2nd Floor Jal Sansadhan Bhawan Anisabad Patna-800002 Tele:+(91)612-2254802 Telefax:+(91)612-2256999 E-mail: krpbihar@gmail.com

column12: Flood Management Improvement Support Centre2nd Floor Jal Sansadhan Bhawan Anisabad
column18: Government of Bihar Water Resources Department Flood Management Improvement Support Centre2nd Floor JalSansadhanBhawan Anisabad Patna ?800002 India: Bihar Flood Management Implementation Support ProjectII Expression of Interest No: FMISC/EoI/03/2012-2013 Dated:10/01/2013 The FloodManagement Improvement Support Centre (FMISC) Water Resources Department Govt. of Bihar has received a Grant [DFIDGrant No. TF096841] from the International Development Association and intends to apply partof the proceeds of this Grantto payments under the contracts for "Developing approach protocols and mechanisms for community participation in embankmentsurveillance and piloting in Select Communities". 1. The objective of this consultancy is to prepare thecomprehensiveapproach protocols and mechanisms for community participation to supplement and complement the Water ResourcesDepartment Field office efforts in embankment surveillance for Bagmati-Adhwara basin that is partially embanked and wheresubstantial investments for new embankments are planned. Data obtained in this process will be integrated into Embankment AssetManagement system developed by another consultancy. The consultant will have to develop a plan for implementing recommendedapproach in the basin and to pilot it in select communities. 2. The Consultancy services will involve: (i) Review ofCurrent status in community participation in embankment surveillance (ii) Developapproach protocols and mechanisms for communityparticipation and (iii) Conduct workshop training and pilot implementation in select communities. 3. The FMISC Patna invites eligible Consultants to indicatetheir interest in providing the Consultancy Services for the above assignment. 4. Interested Consultants must provide the followinginformation indicating that they are qualified to perform the Services (Brochures description of similar assignments successfullycompleted in the past availability of skills and experience among key staff such as Communication Participation Expert CommunityMobilizing Expert and Embankment Specialist). 5. The criteria for short listing of the Consulting firmsshall be as follows:  The firm should have been in consulting businessfor at least 5 years.  The firms shall be financially sound with anaverage annual turnover of more than INR 75 00000) during the previous five years.  The firms should have successfully completed atleast two similar consultancies of comparable magnitude that inter alia includes cost duration and man months for key personnelduring the previous five years.  Availability of skills and experience among keystaff (Communication Participation Expert Community Mobilizing Expert and Embankment Specialist). 6. Consultants may associate to enhance theirqualifications. [The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of asub-consultancy]. This should be clearly statedin the submission 7. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks "Guidelines: Selection andEmployment of Consultants under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers- May 2004 modified October 2006and May 2010". The Guidelines are available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 8. Interested Consultants may obtain further information atthe address given below from 10.00 ? 17.00 hours (IST) on all working days. This notice for Expression of Interest has also beenposted on websites http://www.fmis.bih.nic.inhttp://wrd.bih.nic.inhttp://www.prdbihar.gov.inand http://tenders.bih.nic.in. 9. "Developing approach protocols and mechanisms forcommunity participation in embankment surveillance and Piloting in Select Communities "on top of a closed envelope andbe delivered to the address below by not later than15:00 hours (IST) on Wednesday 27th Feb 2013. column2: IN: National Ganga River Basin Project
column4: Surveyreview The Designredesign Where Necessary & Build New Sewerage Network Of About 242 Km3 Sewage Pumping Stations Incl All Appurtenant Structures & O & M Of Sewerage Network & Pumping Stations For 10 Years In Sewerage District-a Of Allahabadup
column10: Ganga Pollution Control Unit U. P. Jal Nigam
column12: U. P. Jal NigamMahewa Patti Purab NainiAllahabad
column18: INDIA-NATIONAL GANGA RIVER BASIN PROJECT Invitation for Bids (IFB) International Competitive Bidding LoanNo. 8065-IN Credit No. 4955-IN 1. Theinvitation for Bid follows the General Procurement Notice for this Project that appeared in UNDB online on March 30 2011 andupdated last on January 31 2014. 2. The NationalGanga River Basin Authority (NGRBA) Ministry of Environment & Forests Government of India has received a credit and loan ofUS$ 1 billion from The World Bank towards the cost of the National Ganga River Basin Project and intends to apply part of theproceeds towards the implementation of the programme and setting up of infrastructure in the Ganga main stem states of UttarakhandUttar Pradesh Bihar Jharkhand and West Bengal. It intends to apply a part of theproceeds towards payments under the contract for work detailed below. 3. The NMCGState Governments of UttarakhandUttar Pradesh Bihar Jharkhand and West Bengal have entered into a Memorandum of Agreement forimplementation of the NGRBA programme in the respective states. 4. The NGRBAAllahabad Municipal Corporation and Government of Uttar Pradesh have entered into a Memorandum of Understanding towards theimplementation of this project forming a part ofthe NGRBA Programme. 5. Qualification requirements as listed briefly below are required to be fulfilled by thebidder. (Biddersare advised to refer to the bidding document for complete details) (a) The bidder should have designed built and commissioned at least one SewerageNetwork (including Pumping Stations) of 120 km Length of Sewerage Network of which 10% should be above 500 mm during the last sevenyears preceding the bid submission date. (b) The Bidder should have operated andmaintained at least one Sewerage Network (including Pumping station) of 100 km length for a period of 3 years during last 7years. (c) The bidder should have designed builtand commissioned sewer line of minimum 500 metres length using trenchless technology during the last 7years. (d) The Bidder should have net worth ofminimum INR 600 million or US $ 10.0 million in each of the last three financial years preceding the date of submission ofbid. (e) The bidder should have cash creditfacility of INR 240 million or US $ 4.0 million as on the date of submission of bid. 6. Bidding will be conducted through the InternationalCompetitive BiddingProcedure as specified in the World Banks Guidelines :Procurement of Goods Works and Non-consulting Services under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants January 2011 and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in theGuidelines. 7. The GeneralManager Ganga Pollution Control Unit U. P. Jal Nigam Allahabad for and on behalf of the Owner in the State of Uttar PradeshIndia invites sealed bids fromeligible bidders for the works detailed in the table below. The bidders may submit bids for the followingwork as per Instructions to Bidders and the Schedules thereto. 8. Name of the Work Bid Security Cost of Bidding Document Period Survey Reviewthe Design Redesign where necessary and Build NewSewerage Network of about 242 km length 3 Sewage Pumping Stations including all Appurtenant Structures and Operation &Maintenance of Sewerage Network and Pumping Stations for a period of 10 Years in Sewerage District-A of Allahabad State of Uttar Pradesh India Rs. 24.00 million or US $ 0.4 million or equivalent amount in a freely convertiblecurrency. Rs. 22700 including VAT or US $ 400 Design Build Test and Commissioning period of 3 Years and Operation and Maintenance period of 10years. 9. Interestedeligible bidders may obtain further information from and inspect the bidding documents at the office of the General Manager GangaPollution Control Unit U. P. Jal Nigam Allahabad at the address given below during office hoursi.e. 11.00 to 1700 hours. 10. A complete set of bidding documents will be available on the www.upjn.org website w.e.f. March 172014. Thebidders who are interested to participate in the bidding process can downloadthe bid documents from the website for their reference. Bidders are advised to obtainthe hard copy of the bidding document for preparation of their bids. 11. The bidderswho download the documents from the website and use the same for submission of the bids should note that if there is anydiscrepancy between the downloaded document and the hard copy of the document issued to the bidders the hard copy shall be treatedas final and shall prevail over the downloaded documents. The bidders who download the documents shall have to pay along with their bid submission thenon-refundable cost of Rs. 22700 including VAT or US$ 400 in the form of a Certified Cheque/Demand Draft issued by a nationalizedbank/foreign bank listed with the Reserve Bank of India having its branches in India payable to theProject Manager GangaPollution Control Unit U. P. Jal Nigam Allahabad payable at Allahabad Uttar Pradesh. Bidders can also purchase the bid documents commencing from March 17 2014 on payment of Rs.22700/- including VATor US$ 400 in the form of a Demand Draft issued by a nationalized bank/foreign bank listed with the ReserveBank of India having its branches in India payable to the Project Manager Ganga Pollution Control Unit U. P. Jal NigamAllahabad payable at Allahabad State of Uttar Pradesh. Bid documents requested bypost shall be sent through speed post/registered post on payment of an extra amount of Rs. 1000 or US$ 20. The Ganga Pollution Control Unit U. P. Jal Nigam Allahabad will not be held responsiblefor the postal delay if any in the delivery of the documents or non-receipt of the same. 12. The biddersmay also note that the pre-bid proceedings corrigendum if any will also be uploaded on the website mentionedhereinabove. 13. All bids mustbe accompanied by Bid Security of the amount specified in the table above drawn in favor of Project Manager Ganga PollutionControl Unit U. P. Jal Nigam Allahabad. 14. Bids must bedelivered to General Manager Ganga Pollution ControlUnit U. P. Jal Nigam Allahabad on or before 12:00 hours on May 12 2014 andwill be opened on the same day at 12:30 hours in the presence of the bidders representatives who choose to attend. If the office happens to be closed on the date of receipt of the bids as specified the bidswill be receivedand opened on the next working day at the same time and venue. Latebids will be rejected. Office of the General Manager Ganga Pollution Control Unit U. P. Jal Nigam Mahewa Patti Purab Naini Allahabad Uttar Pradesh 211007 INDIA Phone Number : +91 0532 2684691/2684179 Email : gmganga.allahabad@gmail.com Project Website: www.upjn.org

column2: IN: Third National HIV/AIDS Control Proj

column12: 2nd Floor Right Wing Plot No. 1 Sector 29
column18: Invitation for Bids (IFB) Country : India Name of Project : ThirdNational HIV/AIDS Control Project (NACP - III) Name of Goods : ARV Drugs (AntiRetro-Viral Drugs) IFB No : RITES/MSM/NACP/11/2011 1. Government of India has received fund from GFATM towards the cost of Third Programme NationalHIV/AIDS Control Project (NACP - III) and it is intended that part of the proceeds of this fund will be applied to eligible payments under this proposedproject for supply of ARV Drugs (Anti Retro-Viral Drugs) against Schedule I & II for which this invitation for bid is issued. 2. RITES Ltd. (A Govt. of India Enterprise) acting as procurement agent on behalf of Ministry of Health & FamilyWelfare Govt. of India now invites sealedbids from eligible bidder for the Procurement of ARV Drugs (Anti Retro-ViralDrugs) in the quantity as per Schedule of Requirementtothe consignee located at various districts in different states all over India. 3. Bidding will be conducted through theInternational Competitive Bidding procedures specifiedin the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits [May 2004] andis open to all biddersfrom eligible sources countries as defined in the guidelines. 4. Interested eligible Bidders may obtainfurther information from RITES Ltd. and inspect the bidding documents at the address given below in S. No 7 from 1000 to 1600hrs.(IST) on all working days. 5. A complete set of biddingdocuments in English may be purchased by interested bidders on the submission of a written application to the address below andupon payment of a nonrefundable fee of Rs. 5000 or US $110. The method of payment will be by Demand Draft/Pay Order in favour of RITES Ltd. Payable atGurgaon India The document may be purchased from 11 th January 2012 to 15 th February 2012 from theaddress mentioned below in S. No. 7. The documentwill be sent by courier on payment of anextra amount of Rs 900 for domestic bidder and US $ 20 for overseas bidder if requested by mail. Bidders can also download thebid document from RITES website "www.rites.com" or www.nacoonline.org . Fordownloaded bid document no fee is required. The bidders who have downloaded the bid documents shall be solely responsiblefor checking these websites for any addendum/amendment issued subsequently to the bid document and take into consideration the samewhile preparing and submitting the bids. 6. column4: Third Party Quality Audit & Project Monitoring Consultancy Work In 13 Ulbs Of Andhra Pradesh
column12: 2nd floor Engineer-In-Chief (Public Health) complex KashanaBuildings A.C. Guards.
column18: GOVERNMENT OF ANDHRA PRADESH REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES-FIRMS SELECTION) COUNTRY : INDIA PROJECT NAME : ANDHRA PRADESH MUNICIPAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT (APMDP) ASSIGNMENT TITLE : Third Party Quality Audit & ProjectMonitoring Consultancy work in 13 ULBs of Andhra Pradesh Loan No : 7816-IN REoI No.11 : Dated August 30 2012 TheGovernment of India has received financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Andhra Pradesh Municipal Development Project (APMDP) and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consultingservices. The consulting services ("the Services") include consultancyfor thefollowing assignment: "Third Party Quality Audit & Project MonitoringConsultancy work in 13 ULBs of Andhra Pradesh under Andhra Pradesh Municipal Development Project (APMDP )". Duration of the assignment would be 36 months. The Trustee Secretary APUIF MA&UD Department Govt. of Andhra Pradesh Hyderabad now invites eligible ConsultingFirms ("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the services. InterestedConsultants should provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to performthe Services. The short listing criteria are: The firm should have at least 7 yearsstanding in the field of similar consultancy services. Relevant experience in the last 4years with clear documentary evidence of the lead firm. Experience of the firm will onlybe considered towards fulfillment of required qualifications. Theattention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines; Selection and Employment ofconsultants by World Bank Borrowers May 2004 revised October 2006 & May 2010 ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth theWorld Banks Policy on conflict of interest. Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a joint venture or a sub consultancy to enhance theirqualifications. A consultant will be selected inaccordance with the Quality & Cost Based Selection (QCBS) method set out in the World Banks Guidelines. The Terms of Reference is available onthe web sites apmdp.gov.in andcdma.gov.in. Further information if any can be obtained atthe address below during office hours i.e. 1030 to 1700 hours. Expression of interest must be delivered in a written form to the address below by 20.09.2012 1700 hours IST. Attention : Y.Madhusudhana Reddy.I.F.S. Trustee Secretary APUIF 2nd floor Engineer-In-Chief (Public Health)complex Kashana Buildings A.C. Guards HYDERABAD Andhra Pradesh India PIN500004. Email : apufidc@yahoo.com Trustee Secretary APUIF Note:- Those firms who have already responded to national advertisement in Times of India publicationdated June 03 2012 need not resubmit their interest again.

column4: Project Management Consultants For Intelligent Transport System (its) For Hubli - Dharwad Brts Project
column12: First Floor KSFC Building Rayapura PB Road
column18: Hubli-Dharwad BRTS Company Limited (A Government of Karnataka Undertaking) GEF-Sustainable Urban Transport Project India GEF Grant Number: TF 095549 IN REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST for Hiring "Project Management Consultants for Intelligent Transport System (ITS) for Hubli- Dharwad BRTS Project" No: H-DBRTS/12/Tenders/2012-13 Date:03-04-2013 1. This invitation for Expression of Interest follows the General Procurement Notice for this project that appearedin UN Development Business issue number 737 on 1 October 2008. 2. The Government of India has received a loan cum grant from the Global Environment Facility (GEF) - InternationalBank for Reconstruction and Development to implement Sustainable Urban Transport Project (SUTP). A part ofthe grant/loan for SUTPis intended to be used for implementation of Hubli-Dharwad Bus Rapid Transit System (BRTS) Project. These investments are expectedto improve and promote environmentally sustainable urban transport infrastructure and services in the city. 3. Hubli-Dharwad BRTS Project aims at promoting public transport with reduced travel times increased comfortreliability and safety for the commuters in the city. The main features of the BRT Project are ? Segregated buslanes Off boardticketing Intelligent Transport system Area traffic control system integration of trunk with feeder and other city services. 4. Hubli-Dharwad BRTS Company (HDBRTSCO) is a Government of Karnataka undertaking entrusted with the implementationof Bus Rapid Transit System in Hubli-Dharwad City. Hubli-Dharwad BRTS Company Limitedintends to apply part of the proceeds of the grant/loan towards payments for consultancy services and invites eligible consultantsto indicate their interest in providing the service. The brief scope of the project and the broad scope of the consultancy can be seen in the website. 5. Duration of Consultancy: The duration for thisconsultancy is expected to be 36 months. 6. Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified toperform the services(brochures description of similar assignments experience in similar conditions availability of appropriate skills among thestaff etc). Copies of certificates of client work order or agreement shall be necessary to consider a description of similarassignment for evaluation. The indicative structure for submission of EOI can be downloaded from the following website: www.urbantransport.kar.nic.in. 7. Theconsultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by Bank Borrower May 2004 revised May 2010 available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 8. Consultants may associate to enhance their qualifications. The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (withjoint or several liability) or of a sub consultancy. 9. Interested consultants may obtain further information (if required) from the contact person/ address given below: Deputy General Manager (Infrastructure) First Floor KSFC Building Rayapura PB Road Dharwad-580 009 Ph/Fax:0836-2322700 Email: hdbrts@gmail.com Website: www.urbantransport.kar.nic.in During office hours: between 10.00 AM to 5.30 PMon all working days from Monday to Saturday except on Government holidays. 10. Expression of Interest superscripted with the title of the particular consultancy must be delivered to theaddress indicated above not later than 17:30 hrs on 02-06-2013. The proposals shall be submitted in Hard Copiesonly (2 sets).Electronic submission of the proposal is not acceptable.

column18: GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE National ProjectImplementation Unit (NPIU) Director Generalof Employment and Training (DGE&T) VocationalTraining Improvement Project (VTIP) [IDA Cr. No.4319] Ministry ofLabour and Employment Government ofIndia Project ID: P099047 Date: Dec 22 2011 The Government of India has receiveda Credit from the International Development Association (IDA) in the amount of US$ 280 million (approximate) towards the cost ofthe Vocational Training Improvement Project and it intends to apply the proceeds of this Credit to the payments for goods worksrelated services and consulting services to be procured under this project. The Project DevelopmentObjective is to improve the employment outcomes of graduates from the vocational trainingsystem by making the design and delivery of training more demandresponsive. The Project will have following components: 1. Improving Quality ofVocational Training. 2. Promoting SystemicReforms and Innovations 3. Project ManagementMonitoring and Evaluation ? Support Procurement of contracts financed by the Credit will be conductedthrough the procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits dated May 2004 andRevised in October 2006 and May 2010 (the Procurement Guidelines) and is open to all the bidders from eligible source countries asdefined in the guidelines. The provisions of paragraphs 2.55 and 2.56 of the Procurement Guidelines providing for domesticpreference in the evaluation of bidsshall apply to the goods manufactured in the territory of India or and the works to be carriedout by the domestic contractors through International Competitive Bidding. Consulting services will be selected inaccordance withthe World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employmentof Consultants by World Bank Borrowers dated May 2004 and Revised in October2006 and May 2010 (the Consultant Guidelines) Specific procurement notices for the contracts to be bid under the World Banks internationalcompetitive bidding (ICB) procedures and for large-value consultants contracts will be announced as they become available in UNDevelopment Business Banks external website and local newspapers. The following ICBs/Large value Contracts are expected under this Project: Goods: Procurement of IT Equipment ? column4: Consultancy Services For Estimation Of Green House Gas Emission And Energy Consumption For Sutp Demonstration Cities
column10: Government of India Ministry of Urban Development
column12: Room No. 211C Nirman BhawanMaulana Azad Road
column18: Request for Expression ofInterest India GEF - Sustainable Urban TransportProject (GEF-SUTP) Consultancy Services for Estimation of Green House Gas Emission and Energy Consumption for SUTP demonstrationcities GEF Grant No. TF095549 - IN This Request for Expressions of Interest follows the general procurementnotice for this project that appeared in Development Business issue on 1 October 2008 The Ministry of Urban Development has received a grant from the GlobalEnvironment Facility (GEF)/ International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and intends to apply part of the proceeds of thisgrant to payments under the contract for Estimation of Green House Gas Emission and Energy Consumption for SUTPdemonstration cities. The objective of the present consultancy is: To generate estimatesof GHG emissions avoided attributable to the intervention activities in the Sustainable Urban Transport Program (SUTP) cities usingexisting methodologies and develop cost-effective monitoring plans to be able to document and verify avoided emissions during andafter activity implementation; and To build capacity inthe SUTP project cities to carry out systemic energy assessments of urban transport systems. The duration of the consultancy services is expected to be 48 months from the date of award of thecontract. The Ministry of Urban Development now invites eligible consultantstoindicate their interest in providing the services. SubmissionRequirements: Interestedconsultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified to perform the Services. This should include thefollowing: (1) The brief description of the organization including ownership details date and place of incorporation ofthe firm objectives of the firm availability of appropriate skills among staff brochures etc. and the auditedaccounts of theprevious three financial years i.e. 2010-11 2009-10 and 2008-09 with audited statements. (2) Consultants Experience for similar assignments in GHG emissions estimation for various transport especially publictransport related projects using spreadsheet tools monitoring and monitoring plans datacollection and traffic forecasting and its project management for similarassignments completed since the year 2000 (3) Qualifications and strength of keystaff for the performance of this requirement andavailability of key personnel for this assignment. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set outin the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by Bank BorrowerJanuary 2011 available at www.worldbank.org/procure. Companies/Consultants may associate to enhance theirqualifications. Interested Consultants may obtain further information if required atthe address given below: Name of officer: Mr. Sumit Chatterjee #Deputy Secretary (MRTS) Name of office: Ministry of Urban Development (Govt. of India) Postal address: Room No. 211 C Nirman Bhawan Maulana Azad Road NewDelhi-110108 India Telephone number: 91-11-2306 2387 Facsimile number: 91-11-2306 2594 E-mail: sumit_d6@yahoo.com Website: www.sutpindia.com During office hours: 1000 Hours to 1700 Hours on all working days from Monday to Friday. Documents superscripted with the title "Consultancy Servicesfor Estimation of Green House Gas Emission and Energy Consumption for SUTP demonstration cities" must be delivered to the address indicated above not later than 1600hrs three weeks from the date published in the Newspaper that is 22 October 2011.The proposals are to be submitted in Hard copy only (electronic submission of the proposal is not acceptable). Sumit Chatterjee Deputy Secretary (MRTS) Ministry of Urban Development(Govt. of India)

column4: General Procurement Notice
column10: Government of Rajasthan Dept of Agriculture
column12: Rajasthan Agricultural Competitiveness Project (RACP)Dept of Agriculture Govt of Rajasthan Pant Krishi Bhawan
column18: General Procurement Notice INDIA RAJASTHAN AGRICULTURAL COMPETITIVENESS PROJECT (RACP) Country: India Sector: Agriculture Issue Date:_________________________________ Project ID No: P124614 1. The Government of Rajasthan has applied for a credit from theInternational Development Association (IDA) for funding the Rajasthan Agricultural Competitiveness Project (RACP) and it intendsto apply the proceeds to payments for goods works related services and consulting services under this project. Department of Agriculture Government of Rajasthan is the nodal agency for execution of thisproject. 2. The Project will support investments in the state of Rajasthan andhas three components. Procurement is expected to be carried out for the followingworks goods and services:  Component 1: Climate Resilient Agriculture #  Goods works and services that improve : (a) harvest capturecollection delivery and distribution of water for agriculture and livestock purposes in surface water irrigated canal commandareas ground water sources and rainfed areas; (b) on-farm water use efficiency; (c) soil moisture and fertility improvements;(d)sustainable intensification and diversification of farm production; and (e) integrated crop and livestock farmingsystems.  Component 2: Markets and ValueChains  Goods works and service to support: (a) develop value chains aiming toestablish longer term partnershipsand market linkages between farmer groups and agribusiness enterprises facilitated through anAgri-Business Promotion Facility (ABPF) to be established under the project; (b) develop alternate market channels; and (c)generation and dissemination of accurate and timely market information.  Component 3: Capacity building M&E Project Management  Goods works and service to support: (a) mobilization and establishing of farmer groups andcapacity building for participatory planning and plan implementation; (b) strengthening of institutions and human resourcesassociated with the project implementation (i.e. participating line department and other relevant agencies); (c) projectmanagement robust monitoring and evaluation (M&E) system with a view of potentially scaling up approaches deemed successfulunder this operation across the state; (d) building synergies and convergence with ongoing schemes from the Government of Rajasthan(GoR) and the Government of India (GoI); (e) development and pilot testing of production risk management tools in crop andlivestock sectors; and (f) internal audit External audit Third Party Quality audit Project Management Consultancy 3. Procurement of contracts financed by the credit will be conductedthrough the procedures as specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurementunder IBRD Loans and IDA Credits January 2011 and is open to all bidders from eligible source countries as defined in theguidelines. Consulting services will be selected in accordance with the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by World Bank Borrowers January 2011. 4. Specific procurement notices for contracts to be bid under the WorldBanks international/national competitive bidding (ICB/NCB) proceduresand for contracts for consultancy services will be announcedas theybecome available in UN Development Business and and Indian news papers. 5. Interested eligible bidders who wish to be included on the mailinglist to receive invitations to bid under ICB procedures and interested consultants who wish to receive a copy of advertisementrequesting expressions of interest for consultancy contracts or those requiring additional information should contact the addressbelow. The Project Director Rajasthan Agricultural Competitiveness Project (RACP) Dept of Agriculture Govt of Rajasthan Pant Krishi Bhawan Jaipur 302005 (Raj) Phone: 0141-5117325  Fax 0141-5117325 Website www.krishi.rajasthan.gov.in Email pd_racp@rediffmail.com

column4: Engagement Of Regional Process Monitoring Agencies For New Districts
column12: Office of The Project Director  Tamil Nadu Empowerment & Poverty Reduction project (Pudhu Vaazhvu)  No.91St.Mary#s Road Abiramapuram
column18: REQUEST FOREXPRESSION OF INTEREST Name of Country: India Name of Project: Tamilnadu Pudhu Vaazhvu Project Consulting service: Engagement of Regional Level Process MonitoringAgencies Period of Consultancy Two years Expression of Interest: The Project Director Tamilnadu Pudhu Vaazhvu Project(TNPVP)  Government of Tamilnadu has received a credit from the International Development Association (IDA) and intends to applypart of the credit proceeds to make payments under the contract for Tamilnadu Pudhu Vaazhvu Project. The TNPVP a Community Demand Development Project for theempowermentof rural poor and improving their livelihoods is being implemented in2509 Gram Panchayats in 70 Blocks located in 16districts of Tamil Nadu. Under the Additional Financing the Project is being expanded in 10 more Districts covering 1658 VillagePanchayats of 50 Blocks. The period of the Project is upto September 2014. Other details about the project are available in ourwebsite: www.pudhuvaazhvu.org The Project Director TNPVP proposes to engage two regional level process monitoringagencies covering 5 districts eachto support TNPVP in the additional financing districts to conduct field-based process monitoringstudies identifying weak areas in projectimplementation and facilitate review and discussion of the learnings among all the levelsof project management communities. The details of districts to be covered in each region is annexed in Table 1. Period of Consultancy is 2 years. The contract will besubject to annual review on the basis of performance. The Consultant for the contract will be selected using a Quality &Cost Based Selection (QCBS)method in accordance with the World Bank guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Banks Borrowers (publishedby the Bank in May 2004; revised in October 2006 and May 2010) The TNPVP invites Expression of Interest (EoI) from eligible agenciesfor providing the saidservices. Interested agencies/ Firms with a proven track record of over 5 years in anchoring/conducting process monitoring activities and having an average annual turnover of Rs 50.00 lakhs or more during last 3 years or the consultant should havecontracted at least a single assignment of Rs. 25 lakhs/per year during last of 3years are requested to provide information indicating that they are qualified to perform the services namely Brochures descriptionof similar assignments experience insimilar conditions and in Externally Aided Projects track record in anchoring / conductingprocess monitoring activities no. of officers/staff available and availability of appropriate skills among staff details ofaverage annual turnover and Balance Sheets of the last three years along with reports ofat least two recently (within the last 2 years) completedsimilar assignments and list of last two years completed and ongoingsimilar assignments with names of clients. Further detailsabout the assignment is available in the website: http://www. pudhuvaazhvu.org If the agency iswilling to bid for more than one region the detailsand the availability of staff may be indicated. Based on their capacity andmanpower interested agencies may submit EOI for any or all theregions clearly indicating their order of preference. Expressions of Interest must be addressed and delivered not later than 14 days from the date ofadvertisement in sealed envelopes super-scribing "EOI for R egional Level Process Monitoring Agencies " to theOffice of The Project Director  Tamil Nadu Empowerment & Poverty Reduction project ( Pudhu Vaazhvu )  No.91 St.Marys Road Abiramapuram Chennai-600 018 Phone: 044-43443200 E.mail:pvpstate@gmail.com  mes.tnpvp@yahoo.in Project Director Table 1 S.
