column4: Consultancy Services For Providing Support To Spmu In (i) Monitoring Learning And Evaluation (mle) (assignment No. Wbadmip/mle/01/11-12) And (ii) Environmental Management (em) Services Under Wbadmip (assignment No. Wbadmip/em /01/11-12)
column12: Block-14/2 CIT Scheme-VIII (M) ICMARD Buildings 8th FloorUltadanga
column18: Notice No: 4/WBADMIP/CS INDIA West Bengal Accelerated Development of Minor Irrigation Project (WBADMIP). Consultancy Services forproviding support to State Project Management Unit (SPMU) in (i) Monitoring Learning and Evaluation (MLE) (Assignment No.WBADMIP /MLE/01/11-12) and (ii) Environmental Management (EM) services underWBADMIP (Assignment No. WBADMIP /EM /01/11-12) Loan No. 8090-IN / Credit No. 5014-IN Expressions of Interest 1. This request for expressions of interest follows thegeneral procurement notice for this project that appeared in Development Business No. WB2036-775/10 of May 10 2010. 2. The Government of West Bengal through the Government of India has received loan/credit from the International Bank forReconstruction and Development (IBRD)/International Development Association (IDA)for the Accelerated Development of MinorIrrigation Project and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan/credit to payments under the above mentionedc onsultancy services. The project is intended to enhance theagricultural productivity of small and marginal farmers by providing adequate and dependable irrigation facilities round the yearand introducing multi-cropping systems and improved farming practices. The projectimplementation period is proposed for a period of six years. 3. The servicesgenerally relate to assisting the SPMU of WBADMIP with: (i) For MLE services:conducting baseline survey; monitoring of project implementation progress studies on relevant themes; outcome-focused impactevaluations especially at Mid-Term Evaluation and Final Evaluation; and systematic evaluation of project impacts through repeatedmonitoring of the same sample set of households from the beginning to the end of the project. (ii) For EM services:training of water quality surveillance groups; dissemination of water quality data; and arsenic and fluoride contamination studyfor crops and bio-pesticide intensification. 4. The Project Director WBADMIP now invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing the services separately for the above twocategories of assignments in the prescribed format to be collected from the Project Director WBADMIP at the address givenbelow. The application format and detailed Terms of References are available in the projectwebsite www.wbadmip.org . Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they are qualifiedto perform the services (with brochures description of similarassignments experience in similar conditions availability of appropriate skills among staff etc.). Consultants may associate toenhance their qualifications. 5. A consultant will be selected inaccordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines on Selection and Employment of Consultants by World BankBorrowers January 2011. 6. Interested consultants may obtain furtherinformation at the addressbelow onworking days between 10-00 and 15-00 hours. 7. Expressions of interest must be delivered to theaddress below by 20 January2012  15-00Hrs . The Project Director WBADMI Project Block-14/2 CIT Scheme-VIII (M) ICMARD Buildings 8 th Floor UltadangaKolkata-700067. Tel:+91-33-23567546/48/49 Fax:+91-33-23567547 e-mail: pd@wbadmip.org.

column18: State Project Management Unit (SPMU) Integrated Coastal Zone Management (ICZM) Project West Bengal Institute of Environmental Studies & Wetland Management Department of Environment Government of WestBengal Invitation for Expression ofInterest Credit no. # 4765 ? 0 IN Project Management Services for Development of Ecotourism at Sagar Island WestBengal EOI No. 004/2011-12 Date: January 7 2012 1. The Government of India hasreceived a credit from the International Development Association towards the costof the ICZM Project and intends to apply a portionof the funds to eligible payments under this Contract for which this Request forExpression of Interest is issued. 2. Sagar Island is one of the islands under Sundarban Biosphere Reservewith apopulation of 200000; an average annual tourist footfall about 10 lakh peaking at around 3lakh for 5 days during the Sagar Mela (fair). 3. The objective of this Consultancy is to project management support to theSundarban Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited (SIDCL)to the satisfaction of the SPMU for planning designing andconstruction supervision of appropriate and comprehensive (i) solid waste management system (ii) sanitation facilities includingtoilets and sewage treatment (iii) site drainage; (iv) landscape treatment including roads pavements illumination and signage(v) ecotourism including theme gardens meditation centers mythological museum andecoturism huts on and around the Sagar Melaground near the Kapil Muni temple. All of the above will need to usethe best practice regarding community involvement andownership appropriate architecture applicable coastal zone regulations and pollution management. 4. SPMU ICZM Project West Bengal now invites eligible Consultants to indicatetheir interest in providing these Services. Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified toperform the Services. The expression of Interest must include brochuresand other documents describing qualification and experienceof the firm description of similar assignments undertaken qualifications skills and availability of key personnel financialcapability and availability of resources and facilities that would be required for the assignment. Consultants may associate toenhance their qualifications asfar as all associated firm are jointly and severely liable to performthe services if selected. TheEOI should clearly confirm this nature of association and specify name of the lead firm. 5. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out inthe World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by Bank Borrowers May 2004 Revised October 2006 and May2010. Interested Consultants may obtain further information from the ContactPerson between 10 AM And 5 PM on all workingdays. 6. Expression of Interest must bedelivered to the below mentioned address by no later than 5 PM on or before 31 st January 2012. Office name : State Project Management Unit ICZM Project West Bengal Institute of Environmental Studiesand Wetland Management Officers name: Somenath Bhattacharyya Additional Project Director (Technical) Address: DD-24 Sector-I Salt Lake Kolkata -700 064 West Bengal Phone No : 091-33-23341020/ 23340531/23340239 Fax : 091-33-23580967 Website : www.ieswm.org Email : iczmpwb@ieswm.org; some.wetland@gmail.com

The Government of India hasreceived a credit from the International Development Association towards the cost of Rajasthan Water Sector Restructuring Projectand intends to apply a part of the funds to cover eligible payments under the contracts for Supply Installation and Commissioningof Hydro-meteorological Information System for Rajasthan 2. The Office of the Additional Chief Engineer Water Resources Zone Jaipur Rajasthan India invites bids for the above mentioned work which has been detailed inthe Bidding Document. column4: Wbr 8-design Development And Implementation Of Ground Water Information System For Uttar Pradesh State
column12: 9th Floor Indira BhawanAshok Marg
column18: India: Uttar Pradesh Water Sector Restructuring Project Phase II Request for Expression of Interest for Consultancy on the "Design Development and Implementation of Ground WaterInformation System for Uttar Pradesh State" No. 12/PC/PACT/UPWSRP-Ph-II/GWD/A-7(World Bank) dated January 182013 1. The Government of India (GOI) has applied for a credit/loan from theInternational Development Association (IDA)/ International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) to finance the UP WaterSector Restructuring Project (UPWSRP) Phase 2 and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this credit/loan to payments under thecontract for hiring services of consultancy firm for "Design Development and Implementation of Ground Water Information Systemfor Uttar Pradesh State." 2. The scope of services would include: a) Design web-enabled on-line ArcGIS based Ground Water InformationSystem (GWIS) with stakeholder consultations toinclude raw and processed monitoring network data; non-point data including from geological and geophysical surveys test drilling; pumping test datafor aquifer properties; recharge structures and schemes; study reports and documents; primary and secondary data on ground wateravailability and use including policy regulation and compliance data from State GWD and otherstakeholders; harmonize existingdata from all stakeholders; integrate information and knowledge management tools and a data archival access and disseminationsystem that will support effective ground water management; b) Compile and integrate all available data in GWD and other agenciesin GWIS c) Implement GWIS in the Ground Water Data Centre in State Ground WaterDepartment provide training in operation and maintenance and hand-over to Client d) Prepare additional GWIS equipmentspecifications and draft bid document; draft policies protocols standards and agreements covering data collection collationprocessing analysis storage and dissemination processes; e) Suggest institutional capacity building and recommend strategies forsystem upgrading risk management and sustainability of GWIS and f) Develop a comprehensive training program including formal andon-job training and in GWIS and related domain areas and awareness raising workshops for decision makers and in datatransfer/updating protocols in stakeholder agencies. The duration of theassignment shall be for two years. 3. The Director State Ground Water Department (GWD) invites eligible Consultants to indicate their interestin providing the Consultancy Services for the aboveassignment. 4. Interested consultants must provide the following information indicating that they are qualifiedto perform the Services:Brochures Description of Similar Assignments successfully completed in the pastAvailability of Skills and past experience among Staff (including but not limited to ground water information system specialistdatabase specialist hydro-geologist and web designer) and financial statement for the last 3years. 5. The criteria for short listing of the Consulting firms shall be as follows:  The firm should have been in consulting business of developing web basedinformation systems for at least 10 years.  The firms shall be financially sound with an average annual turnover of morethan US$ 900000 (INR 45000000) during the previous five years.  The firms should have successfully completed at least two similar studies in ground water information systems (or related hydrologicinformation systems) of comparable magnitude that inter alia includes cost of studyduration and man months for keypersonnel during the previous five years.  Availability of skills and national and international experience among keystaff (ground water information system specialist database specialist hydro-geologist and web designer etc). 6. The consultant may associate with other firms to enhance their qualification. [The "Association" may takethe form of a joint venture (with joint and severalliability) or of a sub-consultancy] and this should be stated clearly in thesubmission. 7. A consultant will be selected in accordance with Quality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) procedures set out in the World Banks "Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants Under IBRD Loans and IDACredits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers-January 2011". The Guidelines are available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 8. Interested Consultants mayobtain further information at the address given below from 10.00 ? 17.00 hours(IST) on all working days. This notice for Expression of Interest has also been posted on UPID website(http://irrigation.up.nic.in) and Ground Water Department website (http://gwd.up.nic.in). 9. Expression of Interest with all relevant information and documents must be submitted and subscribed "Design Development and Implementation of Ground Water Information System for Uttar PradeshState" on top of a closedenvelope and be delivered to the address below by not later than 15:00 hours (IST) onFebruary 26 2013. In the event this last date being declared as holiday by the StateGovernment due date for submission of above EoI will be the next working day up till the same appointed time. TheDirector Ground WaterDepartment U.P. 9 th Floor Indira Bhawan AshokMarg Lucknow UttarPradesh India Phone: 91522-2287068 2287233 Telefax : 91522-2286471 E-mail: upgwd.in@gmail.com

column18: State Project Management Unit Integrated Coastal ZoneManagement Project (ICZM) Assisted by WorldBank Gujarat Ecology Commission Udyog Bhavan Block No. 18 1 st Floor Gandhinagar # 382 010 Gujarat CORRGIGENDUM-I International Competitive Bidding [ICB] Corrigendum -I to IFB issued for ICB-1 and ICB-2 dated 08/08/2011 The State Project Management Unit ICZMP Gujarat EcologyCommission were invited bids for procurement of Scientific Instrument and its related services under ICB-1 and ICB-2 biddingdocuments for Gujarat Pollution Control Board vide its IFB dated 0808/2011. Following corrigendum in the terms of the Invitation for Bid [IFB] as well as the bid documentsis issued. The bid selling period has been extended till 1 st November-2011 up to 1700 hours. The bid submission date has been extended till 2 nd November-2011 up to 1200hours The Bid opening date has been extended till 2 nd November at 1230hours. All other terms and conditionsprescribed in the Invitation for Bid [IFB] and the bid documents remain the unchanged. Add. Project Director State Project Management Unit Gujarat Ecology Commission Gandhinagar ============================================================================================================= Invitation for Bids(IFB) International Competitive Bidding GUJARAT ECOLOGYCOMMISSION # A STATE PROJECT MANAGEMENT UNIT [GOVERNMENT OFGUJARAT] Integrated Coastal Zone Management Project Credit no. # 4765 # 0 IN Procurement of Scientific Instruments and Related Services for Gujarat Pollution Control Board [Package 1 to 12] ICB / GPCB / 02 / 2011-12 Date: 08/08/2011 1. This Invitation for Bids follows the General Procurement Notice for this Project thatappeared in Development Business Issue # 774 of 30th April-2011 2. The Government of India has received acredit from the InternationalDevelopment Association toward the cost of Integrated Coastal Zone ManagementProject and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of this credit topayments under the Contract for Purchase OF Scientific Instruments and related services. 3. Additional Project Director  ICZMP Project State Project Management Unit Gujarat Ecology Commission Block No. 18 1 st Floor Udyog Bhavan GH Road Gandhinagar Gujarat India now invites sealed bids from eligible and qualified bidders forPurchase of Equipments indicated in the Table belowto be installed and commissioned at Gujarat Pollution Control Board Central and regional Laboratories located at Gandhinagar / Jamnagar / Rajkot /Bhuj . The bidder may submit the bidfor any or all the packages of equipment specified below. PackageNo Description of theEquipment Quantity Cost of Bid document inRs Bid Security in Rs 1 2 4 5 6 Package 1 X-Ray Diffractometer (XRD) 4 2000 100000.00 Package 2 Ton Chromatography with anion and cations measurement facility including reverse phase IC(Chloride Bromide Iodide Nitrate etc. with micro processor based computer facility and printer / plotters) with online computerprintout 1 No. 2000 180000.00 Package 3 HR GC-HR MS NMR for Dioxins & Furans (PCDFs) with online computerprintout 4 Nos. 2000 300000.00 Package 4 HR LC-HR MS NMR for PAHs with online computer printout 1 No. 2000 300000.00 Package 5 X-Ray fluorescence spectrometer (XRF) 1 No. 2000 90000.00 Package 6 Dedicated GC with ECD for Chlorinated Pesticides & PCBs POPs HaloMethanes 1 No. 2000 60000.00 Package 7 Dedicated GC with NPD & FPD for organophosphates and organosulpurand other pesticides /organics 2 Nos 80000.00 Package 8 HPLC for PAHs & Carbamates & Carbonyls 2 Nos 90000.00 Package 9 Water purification system ASTM type # I water for HPLC 2 Nos. 20000.00 Package 10 Iso Kinetic sampling for Dioxine and Furans 4 Nos. 12000.00 Package 11 TOC Analyzer for solid and liquid 2 Nos. 100000.00 Package 12 Portable CTD with Senser 4 Nos 150000.00 4. Bidding will be conducted through the International Competitive Bidding (ICB) proceduresspecified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits May 2004 Revised Oct 2006 and May2010 and is open to all bidders from Eligible Source Countries as defined in the Guidelines. 5. Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information from Additional Project Director  ICZMP ProjectState Project Management Unit Gujarat Ecology Commission Block No. 18 1 st Floor Udyog Bhavan GH Road GandhinagarGujarat India and inspect the Bidding Documents at the address givenbelow from 10.30 AM to 6.00PM 6. The notice and the bid document for the Goods can also be seen with option to download from the Project website www. geciczmp.com . The down loaded bid document can be submitted along with non refundable feementioned in the Table towards the cost of the bid document. The Additional Project Director  ICZMP Project will not accept the same if any portion of thedownloaded document differs from the approved bid document available in the abovementioned office The download facility will be available from Dt 08 /08/2011 to Dt26 /09/2011 up to 17.00Hrs. (a) Price of bidding document (non-refundable) : Rs 2000.00(Including VAT) or US$50 (b) Postal charges inland : Rs 1000.00 (c) Postal charges overseas : Rs 2000.00 (d) Date of commencement of sale of bidding document : 08/08/2011 (e) Last date for sale of bidding document : 26/09/2011 up to 1700 hours (f) Last date and time for receipt of bids : 27/09/2011 upto 12.00 Hrs (g) Time and date of opening of bids : 27/09/2011 at 12.30 Hrs (h) Place of opening of bids : Additional ProjectDirector  ICZMP Project State Project Management Unit Gujarat Ecology Commission Block No. 18 1 st Floor Udyog Bhavan GH Road Gandhinagar Gujarat India Add. ProjectDirector Block-18 FirstFloor Udhyog BhavanGandhinagar (j) Address for Communication : Additional ProjectDirector  ICZMP Project State Project Management Unit Gujarat Ecology Commission Block No. 18 1 st Floor Udyog Bhavan GH Road Gandhinagar Gujarat India A complete setof Bidding Documents in English may be purchased by interested bidders on the submission of a written Application to the addressbelow and upon payment of a non refundable fee as mentioned aboveby demand draft in shape of Demand Draft on any Scheduled bankpayable at Gandhinagar in favor of Additional Project Director ICZM Project-Gujarat or in cash in Indian Rupees or an equivalentamount in a freely convertible currency" The Schedule of Requirements for all theschedules are contained in asingle bidding document. column4: Consultancy Services For Assessment Of O&m Practices At Ptps Panipat
column12: Urja Bhawan Sector 6
column18: EXPRESSION OF INTEREST (EOI) INDIA India: Coal Fired Generation Rehabilitation Project Consultancy Services for Assessment of O&M Practices Project ID No. : P 100101 P100531 This Request for Expressions of Interest follows the general procurement noticefor this project that appeared in UN Development Business online on 4 December 2008. Haryana Power Generation Corporation Limited intends to procure consultancyservices for "Assessment of O&M Practices at PTPS Panipat".The rated capacity of PTPS Panipat is 1360 MW comprising of 4X110MW 2X210 MW and 2X250 MW units. The main objective of the proposed consultancy service is to carry out Assessment of O&MPractices at PTPS Panipat with the objective to assess the effectiveness of procedures adopted for O & M including safetyefficiency of men andmaterial. To develop an action plan for improvement in efficiency operation& maintenance performances aswell as training needs. HPGCL now invites consultants to indicate their interest in providingabove services. HPGCL being an ISO9001-200814000 certified company requires that the interested consultant should have/be 1. Conducted similar studies i.e. technical audit& Gap analysis ofcomplete O&M systems(Main Plant BoP and CHP) for coal based thermal power stations having 110 MW or moreunit size. 2. Consultant to submitcertificate for atleast one successful completion of assignment in last three years from the customer i.e. from CentreGovt./SEBs/Power Utilities. 3. Single order value executed by the consultantsfor similar studies during any financial year in past three financial years should beequal to or more than 50 lakh. 4. The consultants/consulting firms should be reputed with total turnover of five crore or more in any financial year during last three years." Consultant will be selected inaccordance with the procedure as per World Bank procurement guidelines "Guidelines: Selection and Employment of consultants byWorld Bank Borrowers May 2004 revised October 2006." Interested consultant may obtain more information if any at the address given below from 10 AM to 5.00 PMon any business day. Interested parties may submit their interest upto 26 April 2012 at the address given below at 03:00 PM Name of Person Mr. R.S.Kaushal. Designation Chief Engineer (Planning) Haryana Power Generation Corporation Ltd Urja Bhawan Sector 6 Panchkula Haryana (India)PIN 134109 Phone No. - 0172- 5023418 Fax - 0172 ?5022439

column2: IN: Haryana Power System Improv Project
column4: Consultancy Services For Short Medium& Long Term Power Procurement Planning And Optimization Of Power Procurement Cost
column12: Haryana Power Purchase Centre (HPPC)ShaktiBhawan Sector-6
column18: Request for Expression of Interest (EOI) INDIA Haryana Power Sector Improvement(HPSI) Project Consultancy Services for Short Medium& Long Term Power Procurement Planning and Optimization of Power ProcurementCost Project ID No.: P 110051 1. This Requestfor Expression of Interest follows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared in Development Business online onJuly 03 2008 2. TheGovernment of India has received the amount of US$ 330 million equivalent from the World Bank towards the cost of Haryana PowerSector Improvement Project and it intends to apply a part of the proceeds for ConsultancyServices for Short Medium and Long Term Power Procurement Planning and Optimization of Power Procurement Cost. The services shall include Load Forecasting and advice on PPAs related Techno-Commercial-Legalissues. 3. TheConsultant shallsupport the Haryana Power Procurement Cell (HPPC) which carries out power purchase for both the distributionutilities by providing an appropriate tool setting up standardized systems and the necessary datato carry out short medium andlong term power procurement in the most techno-economically feasible manner. The Consultant shall also trainHPPC staff to use thetool and collect data to carry out efficient power procurement on their own in the long run. 4. Some specificservicesthat the Consultant is expected to provide are:  Optimize power purchase costs by accurate load forecast and develop the capacityof Haryana Power Purchase Centre (HPPC) to undertake effective Load Forecastingon Short Medium and Long Term basisand standardization of their power procurement system. The required softwarewill be supplied by the Consultant.  Manage the existingpower purchase agreements (PPAs) and relatedTechno-Commercial-Legal works/ issues including interaction with state and central regulatory commissions and meeting RenewablePurchase Obligations (RPO). Also provide similar support to enter into new PPAs.  Review existing organizational structure of HPPC and recommend a revisedstructure aligned to meet utilities needs and market conditions. Also recommend measures to strengthen the capacity of HPPC bydefining appropriate organization structure design efficient processes and required skill sets including providing training toexisting staff.  Provide inputs regarding fuel prices to assist HPPC in minimizingpowerprocurement costs.  Draft PPA related tariff petitions and formulate replies topetitions.  Verification and processing of PPAs/ petitions related invoices andbills. 5. It is expected that the assignment will be carried out by a team of suitablyqualified persons with prior experience in power procurement or in similar situations. 6. DHBVN now invites eligible Consultants to indicate theirinterest in providing the Services. Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified to providethe Services (brochures description of similar assignments experience in similar conditions along with MIS reports if anyannual turnovers availability of appropriate qualification & skills among staff etc.). 7. The duration of the assignment shall be 2 years with an option toextend. The successful vendor will receivea contract for 1 year subject to extension for another year if performance issatisfactory. 8. The Consultantwill be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by Bank Borrowers 7 May 2004Revised May 2010 9. InterestedConsultants mayobtain further information at the address given below: Chief Engineer/Haryana PowerPurchase Centre (HPPC) Shakti Bhawan Sector-6 Panchkula from 9.00 Hrs. to 17.00 HrsIST. 10. Expression ofinterest must be delivered to the address below not later than 7 th May 2013. ChiefEngineer/HPPC Er. A.K. Parashar Haryana Power Purchase Centre (HPPC) ShaktiBhawan Sector-6 Panchkula Telephone number -91172-2583728 Facsimile number ? 91172-2586836 E-mail: cehppc@gmail.com

IFB No. WB/2008/G-18 B(Re-Bid) 1.0 Govt. of India has received a loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development(IBRD) in various currencies towards the cost of "Haryana Power System Improvement Project(HPSI)". It is intended that part of the proceeds of this loan will be applied to eligible payments under the contract forplant supply installation testing & commissioning of 220kV sub-station and 66 kV bays. 2.0 Haryana Vidyut Prasaran Nigam Limited (HVPNL) now invites sealed bids from eligible biddersfor the construction and completion of following works:- Procurement of plant designsupply & installation testing and commissioning of 220kV sub-station and 66 kV bays:- PACKAGEG-18(B) 1. 220 kV Substation Meerpur Kurali with 2x100MVA 220/66 kV & 1x12.5/16 MVA 66/11 kVTransformers. 2. Creation of one no. 66 kV bay for Meerpur Kurali-Alawalpur line providing circuit breaker andallied equipment for existing 66 kV S/C Alawalpur ? Fatehpur Biloch line along with double bus bar arrangement by utilizing theexisting bus at 66 kV substation Alawalpur. 3. Creation of 2 no. 66kV line bays with double bus arrangement at 66 kV substation Chandhut for LILO of 66 kV S/C Meerpur Kurali- Alawalpur line. 4. Creation of 2 no. 66kV line bays with double bus arrangement at 66 kV substation Chainsa for LILO arrangement of 66 kV Nawada - Fatehpur Bilochline. The document will be sent by airmail / courier for overseasdelivery and surface mail or courier for local delivery. TheBidding Documents can also be downloaded from the HVPNL website www.hvpn.gov.in. Inthis case the cost of Bidding Document shouldbe submitted in separate envelope in the shape of demand draft of a non-refundable fee of Rs. 12000 or US $ 300 payable toAccounts Officer/cash Haryana Vidyut Prasaran Nigam Limited (HVPNL) Panchkula while submitting the bid. column2: IN: Haryana Power System Improv Project
column4: Third Party Outsourcing Services For Internal Audit For The Financial Year 2009-10 2010-11 & 2011-12
column12: Shakti Bhawan Sector-6
column18: Request for Expression of Interest (EOI) (Websiteversion) HaryanaPower System Improvement Project Third Party outsourcing services for Internal Audit for the FinancialYear 2009-10 2010-11 and2011-12 ProjectID No. : P 110051 Loan No. 7748 IN 1. This Request for Expression of Interest follows theGeneral Procurement Notice for this project that appeared in Development Business online on July 03 2008. 2. A loan agreement has been signed between Govt ofIndia for financing the amount of US$ 330 million equivalent towards the cost of Haryana Power System Improvement Project and itintends to apply a part of the proceeds for Third Party outsourcing services for Internal Audit of Haryana Vidyut Prasaran NigamLtd for the FY 2009-10 2010-11 and 2011-12. 3. The Internal Audit will cover the financial years2009-10 2010-11 and 2011-12. The entire task of completing the audit would need to be completed within ten months from the date ofaward of contract including report on status of compliances. The internal audit will be conducted as per the TOR agreed with theWorld Bank which would be suitably provided to the bidders. The broad objectives of the internal audit are asunder:- [a] To ensure that the accounting and financialmanagement systems are reliable and effective in design; and to assess the extent to whichthey are beingfollowed. [b] To review the efficacy adequacy and application ofaccounting and financial controls and thereby ensuring the accuracy of the books of account. [c] To verify that the system of Internal checks iseffective in design and operation in order to ensure the prevention of and early detection of defalcations fraudsmisappropriations and misapplications. [d] To identify areas of significant in-efficiencies inexisting systems and to suggest necessary remedial measures. [e] To confirm the existence of financial propriety inall decisionsand verify compliance to Government and statutory requirements. 4. Transaction audit of 2009-10 2010-11 and 2011-12. Aset of mandatory criterion for eligibility to participate in the Expression of Interest has been determined asfollows: [a] CAG Empanelment: The firmshould be from the Major list of Chartered Accountant firms being published by C&AG India; [b] Specified Experience: The firm should have experience ofsuccessfully carrying systems related assignment (including internal audits) of an Indian power utility company;and [c] Specified Turnover: Annual turnover of thefirm for the last three financial years (FY) from internal audit services is 75 lacs or above; 5. Haryana Vidyut Prasaran Nigam Ltd now invites firms of Chartered Accountantswith offices in India to indicate their interest in providing the Services. The eligible firms will have to provide necessarydocumentary evidence for satisfying the above qualifying criteria at the time of submission of their bidsincluding: [a] A self attested copy of the latest empanelmentintimation letterissued by the CAG containing the Unique Identification Number and thescores. The firm will confirm that it isstill included in the panel for large audits (This list is available on CAG website); [b] The certificate of completion of assignment or proof of final sign-off ofsystems related assignment carried out for an Indian power utility company along with a self certified statement that the saidassignment was successfully completed by the firm; [c] Specific Turnover would mean the professional feeearned from internal audit services excluding service tax and travelling if billed separately. For income from internal auditservices the copies of audited accounts should be provided. In case the income from Internal audit is not mentioned separately inthe audited accounts a self certified statement of the specified turnover be submitted; [d] Additionally interested parties must provide information indicating that theyare qualified to perform the Services (brochures description of similar assignments experience in similar conditionsavailability of appropriate skills among staff etc). 6. The Auditors will be selected in accordance with theprocedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by Bank Borrowers January2011. 7. Interested Auditors may obtain further informationfrom Senior Accounts Officer HVPNL Panchkula on all working days from 9.00 Hrs. to17.00 Hrs 1ST (Contact No.09316369224). 8. Expression of interest must be delivered to theaddress below by not later than 11.06.2012 3:00 PM. (Sh. J.S. Batra) Chief Engineer/Material Management Haryana Vidyut Prasaran Nigam Limited Shakti Bhawan Sector-6 Panchkula-134109 (Haryana)

column4: Comprehensive Water Supply Service Improvements In Malkajgiri (part Of Ghmc) Package ?i(b) : Supply Laying Jointing Testing And Commissioning Of Ms Gravity Feeder Mains Of Diameters 700 1200 And 1600 Mm Supply Laying Jointing Testing And Commissio
column12: Chief General Manager (Engg) Project Construction Circle-IIIHMWSSB Khairatabad
column18: e-Procurement Notice HYDERABAD METROPOLITAN WATERSUPPLY AND SEWERAGE BOARD Andhra Pradesh Municipal Development Project INVITATIONSFOR BIDS (IFB) INTERNATIONAL COMPETITIVE BIDDING (ICB) Loan No. 78160-IN IFB No.E-02/CGM(E)/PCC-III /Malkajgiri/APMDP/Package-I(b)/ 2013-14 dt18-06-2013 1. This invitation for bids follows the GeneralProcurement Notice (GPN) for this Project which was published in the UNDB online Dated 31 st July 2009 of Notice No. WB2838-755. 2. The Government of Andhra Pradesh through Government of India has received a loan from the International Bank forReconstruction & Development (IBRD) in various currencies towards the cost of Andhra Pradesh Municipal Development Project(APMDP). It is intended that part of the proceeds of this loan will be applied to eligible payments under the contract for providing Comprehensive Water supplyService Improvements in Malkajgiri (Part of GHMC) Package-I(b). 3. The Chief General Manager (Engg) PCC-III HMWSSB Hyderabad PIN: 500 004 invites item rates bids from the eligible bidders in electronic procurement system for the construction and completion ofComprehensive Water supply Service Improvements inMalkajgiri (Part of GHMC) Package-I(b) consisting of the following main components. Supply laying Jointing testing and Commissioning of MS Gravity feeder mains of diameters 7001200 and 1600mm; Supply laying Jointing testing and Commissioning of DI pipelines in distribution system varying from 100 to 500 mm diameterincluding replacement of existing pipelines; and Providing House service connections with MDPE pipes andspecials 4. Bidding will be conducted through InternationalCompetitive Bidding (ICB) as per the provisions in the World Bank Standard Bidding Documents: Procurement of works (SBDW) under IBRD loans and Credits March 2012 Edition and is open to bidders from eligiblecountries as per Section V of Bidding documents. 5. Bidders are advised to note the minimum qualificationcriteria specified in Section III of the Bidding document to qualify for the award ofcontract. 6. Interested eligiblebidders may obtain further information from the e-procurement portal http://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/app in Tender Search byentering key word APMDP and also from the Project website www.apmdp.gov.in bynavigating through eProcurement (Goods& Works) 7. The complete set of bid documents is available online from 18-06-2013 11:00 AM onwards. The bids may beviewed downloaded and submitted online through the portal http://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/app. Bids submitted manually will not beaccepted. The bidders would be required to register in the web-site. Bidders who are not registered may obtain the User ID andPassword for participating in the bids by registering in the website: http://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/app free of charge. 8. For submitting bids the bidders are required to have Digital Signature Certificate(DSC) issued from any of the authorized Certifying Authorities. Foreign bidders from eligible countries may obtain Class-II DSCfrom the Certifying Authorities following the procedure described in the Downloadsoption in the e-procurement portal http://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/app. 9. Bid Security: INR 22 million (USD 440000) Bid security will have tobe in any one of the forms as specified in the bidding document and shall have to be valid for 45 days beyond the validity of thebid 10. The bidders are required to submit (a) original bid security in approved formand (b) original power of Attorney authorizingthe person to sign the bids on behalf of the bidder as per Clause 20 of ITB ofbidding document (in case of bidder who is not anindividual) in the Office of the Chief General Manager (Engg) PCC-III HMWSSB Hyderabad PIN: 500 004 Andhra Pradesh (India) on or beforethe date and time of opening ofBids either by registered post or by hand failing which the bids shall be declarednon-responsive. i) The above documents may be submitted in one envelope. Thebidders shall not write their names or addresses on this envelope. ii) The number mentioned on acknowledgement of online submissionof the bid by the bidder shall be mentioned on envelope containing the documents as detailedabove. 11. A pre-bid meeting will be held on 27-06-2013 at 11:00 AM(IST) at the office of Chief GeneralManager (Engg) PCC-III HMWSSB Hyderabad PIN: 500 004 Andhra Pradesh (India)to clarify the issues and to answer questions on any matter thatmay be raised at that stage as stated in Clause 7.4 of Instructions to Bidders of the biddingdocument. 12. The last Date and time for receipt of bids through thee-procurement portal http://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/app is 31-07-2013 upto 5:00 PM (IST). Bids will be opened in the presence of the bidders representatives who choose toattendat 11:00 AM (IST) on 05-08-2013 in the office of Chief General Manager(Engg) PCC-III HMWSSBHyderabad PIN: 500 004 Andhra Pradesh (India). If the officehappens to be closed on the date of opening of the bids as specified the bids will be opened on the next working day at the sametime and venue. 13. There is no margin of preference to the domesticbidders. 14. Other details can be seen in the bidding documents. TheEmployer shall not be held liable for any delays due to system failure beyond its control. Even though the system will attempt tonotify the bidders of any bid updates The Employer shall not be liable for any information not received by the bidder. It is thebidders responsibility to verify the website for the latest information related to thetender. 15. The address forcommunicationis as under: Name & Designationof Officer: Chief General Manager (Engg) Project ConstructionCircle-III HMWSSB Khairatabad Hyderabad PIN: 500 004 Andhra Pradesh INDIA Phone No. : +91 0466872222 Mobile No: +91 9989986779 Email: cgmpcc3hmwssb@gmail.com

Thisinvitation for bids follows the General ProcurementNotice (GPN) for this project that appeared in Development Business No. 653 dated 30.04.2005 and posted online on March 312005.The Government of Himachal Pradesh through the Government of India has received a loan from the International Bank forReconstruction and Development (IBRD) in various currencies towards the cost of Himachal Pradesh State Roads Project and itintends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan to payments under the contracts for which this invitation for bids has beenissued.he Chief Engineer cum Project Director State Roads Project Himachal Pradesh Road And Other Infrastructure DevelopmentCorporation Limited (HPRIDC) Shimla on behalf of the Governor of Himachal Pradeshnow invites sealed bids from eligible bidders for Balance Work of Widening and Strengthening of Theog ? Khara Patthar Section from Km 0.000 to Km48.000 having total length of 48.00km(Contract # PW.SRP/RIDC/HP/5/ICB/PKG-I); a. Contract PW.SRP/RIDC/HP/5/ICB/PKG-I consists of widening and strengthening of existingsingle/Intermediate lane road to two lane standard involving 41000 cum bituminous works 133000 cum aggregate base work1000000 cum earth work in excavation and embankment and 7 bridges with 33000 cum concrete. Contract Completion period would be 30 months. b. The contract will also be implemented forEnvironmental and Social managementaspects. 2. Bidders may obtain further information from andinspect the bidding documents from 1000 to 1700 hours Indian Standard Time(IST) onworking days from April 18 2013 to June 3 2013 at the Office of The Chief Engineer cum Project Director HP State Roads Project NirmanBhawan Nigam Vihar Shimla- 171002 Himachal Pradesh India; Telephone # +91+177+2627602 Fax # +91+177+2620663 email-id:pdsrp-hp@nic.in. 3. A complete set of bidding documents (andadditional copies) in English may be purchased by interested eligible bidders onsubmission of a written application during the time date and at the address given in paragraph 4 above and upon payment of a nonrefundable fee of Rupees. 25000 (Rupees Twenty Five Thousand only) or US$ 455 (US Dollar Four hundred Fifty Five only) for each of the contracts. The method of payment will be a Bank demand draft of Scheduled Banks approved by Reserve Bank of India in favor ofHimachal Pradesh Road and other Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited payable at Shimla India. Bidding documents requested by mail will be dispatched by registered/speedpost/courier on payment of an extra amount of Rupees. 1000 (Rupees One Thousand only) for domestic contractors and Rupees 5000(Rupees five thousand only) or US$ 91 (US Dollar Ninety One only) for overseas contractors. The Chief Engineer cum Project Directorwill not be held responsible for the postal/courier delay if any in the deliveryof the documents or non-receipt of thesame. 4. A pre-bid meeting will be held at 1100 hours (IST) on May 6 2013 at Conference Hall Nirman Bhawan Nigam Vihar Shimla- 171002 Himachal Pradesh India; Telephone Number91+177+2627602 Fax +91+177+2620663to clarify the issues andto answer questions on any matter that may be raised at thatstage asstated in Clause 7.4 of Instructions to Bidders of the bidding document.10 The Employer will grant a Margin of Preference for Domesticcontractors in accordance with the provisions made in the bidding documents. column4: Consultancy Services For Technical Assistance To Help Upgrade Road Maintenance Management System To Road Management System In The State Of Himachal Pradesh.
column12: HPRIDC Nirman BhawanNigam Vihar
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES) INDIA HIMACHAL PRADESH STATE ROADS PROJECT Loan No: 4860-IN & 8199-IN Reference No.:- 22 (ProcurementPlan) Assignment Title: Consultancy Services for Technical Assistance to help upgrade Road Maintenance ManagementSystem to Road Management System in the State of Himachal Pradesh. The Government of Indiahas received a loanno. "Ln.4860-IN/8199-IN" from The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development towards the cost of"Himachal Pradesh State Roads Project (HPSRP)" and intends to apply a part of the funds to cover eligible payments for thefollowing consulting services. Theconsulting services ("the Services") include Technical Assistance to help upgradeRoad Maintenance Management System to Road Management System in the State of Himachal Pradesh The specific objectives of the services are to: a) Review the existing MS-Access based Road Information System in use at HQ& Field Units; b) Creation of additional fields and other information in RIS for its use in latest version ofHighway Development & Management Model (HDM-4)software; c) Carry out any changes in the MS Access software for compatibility ofdata for producing reports/outputs as per need ofthe Client including enhancing Querying/ Reporting; d) Develop and establish a middleware for linking modified RIS with HDMfor smooth transfer of data between the two orlinking will include data import and export facilitates between the RMS and other applications and between various applications andreport generation modules; e) Supply and install 2 No. Multiuser lifetime licences of latest COTS HDM-4latest software withonline upgrade facility in HPPWD and HPRIDC HQs; f) Carry out compliance/pilot testing and validation of all various modules/every sub-program/sub-systems and entireupgraded system after full interface with HDM software; g) Transfer skills and procedures to an adequate number of staff in theHPPWD/HPRIDC for hand-holding and training tosustain the use of the HDM and RMMS during as well as after the end of these services; h) Providing implementation operation & maintenance support (intermittent) to HPPWD & HPRIDC for 18 months after all mandatory testing and validations and third party User AcceptanceTest-Response time of not more than 24 hoursand rectification time not more than 72 hours.That will include trouble shooting resolvingany problems faced by the RBD/RDC minor modifications and refinementsrequired in the system to improve its effectiveness based on the feedback information collected from its use and removing bugsfrom the Software. These services are expected to be delivered over a 42 months period. The Himachal Pradesh Road & Other Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited (HPRIDC)now invites eligible consulting firms("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the Services.InterestedConsultants should provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to performthe Services. The Consultants shall provide complete address with email ID. The short listing criteria are: Annual Turnover figure of last three years Net worthNet Profit Figure Past Experience of workof similar nature Overall Experience of Firm Experience as Lead Consultant in similarconsultancy etc. The attention of interested Consultants isdrawn to paragraph 1.9 ofthe World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loans and IDACredits & Grants] by World Bank Borrowers January 2011("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth theWorld Bankspolicy on conflict of interest. Consultants may associate with other firms inthe form of a joint venture or a sub consultancy to enhance their qualifications. The type of association should be clearly statedin the submission if it is JV or sub consultancy. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the Quality-And Cost-Based Selection (QCBS) method set out in the Consultant Guidelines. Further informationcan be obtained at the address below during officehours i.e1000 to 1700 hours. Expressions of interest must be delivered in a written form to theaddress below (in person or by mail or by fax or by e-mail) by May 03 2014. Request For Expressions of Interest (REOI) can also be downloaded fromany one of the followingwebsites: http://admis.hp.nic.in/himachal/hpridc/ or http://tenders.gov.in or http://hppwd.gov.in Chief Engineer-cum-Project Director Dated: April 02  2014 State Roads Project HPRIDC NirmanBhawan Nigam Vihar Shimla-171002 HimachalPradesh India. Tel:+91-177-2627602; Fax:+91-177-2620663 E-mail: pdsrp-hp@nic.in

column4: Prepartion Of City Plan For Hubli-dharwad
column12: 1st Floor KSFC Building PB RoadRayapur I
column18: Hubli-Dharwad BRTS CompanyLimited (A Government of KarnatakaUndertaking) GEF-Sustainable Urban TransportProject India GEF Grant Number: TF 095549IN REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OFINTEREST No: HDBRTS/LU-MP (RW-2)/36/2013-14 Date: 18-11-2013 1. This invitation for Expression of Interest follows the General Procurement Notice for this projectthat appeared in UN Development Business issue number 737 on 1 October 2008. 2. The Government of India has received a loan cum grantfrom the Global Environment Facility (GEF) - International Bank for Reconstruction and Development to implement Sustainable UrbanTransport Project (SUTP). A part of the grant/loan for SUTP is intended to be used for implementation of Hubli-Dharwad Bus RapidTransit System (BRTS) Project. These investments are expected to improve and promote environmentally sustainable urban transportinfrastructure and services in the city. 3. Hubli-Dharwad BRTS Company is a Government of Karnataka undertaking entrusted with the implementationof Bus Rapid Transit System in Hubli-Dharwad City intends to apply part of the proceeds of the grant/loan towards payments forconsultancy services and invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing the services asunder: The scope of the assignment under consideration includes prepartion of a concept plan for theHubli-Dharwad city region prepartion of a City Plan for Hubli-Dharwad and prepartion of a Town Planning Scheme for one selectedarea within the Hubli-Dharwad LocalPlanning Area. While theplan and the scheme are tobe evolved within the framework of the provisions under the Karnataka Town and Country Planning (KTCP) Act. The consultant isexpected to adopt methodologies and concepts more in line with the current day thinking. The scope of the assignment for the "Prepartion of Hubli- Dharwad City Plan" is available in web site www.hdbrts.co.in 4. The consultant is required to have successfully completed such similar assignments either atinternational/national/regional or city level. Consultants may associate to enhance their qualifications. The "Association" maytakethe form of joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of a Sub-consultancy. 5. The time duration for the assignment would be approximately 24 months from the date of award ofcontract. 6. Interestedconsultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified to perform theservices (brochures description of similar assignments experience in similar conditions availability of appropriate skills amongthe staff etc). The indicative structure for submission of EOI can be downloaded from the following link: www.hdbrts.co.in 7. The consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World BanksGuidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by Bank Borrower May 2004 revised May 2010 available atwww.worldbank.org/procure. 8. Interested consultants may obtain further information (if required)from the contact person/ address given below: MANAGING DIRECTOR Hubli Dharwad BRTS CoLtd 1stFloor KSFC BuildingPB Road RayapurI Dharwad-580009 Ph/Fax: +91-836-2322700 E-mail: hdbrts@gmail.com Website: www.hdbrts.co.in During office hours:between 10.00 AM to 5.00 PM on all working daysfrom Monday to Saturday except on Government holidays. 9. Expression of Interest superscripted with the title of the particularconsultancy must be delivered to the address indicated above not later than17:00 hrson 18-12-2013. The proposals can be submitted in Hard Copy (2 sets) only (electronic submission of the proposal is notacceptable). -Sd- Managing Director Hubli-Dharwad BRTS Company Ltd

column4: Hubli-dharwad Brts Project - Segregated Bus Lanes Off Board Ticketing Intelligent Transport System Area Trafficcontrol System Integration Of Trunk With Feeder And Other City Services
column12: BRTS Directorate of Urban Land Transport # 504 5th floor 4th Gate MS Building
column18: Hubli-Dharwad BRTS Company Limited (A Government of Karnataka Undertaking) Regd Office: # 504 4th Gate 5th floor M S Building Bangalore 560001. Ph: 080-22373780; Fax: 080-22373781. E-mail:hdbrts@gmail.com Website: www.urbantransport.kar.nic.in GEF-Sustainable Urban Transport Project India No: H-D BRTS/05/Tenders/2012-13 Date: 09-11-2012 GPN No: UN Development Business issue Number 737 on 1st October2008 GEF Grant Number: TF 095549 Notification for Extension of date for submission of EXPRESSION OF INTEREST (EOI) for consultancy services listed below: 1. Communications and Outreach Programme for Hubli-Dharwad BRTS Project 2. Monitoring and Evaluation of Social Safeguards of Hubli-Dharwad BRTS Project 3. Project Management for Hubli-Dharwad BRTS Project With reference to the notification dated 12-10-2012 the last date for submission of EOI for all the consultancy services has been extended till 5:00 PM (IST) on 24-11-2012. Sd/- Chairperson Hubli-Dharwad BRTS Company Ltd. ============================================================= Hubli-Dharwad BRTSCompany Limited (A Government of Karnataka Undertaking) GEF-Sustainable Urban Transport Project India GEF Grant Number: TF 095549IN REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST No: H-D BRTS/05/Tenders/2012-13 Date: 12-10-2012 1. This invitation for Expression of Interest follows the GeneralProcurement Notice for this project that appeared in UN Development Business issue number 737 on 1 October 2008. 2. The Government of India has received a loan cum grant from the GlobalEnvironment Facility (GEF) - International Bank for Reconstruction and Development to implement Sustainable Urban Transport Project(SUTP). A part of the grant/loan for SUTP is intended to be used for implementation of Hubli-Dharwad Bus Rapid Transit System(BRTS) Project. These investments are expected to improve and promote environmentally sustainable urban transport infrastructureand services in the city. 3. Hubli-Dharwad BRTS Project aims at promoting public transport withreduced travel times increased comfort reliability and safety for the commuters in the city. The main features of the BRT Projectare ? Segregated bus lanes Off board ticketing Intelligent Transport system Areatraffic control system integration of trunkwith feeder and other city services. 4. Hubli-Dharwad BRTS Company is a Government of Karnataka undertakingentrusted with the implementation of Bus Rapid Transit System in Hubli-Dharwad City. Hubli-Dharwad BRTS Company Limited intends toapply part of the proceeds of the grant/loan towards payments for consultancy servicesand invites eligible consultants to indicatetheir interest in providing the services as under: A. Consultancy Services for Communications and Outreach Programme forHubli-Dharwad BRTS Project: a. Brief Scope of the Assignment: The scope of the assignment includes Stage-1: Preparation of a Communication and Outreach Plan with thefollowing broad objectives: i. Build a positive identity for BRTS &Non-Motorized Transport- Creation of a uniform brand identity for the BRTS that is identifiable and popular for keysegments of the population in HDMC including women children business persons disabled/elderly and other end-users. ii. Position BRTS ? Asa clean modern fast safe and reliable transportation solution to the public. Build greater understanding and appreciation of itsrole in decongesting road space and contributing towards cleaner environment. iii. Create awarenessamong the citizens about sustainabletransport in general BRT in particular. iv. Educate new riderson how to use BRTS. Inform and prepare the public for the difficulties they are likely to face during construction and thetransition to the new system seek their cooperation and receive their feedback. v. Identify key stakeholders and build strongpartnerships with media and civil society for smooth implementation of the project. vi. Induce a shifttowards sustainable modes of transport. vii. Monitor measure and evaluatethe effectiveness of theoutreach program. The time frame for preparation of the Communication and Outreach Plan is approximately 10 weeks from the date ofaward of contract. Stage-II: The implementation of the Communication and Outreach Plan Thetime frame for theimplementation stage is approximately 110 weeks from the date of the acceptance of the Communication and Outreach Plan. b. Skills/ Experience required: The consultants will need to have a highly-qualified team with a broad range of skill mixes that allows it todeliver the discrete tasks identified above. The consultants will need to show: i. Experience in conducting and designing respectivelysimilar communication need assessment and strategies in terms of size and complexity; ii. Experience in designing and managingsensitive development and social campaigns; and the ability to engage experts with a good understanding ofsocial/environment/infrastructure programs in India. B.Consultancy Services for Monitoring and Evaluation of Social Safeguards of Hubli-Dharwad BRTS Project a. Brief Scope of the Assignment: i. Tomonitor the effectiveness of the implementation of theresettlement and rehabilitation measures as outlined in the RAP; and ii. To bring the difficulties faced bythe PAPs / communities to the noticeof ESDC so as to help in formulating corrective measures on implementation of safeguardprovisions. The external agency shall submit quarterly report on progress made relating to different aspects of implementation ofR&R provisions during the project implementation period. iii. To assist the SPV (Special PurposeVehicle) to respond to the World Bank on any matters related to the implementation of RAP and related matters. iv. To carry out an assessment of thevarious indicators put forth in the RAP provisions as part of the periodic monitoring exercise. v.To organize periodical training in the implementation of RAP and delivering of entitlements consultations etc. to SPV staff asnecessary. b. Skills/ Experience required: The consultant is expected to have experience in design and implementation of RAP of externally aidedinfrastructure projects (World Bank or Asian Development Bank). c. Approximate Duration of the Project: 24months (Spread across BRT Project Implementation Period- 36 months) from the date of award of contract. C.Consultancy Services for Project Management for Hubli-Dharwad BRTS Project: a. Brief Scope of the Assignment: i.The role of the Project Management Consultancy (PMC) would be to effectively monitor and supervise the construction activitiesincluding overseeingpre-construction activities for the execution and development of roadway roadside furniture pedestrianwalkways and other non-motorized transit infrastructure bus shelters bus depots workshops and bus terminal terminals for theHubli-Dharwad BRTS project. ii. The PMC shall assist the SPV in pre-construction activities like shifting ofutilities obtaining statutoryapprovals preparing implementation schedule budget and cash flow statements. It shall review all the project documents (contractdocuments BOQ EMP etc) and list out deficiencies/ inconsistencies from the perspective of implementation and assistthe SPV in bidevaluation and selection of contractors. iii. The PMC shall be involved in day to day supervision quality control bill verification etc. It shall ensurehigh quality construction with full compliance to engineering designs drawings and technical specifications and the contractdocuments with specified schedule. iv. The PMC shall monitor the effectiveness of implementation of the Environmental Management Plan and ensureadherence of the contractor to environmental standards and safeguards. v.The PMCshall prepare a detailed maintenance manual of the works and assist in handing over the completed works to the SPV. b. Skills/ Experience required: The consultant is expected to have experience as construction supervision consultant/ project management consultantfor infrastructure projects of similar nature. c. Approximate Duration of the Consultancy Service: 36months from the date of award of contract. 5. Consultants may associate to enhance their qualifications. The"Association" may take the form of joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of a Sub-consultancy. The consultant canapply for one or two of the consultancyservice or for all of them; However Expression of Interest shall be separate and independent for each of the consultancy servicesapplied. 6. Interestedconsultants must provide information indicating that they arequalified to perform the services (brochures description of similar assignments experience in similar conditions availability ofappropriate skills among the staff etc). The indicative structure for submission of EOI can be downloaded from the following link: http://stg1.kar.nic.in/urbantransport/tenders.html 7. The consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out intheWorld Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by Bank Borrower May 2004 revised May 2010 available atwww.worldbank.org/procure 8. Interestedconsultants may obtain further information (if required) from thecontact person/ address given below: Assistant Director BRTS Directorate of Urban Land Transport # 504 5th floor 4th Gate MS Building Bangalore-560 001 Contact No.:080-22373780 Email: hdbrts@gmail.com Website: www.urbantransport.kar.nic.in During office hours: between 10.00 AM to 5.00 PM on all working days fromMonday to Saturday except on Government holidays. 9. Expressionof Interest superscripted with the title of the particularconsultancy (A B or C above) must be delivered to the address indicated above not later than 1700 hrs on 15-11-2012. The proposalsshall be submittedin Hard Copies only (2 sets). Electronic submission of the proposal is not acceptable. -Sd/- ChairpersonHubli-Dharwad BRTS Company Ltd

column4: Wbr 3-package B-detailed Survey & Rehab/modernization Design Of Irrigation & Drainage Infra Associated With Lower Ganga Canal (lgc) System Comprising Commands Of Kanpur Branch (kb)west Allahabad Branch(wab) & Fatehpur Branch (fb)
column12: Irrigation Colony 52 Cantt.
column18: INDIA: Uttar Pradesh Water Sector RestructuringProject Phase II Request for Expression of Interest [REOI] For Survey and Rehabilitation/Modernization Design of Irrigation and Drainage Infrastructure inLower Ganga Canal System ? Kanpur Branch (KB) West Allahabad Branch (WAB) and Fatehpur Branch (FB) Package ? B Project ID : P122770 1. The Government of Uttar Pradesh/Government of Indiaintends to apply for a Credit/Loan from the International Development Association/International Bank for Reconstruction andDevelopment and intends to apply part of the proceeds to appoint a consulting firm to undertake detailed survey andRehabilitation/Modernization Design of Irrigation and Drainage infrastructure associated with the Lower Ganga Canal System (LGCSystem) comprising the commands of Kanpur Branch (KB) West Allahabad Branch (WAB) andFatehpur Branch (FB). 2. The scope of the services would include (i) thepreparation of precise Topographic and Cadastral maps of thecommands and detailed Longitudinal and Cross-section data of KB WABand FB and all Distributaries and Minors associated with these systemsand (ii) the preparation of designs forRehabilitation/Modernization of Irrigation and Drainage infrastructure including construction drawings cost estimates Economicand Financial analysis and bidding documents. The consultant is expected to use latest techniques in Surveys and Designs andsuggest the least cost solutions to achieve the objective of optimal use of available water in the system. The duration of theconsultancy is expected to be 36 months. The total command area is estimated to be 520000 ha. 3. The Superintending Engineer II CircleIrrigationWorks Kanpur invites eligible Consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Consultancy Services for the aboveassignment. 4. Interested Consultants must provide the followinginformation indicating that they are qualified to perform the Services: Brochures Description of Similar Assignments Availabilityof Skills among Staff including but not limited to Survey Specialists with experience in Modern Surveying Techniques IrrigationDesign Specialists and Specialists in Modern Canal Instrumentation and Operation. 5. Consultants may associate to enhance theirqualifications. [The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of asub-consultancy] and this should be stated clearly in the submission. 6. The criteria for short listing of the Consulting firmsshall be as follows:  The firms should have been in business for at least fifteen (15)years in Survey and Design of large Irrigation System with at least three International assignments of similarnature.  Should have at least three (3) similar experience during the lastseven (7) years in Canal Cross-section Surveys including Survey works in running canals and three (3) similar experience inRehabilitation/Modernization/automation Design of Irrigation infrastructure of large systems.  Should have design expertise in canalautomation.  Shall be financially sound with an average annual turnover of more than INR 450000000 (US$9000000) during the last five (5) years (2007-08 to 2011-12);and  Availability of skills mentioned above among core staff of the firm. 7. A consultant will be selected in accordance withQuality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) procedures set out in the World Banks"Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants Under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits& Grants by World Bank Borrowers- January 2011". The Guidelines are available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 8. Interested Consultants may obtain further informationat the address given below from 10.00 ? 17.00 hours (IST) on all working days. This notice for Expression of Interest has also beenposted on UPID website http://irrigation.up.nic.in/project.htm 9. Expression of Interest with all relevant informationand documents must be submitted and subscribed "Expression of Interest for Survey and Design Consultancy for the LGC Systemcomprising the Irrigation and Drainage Infrastructure of the commands of KB WAB and FB" on top of a closed envelope and bedelivered to the address below by not later than 15:00 hours (IST) on Monday December 03 2012. In the event this last date being declared as holiday by the State Government due date for submission of aboveEoI will be the next working day up till the same appointedtime. Superintending Engineer IInd Circle Irrigation Works Irrigation Colony 52 Cantt. Kanpur Uttar Pradesh208004 INDIA Phone : 0512-2380818 Telefax : +(91)0512-2380818 Email : seiw2knp@gmail.com Website : http://irrigation.up.nic.in/project.htm

column2: IN:IIFCL - India Infras Finance Co Ltd
column4: Engaging An Individual Consultant As Head Environment And Social Mangement Unit
column12: 8th Floor Hindustan Times House 18-20 Kasturba Gandhi Marg
column18: Engagement of Individual Consultant as HEAD ?ENVIRONMENT AND SOCIAL MANAGEMENT UNIT" REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST( EOI) Country : INDIA Project : BuildingCapacity and Strengthening Monitoring and Implementation Capability of India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited Sector : Finance and Private Sector Development Grant No : TF 096466 1. This request for Expression of Interest follows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared indgMarket/UNBD onlineon 24 Feb 2010. 2. The India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited (IIFCL) has received a Grant from the World Bank acting as administrator ofgrant funds provided by the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland under the United Kingdoms Department forInternational Development (DFID) towards the cost of Building Capacity and Strengthening Monitoring and Implementation Capabilityof India Infrastructure Company Finance Limited and intends to apply part of the proceeds to payment for goods and consultingservices to be procured under this Grant. 3. The India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited would like to appoint an INDIVIDUAL CONSULTANT for the position of "HEAD ?ENVIRONMENT AND SOCIAL MANAGEMENT UNIT " at IIFCL. The objective of this assignment is to establish the eligibility of sub-projects financed by IIFCL forfinancing using the World Bank loan agreement with IIFCL. 4. SCOPE OF WORK: This activity would entail: a. To review project documentation received from Lead Bank/ project developer to check applicability of all applicable nationalstate and local environmental and social policies and regulatory requirements development partners requirement- especially on theprocess to be followed and identify gaps if any for action at the end of Lead Bank/ project developer. ? b. ESMU Head will review the relevant project documents including the EMPs/RAPs/IPDPs and check their adequacy and effectivenessin mitigating adverse environmental and social issues appropriateness of thebudget and robustness of the institutional mechanismfor implementation and monitoring of safeguard measures. Make suggestions if there aredeficiencies to the Lead Bank/ projectdeveloper. c. Managing and Ensuing quality in preparation and implementation of Environmental and social impacts (DDR) related tosub-projects in the pipeline and portfolio; review sector specific checklist guidelines monitoring and reporting formats tostrengthen environment and social due diligence. These guidelines will make use of materials developed by GOI. d. Managing and Ensuing quality in preparation and implementation of audit recording sheet for sub projects and conduct annualenvironmental and social audit that would meet IIFCLs as well as development partners requirement. e. Undertake site visits for assessments monitoring and reviewingof subprojects and procure documentation and discusscompliance requirements with project sponsors; f. Managing the staff of ESMU and contributing to the overall management of safeguards compliance and monitoring theimplementation of safeguard aspects in the sub-projects financed by IIFCL; g. Providing leadership and vision on Environmental and Social Development aspects within the organization; h. Conduct information dissemination and annual learning workshop for IIFCL and stakeholders. i. Representing IIFCL on Environmental and Social Development issues with Lead Banks /consortium partners GovernmentDevelopment Partners etc; j. Any other tasks those are appropriate to manage the Environmental and social risks in IIFCL Portfolio. k. To devote 25% of the time to build capacity within IIFCL in understanding all aspects of the environment and social safeguardframework. l. Assist IIFCL in meeting safeguards policy requirements of the development (funding) partners as agreed with the latter. ? 5. QUALIFICATIONSAND SKILLREQUIREMENTS a. Minimum Masters degree in a relevant discipline and 10 years of experience directly related to Environment and/or Socialaspects of infrastructure development. b. Experience of working in multilateral financed projects is an added advantage. c. Familiar with domestic laws and policies related to Environmentand Social safeguards aspects of infrastructure development. d. The consultant should possess capacity building and coaching skills. 6. The India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited now invites applications from eligible individual consultants to indicatetheir interest in providing the services. Interested consultants must provide information in their CV indicating that they arequalified to perform the services and have prior experience. The individual consultants shallenclose proof of their credentialssupporting documents etc. 7. The selection process will be in accordance with the proceduresset out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (May 2004 revised in October 2006). The submission deadline date is 1700 hrs on 1 April 2013. India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited Attn: Manager (Procurements) 8 th Floor Hindustan Times House 18-20 Kasturba Gandhi Marg New Delhi ? 110 001 Phone: 91-11- 23708263 23708264 Fax : 91-11-2376625623730251 E-mail: procurements@iifcl.org Web site: www.iifcl.org Curriculum Vitae (CV) 1. Proposed Assignment : 2. Name of Candidate [Insert fullname] : 3. Date of Birth : Nationality : 4. column2: IN:IIFCL - India Infras Finance Co Ltd
column4: Preparing The Strategic Review
column12: 8th Floor Hindustan Times House18-20 Kasturba Gandhi Marg
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST Assignment : Independent Strategic review IDF GrantNo: TF 095760 1. The India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited (IIFCL) has receiveda Grant from the Institutional DevelopmentFundtowards the cost of Building Capacity and Strengthening Monitoring and Evaluation Capabilityof India Infrastructure Finance Company Ltd and intends to apply part of the proceeds to payment for goods and consulting services to be procured under this Grant. 2. The Grant supports the Project on "Financing Public Private Partnerships (PPPs) projectin Infrastructure through Support to the India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited" (the project) for which IIFCL has receivedfinancing in the amount of US$ 1195000000 equivalent from the World Bank. As part of themid-term review of the Project an independent strategic review is envisaged which will take stock of implementation process and progress of the Project andreview progress towards achieving the Projects key developmentobjectives 3. The India InfrastructureFinance Company Limited would like to appoint an INDIVIDUAL CONSULTANT having expertise in development sector for "Preparing the Strategic Review ? 1 of World Bankloan agreement with IIFCL. 4. BROADSCOPE OF WORK: This activity would entail conducting an independent strategic review and should lead to areport and will contain the following:  Consider the aims and objectives of the project as originally conceived and the success or otherwise inachieving these.  The nature of the obstacles for private sector involvement in Indiasinfrastructure and the degree of theprojects success in addressing those obstacles.  Consider the optimum means by which the project could contribute to the long term goals of private sectorinvolvement in infrastructure development.  Consider the governance structure management organisation sourcing of work and activities controlreporting and funding of sub- projects at IIFCL  Comment on the validity of the original objectives of the project andrecommend course-correction (ifappropriate) 5. TIMELINE FOR DELIVERABLES (i) Draft report shall be submitted to IIFCL within 16weeks from the date of signing of contract for the consultancy services. (ii) Final report 2 weeks after review comments have beenprovided by IIFCL on the draft versions 6. QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS (i) At least ten years working experience in thedevelopmental field including the role of the private sector in developmental activity preferably in the infrastructuresector. (ii) At least five years working experience in adeveloping country preferably in India or South Asia (iii) Knowledge of issues pertaining to private sectorinvolvement in developing of infrastructure in India including the enabling and regulatoryenvironment financing and riskconstraints. (iv) Previousexperience of evaluating multilateral donor programs including the use of quantitative techniques. 7. The India InfrastructureFinance Company Limited now invites applications from eligible individual consultants to indicate their interest in providing theservices. Interested consultants must provide information intheir CV indicating that they are qualified to perform the services and have prior experience in strategic review of multilateralsand other developmental agency funded projects in the enclosed FORMAT. 8. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World BankBorrowers May 2004 revised October 2006. 9. Interested consultants may obtain furtherinformation at the address below during office hours (1030 hours to 1700 hours) Expressions of interest along with detailed CV must be delivered by post or through e mailto the address below by 21 August 2012. India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited Attn: Manager (Procurement) 8 th Floor Hindustan Times House 18-20 Kasturba Gandhi Marg New Delhi ? 110 001 Tel: +91-11-2373026323730264 Fax: +91 -11-23766256 E-mail: procurements@iifcl.org Web site: www.iifcl.org

column2: IN:IIFCL - India Infras Finance Co Ltd
column4: M&e Framework & Gaap Indicators
column12: India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited
column18: REQUEST FOREXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST Assignment : Monitoring and Evaluation Framework and GAAPMonitoring and Indicators DFID Grant No:TF 096466 The India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited (IIFCL) has receiveda Grant from United Kingdoms Department for InternationalDevelopment (DFID) towards the cost of Building Capacity and Strengthening Monitoring and Implementation Capability of IndiaInfrastructure Company Finance Limited and intends to apply part of the proceeds to payment for goods works related services andconsulting services to be procured under this Grant. 2. Monitoring & EvaluationFramework: A robust monitoring framework to track inputs outputs andoutcomes of the Project in a systematic and timely fashion are envisaged under the Project. Project outcomes and outputs will bemonitored via Project supervision using administrative data from several sources. 3. Governance and Accountability Action Plan (GAAP)Monitoring and Indicators: In line with the governance and accountability action plan (GAAP)developed for this Project and included in the Project Operations Manual(OM) actions have been built into the Projects designimplementation Bank supervision arrangements to mitigate risks related to poor governance fraud and corruption at key stagesalong the value chain. 4. The India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited would like to select an individual as consultant to assist the company with theImplementation of the M&E framework and Governance and Accountability Action Plan (GAAP) Monitoring and Indicators. The consultant willundertake but not limited to the following activities: a. Study of the Monitoring & Evaluation Framework agreed between IIFCL & the Bank. b. Study of the Governance and Accountability Action Plan (GAAP) Monitoring and Indicators. c. Identify the sources of data for M & E reporting & their interpretation while preparing the M& E reports. d. Identify the relevant sub project data relating to procurement risk & credit management audit andaccounts reporting structures and internal control mechanisms e. Provide the framework of the reports to be prepared for Monitoring & Evaluation Framework and the Governance andAccountability Action Plan (GAAP) Monitoring and Indicators 5. The India Infrastructure FinanceCompany Limited now invites applications from eligible individual consultants to indicate their interest in providing the services.Interested consultants must provide information in their CV indicating that they are qualified to perform the services withrelevant experience in similar assignments in the enclosed FORMAT. 6. column18: INDIA-Financing Public Private Partnership Through Support to the IndiaInfrastructure Company Limited [IIFCL] Request for Expressions of Interest for Consulting Firm for Preparation of aCommunication Strategy for India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited [IIFCL] Project ID : P102771 DFID Grant Number : TF096466 1.
