column2: IN:IIFCL - India Infras Finance Co Ltd
column4: Hiring Of Consultancy Services Of A Dedicated Grievance Redressal Mechanism
column12: 8th Floor Hindustan Times House 18-20 Kasturba Gandhi Marg
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST Title of the proposed consultancy: Establishment of a dedicated grievance redressalmechanism IDF Grant No: TF095760 1. The India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited has received a Grantfrom the World Banks InstitutionalDevelopment Fund for building itscapacity and strengthening monitoring and evaluation capability and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consultant services. 2. The IIFCL is complying with Indias Right to Information Act (RTI) 2005 and will continue to strengthenits transparency and accountabilitymechanisms as required as per the Act. The IIFCL has appointed a senior person as the centralpublic information officer responsible for RTI for the organization. The IIFCL will conduct a periodic review of compliance withthe disclosure requirements under the RTI Act followinggood industry practice and take appropriate actions to enhance disclosureon an ongoing basis. The IIFCL will establish a dedicated grievance redressal mechanism with a clearly defined timeline roles andresponsibilities. The mechanism shall contain specific provisions for establishment of appropriate system for disposing complaintsin relation to implementation of projects that may be made by any person or group of persons. The enhanced ESSF will also outlinethe mechanism for grievance redressal and the monitoring and reporting. The proposed grievance redressal mechanism will beapplicable to all infrastructure projects financed by IIFCL in order to enhance the governance transparency and accountabilitypractices with respect to infrastructure projects. 3. The India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited would like to appoint an individual consultant toEstablish a dedicated grievance redressal mechanism. The grievance redressal mechanism proposed by the consultant will includepolicies and procedures to address but not limitedto the following: a. Setting up of a Grievance Redress Machinery b. Designation of a Grievance Officer and other members of the grievanceredressal panel at IIFCL c. Functioning of Grievance Redressal Machinery at IIFCL d. Fixing time limits for disposal of work relating to public grievancesand strictly adhere tothem e. Constitution of an Audit Panel or such other similar machineryfor examining areas of public interface f. Publicising the grievance redressal mechanism through appropriate media g. The redressal mechanism review processes to identify activities wheretransparency equity prudence andpropriety are compromised interventions that can help achieve better outcomes improve satisfaction of allstakeholders h. Performance review of grievance redressal machinery of IIFCL at defined periodicity 2. The India Infrastructure FinanceCompany Limited now invites applications from eligible individual consultants to indicate their interest in providing the services.Interested consultants must provide information in their CV indicating that they are qualified to perform the services and haveprior experience in grievance redressal. 3. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World BankBorrowers May 2004 revised October 2006. 4. Interestedconsultants may obtain further information at the address below during office hours (1030hours to 1700 hours) Expressions of interest must be delivered by post or through e mail to the address below by 22 August.2012 India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited Attn: Manager (Procurement) 8 th Floor HindustanTimes House 18-20 Kasturba GandhiMarg New Delhi ? 110 001 Tel: +91-11-23730269 23730270 Fax: +91 -11-23736355 E-mail: procurements@iifcl.org Web site: www.iifcl.org

column4: Establishment Of National Agricultural Bioinformatics Grid In Icar
column12: IASRI Library Avenue
column18: INDIAN AGRICULTURAL STATISTICS RESEARCHINSTITUTE Centre forAgricultural Bioinformatics (CABin) (I.C.A.R.) Library Avenue New Delhi-110012 Country: India Name of the Project: National AgriculturalInnovation Project (NAIP) Sector: Agricultural Bioinformatics CONSULTANCY SERVICES Credit No. 4161-IN& 4162-IN Project ID No. P092735 EXPRESSION OF INTEREST 1. This request for Expressions of Interest follows thegeneral procurement notice for this project that appeared in Development Business issue no. No. 675 of 31st March2006. 2. The Government of India (GOI) has received a credit fromthe International Development Association (IDA) for funding the National Agricultural Innovation Project (NAIP) of the IndianCouncil of Agricultural Research (ICAR) and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this Creditto payment towards a consultancy on"Bio-Clustering and Agricultural BioinformaticsPortal Development" under NAIP component-I sub-project on " Establishment of National Agricultural Bioinformatics Grid inICAR" 3. The consultant needs to provide two majorservices: A:Bio-clustering of HPC systems whichmay include (i) Design and development of National Agricultural Bioinformatics Grid (NABG)resources to providebioinformatics and bio-simulation services to its users in an easy touse and intuitive model (ii) definingcomputational biology servicesthat would be offered by NABG and (iii) development of bio-simulation service portfolios that would be supported by NABG. B: Development of agricultural bioinformatics portal which includes (i) designingdevelopment and implementation of genomic databases and data warehouse (ii) development ofagricultural bioinformatics web portal for providing computational services and support to the users through development of analytical pipeline and workflow management for bioinformatics applications along with implementationof other standard services/functionalitiesof the portals. Apart from this consultant is to assist the project team in evaluationbenchmarking monitoring and management of the hardware (i.e. HPC system and related infrastructure) as well as softwareof theproject at all locations of the project. Consultant will also be responsible for operational management of the complete systemafterits implementation. Implementation Period : 12 months Monitoring Organization : Indian Agricultural Statistics ResearchInstitute Library Avenue New Delhi-110012. 4. Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute(IASRI) New Delhinow invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing the services. Interested consultantmust provide the following information indicating that they are qualified to perform the services: a. Company profile with organization setup and details of experiences. b. Core business of the firm and number of years in business. c. Number of professional staff including the availability of appropriate skillsamong staff with specific qualifications required for this assignment. d.Experience showing establishment of HPC and bioinformatics services in in India &abroad. 5. A consultant will be selected in accordance with theprocedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines; Selection and Employment of consultant by World Bank Borrowers May 2004 revisedOctober 2006 & May 2010. 6. Interested consultants may obtain further information atthe address given below on any working days from 10:00 to 16:00 P.M. 7. Expression of interest must be submitted to theaddress given below by 08.06.2011 till 1600 hours. Assistant Administrative Officer (Central Purchase Section) Address: IndianAgricultural Statistics Research Institute (IASRI) Library Avenue Pusa New Delhi - 110012 India. Tel: 91-11-25847122-24 Extn: 4137/4130 Fax: 91-11-25841564 E-mail: director@iasri.res.in cps@iasri.res.in Website: www.iasri.res.in

column18: SPECIFIC PROCUREMENT NOTICE Country : India Name of Project : National Agricultural Innovation Project(NAIP) Sector : AgricultureExtension andResearch Brief Description of Goods : Designing Site-Preparation Supply Installation Commissioning Maintenance Operations ofthe High PerformanceComputing Systems for "National Agricultural Bioinformatics Grid in ICAR" at IASRI New Delhi under National agriculture innovation project. Credit No. : 4161-IN and4162-IN Project ID No. : P 092735 Bid No. : 36(17)/2010- CPS The Government of India hasreceived financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the National Agricultural Innovation Project and it intends to applypart of the proceeds toward payments under the contract for Designing Site-Preparation Supply InstallationCommissioning Maintenance Operations of the High Performance Computing Systems for "National Agricultural Bioinformatics Grid inICAR"at IASRI New Delhi. The Indian AgriculturalStatistics Research Institute (IASRI) (Indian Council ofagriculturalResearch) New Delhi India now invites sealed bids from eligible bidders for Designing Site-Preparation Supply InstallationCommissioning Maintenance Operations of the High Performance Computing Systems for "National Agricultural Bioinformatics Grid inICAR" at IASRI New Delhi Bidding will be conducted using the International CompetitiveBidding (ICB) procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits edition of May2004 revised October 2006 and is open to all Bidders eligible as defined in these Guidelines that meet theminimum qualification criteria as specified in the BiddingDocument. Some of critical qualification criteria are: S. No. Qualification Criteria 1. Thedomestic bidders should be companies registered in India under the company Act 1956 since last 3 years. Similarly the foreignbidders should be registered under the relevant Act prevailing in their country since last 3 years. 2. Bidder should be System Integrator or HPC OEM firm 3. Bidder or one of its JV partner should be an established HPC solution providing company and should have experience as per Instruction to bidders(ITB). 4. Bidder or one of its JV partner should be an established System Integrator company and should have experience andfinancial capacity as per Instruction to bidders (ITB). 5. Bidder or one of its JV partner should be an established Data Centre Solution providing company and should have workexperience as per Instruction to bidders (ITB). 6. Bidder should have annual turnover of at least Rs. 300 crores forpreceding three Financial Years. 7. Bidder should have installed and commissioned successfully similar HPC and Data center project through single workorder of value not less than Rs 15 crore or two separate work orders value of Rs. 10 Crore each. for Government Institutions/Private or Public Organizations in last five years Interested eligible Bidders may obtain further information from Assistant Administrative Officer CP Section Email:cps@iasri.res.in and inspect the bidding documents at the address given below from23 rd August 2011 between 10.00 AM to 4.00 PM on all working days. A completeset of Bidding Documents in English may be purchased by interested bidders on the submission of a written application to theaddress below and upon payment of a non refundable fee of Indian Rupees 5000/- or US$ 100 in the form of a Demand Draft/Bankerscheque in favour of "Director IASRI" payable at New Delhi from23 rd August 2011 to 2 nd November 2011. Bidding document requested by mail will be dispatched by courier on paymentof an extra amount of Indian Rupees 1000/- for domestic bidders andUS$ 50 for overseas bidder. IASRI New Delhi India will not be held responsible for postal delay if any in the delivery of document ornon-receipt of the same. Alternatively the biddersmay visit IASRIs website www.iasri.res.in and/or NAIPs websitewww.naip.icar.org.in for more information and/or download thebid document. The cost of bid document may be submitted along with the bid beforeopening. Please note that in case of any discrepancy between the documents downloaded by the prospective bidder and theBidding Documents (hard copy) of IASRI New Delhi India the latter shall prevail. A pre-bid meeting with potential bidders will be held on26 th September 2011. Bids must be delivered tothe address below ator before 11:00 AM 3 rd November 2011. All bids mustbe accompanied by a bid security ofINR 10000000 (10Millions INR)or its equivalent amount ina freely convertible currency. Late bids will be rejected. Bids will be opened in thepresence of the Bidders representatives who choose to attend at the address below at 11:30 AM 3 rd November2011 The attention of prospective Bidders is drawn to (i) the fact that theywill be required to certifyin their bids that all software is either covered by a valid license or was produced by the Bidder and(ii) that violations are considered fraud which can result in ineligibility to be awarded World Bank-financedcontracts. column4: Hiring Of Consultancy Services For Communication And Dissemination Of Naip Achievements
column12: Project Implementation Unit - NAIP 5th Floor KAB-II Pusa Campus
column18: EXPRESSION OF INTEREST FOR HIRING OF CONSULTANCY SERVICESFOR COMMUNICATION AND DISSEMINATION OF NAIP ACHIEVEMENTS Indian Council of AgriculturalResearch Directorate of Knowledge Management inAgriculture Krishi Anusandhan Bhavan?I PusaCampus New Delhi?110 012 Website: www.icar.org.in No. :8(5)/NAIP/MMP/2013-14 Country: India Name of the Project: National Agricultural Innovation Project (NAIP) Credit No.: 4161-IN & 4162-IN Sector: Agriculture Communication and Publicity Project ID No.: P092735 EXPRESSION OF INTEREST FOR HIRING OFCONSULTANCY SERVICES FOR COMMUNICATION AND DISSEMINATION OF NAIP ACHIEVEMENTS 1. The Government of India (GOI) has received a credit from the International Development Association (IDA) for fundingthe National Agricultural Innovation Project (NAIP) of the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) and intends to apply partof the proceeds towards a consultancy for communication and dissemination of NAIP achievements. NAIP has identifiedtechnologies/process/success stories for wider dissemination and popularization among various stakeholders through appropriatemedia mix. 2. The services include:  Design Development and release of news/features/sponsored features and advertisements for print media which includesNewspapers and Magazines in English Hindi and other regional languages  Development and dissemination of Video and Audio Clips to ElectronicMediawhich includes Television and Radio channels and streaming of audio visual content on NAIP ICAR and relatedwebsites  Sharing and dissemination of Information through Social Networking Tools such as Facebook Twitter YouTube and otheronline platforms  Design and Development of NAIP website and content management including design and development ofeNewsletter  Organization of media visits at identified places across India which includes development of theme/concept/content andrelease of press note to media  Design and development of multi colour publications on NAIP Technologies Success Stories Innovations andImpact Implementation period: 06Months Monitoring Organization: Directorate of KnowledgeManagement in Agriculture (DKMA) ICAR 3. DKMA invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest inproviding the services. Interested consultant must provide the following information along with documentary evidenceindicating thatthey are qualified to perform the services:  Company profilewith organization setup and details of experiences  Core business ofthe firm and number of years in business  Generalqualifications and number of professional staff  Details regardingin house facility of audio-visual studio  Experiences showingthe execution of similar nature of assignments 4. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection andEmployment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers May 2004 revised October 2006. 5. Interested consultants may obtain further information at the address given below on any working day from 10:00 to17:00 hours. 6. Expression of Interest must be submitted to the address given below by25.10.2013 till 15:00 hours. Project Incharge NAIP Mass Media Project Room No. 603KAB-I Pusa Campus New Delhi-110012 India Telefax: +91-11-2584 2649 Fax +91-11-2584 1282 Email:naipmassmedia@gmail.com Project Incharge NAIPMass Media Project DKMA

column4: Consultancy For Outcome Focused Impact Evaluation Of The Naip
column12: Project Implementation Unit (PIU) KAB-II Pusa Campus
column18: Indian Council of Agricultural Research National Agricultural Innovation Project Project ImplementationUnit Krishi Anusandhan Bhavan # II Pusa New Delhi # 110 012 Web site: http://www.naip.icar.org.in Country: India CONSULTANCY SERVICES Name of theProject: National Agricultural Innovation Project (NAIP) Credit No.:4161-IN & 4162-IN Sector: Agriculture Extension andResearch Project ID No.: P092735 EXPRESSIONOF INTEREST 1. The Government of India (GOI) has received a credit from theInternational Development Association (IDA) for funding the National Agricultural Innovation Project (NAIP) of the Indian Councilof Agricultural Research (ICAR) and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this credit to payment towards a consultancy foroutcome focused impact evaluation of the NAIP. 2. The servicesinclude:  Undertake the full-scale impact evaluation studies of theNAIP sub-projects and the NAIP as a whole at mid-term and at the completion of project implementation.  Design and prepare the impact evaluation reports takinginto account project outcomes covering achievements of project development objectives and outputs the implementation experiencebusiness processes consortia approach sustainability issues lessons learnt potential weaknesses and mitigation measures.  Undertake relevant financial and economic analysis toprovide a quantitative assessment of the benefits generated by the project and documentation of important outcomes and outputs interms of scientific and technological advancements and comparison with othersystems  Prepare the Impact Evaluation Reports in a format agreedwith the PIU. Implementation Period: 30 months Monitoring Organization:Project Implementation Unit (PIU) NAIP 3. The Project Implementation Unit (PIU) NAIP now inviteseligible consultants toindicate their interest in providing the services. Interested consultant must provide the followinginformation indicating that they are qualified to perform the services: a. Company profile withorganization setup and details of experiences. b. Core business of the firm andnumber of years in business. c. General qualification andnumber of professional staff. d. Experience showing the handlingof Impact Evaluation Studies of developmental projects. 4. A consultant will be selected in accordance with theprocedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers May 2004revised October 2006. 5. Interested consultants may obtain further information at theaddress given below on any working days from 1000 to 1700 hours. 6. Expressionof Interest must be submittedto the address given below by 05.09.2011 till 1600 hours. Kumar Rajesh Under Secretary Project Implementation Unit (NAIP) 5th FloorKAB-II Pusa Campus New Delhi-110012 India Telefax:++91-11-2584 1473 Fax ++91-11-2584 3403 Email:kumarrajesh@icar.org.in

column4: Establishment Operation Maintenance Of Mpls Network (national Agricultural Bioinformatics Grid) Under National Agriculture Innovation Project In Icar At Iasri New Delhi.
column12: Project Implementation Unit (PIU) KAB-II Pusa Campus
column18: SPECIFIC PROCUREMENT NOTICE Country : India Name of Project : National Agricultural Innovation Project(NAIP) Sector : AgricultureExtension andResearch Brief Description of Goods : Establishment Operation Maintenance of MPLS Network(National Agricultural Bioinformatics Grid) under National Agriculture Innovation Project in ICARat IASRI NewDelhi. Credit No. : 4161-IN and4162-IN Project ID No. : P 092735 Bid No. : 36(26)/2012- CPS The Government of India hasreceived financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the National Agricultural Innovation Project and it intends to applypart of the proceeds toward payments under the contract for Establishment Operation Maintenance of MPLS Network (NationalAgricultural Bioinformatics Grid) under National AgricultureInnovation Project in ICAR at IASRI New Delhi. The Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute(IASRI) (Indian Council of Agricultural Research) New Delhi India now invites sealed bids from eligible bidders forEstablishment Operation Maintenance of MPLS Network (National Agricultural Bioinformatics Grid) under National AgricultureInnovation Project in ICARat IASRI New Delhi as per the following details: Briefdescription Bid Security Amount in INRor its equivalent in a freely convertible currency. Establishment Operation Maintenance of MPLS Network under "National Agricultural Bioinformatics Grid inICAR" for three years at six different locations i.e. IASRI New Delhi NBPGR New Delhi NBAGR Karnal NBFGR Lucknow NBAIM Mau andNBAII Bangalore under "National Agricultural Bioinformatics Grid in ICAR" at IASRI New Delhi 1200000 (1.2 Millions INR) Bidding will beconducted using theInternational Competitive Bidding (ICB) procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDACredits edition of May 2004 revised 2006 and is open to all Bidders from eligible source countries as defined in these Guidelines that meet thefollowing minimum qualificationcriteria: Establishment Operation Maintenance of MPLS Network under "NationalAgricultural Bioinformatics Grid in ICAR" at IASRI New Delhi Establishment Operation Maintenance of MPLS Network under "NationalAgricultural Bioinformatics Grid in ICAR" at IASRI New Delhi S. No. QualificationCriteria 1 The bidder should have 50 crore turnover in each last three Financial Yearsending on 31.03.2012. 2 The bidder should have at least 200MPLS PoPs. 3 The bidder should have in similar service (MPLS VPN) in last 3 Years. 4 The bidder should have National Long Distance License (NLD) /UASL or othervalid license to offer MPLS VPN services in all Indian states and Union territories. 5 The bidder should delivered MPLS VPN Services in at least 15 states in India. 6 The bidder should have delivered and working with MPLS VPN network of minimum1000 links. 7 The bidder should have minimum 2 NOCs in different seismic zones in India withat least 100 engineers each. At least one NOC should be DoT certified. 8 The bidder should have ISO-27000 ISO 9001 and ISO 20000 certificates. Interested eligible Bidders may obtain furtherinformation from Assistant AdministrativeOfficerEmail: cps@iasri.res.in and inspect the bidding documents at the address given below from September 17 2012 between 10.00 AM to 4.00 PM on all working days. A complete set ofBidding Documents in English may bepurchased by interested bidders on the submission of a written application to the address belowand upon payment of a non refundable fee ofIndian Rupees 5000/- or US$ 100 in the form of a Demand Draft/Bankers cheque in favourof "Director IASRI" payable at New Delhi from September 17 2012 to November20 2012. Bidding documentrequested by mail will be dispatched by courier on payment of an extra amount of Indian Rupees 1000/-for domestic bidders and US$50 for overseas bidder. IASRI New Delhi India will not be held responsible for postaldelay if any in the delivery of document or non-receipt of the same. Alternatively the bidders may visit IASRIs website www.iasri.res.in and/orNAIPs website www.naip.icar.org.in for more information and/or download thebid document. Thecost of bid document may be submitted along with the bid beforeopening. Please note that in case of any discrepancy between the documents downloaded by the prospective bidder and theBidding Documents (hard copy) of IASRI New Delhi India the later shall prevail. Apre-bid meeting with potential bidders will be held on October 222012 at 11.00 A.M. Room Number 106Training-cum-Administration Block of the institute. Bids must be delivered to theaddress below at or before November 21 2012 11.00 A.M.. All bids must be accompanied by a bid security amount indicatedabove and in bidding documents or an equivalent amount in a freely convertible currency. Late bids will be rejected. Bids will beopened in the presence of the Bidders representatives who choose to attend at the address below at November 21 2012 11.30A.M. The attention of prospectiveBidders is drawn to (i) the fact that they will be required to certify in their bids that all software is either covered by a validlicense or was produced by the Bidder and (ii) that violations are considered fraud which can result in ineligibility to beawarded World Bank-financed contracts. Some of critical qualification criteria are: S. No. Qualification criteria 1 The domestic bidders should be companies registered in India under the Company Act 1956 since last 5 years. Similarly theforeign bidders should be registered under the relevant Act prevailing in their country since last five yearsand the bidder shouldhave an office in India. 2 Bidder or its JV partner should be an established online solution providing company should have successfully executedtwo assignments of similar nature during the last four financial years (supply and installation of Computer Hardware and/orServerscomprising ofat least 1000 peripherals and Conducting Online cum Computer Based Test Examinations ofwhich at least one assignment should be ofRs. 300 Lakhs or more) 3 The Bidder or its JV Partner must have on its roll at least 50 technically qualified professionals in Networking SystemSystem Integration Programmers Project Management Professionals and prior experience in conducting Online CumComputer Based Test(CBT) Examinations and System Integration. 4 The bidder should have turnover of at least Rs. 100 crores per year for last 3Financial Years ending on 31.03.2011. Sharma Deputy Director(Finance) & Controller (Online Examination) Email:asrb.online@gmail.com and inspect the biddingdocuments at the address given below from 25th August 2011 between 10.00 AM to 4.00 PM on all workingdays. column2: IN: Integrated Coastal Zone Mgmt Project
column4: Consultancy For Collection And Processing Of Primary Data In Connection With Theregional Coastal Process Study
column12: Address 108Suryanagar
column18: The Last date of receipt of EoI : "Consultancy for PrimaryData Collection to be applied in Regional Coastal Process Study under Integrated CoastalZone Management Project " is rescheduled as below. Expression of Interest may now be delivered to the address belowby no later than : 5 PM on June 21 2011. All other terms andcondition of the Request for Expression of interest for the above mentioned consultancy remain unaltered. Clarification may be sought from the Contact Person(As indetailed EoI) between 10 AM and 5 PM on all working days. =============================================================== Request for Expression ofInterest Consultancy for Collection and processing of Primary Data in connection with the Regional Coastal Process Study under Integrated Coastal Zone Management Project Orissa EoI. No. 13- ICZMP-Orissa /2011-12 Date: May 24 2011 1. TheGovernment of India (hereinafter called "Borrower") has received a credit from the International Development Association(IDA) (hereinafter called "loan") toward the cost of Integrated Coastal Zone Management Project (ICZMP) in Orissa and intends toapply a portion of thefunds to eligible payments under this Contract for which this Expression of Interest is issued. 2. The projectobjective is to coordinate the initiatives of various coastal economic sectors towards long term optimal socio-economic outcomesincluding resolution of conflicts between sectors and mediating beneficial tradeoffs through an integrated approach for bettergovernance and management of coastal recourses. 3. Theobjective of this Consultancy would be to carry out: To collectprimary data on energy (wave tide etc.) geomorphology & sediment to provide general but comprehensive cover of the Orissacoast as a part of the Regional Coastal Process Study. 4. The broadscope of work to be carried out by the selected consultant will be; Assessment of the coastal geomorphology of the Staterequiring information where one source of such information is from primary data collection in the field based on the sedimentcell. Primary data acquisition is to focus on developing a comprehensive data base covering the entire coastal area of Orissaincluding other geomorphological interaction estuary inlets and sections of coasts of adjoining states that will inform aconceptual model of the coastal geomorphology. Three attributes be covered under the study for generation ofprimarydata are; Energy (e.g. waves tide etc.) Sediments (e.g. distribution of major types; grain size analysis; suspended sediment concentrations) Landforms and associated ecological zones (e.g. morphology of the open coast shore and sea bed;estuarine intertidal and sub-tidal morphology; supra-tidal and delta depositional morphology). 4. Theconsultants/ firm/institutions will specify organise procureand deploy such equipment as is necessary for the measurement ofthese attributes. The consultants/ firm/institutions will record the necessarymeasurements using such equipment in a format that will conform to the Data Base to be set up specifically for the ICZMProject. The totalduration of the assignment will be 42 (Forty-two ) months . 5.ICZMP-Orissa now invites eligible consultants/ firm/institutions to indicate their interest in providing theseServices. Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified to perform the Services [(brochures description of minimum three similar assignments undertaken by the consultant experience in conducting similarstudies list of eqipments available with them which are essential to carry out suchstudies general qualifications and experienceand number of key personnel appropriate for the assignment financial turn over for last three years and so forth).Consultants may associate to enhance their qualifications. The EOI submitted by consultants in association or consortium shouldclearly indicate the name of the lead firm. The "Association" may take the formof a joint venture (with joint and severalliability) or of a sub-consultancy. 6. Aconsultant/ firm/institutions will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: SelectionandEmployment of Consultants by Bank Borrowers May 2004 Revised October 2006 and May 2010. 7. InterestedConsultants may obtain further information from the Contact Person between 10 AM And 5 PM on all working days . 8. Expressionof Interest must be delivered to the address below by no later than 5PM on June 10 2011. Office name : Integrated Coastal Zone Management SocietyOrissa Officers name : H.K. Bisht IFS Additional Project DirectorICZMP-Orissa Address108Suryanagar Bhubaneswar Orissa India Pin 751 003. Email- apd_operations@iczmpodisha.org Contact Person : Er. Manoj Mohanty ProcurementOfficer Telephone Number : 0674-2397920/30 Fax- 0674- 2397965 Email: procurement@iczmpodisha.org Website: iczmpodisha.org

column4: Wbr 5-pkg A-detailed Survey & Rehab/moderniza.n Design Of Irriga.n & Drainage Infras Associated With Lowerganga Canal (lgc) Sys. Comprising Commands Of Lower Ganga Canal (lgc)parallel Lower Ganga Canal (plgc)farukkhabad Branch (fb)& Bewar Branch (bb)
column12: Irrigation Colony
column18: INDIA - Uttar Pradesh Water Sector Restructuring Project Phase II Request for Expressionof Interest [REOI] For Survey and Rehabilitation/Modernization Design of Irrigation and DrainageInfrastructure in Lower Ganga Canal System ? Lower Ganga Canal(LGC) Parallel Lower Ganga Canal (PLGC) Farrukhabad Branch (FB)andBewar Branch (BB) Package A Project ID :P122770 1. The Government of Uttar Pradesh/Government of Indiaintends to apply for a Credit/Loan from the International Development Association/International Bank for Reconstruction andDevelopment and intends to apply part of the proceeds to appoint a consulting firm to undertake detailed Survey andRehabilitation/Modernization Design of Irrigation and Drainage Infrastructure associated with the Lower Ganga Canal System (LGCSystem) comprising the commands of Lower Ganga Canal (LGC) Parallel Lower Ganga Canal(PLGC) Farukkhabad Branch (FB) and Bewar Branch (BB). 2. The scopeof the services would include (i) the preparation ofprecise Topographic and Cadastral maps of the commands and detailedLongitudinal and Cross-section data of LGC PLGC FB BB and all Distributaries and Minors associated with these systems and (ii)the preparation of designs for Rehabilitation/Modernization of Irrigation and Drainage infrastructure including constructiondrawings cost estimates Economic and Financial analysis and bidding documents. The consultant is expected to use latesttechniques in Surveys and Designs and suggest the least cost solutions to achieve the objective of optimal use of available waterin the system. The duration of the consultancy is expected to be 30 months. The total command area is estimated to be 160000 hawith LGC and PLGC having a total length of about 190 km and a design discharge capacities of 8500 cusecs and 8900 (present designdischarge capacity 4200) cusecs respectively. 3. The Superintending Engineer Irrigation Works CircleAligarh invites eligible Consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Consultancy Services for the above assignment. 4. Interested Consultants must provide the followinginformation indicating that they are qualified to performthe Services: Brochures Description of Similar Assignments Availabilityof Skills among Staff including but not limited to Survey Specialists with experience in Modern Surveying Techniques IrrigationDesignSpecialists and Specialists in Modern Canal Instrumentation and Operation. 5. Consultants may associate to enhance theirqualifications. [The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of asub-consultancy] and this should be stated clearly in the submission. 6. The criteria for short listing of theConsulting firmsshall be as follows: The firms should havebeen in business for at least fifteen (15) years in Survey and Designof large Irrigation System withat least three International assignments of similar nature. Should have at least three (3) similar experience during the last seven (7) years in Canal Cross-section Surveys includingSurvey works in running canals and three (3) similar experience in Rehabilitation/Modernization/automation Design of Irrigationinfrastructure of large systems. Should have design expertise in canal automation. Shall be financially sound with an average annual turnover of more than INR 200000000 (US$ 4000000) during the last five (5) years (2007-08 to 2011-12); and  Availability of skillsmentioned above among core staff of the firm 7. A consultant will be selected in accordance withQuality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) procedures set out in the World Banks"Guidelines: Selection andEmployment of Consultants Under IBRD Loans and IDACredits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers- January 2011". The Guidelines are available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 8. Interested Consultants may obtain further informationat the address given below from 10.00 ? 17.00 hours (IST) on all working days. This notice for Expression of Interest has also beenposted on UPID website http://irrigation.up.nic.in/project.htm 9. Expression of Interest with all relevant informationand documents must be submitted and subscribed "Expression of Interest for Survey andDesign Consultancy for the LGC System Comprising the Irrigation and Drainage Infrastructure of the Commands of LGC PLGC FB andBB" on top of a closed envelope and be delivered to the address below by not later than 15:00 hours (IST) on Monday December03 2012. In the event this last date beingdeclared as holiday by the StateGovernment due date for submission of above EoI will be the next working day up till the same appointed time. Hari Mohan Singhal Superintending Engineer Irrigation Works Circle Irrigation Colony Aligarh Uttar Pradesh 202001 INDIA Phone: 0571 2700392 Telefax : + 91 571 2700392 E-mail: hmsinghal@gmail.com Website :http://irrigation.up.nic.in/project.htm

column4: Hiring Of Financial Planning And Advisor To Facilitate Private Sector Financing And Domestic Borrowing.
column12: Regd. Office: No. 16/J 1st Floor Miller Tank Bed Area Thimmaiah Road Cross Bangalore.560 052 Karnataka India.
column18: KARNATAKA ROAD DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION LIMITED GOVERNMENT OF KARNATAKA Country : Karnataka India. Name of the Project : Karnataka State Highway Improvement Project II Sector : Road. Consulting Services : Financial Planning and Advisory (FPA) Services. Hiring of Financial Planning and advisor to facilitateprivate sector financing and domestic borrowing. Loan No. /Credit No./TF No./Grant No.: Project ID No.: P 107649 REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTANT SERVICES) The Government of Karnataka has received financial assistance from the World Bank toward the cost of the Karnataka State HighwayImprovement Project II and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consultant services for hiring a financial planning andadvisory services to support the Karnataka Road Development Corporation Limited (KRDCL). The consultancy services include: a. Preparation of Financial Policies for the KRDCL Medium-term Financial Plan (MTFP) for the development and maintenance of theKRDCL portions of the Core Road Network (CRN). b. Preparation of details MTFP (2011-12 through 2015-2016) clearly delineating the alternate sources and uses of funds including private financing domestic borrowing and multilateral financing. c. Transaction services for any capital raised by KRDCL for the development of CRN. d. Advisory support to KRDCL during the procurement of PPP projects on "as needed" basis. e. Assistance for getting credit rating for KRDCLs bond issues and borrowing if required. f. Assess procurement options for toll collection on completed CRN roads (BOT Annuity Modified BOT Annuity or EPC contracted roads). g. Provide capacity building and corporate governance improvement support to KRDCL The assignment could last approximately 24 months for a total of 100 professional man-months. The Karnataka Road Development Corporation Limited now invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing the services. Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified to perform the services (brochures description of similar assignments experience in similar conditions availability of appropriate skills among staff etc.). Consultants may associate to enhance their qualifications. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the Quality and Costbased Selection (QCBS) procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (current edition). Interested consultants may obtain further information at the address below during office hours 1000 hours to 1730 hours. Expressions of interest must be delivered to the address below before5.00 pm on 16-08-2011 The Managing Director Karnataka Road Development Corporation Limited Regd. Office: No. 16/J 1st Floor Miller Tank Bed Area Thimmaiah Road Cross Bangalore. 560 052 Karnataka India. Tel: +91 80 2238 2362 +91 80 2238 0142. Fax: +91 80 2238 2360. e-mail: cekrdcl@gmail.com. Web site: http://www.krdcl.in

column2: IN:Karnataka State Highway Improv Pro II
column4: Consulting Services Forcapacity Building In Road Safety Management
column12: Karnataka State Highways Improvement Project
column18: Second Karnataka State Highways Improvement Project Request for Expressions of Interest Consulting Services for Capacity Building in RoadSafety Management The Government ofKarnataka (GoK) has applied for a loan from the International Bank forReconstruction and Development (IBRD) for an amount of US $350 million towards the cost of the Karnataka State Highways ImprovementProject-II (KSHIP-II) aimed at improving thestates major road infrastructure and the institutional capacities available to the GoKfor management of the roads sector. The new KSHIP-II will be managed primarily by the GoKPublic Works Department through its Project Implementation Unit (PIU). In recent years the road safety situation in Karnataka has become a major concern and the stategovernment has committed itself to taking measures to inter alia establish a moreeffective framework of functions and capacity for road safety management. In particularthe GoK has appointed the Transport Department as thelead GoK agency for road safety charged with leading the GoK engagement ofKarnatakas substantial road safety challenges and responsibilities more effectively in a comprehensive multi-sectoral andstrategic manner. In that context the GoK intends to applypart of the proceeds of the IBRD loan to payments for consulting services required to assist the GoK Transport Department to develop and operationalize a sustainable and effectivecombination of institutional arrangements functions staffing and other resources largely centered on the Departmentsnew Traffic & Road Safety Cell (TRSC) as determinednecessary to fulfill the Departments lead agency role in road safety management forKarnataka. The required consulting services shall be of twenty four (24) monthsduration and shall assistthe Transport Department and the TRSC in: 1) Developing the organizationfunctioning and capacity of the TRSC 2) Implementing an ongoing Trainingand skills development program 3) Establishing a dedicatedMonitoring & Evaluation capability 4) Undertaking an internationalStudy Tour to observe relevant examples of road safety management best practice 5) Surveying and advising onstrengthening of relevant state-level legislation statutes regulations; and 6) Planning and managing theimplementation of the KSHIP-II funded Safe Corridors Demonstration (pilot) Program (SCDP). 7) Initiating new formsof public promotion communications andreporting on Road Safety mattersin the state as determined in consultation with the KSHTTA. 8) Facilitating the initiation of dedicatedstate-level funding for RoadSafety programs. The selected Consultant(s) will be expectedto field a suitably-qualified multi-disciplinary team of professional and technical personnel covering Road Safety ManagementTraining & H R D Communications & Advocacy Legislation Statutes & RegulationsPublic Information & Communication(Promotion/Advocacy) Monitoring & Evaluation (M&E) Financial Analysis andPlanning(Funds mobilization) headed by a RoadSafety Advisor having relevant international-standard qualifications and extensiveexperience in the implementation of road safety initiatives and reforms in both developing and developed countries. The Project Implementation Unit (PIU) KSHIP-II now inviteseligibleConsultants/Agencies to submit an Expression of Interest (EOI) for the provision of these services. Interested consultants must provide detailed information indicating that they are qualified todischarge the said services. The information shall include details of completed or ongoing services to any Government preferablyin at least one developed country and one Asian country. The EoI should also include information of the company for the last fivecompleted financial years and minimum information are financialsituation (including fee income) experience in similar Advisoryservices references from previous employers and availability of suitable skills/resources. Consultants may associate as jointventure to enhance their qualifications which shall be supported by a written commitment from the associates. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the World Bank Guidelines:Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers latest version of January 2011 based on Quality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) criterion. It is anticipated that requestsfor proposals will be issued in 25 th July 2011. Interested Consultants may obtain further information ifrequired at the address given below from 10.30 to 17.30 hours on working days. The broad TOR is ready and it can be accessed on our website www.kship.org & www.kpwd.gov.inby the prospective consultants. Submission of EOI must be in sealed envelopes clearly marked"Expressions of Interest for Consulting Services for Capacity Building in Road Safety Management for Karnataka State" and deliveredto the addressgiven below by 1600 hours (local time) on 25 th June 2011. The Project Director Project Implementation Unit Karnataka State Highways Improvement Project 1 st Floor PWD Annexe Building K.R. Circle Bangalore # 560 001 Karnataka India. Tel: +91 80 22126758-61 Fax: + 91 80 2222 9666 E-mail: piukship@gmail.com

column18: Karnataka State Highways ImprovementProject-II Public WorksPorts and Inland Water Transport Department Government ofKarnataka India Project ID:P107649 No.PIU/KSHIP/WB/WAEP/CSC/2013-14 Date: 03.03.2014 Request for Expressions ofInterest Hiring Of Construction Supervision ConsultantFor Supervision of ICB Item Rate Contracts of Construction and ContractAdministration The Government ofKarnataka (GoK) has received loan from the International Bank for Reconstructionand Development (IBRD) for an amount of US$350 million towards the cost of improvement of existing State Highways under KarnatakaState Highways Improvement Project-II (KSHIP-II) and intends to apply a portion of the proceeds of this loan to the eligiblepayments under the contract for which this Request for Expression of Interest is being issued. The Government of Karnataka intends to awardconstruction contracts forUpgrading 264 km throughout the State of Karnataka with a construction period as detailed below plus 12months of Defects Notification Period. These contracts will include without limiting to site clearanceearthworks roadreconstruction widening reconstruction or rehabilitation of cross drainage structures/bridges protective workstrafficmanagement including environmental mitigation measures and maintenance. Contracts shall be awarded in a single tranche of three (3) contract packages under International Competitive Bidding (ICB)through e-procurement under the WorldBank guidelines. The Civil Works Contracts are likely to be awarded by September 2014. Brief details of the packages are asbelow: ProjectCode ProjectName ApproxLength in Km constructionperiod (in Months) WAEP 3A Upgradation of the Road from Shimoga (0+000) ?Shikaripura -Anandapuram(Km 82+000) of SH-1 & SH-57. 82.00 32 WAEP 3B Upgradation of the Road from Shikaripura (km0+000) - Anvatti -Hangal(Km71+630) of SH-1. 72.00 29 WAEP 4 Upgradation of the Road from Managuli (Km.0+000) to Devapura (Km109+953) of SH-61 110.00 32 The objectives of the consultancy services are: a) To ensure high quality construction with full compliance to Engineering Designs and DrawingsTechnical Specifications and other ContractDocuments within the specified time schedule. b) To monitor the Pre-construction activities. c) To assist in taking remedial actions to avoid slippages cost overruns delays by thecontractor. d) To demonstrate the efficacy of contract supervision by independent external agencies experienced inthis field of work. e) To ensure safety during construction and adherence to all Environment Management Regulationsprescribed under the Contract. f) To ensure that effective Contract Administration isachieved. The Project Implementation Unit KSHIP II now invites eligible consultantsto indicate their interest in providing theseservices. Interested consultants should provide information demonstrating that theyhave the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the services. Theinformation shall include completed and ongoing Construction Supervision of Upgradation (new construction and widening &strengthening) of roads on National Highways and State Highways in India and abroad such supervision should include experience ofsupervision of Major/Minor Bridge and ROB/RUB Construction. The Expression of Interest should include details of the companysfinancial situation (including fee income) experience in similar works (including details of project with cost) experience ofconstruction supervision as Engineer on externally-funded projects references from previousemployers and staffing resources. All the credentials for the last five completed financial years shall be furnished. The criteria for evaluation would be Number of External Aided Projects carried out Similar Services provided in RoadProjects and also projectswith FIDIC condition of contracts (Independent Engineer Project Management Consultants QualityAssurance and Technical Assistance will not be counted as similar services) Maximum annual fee earned in the past five yearsNumber of key personnel working with the firm RegionalExperience and performance letter issued by variousemployers. Consultants may associate as joint venture to enhance theirqualifications which shall be supported by a written commitment from the associates. However JV shall not have not more than threemembers including lead member. No consultant can submit EoI for this assignment simultaneously as sole consultancy and as a memberof any Joint Venture. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the WorldBank Guidelines: Selection andEmployment of Consultants under IBRD Loans And IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers latest version of January 2011based on Quality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) Method. It is anticipatedthat requests for proposals will be issued in the month of June 2014. InterestedConsultants may obtain further information if required at the address given below from 10.30 to 17.30 hours on all workingdays. The TOR details can be accessed on our website www.kship.in by the prospectiveconsultants. Submission of EOImust be in hard form in sealed envelopes 5 copies clearly marked "Expressions of Interest forConstruction Supervision Consultantsfor the Supervision of Construction and Contract Administration of the Karnataka State Highways Improvement Project-II" anddelivered to the address given below by 1600 hours (local time) on or before 15/04/2014. The Project Director Project Implementation Unit Karnataka State Highways Improvement Project 1 st Floor PWD Annexe Building K.R. Circle Bangalore ? 560 001 Karnataka India. Tel: +91 80 22126758-61 Fax: + 91 80 2222 9666 E-mail: piukship@gmail.com ProjectDirector PIUKSHIP

column4: Pq Package Pkg Kuidfc/kuwsmp/opr-glb/01-operator For Cost Effective And Sustainable Up-scaling Of Continuous (24x7) Pressured Water Supply Its Operation And Management In Gulbarga City Of Karnataka
column10: Karnataka Urban Infrastructure Development and Finance Corporation (KUIDFC)
column12: Silver Jubilee Block 2nd FloorUnity Building Annex3rd Cross Mission Road
column18: SPECIFICPROCUREMENTNOTICE Karnataka Urban Infrastructure Development and Finance Corporation (KUIDFC) Silver Jubilee Block 2nd Floor UnityBuilding Annex 3rd Cross Mission Road Bangalore Karnataka India Request for Qualification (RFQ) (International CompetitiveBidding) (Through e-procurement only) Karnataka Urban Water Supply Modernization Project(KUWSMP) Procurement of Services of Operator for Cost Effective and Sustainable Up-scaling of Continuous (24x7) Pressured WaterSupply its Operation and Management in Gulbarga City of Karnataka India This Request for Qualificationfollows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared in Development Business No. WB118-01/14ofJanuary 9 2014 on-line. The Government of India has applied fora loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction andDevelopment (IBRD) towards the cost of the "Karnataka Urban Water Supply ModernizationProject" and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan to payments for Operator Contract No.KUIDFC/KUWSMP/OPR-GLB/01.The Karnataka Urban Infrastructure Development and Finance Corporation (KUIDFC)intends to prequalify Water companies and/or Consulting Firms for Procurement of Services of Operator for Cost Effective and SustainableUp-scaling of Continuous (24x7) Pressured WaterSupply its Operation and Management in Gulbarga City of KarnatakaIndia. A single contract will be let for the above project. TheServices of Operator under the Contract includes studying existing systems designs developing methodology to scaling up serviceprocurement of contractors for capex and its implementation supervision and Operation and Management of systems developed todeliver desired service levels in Gulbarga. It is expected that Request for Proposals will be issued in first half of 2014. Prequalification will beconducted through InternationalCompetitive Bidding procedures as specified in theWorld Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits January2011 and is open to all bidders from eligible source countries as defined in the guidelines. The Prequalification document is availableonline from January 30 2014 to March21 2014 and the same can be viewed and downloaded by logging on to http://eproc.karnataka.gov.in The Requirements for Foreign Bidder/local bidder Registration can be downloaded from https://www.eproc.karnataka.gov.in Applications for prequalification should be uploaded by. 1700 Hrs on March 21 2014 (as per server time) using theE-procurementportal. For any clarificationsthe Task Manager KUWSMP may be contacted. Managing Director KUIDFC Bangalore

They are also required to pay the stipulated processing fee. Sd/- Project Director & Commissioner KWDP-II(Sujala-III) Project Watershed Development Department Bangalore. ================================================================= REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERICES- FIRMS SELECTION) INDIA KARNATAKA WATERSHED DEVELOPMENT PROJECT (KWDP) ?II Credit Number 5087-IN Assignment Title: Providing Institutional Strengthening Services for KWDP-II Reference No (as per ProcurementPlan dated July 13 2012)- Package No. CON-3 The Government of India/ Government of Karnataka has received financing from the WorldBank toward the cost of Karnataka Watershed Development Project- II and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consultingservices. The consulting services ("the Services") include:  Establish effective working relationship withthe existing IWMP (Integrated WatershedManagement Program) implementation mechanism;  Conduct capacity building training and exposure programs for the project stake holders at the State DistrictandField levels; The complete Terms of Reference for the consultancy services may please be seen in the website: www.watershed.kar.nic.in. The Commissioner Watershed Development Department/Project Director now inviteseligible consulting firms ("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultants shouldprovide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services.Theshort listing criteria are:  Experience (not less than five years) in assessment of training needs capacitybuilding/conducting training for senior level specialists project stake holders for Watershed/Agriculture/Horticulture/Rural WaterSupply and sanitation etc;  Annual financial turnover of not less than Rs100 million in any one of the last three years. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of te WorldBanks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loans andIDACredits & Grants] by World Bank Borrowers- January 2011 ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World BankPolicy on conflict of interest. Consultants may associate with other firms in the formof joint venture or asub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the Quality-and Cost-Based Selection(QCBS) method set out in the Consultant Guidelines. Further information can be obtained at the address below during office hours [1100 to 1600 hours] Expressions of interest super scribed "EOIs for Institutional Strengthening Services to KWDP-II"supported by:  Proof of registration with competent statutory authorities;  Financial Statements;  Details of similar assignments completed;  Certificates of the Clients/Employers and other documents in support of meeting thespecified qualification criteria must be delivered in a written form to the address below (in personor by mail or by fax or bye-mail) by February 212014 Commissioner WDD/Project Director KWDP-II 7 th Floor KHB Complex Cauvery Bhawan KG Road Bangalore 560009 Telephone: (080)- 22248618; Fax: (080)-22129297 Email: sujala3@gmail.com; Website: www.watershed.kar.nic.in.

column4: Selection Of Independent Construction Quality & Surveillance Consultancy For Batch Ibatch Ii & Tribalgrama Panchayaths At Rpmu Kannur Malappuram And Idukki
column10: Kerala Rural Water Supply & Sanitation Agency (KRWSA)
column12: P.T.C Towers 3rd Floor S.S Kovil Road Thampanoor
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST Kerala Rural Water Supply & Sanitation Agency (KRWSA)- JALANIDHI Credit No.: 5027 ? IN Consultancy Services for following three packages of services: (i) Independent Construction Quality Surveillance consultant forBatch I Batch II & Tribal GPs of Jalanidhi-II at RPMUKannur (ii) Independent Construction Quality Surveillance consultant for Batch I Batch II & Tribal GPsof Jalanidhi-II at RPMU Malappuram (iii) Independent Construction Quality Surveillance consultant for Batch I Batch II & Tribal GPs ofJalanidhi-II at RPMU Idukki The Government of Kerala has received financingfrom the World Bank towards the cost of theJalanidhi and intends toapply part of the proceeds for consulting services. The consulting services include engaging an Independent Construction Quality Surveillance consultant (ICQSC) to monitor that the quality ofgoods and works procured are of high standards and of theassured quality resulting in creation of sustainable assets. ICQSC shallensure that the quality assurance of materials is properly documented. KRWSA intends toengage one ICQSC agency per RPMU at Kannur Malappuram and Idukki for Batch I Batch II & TribalGPs. The KeralaRural Water Supply & Sanitation Agency (KRWSA) now invites eligible "Consultants" to indicate their interest in providing theServices. Interested Consultants should provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevantexperience to perform the Services. The shortlisting criteria are: (i) Key personnel Required: The organization shall be ableto demonstrate to have key expertsin the areas of Civil/Public Health Engineering Works with aminimum of 8 yrs experience and in Quality Assurance with a minimum of 3 yrs experience. (ii) A minimum annual turnover of INR 3.50 Crores for any one of the past three years; (iii) Experience inCQMS of water supply schemes and Presence and experience in any state in India. Consultants shall clearly indicate their choice of package mentioned above. If a consultant consider themselves capable forproviding services for all three packages ortwo of the three packages they may state so in their cover letter. If choices are notclearly indicated KRWSA retains the right to assigna qualified Consultant to any particular short list. Consultants may associate with other firms inthe form of a joint venture or a sub consultancy to enhance their qualifications. A Consultant will be selected in accordance withthe Quality and Cost Based Selection method set out in the World Banks Guidelines:Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants] by World BankBorrowers January 2011 World Banks policy on conflict ofinterest as set out in para 1.9 of the guidelines will be applicable. Further information including the draftTerms of Reference can be obtained at www.jalanidhi.kerala.gov.in and from theaddress below during office hours between 10.00 AM till 5.00 PM. Expressions of interest must be delivered in a written form to theaddress below in person or by mail or by fax or by e-mail by 17-2-2014 Attn: Shri.T.Bhaskaran IAS ExecutiveDirector The Kerala Rural Water Supply &Sanitation Agency (KRWSA) P.T.C Towers 3 rd Floor S.S Kovil Road Thampanoor Thiruvananthapuram- 695001 Tel: 0471- 2337002Fax: 0471-2337004 E-mail: dfajalanidhi@gmail.com

column4: General Procurement Notice
column10: KERALA RURAL WATER SUPPLY & SNITATION AGENCY
column12: PTC TOWERS 3RD FLOOR S.S. KOVIL ROAD THAMPANOOR
column18: The Government of India has applied for financing in the amount of US$220M equivalent form the World Bank toward the cost of theKerala Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Project Jalnidhi-II and it itends to apply part of the proceeds to payments for goodsworks related services and consulting services to be procured udner this project. This project will be financed by theINTERNATIOANL DEVELOPMENT AGENCY. The project will include the following components: * Institution Building: This will include financing KRWSAs institutional costs (investment and operations)development and implementation of RWS section communication plan capacity development of KRWSA KWA and support agencies (such asNGOs GP Action Teams); M&E; and TA to sector agencies - mainly KWA. * Technical Assistance: This will mainly include costs of Support Organizations and GP ActionTeams in providingtechnical community mobilizationa dn management support to GPs and Beneficiary Groups (BGs) - in water and sanitationinfrastructure development and in the management of service delivery providing TA to GPs in preparing GP-wide water securityplans. * Infrastructure Development: This will include financing construction of new infrastructure and/orupgradation/rehabilitiation/extension of existing water and sanitation infrastrucutre in about 200 selected GPs. IN addition thiswill include (i) investment support of GPs in the ownership and management transfer of existing single GP schemes to GPs/BGs(currently owned and manage dby Kerala Water Authority or the GPs) and rehabilitating these as needed; (ii) implementing solid andliquid waste management schemes in selected GPs and (iii) construction of five multi GP water supply schemes in collaboration withKWA and in line iwth the DDWS/MoRD GOI guidelines. Procurement of contracts financed by the World Bank will be conductedthrough the procedures as specified in the World BanksGuideliens; Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits (current edition) and is open to all eligible bidders asdefined inthe guidelines. Consulting services will be selected in accordance witht he World Banks Guidelines: Selectionand Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (current edition). Specific procurement notices for contracts to be bid under the World Banks international competitive bidding (ICB) procedures andfor contracts for consultancy service will be announched as they become available in UN Development Business. Interested eligible bidders who wisht o be included ont eh mailing list to receive invitations to prequalify/bid underICB procedures and interested consultants who wish to receive a copy fo advertisement requesting expressions of interest forconsultancy contracts or those requiring additional information should contract the address below. KERALA RURAL WATER SUPPLY & SNITATION AGENCY Attn: ASHOK KUMAR SINGH IAS EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR PTC TOWERS 3RD FLOOR S.S. KOVIL ROAD THAMPANOOR THIRUVANANTHAPURAM KERALA INDIA 695001 Tel: 914712337003 914712337006 Fax: 91471233704 E-mail: pmu@jalanidhi.kerala.gov.in pmujalanidhi@gmail.com Website: www.jalnidhi.kerala.gov.in

A part ofthe credit is intended to be applied to procure the services of Services Providers (NGOs) for Formation of Farmers Groups(Common Interest Groups (CIGs) /Farmer Interest Groups (FIGs) / Producer Groups (PGs) for Crops and Livestock. For convenienceof implementation of above services Fivepackages are considered and packages have been numbered as given in the followingtable. Sr No Package No. Districts 1 Phase-II PackageNo.1 NagpurWardhaGondia Bhandara Chandrapur Gadchiroli 2 Phase-II PackageNo.2 LaturNandedBeedOsmanabadSolapur 3 Phase-III PackageNo.1 NahikDhuleJalgaonNandurbar 4 Phase-III PackageNo.2 SindhudurgRatnagiriRaigadThane 5 Phase-III PackageNo.3 PuneSataraSangliKolhapur 2. The Services include "Providing ConsultancyServices as Service Provider NGOs for Formation of Common Interest Groups (CIGs) / Farmer Interest Groups (FIGs) / Producer Groups(PGs) for Crops and Livestock" for Maharashtra Agricultural Competitiveness Project(MACP) for the period of 15 months. Thebrief description of the services is as under: Objectives of theServices: The overall objective of this assignment is to develop establish viable & sustainable CIGs/FIGs/PGs in project area toundertake various activities such as group based agricultural extension and to work as a member of Producers Association (PA) forbulk purchase of inputs and delivery to individual members; marketing of produce grading primary processing and linkages withmarkets. The specific objectives ofthe assignment are as under: i. Social mobilizationof farmers having common interest around a particulargroup of commodities (viz. grains fruits & vegetables andlivestock). ii. Organizing selectedinterested farmers into groups (CIGs/FIGs/PGs) for efficient andcost effective delivery of extension services. iii. Preparing calendarof training & accordingly train the groups on increasing productivity market led production quality improvement and jointlyorganizing training programs with SP for FCSC on marketing techniques market linkages &agribusiness. iv. Mentoring backstopping and monitoring effectiveness of the CIGs/ FIGs/ PGs on regular basis revising and adapting planning & implementation arrangement to ensuresustainability of groups. v. Grading of groups on the basis of rating tool developed by project & handoverrequisite list of groups of A grade to project. Expected Results of theServices: Sr. No. Deliverables TimeFrame ? Schedule for Completion by the end of months after the date of effectiveness of contract 1 Prepared district wise action plans for formation of the farmers groups (Minimum asper package wise target.) their capacity building & making them sustainable. 2 months 2 Well established CIGs/ FIGs/ PGs registered with ATMA. 6 months 3 Capacity building of all establishedgroups by conducting trainings on dynamic groups& management andmarked led extension. 9 months 4 Capacity building of established groups by conducting trainings on market techniquesmarket linkages & agribusiness jointly organized with SP for FCSC. 12 months 5 Assured sustainability of established groups by linking them with ATMA activities andestablishing market linkages. 15 months The NGOs would be responsible for Mobilization formation establishment capacity building and ensuring sustainabilityof farmers groups CIGs/ FIGs/ PGs. For further detail refer Terms of Reference. 3. The Maharashtra Agricultural Competitiveness Project (MACP) now invites eligible Service Provider NGOs to indicatetheirinterest in providing the Services. Interested Service Providers mustprovide information indicating that they are qualified toperform theservices [brochures description of similar assignments (with detailson client assignment period region staffinvolved budget etc) experience in similar conditions (regional experience & experience on international funded projects)financial details (turnover of lastthree years and other details) availability of appropriate skills among staff(qualification andrelevant experience of the proposed staff) etc.]. Service ProviderNGOs may associatewith other NGOs to enhance their qualifications. [The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (with joint andseveralliabilities)]. 4. The MACP invites eligible NGOs to indicate their interest in providing the servicesseparately for each of the above package. Separate application for each package should be submitted in separate sealed envelopeclearlysuperscripted as "Expression of Interest for Services Provider forFormation of Farmers Groups (Common Interest Groups(CIGs) / Farmer Interest Groups (FIGs) / Producer Groups (PGs) for Crops and Livestockfor the Phase ---- Package No. ------- for --------------- --------------- & --------------- Districts". 5. NGOs should bear in mind that staffing pattern (Team composition) given in TOR isfor each package separately. The NGOs submitting the EOI should note that the NGOs expressing their interest for more than onepackagewill be required to propose separate teams for each package at the time of submission of proposal (if short listed). AlsoNGOs should be in a position to commence the work within a period of two weeks (with the complete team for all districts in apackage) from the date of initiation of contract if selected. 6. A Service Provider NGOs will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by BankBorrowers May 2004 revised Oct 2006 and revised May 2010. 7. Intended Service Provider NGOs can see further details (Drafts of ToR forassignment etc) on websites www.macp.gov.in  and www.mahaagri.nic.in www.msamb.com and may obtain further information at theaddress given below between 1100 to 1700 hrs. 8. Expression of interest in English must be delivered to the address below mentioning the title on the envelope by no later than April 18 2013 upto 17.00 hrs at the address below: Nodal Officer PIU (Agri) MACP. Commissioner Agriculture Maharashtra Agricultural Competitiveness Project(MACP) S. column18: MAHARASHTRA STATE POWER GENERATION COMPANYLIMITEDKORADI THERMAL POWER STATION KORADI SELECTION OFQUALITY ASSURANCE CONSULTANT WITH REFERENCE TO COAL-FIRED GENERATION REHABILITATION PROJECT EXPRESSION OF INTEREST The Government of India (GOI) has received an IBRD loan of US $ 180million and a GEF grant of US $ 45.4 million to implement pilot energy efficient renovation & modernization (EER&M) in select coal-fired units of India. Koradi Unit-6 (210 MW) is one of the units to berehabilitated underthis project. The IBRD loan is intended for the goods supplies andworks to be undertaken and the GEF grant is for technical assistance. The GOI intends to apply part of the proceeds for technicalassistance for consultant services. The services will include quality assurance support. A project design study for Koradi Unit-6has already been done with a view to improve the heat rate and efficiency of the Plant. The residual life of the plant is to beextended by further 20 years with special emphasis on meeting requirements of environmental and safety standards. The Invitationfor Bids (IFB) for calling International Competitive Bidding(ICB) for tendering of the largest supply-and-installation contract(boiler-turbine-generator) for upgrading the plant capacity availability and reliable operation is already published. Other contracts will cover coal handling ash handling and electrical equipment. In order to ensure that R&M worksfor Koradi under contracts as listed above are executed as per plans and there is no compromise in quality of supplies and worksit is proposed to utilize the services of a Quality Assurance Consultant. The Consultantwould have a complete organization set up and experienced and qualified engineers to undertake the specified work. The Consultant shall alert the owner in case of any lapses on the part of the manufacturerduring the manufacturing and installation process by reporting the deviations notice quality lapses at manufacturingworks andinstallation with a recommendation for acceptance / rejection / repairs. The Quality Assurance Consultant will act as MSPGCLs engineer and validate QualityAssurance Plans for material supplies and works execution under the above mentioned contracts. The Consultant should be able toprovide services in respect of quality for implementation of the R&M scheme to improve the energy efficiency and upgrade thecapacityand residual life of the unit. The Maharashtra State Power Generation Company Limited(MSPGCL) now invites consultants to indicate their interest in providing services. Interested consultants must provide informationthat they are qualifiedto perform the services (brochure description of similar assignments experience on similar plants andavailability of appropriate skillsamong staff). Consultants may associate to enhance their qualification. The Quality Assurance Consultant will be selected in accordance withprocedures as per World Bank guidelines: "Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers" May 2004 and revisedOctober 2006and May 2010. Interested consultants may obtain further information at the address below from10.00 AM to 5.00 PM on any business day. Expression of Interest must be delivered to the address below by15/06/2011 MAHARASHTRA STATE POWER GENERATION COMPANY LIMITED Attn.: Shri L.N.Margade Chief Engineer (O&M) Koradi Postal Address: Urja Bhavan Koradi Thermal Power Station Koradi Dist.Nagpur Maharashtra State. India. Postal code:# 441111 Tel.(91) 07109 # 262157 262141 to 262146 FAX: (91) 07109 # 262127 E-Mail: cegenkoradi@mahagenco.in Sd/- CHIEF ENGINEER(O&M)

column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST MAHARASHTRA STATE RURAL LIVELIHOODS MISSION(MSRLM) Rural Development AND WATER CONSERVATION DEPARTMENT Government ofMaharashtra procurement of Consultancy services FOR Tracking Survey for the Maharashtra State Rural Livelihoods Mission under the National rurallivelihoodsproject (nRLP) National Rural Livelihoods Mission (NRLM) is an ambitious mission mode programme launched byMinistry of Rural Development Government of India for eradication of rural poverty. Maharashtra State Rural Livelihoods Mission is established to implement National Rural Livelihoods Mission. A special component under National Rural Livelihoods Mission is National Rural LivelihoodsProject (NRLP) which is funded jointly by Government of India International Development Association (IDA) International Bank forReconstruction and Development (IBRD) and the Government of Maharashtra. NationalRural Livelihoods Mission aims at creating efficient and effective institutional platforms of the rural poor enabling them toincrease household income through sustainable livelihood enhancements and improved access to financial and public services. Maharashtra State Rural Livelihoods Mission intends to apply a portion of the proceedsto make payments under the contract for the followingservices: Consultancy services for Tracking Survey for MSRLM under NRLP TheMaharashtra State Rural Livelihoods Mission now invites eligible consulting firms to indicate their interest in providing the abovementioned services. A consulting firm will be selected in accordance with theprocedures set out in the National Rural Livelihoods Mission Procurement Manual which follows the Selection and Employment ofConsultants [under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants] by World Bank Borrowers "Consultants Selection Guidelines of theWorld Bank dated January 2011" ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict of interest. " The Guidelines are available at www.worldbank.org/procure". Interested consulting firms may submit "Expressionof Interest" in a sealed envelop clearly superscripted as Expression of Interest for "Consultancy services for Tracking Survey forMSRLM under NRLP". They may obtainfurther information about Terms of Reference and therequirements andprocedures for submitting the Expression of Interest at http://www.maharashtra.gov.inhttp://www.mahashg.com/NRLMAdv.html http://aajeevika.gov.in ConsultingFirms may associate other consulting firms to complement their respective areas of qualifications/expertise such that the agencycan deliver the required management support to Maharashtra State Rural Livelihoods Mission. Expressions ofInterest must be delivered to the address belowby November 15 2013 before 17.00 Hrs (IST). Mr. Shravan Hardikar Chief Executive Officer Maharashtra State Rural Livelihoods Mission (MSRLM) Office No. 101 & 102 Monarch Plaza PlotNo. 56 Sector 11 Belapur Navi Mumbai Maharashtra 400614 INDIA Phone : +91 22 27562554/52 Email : ceo.msrlm@gmail.com
