column4: Design And Implementation Of Technology Centre Systems Programme [tcsp]
column12: Office of Development CommissionerMicro Small & Medium Enterprise (MSME)Room No 723 (A) ?A? Wing7thFloor Nirman BhavanMaulan
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONOF INTEREST (REOI) (CONSULTING SERVICES ?FIRMS SELECTION) Country -India Project Title ? Technology Centre Systems Programme (TCSP) ? Enhancing the GlobalCompetitiveness of MSMEs Loan No. P145502 Assignment Title: Design and Implementation of TCSP. The Ministry of MSME Government of India through the Office ofthe Development Commissioner Ministry of Micro Small and Medium Enterprises (hereby referred as O/o DC MSME) intends to apply fora USD 200mn World Bankloan for the Technology Centre Systems Programme (TCSP) for a total Project size of USD 400 million andintends to apply part of the proceeds for consulting services The Programme will consist in upgrading the existing 18 Technology Centres (TCs) -also referred to as Tool Roomsand Technology Development Centres - and establishing up to fifteen new TCs. The TCsare to be located in various parts of the Country and cater to the needs of small and medium firms in the field of trainingcomponent designing rapid prototyping etc. For full details please visit http://dcmsme.gov.in/Toolroom_tdcs.htm. 2. For the success of the project the Government proposes to engage the services of a professional consulting firm fordesigning the project undertaking pre-project activities and providing implementation support during the course of theproject. The overall magnitude of the effort is expected to be in excess of onethousand manmonths in two phases over a six year period. 3. During the course of the proposed project it is also proposed to engage Technology Partners relating to subject matterfields such as Tooling ESDM Footwear Flavors & Fragrances Glass Industry etc. Subsequent to the launch of the project at the locations of existing as well as new Technology Centres it is also proposedto establish Cluster Network Managers who can create and manage an eco-system built around such Technology Centres linking up thedemand and supply for technology and skills development ? in particular existing and future entrepreneurs training and research institutions as well as academia. 4. It is the intent of the Government to appoint a professional consulting firm who shall perform the followingservices:- Programme Design and PreparationActivities i.e. (a) designing of this Programme. (b) conducting the start-up activities for launching ofthis Programme. The designing of this Programme will entail: (i) conduct an in-depth assessment of the Technology andSkillDevelopment needs of the selected sectors and articulate the development objective for the Programme (ii) identify global and domestic leading practices with respect to meeting theTechnology and Skill Development needs and evaluate relevant successful (and unsuccessful) cases (iii) develop the social and environmental frameworks in undertaking the upgrade and expansionactivities (concurrent to Programme designing) (iv) develop the Monitoring & Evaluation (M&E) framework for the Programme provide thebaselines and design a robust Management Information System (MIS) (v) prepare the Detailed Project Report (DPR) (including Economic Analysis)for presentation to World Bank Board and (vi) assist the O/oDC MSME with and during the World Bank Appraisal Mission. (vii) assist the O/o DC MSME in presentation oftheDPR to the World Bank and prepare the Implementation Operational Manual. The duration of this activity is likely to be four months till thecompletion of Activity (vi) and two more months for Activity (vii). 5. Upon the approval of the Programme by the World Bank Board the consultancy firmshall be expected to provide implementation support for manning of the Programme Management Unit anchored in the O/o DC MSME. This phase would consist of but not be limited to the followingactivities:- (i) Procurement of Long Term Technology Partner/s and Cluster NetworkManager/s. (ii) Procurement Management. (iii) Coordination & Monitoring of the construction works. (iv) Coordination with Technology Partner/s and Cluster Network Manager/s for theupgrading/development of TCs and developing ecosystems in geographical / domain clusters. (v) Contract Management. (vi) Monitoring & Evaluation (M&E) reporting requirements as per the guidelines (includingEnvironmental & Social). (vii) Programme completion and handover (including capacity building within the O/o DCMSME). The duration of this phase is likely to be fiveyears. 6. For both phases of the assignment the Government will provide the selected firm with office space within the O/o DC MSME. 7. The Project Concept Document as developed by the Office of the DC (MSME) whichenvisages strengthening of the existing and setting up of new Technology Centres canbe accessed on http://dcmsme.gov.in/MSME_Project_Concept_Note.pdf. The draft ToR for the services theconsultant is expected to provide can be seen at www.dcmsme.gov.in 8. Those who apply for Project Design and Project Management Unit will not be permitted to participate as Technology Partnersor Cluster Network Managers due to conflict of interest of issues. 9. The short listingcriteria are as follows:- Qualifications: (i) The firm mustbe a registered legal entity. (ii) The firm must have an average annual turnover of USD 30 million. fromconsultancy assignmentsin the last 3 years. At least USD 2 million on an averageannually should be from Government consultancy (iii) Experience of working in India ( or countries of similar geographical and economic conditions)for national projects ? meaning that it assisted a Ministry/Department of a Central/Federal Ministry with respect to a Nationalscheme. (iv) Proven experience in the managementof at least 3 large projects in the last 5 years ?Largeprojects meaning projects of more thanUSD 50 million each in size. (v) Experience in procurementand contract management. Experience with WorldBank procedures will be an advantage 10. Consultants may associate with other firms/experts in the form of a jointventure or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications (in particular in the fields of technology and skill development aswell as Engineering Procurement Contract Management). This should beclearly stated in the EOI submission. 11. A Consultantwill be selected in accordance with the Quality Cost Based Selection (QCBS) methodset out in the Consultant Guidelines. 12. The attention of interested Consultants is drawntoparagraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits &Grants] by World Bank Borrowers (January 2011) ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict ofinterest. 13. The WorldBank procurement guidelines may be seen at www.worldbank.org. 14. TheExpression of Interest is herebybeing published to ask the eligible firms to apply/ express their interest by submitting theirapplication along with (a) Organization Profile (as per format provided at Annexure-A)(b) Details of similar Projects executed (as per format provided at Annexure-B notexceeding 1 page per project) and (c) Approach & Methodology proposed for the proposed Project (not exceeding 2 page). 15. Theapplication for EoI must be delivered by 12 th of July2013 (5.00 PM Indian Standard Time) atthe following address: Office of Development Commissioner Micro Small & Medium Enterprise (MSME) R. K.Rai Director (Tool Room) RoomNo 723 (A) A Wing 7 th Floor Nirman Bhawan Maulana Azad Road New Delhi ? 110108 Tel:+91 11 23062561 Fax:+91 11 23061068 Mobile No: +91 9818117168 Email: rk.rai@nic.in 16. Short listed firms wouldsubsequently be issued RFP. No. : Mobileno. : Fax no. : Email id: Postaladdress : (Signature of Authorized signatory) (Signature of Authorized signatory) Annexure B:Consultants Experience [Using the format belowprovide information on at least 3 previous consulting assignments similar to the assignment subject of this solicitation for whichyour consulting firm/organization andthe sub consultants for this assignment were engaged either individually as distinct corporateentities or jointly as members of an association or consortium of corporate entities wherein your consulting firm/organization wasthe lead consultant.] Assignment name: Approx. value of the contract (in currentINR): Country: Location within country: Duration of assignment(months): Name of Client: Total No. of staff-months of theassignment: Contact Person Title/Designation Tel.No./Address: No. of professional staff-months provided by yourconsulting firm/organization or your sub consultants: Nameof associated Consultants ifany: Start date(month/year): Completiondate (month/year): Nameand contact details of senior staff of your consultingfirm/organization involved in the project (e.g. Project Director/Coordinator TeamLeader): Description of Project: Description of Project: Description of actual services and key deliverables provided by your staffwithin the assignment: Description of actual services and key deliverables provided by your staffwithin the assignment:

column18: RURAL WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION PROJECT FOR LOW INCOME STATES(RWSSP-LIS) GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE Country: India Name of theproject: Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Project for Low Income States (RWSSP-LIS) Project ID No. P132173 The Government of India has applied for financing in the amount of US$ 500million equivalent from the World Bank toward the cost of the Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Project for Low IncomeStates (RWSSP-LIS) and it intends to apply part of the proceeds to payments for goods works related services andconsultingservices to be procured under this project. This project will be jointly financed by the Government of India equally tothe tune of US$ 500million. The project will include the followingcomponents; Component A: Capacity and Sector Development: The component allocated 15% of the total project cost willsupport institutional capacity building for implementingmanaging and sustaining the project activities along with IEC monitoring & evaluationand sector development studies to aidpolicy decisions. There will be procurement of small consultingservices contracts mainly under this component. Component B: Infrastructure Development: Thecomponent allocated 80% of the total project costwill comprise construction of new drinking watersupply and sanitation infrastructure along with rehabilitation and augmentation of existing schemes. Themajor procurement under this component will comprise of workscontracts on turnkey basis with some small goods contracts. Component C: Project Management Support (5%):The componentallocated 5% of the total project cost will support implementing agencies establishedunder the project at various levels for efficientprojectmanagement. The procurementunder this component will comprise mainly of small goods and services contracts. Procurement of contracts financed by the WorldBank will be conducted through the procedures as specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDACredits (January 2011) and is open to all eligible bidders as definedin the guidelines. Consulting services will be selectedin accordance with the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (January 2011). Specific procurement notices for contracts tobe bid under the WorldBanks international competitive bidding (ICB) procedures and for contracts for consultancy services will beannounced as they become available in UN Development Business and national & local newspapers. Prequalification of suppliers and contractorswill be required for the following contracts. Not Applicable Interested eligible bidders who wish to be included on the mailing list to receive invitations to prequalify/bid under ICBprocedures and interested consultants who wish to receive a copy of advertisement requesting expressions of interest forconsultancy contracts or those requiring additional information should contact the address below. Ministry of Drinking Water &Sanitation National Project Management Unit(NPMU) Attn: Director(Water) 8 th Floor ParyavaranBhawan CGO Complex LodhiRoad New Delhi - 110003 Tel:+91-11-24360102 Fax: +91-11-24363253 E-mail: sujoy.m@nic.in procurement.npmu@gmail.com Web site:www.mdws.gov.in

column18: BERHAMPUR MUNICIPAL CORPORATION No. 2039//E.ll-111/37/13 Dt. 27/13 Request for Expression of Interest (REol) For Consultancy services for "ProjectManagement Supervision and Quality control Consultancy through Establishment of Project Implementation Unit (PIU)" The BeMCBerhampur under Odisha Disaster RecoveryProject(ODRP) funded by the World Bank requires consultancy services for Project Management Supervision and Quality Control throughEstablishment of Project Implementation Unit at BeMCBerhampur and Project Management Unit at H& U.D.Deptt.Bhubaneswar. The detailed terms andconditions for submission ofREOlare indicated in Draft Terms of Reference and REOlthat shall be available on our web sitewww.berhampur.gov.in with effect from 22-02-2014 Interest consultants are required to submit their REOl with therequired details and supporting documents latest by10-03-2014 up to 4.00 PM at theaddressed mentioned in REOl. Please visitthe website www.berhampur.gov.in for any clarification Municipal Commissioner Berhampur MunicipalCorporation ========================================================= Government of Odisha Ministry of Housing and Urban Development Berhampur Municipal Corporation Request for Expression of Interest(REoI)? India Odisha Disaster Recovery Project (ODRP) Loan No. :P148868 Assignment title: "Consultancy services forProject Management Supervision and Quality control Consultancy through Establishment of Project ImplementationUnit (PIU)" for World Bank funded Project in Berhampur Municipal Corporation(BeMC). Reference No. 2039 /Date : 21.02.2014 The Governmentof India has applied for financing from the World Bank towards cost of Odisha Disaster Recovery Project (ODRP) and intends toapply part of the proceeds for consulting services. Sub-component 2 of the project will finance investments to improve publicservices in Berhampur. Improved public infrastructure will reduce vulnerability through improved drainage to reduce floods andincreasing the resilience of public service infrastructure. The Berhampur Municipal Corporation (BeMC) under the aegis ofDepartment of Housing & Urban Development (H&UD) will be responsible for implementation of theProjects. The consulting services (the Services") shall broadly include providing day to day project implementation support to BeMC andwill be responsible for preparation/review of Detailed Project Reports (DPRs) including technical designs surveys investigationsetc.; tendering bid evaluation contract management; financial management and safeguardcompliance and progress and expensereporting to PMU. Therefore it is expected that the potential consultant should be staffed with multi-disciplinary experts withdeep knowledge and experience in engineering procurement and financial management social and community expertise environmentalspecialist urban planners and MIS specialist etc. Theteam will be based full time in Berhampur. Two members shall be basedinBhubaneswar. A draft Terms of Reference (TOR) is available at www.berhampur.gov.in. The engagement of the finally selected firm shall be for an initial period of 3 years with provision for extension subject tosatisfactory performance. The Municipal Commissioner Berhampur Municipal Corporation (Project Implementing Unit) now invites eligible consulting firms("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the Services. InterestedConsultants should provide informationdemonstrating that they have required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services. The short-listing criteria are: (i) The firm should have prior working experience in establishmentof PIU for any urban infrastructure project with experience ofProject Management Consultancy services for an external aided project. (ii) Consultant should have qualified key personnel experience in implementation of urban infrastructure works working withurban localbodies/. Expressions of Interest (EoI) mustinclude; ? Introduction letteron a letter head ( with complete contact details name of contact person mailing address telephonefax email etc) explaining how the firm is best to deliver the task; ? Organization profile; ? Short note on the similar projects implemented by the firm pertaining to the shortlisting criteria; ? Two years latest annual report including audited Financial Statement; and ? The EOI should contain sufficient supporting documents to substantiate the claim of the Consultant towards their qualificationas per the shortlisting criteria. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants] byWorld Bank Borrowers January 2011("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict of interest. Firms (Consultants) may associate with other firms in the form of a joint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance theirqualifications. The submission should clearly state the nature of Association (JV or sub-consultant). Firms (Consultants) will be selected in accordance with the Quality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) method set out in theConsultants guidelines. Further information can be obtained at the address below during office hours between 1000 hours to 1700 hours. Expressions of interest must be delivered to the address below by 10thMarch 2014. Commissioner Berhampur Municipal Corporation Berhampur Ganjam District Odisha PIN:760002 email: ber_municipality@rediffmail.com Phone:0680-2250290Fax : 0680-2250480 Sd\ 21.01.14 Municipal Commissioner

column4: Support For Operationalizing Challenge Fund
column10: Ministry of Housing and Urban Poverty Alleviation
column12: Government of India Room No 219G Nirman Bhawan Maulana Azad Road
column18: Government ofIndia MINISTRY OF HOUSING AND URBAN POVERTY ALLEVIATION REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST (REOI) (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) INDIA CAPACITY BUILDINGFOR URBAN DEVELOPMENT (CBUD) PROJECT Credit No.:4997-IN Assignment Title: "Support for Operationalizing Challenge Fund" Reference No.: CBUD/CF/102 The Government of India has received financing from the International Development Association (IDA) toward the cost ofthe Capacity Building for Urban Development Project (CBUD) and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consulting services. Thedetails of the required consulting services ("theServices") are available at www.mhupa.gov.in The Ministry of Housing and Urban Poverty Alleviation (MoHUPA) Government of India now invites eligible consultancyfirms (Consultants) to indicate their interest in providing the services of identified professionals for OperationalizingChallenge Fund (CBUD/CF/102). Interested consulting firms should provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications andrelevant experience to perform the Services. The shortlisting criterion is as follows:  Experience in similar nature of assignments  Relevant experienceofworking with Central State and Local governments on programs relatedto urban poverty alleviation and service delivery to urbanpoor  Experience onnetworking and creating partnerships with NGOs CBOs in dealing with Urban Poverty alleviationprograms  Experience ofworking with externally aided projects on programs related to urban poverty alleviation and service delivery to urbanpoor The attention of interested Consultants is drawnto paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants [under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants] by World Bank Borrowers [May 2004 revised in October 2006 and May 2010] ("Consultant Guidelines")setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict of interest. Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a jointventure or a subconsultancy to enhance their qualifications. An agency will be selected in accordance with the Quality and CostBased Selection method set out in the Consultant Guidelines. Further information can be obtained at the address below duringoffice hours [0900 to 1730 hours]. Expressions of interest must be delivered in sealed envelope mentioning "REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST (REOI)for Support forOperationalizing Challenge Fund" On the cover of the envelop to the address below by 15:00 hrs of 13 December 2012. Ms. Alka S.Asthana DirectorRAY Ministry of Housingand Urban Poverty Alleviation Government ofIndia Room No 219G Nirman Bhawan Maulana Azad RoadNew Delhi 110001 Tel: 011-23062279 Website: www.mhupa.gov.in ============================================================ Support for Operationalizing ChallengeFund Under Capacity Building for Urban Development Project (CBUD) BACKGROUND CapacityBuilding for Urban Development (CBUD) Project aims to help in addressing the major constraints to urban development andspecifically focuses on the capacity building requirements for successful urban management and poverty reduction. Themain objective of the project is to assist in the following:  Assist selected states andurban local bodies to operationalize institutionalize urban reform agenda;  Strengthen policyinstitutional reform and improve procedures; and  Improve skills in the areasof governance planning service delivery and municipal financial management. One of the support areas under theproject is aimed at fostering knowledge and information exchange and learning amongst urban local bodies. Establishment ofChallenge Fund for Urban Poverty Alleviation is one of the key tasks to promote the implementation and replication of best practisein the area of urban poverty reduction. Challenge Fund envisages technical and financial support to ULBs for replicating good practices. Thefocus is to encourage ULBs to adopt good practices which have already been recognised elsewhere in the overall context of reformprocess. The Challenge Fund is jointlyproposed under the World Bank supported Capacity Building for Urban Development (CBUD) project and the DFID supported Support toNational Policies for Urban Poverty Reduction (SNPUPR) project. The Challenge Fund will be operational till June2016. Challenge Fund is institutionally positioned as a flagship initiative of theMinistry of Housing and Urban Poverty Alleviation. Human Settlements Management Institute (HSMI) New Delhi has been nominated asthe administrator of the fund. In order to operationalize challengefund HSMI has formed a core Management Unit for overall management of the fund. This core team will effectively manage andsustainthe challenge fund program and implement knowledge management activities and network between participating cities. This CoreManagement Unit will be supported by three professionals with adequate experience and expertise and would be based in the HSMIoffice in Delhi. The Ministry of Housing and UrbanPoverty Alleviation (MoHUPA) Government ofIndia now invites eligible consultancy firms (Consultants) to provide three professionals viz. (i)Urban Specialist (ii) Financial Management Specialist and (iii) Social Development Specialist for providing technical andmanagerial support to the core Unit located at HSMI in management of the Challenge Fund and in realization of its objectives. Theprofessionals will be engaged for three years. These three professionalswill report directly to the Coordinator CF Unit at HSMI for spearheading Challenge Fund implementation.

column18: Government of India Ministry of Road Transport and Highways REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST(REOI) Authoritys Engineer Consultancy Services for Rehabilitation and Upgrading to 2lanes/2 lane with paved shouldersconfiguration and strengthening of Birpur ? Bihpur Section (km 0 to km 106) of NH-106 in the State of Bihar under Phase-I of National Highways Inter-connectivity Improvement Project (NHIIP) Loan No. 8301-IN Package No. NHIIP-BR-AE-106-7 1. The Ministry ofRoad Transport and Highways has applied for a loan from the World Bank in the amount of about US$ 500 Million as a part towards thecost of the Phase-I of National Highways Inter-connectivity Improvement Project and it intends to apply the proceeds of this loanto payments for goods works related services and consulting services to be procured under this NHIIP project. 2. The projectwork consists of rehabilitation and upgrading to 2 lanes/2 lane with paved shoulders configuration of stretches of NationalHighways from single/intermediate lane and strengthening. Civil works related to these projects are proposed to be taken up on itemrate/EPC mode of contract. The project includesperformance basedmaintenance of project roads upon completion of up-gradation for a period of five years which is co-terminus withdefects liability period.Rehabilitation and Upgrading to 2 lanes/2 lane with paved shoulders configuration of Birpur ? Bihpur Section (km 0 to km 106) of NH-106 in the State of Biharis one of the projects under Phase I of NHIIP proposedto be taken up on EPC mode of contract. A briefoverview of the scope of the project is given as under: "The proposed improvement workswill consist mainly concentric i.e. equal widening on both sides; except in somereaches where realignments have been proposed due to geometric improvements considered necessary as per IRC codes; of the existingsingle/intermediate (5.5m) lane to two lanes (7m) followed by 1.5m wide paved shoulders on both sides of the road in the built upsections/earthen shoulders in remaining portions raising the formation level where necessary upgrading/improvement of roadgeometrics pavement strengthening and improving cross drainage structures. The scope of work also includes construction of 2 ROBs construction of 24bridges; reconstruction/new construction of 106 culverts widening of 36 culverts construction of retaining wall construction ofRCC covered drains in built-up areas bus bays & miscellaneous items like road signs road markings etc." 3. The ConsultancyServices forAuthority Engineer will broadly include review of design and drawings quality assurance plan methodology prepared bythe contractor inspection of works pre construction review of manufacturers test reports project monitoring sample quality control check contract management and makingengineering decisions providing advisory services to the client for administering successful and timely implementation of theconstruction contract mentioned in para 2 under EPC mode of construction which is envisaged to be completed in 36 months ofconstruction period plus five years of performance based maintenance which is co-terminus with defects liability period. The detailed scope of work shall be furnished in theRequest for Proposal (RFP) to be provided to the short-listed consultants. 4. The Ministry ofRoad Transport and Highways (MoRTH) now invites eligible consulting firms having proven track record in construction supervision ofsimilar highway works involving modern equipments and construction techniques to submit their Expression of Interest (EoI). Interested consulting firms must provide the followinginformation in the format given in Annexure I: a) Name Address Telephone& Facsimile No. and e-mail id of the consulting firm b) The structure andorganization of the consulting firm including year of registration c) Annual Turnover of theconsulting firm during last five financial years d) List of the similarassignments involving projects of similar nature that have been completed/undertaken in the last five calendar years in any mode ofdelivery such as item rate Engineering Procurement Construction (EPC) Build Operate and Transfer (BOT) and variantsthereof e) Information in respect oftechnical experts/personnel employed/available with the consulting firm f) Availability of infrastructure including Information Technology (IT)capabilities in the consulting firm 4.1 Interested consulting firmsmust fulfill the following criteria: a) The firm (Lead Member in case of JV) should have been operational during last 10 years b) The firm (all members together in case of JV) should have carried out at least 3 similar assignments during last 5years c) The firm (any Member in case of JV) should have worked in the project region/area or similar area during last 5years 5. Consultingfirms may associate with other firms in the form of joint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualification. 6. The consultant will be selected in accordance with Quality and Cost based Selection method set out in the ConsultantGuidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers January2011 "Consultant Guidelines". The attention ofinterested consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Consultant Guidelines setting forth the World Banks policy onconflict of interest. 7. Interestedconsulting firms may refer to E-TENDERING INSTRUCTIONS TO APPLICANTS at Annexure II to this document to obtain further information. 8. Expression ofInterest must be submitted online only at http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH on or before February 5 2014 (up to 13.30 hours IST). Expression of Interest transmitted through any other mode shall not be entertained. The Superintending Engineer (EAP) II Ministry of Road Transportand Highways Jeevan Tara Building Ground Floor 5 Parliament Street New Delhi 110 001 India Telefax : +91 11 23748316 Email : pooran.s@nic.in Annexure I 1. Name Address Telephone & FacsimileNo. and e-mail id of the consulting firm: [Furnish the details as required. Attach certificate of incorporation from Company registrar.] 2. The structure and organization of thefirm: [Give a brief note no more than 2 pages long. Additional documents/printed materials may be attached with properindexing.] 3. Annual Turnoverof the consulting firm during last five financial years: Year Annual Turn Over fromConsultancy Works 1* 2* 3* 4* 5* *Means the number of yearsbefore the financial year in which theEOI is invited. For the avoidance of doubt financial year shall for the purpose mentionedhere above means the accounting year followed bythe applicant in the course of its normal business. For Turn Over figure in currency other than INR the source for determining exchange rate is Reserve Bank Of India. In case Reserve Bank of India does not publish exchange rate for a particularcurrency the exchange rate of International MonetaryFund shall be first used to convert amount in particular currency to US Dollarwhich will be later converted to INR using exchange rate of Reserve Bank of India. Exchange rate prevailing as on October 1 of the concerned year shall beconsidered. 4. List of thesimilar assignments involving projects of similar nature that have been completed/undertaken in the last five calendar years in anymode of delivery such asitem rate Engineering Procurement Construction (EPC) Build Operateand Transfer (BOT) and variantsthereof: Sl. No. Name ofwork Name addresstelephoneno. and e-mail id of client Date ofcommencement Date ofcompletion Payments received duringApril 1 2008 to March 31 2013 Nature of servicesrendered* If the assignmentperformed was in JV share of the applicant *Experience of dealing maintenance works if any maybe mentioned. [Assignments involving completion of civil works upto 90% may only belisted. Certificate from client should be attached.] 5. Availability oftechnical experts/personnel employed/available with the consulting firm: 6. Availability ofinfrastructure including Information Technology (IT) capabilities in the consulting firm: Note: 1. An index should be attached in thebeginning giving page numbers serially. 2. In case adocument is in a languageother than English translation of the saiddocument in English language shall be provided. 3. In case of joint venture details ofeach member should be separately provided. 4. Instructions given as text in squarebracket may be deleted from the submission. AnnexureII E-TENDERING INSTRUCTION TO APPLICANTS 1. Accessing/Purchasing of REOI documents (i) It is mandatory for allthe applicantsto have class-III Digital Signature Certificate (in the name of person who will sign the EOI) from any of thelicensed Certifying Agency (Applicants can see the list of licensed CAs from thelink http://www.cca.gov.in) to participate in this e-tendering of MoRTH. (ii) To participate in this e-tendering itismandatory for the applicants to get registered their firm/joint venture with e-procurement portal of MoRTH http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH to haveuser ID & password which has to be obtained by submitting an annual registration charges of INR 2247/-(inclusive of all taxes)to M/s ITI Ltd. through e-payment gateway ofPunjab National Bank using Credit Card/Debit Card ( Master Card and Visa Card only) ornet banking (Punjab National Bank Account holders only). Validity of online registration is 1 year. (iii) The complete REOI documents can be viewed / downloaded free of costfrom MoRTH portal http://www.morth.nic.in or e-procurement portal of MoRTH http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH. (iv) Submission of EoI can be requestedfrom e-procurement portal of MoRTH i.e. http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH until February 4 2014 (up to17.00 hours IST). For this purpose applicants have to pay INR 2247/- (Rs. TwoThousand Two Hundred Forty Seven only) towards application processing fee (non-refundable) to M/s ITI Ltd. against tenderprocessing fee through e-payment gateway of Punjab National Bank using Credit Card/Debit Card-Master Card and Visa Cardonly. (v) Following may be noted (a) Registration should be valid at leastup to one month after the date of submission of EOI. (b) EOI can be submitted only during thevalidity ofregistration (c) Amendment/clarification to the REOIdocument ifany will be hosted on the MoRTH portal http://www.morth.nic.in ore-procurement portal of MoRTH http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH (d) If the consulting firm/joint ventureis already registered with e-procurement portal of MoRTH NHAI BRO and validity of registration is not expired the consultingfirm/joint venture is not required to do fresh registration. 2. Preparation & Submission of EOI: (i) EOI shall be submitted onlinefollowing the instruction appearing on the screen. A vendor manual containing the detailed guidelines for e-procurement system is also available on e-procurementportal of MoRTH. (ii) The documents comprising of Annexure Ito this REOI document duly filled in and supporting documents there to shall be prepared duly signed manually by the authorizedsignatory and scanned in different files (in PDF or JPEG format such that file size is not more than 5 MB) and uploaded during theonline submission of EOI on or before February 5 2014up to13.30 hours ISTi.e.the EOI submission Due Date. (iii) On submissionof EOI in the e-procurement portal the consulting firm/joint venture will receive an auto-generated acknowledgement no. whichshall be referred to in all future correspondence. 3. Modification/Substitution/Withdrawalof EOI: (i) The applicant may modify substitute or withdraw its EOI any time prior to the EOIsubmission deadline. The e-procurement system ofMORTH will not allow any modification/substitution/withdrawalafter the EOI submission deadline. (ii) For modification of e-tender applicant has to click on update link on e-procurementportal and upload/resubmit modified EOI. (iii) For withdrawal of EOI applicant has to click on withdrawal icon at e-tendering portal of MoRTHand can withdraw its e-tender. (iv) It may specifically be noted that after withdrawal of a EOI for any reason applicantcannot re-submit e-tender again. (v) Modification/Withdrawal of EOI by any other means shall not be considered forevaluation. 4. Late Submission: The e-procurementportal will not allow any submission of EOI after the EOI submission deadline. 5. Opening & Evaluation ofEOI. MoRTH shall open online all the EOIs received inthe e-procurement portal at 14.30 hoursIST on February 5 2014 in the presence of the applicants who choose to attend. MoRTH will subsequently examine andevaluate the EOI.

PDS against Clause 19.1 of ITA shall be read as below: "The opening of the Applications shall be at : Date: August 9 2013 Time: 15.00 hours IST Ministry of Road Transport and Highways Government of India Transport Bhawan No. 1 Parliament Street New Delhi ? 110 001 INDIA" All other terms and conditions stated in REOI vide File No.RW/NH-12013/ 26/6/2010/SP(D/8)/P-9 dated June 14 2013remain unchanged. Superintending Engineer (EAP) I Ministry of Road Transport and Highways Transport Bhawan No. 1 Parliament Street New Delhi 110 001 INDIA **************************************************************************************************** ORIGINAL INVITATION FOR PRE-QUALIFICATION SPECIFIC PROCUREMENT NOTICE Invitation for Prequalification Ministry of Road Transport and Highways Government of India National Highways Inter-connectivity Improvement Projects (NHIIP) Phase-I Rehabilitation and Upgrading to 2 lanes/2 lane with Paved Shoulders Configuration from Single/Intermediate lane andStrengthening of Bhojpur-Chhatabar Section (Km 131to km 192) of NH-200 in theState of Odisha (Package No.NHIIP-OD-200-5) Project ID: P121185 This invitation for prequalification follows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared inDevelopment Business of April 18 2012 on-line. The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways has applied for a loan from the InternationalBank forReconstruction and Development (IBRD) towards the cost of the National Highways Inter-Connectivity ImprovementProjects (NHIIP) and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan to payments under the contract for"Rehabilitation and Upgrading to 2 lanes/2 lane with Paved Shoulders Configuration from Single/Intermediate lane and Strengtheningof Bhojpur-Chhatabar Section (Km 131 to km 192) of NH-200 in the State of Odisha (Package No. NHIIP-OD-200-5)". The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways intends to prequalify contractors and/or firms for thefollowing project road in the first Phase of NHIIP: State NH No. Package Chainage Estimated Cost Completion Time Maintenance Period Odisha 200 (new NH No. partly 49 and partly 53) NHIIP-OD-200-5 Km 131 to km 192 Bhojpur-Chhatabar 185.48 Cr. (US$ 33.72* Million) 24 Months 60 Months from the Date of Completion *1US$=INR 55.00 considered It is expected that invitations for bid will be madein June 2013. Prequalification will be conducted through prequalification procedures specified in the World BanksGuidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits January 2011 and is open to all bidders from eligible sourcecountries as defined in the guidelines. Application for prequalification must be submitted online. A complete set of the prequalification document in English languagecan be viewed/downloaded free of cost from MoRTH portal http://www.morth.nic.in ore-tendering portal of MoRTH http:// HYPERLINK "http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH" www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH from June 14 2013 to July 25.2013(up to 17.00 hours IST). To participate in the e-tendering process the Applicant shall have to obtain Class III Digital Signature Certificate (DSC) inthe name of the person duly authorized to sign on behalf of the Applicant from any of the licensed Certifying Agency (CA)(Applicants can see the list of licensed CA?s from the link http:// HYPERLINK "http://www.cca.gov.in"www.cca.gov.in ). A Foreign Applicant may read the procedure for obtaining DSC from Indian CA at the following link: https://www.tenderwizard.com/ROOTAPP/DataDisplay.jsp?dept=adminmorth . The Applicant shall have to get registered with e-tendering portalof MoRTH http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH and obtain user ID & password bysubmitting an annual registration charges of INR 2247/-(Rs. Two Thousand Two Hundred FortySeven only inclusive of all taxes) to M/s ITI Ltd. through e-payment gateway of Punjab National Bank using Credit Card / Debit Card(Master Card and Visa Card only) or net banking (Punjab National Bank Account holders only). Validity of online registration is 1year. Before requesting Application on e-tendering portal of MoRTH http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH  the Applicant shall pay INR 2247/-(Rs. Two Thousand Two Hundred Forty Seven only) towards application processing fee (non-refundable) to M/s ITI Ltd.against tender processing fee through e-payment gateway of Punjab National Bank using Credit Card/ Debit Card (Master Cardand VisaCard only) or net banking (Punjab National Bank Account holders only). Applications for prequalification must be submitted online only at http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH on or before July 26 2013 (up to 11.00hours IST). Applications for prequalification through any other mode shall not be entertained. column4: Wbr 21-pkg Nhiip-wb-ae-60a-6-authority Engineer Cons Services For Rehab & Upgrading To 2 Lanes/2 Lane With Paved Shoulders Configuration & Strengthening Of Bankura-purulia Section (km 0 To Km 84) Of Nh-60a (new Nh-314) In West Bengal Under Ph 1 Of Nhiip
column10: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways
column12: Jeevan Tara Building Ground Floor5 Parliament Street
column18: Government of India Ministry of Road Transport and Highways REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST(REOI) Authoritys Engineer Consultancy Services for Rehabilitation and Upgrading to 2lanes/2 lane with paved shouldersconfiguration and strengthening of Bankura-Purulia Section (km 0 to km 84) of NH-60A (New NH-314) in the State of WestBengalunder Phase-I ofNational Highways Inter-connectivityImprovement Project (NHIIP) Loan No. 8301-IN Package No. NHIIP-WB-AE-60A-6 1. The Ministry ofRoad Transport and Highways has applied for a loan from the World Bank in the amount of about US$ 500 Million as a part towards thecost of the Phase-I of National Highways Inter-connectivity Improvement Project and it intends to apply the proceeds of this loanto payments for goods works related services and consulting services to be procured under this NHIIP project. 2. The projectwork consists of rehabilitation and upgrading to 2 lanes/2 lane with paved shoulders configuration of stretches of NationalHighways from single/intermediate lane and strengthening. Civil works related to these projects are proposed to be taken up on itemrate/EPC mode of contract. The project includesperformance basedmaintenance of project roads upon completion of up-gradation for a period of five years which is co-terminus withdefects liability period.Rehabilitation and Upgrading to 2 lanes/2 lane with paved shoulders configuration of Bankura-Purulia Section (km 0 to km 84) of NH-60A (New NH-314) in the State of WestBengalis oneof the projectsunder Phase I of NHIIP proposed to be taken up on EPCmode of contract. A brief overview of the scope of the project is given as under: "The proposed improvement works willconsist mainly widening to 2 lanes(7.0 m) with paved shoulders( 1.5 m ) on each side in 88.588km. 2 lane with paved shoulders and drain in 24.042 km. in town portions and 2 lane withpaved shoulders (new carriageway) in raising stretch- in 1.535 km. except in somereaches where realignments have been proposed dueto geometric improvements considered necessary as per IRC codes followed by 1.0 m wide earthen shoulders on both sides of theroad The scope of work also includes repair of one ROB 1 major bridge and 10 minor bridges and construction of new/reconstructionof 7 Minor bridges and widening of 3 minor bridges. 48 culverts (23 Slab 18 HP and 7 Box) are proposed to berepaired 1slabculvert is proposed to be widened and 62 culverts areproposed to be reconstructed (58 box and 4 slab). Besides 20 additional boxculverts are proposed to be newly constructed. Theworks also include improvement of 5 Major junctions and 168 minor junctions with different category of roads and construction of 14Bus bays with Bus shelters and 2 no. truck lay- byes and safety measures such as traffic signs road markings safety barriersetc." 3. The ConsultancyServices forAuthority Engineer will broadly include review of design and drawings quality assurance plan methodology prepared bythe contractor inspection of works pre-construction review of manufacturers test reports project monitoring sample qualitycontrol check contract management and making engineering decisions providing advisory services to the client for administeringsuccessful and timely implementation of theconstruction contract mentioned in para 2 under EPC mode of construction which isenvisaged to be completed in 30 months of construction periodplus five years ofperformance basedmaintenance which is co-terminus with defects liability period. The detailed scope of work shall be furnished in the Request forProposal (RFP) tobe provided to the short-listed consultants. 4. The Ministry ofRoad Transport and Highways (MoRTH) now invites eligible consulting firms having proven track record in construction supervision ofsimilar highway works involving modern equipments and construction techniques to submit their Expression of Interest (EoI).Interested consulting firms must provide the following information in the format given in Annexure I: a) Name Address Telephone& Facsimile No. and e-mail id of the consulting firm b) The structure andorganization of the consulting firm including year of registration c) Annual Turnover of theconsulting firm during last five financial years d) List of the similarassignments involving projects of similar nature that have been completed/undertaken in the last five calendar years in any mode ofdelivery such as item rate Engineering Procurement Construction (EPC) Build Operate and Transfer (BOT) and variantsthereof e) Information in respect oftechnical experts/personnel employed/available with the consulting firm f) Availability of infrastructure including Information Technology (IT)capabilities in the consulting firm 4.1 Interested consulting firmsmust fulfill the following criteria: a) The firm (Lead Member in case of JV) should have been operational during last 10 years b) The firm (all members together in case of JV) should have carried out at least 3 similar assignments during last 5years c) The firm (any Member in case of JV) should have worked in the project region/area or similar area during last 5years 5. Consultingfirms may associate with other firms in the form of joint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualification. 6. The consultant will be selected in accordancewith Quality andCost based Selection method set out in the Consultant Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants underIBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers January 2011 "Consultant Guidelines". The attention of interestedconsultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Consultant Guidelines setting forth the World Banks policy on conflictof interest. 7. Interested consultingfirms may refer to E-TENDERING INSTRUCTIONS TO APPLICANTS at Annexure II to this document to obtain furtherinformation. 8. Expression ofInterest must be submitted online only at http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH on or before February 4 2014 (up to 13.30 hours IST). Expression of Interest transmitted through any other mode shall not be entertained. The Superintending Engineer (EAP) II Ministry of Road Transportand Highways Jeevan Tara Building Ground Floor 5 Parliament Street New Delhi 110 001 India Telefax : +91 11 23748316 Email : pooran.s@nic.in Annexure I 1. Name Address Telephone & FacsimileNo. and e-mail id of the consulting firm: [Furnish the details as required. Attach certificate of incorporation from Company registrar.] 2. The structure and organization of thefirm: [Give a brief note no more than 2 pages long. Additional documents/printed materials may be attached with properindexing.] 3. Annual Turnoverof the consulting firm during last five financial years: Year Annual Turn Over fromConsultancy Works 1* 2* 3* 4* 5* *Means the number of yearsbefore the financial year in which theEOI is invited. For the avoidance of doubt financial year shall for the purpose mentionedhere above means the accounting year followed bythe applicant in the course of its normal business. For Turn Over figure in currency other than INR the source for determining exchange rate is ReserveBank Of India. In case Reserve Bank of India does not publish exchange rate for a particularcurrency the exchange rate of International Monetary Fund shall be first used to convert amount in particular currency to USDollar which will be later converted to INR using exchange rate of Reserve Bank of India. Exchange rate prevailing as on October 1 of theconcerned year shall beconsidered. 4. List of thesimilar assignments involving projects of similar nature that have been completed/undertaken in the last five calendar years in anymode of delivery such asitem rate Engineering Procurement Construction (EPC) Build Operateand Transfer (BOT) and variantsthereof: Sl. No. Name ofwork Name addresstelephoneno. and e-mail id of client Date ofcommencement Date ofcompletion Payments received duringApril 1 2008 to March 31 2013 Nature of servicesrendered* If the assignmentperformed was in JV share of the applicant *Experience of dealing maintenance works if any maybe mentioned. [Assignments involving completion of civil works upto 90% may only belisted. Certificate from client should be attached.] 5. Availability oftechnical experts/personnel employed/available with the consulting firm: 6. Availability ofinfrastructure including Information Technology (IT) capabilities in the consulting firm: Note: 1. An index should be attached in thebeginning giving page numbers serially. 2. In case adocument is in a languageother than English translation of the saiddocument in English language shall be provided. 3. In case of joint venture details ofeach member should be separately provided. 4. Instructions given as text in squarebracket may be deleted from the submission. AnnexureII E-TENDERING INSTRUCTION TO APPLICANTS 1. Accessing/Purchasing of REOI documents (i) It is mandatory for all theapplicants to have class-IIIDigital Signature Certificate (in the name of person who will sign the EOI) from any of the licensed Certifying Agency (Applicantscan see the list of licensed CAs from the link http://www.cca.gov.in ) to participate in this e-tendering of MoRTH. (ii) To participate in this e-tendering itismandatory for the applicants to get registered their firm/joint venture with e-procurement portal of MoRTH http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH to haveuser ID & password which has to be obtained by submitting an annual registration charges of INR 2247/-(inclusive of all taxes)to M/s ITI Ltd. through e-payment gateway ofPunjab National Bank using Credit Card/Debit Card (Master Card and Visa Card only) ornet banking (Punjab National Bank Account holders only). Validity of online registration is 1 year. (iii) The complete REOI documents can be viewed / downloaded free of costfrom MoRTH portal http://www.morth.nic.in or e-procurement portal of MoRTH http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH. (iv) Submission of EoI can be requestedfrom e-procurement portal of MoRTH i.e. http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH until February 3 2014 (up to 17.00 hours IST). For this purpose applicants have to pay INR 2247/- (Rs. Two Thousand TwoHundred Forty Seven only)towards application processing fee (non-refundable) to M/s ITI Ltd. against tender processing fee through e-payment gateway ofPunjab National Bank using Credit Card/Debit Card-MasterCard and Visa Card only. (v) Following may be noted (a) Registration should be valid at least up to one month after the date of submission ofEOI. (b) EOI can be submitted only during the validity of registration (c) Amendment/clarification to the REOI document if any will be hosted on the MoRTHportal http://www.morth.nic.in or e-procurement portal of MoRTH http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH (d) If the consulting firm/joint ventureis already registered with e-procurement portal of MoRTH NHAI BRO and validity of registration is not expired the consulting firm/ joint venture is not required to do fresh registration. 2. Preparation and Submission of EOI: (i) EOI shall be submitted onlinefollowing the instruction appearing on the screen. A vendor manual containing the detailed guidelines for e-procurement system is also available on e-procurementportal of MoRTH (ii) The documents comprising of Annexure Ito this REOI document duly filled in and supporting documents there to shall be prepared duly signed manually by the authorizedsignatory and scanned in different files (in PDF or JPEG format such that file size is not more than 5 MB) and uploaded during theonline submission of EOI on or before February 4 2014up to13.30 hours ISTi.e.the EOI submission Due Date. (iii) On submissionof EOI in the e-procurement portal the consulting firm/joint venture will receive an auto-generated acknowledgement no. whichshall be referred to in all future correspondence. 3. Modification/Substitution/Withdrawalof EOI: (i) The applicant may modify substitute or withdraw its EOI any time prior to the EOI submission deadline. The e-procurement system of MORTH will not allow anymodification/substitution/withdrawal after the EOI submission deadline. (ii) For modification of e-tender applicant has to click on update link on e-procurementportal and upload/resubmit modified EOI. (iii) For withdrawal of EOI applicant has to click on withdrawal icon at e-tendering portal of MoRTHand can withdraw its e-tender. (iv) It may specifically be noted that after withdrawal of a EOI for any reason applicant cannotre-submit e-tender again. (v) Modification/Withdrawal of EOI by any other means shall not be considered forevaluation. 4. Late Submission: The e-procurementportal will not allow any submission of EOI after the EOI submission deadline. 5. Opening & Evaluation of EOI. MoRTH shall open online all the EOIs received inthe e-procurement portal at 15.00 hoursIST on February 4 2014 in the presence of the applicants who choose to attend. MoRTH will subsequently examine andevaluate the EOI.

column4: Package Nhiip-tpa-14-third Party Performance Monitoring And Auditing Of National Highways Interconnectivity Improvement Projects (nhiip)
column10: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways
column12: Jeevan Tara Building Ground Floor5 Parliament Street
column18: Addendum 1 dated April11 2014 The last dateofsubmission of Expressions of Interest [EOI] have been extended from April 4 2014 @ 11 Hours Indian Standard Time [IST] to May 52014 @11 Hours IST. The date of opening of all the EOIs received in the eprocurement portal of MoRTH is rescheduled fromApril 4 2014 @ 14:30 hours IST to May 5 2014 @ 14:30 hours IST. ******* ORIGINALEOI ******* Government of India Ministry of Road Transport and Highways REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OFINTEREST (REOI) Third Party Performance Monitoring and Auditing of NationalHighways Interconnectivity Improvement Projects (NHIIP) Loan No. 8301- IN Package No. NHIIP-TPA-14 F.No.RW/NH-24020/1/2014-EAP 1. The Ministry of Road TransportandHighways (MoRT&H) has applied for a loan from the World Bank in the amount of about US$ 500 milliion towards the cost of thePhase-I ofNational Highways Inter-connectivity Improvement Projects (NHIIP) andit intends to apply the proceeds of this loan topayments for goods works related services and consulting services to be procured under this NHIIP projects. 2. The NHIIP has three components. Component A consists of upgrading of about 1120 km of existing single/intermediate lane National Highways tostandard two-lane configuration. Works contracts for about 400 km of these roads will be item-rate type and the rest 720 kmwill beEPC and all the works contracts will have a 5-year maintenance period post construction. Component B is the Institutional Development Component which envisages enhancementof the institutional capacity of MoRTH to better manage its road network through supporting specific intervention in five areasviz. process improvements network monitoring & management financing governance & accountability and training. Component C will pursue the objective of improving roadsafety through updating Indian standards and regulations related to road safety improving road accident data collection andanalysis at central and state levels through implementation of the Road Accident Database Management System in project statesstrengthening road safety capacity at the central level and training. 3. The Component A of the project consists of rehabilitation and upgrading to 2lanes/2 lane with paved shoulders configuration of 11 stretches of National Highways from single/intermediate lane andstrengthening involving 15 civil works contracts. The works include performance-based maintenance of project roads upon completion of up-gradation for a period offive years which is co-terminus with defects liability period. The table below liststhe details of the 11 road stretches: Sl. No. State NH No. (Old) Section Chainage (km-km) Type of civil works contract 1 Rajasthan 11B Lalsot-Karauli 0.0-85.0 Item rate 2 Rajasthan 113 Pratapgarh-Padi 80.0-100.0 Item rate 3 Bihar 98 Anisabad-Aurangabad-Hariharganj 0.0-62.0 Item rate 62.0-154.625 Bihar 98 Anisabad-Aurangabad-Hariharganj Item rate 4 Odisha 217 Nuapada-BangoMunda 90.0-158.0 Item rate 5 Bihar 30A Fathua-Harnaut-Barh 0.0-69.600 EPC 6 Bihar 106 Birpur-Bihpur 0.0-106.0 EPC 7 Bihar 104 Sheohar-Sitamarhi-Jaynagar-Narhiya 40.0-79.400 EPC 79.400-156.500 Bihar 104 Sheohar-Sitamarhi-Jaynagar-Narhiya EPC 156.500-219.945 Bihar 104 Sheohar-Sitamarhi-Jaynagar-Narhiya EPC 8 Odisha 200 Bhojpur-Chattabar 131.0-192.0 EPC 9 Odisha 201 Navarangpur-Koksara 25.0-80.0 EPC 10 Karnataka 234 Madhugiri-Mudbagal 343.800-400.330 EPC 400.330-483.151 Karnataka 234 Madhugiri-Mudbagal EPC 11 West Bengal 60A Bankura-Purulia 0.0-83.430 EPC At the level of each sub-project consulting firms will be engaged to serve as either supervision consultant (for item-ratecontracts) or Authority Engineer (forEPC contracts) who will be working in close collaborationwith the respective National Highway Division of the State WorksDepartment to ensure that the works and O&M are executed as per the technical specifications and commercial conditionsstipulated under the contract. In addition eachsub-project will have consultants/non-governmental organizations to assist MoRTH in the implementation of the Resettlement ActionPlans (RAPs) and HIV/AIDS strategy/actionplan. 4. The Consultant Services ("The Services")include conducting Third Party Audit as outlined hereafter. MoRTH intends that periodic Performance Monitoringand Auditing are carried out by a third-party to enable the MoRTH and the Bank assess critically the implementation progresseffectiveness and the in-place quality of the projects in view of the issues typically faced by implementing agencies rangingfrom insufficient quality to delays cost overruns and unethical practices. Performance Monitoring and Auditing is required to be carried out for all thecomponents of NHIIP once in every six months for a period of four years. The audit will be comprehensive and include an analysis of the implementationprocess reviewing both the results and activities that have been completed and those in progress. This will include examination of the quality of works executed and servicescarried out implementation of Environmental Management Plan (EMP) and Resettlement Action Plan (RAP) compliance of road andbridge works with the technical specifications and standards described in the contract documents; social and environmentalsafeguards compliance including compliance with statutory processes and regulations periodic verification of employersresponsibility/obligation towards complying with agreed contract schedule for making encumbrance-free land available etc. and therecommendations for improvements in project implementation. The detailed scopeof work shall be furnished in the Request for Proposal (RFP) to be provided to the short-listed consultants. 5. The Ministry ofRoad Transport and Highways (MoRTH) now invites eligible consulting firms bonafide institutions and organizations havingproventrack record in similar audit activities to submit their Expression of Interest (EoI). Interested consulting firms must provide thefollowing information in the format given in Annexure I: a) Name Address Telephone & FacsimileNo. and e-mail id of the consulting firm/institution/organization b) The structure and organization of the consulting firm/institution/organizationincluding year of registration c) Annual Turnover of the consulting firm/institution/organization during last fivefinancial years d) List of the similar assignments involving projects funded by multilateralinstitutions e) Information in respect of technical experts/personnel employed/available with theconsulting firm. f) Availability of infrastructure including InformationTechnology (IT) capabilities in the consulting firm 5.1 Interested consulting firm/institution/organization mustfulfill the following criteria: a) The consulting firm/institution/organization (Lead Member in case ofJV) should have been operational during last 10 years b) The consulting firm/institution/organization (Lead Member in case ofJV) should have carried out at least one similar assignment during last 5 years. 6. Consulting firm/institution/organizationmay associate with other firms in the form of joint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualification. 7. The Third-Party Audit ConsultingFirm (TPAC) will be selected in accordance with Quality and Costbased Selection method set out in the ConsultantGuidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants under IBRDLoans and IDA Credits& Grants by World Bank Borrowers January 2011 "Consultant Guidelines". The attention of interested consulting firm/institution/organization is drawn toparagraph 1.9 of the World Banks Consultant Guidelines setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict ofinterest. 8. Interested consultingfirms may refer to E-TENDERING INSTRUCTIONS TO APPLICANTS at Annexure II to this document to obtain further information. 9. Expression ofInterest must be submitted online only at http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH on or before April 4 2014 (up to 11.00 hours IST). Expression of Interest transmitted through anyother mode shall not beentertained. The Superintending Engineer (EAP) I Ministry of Road Transportand Highways Jeevan Tara Building Ground Floor 5 Parliament Street New Delhi 110001 INDIA Telephone: +91 11 23748315 Email: vivek.rth@nic.in Annexure I 1. Name AddressTelephone &Facsimile No. and e-mail id of the consulting firm/institution/organization: [Furnish the details as required. Attach certificate of incorporation from Company registrar.] 2. The structure andorganization of the consulting firm/institution/organization : [Give a brief note no more than 2 pages long. Additional documents/printed materials may be attached with proper indexing.] 3. Annual Turnover of the consulting firm/institution/organization during last five financial years: Year Annual Turn Over fromconsultancy/auditworks 1* 2* 3* 4* 5* *Means the number of years before thefinancial year in which the EOI is invited. Forthe avoidance of doubt financial year shall for the purpose mentioned here above means the accounting year followed by theapplicant in the course of its normal business. For Turn Over figure in currency other than INR the source for determining exchange rate is Reserve Bank OfIndia. In case Reserve Bankof India does notpublish exchange rate for a particular currency the exchange rate of International Monetary Fund shall be first used to convertamount in particular currency to US Dollar which will be laterconverted to INR using exchange rate of Reserve Bank ofIndia. Exchange rate prevailing as on 1st October of theconcerned year shall be considered. 4. List of the similar assignments involving projects of similar nature that have been completed/undertaken in the last fivecalendar years: Sl. No. Name ofwork Name addresstelephoneno. and e-mail id of client Date ofcommencement Date ofcompletion Payments received during01.04.2008-31.03.2013 Nature of servicesrendered* If the assignmentperformed was in JV share of the applicant *Experience of dealing maintenance works if any may be mentioned. [Assignments involvingcompletion of civil works upto 90% may only be listed. Certificate from clientshould be attached.] 5. Availability oftechnical experts/personnel employed/available with the consulting firm: 6. Availability ofinfrastructure including Information Technology (IT) capabilities in the consulting firm: Note: i). An index should be attached in the beginninggiving page numbersserially. ii). In case a document is in a language other than English translation of the said document in English language shall beprovided. iii). In case of joint venture details of each member should be separately provided. iv). Instructions given as text in square bracket may be deleted from the submission. Annexure II E-TENDERING INSTRUCTION TO APPLICANTS 1. Accessing/ Purchasing ofREOI documents (i) It is mandatory for all the applicants to have class-III DigitalSignatureCertificate (in the name of person who will sign the EOI) from any of the licensed Certifying Agency (Applicants can see the listoflicensed CAs from the link http://www.cca.gov.in ) to participate in this e-tendering of MoRTH. (ii) To participate in this e-tendering it is mandatory for the applicants to get registered theirfirm/joint venture with e-procurement portal of MoRTH http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH to have user ID & password which has to be obtained by submitting anannual registration charges of INR 2247/-(Inclusive of all taxes) to M/s ITI Ltd. through e-payment gateway of Punjab NationalBank using Credit Card / Debit Card (Master Card and Visa Card only) or net banking (Punjab National Bank Account holders only). Validity of online registration is 1year. (iii) The completeREOI documents can be viewed/downloaded free of cost fromMoRTH portal http://www.morth.nic.in or e-procurement portal of MoRTH http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH. (iv) Submission of EoI can be requested from e-procurement portal of MoRTH i.e.http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH from March4 2014 to April 3 2014 (up to 17.00 hoursIST). Forthis purpose applicants have topay INR 2247/- (Rs.Two Thousand Two Hundred Forty Seven only) towards application processing fee (non-refundable) to M/s ITI Ltd. against tenderprocessing fee through e-payment gateway of Punjab NationalBank using Credit Card/ Debit Card-Master Card and Visa Cardonly. (v) Following may be noted : (a) Registration should be valid at least up to onemonth after the date of submission of EOI. (b) EOI can be submittedonly during the validity ofregistration (c) Amendment/clarification to the REOI documentif any will be hosted on the MoRTH portal http://www.morth.nic.in ore-procurement portal of MoRTH http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH. (d) If the consulting firm/joint venture is alreadyregistered with e-procurement portal of MoRTH NHAI BRO and validity of registration is not expired the consulting firm / jointventure is not required to do fresh registration. 2. Preparation and Submission of EOI: (i) EOI shall be submitted online following the instruction appearing on the screen. A vendor manual containing the detailed guidelines fore-procurement system is also available on e-procurement portal of MoRTH. (ii) The documents comprising of Annexure I to this REOI document duly filled in and supportingdocuments there to shall be prepared duly signed manually by the authorized signatory and scanned in different files (in PDF orJPEG format such that file size is not more than 5 MB) and uploaded during the online submission of EOI on or before April 4 2014upto 11.00 hours IST i.e. the EOIsubmission due date. (iii) On submission of EOI in the e-procurement portal the consulting firm/joint venture will receive an auto-generatedacknowledgement no. which shall be referred to in all future correspondence. 3. Modification/Substitution/Withdrawal of EOI: (i) The applicant may modify substituteor withdrawits EOI any time prior to the EOI submission deadline. The e-procurement system of MORTH will not allow any modification/substitution/withdrawal after the EOIsubmission deadline. (ii) For modification of e-tender applicant has toclick on update link on e-procurement portal and upload / resubmit modified EOI. (iii) For withdrawal of EOI applicant has to clickon withdrawal icon at e-tendering portal of MoRTH and can withdraw its e-tender. (iv) It may specifically be noted that afterwithdrawal of a EOI for any reason applicant cannot re-submit e-tender again. (v) Modification/Withdrawal of EOI by any othermeans shall not be considered for evaluation. 4. Late Submission: The e-procurement portal willnot allowany submission of EOI after the EOI submission deadline. 5. Opening & Evaluation of EOI. MoRTH shall open online all the EOIs received in the e-procurementportal at 14.30 hrs IST on April 42014 in the presence of the applicants who choose to attend. MoRTH will subsequently examine and evaluate the EOI.

column4: Wbr 20-pkg Nhiip-br-ae-30a-8-authority Engineer Consultancy Services For Rehab & Upgrading To 2 Lanes/2 Lane With Paved Shoulders Configuration & Strengthening Of Fatuah-harnaut-barh Section (km0 To Km69.6) Of Nh-30a In The State Of Bihar-ph1 Of Nhiip
column10: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways
column12: Jeevan Tara Building Ground Floor5 Parliament Street
column18: Government of India Ministry of Road Transport and Highways REQUEST FOREXPRESSION OF INTEREST(REOI) Authoritys Engineer Consultancy Services for Rehabilitation and Upgrading to 2 lanes/2 lane with paved shouldersconfiguration and strengthening of Fatuah-Harnaut-Barh Section (km0 to km69.6) ofNH-30A in the State of Bihar under Phase-I of National HighwaysInter-connectivity Improvement Projects (NHIIP) Loan No. 8301-IN Package No.NHIIP-BR-AE-30A-8 1. The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways has applied for a loan from the World Bank inthe amount of about US$ 500 Millionas a part towards the cost of thePhase I of National Highways Inter-connectivity Improvement Project and it intends to apply theproceeds of this loan to payments for goods works related services and consulting services to be procured underthis NHIIPproject. 2. Theproject work consists of rehabilitation and upgrading to 2 lanes/2 lane with paved shoulders configuration of stretches of NationalHighways from single/intermediate lane and strengthening. Civil works related to theseprojects are proposed to be taken upon item rate/EPC mode of contract. The projectincludes performance based maintenance of project roads upon completion of up-gradation for a period of five years which isco-terminus with defects liability period. Rehabilitation and Upgrading to 2 lanes/2lane with paved shoulders configuration of Fatuah-Harnaut-Barh Section (km0 tokm69.6) of NH-30A in the State of Bihar is one of the projects under Phase I of NHIIP proposedto be taken up on EPC mode of contract. A brief overview of the scope of the projectisgiven as under: "The proposed improvement works willconsist mainly wideningto 2 lanes(7.0 m) with paved shoulders from km0.0 to km40.0 continuously and thereafter in built up areas. Earthen shoulder is provided in the remaining length. Pucca drain with pave rblockbeyond paved shoulder to drain is provided in built up areas. There are 3 bypasses proposed inthe project road i.e. at Daniawan (km7.5 to km10.22)Harnaut (km38.98 to km42.62) and Barh (km66.68 to km71.65). The scope of work alsoincludes construction of 3 ROBs i.e. at km7.6 km40.8 and km68.4 construction/reconstruction of 7 major bridges and 19 minorbridges and widening of 1 minor bridge construction/reconstruction of 111 culverts widening of 31 culverts rehabilitation of 3major bridges 7 minor bridges and 45 culverts. The works also include improvement of11 major junctions construction of 9 Bus bays with Bus shelters and 1 no. truck lay- byes and safety measures such as trafficsigns road markings safety barriers etc." 3. The Consultancy Services for Authority Engineer will broadly include review of design anddrawings quality assurance planmethodology prepared by the contractor inspection of works pre construction review of manufacturers test reports project monitoring sample quality control check contract management and making engineeringdecisions providing advisory services to the client for administering successful and timely implementation of the constructioncontract mentioned in para 2 under EPC mode of construction which is envisaged to be completed in 36 months of constructionperiod plus five years of performance based maintenance which is co-terminus with defects liability period. The detailed scope of work shall be furnished in the Request for Proposal (RFP) to beprovided to the short-listed consultants. 4. The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH) now invites eligible consulting firmshaving proven track record inconstruction supervision of similar highway works involving modern equipments and construction techniques tosubmit theirExpression of Interest (EoI). Interested consulting firms must provide the followinginformation in the format given in Annexure I: a) Name Address Telephone & Facsimile No. and e-mailid of the consulting firm b) The structure and organization of the consulting firmincluding year of registration c) Annual Turnover of the consulting firm during last fivefinancial years d) List of the similar assignments involving projects ofsimilar nature that have been completed/undertaken in the last five calendar years in any mode of delivery such as item rateEngineering Procurement Construction (EPC) Build Operate and Transfer (BOT) and variants thereof e) Information in respectof technical experts/personnelemployed/available with the consultingfirm f) Availability of infrastructure including InformationTechnology (IT) capabilities in the consulting firm 4.1 Interestedconsulting firms must fulfill the following criteria: a) The firm (Lead Member in case of JV) should have been operational duringlast 10 years b) The firm (all members together in case of JV) should have carried out atleast 3 similar assignments during last 5 years c) The firm (any Member in case of JV) should have worked in the projectregion/area or similar area during last 5 years 5. Consulting firms may associate with other firms in the form of joint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance theirqualification. 6. The consultant will be selected in accordance withQuality and Cost based Selection method set out in the Consultant Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants under IBRDLoans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers January2011 "Consultant Guidelines". The attention of interested consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Consultant Guidelinessetting forth the World Banks policy on conflict of interest. 7. Expression of Interest must be submitted online only at http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH on or before February 52014 (up to 13.30 hours IST). Expressions of Interest transmitted through any other mode shall not be entertained. column4: General Procurement Notice
column10: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways
column12: No. 1 Parliament Street Transport Bhawan
column18: INDIA National Highways Interconnectivity Improvement Project (Project ID: P121185) GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE The Ministry of RoadTransport and Highways has applied for loan fromthe World Bank in the amount of US$500 million equivalent toward the cost of theNational Highway Interconnectivity Improvement Project (NHIIP) and it intends to apply the proceeds of this loan to paymentsforgoods works related services and consulting services to be procuredunder this project. The Project DevelopmentObjective (PDO) is to improve the connectivity in less developed areas in the project states by upgrading selected sections of theNational Highway network and to improve the institutional capacity of the MoRTH to deliver effective and safe roads to users. Theproject will include upgrading about 1000 km of selected sections of "non-NHDP" National Highways to two-lane standard. Candidateproject roads are located in several states including Bihar Orissa Rajasthan Karnataka and West Bengal. The civil works willbe done following traditional contracting method (item-rate contract) and non-traditional contracting methods such as EngineeringProcurement and Contracting (EPC) and Design-Build-Operate-Maintain (DBOM). All contractswill include at least five year operation and maintenance phase. Consultancy serviceswill be required under the Road Safety and Institutional Strengthening component amongst others for the following: (a) to supportproject implementation and management: This will includeservices of project management consultants design and supervisionconsultants integrated performance audit (contract execution environmental and social safeguards) monitoring and evaluation ofsocio-economic impact of the project communication and public information; (b) toenhance sector performance in the following fourareas: network management road sector financing road safety construction site safety and capacity building. Procurement ofcontracts financed by the loan will be conducted through the procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement of Goods Works and Non-Consulting Services under IBRD Loans and IDACredits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers January 2011  and is open to all biddersfrom eligible source countries as defined in the guidelines. Consulting services will be selected in accordance with the WorldBanks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits& Grants by World Bank Borrowers January 2011. Specific procurement notices for contracts to be bid under the World Banks international competitive bidding (ICB) procedures andfor large-value consultants contracts will be announced as they become available in UN Development Business and in localnewspapers. Interested eligible bidders who wish to be included on the mailing list to receive an invitation to [prequalify/ bid] under ICBproceduresand interested consultants who wish to receive a copy of the advertisement requesting expressions of interest forlarge-value consultants contracts or those requiring additional information should contact at the address below: Mr A K Srivastava Chief Engineer Ministry of Road Transport and Highways No. 1 Parliament Street TransportBhawan New Delhi ? 110 001 (India) Tel: 011-23710358 Fax: 011 - 23736251 E-mail: aks5858@yahoo.in

column10: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways
