column18: Government of India Ministry of Road Transport and Highways REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST(REOI) Authoritys Engineer Consultancy Services for Rehabilitation and Upgrading to 2 lanes/2 lane with pavedshoulders configuration and strengthening of Bhojpur-Chhatabar Section (Km 131to km 192)of NH-200 in the State of Odisha under Phase-I of National Highways Inter-connectivityImprovement Projects (NHIIP)-Package NHIIP-OD-AE-200-5 Project Identification Number : P121185 Loan Number : 8301-IN 1. The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH) has applied for a loan from the World Bank in the amount of about US$500 million as a part towards the cost of the Phase-I of National Highways Inter-connectivity Improvement Projects and it intendsto apply the proceeds of this loan to payments for goods works related services and consulting services to be procured under thisNHIIP projects. 2. The project work consists of rehabilitation and upgrading to 2 lanes/2 lanewith paved shoulders configuration of stretches of National Highways from single/intermediate lane and strengthening. Civil worksrelated to these projects are proposed to be taken up on item rate/EPC mode of contract. The project includes performance based maintenance of project roads upon completion of up-gradation for a periodof five years which is co-terminus withdefects liability period. Rehabilitation and Upgrading to 2 lanes/2 lane with pavedshoulders configuration of Bhojpur-Chhatabar Section (Km 131to km 192) of NH-200 in the State ofOdisha is one of the projects under Phase I of NHIIP proposed to be taken up on EPC modeof contract. A briefoverview of the scope of the project is given asunder : "The proposed improvement works will consist mainly concentric i.e. equal widening on bothsides; except in some reaches where realignments have been proposed due to geometric improvements considered necessary as per IRCcodes; of the existing Single (3.6m approx.)/intermediate (5.5m approx) lane to two lanes (7m) followed by 2.5m wide earthenshoulders(in built-up areas 1.5m paved shoulders and 1.0m earthen shoulders) on both sides of the road raising the formationlevelwhere necessary upgrading/improvement of road geometrics pavement strengthening/reconstruction and improving cross drainagestructures. The scope of work also includes construction of new/reconstruction of 17bridges and 141 culverts; widening of 6 bridges and 34 culverts; construction of CC drains in built-up areas 14 bus bays 1 trucklay- bye and safety measures such as traffic signs road markings safety barriers etc." 3. The Consultancy Services for Authority Engineer will broadly include review of design anddrawings quality assurance planmethodology prepared by the contractor inspection of works pre construction review of manufacturers test reports project monitoring sample quality control check contract management and making engineeringdecisions providing advisory services to the client for administering successful and timely implementation of the constructioncontract mentioned in para 2 under EPC mode of construction which is envisaged to be completed in 24 months of constructionperiod plus five years ofperformance based maintenance which is co-terminus with defects liability period. The detailedscope of work shall be furnished in the Request for Proposal (RFP) tobeprovided to the short-listed consultants. 4. The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH) now invites eligible consulting firmshaving proven track record inconstruction supervision of similar highway works involving modern equipments and construction techniques tosubmit theirExpression of Interest (EoI). Interested consulting firms must provide the followinginformation in the format given in Annexure I: a) Name Address Telephone and Facsimile No. and e-mail id of the consulting firm b) Thestructure and organization of the consulting firm including year of registration c) Annual Turnover of theconsulting firm during last five financial years d) Listof the similar assignments involving projects of similar nature that have been completed/undertaken in the last five calendar yearsin any mode of delivery such as item rate Engineering Procurement Construction (EPC) Build Operate and Transfer (BOT) andvariants thereof e) Information in respect of technical experts/personnel employed/available with the consulting firm f) Availability of infrastructure including Information Technology (IT) capabilities in theconsultingfirm 4.1 Interested consulting firms must fulfill the following criteria: a) The firm (Lead Member in case of JV) should have been operational duringlast 10 years b) The firm (all members together in case of JV) should have carried out atleast 3 similar assignments during last 5 years c) The firm (any Member in case of JV) should have worked inthe projectregion/area or similar area during last 5 years 5. Consulting firms may form joint venture to enhance their capability. In suchcase qualification and experience of all the joint venture members shall be added to determine combined score of the joint venturethat will form the basis for shortlisting. All the members of the joint venture shallbe severally and jointly liable to the consultancyassignment. No other form ofassociation shall be allowed. 6. The consultant will be selected in accordance with Quality and CostbasedSelection method set out in the Consultant Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits&Grants by World Bank Borrowers January 2011 "Consultant Guidelines". Theattention of interested consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Consultant Guidelines setting forth the WorldBanks policy on conflict of interest. 7. Interested consulting firms may refer to E-TENDERING INSTRUCTIONS TO APPLICANTS at Annexure II to this document to obtainfurther information. 8. Expressions of Interest must be submitted online only at http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH on or before January 30 2014 (up to 13.30 hours IST). Expressionsof Interest transmitted through any other mode shall not be entertained. Rehabilitation and Upgrading to 2 lanes/2 lane withpaved shoulders configuration of Nabarangpur-Koksara Section (km25.0 to km80.0) ofNH-201in the State of Odishais one of theprojects under Phase I of NHIIP proposed to be takenup on EPC mode of contract. A brief overview of the scope of the project is given as under: "The proposed improvement work willconsist mainly widening to 2 lanes (7.0) with paved shoulder for a length of 6.4 km inbuilt-up areas. Earthen shoulder is provided inthe remaining length. Pucca drain with paver blockbeyond paved shoulder to drain is provided in built up areas. The scopeof work also includes construction/reconstruction of 2 majorbridges and 8 minor bridges and 88 culverts rehabilitation of 5 minor bridgesand 4 culverts. The work also includes improvement of 1 major intersection and 55 minorintersections construction of 10 bus bays with bus shelters and 1 no of truck lay-byes and safety measures such as traffic signroad marking safety barriers etc." 3. Avendor manual containing the detailed guidelines for e-tendering system is also available on e-tender portal of MoRTH. (ii) The following documents shall be prepared and scanned indifferent files (in PDF or JPEG format such that file size is not more than 5 MB) and uploaded during the online submission of EOIon or before 19.02.2013 up to 11.00 hoursIST i.e. the EOI submission DueDate. . a) Information about the firm i.e. NameAddress Telephone and Facsimile No. of the consulting firm. b) The structure and organizationof thefirm. c) Financial Statements showing Annual Turnoverof the firm during last 5 years i.e. 2007-08 onwards. d) List of major assignments which are similar toNHIIP and have been completed/ undertaken in the lastfive years including EPC/ Turnkey on a lumpsum basisDesign-Build-Operate-Transfer (DBOT). e) Information in respect of technicalexperts/personnel employed/available with the firm. f) Availability of Infrastructure InformationTechnology (IT) capabilities including project management software. (iii) On submission of EOI in the e-procurementportal the Consultancy Firmwill receive an auto-generated acknowledgement no. which shall be referred to in all futurecorrespondence. 3. Modification/Substitution/withdrawal ofEOI: (i) The applicant may modify substitute or withdraw its EOIany time prior to the EOI submission deadline. The e-procurement system of MORTH will not allow anymodification/substitution/withdrawal after the EOI submission deadline. (ii) For modification of e-tender applicant hasto detach itsold EOI from e-tendering portal and upload / resubmit digitally signed modified EOI. (iii) For withdrawal of EOI applicant has to click onwithdrawal icon at e-tenderingportal of MoRTH and can withdraw its e-tender. (iv)Itmay specifically be noted that after withdrawal of a EOI for any reason applicant cannot re-submit e-tenderagain. (v) Modification/Withdrawal of EOI by any other means shall not be considered for evaluation. 4. Late Submission: The e-procurement system will not allow any submissionof EOI after the EOI submission deadline. 5. Opening &Evaluation of EOI. (i) Opening and evaluation of EOI will be done through online process. (ii) MoRTH shall open online all the EOIs received in the e-procurement portal at 15.00 hoursIST on 19.02.2013 in the presence of the applicants who choose to attend. MoRTH will subsequently examine and evaluate the EOI inaccordance with the provisions set out.

column4: Hiring Of Consultancy Services For Project Management Consultancy
column10: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways

column18: Government of India Ministry of Road Transport and Highways e-REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OFINTEREST (e-REOI) for Project ManagementConsultancy for National HighwaysInter-connectivity Improvement Projects (NHIIP) File No RW/NH-12037/9/2012/SP (W.Bank)/P-9 Date:05.11.2012 1. The Ministry ofRoad Transport and Highways (MoRTH) has applied for a loan from the World Bank in the amount of Rs. 2500.00 Crores as a parttowards the cost of the Phase I of National Highways Inter-connectivity Improvement Projects (total cost of civil works of Phase Iof NHIIP is Rs. 3654.00 Crores) and it intends to apply the proceeds of this loan to payments for goods works related servicesand consulting services to be procured under this NHIIP projects. 2. The project workconsists of rehabilitation and upgrading to 2-lanes/2-lane with pavedshoulders configuration from single/intermediate lane and strengthening. The project includes Output and Performance BasedManagement and Maintenance of Roads for four years including Defects Liability Period of 365 days upon completion of up-gradationof the roads. The below listed 11 roads are to be considered for subproject packages under Phase I ofNHIIP. State NH No. Chainage Rajasthan 11B km 0 to 85; Lalsot toKarauli; 85 km Rajasthan 113 km 80 to 180; Pratapgarhto Padi; 100 km Bihar 104 km 40 to 217;Sheohar-Sitamarhi-Jaynagar-Narhiya; 177 km Slice 1 (km 40 to km70) Slice 2 (km 70 to km150) Slice 3 (km 150 to km217) Bihar 106 km 0 to 106; Birpur toKishanganj; 106 km Bihar 98 km 0 to 154.6;Anisabad-Aurangabad-Hariharganj; 154.6 km Slice 1 (km 0 to km62) Slice 2 (km 62 to km154.6) Bihar 30A km 0 to 69;Fathua-Harnaut-Barh Section; 69 km WestBengal 60A km 0 to 84; Bankura toPurulia; 84 km Karnataka 234 km 343.8 to 509.5;Madhugiri to AP border; 165.7 km Slice 1 (km 343.8 to km405) Slice 2 (km 405 to km509.5) Orissa 201 km 25 to 80; Nabarangpurto Koksara 55 km Orissa 217 km 90 to 158; Nuapada toBangoMunda; 68 km Orissa 200 km 131 to 192; Bhojpur toChhatabar; 61 km 3. The Project ManagementConsultancy services will include but not be limited to: general support to MoRTH inall aspects of project management including procurement and financial management procedures and documentation monitoring ofprojects resolving contractual/policy/managementissues application of policies and implementation issues at the project levelcoordination with supervision consultants/ PWDs training and capacity building. The Project Management Consultancy services will also include CharteredAccounting for compiling/analyzing various reports. The detailed scope of work including full project details will befurnished in the Request for Proposals (RFP). 4. The Ministry of RoadTransport and Highways (MoRTH) now invites eligible Consultants having proven track record in managing large civil works projectsinvolving modern equipment designplanning construction and operation & maintenance to submit their expression of interest.Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified to perform the services (brochure certifiedcopies/certificates description of similar assignmentsexperience in similar conditions availability of appropriate skills amongstaff etc.) as mentioned below: a) Name AddressTelephone and Facsimile No. of the consulting firm. b) The structure and organization of the firm. c) Annual Turnover of the firm during last 5 years i.e. 2007-08 onwards. d) List of major assignments which are similar to NHIIP and have been completed/ undertaken in the last five years includingEPC/ Turnkey on a lumpsum basis Design-Build-Operate-Transfer (DBOT). e) Information in respect of technical experts/personnel employed/available with the firm. f) Availability of Infrastructure Information Technology (IT) capabilities including project managementsoftware. Consultants may associate to form joint ventures. 5. The consultants will beselected in accordance with the procedure specified in the World Bank Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants underIBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers January 2011. Onlyfirms shortlisted as a result of this REOI process will be provided with the RFP. The notification for short listed applicants willbe sent to all firms who submitted an REOI and entities that specifically requested for this short list in accordance with WorldBank Guidelines 6. Interested consultantsmay follow E-TENDERING INSTRUCTIONS TO APPLICANTS at Annexure I to this document to obtain further information. 7. Expression of Interestmust be submitted onlineonly at http://www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH on or before 07.12.2012 (up to 11.00 hours IST). Expression of Interest transmitted through any other mode shall not be entertained. Superintending Engineer (EAP) I Ministry of Road Transport andHighways Transport BhawanNo. 1 ParliamentStreet New Delhi ? 110 001(India) Annexure I E-TENDERING INSTRUCTION TO APPLICANTS 1. Accessing/ Purchasing ofREOI documents (i) It is mandatory for all the applicants tohave class-III Digital Signature Certificate (in the name of person who will sign the REOI) from any of the licensed CertifyingAgency (Applicants can see the list of licensed CA?s from the link www.cca.gov.in ) to participate ine-tendering ofMoRTH. (ii) To participate in thee-tendering submission it is mandatory for the applicants to get registered their firm/joint venture with e-tendering portal ofMoRTH www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH to have user ID & password which has to be obtained by submitting an annual registrationcharges of INR 2247/-(Inclusive of all taxes) to M/s ITI Ltd. through e-payment gateway of Punjab National Bankusing Credit Card /Debit Card( Master Card and Visa Card only) or net banking (Punjab National Bank Account holders only). Validity of onlineregistration is 1 year. (iii) The complete REOI documents can be viewed / downloadedfree of cost from MoRTH portal http://www.morth.nic.in or e-tender portal of MoRTH www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH from 07.11.2012 to 06.12.2012 (up to 17.00 hours IST). (iv) To participate in EOI applicants have to pay INR 2247/-(Rs. Two Thousand Two Hundred Forty Seven only) towards applicationprocessing fee (non-refundable) to M/s ITI Ltd. against tenderprocessing fee through e-payment gateway of Punjab National Bankusing Credit Card/ Debit Card-Master Card and Visa Card only. (v) REoI can be requested frome-tender portal of MoRTH www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH from 07.11.2012 to 06.12.2012 (up to 17.00 hoursIST). Following may be noted (a) Registration should be valid atleast up to one month after the date of submission of EOI. (b) EOI can be submitted only duringthe validity of their registration (c) The amendments / clarificationsto the EOI document if any will be hosted on the MoRTH portal http://www.morth.nic.in or e-tender portal of MoRTH www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH. (d) If the firm / joint venture isalready registered with e-tendering portal of MoRTH NHAI BRO and validity of registration is not expired the firm / joint ventureis not required for fresh registration. 2. Preparation &Submission of EOI: (i) The complete REOI documentsmaybedownloaded from MoRTHportalhttp://www.morth.nic.in ore-tender portal of MoRTH www.tenderwizard.com/MORTH from from 07.11.2012to 06.12.2012 (up to 17.00 hours IST) and EOI shall be submitted online following the instruction appearing onthe screen. Avendor manual containing the detailed guidelines for e-tendering system is also available on e-tender portal of MoRTH. (ii) The following documents shall beprepared and scanned in different files (in PDF or JPEG format such that file size is not more than 5 MB) and uploadedduring theonline submission of EOI on or before 07.12.2012 up to 11.00 hours IST i.e. the EOI submission Due Date. . a) Information about the firm i.e. Name Address Telephone andFacsimile No.of the consulting firm. b) The structure and organization of thefirm. c) Financial Statements showing Annual Turnover of the firm during last5 years i.e. 2007-08 onwards. d) Listof major assignments which are similar to NHIIP and have beencompleted/ undertaken in the last five years including EPC/ Turnkey on a lumpsum basis Design-Build-Operate-Transfer(DBOT). e) Information in respect of technical experts/personnelemployed/available with the firm. f) Availability of Infrastructure Information Technology (IT)capabilities including project management software. (iii) On submission of EOI in the e-procurement portal the Consultancy Firm will receive an auto-generatedacknowledgement no. which shall be referred to in all future correspondence. 3. Modification /Substitution / Withdrawal of EOI: (i) The applicant may modifysubstitute or withdraw its EOI any time prior to the EOI submission deadline. The e-procurement system of MORTH will not allow anymodification/substitution/withdrawal after the EOI submission deadline. (ii) For modification of e-tenderapplicant has to detach its old EOI from e-tenderingportal and upload / resubmit digitally signed modifiedEOI. (iii) Forwithdrawal ofEOI applicant has to click on withdrawal icon at e-tendering portal of MoRTH and can withdraw itse-tender. (iv) It may specifically be noted that after withdrawalof a EOI for any reason applicant cannot re-submit e-tender again. (v) Modification/Withdrawal of EOI by any other meansshall not be considered for evaluation. 4. Late Submission :The e-procurement system will not allow any submission of EOI after the EOI submission deadline. 5. Opening &Evaluation of EOI. (i) Opening and evaluation of EOI will be done throughonline process. (ii) MoRTH shall open online all the EOIs received in the e-procurementportal at 15.00 hours IST on 07.12.2012 in the presence of the applicants who chooseto attend. MoRTH will subsequently examine and evaluate the EOI in accordance with the provisions set out. **********

column4: Wbr 6-rfp No.:11809/11/1/nrlm-management Support Services To National Rural Livelihoods Mission
column12: 6th Floor Hotel SamratChanakya Puri
column18: This notice has been cancelled as of 05/08/2012. Please do not respond. NATIONALRURAL LIVELIHOODS PROJECT (NRLP) Consultancy services as ApplicationDevelopment Agency for the Design Development Deployment Maintenance and Support for a ComprehensiveManagement InformationSystem for the National Rural Livelihoods Mission The Government of India has launched the National Rural Livelihoods Mission (NRLM)under the Ministry of Rural Development (MoRD). The mission aims at creating efficient andeffective institutional platforms of the rural poor enabling them to increase household income through sustainablelivelihoodenhancements and improved access to financial and selected public services. NRLM has set out with an agenda toreach out and mobilize 7 crore BPL households across 600 districts 6000 blocks 2.5 lakhs Gram Panchayats 6 lakhs villages inthe country into self-managed SHGs and federated institutions and support them for livelihoods enhancement and incomeaugmentation. The Government of India has availed a credit from InternationalDevelopment Association (IDA) towards the National Rural Livelihoods Project which aimsto support the National Rural Livelihoods Mission under the Ministry of Rural Development Government of India; andintends to apply part of the loan proceeds to make payments under the contract for the following services: Consultancy services as  Application Development Agency for the DesignDevelopment Deployment Maintenance and Support for a Comprehensive Management Information System for the National RuralLivelihoods Mission under the National Rural Livelihoods Project(NRLP). The National Rural Livelihoods Project now invites eligible Consultants to indicate their interest inproviding the services. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the NRLMProcurement Manualwhich follows the Consultants Selection Guidelines of the World Bank dated January 2011. Interested Consultant/s may submit"Expression of Interest" in a sealed envelop clearly superscripted as Expression of Interest for " Consultancy services for NRLM". They may obtain further information about the requirements and proceduresfor submitting the EOI at: http://rural.nic.in/sites/advertisements-tender.asp & www.eprocure.gov.in Consultants may associate other Service Providers to complement theirrespective areas ofqualifications/expertise such that the agency can deliver the required management support to NRLM. Expressions of Interest mustbe delivered to the address below within 15 days from the date of publication of this advertisement. The Mission Director Ministry of Rural Development 6 th Floor Hotel Samrat Chanakya Puri New Delhi -21 India

Sridevi Director Ministry of Urban Development Government of India Room No134-C Nirman Bhawan Maulana Azad Road New Delhi 110001 Tel: 011-23061047/64691073 Web site: www.jnnurm.nic.in. Project Director (CBUD) ====================================== GovernmentofIndia MINISTRY OF URBAN DEVELOPMENT REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST(REOI) (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMSSELECTION) INDIA CAPACITY BUILDING FOR URBAN DEVELOPMENT (CBUD) PROJECT Credit No.: 4997-IN AssignmentTitle: TechnicalSupport in Improvement and computerization of Assessment and Collection System of Property Tax by 6 Selected Urban LocalBodies Reference No.: CBUD/FIN/11 The Government ofIndia has received financing from the International DevelopmentAssociation (IDA) toward the cost of the Capacity Building for Urban Development Project (CBUD) and intends to apply part of theproceeds for consulting services. The details of the required consulting services ("the Services") are available at www.jnnurm.nic.in. The Ministry of Urban Development Government ofIndia now invites eligible consultancyfirms (Consultants) to indicate their interest in providing the services for  Technical Support in Improvement and computerization of Assessment and Collection Systemof Property Tax by 6 Selected UrbanLocal Bodies (CBUD/FIN/11) (Improvement in Property Tax Collection-Widening of Tax Base-Computerization of Property Tax records-Introduction of OnlineAssessment and Collection-Dispute Redress Mechanism at Chhindwara Cuttak Dehradun Haridwar Puri and Nagpur) Interested firm should provide informationdemonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to provide the Services. The short listingcriteria is based on general experience of the firm; experience of the firm in implementing financial reforms in the ULBs/ParaStatal Bodies and undertaking similar assignments (Improvement in Property Tax Collection-Widening of Tax Base-Computerization ofProperty Tax records-Introduction of Online Assessment and Collection-Dispute Redress Mechanism in Central/State Urban LocalBodies); total staff strength including staff havingexperience of carrying out similar assignments and having performed tasks mentioned above. The attention of interested Consultants is drawnto paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [underIBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants] by World BankBorrowers [May 2004 revised in October 2006 and May 2010]("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict of interest. Consultants may associate with other firms inthe form of a joint venture or a sub consultancy to enhance their qualifications. An agency will beselected in accordance with theQuality and Cost Based Selection method set out in the Consultant Guidelines. Further information can be obtained at theaddress below during office hours [0900 to 1730 hours]. Expressions of interest must be delivered to the address below by 17:00 hrsof December 24 2012. Ms. B.P. Sridevi Director Ministry of Urban Development Government of India Room No134-C Nirman Bhawan Maulana Azad Road New Delhi 110001 Tel: 011-23061047/64691073 Web site: www.jnnurm.nic.in. Project Director (CBUD) Improvement in PropertyTax Collection-Widening of TaxBase-Computerization of Property Tax records-Introduction of Online Assessment and Collection-Dispute RedressMechanism The Governmentof India (GOI) is implementing the Capacity Building for Urban Development Project (CBUD) financedby the World Bank. CBUD isconfigured to provide a comprehensive framework for long term capacity building requirements of ULBs and incorporates the urgentpriorities identified by the GOI for the Ministries of Urban Development (MoUD) and Ministry of Housing and Urban PovertyAlleviation (MoHUPA). The Project has two components: (1) Capacity Building for Strengthened Urban Management and (2) CapacityBuilding for Effective Urban Poverty Monitoring and Alleviation. Under componentone improvement of the methods of revenue mobilizationby the ULBs under provisions of their applicable Acts has been identified by the Ministry of Urban Development as an area requiring further strengthening. Fundamental tothe strengthening of municipal revenues is improvement of the system of levy and collection of property tax which is the majorsource of revenue for ULBs expected to contribute up to 60% of the total tax revenues in majority of the ULBs.However fiscal roleof property tax has lately declined much below the 60% level in the total tax revenues of ULBs primarily due to inefficiency inensuring total tax compliance and the lack of an efficient and taxpayer friendly assessment collection and dispute redresssystem.The global objective of this TA will be to improve the revenue of theULB from property tax by identifying under-assessed andun-assessed properties computerise property tax recordsput in place an on-line assessment and collection of property tax andrecommend measures to achieve significant increase in property tax collection by improved tax administration including an effectivecollection mechanism along with a grievances redress system. The MoUD isimplementing the CBUD project in 30 cities grouped in six zones . The current proposal will cover only following 6cities:- S.No. Name of City Name of State 1. Chhindwara Madhya Pradesh 2. Dehradun Uttrakhand 3. Haridwar Uttrakhand 4 Puri Odisha 5 Cuttack Odisha 6 Nagpur Maharashtra

column18: Government of India MINISTRY OF URBAN DEVELOPMENT REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST (REOI) (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) INDIA CAPACITY BUILDING FOR URBAN DEVELOPMENT (CBUD) PROJECT Credit No.: 4997-IN Assignment Title: Implementation of Accrual Based Double EntryAccounting System Reference No.: CBUD/FIN/09; CBUD/FIN/10 The Government of India has received financing from the International Development Association (IDA) toward the cost of the Capacity Building for UrbanDevelopment Project (CBUD) and intends toapply part of the proceeds for consulting services. The details of the requiredconsulting services ("the Services") are available at www.jnnurm.nic.in. The Ministry of Urban Development Government of India now inviteseligible consultancy firms (Consultants) to indicate their interest in providing the services for  Package 1- Implementation of Accrual Based Double Entry Accounting System in 5 Urban Local Bodies (CBUD/FIN/09) (Preparation ofOpening Balance Sheet Fixed Asset Inventory and Valuation Implementationof computerized accounting system for key accounting and revenuefunctions Handholding and Capacity Building to sustain Accrual Based Double Entry Accounting System atChhindwara Puri Cuttak Kurukshetra and Yamuna Nagar)  Package 2- Implementation of Accrual Based Double Entry Accounting System in 3 Urban Local Bodies (CBUD/FIN/10) (Updation ofOpening Balance Sheet Fixed Asset Inventory andValuation Implementation of computerized accounting system for keyaccounting and revenue functions Handholding and Capacity Building to sustainAccrual Based Double Entry Accounting System at Nagpur Haridwar andDehradun) Interested firm should provide information demonstrating that they havethe required qualifications and relevant experience to provide the Services. The short listingcriteria is based on generalexperience of the firm; experience of the firm in implementing financial reforms in the ULBs/Para Statal Bodies and undertakingsimilar assignments (implementation of Accrual BasedDouble Entry Accounting System in Central/State Urban Local Bodies and/or ParaStatal bodies including valuation of assets maintenance of accounts on accrual basis and preparation of periodical financialstatements and recommending/implementing solutions for computerization of accountingsystem); total staff strength including staff having experience of carrying out similarassignments and having performed tasks mentioned above. Interested agency must indicatethe package/s for which EOI has beensubmitted. One consultant can be short listed for maximum 1 packageonly. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of theWorld Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants[under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants] byWorld Bank Borrowers [May 2004revised in October 2006 and May 2010] ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Bankspolicy on conflict ofinterest. Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a joint ventureor a sub consultancy to enhance their qualifications. An agency will be selectedin accordance with the Quality and Cost BasedSelection method set out in the Consultant Guidelines. Further information can beobtained at the address below during officehours [0900 to 1730 hours]. Expressions of interest must be delivered to the address below by 17:00 hrs of 10 December2012. Ms. B.P. Sridevi Director Ministry of Urban Development Government of India Room No134-C Nirman Bhawan Maulana Azad Road New Delhi 110001 Tel: 011-23061047/64691073 Web site: www.jnnurm.nic.in. Project Director (CBUD) Package 1 - Implementation of Accrual BasedDouble Entry Accounting System in 5 Urban Local Bodies (CBUD/FIN/09) Background Government of India (GoI) is implementing the Capacity Buildingfor Urban Development Project (CBUD) with support of the World Bank. CBUD is configured to provide comprehensive framework for longterm capacity building requirements and incorporates the urgent priorities identified by the GoI for the Ministries of UrbanDevelopment (MoUD) and Ministry of Housing and Urban Poverty Alleviation (MoHUPA). The Project has two components: (I) CapacityBuilding for Strengthened Urban Management; and (2) Capacity Building for Effective Urban Poverty Monitoring and Alleviation.Financialmanagement reforms are one the key sub component under Capacity Building for Strengthened Urban Management. Financial Management Reform- Implementation ofAccrual Based Double Entry Accounting System Most of the ULBs had been following cash basedsingle entry accountingsystem wherein data for preparation of Balance Sheet cannot easily beidentified. In fact in this systemthere is no provision for preparation of Balance Sheet though ULBs are required to maintain records of assets and liabilities invarious forms (such as register of deposits register of tools and plants the DCB register etc.). However in practice many ofthese records are not updated by the ULBs regularly and thus the data available is insufficient to arrive at the actual financialposition of the ULBs. Implementation of the Accrual Based Double Entry Accounting System is expected not only to enhance thecapacities of ULBs in municipal accounting leading to increased transparency and accountability in the utilization of public fundsbut will also help Urban Local Bodies to play their role effectively and ensure better service delivery. In an effort to provide support to ULBs inimplementation of Accrual Based Double Entry Accounting System Ministry of Urban Development Government of India developed aNational Municipal Accounting System. The National Municipal Accounting Manualprovides a generic framework of municipal accounting andsimplified tool kit to the ULBs for recording the accountingentries. Based on this National Municipal Accounting Manualsome states also developed Accounting Manual for the ULBs. Since introduction of Accrual Based Double Entry Accounting System isalso a mandatory reform under JNNURM a number of ULBs have initiated process of migration to the new accounting system. Thoughlots of effort has gone into implementation of Accrual Based Double Entry Accounting System in the ULBsits further strengtheningis needed to ensure correct complete and timely recording of municipal transactions and produce accurate and relevant financialreports. Sustainability has also been another major area concern where capacity building and handholding is a need of thehour. To assist the Urban Local Bodies of Chhindwara inthe State of Madhya Pradesh Puri & Cuttak in the State of Odisha and Kurukshetra andYamuna Nagar in the State of Haryana inimplementing the Accrual Based Double Entry Accounting System it is proposed to engage an eligible consulting firm to providetechnical and advisory services to the ULB. The main area of work would be: (a) Prepare Opening Balance Sheet including all assets and liabilities as on 1 st April 2012 (b) Prepare accounting manual and relevant training materials for ULB staff (c) Survey and list Fixed Assets and inventory carry out valuation of fixed assets and liabilities in compliance withrequirements of National Municipal Accounting Manual/State Municipal Accounting Manual and other government notifications. (d) Implement computerized accounting system through suitable software available in the market as per the requirements of eachULB. It shall be interlinked with other existing or proposed systems for ULB so as to synchronize the output of each system likeProperty Tax Fixed Asset and others. (e) Provide training and handholding to ULB staff on both accounting aspects and the computerized system (f) Prepare financial statements for the year 2012-13 2013-14 2014-15 including (half year endfinancial statements) (g) Carry out handholding exercise and provide necessary professional help for sustaining the implementation ofthe newaccounting system. The detailed scope of work tasks andresults to be achieved will be indicated in the Request for Proposal to be issued to the shortlisted consultingfirms. Package 2 - Implementation of Accrual BasedDouble Entry Accounting System in 3 Urban Local Bodies (CBUD/FIN/10) Background Government of India (GoI) is implementing the Capacity Buildingfor Urban Development Project (CBUD) with support of the World Bank. CBUD is configured to provide comprehensive framework for longterm capacity building requirements and incorporates the urgent priorities identified by the GoI for the Ministries of UrbanDevelopment (MoUD) and Ministry of Housing and Urban Poverty Alleviation (MoHUPA). The Project has two components: (I) CapacityBuilding for Strengthened Urban Management; and (2) Capacity Building for Effective Urban Poverty Monitoring andAlleviation. Financial Management Reform- Implementation ofAccrual Based Double Entry Accounting System Most of the ULBs had been following cash basedsingle entry accountingsystem wherein data for preparation of Balance Sheet cannot easily beidentified. In fact in this systemthere is no provision for preparation of Balance Sheet though ULBs are required to maintain records of assets and liabilities invarious forms (such as register of deposits register of tools and plants the DCB register etc.). However in practice many ofthese records are not updated by the ULBs regularly and thus the data available is insufficient to arrive at the actual financialposition of the ULBs. Implementation of the Accrual Based Double Entry Accounting System is expected not only to enhance thecapacities of ULBs in municipal accounting leading to increased transparency and accountability in the utilization of public fundsbut will also help Urban Local Bodies to play their role effectively and ensure better service delivery. In an effort to provide support to ULBs inimplementation of Accrual Based Double Entry Accounting System Ministry of Urban Development Government of India developed aNational Municipal Accounting System. The National Municipal Accounting Manualprovides a generic framework of municipal accounting andsimplified tool kit to the ULBs for recording the accountingentries. Based on this National Municipal Accounting Manualsome states also developed Accounting Manual for the ULBs. Since introduction of AccrualBased Double Entry Accounting System isalso a mandatory reform underJNNURM a number of ULBs have initiated process of migration to the new accounting system. Though lotsof effort has gone into implementation of Accrual Based Double Entry Accounting System in the ULBs its further strengthening isneeded to ensure correct complete and timely recording of municipal transactions and produce accurate and relevant financialreports. Sustainability has also been another major area concern where capacity building and handholding is a need of thehour. It is also proposed to engage consulting firm toprovide technical assistance for to the Urban Local Bodies of Nagpur in the State of Maharashtra Haridwar and Dehradun in the State ofUttrakhand for (a) updating theirBalance Sheets including all assets and liabilities (b) List Fixed Assets and inventory carry out valuation of fixed assets and liabilities in compliance with requirements ofNational Municipal Accounting Manual/State Municipal Accounting Manual and other government notifications. (c) Implement computerized accounting system through suitable software available in the market as per the requirements of eachULB. It shall be interlinked with other existing or proposed systems for ULB so as to synchronize the output of each system likeProperty Tax Fixed Asset and others. (d) Provide training and handholding to ULB staff on both accounting aspects and the computerized system (e) Prepare financial statements for the year 2012-13 2013-14 2014-15 including (half year end financial statements) (f) Carry out handholding exercise and provide necessary professional help for sustaining theimplementation of the new accounting system. The detailed scope of work tasks and results tobe achieved will be indicated in the Request for Proposal to be issued to the shortlisted consulting firms.

Improvement in Property Tax Collection-Widening of Tax Base-Computerizationof Property Tax records-Introduction of Online Assessmentand Collection-Dispute Redress Mechanism (Phase2-Package1) The Government of India (GOI) is implementing the Capacity Building for Urban DevelopmentProject (CBUD) financed by the World Bank. E mail: usjnnurm4@gmail.com ProjectDirector (CBUD) ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Developing Strategy for reduction of Non Revenue Water (NRW) in selected 6 cities The Government of India (GoI) isimplementing the Capacity Building for Urban Development Project (CBUD) financed by the World Bank. CBUD is configured to provide acomprehensive framework for long term capacity building requirements and incorporates the urgent priorities identified by the GoIfor the Ministries of Urban Development (MoUD) and Ministry of Housing and Urban Poverty Alleviation (MoHUPA). The Project has twocomponents: (I) Capacity Building for Strengthened Urban Management; and (2) Capacity Building for Effective Urban PovertyMonitoringand Alleviation. Generally cities in India are found not tobe performing well when measured against the standard performance indicators. The cities in general are poorly managing watersupply infrastructure and operating with low cost recovery. They are struggling financially lack conducive governance structureand resources to improve performance. Reduction in Non Revenue Water (NRW) is one such initiative which if successfullyimplemented will lead to improved water service delivery in the ULBs. The objectiveof thistechnical assistance is to support selected 6 ULBs in developing a strategy for reduction of Non Revenue Water (NRW). The MoUD is implementing the CBUD project in30 cities grouped in sixzones. The name of these cities and corresponding zones are given in the table below. The proposedassignment will cover only for 6 (six) cities from the following list. The final list of six cities to be covered under theassignment will be confirmed at RfP stage considering willingness and buy-in from the concerned ULBs. This final list couldpotentially include one city from each zone. Sridevi Director Ministry of Urban Development Government of India Room No134-C Nirman Bhawan Maulana Azad Road New Delhi 110001 Tel: 011-23061047/64691073 Web site: www.jnnurm.nic.in Project Director (CBUD) Preparation of Fresh CityDevelopment Plans and Revision of Existing City Development Plans for Selected Cities Government of India (GoI) is implementing the Capacity Building for Urban Development Project (CBUD) withsupport of the World Bank. CBUD is configured to provide comprehensive framework for long term capacitybuilding requirements andincorporates the urgent priorities identified by the GoI for the Ministries of Urban Development (MoUD) and Ministry of Housing andUrban Poverty Alleviation (MoHUPA). The Project hastwo components: (I) Capacity Building for Strengthened Urban Management; and (2)Capacity Building for Effective Urban Poverty Monitoring and Alleviation. Preparation of Fresh CDPs City Development Plans (CDPs) of cities indicated below are proposedto be developed under flagship of CBUD.CDP would serve as a City Vision Document based on systematic realistic and strategic data sources. This would enable cities tostrategically prioritise the sectors/ projects to be taken up identify funding sources to be tapped for project implementationover 10 years. The objective of preparation of a CDP is to create a comprehensive plan for the sustainable development of the citywith a strong focus on addressing the priority problems inline with a medium to long term vision for the future supported byavailable financial resources. In addition to its spatial aspects of traditional planning the CDP takes a more strategic view ofthe development of the city and aligns infrastructure development and service delivery to the vision for development in aintegrated consultative and participatory manner. Revision of Existing CDPs To assist the ULB in identifying the gaps in service delivery and inorder to help the ULBs better managetheir urban space it is proposed to assess revise and update the existing city development plans which form the baseline for anyplanning exercise post JNNURM. This willhelp in ensuring that the plans are grounded with current situations and participatory innature and address the current legal and systemicconstraints. The updation exercise will also help identify areas where ULBs needassistance on urban management and capacities can be builtaccordingly. The details of packages are as follows: Package State Cities for Preparation of Fresh CDPs Cities forRevision of CDPs PACKAGE 1: NORTH & NORTH EAST (13 Cities) Haryana J&K Chandigarh UttarPradesh Uttrakhand Himachal Pradesh Assam Sikkim Meghalaya and Mizoram Yamunanagar Kurukshetra Jammu Chandigarh AllahabadVaranasi Dehradun Haridwar Shimla Guwahati Gangtok Shillong and Aizwal PACKAGE 2: EAST ZONE WEST ZONE SOUTH ZONE & CENTRAL ZONE (17 Cities) Odisha West Bengal &Jharkhand Goa Gujarat Maharashtra Rajasthan Andhra Pradesh Karnataka Kerela Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh Siliguri Puri Cuttack Ranchi Panaji. column4: General Procurement Notice
column12: Nirman Bhawan Maulana Azad Road
column18: CAPACITY BUILDING FORURBAN DEVELOPMENT PROJECT GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE COUNTRY: INDIA Sector: Sub-national government administration Project ID No.: P099979 Loan /Credit No: 4997-IN OriginalGeneral Procurement Notice: 30 September 2007 This general procurementnotice updates 1 that publishedin Development Business of September 302007. The Government of India has received credit in the amount of US$ 60000000 equivalent from the InternationalDevelopment Association (IDA) toward the cost of the Capacity Building for Urban DevelopmentProject and it intends to apply the proceeds of this credit to payments forgoods related services and consulting services tobe procured under this project. The project will include the followingcomponents: (i) Capacity Building for Strengthened Urban Management (Component 1) ? This consists of the following subcomponents: Financial and FM Reform: The project would support ULBs in the key areas of improvingbudgeting and planning expenditure management procurement planning and execution revenue mobilization (including property taxdevelopment charges and user charges) asset/liability management accrual accounting internal controls auditing FM informationsystems procurement capacity enhancement of municipal accountants and IT standardization. Implementation and operationalplanning including developing strategies for project execution and monitoring and review including effective quality controlprocedures will also be supported. Framework for Urban Planning: The project would support ULB reforms to the urban planningprocess and land management including pro-poor planning approaches. Service Delivery: The project would support institutional design in ULBs forservice delivery tariff and subsidy design the financing framework (includingaccess to capital markets public privatepartnerships (PPPs) and carbon finance) service delivery for the poor strengthening project planning implementationperformance planning and benchmarking and monitoring training and professionalization of service delivery and efficientmanagement of social impacts. Framework for Governance: The project would seek to improve the quality of theinteractions between local officials and citizens through support for citizen awareness and participation (e.g. citizen scorecardsstakeholder forums government) and skills development for elected officials. In addition to improve transparency publicconsultations citizens forums and measures such as disclosure of finalized audited financial statements wouldbesupported. (ii) Capacity Building for Effective Urban Poverty Alleviation and Monitoring (Component 2) ? Thesecapacity building initiatives reflect the need to strengthenMOHUPA share urban poverty alleviation experiences and designstrategies on urban poverty alleviation. It is anticipated that this component will further assist in the effective implementationof RAY. Challenge Fund for Urban Poverty Alleviation: Grant funding will be provided to ULBs working on urban poverty alleviation via two windows: (i) to recognize and awardparticularly innovative practices in this area; and (ii) to government departments and institutions and parastatals interested inadopting and scaling up one or more of the ?best practices identified through the first window. Thesub-component will also providefunding for the administration of theChallenge Fund. Creation of a Practitioners Network: Supportwill be provided to the Challenge Fund to constitute a network of practitioners with the objective of promoting information sharingand capacity building. The network will include government officialsfrom the selected ULBs academics and other actors active inthe areaof urban poverty alleviation both nationally and internationally andis envisioned to serve as a platform for bothpeer-topeer learning and the delivery of formal training. The network will also facilitate the dissemination and discussion of bestpractices identified and/or developed through the Challenge Fund. Development of Training Materials on Urban Poverty and ServiceDelivery: Support will be provided to 4 National Resource Centers to develop training modules on urban povertyreduction and service delivery. Preparation of ULB level Poverty Reduction Strategies: Support will be provided to ULBs to prepare diagnostics and povertyreduction strategies which build upon the existing andfuture planning instruments such as City Development Plans and Slum-free City ActionPlans. Support will also be provided to improvedatabases and other tools needed for targeting and monitoring of service delivery in urban areas. Strengthening of MOHUPA: The technical assistance willsupport policy analysis and development as well as build a comprehensive monitoring and evaluation (M&E) system in MOHUPA incoordination with the Resource Centers and ULBs. The list of key contract packages is inAnnexure 1. Procurement of contracts financed by the credit willbe conducted through the procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans andIDA Credits (May 2004 revised Oct 2006 and May 2010) and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in the guidelines. Consulting services will be selected in accordancewith the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by World Bank Borrowers (May 2004 revised Oct 2006 and May 2010). Specific procurement notices for contracts to be bidunder the World Banks international competitive bidding (ICB) procedures and for large-value consultants contracts will beannounced as they become available in UN Development Business www.urbanindia.nic.in www.eprocure.gov.in and in nationalnewspapers as per guidelines. Interestedeligible bidders who wish to be included on the mailing list to receive invitations to prequalify/bid under ICB procedures andinterested consultants who wish to receive a copy of advertisement requesting expressions of interest for large-value consultantscontracts or those requiring additional information should contact the address below. For Component 1 The Project DirectorCBUD Ministry of Urban Development(MoUD) Nirman Bhawan Maulana AzadRoadNew Delhi - 110001 Tel:91-11-64691073 E-mail: cbudproject@gmail.com Web site: www.urbanindia.nic.in For Component 2 The Project DirectorCBUD Ministry of Housing and UrbanPoverty Alleviation Nirman Bhawan Maulana AzadRoadNew Delhi - 110001 Tel:91-11-64691073 E-mail: cbudproject@gmail.com Web site: www.mhupa.gov.in Project Director CBUD Ministry of Urban Development (MoUD) Annexure 1. LIST OF KEY CONSULTANCY CONTRACT PACKAGES (COMPONENT 1) Zonal/ City Support Units for capacity Building activities of Urban Local Bodies (3Packages) Assessment of Training Needs Design and Delivery ofTrainings (including study tours) for Urban Local Bodies across CBUD cities Implementation of Accrual Based Double EntryAccounting System (DEAS)for Urban local Bodies (2 packages) Technical Support in implementation of reforms inproperty tax system user charges and other fees & taxes by Urban Local Bodies (2 Packages) Preparation of Infrastructure master plans and city sanitation plans for selected UrbanLocal Bodies (2 Packages)

column18: Request for Expression ofInterest India GEF - Sustainable Urban TransportProject (GEF-SUTP) Consultancy Services for Program Evaluation Study of Deployment of Buses by Cities under JnNURM GEF Grant No. TF095549 - IN This Request for Expressions ofInterest follows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared in Development Business issue on 1 October 2008 The Ministry of UrbanDevelopment has received a grant from the Global Environment Fund (GEF) through International Bank for ReconstructionandDevelopment and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this grant to payments under the contract for Program Evaluation Study for Bus Procurement under JnNURM. In this project the consultantwill determine whether the sanctioning of buses under JnNURM and implementation of related reforms achievedtheir objectives bycomparing the baseline pre-program situation with that after implementation of the project. The consultant shall select relevantperformance indicators which reflect project objectives collect and analyse related data and synthesize and document analysisresults. The objective of the presentconsultancy are as follows:  Analyse thechange in public transport performance due to the deployment of modern buses and implementation of reforms under JnNURM in termsof public transport efficiency effectiveness safety and environmental impact;  Document andcompare the impact of value additions that are the reforms related to the bus modernization program including setting up SpecialPurpose Vehicles (SPVs) changes in network and route structure changes in operations and maintenance practices construction ofdepotsITS implementation and other;  Analyse thechange in bus user satisfaction due to deployment of modern fleet sanctioned under JnNURM and related reforms; and  Propose nationalstrategies and policies required to further enhance the public transport systems in Indian cities based on the lessons learned bythe JnNURM cities that can be applied to future initiatives. The duration of the consultancy services is expected to be 15 monthsfrom the date of award of the contract. The Ministry of UrbanDevelopment now invites eligible consultants toindicate their interest in providing the services. A consultant will be selectedin accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection andEmployment of Consultants by Bank Borrower May 2004 and revised in October 2010 available at www.worldbank.org/procure. Million) - Start Date (dd/mm/yyyy) - Completion Date (dd/mm/yyyy) - Detailed Narrative Description of the Project - Detailed Description of the Actual Services Provided by your Firm relevant to the assignment (Policy and itsimplementation Operations andmanagement Program / Project Evaluation) Indicate no more than 20 reference projects (1-2 pages per project) that thefirm/association/joint venture feels are relevant to this project. It is desirable that a summary table of all projects listedshould also be provided. [Termsof Reference for the consultancy can be found on www.sutpindia.com and www.urbanindia.nic.in] Interested Consultants mayobtain further information if required at the address given below: Name of officer: Ms Rachna Kumar Under Secretary (MRTS IV) Name of office: Ministry of Urban Development (Govt. of India) Postal address: Room No. 311 B Wing Nirman Bhawan Maulana Azad Road New Delhi-110108 India Telephone number: 91-11-2306 2964 E-mail: rachna.kumar@nic.in Website: www.sutpindia.com During office hours: 1000 Hours to 1700 Hours on all working days from Monday to Friday. Mr Dinesh Kumar Director Ministry of Urban Development Government of India Room No 313-B Nirman Bhawan Maulana Azad Road New Delhi110001 Tel: 011-23062474/64691073 Web site: www.jnnurm.nic.in. E mail: usjnnurm4@gmail.com Project Director (CBUD) ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ Nodal Training Agency for Delivery of Phase-I of Training and Study Visits to Best Practices Training under the CBUD project is proposed to be conducted in two Phases. Phase l of the training program consists oftraining courses in subject areas that have been identified on the basis of visits to the project cities and in-depth interactionwith the ULBs officials and staff. Further training needs (Phase-II) of the ULBs isbeing assessed through a detailed formal training needs assessment study under a separate procurement process that will lead topreparation of a Strategic Training Plan to be implemented under Phase-II TrainingProgram. The first phase training will be conducted in the following subject areas: 1. Orientation Programme for Elected Councilors ofthe ULBs; 2. Municipal Financial Resource Mobilisation fromTax and Non-Tax Sources; 3. Double Entry Accrual based Accounting System; 4. Project Development and Management for UrbanInfrastructure Projects; and 5. Urban Service Delivery ? Performance ImprovementPlanning Financing & Maintenance During the contract period of 18 months the Training Agency (TA) will conduct training courses in four clusters of cities(mentioned below) into which the 30 CBUD project cities have been grouped for the purpose of conducting the first phase training.With a view to bring large number ofULB staff under the first phase training the TA will need to conductone training workshop ineach of the five subject areas of training in each cluster. A total of 20 training workshops would need to be conducted during thecontract period in all the four clusters. Each workshop will consist of three days of training; two and a half days would bedevoted to class room workshop and the remaining half a day will be used to take the participants on field visit within the city orin theneighboring city to study a good practice related to the subject areaof training. Each training workshop will have 20 to 25participants. Cluster of Cities for the First Phase Training Roll Out S.N. Cluster l Cluster ll Cluster lll Cluster lV 1 Allahabad Guntur Guwahati Jabalpur 2 Varanasi Hubli Gangtok Dewas 3 DehraDun Visakhapatnam Shillong Bharuch 4 Chandigarh Kollam Aizawal Ranchi 5 Kurukshetra Nagpur Siliguri Udaipur 6 Shimla Sholapur Puri Chhindwara 7 YamunaNagar Panaji Cuttack Raipur 8 Jammu 9 Haridwar In addition to 20 training workshops mentioned above the TA will also organize4 in-country study visits (one each for eachCluster of ULBs) to bestpractices within India on the identified 5 subject areas and 2 international study tours to best practicesin urban management. The TA will be responsible for all logistics and professional inputs for conducting trainingprograms/ study visits including; training venue; audio-visual/ computer support; participants board/ lodging and travel/transport arrangements related to the training event.

column4: Preparation Of Detailed Project Report For Solid Waste Management For Selected Cities
column10: Ministry of Urban Development Government of India
column12: 134-C Nirman Bhawan Maulana Azad Road
column18: Government of India MINISTRY OF URBAN DEVELOPMENT REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST (REOI) (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) INDIA CAPACITY BUILDING FOR URBAN DEVELOPMENT (CBUD) PROJECT Credit No.: 4997-IN Assignment Title:"Preparation of Detailed ProjectReport for Solid Waste Management for selected cities" (Reference No.: CBUD/SD/26) The Government of India has received financing from the International Development Association (IDA) toward the cost of theCapacity Building for Urban Development Project (CBUD) andintends to apply part of the proceeds for consulting services. Thedetails of the required consulting services ("the Services") are available at www.jnnurm.nic.in. The Ministry ofUrban Development Government of India nowinvites eligible consultancy firms (Consultants) to indicate their interest in providing the services for "Preparation of Detailed Project Report for Solid Waste Management for selected cities"(CBUD/SD/26) Interested firmshould provide information demonstrating thatthey have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services. The short listing criteria include generalexperience of firm; staff strength including staff having experience in the relevant field; experience of studies in urban (Waterand Sanitation) sector; experience of similar assignments (MunicipalSolid WasteManagement related) The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph1.9 of the World BanksGuidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants]byWorld Bank Borrowers [May 2004revisedin October 2006 and May 2010] ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict ofinterest. Consultants mayassociate with other firms in the form of ajoint venture or a subconsultancy to enhance their qualifications. An agency will be selected in accordance with the Quality andCost Based Selection method set out in the Consultant Guidelines. Further information can be obtained at the address below duringoffice hours [0900 to 1730 hours]. Expressions of interest must be delivered to the address below by 04 February2013. Ms. B.P. Sridevi Director Ministry of Urban DevelopmentGoI 134-C Nirman Bhawan Maulana Azad Road New Delhi 110001Tel: 011-23061047/64691073 email: usjnnurm4@gmail.com Project Director (CBUD) Preparationof Detailed Project Report for Solid Waste Management for selectedcities. TheGovernment of India (GoI) is implementing the Capacity Building for Urban Development Project (CBUD) financed by the World Bank.CBUD is configured to provide a comprehensive framework for long term capacity building requirements and incorporatesthe urgentpriorities identified by the GoI for the Ministries of Urban Development (MoUD) and Ministry of Housing and Urban PovertyAlleviation (MoHUPA). The Project has two components: (I) Capacity Building for Strengthened Urban Management; and (2) CapacityBuilding for Effective Urban Poverty Monitoring and Alleviation. MoUD is implementing CBUD project in 30 cities clusteredin 6 zones. Out of the 30 cities following 9 cities areproposed to be taken up forpreparation of Detailed Project Report for Municipal Solid Waste Management with focus on innovative technologies. However thefinal list of cities will be reconfirmed at RfP stage considering willingness and buy-ins from the concerned ULBs. Zone State Cities Zone State Cities North Zone Haryana Kurukshetra East Zone West Bengal Siliguri North Zone Haryana Kurukshetra West Zone Gujarat Rajasthan Bharuch Udaipur South Zone Andhra Pradesh Kerala Vishakhapatnam Guntur Kollam Central Zone Madhya Pradesh Maharashtra Dewas Solapur The proposed consultancy aims at developing acomprehensive detailed project report forMunicipal Solid Waste Management system including exploring innovative technologicaloptions in order to improve the overall urban environment and quality of the life of the population in the selected cities. The purpose of this DPR is to assess the existing SWMsituation of the project cities evaluate the deficiencies and finally prepare a detailed document withcost estimates suggestingoptimum ways to improve substantially the present level of collection transportation and disposal systems. The DPR shall alsofocus on strengthening the institutional and financial systems of the ULBs so that the improvement can be sustained and improvisedsystem works effectively and efficiently.

column18: Government of India Ministry of Women and ChildDevelopment Consulting Services Request for Expression of Interest(REOI) Technical Assistance for Supporting the ICDSSystems Strengthening and Nutrition Improvement Project (ISSNIP) Project ID: P121731 EOI No: 9-3/2010-WBP 1. The Ministry ofWomen and Child Development (MWCD) has applied for aCredit from International Development Association (IDA) towards the cost of theICDS Systems Strengthening and Nutrition Improvement Project (ISSNIP) and intends toapply part of the proceeds for Consultant Services. The services include comprehensive technical assistance for supporting theISSNIP. 2. The services to be provided includetechnical support in the areas of nutrition and health early childhood education and development training and capacity buildingbehavior change communication programme monitoring operations research community and civil society engagement implementationsupport at central state and district levels procurement & financial management supportand human resource development. Theproject will cover about 160 districts in 8 states. 3. column2: ICDS Syst. Strength. & Nut. Imp. Prog.
column4: General Procurement Notice
column10: Ministry of Women and Child Development
column12: Shastri Bhawan
column18: General Procurement Notice GOVERNMENT OF INDIA MINISTRY OF WOMEN & CHILD DEVELOPMENT "ICDS SYSTEMSSTRENGTHENING & NUTRITION IMPROVEMENT PROJECT(ISSNIP)" Project ID: P121731 Date: 3 May 2011 The Ministry of Women & Child Development (MWCD) hasapplied for a Credit from the International Development Association (IDA) in the amount of US$ 450 million equivalent towards thecost of the ICDS Systems Strengthening and Nutrition Improvement Project (ISSNIP) and itintends to apply the proceeds of this Credit to the payments for consulting services to be procured under this project. The proposed project would be implemented in two distinct phases withthe overallobjective to improve child development and nutrition outcomes of children in India. The project development objective of Phase 1 ofthe project would be: (i) to strengthen the policy framework systems and capacities of the ICDS programme at the national leveland inselected states/districts to deliver quality services to facilitate communityengagement and to ensure a focus on children under 3; and (ii) to strengthen coordinated and convergent nutrition planning andactions at the national leveland in selected states. Theproject will have following components: 1) ICDS Systems Strengthening 2) Community Mobilization & Behavior ChangeCommunication 3) Piloting Convergent Nutrition Actions: 4) Project Management Monitoring and Evaluation Under component 4 there will be comprehensive technical and programme management supportto the other components of ISSNIP viz. ICDS systems strengthening community mobilization and BCC and convergent actions for addressing malnutrition.The services to be providedinclude technical support in the areas of nutrition and child development early childhood education anddevelopment training and capacitybuilding behavior change communication programme monitoring operations research community andcivil society engagement implementation support at central state and district levels procurement & financial managementsupport and human resource development. The project will cover about 160 districts across 8 states in India. Procurement of contracts financedby the Credit will be conducted through the procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans andIDA Credits dated January 2011(the Procurement Guidelines) and is open to all the bidders from eligible source countries asdefined in the guidelines. Consulting services will be selected in accordance with the World Banks Guidelines: Selection andEmployment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers dated January 2011 (theConsultant Guidelines) Specific procurement notices for the contracts to be bidunder the World Banks international competitive bidding (ICB) procedures and for large-value consultants contracts will beannounced as they become available in UN Development Business DGMarket and National newspaperand local newspapers. The following large value consulting contracts are expectedunder theproject: (i) comprehensive technical assistance for supporting ISSNIP (ii) baseline surveys etc Interested eligible bidders/consultants who wish to beincluded on the mailing list to receive an invitation to bid under ICB procedure andinterested consultants who wish to receive acopy of the advertisement requesting expression of interest for large value consultingservices contracts or those requiring additional information should contact the address below: Dr. Shreeranjan IAS Joint Secretary Ministry of Women and ChildDevelopment Government of India Shastri Bhawan New Delhi 110 001 Tel: 2338 7683 E-Mail ID:procurement.issnip@gmail.com; Copy to shreeranjan@nic.in
