column2: Mizoram State Roads II- Reg Connectivity
column4: General Procurement Notice
column12: O/o Chief Engineer(Roads)PWD
column18: UPDATED GENERAL PROCUREMENTNOTICE Country: India Name of the Project: Mizoram State RoadsII-RegionalTransport Connectivity Project (MSRP II) UPDATED GENERAL PROCUREMENTNOTICE Credit No. : Yet to Be Allocated Project id:P145778 This is an updated GPN as more details have become available now.This replaces the earlier GPN published on UNDB online in May 2013. The Government of India has applied for financing from theInternational Development Agency (IDA) toward the cost of the Mizoram State Roads II-Regional Transport Connectivity Project(MSRPII) and intends to apply part of the proceeds to payment for goods works and services to be procured under this project. The project will include the following components: Component A: Improvementof Priority Cross-border Roads and Trade-Related Infrastructure (US$ 120 million) i. Widening and strengthening of 99km of road and preparation studiesfor 330km of road (US$ 115.0 million). Widening and strengthening of three sections of (Group 1) road totaling 99 km including (i)a 30.0 km section of Lunglei ? Tlabung ? Kawrpuichhuah Road on the border with Bangladesh; (ii) 27.5km Champhai-Zokhawthar Road onthe border with Myanmar; and (iii) the 41.7km Chhumkhum-Chawngte North-South alignment connecting to the border roads withBangladesh to the west and Myanmar to the south. Concurrently the project would fund detailed studies and designs for another330km of (Group 2) road in the North-South Corridor. Many of theseroads would be greenfield and would increase the connectivityboth within the state ? improving access to transport infrastructure and services for isolated communities ? as well as to keyinternational trunkroads and transport corridors that connect to other NE India states Bangladesh Chittagong Port and the rest ofSouth Asia and to Myanmar. The alignment starts at Junction NH44A (Origination) passing throughChungtlang Darlung BuarpuiThenlum Zawlpui Phairuangkai and Chawngte. Road Safety Improvement Projects will also be incorporated in projectcorridors. ii. Construction or improvement of trade-related infrastructure alongproject roads including market haat structures and truck stops (US$ 5 million). These infrastructure not only improve the tradecapacity of the residents of the state and of the region they also are key benefit-sharing measures as requested by thecommunities and help improve road safety along projectroads. Market haat structures provide a safe place for local communities tomarket and sell their produce and goods instead of selling on the side of the road in self-made structures that may be unsound andthat may be located in unsafe locations from a road safety perspective.Truck stops provide a safe place for drivers to stop alongproject corridors which would enhance safety for both truck drivers as well as other traffic sharing the road and residents livingalong project corridors. Component B: Road SectorModernization and Performance Enhancement through Institutional Strengthening (US$ 8 million). This component will support gradualtransformation ofPWD into a modern road agency through implementation of a Road SectorModernization Plan (RSMP) which will carryforward and deepen variousinstitutional development initiatives introduced under the MSRP I. The RSMP will be periodically reviewedand modified during project implementation and will focus on: i. Modernization of policies engineering practices and business procedures: Key activities includedevelopment and modification of sector policies and strategies engineering manuals and studies to introduce improved practices ofdesign construction quality monitoring and maintenance of hill roads includinga procurement and contract management manual; ii. Asset management and maintenance: Modification of the existing maintenance management system into an AssetManagement System (AMS) including an asset management strategy operationalization of the existing road maintenance fund assetmanagement information system strategic core road network of key state and regional corridors technical assistance to mobilizeadditional funds for road maintenance and use of simple maintenance contracts to deliver maintenance works including communitybased contracts (The contracts are to be funded through PWDs maintenance budget); iii. Institutional and Human Resource Development: Development and implementation of an Human Resources Development Strategy to build capacity of PWD engineers and other staff improvement of PWD institutionalstructure including measures to increase efficiency and staff productivity capacity building of the local construction industrystrengthening ofPWD design cell and carrying forward the computerization of PWD initiated under MSRPI. iv. Road Safety Management: Support further refinement and implementationofPWD road safety strategy focusing on building road safety management capacity of PWD and related agencies through suitabletraining and other measures road safety audits of important traffic corridors road safety improvement projects on identified roadsections  integrating road safety in asset management system and awareness programs on road safety and work zonesafety. Procurement of contracts financed by the IDA will beconducted through the procedures as specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement underIBRD Loans and IDA Credits (January 2011) and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in theguidelines. Consultingservices will be selected in accordance with the World Banks Guidelines: Selection andEmployment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (January 2011). Specific procurement notices for contracts to be bidunder the World Banksprocedures and for contracts for consultancy services will be announced as they become available inUN Development Business online the Banks external website and in national newspapers ofwide circulation and in a widely-used electronic portal with free national and international access as may beapplicable. As of now the following contracts areenvisaged; LARGE WORKSCONTRACTS Sl.No. Description of theProject Estimated Cost (in Million US$) 1 Champhai-ZokhawtharRoad Project (27.25 Km) 26.32 2 Chhumkhum ?Chawngte Road Project(41.53) 38.56 3 Lunglei-PhairuangRoad Project (30 Km) 33.87 LARGE CONSULTANCY SERVICES CONTRACTS Sl.No. Description of the ConsultancyServices Estimated Cost (in MillionUS$) 1 Project Preparation ConsultantI 1.50 2 Project Preparation ConsultantII 1.20 3 Construction SupervisionConsultant 2.00 4 Project Management Consultant 1.50 ========================================= GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE INDIA: MIZORAM STATE ROADS II PROJECT(MSRP II) TRANSPORT SECTOR : Transport Credit No: Not yet allotted (project under preparation) Project ID No. : P145778 The Govt. of India intends to apply for financing in the amount of US$ 300million equivalent from the World Bank towards the cost of the Mizoram State Road Project(MSRP II) and it intends to apply part of the proceeds to payments for goods works related services and consulting services to beprocured under this project. The project will include the following components :- 1) Upgradation of existing roads and new construction for corridor connecting NH44?A with Kaladan Multimodal Road for a total length of about 350Km to a double lanestandard comprising site clearance earthworks pavement cross drainage protective and environmental management works bridgessafety and traffic management measures. 2) Consultancy Services for the project preparation supervision of construction of roads project management and contractadministration for the Civil Works contract and for advisory service for the implementationof an Institutional Development Strategy(IDS) action plan of Public Works Department (PWD). 3) Procurement of equipments and logisticsupport for the implementation of the (IDS) action plan of the PWD Procurement of contracts financed by the World Bank will be conductedthrough the procedures as specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans andIDA Credits(January 2011) and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in the guidelines.Consulting services will be selected in accordance with the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers(January2011). Specific procurement notices for contracts to be bidunder the WorldBanks international competitive bidding (ICB) procedures and for contracts for consultancy services will be announced as theybecome available in UN DevelopmentBusiness on line Banks external website and in national newspapers of wide circulation and in a widely usedelectronic portal with free national and international access. As of now the following ICB/NCB contracts/ consultancy services areenvisaged: 1 Civil Works Contracts (190 Km) for the following pakages I LUNGLEI-TLABUNG-KAWRPUICHHUAH-2 SEC (112 Km) II CHAMPHAI-ZOKHAWTHAR(28 Km) III CHHUMKHUM-CHAWNGTE(48Km) 2 ProjectMonitoring Consultant (PMC) 3 ConstructionSupervision and Contract Administration Consultant 4 Institutional Development Strategy This GeneralProcurement Notice will be further updated once more contract packages become available.

column4: Hiring Of Consultancy Services For Technical Support Consultant (tsc)
column12: First Floor Mini Shopping Complex NBCC Place Lodhi Road New Delhi- 1100
column18: No.A-11012/1/2010-NGRBA-PMGI Government of India Ministry of Environment andForests National Ganga River BasinAuthority Project Management Group Notice Inviting Expression of Interest (EOI) for Technical Support Consultant (TSC) for the World Bank assisted NationalGanga River Basin Project (Global Invitation) The Ministry ofEnvironment & Forests (MoEF) Government of Indiais implementing a World Bank assisted project to facilitate implementation ofa multi-sectoral National Ganga River Basin Authority (NGRBA) programme in the five States ofUttarakhand Uttar Pradesh Bihar Jharkhand and West Bengal. The NGRBA is responsible for planning financing monitoring and co-ordination of activities for effective abatement of pollution andconservation of the riverGanga. The major objectives of the NGRBA are to maintain the desired water quality in Ganga and to ensure minimumecological flowsespecially in the critical stretches. A Project Management Group (PMG) has been set up under the MoEF toco-ordinate & implement at the national level the various activities of the NGRBA programme including those supported underthe World Bank assisted National Ganga River Basin Project. Also State-level PMGs (SPMGs) are being set-up by the respective State Governments toco-ordinate & implement the NGRBA program activities at the State level. Investment proposals will be prepared and implementedby a variety of executing agencies selected by the SPMGs. 2. MoEF is seeking Technical Support Consultancy (TSC) services from reputed/experienced organizations/firms to support the SPMGs in the 5 States. While theTSC will be hired centrally by the PMG its services would be aimed at assisting the 5 SPMGs. The same TSC will support all 5states. 3. Scope of Work: The TSC would be responsible for the following: 4. Guiding facilitating and supporting the SPMGs in getting the Feasibility Reports (FRs) andDetailed Project Reports (DPRs) for various investment proposals prepared by the executing agencies as per NGRBA Guidelines. TheNGRBAs infrastructure investments programme will cover investments in wastewater management industrial pollution control solidwaste management and river front management in the 5 states and the total amount of first phase investments is expected to beapprox. Rs4500 crores. The largest fraction (60-70%) of investments will be in the wastewater management sector. Providing the required assistance to the SPMGs for reviewing and improving thequality of FRs and DPRs prepared by the executing agencies before they are submitted tothe PMG for sanction. 4. TheTechnical Support Consultants (TSC) to the PMG would consist of a team of specialists led by a Team Leader. The assignment wouldinitially be for a period of 3 years subject to satisfactory performance review at the endof first and second years and could be extended for a further period of 2 or 3 years based on performance and mutualagreement. 5. MoEFinvites Expression of Interest (EOI) from consulting firms toindicate their interest in providing services for above mentionedconsultancy support. The interested firms must provide information indicating their past experience in related sectors experienceof key personnel and financial strength to perform the services under the followingheads: (a) PastExperience of the firm - Number of yearsexperience - Past Experienceof work of similar nature-no of projects in the area in the immediate past i.e. 3-5 years - Past experiencein carrying out work in related sectors - Experience ofworking with government (b) Experience of Key Personnel - Qualifications - RelevantExperience including their participation in the projects referred above (c) Financial Strength of the Consultant - Turnover figure of Last three years - Value of contracts in the area of expertise requested - Net Profit figure for Last three years (d) Name of the Associatesifany Specifically the firms should provide information showing their experience in thedesign documentation and implementation of similar investments and in particular of large scale municipal servicesinfrastructure. Consultants may associate or form joint ventures with other firms to enhance their qualification. Consulting firmsshall be selectedin accordance with the procedure of the World Bank procurement guidelines "Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by World Bank Borrowers May 2004 revised 2010 available at www.worldbank.org/procure. Interested Consultants may submit Expression Of Interestin an envelope clearly superscripted as "Expression of Interest for the Technical SupportConsultant For NGRBAProject" in one original and five copies to Project Officer(Procurement) National Ganga River Basin Authority (Project Management Group) First Floor Mini Shopping Complex NBCC PlaceLodhi Road New Delhi- 110003 within one month form the date of publishing (01-05-2011). . 6. The Ministry reserves the right to reject all or any of the proposalswithoutassigning any reason thereof. (Brijesh Sikka) Director NRCD MoEF Project Officer (Procurement) National Ganga River Basin Authority (Project Office) Ministry of Environment and Forests. 1 st .FloorMini Market Shopping Complex  NBCC Place. Lodhi Road. New Delhi-110003. Tel: 91-11-24361071 to 1073FAX- 91-11-24361073. E-Mail-sensomdada@yahoo.co.in Web site:http//www.moef.nic.in/module/recent-initiatives/index.html

column4: Hiring Of Agency For Providing Supply Chain Management Services For Health Sector Goods
column12: RITES Ltd. Plot No.1 Sector-29
column18: Request for Expression of Interest (REOI) for Hiring of Agency for Providing Supply Chain Management Services for Health SectorGoods Country: India Name of projects: NACP-III Credit No. 4299 -IN REOI No. RITES/MSM/NACP/2010/REOI/SCM/01/REBID This request forexpressions of interest follows the General Procurement Notice for this project that appeared in United Nations DevelopmentBusiness (UNDB) Website on 16th April 2007. National AIDS ControlOrganisation (NACO) Department of AIDS Control Ministry of Health & Family Welfare Govt. of India has received financialassistance from World Bank and other development partners and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this financial assistanceto payments under the contract for Hiring of Agency for providing above services. The procurement plan along with list of items canbe seen in "Projects & Programs" at www.worldbank.org and list of SACS can be obtained from www.nacoonline.org. RITES as Procurement Agentfor NACO needs to hire an Agency with sound professional base in Supply Chain Management. The Agency would be required to monitorsupplies of goods including drugs medical supplies equipments kits consumables etc. at multiple stock/user points across thecountry through 38 SACS andother locations. However the agency would not be required to do actual transportation or shifting ofgoods from one place to another place.The agency shall initially be hired for one year which can be furtherextended for another oneyear subject to need and performance. Tasks to becarried out: The Professional Agency shall require to perform the under mentioned Scope of Work  Co-ordinate with supply chain partners to ensure smooth flow of goodsincluding drugs medical supplies equipment  consumables etc. at several destination points across the country  Follow up to ensure timely & safe supply at destination points fromthe supplier(s) and coordination with inspection agency  Provide on going support and data inputs for "delivery and stock level"and projection of requirement for next procurement cycle.  Review of inventory management of expirables at selected primary and/orintermediate stock points  Coordinate with inspection agency during post delivery inspection ofdrugs medical supplies equipment kits and consumables etc.  Maintenance of complete record of activities undertaken RITES Ltd. on behalf of MOH&FW now invites eligible consultancy firm/company to indicate their interest inproviding these services. Interested consultancy firm/company must provide information indicating that they are qualified toperform the services (brochures description of similar assignments executed by the consultancy firm/company andnumber of key staff along with their qualification and experience in similar projects and so forth). Individual consultant(s) will not be considered eligible. A consultancy firm/companywill be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World BanksGuidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultantsby World Bank Borrowers (current edition). Interested consultancyfirm/companymay obtain further information at the address below from 1000 to 1600hrs. (IST). EOI must be deliveredin sealed envelope subscribed with REOI No. mentioned above at the address given below by 14:00 Hours on 12 th January 2012. General Manager/MSMDivision RITES Ltd. Plot No.1Sector-29 Gurgaon-122001(Haryana)-India. Web Site: www.rites.com Email: rites_naco@rediffmail.com rites_naco@rites.com Tel: 91(124) 2818208/2818241/2818202 Fax:91(124)2571659/2571660

column4: Provision To Support The Development Of The Indian Railways Long Term Strategy For Suburban Railway
column12: 2nd floor Churchgate Railway Station Building
column18: INDIA MUMBAI URBAN TRANSPORT PROJECT 2A (IBRD LoanNo. 7941-IN) INSTITUTIONALDEVELOPMENT OF THE SUBURBAN RAIL SYSTEM: SUPPORT TO INDIANRAILWAYS IN THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF SUBURBAN RAIL STRATEGY 1. This request for Expression of Interest follows the GeneralProcurement Notice for this project that has appeared in Development Business issue volume 32 Number 751 of 31st May 2009. 2. Mumbai Railway Vikas Corporation (MRVC) Ltd. is a PSU ofMinistry of Railways which has the equity participation with Govt. of Maharashtra in the ratio of 51:49 respectively. MRVC hasreceived a loan from International Bank for Reconstruction and Development for MUTP 2A and intend to apply part of the proceedsofthis loan to payments under the contract for "Institutional Development of the Suburban Rail System : Support to Indian Railways inthe design & Implementation of Suburban Rail Strategy". 3. Mumbai Suburban Railway Networkoperated by two zonalrailways i.e. Central & Western Railway connecting island city with its suburbs is amongst the most intensivelyused systemsin the world. Each day Central and Western Railway operate more than 2600 suburban passenger trains per day and carry about 7.1millions of passengers. 4. Scope ofServices: 4.1 The study covered by this TOR isfor Institutional Development of the Suburban Rail System : Support to Indian Railways in the design & Implementation ofSuburban Rail Strategy. 4.2 The major objectivesof the studies is : To support initiatives by Indian Railways for the implementation of their Strategy for Suburban Railthrough development of legal and institutional arrangements within IR for the future ownership planning expansion managementfinancing and operation of suburban rail services including using Mumbai and one other city (Chennai Delhi or Kolkata) as casestudies for these arrangements and the proposed partnership arrangements between IR and State Authorities. 4.3 The following tasks are identified in general for the study tobe carried out. 4.3.1 Part A : Development of the suburban rail strategy forIR i. IR Suburban Rail OrganizationConcept a) Possible legal status b) Possible institutional arrangements and organizationalstructure c) Objectives of the Suburban RailOrganization. d) Operational responsibility e) Ownership and maintenance of Assets f) Service Planning g) Fares and operating subsidies Who is anticipated to have the key roles and responsibilities h) Business planning - who is anticipated to have the key roles andresponsibilities for 3 -5 year Business Planning i) Strategic Planning for System expansion andcapital investment Who is anticipated to have the key roles and responsibilities for 5? 20 year Strategic Planning j) Partnership Arrangements with StateAuthorities ii. Review of International Experience in theInstitutional Arrangements for Suburban Rail Operations in selected countries (and cities) iii. Framework for Case Studies iv. Design and Evaluation of IRSuburban Rail Organization. a) Definition ofOptions b) Definition of EvaluationCriteria c) Evaluation of Options and selection of a preferred option v. Implementation and CapacityBuilding Program for the Preferred Option a) Implementation Program forrecommended option b) Capacity buildingprogramme. 4.3.2. Part B : Case Study of Mumbai Metropolitan region: vi. MMRDA Concept for MumbaiSuburban Rail Organization. vii. MRVC Concept for MumbaiSuburban Rail Organization viii. Summarize IR MMRDA and MRVCviews and requirements ix. Design and evaluation ofoptions for the MMR Suburban Rail Organization a) Possible institutionalarrangements for Mumbai and outline steps for the achievement of the arrangements to achieve them. b) Define criteria forevaluating the institutional effectiveness of the arrangements c) Evaluatethe options and select a preferred option. x. Implementation and CapacityBuilding Program for the Preferred Option 4.4.1 Output from the Study ? i. The consultant shall submit preliminary design and evaluation of options for IR suburban rail Indian Railway framework forcase study International experience of Suburban rail operation implementation and capacity building program for preferred IRoption. ii. The consultant shall also bring out the same in detail for Mumbai Suburban Rail Network. 5. Mumbai Railway Vikas Corporation now invites eligible consultants to indicatetheirinterest in providing the services. column4: Revenue Maximizing Study In Particular For Non-fare Box Revenue And Affordability For Commuters
column12: 2nd floor Churchgate Railway Station Building
column18: INDIA MUMBAI URBAN TRANSPORT PROJECT 2A (IBRD LoanNo. 7941-IN) REVENUE MAXIMISING STUDY IN PARTICULAR FOR NON-FARE BOX REVENUES WITH AFFORDABILITYSTUDY 1. This request for Expression of Interest follows the GeneralProcurement Notice for this project that has appeared in Development Business issue volume 32 Number 751 of 31st May 2009. 2. Mumbai Railway Vikas Corporation (MRVC) Ltd. is a PSU ofMinistry of Railways which has the equity participation with Govt. of Maharashtra in the ratio of 51:49 respectively. MRVC hasreceived a loan from International Bank for Reconstruction and Development for MUTP 2A and intend to apply part of the proceedsofthis loan to payments under the contract for "Selection of Consultant for the Study of Revenue maximizing study in particular fornon-fare box revenues with affordability study. 3. Mumbai Suburban Railway Networkoperated by two zonalrailways i.e. Central & Western Railway connecting Island city with its suburbs is amongst the most intensivelyused systemsin the world. Each day Central and Western Railway operate more than 2600 suburban passenger trains per day and carry about 7.1millions of passengers. 4. Scope ofServices: 4.1 The study covered by this TOR is toexamine proposals for revenue maximizing in particular for non-fare box revenues with affordability study. 4.2 The major objectivesof the studies are :  To identify ways to increase the revenue of the suburban train system focusing on non fare boxrevenue  To study and review the socio-economic profile of customers and examine thejustification for financial cross-support from other economic agents as well as the potential for fare adjustment in relation toaffordability and service quality. 4.3 The following tasksare identified in general for the study to be carried out. i. Review of Past &Current studies such as TRANSFORMIndian Railways vision 2020 etc. ii. Estimation of potentialrevenue: Consultant shall ? a) consider the means of maximizing sources revenue and estimate potentialincome such as Advertising including inside and outside local trains Platforms Rental of commercial space at stationsCommercial development at stations or on other suburban rail land Indirect user charges including payroll taxes and increasedproperty taxes in areas around stations Pay and use amenities etc. b) review the existing rental system of stalls and commercial activities at suburbanstations and suggest the system for enhancing the potential of revenues from these sources. c) carry out the feasibility Study or Concept Plan for revenue maximizing on selectedsuburban stations inside and surroundings (one major and one medium size each onWestern and Central Railway). d) provide the scope of revenue generation from non fare boxareas time and cost based implementation schedule with and without any institutional and regulatory changes that may berequired. iii. Socio economic profile of customers andaffordability a. Toreview the existing pattern of fare for suburban rail network and optimizing the overall levels of fares (according to what the market will bear) while protecting the lowerincome passengers. b. To undertake surveys to update/refine available information in thesocio-economic profile ofcustomers current overall expenditure on transport and the percentage of income. c. Toidentify the potential using different models for fare adjustment in relation with affordability willingness to pay keeping thesocio economic profile of commuters in consideration. iv. Guided Study Tour/Training to other major suburban systems ? v. Interaction with Stake-holders such as MRVC Railways MMRDA etc.: 4.4 Output from the Study ? Estimation of potential revenue atselected suburban stations for both fare box and non-fare box areas cost and time based implementation schedule changes required in the Institutional and regulatory system enhancing the potential for generating therevenues with or without any institutional and regulatory changes Fare affordability andfare table adjustment based on socio economic profile opportunities of mobilizing other economic agents. and impacts onrevenue. 4.5 The study including training will be completedin about 9 Months. 5. Mumbai Railway Vikas Corporation now invites eligible consultants to indicatetheirinterest in providing the services. The consultants should specifically mention the form of association if any in their EOI. 6. column4: Development Program For Mumbai Suburban Rail Services
column12: 2nd floor Churchgate Railway Station Building
column18: INDIA MUMBAI URBAN TRANSPORT PROJECT 2A (IBRD LoanNo. 7941-IN) SELECTION OF CONSULTANT FOR THE STUDY OF DEVELOPMENT AND EXPANSIONPLAN FOR MUMBAI SUBURBAN RAIL NETWORK 1. This request for Expression of Interest follows the GeneralProcurement Notice for this project that has appeared in Development Business issue volume 32 Number 751 of 31st May 2009. 2. Mumbai Railway Vikas Corporation (MRVC) Ltd. is a PSU ofMinistry of Railways which has the equity participation with Govt. of Maharashtra in the ratio of 51:49 respectively. MRVC hasreceived a loan from International Bank for Reconstruction and Development for MUTP 2A and intend to apply part of the proceedsofthis loan to payments under the contract for "Selection of Consultant for the Study of Development and Expansion Plan for MumbaiSuburban Rail Network. 3. Mumbai Suburban Railway Networkoperated by two zonalrailways i.e. Central & Western Railway connecting island city with its suburbs is amongst the most intensivelyused systemsin the world. Each day Central and Western Railway operate more than 2600 suburban passenger trains per day and carry about 7.1millions of passengers. 4. Scope ofServices: 4.1 The study covered by this TOR is toexamine proposals for the physical development /expansion of the suburban rail system and to develop a long term strategicplan. 4.2 The major objectivesof the studies are : (i) To develop time basedand costed proposals for physical expansion increasing capacity andimproving the service quality in line with the changing needsof the commuters of the suburban rail system by 5 year stages from 2016 to 2031. (ii) To carry out pre-feasibility study fortheinvestment proposals for the period 2016-2021 including cost estimates and the financial and economic viability of theproposed projects. (iii) To help in strengthening of transport planningskills particularly suburban rail network and transfer all data planning model/tools and knowledge obtained through the study toMRVC and MMRDA as requested to other agencies such as Indian Railways Western & Central Railways. 4.3 The following tasksare identified in general for the study to be carried out. i. Review of Past &Current studies such as TRANSFORMIndian Railways vision 2020 etc. ii. Assessment of estimated demand: Validating/revalidating and updating the estimate of the demand of suburban rail services for thenext 20 years i.e. from the year 2011 to 2031 based on household surveys carried out byvarious studies conducted by Railways MMRDA etc. iii. Identify Proposals for Expansion of suburban rail network : Based on the basicmaterial and consultants ownexpertise and experience the Consultant shall developproposals for system expansion of suburbanrail network. These proposals should includethe following items: a. Extension of the existing rail corridors b. Identification of new rail corridors in Mumbai Suburban RailNetwork c. Additional tracks on existing corridors to enhancecapacity d. Extension of platform lengths to accommodate 15 cartrains. e. Development of new terminals at intermediate points with heavydemands. iv. Develop proposals for increasing system capacity comfort and quality of service. v. Develop Proposals for Station Improvements vi. Mode Shift ? Identify actions that arenecessary to induce road users to migrate to rail transport so that carbon emissions are reduced vii. Prefeasibility studies ?to undertake the prefeasibility studies for theidentified projects in the period of 2016-2021 in order of priority. viii. Guided Study Tour/Training to other major suburban systems ? ix. Interaction with Stake-holders such as MRVC Railways MMRDA etc. : 4.4 Output from the Study ? i. A costed time based andprioritized development plan for the suburban rail system by five year stages to the year 2031 prefeasibility studies for theidentified projectsin the period of 2016-2021 in order of priority and Financial and economic analysis of theproposals. ii. The Consultant shallconduct the financial and economicanalysis of the development proposals and will comment on the financial viability of each of theproposal. 4.5 The study including training will be completedin about 12 Months. 5. Mumbai Railway Vikas Corporation now invites eligible consultants to indicatetheirinterest in providing the services. column4: Wbr 60-third Party Quality Audit And Quality Monitoring Of Civil Works In Mwsip Under The Jurisdiction Of The Superintending Engneer Quality Control Circle Pune
column12: Bungalow No.2 Gunvatta Bhawan Jail Road Yerwada
column18: 1. This request for expressions ofinterest follows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared in Development Business issue No. 712 of 16 October2007 2. The Government of Maharashtra hasreceived a loan from the international Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) and intends to apply part of the proceeds ofthis loan to payments under the contract for Consultancy assignment for Third Party Quality Audit and Quality Monitoring of CivilWorks in Maharashtra Water Sector Improvement Project under the jurisdiction of the Superintending Engineer QualityControl Circle Pune. 3 The services include (1)Monitoring & evaluation of performance of qualitycontrol and quality assurance of various materials and civil works executed & ongoing under MWSIP based on the establishedQuality Control and Quality Assurance Manual (QC/QAManual) (2) Thescope of Quality Monitoring and Quality Audit under this consultancy includes total 79 schemes (in Puneand Konkan Region). (3) To prepare & submit monthly quarterly & final report to the authorities for review & acceptance coveringthe status of quality of work ineach contract of projects covered under this assignment (4) Evaluate the completed works for acceptance asit is or in partial. (5)Consultant shall suggest the remedies to be taken up for the defective works so that same can make acceptable stage afterimplementing those remedial works.(6) Consultantshall independently conduct all necessary tests to verify quality of workof each contract by selecting random samples with histesting equipment at his own cost. (7) The Consultant shall undertake field visits to all completed as well as on goingworksites at periodic intervals to evaluate the quality of work executed and also to ensure quality monitoring of ongoing works.(8) The Consultant shall submit certificate for all contracts with respect to technical specifications. Period of Implementationfor the assignment is 9 (Nine) months. 4. The Superintending EngineerQuality Control Circle Pune now invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested consultants must provide information indicatingthat they are qualified to perform the Services (brochures description of similarassignments experience in similar conditionsavailability of appropriate skills among staff etc.) Consultants may associate to enhance their qualifications. (The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (withjoint and several liability) or of a sub consultancy) 5. A consultant will be selected inaccordance with the Quality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) procedures setout in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection andEmployment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers May 2004 (Revised October 1 2006) 6. Interestedconsultants may obtainfurther information at the address below during office hrs (10.00 to 17.00) SuperintendingEngineer Quality Control Circle Pune Bungalow No.2Gunvatta Bhavan Jail Road Yerwada Pune 411 006. Telephone No.02026684167 seqccpn@gmail.com Fax No.02026684167 7. Expressions of interest must be delivered to the address below by23 November 2012 up to 17.00 hrs. Superintending Engineer Quality Control Circle Pune Bungalow No.2Gunvatta Bhawan Jail Road Yerwada Pun e411 006 Telephone No.02026684167 seqccpn@gmail.com Fax No.02026684167

column4: Hiring Of Consultancy Services For Business Planning Development Units (bpdus) Of Icar
column12: 5th Floor KAB-II Pusa Campus
column18: Indian Council of Agricultural Research National Agricultural Innovation Project Project Implementation Unit Krishi Anusandhan Bhavan # II Pusa New Delhi # 110 012 Country: IndiaCONSULTANCY SERVICES Name of theProject: National Agricultural Innovation Project (NAIP) Credit No.: 4161-IN & 4162-IN Sector:Agriculture Extension and Research Project ID No.: P092735 EXPRESSION OF INTEREST 1. The Government of India (GOI) has received a credit from the International DevelopmentAssociation (IDA) for funding the National Agricultural Innovation Project (NAIP) of the Indian Council of AgriculturalResearch(ICAR) and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this Credit to payment towards a consultancy for long term development andcapacity building of Business Planning Development Units (BPDUs) of ICAR. 2. The services include:  Implementation by a high quality commercially strong consultant who will work withand develop the role of BPDUs over a period of 2 years. This consultancy will focus onlonger term sustainability of the BPDUs developing a range of business models for technology promotion reflecting the wide rangeand scale of technologies being generated and aiming for a longer term shift in the way that Indian agricultural science seeks tocarry out its near market research # which will results in a higher percentage of research projects ending up beingcommercialized.  This will involve a participative approach for 2 years time scale inwhich theconsultant will work in partnership with the 10 BPDUs to develop their capacity use experiential learning processes leveragelearning from their existing programs (and especially those of NAIP) andalso have a leadership role to build the foundation of theways that BPDU operates in the future.  To carry out pilot implementationprototype for overall development of BPDU  To develop a roadmap for roll out of the BPDUs in ICAR. Implementation Period: 24 months Monitoring Organization: Project Implementation Unit (PIU) NAIP 3. The Project Implementation Unit (PIU) NAIP now invites eligible consultants to indicatetheir interest in providing the services. Interested consultant must provide the following information indicating that they arequalified to perform the services: a. Company profile with organization setup and details of experiences. b. Core business of the firm and number of years in business. c. General qualification and number of professional staff including the specificqualification required for this assignment. d. Experience showing the handling of Business Planning & development projects inIndia. 4. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the WorldBanks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of consultant by World Bank Borrowers May 2004 revisedOctober 2006. 5. Interested consultants may obtain further information at the address given below on anyworking days from 1000 to 1700 hours. 6. Expression ofInterest must be submitted to the address given below by 23.08.2011 till 1600 hours. Kumar Rajesh UnderSecretary NationalAgricultural Innovation Project (NAIP) ProjectImplementation Unit 5th FloorKAB-II Pusa Campus New Delhi-110012 India Telefax:++91-11-2584 1473 Fax ++91-11-2584 3403 Email:kumarrajesh@icar.org.in

column4: General Procurement Notice
column12: 6th & 9th Floor Chanderlok Building36 Janpath
column18: INDIA Proposed FOURTH NATIONAL HIV/AIDS CONTROL PROJECT (NACP-IV) Sector: Health Nutrition andPopulation GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE Project Identification No. P130299 The Government of India has applied for a Credit from the World Bank toward the cost of the proposed Fourth National HIV/AIDS ControlProject (NACP-IV) and itintends to apply part of the proceeds to payments for goodsworks consulting and non-consulting services to be procured under thisproject. This project will be implemented by National AIDS Control Organization (NACO) India and through AIDS Control Societies ofvarious states union territories and metropolitan cities. The project will include the procurement of following items: Services forTargeted Interventions (TI) Studiescapacity building and other consulting services OpioidSubstitution Therapy (OST) Drugs Procurement of contracts financed by the World Bank will be conductedthrough the proceduresas specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans andIDA Credits (January 2011 edition) and the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by World Bank Borrowers (January 2011 edition) and is open to all eligible bidders/consultants as defined in the guidelines. Specific procurement notices for larger consultancy contracts will beannounced as theybecome available in UNDevelopment Business and in local newspapers/web sites of the implementingagencies. Interested bidders/consultants who wish to receive a copy of advertisement requesting bids or expressions of interest forconsultancy contracts or those requiring additional information should contact the address below. National AIDS Control Organisation Department of AIDS Control (DAC) Ministry of Health & Family Welfare Government of India 6th & 9th Floor Chanderlok Building 36 Janpath New Delhi - 110001 (India) Tel: 91-11-43509999 91-11-23731778 Fax: 91-11-23731746 Email: nacoasdg@gmail.com Web: http://www.nacoonline.org

column4: Setting Up Technical Support Unit(s)
column12: 6th Floor Chandralok Building 36 Janpath
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST (EOI) (Setting up Technical Support Unit(s) ? (TSUs) for providing technical assistance to State AIDS Control Societies inimplementation of National HIV/AIDS Control Program) India Fourth National HIV/AIDS Control Project Phase (NACP? IV) (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) Project ID No. P130299 1. This notice follows the General Procurement Notice published inUN Development Business Online (UNDB online) on May 7 2012. 2. The Government of India has applied for a Credit from the WorldBank to meet a portion of the cost of the proposed NACP-IV andit is intended that part of the proceeds of this Credit will be applied to eligible payments under the contracts for which thisRequest for Expression of Interest is issued. The NACP IV is supported by various donor partners viz. World Bank GFATM and otherdonor partners including funds of Govt. of India. The NACP-IV shall be implemented by National AIDS Control Organization (NACO)Department of AIDS Control Ministry of Health & Family Welfare Govt. of India and State / UT / District AIDS ControlSocieties (SACS) in 35 States of India. 3. The National AIDS Control Organization (NACO) Government of India now invites eligible consultants to indicate theirinterest in setting up Technical Support Unit (TSU) in the states of Jharkhand Madhya Pradesh Chhattisgarh Orissa West Bengal PunjabDelhi and Bihar . The consultant organisation will be required to setup TSU at the respective state capital. If the consultantorganisation intends to send EoI for more than one state separate EoIs for each state should be sent. 4. The consultant organisation will be required to provide technical assistance to the respective State AIDS Control Society/ies(SACS) in implementation of Targeted Intervention program. The Targeted Intervention Program aims to prevent the spread of HIVamong high risk behaviour groups by providing peer Counselling Condom Promotion Needle/Syringe distribution STI screening andtreatment linkages for HIV testing and Care & Support services. The Targeted Intervention Program also aims to prevent thespread of HIV among bridge population like migrants truckers etc. The interested consultant organisation if selected will serve asa Technical Support Unit and will facilitate the exercise of designing planning implementation and monitoring of TargetedIntervention in the respective state on behalf of SACS. 5. The contract will be for a period of 3 years. However the performance of the services will be reviewed each year forconsidering continuation of contract in subsequent year. 6. The Consultant organization must have experience of at least three years of having carried out works of similar nature. Theaverage annual turnover of consultant organization must be atleast Rs. 1.00 Cr.of past three Financial year (F.Y. 2009-10 2010-11and 2011-12) 7. The consultant organisation must have a substantial structure and professional base in providing technical assistance atstate or national level of similar nature preferably in Health and HIV/AIDS. The EoI and capability will be assessed againstevidence of skills and experience in providing services of project planning appraisal implementation monitoring and evaluationincluding financial analysis capacity building of NGOs and Civil Society organizations policy analysis advocacy communicationand condom programming. The consultant organization must have experience in managing inter-disciplinary teams and multiplestakeholders on complex projects in HIV/AIDS or Health sector. The consultant organization must have skills in developing needbased strategies acceptable to vulnerable groups and build up regional supportfor effective implementation. 8. The EoI should be sent along with a Capability statement including a profile of the lead organization and any collaboratingorganizations number of years of existence details of previous partnerships relevant technical and geographical experiencemajor clients Financial turnover for the last three financial years individually. Individual CVs are not required at this stagebut the number and the profile ofthe key staff must be provided. Any EOI with inadequate information and those which do not meetthe above criteria or received after the closing date will not be considered. EOI should be as concise and as focused as possibleto give evidence of the above requirements. The shortlisting will be done on the basis of the above information/documents. Canvassingwith the Government of India NACO State Government or SACS for further information beyond that specifically made available wouldpotentially lead to disqualification. 9. The consultants will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by WorldBank Borrowers (January 2011 edition). The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World BanksGuidelines setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict of interest. 10. The EoIs should be mailed (hard or soft copy) to the followingaddress so as to arrive no later than 17.00 hrs on March 182013. Only the shortlisted candidates shall be later invited to submit detailed proposals Director Finance Department of AIDS Control Ministry of Health and Family WelfareGovt. of India National AIDS Control Organization 6th Floor Chandralok Building 36 Janpath New Delhi 110001 Tel: 011-43509999 Fax 011-23731746 E-mail: dfnaco@gmail.com Website : www.nacoonline.org

column4: Procurement Agent
column12: 9th Floor Chandralok Building 36 Janpath
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST (EoI) (Procurement Agent Services for National AIDS Control Organization) India Fourth National HIV/AIDS Control Project Phase (NACP? IV) (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) Project ID No. P130299 This notice follows the General Procurement Notice published inUN Development Business online (UNDB) online The Government of India has applied for a Credit from the WorldBank to meet a portion of the cost of the proposed NACP-IV and it is intended that part of the proceeds of this Credit will beapplied to eligible payments under the contracts for which this Request for Expression of Interest is issued. The NACP-IV shall beimplemented by National AIDS Control Organization (NACO) Department of AIDS Control Ministry ofHealth and Family Welfare Govt.of India. The National AIDS Control Organisation (NACO) Government ofIndia now invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing the services of a Procurement Agent. Services of a consultant organization will be required forprocuring drugs medical supplies and equipment as well as ensuring the inspection and supply chain management of thegoods/supplies. The consultant will handle the procurement of goods and related services viz. quality assurance and supply chainmanagement to meet NACOs requirements to achieve value for money efficiency transparency probity and adherence to the agreedprocurement arrangements for the project. The contract will be initially for 2 years and 6 months and isextendable up to another two years with inbuilt annual performance reviews. The consultant organisation must have a substantial corporatestructure and professional base in procurement. The EoI and capability will be assessed against evidence of skills and experiencein providing services in the following areas; assisting organisations in procurement; and managing procurement teams on complexprojects preferably in the HIV/AIDS or health sector. The EoI should be sent along with a Capability Statementincluding a profile of the lead organisation and any collaborating organisations covering relevant technical and geographicalexperience along with thefinancial turnover for the last 3 financial years. Experience in assisting organizations in procurement ingeneral and in health sector projects may also be indicated in detail. Individual CVs are not requiredat this stage. Interestedconsultants must also provide information indicating as to how that they are qualified to perform the services (brochuresdescription of similar assignments experience in similar conditions availability of appropriate skills among staff etc.).Details of capability for quality assurance and supply chain management should also be indicated in the EOI. Consultants mayassociate with otherfirms in the form of a joint venture or a subconsultancy to enhance their qualifications. Any EoI withinadequate information those which do not meet the above criteria or those received after the closing date may not be shortlisted. EoI should be as concise and focused as possible to give evidence of the above requirements including the capabilitystatement and organisation profiles. The short listing will be done on the basis of the above information/documents. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the proceduresset out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selectionand Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (January 2011 edition).The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines setting forth the World Bankspolicy on conflict of interest. The EoIs should be mailed to the following address so as toarrive nolater than 15.00 Hrs. on 11 June 2012. The shortlisted organizations shall belater invited to submitdetailed proposals. Under Secretary (Admn &Proc) National AIDS control Organization 9 th Floor Chandralok Building 36Janpath New Delhi -110001 Tel: 011-23351715 Fax: 011-23731746 Web site: www.nacoonline.org

column4: Selection Of Consultant For Design And Implemantation Support For Strengthening Last Mile Connectivity Of Early Warning Dissemination System
column12: National Disaster Management AuthorityNDMA Bhawan A-1Safdarjung Enclave
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OFINTEREST INDIA WORLD BANK AIDED NATIONAL CYCLONE RISK MITIGATION PROJECT-I (NCRMP-I)OF NATIONAL DISASTER MANAGEMENT AUTHORITY(NDMA) SELECTION OF CONSULTANT FOR DESIGN AND IMPLEMANTATION SUPPORT FOR STRENGTHENING LAST MILE CONNECTIVITY OF EARLY WARNINGDISSEMINATION SYSTEM CREDIT NO. 4772 -IN 1. This Request for Expressions of Interest follows the general procurement noticefor this project that appeared in Development Business website www.devbusiness.com on December 32009 and the Times of India on December 9 2009. 2. The Government of India has received a credit from the International DevelopmentAssociation and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this credit to payments under the contract forSelection of Consultant forProcurement & Implementation Partner for implementing Component A of the project (NCRMP I) i.e. strengthening of the Last MileConnectivity in 9 coastal districts of Andhra Pradesh and 6 coastal districts of Odisha covering about 4000 habitations in 760coastal villages of AP and 980 in Odisha. It involves procurement & installation of equipment like GSM/CDMA handsets RemotePublic Alarm Devices (R-PACS) Satellite Phones TETRA equipment and a Project Command & Control Unit (PCCU) etc. and trainingto various stakeholders to receive & respond to advance warnings on Cyclone and other such calamities. 3. TheServices include assisting the NDMA and state agencies in the system design and providing complete technical & otherimplementation support to PMU. The specific task includes assisting in assessing the feasibility of the systems and designing theconfiguration and architecture of the early warning dissimilation system preparation &finalization of specifications ofequipment procurement plan project rollout plan bid document bid process management & assisting in selection ofimplementation partners/service providers/venders installation testing & commissioning of the equipment including QualityAssurance test ensuring Operations & Maintenance arrangements and operational trainingto various stakeholders. 4. The National Cyclone Risk Mitigation Project-I (NCRMP-I) of National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) now invites eligibleconsultants to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested consultantsmust provide information indicating that theyare qualified to perform the Services (brochures description of similar assignmentsexperience in similar conditions availability of appropriate skills among staff etc.). Consultants may associate to enhance their qualifications. The details of Information to be providedare listed in the project web site of NDMA. 5. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by Bank Borrowers May 2004 (revisedOctober 2006 and May 2010). 6. Interested Consultants may obtain further information on qualification etc. at the address given below from 10:00 to 17:00hours on allworking days or at project web site www.ncrmp.gov.in orNDMA website www.ndma.gov.in. 7. Expression of interest must be delivered to the address below by no later than 28 th September 2012. Project Director National Cyclone Risk Mitigation Project (NCRMP) National Disaster Management Authority NDMA Bhawan A-1 Safdarjung Enclave New Delhi ? 110029 Ph:+91 11 26701886 Fax: +91 11 26701840 Email: ncrmp@ndma.gov.in

column4: General Procurement Notice
column12: Project Management UnitAnand
column18: GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE PROJECT MANAGEMENT UNIT (PMU) (Located in NDDB) National Dairy Support Project (NDSP) [Also referred to as the NationalDairy Plan I] Project ID: P 107648 Date: 14 July 2011 The Government of India has applied for a credit from the International Development Association (IDA) inthe amount of US$ 352 million (approximate) towards the cost of the National Dairy Support Project (NDSP) and it intends to applythe proceeds of this credit to the payments for goods works related services and consulting services to be procured under thisproject. The objectives of the National Dairy Support Project (October 2011 toSeptember 2017) are:  Tohelp increase productivity of milch animals and thereby increase milk production to meet the rapidly growing demand for milk.  Tohelp provide rural milk producers with greater access to the organised milk-processing sector. These objectives would be pursued through the adoption of a focused scientific and systematic process in provisionof technical inputs supported by appropriate policy and regulatory measures. The Project will havefollowing components: (A) Productivity Enhancement: i. Improvement in the genetic merit ofcattle and buffalo: a) Production of high geneticmerit (HGM) cattle and buffalo bulls and import of bulls/ semen/ embryos of HF and Jersey breeds for semen production; b) Strengthening existingSemen Production/ Starting new stations for producing high quality disease free semen doses; c) Setting up a pilot modelfor viable doorstep AI delivery services (based on Standard Operating Procedures [SOPs]) through a professional serviceprovider. ii. Scientific approach to feeding of milch animals to produce milkcommensurate with their genetic potential and to reduce methane emission: a) Ration BalancingProgramme; b) Fodder Development. (B) Village based milk procurement systems for weighing testing quality of milk received and making payment to milkproducers. (C) Project Management and Learning. Procurement ofcontracts financed by the Credit will be conducted through the procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Guidelines:Procurement of Goods Works and Non-Consulting Services under IBRDLoans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers" datedJanuary 2011 (Procurement Guidelines) and is open to all the bidders from eligible source countries as defined in the guidelines.The provisions of paragraphs 2.55 and 2.56 of the Procurement Guidelines providing for domestic preference in the evaluation ofbids shall not apply to the goods manufactured in the territory of India or and the works tobe carried out by the domesticcontractors through International Competitive Bidding. Consulting services will be selected in accordance with the World BanksGuidelines: Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World BankBorrowers" dated January 2011 (Consultant Guidelines). Specific procurement notices for the contracts to be bid under the World Banksinternational competitive bidding (ICB) procedures and for large-value consultants contracts will be announced as they becomeavailable in UN Development Business Banks external website and local newspapers. Thefollowing large value goods works and services procurement and consulting Services Contracts are expected under thisProject: Goods and Works: High Genetic Merit Bulls Bulk Milk Coolers Automated Milk CollectionUnits Lab Equipment for Semen Station Computer Hardware & ERP Software Personal Digital Assistant Frozen Semen ContainersLiquid Nitrogen Containers Civil & Utilities Works for New Semen Stationetc. Consulting Services External Monitoring & Evaluation (M&E) Agency Special TechnicalStudies Methane Reduction Emission Studies Architectural Services SME for Progey Testing Individual Consultant for SemenProduction & Processing;Third Party Quality Assurance/Audit Interested eligible bidders/consultants who wish to be included on the mailing list toreceive an invitation to bid under ICB or REOI for large consulting services contracts or those requiring additional informationshould contact the address below by mentioning "NDSP" as a reference in the subjectline: Project Management Unit National Dairy Development Board Anand # 388001 Gujarat INDIA Phone: +91-2692-260148 / 260149 Fax: +91-2692-260157 Email: pmu@nddb.coop Project Management Unit National Dairy Development Board Anand # 388001 Gujarat INDIA Phone: +91-2692-260148 / 260149 Fax: +91-2692-260157 Email: pmu@nddb.coop

column4: Consulting Services For External Monitoring And Evaluation
column10: National Dairy Support Project (National Dairy Plan I)
column12: Project Management Unit (PMU) National Dairy Development Board
column18: Project Management Unit located in NDDB National Dairy Support Project (National Dairy Plan I) Request for Expression ofInterest (REoINo: PMU:HO:PUR:NDP:EoI:012011) ConsultancyServices for ExternalMonitoring and Evaluation of NDP I/NDSP Project ID: P107648 Date: 21 July 2011 1. This Request for Expression of Interest (REoI) follows the General Procurement Notice (GPN) for the National Dairy Support Project (NDSP) also referred to as National Dairy Plan (NDP) I that appeared in the UNDB and World Banks external website on 15 July 2011. 2. The Government of India has applied for a credit from International Development Association (IDA) for NationalDairy Support Project (NDSP). The NDSP is implemented by Project Management Unit (PMU) located in NDDB. The PMU in NDDB intends touse part of the credit towards eligible payments on an assignment for Consulting Services for External Monitoring and EvaluationAgency. 3. The duration of the assignment is 72 months subject to at least two successful performance reviews atpre-determined intervals. 4. The main objective of the assignment is to conduct household surveys for collecting data to monitor performance of the projectat various intervals including a baseline survey before project implementation yearly monitoring surveys mid-term review surveyand end-of-project survey. The main tasks of the assignment will include:  Todevelop a sampling strategy for the surveys including calculatingsample size and applying appropriate techniques to draw a sampleof villages and households.  Todevelop a set of questionnaires (household village etc) and otherdata collection instruments to capture a set of performanceindicators and other socio-economic variables.  Toconduct the data collection surveys while ensuring quality controlthrough effective arrangements for field supervision.  Toenter the data in accepted statistical software clean the data and hand-over the data to PMU in accepted statistical software andwithproper documentation including a data codebook/dictionary. All completed questionnaires must also be handed-over toPMU.  To analyze the data and report the findings in reports and tablessubject to reviews by PMU. 5. The Project Management Unit (PMU) now invites eligible agencies/ consultants to indicate their interest inproviding these services. Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified to perform theservices (brochures description of minimum three similar assignments undertaken by the consultant experience in similarconditions general qualifications and experience and number of key staff appropriate for the assignment financial turn over forlast three years and so forth). 6. Prospective consulting firm(s) may associate to enhance their qualifications but shouldmention whether their association is in the form of either "Joint-Venture" or "Sub-Consultancy". In the case of an association allmembers of such association should havereal and well defined inputs to the assignment and the same should be detailed in the EOI submitted. 7. Agencies/Consultants will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in theWorld Banks Guidelines: "Selection and Employment of Consultants under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World BankBorrowers" dated January 2011 (Consultant Guidelines). 8. Interested Agencies/Consultants may obtain further information at theaddress mentionedbelow from 10:00 Hrs to 16:00 hrs on working days. 9. Eligible Agencies/Consultants are requested to submit Expression of Interest to thefollowing address latest by 26 August 2011 on or before17.00 hrs (IST): Project Management Unit (PMU) National Dairy Development Board Anand 388001 Gujarat India Telephone no.: +91-2692-260148/260149 Faxno.: +91-2692-260159 E-mail ID: purchase.pmu@nddb.coop; Website: www.nddb.org/NDP

column4: Consultancy For Project Management (pmc)
column10: National Ganga River Basin Authority (Project Management Group)
column12: First Floor Mini Shopping Complex NBCC Place Lodhi Road
column18: No.A-11012/1/2010-NGRBA-PMGI Government of India Ministry of Environment andForests National Ganga River BasinAuthority Project ManagementGroup NoticeInviting Expression of Interest (EOI) for Project Management Consultant (PMC) for the World Bank assisted National Ganga RiverBasin Project (Global Invitation) 1. The Ministry of Environment & Forests (MoEF) Government of Indiaisimplementing a World Bank assisted project to facilitate implementation of a multi-sectoral National Ganga River Basin Authority (NGRBA) programme in the five States of Uttarakhand Uttar Pradesh Bihar Jharkhand and West Bengal. The NGRBA is responsible forplanning financing monitoring and co-ordination of activities for effective abatement of pollution and conservation of the riverGanga. The major objectives of the NGRBA are to maintain the desired water quality in Ganga andto ensure minimum ecological flowsespecially in the critical stretches. A Project Management Group (PMG) has been set up under the MoEF to co-ordinate & implement at the national level thevarious activitiesof the NGRBA programme including those supported under the World Bank assisted National Ganga River BasinProject. 2. MoEF is seeking Project Management Consultancy (PMC) services from reputed/experienced organizations/firms to support the PMG. 3. Scope of Work: The PMC would be responsible for the following: Providingcomprehensive program management support to PMG in all aspects (including planning technical procurement and financialmanagement) of implementation of the entire NGRBA programme including the World Bank assisted National Ganga River BasinProject: (i) This will include but will not be limited to comprehensive program management support (facilitating advising and assisting) for the NGRBAs infrastructureinvestments program which will cover investments in wastewater management industrial pollution control solidwaste management andriver front management in the 5 states and the total amount of first phase investments is expected to be approx. Rs. 4500crores. The largest fraction (60-70%) of investments will be in the wastewater managementsector. (ii) Assisting the PMG in managing the various consultancies appointed under theproject. 4. The Project Management Consultants (PMC) to the PMG would consist of a team of specialists led bya Team Leader. The assignment would initially be for a period of 3 years subject tosatisfactory performance review at the end of first and second years and could be extended for a further period of 2 or 3 yearsbased on performance and mutual agreement. 5. MoEF invites Expression of Interest (EOI) from consulting firms to indicate their interest inproviding services for above mentioned consultancy support. The interested firms must provide information indicating their pastexperience in related sectors experience of key personnel and financial strength to perform the services under the following heads: (a) Past Experience of the firm - Number of years experience - Past Experience of work of similar nature-no of projects in the area in the immediate past i.e. 3-5years - Past experience in carrying out work in related sectors. - Experience of working with government. (b) Experience of Key Personnel - Qualifications - Relevant Experience including their participation in the projects referredabove (c) Financial Strength of the Consultant - Turnover figure of Last three years - Value of contracts in the area of expertise requested - Net Profit figure for Last three years. d) Name of the Associate if any Specifically the firms should provide information showing their experience in the design documentation andimplementation of similar investments and in particular of large scale municipal services infrastructure. Consultants mayassociate or form joint ventures with other firms to enhance their qualification. Consulting firms shall be selected in accordancewith the procedure of the World Bank procurement guidelines "Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by WorldBankBorrowers May 2004 revised 2010 available at www.worldbank.org/procure. InterestedConsultants may submit Expression Of Interest in an envelope clearly superscripted as "Expression of Interest for the Project Management Consultant For NGRBA Project" in one original and five copiesto Project Officer (Procurement) National Ganga River Basin Authority (Project Management Group) First Floor Mini Shopping Complex NBCC PlaceLodhi Road New Delhi- 110003 by 25 th April2011. 6. The Ministry reserves the right to reject all or any of the proposalswithout assigning any reasonthereof. (Brijesh Sikka) Director NRCD MoEF

column4: Developing Mobile Application For Multiple Devices
column12: G-5 & 6 Sector 10 Dwarka
column18: INDIA NHAI TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROJECT CONSULTING SERVICES FOR DEVELOPING MOBILE APPLICATION FOR MULTIPLE DEVICES FOR HIGHWAY USERS AND ADMINISTRATORS Loan No. (7980-IN) EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST This request for expressions of interest follows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared in UN Development Business of July 14 2010 The NHAI has received a loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) andintends to apply part of the loan proceeds to make payments under the contract for Developing application for Multiple Devices for Highway Users and Administrators. As the implementation of National Highways across the Country and Development Program (NHDP) progresses the Ministry of Highways andNHAI recognizes that user friendly mobile phone/tablet applications supporting graphical representation with no running cost to user be developed. These applications should work offline without internet /GPRS use for the user to the extent possible. The proposed applications shall support all technology platforms in use ? Blackberry Android IOS etc. The proposed application will be hosted on Data Centre in India and should have tie-up with various Telecom operators as well as SMS Gateway. The proposed application should have flexibility to accommodate future addition in attributes/ fields. The beneficiaries of the application will be Highway Users i.e. Drivers and Passengers and Administrators. Brief of the Functional Requirements (A) Highway Users perspective who are having access touseful information are like route planning Road Alerts viz. Traffic congestion Construction work in progress alternative routes Toll Plaza patrol pump locations rest and service areas Inoperative Toll Lanes ahead and Emergency Situation; Weather conditions; Emergency Phone Numbers of Police Medical Assistance Towing Cab Service Centre and Spare Part;Common car fixes ?step by step guide. (B) NHAI/ MoRTH perspective - Encouraging ETC viz. specifying ETC enabled toll plaza/lane locations Points of availability of RFID tags Smart Cards etc. and Discounts offered; Promoting Road Safety (preventive measures) viz. Message on use of Helmets Seat Belts proper use of Headlights discouraging use of cell phones while driving discouraging drinking and driving and safety tips based on weather & road connections; location and contact details of NHAI/Ministry field offices In order to popularize the proposed application it mayhave functionality for encouraging cross functional applications like booking of metro rail tickets Booking of train tickets Access to banks etc. Linkingto proposed ERP and GIS based project monitoring system of NHAI in future etc. Commercial tie ups with concessionaires vehicle & tyre selling companies telecom operators may help The consultancy contract period will be about 24 months. The NHAI now invites on-line expression of interests from eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing the services. Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified to perform the services (brochures description of similar assignments experience in similar conditions availability of appropriate skills among staff etc.). Consultants may associate other firms in the related field to enhance their qualifications. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by World Bank Borrowers - May 2004 Revised October 2006 and May 01 2010 & January2011. The Shortlisting criteria are enclosed at Annexure ? A.Applicants should score minimum 70% mark on each of the shortlisting criteria to be shortlisted and top six applicants from the shortlisted applicants will be qualified for the RFP Stage. Instructions for electronic EOI :- The EOI is available online at NHAI web portal (http://www.nhai.org)/ "www.tenderwizard.com/NHAI" on e-tendering mode to the registered consultants for e-tendering only. For participating in e-tendering process registration for e-tendering is mandatory for all consultants. The consultants not registered for participating in Etendering mode earlier are requested to register themselves first. The consultants are required to register on this website to have user ID and Password which has to be obtained by submitting an annual registration charges of INR 2247 (inclusive of all taxes to M/s ITI Ltd. and prior to the submission of proposals. The online payment facility for the submission of registration fee (Rs. 2247/-) and tender processing fee (Rs. 13483/-) only inclusive of all taxes shall be paid to E-tender service provider i.e. M/s ITI Ltd. which has been enabled on E-tender portal http://www.tenderwizard.com/NHAI. The tender processingfee has to pay only once i.e. at the time of application. In absence of submission of Tender Processing Fee the Expression of Interest will not be considered.The Tender Processing Fee must be paid one day prior to the last date and time for submission of bid i.e. 5 PM on 15.05.2014. The consultant shall pay registration charges andtender processing fee through E-payment gateway of Punjab National Bank either using Credit/ Debit Card (Master Card and Visa Card) or net banking (PNB account holders only) which is payable to e-tender service provider. The validity of online registration is One year. Consultant is also required to have a Class-III Digital Signature (DSC) in order to submit a proposal on line at the web address indicated above. The list of the authorized Certifying Authorities can be found www.cca.gov.in. For training clarification queries and registration on e-Tendering process all consultants may contact [(i) Mr. Krishna at 08800900127 (ii) Mr. Mithun Ghosh at 0882604002 Mr. Rajesh Kumar at 09868123587] Interested consultants may obtain further information at the address below from 1100 to 1600 hours on working days (Monday to Friday) from 9.30 AM to 6.00 PM The last date and time of submission of Expressions of interest online is 16.05.2014 at 11:30 Hrs. The NHAI has received aloan from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) and intends to apply part of theloan proceeds to make payments under the contract for Consulting Services for Technical Assistance to strengthen AssetManagement Capacity of NHAI and Ministry. As theimplementation of National Highways across theCountry and Development Program (NHDP) progresses the Ministry of Highways and NHAIrecognizes that its operations would need more focus on network based road asset management. The proposed services shall includedeveloping a comprehensive and structured asset management approach including preparation of a framework for NHAI and Ministry ofRoadTransport and Highways to implement capacity building activities in this area. As part of these services consultants shallalso review existing systems/tools including the Road Information System (RIS) already developed by NHAI in the year 2005-06. NHAIwants to refurbish / upgrade its Road Information System to cater the present requirement on the latest technology. The broad scopeof this Consultancy will be (i) Review of Existing RIS which inter alia will include report on why it could not be put to effectiveuse in entire organisation(ii) Up-gradation of RIS and linkages with latest mapping technique and freely available maps on net(iii) Develop appropriate easy and simple forms fordata collection mapping data updation from field keeping requirementof MoRTHand NHAI road users from the point of view of Land Acquisition / Tour Operators. Commercial establishment such as hotel/motel safety requirement for capturing accidents blackspot etc.(iv) Data collection for roadinventory data road condition data and other data on safety aspect through latesthand held automated equipment with GIS capabilities for a approximate length of 1000 km. Populate the data collected for 1000 km inRIS by supplying upgrading and installing the existing Relational Database Management System(RDBMS)[ existing RDBMS is Oracle 9i]to the latest version. Also update other software including software for GIS mapping/storing/retrieval (v) recommend appropriatehardware after reviewing the existing hardware of NHAI (vi) recommend appropriate strategy for commercial use of the system sodeveloped for the purpose of developing traveller information system / tourist information system (vii) Suggest appropriateTraining plan for NHAI and MoRTH officials and (viii) The consultant will be required to conduct 3-4 workshop during the consultingperiod for ( a) Submitting Inception Report (b) Freezing Data collection plan and strategy and (c ) Finalworkshop The consultantsshould be expert in developing and implementing Asset Management approaches and plans for Large Highways and Expressways Network.The consultancy contract period will be about 36 months. column4: Wbta-8 : Consulting Services To Undertake Wbta-8 : Corporate Governance Assessment Of National Highways Authority Of India (nhai)
column12: G # 5&6 Sector-10 Dwarka
column18: NATIONAL HIGHWAYS AUTHORITY OF INDIA (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST INDIA NHAI Technical Assistance Project CONSULTING SERVICES TO UNDERTAKE CORPORATE GOVERNANCE ASSESSMENT OF NATIONAL HIGHWAYS AUTHORITY OFINDIA (NHAI) Loan No. : 7980-IN This request for expressions of interest follows the general procurement notice for this project that appearedin UN Development Business online on 14 July 2010 NHAI has received loan from the International Bank for Reconstructionand Development (IBRD) towards the cost ofNHAI Technical Assistance Project and intends to apply part of this loan proceeds to make payments under the contract for"Consulting Services to Undertake Corporate Governance Assessment of NHAI". NHAI proposes to undertake Corporate Governance Assessment under the Technical Assistance Project. Corporate Governance involves a set of relationships between an organizations management itsBoard and other stakeholders. It provides a principled process and structure through whichthe objectives of the organization the means of attaining the objectives and systems of monitoring performance are also set. The main pillars of Corporate Governance are commitment to values ethical business conducttransparency probity and public accountability. The assessment will primarily involve -enhanced audit and integrity requirements; improving performance and strengthening mitigation of integrity risks in contractmanagement with a particular focus on PPP projects through the integrated risk management system; review and enhancement of thesanctions regime to achieve a robust detection deterrence and sanction system at NHAI; strengthening existing socialaccountability and grievance redressal mechanisms and promoting integrity standards and good practices in the industry. NHAI now invites eligible consultant/s to indicate their interest in providing the services. Interestedconsultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified to perform the services (brochures description of similarassignments experience in similar conditions availability of appropriate skills among staff etc.). Consultants may form associations to enhance their qualifications.
