column4: Turnkey Implementation Of Enterprise Resource Planning (erp) Solution At Mort&h And Nhai (first Stage Bidding)
column12: G-5 & 6 Sector ?10 Dwarka
column18: Additional Clarifications and Second Addendum to the Bid Document have been published on theNHAI website www.nhai.org ande-tendering website www.tenderwizard.com/NHAI. The deadline for the submission of first stage bid is being extended to April8 2013 11.30 hrs. --------------------------------------------------------------The pre-bid response andAddendum to the Bid Document have been published on the NHAIwebsite www.nhai.org and e-tendering website www.tenderwizard.com/NHAI. Thedeadline for the submission of first stage bid is being extended to March20 2013 11.30 hrs. --------------------------------------------------------------- Invitation for Bids(IFB) ? First Stage Project Name: NHAITechnical Assistance Project Loan Number: LN7980 IN IFB Title: Turnkeyimplementation of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Solution at MoRT&H and NHAI IFB No.: 11013/186/2012/P&IS 1. This invitation for Bids (IFB) followsthe General Procurement Notice (GPN) for this project that appeared in UNDB online on 14/08/2010. 2. The Government of India has secured a loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) toward the cost of NHAI Technical Assistance Project and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan to payments under the agreement(s) resulting from this IFB (IFB no. 11013/186/2012/P&IS) 3. The NHAI serves as theimplementingagency for the project and now invite online bids from eligible Bidders for Supply installation customization commissioning integration training and technical support as well as maintenance of Enterprise resource planning solution for MoRT&H and NHAI spread over a period of 6.5 years (18 months of ERP implementation & 5 years of Support Maintenance). In addition to this it will also include FacilityManagement Services(FMS) for NHAI during the post implementation phase. 4. Bidding will be conducted using the International Competitive Bidding (ICB)procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDACredits edition of May 2004 revised October 1 2006& May 1 2010 and is open to all Bidders eligible as defined in these Guidelines that meet the minimum qualificationcriteria. 5. Interested eligible Bidders may obtainfurther information from NHAI. A pre-bid meeting which prospective bidders may attend will be held on 03.01.2013 at 11:30 AM 6. Accessing/ Purchasing of bid documents i) It is mandatory for all the bidders tohave class-III Digital Signature Certificate (in the name of person who will sign the Bid) from any of the licensed CertifyingAgency (Bidderscan see the list of licensed CAs from the link www.cca.gov.in) to participate in e-tendering of NHAI. The foreignbidders may obtain the DSC from any Licensed Certifying Authority which has been recognized bythe Controller of CertifyingAuthorities Govt. of India as per the details available at www.cca.gov.in. For this purpose foreign bidders are advised toapproach the concerned Indian Consulate/ Embassy in their respective countries for verification of the relevant documents beforeapproaching the licensed certifying authority in India ii) To participate in the E-Bid submission it ismandatory for the bidders to get registered with their firm/company with e-tendering portal http://www.nhai.org// andhttp://www.tenderwizard.com/NHAI to have user ID & password which has to be obtained by submitting an annual registrationcharges of INR 2247/- (Inclusive of all taxes) which can be paid online through Debit/ Credit cards using the payment gateway ofPunjab National Bank in favour of "M/s ITI Ltd". Validity of online registration is 1 year. iii) The complete Bid Document can be viewed /downloaded from the NHAI e-tendering portal free of cost (www.nhai.org & www.tenderwizard.com/NHAI) till the last date ofsubmission of tender. iv) To participate for bidding bidders have to pay Rs.10000/-(Rs.Ten Thousand only) towards fee for Tender document (non-refundable) in the form of Demand Draft issued from a scheduled Bank in India in favour of "NationalHighways Authority of India" payable at New Delhi and Rs 13483/- (Thirteen Thousand Four Hundred Eighty Three Only)inclusive of all Taxes towards Tender Processing fee (Non-Refundable) in favour of "M/s ITI Limited" payable at New Delhi. The scan copy of the demand draft shallbe submitted by the Bidder on e-tender portal of NHAI while submitting their bid. The original Demand draft and other document arerequired to be submitted by the bidder by the last date/ time as specified at clause numbers ITB 18.3. Following may benoted (a) Registrationshould be valid up to at least upto 180 days after the deadline of the submission of the bid. (b) Bids can besubmitted only during the validity of their registration. (c) The amendments /clarifications to the bid document if any will be hosted on the NHAI website/ e-tender portal. (d) If the firm /company is already registered with e-tendering portal of NHAI and validity of registration is not expired the firm / company is notrequired for fresh registration. 7. Detailed tender documents may be downloadedfrom e-tender portal of NHAI www.nhai.org and www.tenderwizard.com/NHAI till the last date of submission of tender and tender maybe submitted online following the instruction appearing on thescreen. A buyer manual containing the detailed guidelines fore-tendering system is also available on e-tender portal of NHAI. The downloadversion of bidding documents and anyaddenda/corrigendum to it will be binding on the bidders. 8. A two-stage bidding process will be used which willproceedas follows : (a) The firststage bid will consist of a technical bid only without any referenceto prices but includinga list of any deviations to the technical and commercial conditions set forth in the bidding documents and/or adding anyalternative technical solutions a Bidder wishes to offer and ajustification therefore always provided that such deviations oralternative solutions do not change the essential requirements specified in the bidding documents. The first stage bid documentsshould be uploaded in the Edit attachments link on the e-tender portal of NHAI (www.tenderwizard.com/NHAI). Following theevaluation of first stage bidsa Bidder that adequately meets the minimum acceptable qualification criteria and has submitted asufficiently technically responsive bid may be invited to attend a clarification meeting(s) during which the Bidders bid will bereviewed. Any required bid-specific changes additionsdeletions and other adjustments will be noted and recorded in a memorandum or if amendments are of a general nature will bepromulgated via an addendum to the bidding documents. Bidders may not be invited to submit second stage bids if their first stage bids contain departures from the requirementsin such numbers or of such nature that making the bids fully responsive in the remaining time for thetwo-stage process cannotreasonably be expected. All other suitably qualified andeligible Bidders however shall receive invitationsto submit second stage bids. (b) The second stage bid will consist two separate bids comprising of: (i) the updated technical bid incorporating all changes required as recorded in the bidder-specificmemorandum and/or as necessary to reflect any Addenda to the bidding documents issued subsequent to the first bidding-stage Thedocuments for this stage should be uploaded on the Edit attachments link on the e-tender portal of NHAI(www.tenderwizard.com/NHAI)and (ii) the commercial bid for this stage should be uploaded in Edit attachments link on the e-tender portal ofNHAI (www.tenderwizard.com/NHAI). 9. A plan for receiving examining and resolving protest/complaints from bidders at the First and Second stages of the bidding process including sufficient time between successive stepsfor all bidders is enclosed at Annexure VIII. The vendor query management system is available on e-tendering portal of NHAI toaddress the queries for tenders being processed under e-procurementsystem. 10. First stage bid must be submitted online at or before 11.30 AM on 20.02.2013. The electronicbidding system would not allow any late submission of bids after the due date & time as per server time. First stage bids will be opened online at 1200 Hrs. on 20.02.2013. In the event of thespecified date for the opening of bids being declared a holiday for the purchaser the bids will be opened at the appointed time onthe next working day. Interested eligible bidder may obtain further information from NHAI at the address of communication mentionedbelow: National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) General Manager (Tech)/P&IS G-5 & 6 Sector ?10 Dwarka New Delhi 110 075 Phone: 25074100 / 25074200 [Extn.1753/2201] Email: erp@nhai.org Website: http://www.nhai.org

column2: IN: National Ganga River Basin Project
column4: Expressions Of Interest [eoi] For Technical Support Consultants [tsc] For World Bank Assisted National Ganga Riverbasin Project
column12: National Ganga River Basin Authority Ministry of Environment and Forests 1st Floor Mini Market Shopping Complex NBCC Place Lodi Road
column18: INDIA-National Ganga River Basin Project Expressions of Interest [EOI] for Technical Support Consultants [TSC] for World Bank assisted National Ganga River Basin Project Project Identification Number : P119085 Ref No. : A-11012/1/2010-NGRBA-PMG I The Government of India has availed a credit/loan tofacilitate implementation of a multi-sectoral National Ganga River Basin Authority [NGRBA] programme in the five States ofUttarakhand Uttar Pradesh Bihar Jharkhand and West Bengal from the International Development Association [IDA] and the International Bank forReconstruction and Development [IBRD] and intends to apply part of the loan/credit proceeds to make payments under the contract forthe following services: 1. Technical Support Consultancy [TSC] services for Uttarakhand and UP[Package-I] 2. Technical Support Consultancy [TSC] services for Bihar JharkhandandWest Bengal [Package-II] The NGRBA is responsible for planning financingmonitoring and co-ordination of activities for effective abatement of pollution and conservation of the river Ganga. A National Mission for Clean Ganga [NMCG] has been set up under the Ministry ofEnvironment and Forests [MoEF]to co-ordinate and implement at the national level the various activities of the NGRBA Programmeincluding those supported under the WorldBank assisted National Ganga River Basin Project. State-level Project Management Groups [SPMGs] are also being set-up by the respective State Governments toco-ordinate and implement the NGRBA program activities at the State level. Investment proposals will be prepared and implemented bya variety of executing agencies selectedby the SPMGs. 2. NMCGis seeking Technical Support Consultancy [TSC] services from reputed/experienced organizations/firms to support the SPMGsseparatelyfor [Package-I] - Uttarakhand & U.P and [Package-II] - Bihar Jharkhand & West Bengal. Consultancy firms may apply for both parts but will be selected for one part only. While the TSC will be hired centrally by the NMCG its services would be aimed at assisting the respectiveSPMGs. 3. Scope of Work : The TSC would be responsible for the following: - Guidingfacilitating and supporting the SPMGs in getting the Feasibility Reports [FRs] and Detailed Project Reports [DPRs] for variousinvestment proposals prepared by the executing agencies as per NGRBA Guidelines. TheNGRBAs infrastructure investments programme will cover investments in wastewater management industrial pollution control solidwastemanagement and river front management in the 5 states and the total amount of first phase investments is expected to beapprox. Rs 4500 Crores. The largest fraction [60-70%] of investments will be in the wastewater management sector. - Providing therequired assistance to the SPMGs for reviewing and improving the quality of FRs and DPRs prepared by the executing agencies beforethey are submitted to the NMCG for sanction. 4. The Technical SupportConsultants [TSC] to the NMCG would consist ofa team of specialists led by a Team Leader. The assignment would initially be for a period of 3 years subject tosatisfactory performance review at the end offirst and second yearsand could be extended for a further period of 2 or 3 years based on performance and mutualagreement. 5. NMCG invites Expression ofInterest [EOI] from consulting firms toindicate their interest in providing services for above mentioned consultancy support. The interested firms must provide information indicating their past experience in relatedsectors experience of key personnel and financial strength to perform the services under the following heads: (a) Past Experience of thefirm - Number of years experience - Past Experience of work of similarnature-no of projects in the area in the immediate past i.e. 3-5 years - Past experience in carrying out work inrelated sectors - Experience of working withgovernment (b) Experience of KeyPersonnel - Qualifications - Relevant Experience including theirparticipation in the projects referred above (c) Financial Strength of theConsultant - Turnover figure of last three years - Value of contracts in the area of expertise requested - Net Profit figure for last three years (d) Name of theAssociates if any Specifically the firmsshould provide information showing their experience in the design documentation and implementation of similar investments and inparticular of large scale municipal services infrastructure. Consultants may associate orform joint ventures with other firms to enhance their qualification. Consulting firms shallbe selected in accordance with the procedure of the World Bank procurement guidelines Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by World Bank Borrowers May 2004 revised 2010available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 6. This EoI is a result ofmodifications of services requirements to anearlier request advertised by NGRBA on April 2 2011. Those who have responded to the earlier advertisement also need to submit response to this request clearly indicatingthe name of the Package[s]. 7. Interested Consultants may submit Expression Of Interest in an envelope clearly superscripted as "Expression of Interest for the Technical Support Consultant (Package-I or Package-II asapplicable) for the NGRBA Project" in one original and five copies to the Project Officer [Procurement] National Mission for CleanGanga [NMCG] First Floor Mini Shopping Complex NBCC Place Lodi Road New Delhi 110003 by 3 PM within one month from thedate of publishing of theadvertisement [November 28 2011]. 8. NMCG reserves the right to reject all or any of the proposals without assigning any reason thereof. Project Officer [Procurement] National Mission for Clean Ganga [NMCG] National Ganga River Basin Authority Ministry of Environment and Forests 1 st Floor Mini Market Shopping Complex NBCC Place Lodi Road. New Delhi 110003 INDIA Tel : + 91 11 24361071/72 Fax : + 91 11 24361073 Email : sensomdada@yahoo.co.in

Update 3 to GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE [GPN] published on January 31 2014 INDIA National Mission for Clean Ganga (NMCG) National Ganga River Basin Project (NGRBP) Project ID : P119085 Credit No. : Credit-4955-IN/Loan 8065-IN This GPN is an update to the GPN for this project that was published on March 30 2011 [appended below] and updated onNovember 26 2013. The Government of India has received financing for an amount of US$ 1 Billion equivalent from the World Bank toward thecost of the National Ganga River Basin Project (NGRBP) and it intends to apply part of the proceeds to payments for goods worksrelated services and consulting services to be procured under this project. The project will have two components relating to institutional development and priority infrastructure investments. Thefirst component would seek tobuild the institutional capacity to effectively implement the overallNGRBA program includinginfrastructure investments funded by the second component. The project aims that the National Ganga River Basin Authority (NGRBA) :builds capacity of its operational-level institutions for managing a comprehensive Ganga clean-up and conservation program; andreduces point-source pollution loads through sustainable interventions at selected locations on the Ganga. Various goods andservices identified to be procured through ICB procedures include: -35 nos.Sewage Treatment Plants in 5 states i.e. Uttarakhand UP Bihar Jharkhand and West Bengal with capacity ranging from2 Mldto 200 Mld with 10yrs. O&M and on DBOT basis. Some of the Sewage Treatment Plants will also be with Sewage Network -River Front Development in 5 states i.e Uttarakhand UP Bihar Jharkhand andWest Bengal -Services to provide real-time information for water quality parameters at selected locations in the Ganga system -Procurement of Laboratory Equipment (Laboratory Safety Processing and Preservation Systems) for Pollution Control Boards atnational level and in5 states -Procurement of Laboratory Instrumentation Equipment for Pollution Control Boards at national level and in 5 states -Procurement of IT Equipment (IT hardware GIS software computers laptops servers) for national level and in 5states -Procurement of Cameras LCD/DLP Projectors for national level and in 5 states -Consultancy Services to support Ganga Knowledge Base Development Modeling and Use -Consultancy services for the Central Pollution Control Board to conduct a Ganga Water Pollution Source Inventory -Consultancy services to conduct a Strategic Environmental Social and Economic Assessment for the Ganga Basin -Consultancy services for the National Ganga River Basin Authority to facilitate Program Communications and Community Participation(including city-level strategy and intermediation services) -Consultancy services for the Central Pollution Control Board to provide Quality Assurance for the real-time water qualitymonitoring system performance -Consultancy services for the Central Pollution Control Board to undertake a Biomonitoring assessment for the Ganga -Consultancy services to develop Systems for Governance and Accountability Action Plan (including e-procurement and grievanceredressal) for the National Ganga River Basin Authority -Works related to Sewage Treatment Plant Network and Combined Sewage Treatment Plant and Network with 10/15 yrs. O&M and onDBOT basis for all the 5 States along river Ganga -Works related to River Front Development for all the 5 States along river Ganga -Works related to Effluent Treatment Plant for all the 5 States along river Ganga Procurement of goods and works financed by the World Bank will be conducted through the procedures as specified in theWorld Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits (January 2011) and is open to all eligible bidders asdefined in the guidelines. Consulting services will be selected in accordance with the World Banks Guidelines: Selection andEmployment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (January2011). Specific procurement notices for goods works and consultancy services contracts to be bid under the World Banksinternational competitive bidding (ICB) procedures will be announced as they become available on the Banks external website andin national/local newspapers. Interested eligible bidders who wish to be included on the mailing list to receive invitations to bid under ICB proceduresand interested consultants/contractors who wish to receive a copy of advertisement requesting expressions of interest forconsultancy contracts or those requiring additional information should contact the address below. Mr. Somnath Sen OSD (Procurement) Rear Building MTNL 9CGO Complex National Mission for Clean Ganga Ministry of Environment and Forests Lodhi Road New Delhi110003 INDIA Telephone: +91 11 24361071-74 Fax : 91 11 24367988 Email : sensomdada@yahoo.co.in Website :www.moef.nic.in/sites/default/files/ngrba/index.html ************************************** Update 2 to GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE [GPN] published on January 27 2014 INDIA National Mission for Clean Ganga (NMCG) National Ganga River Basin Project (NGRBP) Project ID : P119085 Credit No. : Credit-4955-IN/Loan 8065-IN This GPN is an update to the GPN for this project that was published on March 30 2011 [appended below] and updated onNovember 26 2013. column18: NATIONAL RURAL LIVELIHOODSPROJECT (NRLP) Consultancy services as Technical Support Agency for Providing Technical Management Business andLegal Consultancy for eNRLMS Re-Advertised: Those firms that had appliedearlier kindly apply again. Please note revised criteria in para. 5 and 7 on the EoI letter available onthewebsite/s The Government of India has launched the National Rural Livelihoods Mission (NRLM)under the Ministry of Rural Development (MoRD). The mission aims at creating efficient andeffective institutional platforms of the rural poor enabling them to increase household income through sustainablelivelihoodenhancements and improved access to financial and selected public services. NRLM has set out with an agenda toreach out and mobilize 7 crore BPL households across 600 districts 6000 blocks 2.5 lakhs Gram Panchayats 6 lakhs villages inthe country into self-managed SHGs and federated institutions and support them for livelihoods enhancement and incomeaugmentation. The Government of India has availed a credit from InternationalDevelopment Association (IDA) towards the National Rural Livelihoods Project which aimsto support the National Rural Livelihoods Mission under the Ministry of Rural Development Government of India; andintends to apply part of the loan proceeds to make payments under the contract for the following services: Consultancy services as Technical Support Agency for ProvidingTechnical Management Business and Legal Consultancy for eNRLMS under the National RuralLivelihoods Project (NRLP). The National Rural Livelihoods Project now invites eligible Consultants to indicate their interest inproviding the services. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the NRLMProcurement Manualwhich follows the Consultants Selection Guidelines of the World Bank dated January 2011. Interested Consultant/s may submit"Expression of Interest" in a sealed envelop clearly superscripted as Expression of Interest for "Consultancy services for NRLM". They mayobtain further information about the requirements and proceduresfor submitting the EOI at: http://rural.nic.in/sites/advertisements-tender.asp/ http://www.aajeevika.in/advertisement-tenders.html / www.eprocure.gov.in Consultants may associate other Service Providers to complement theirrespective areas ofqualifications/expertise such that the agency can deliver the required management support to NRLM. Expressions of Interest mustbe delivered to the address below within 15 days from the date of publication of this advertisement. The Mission Director Ministry of Rural Development 6 th Floor Hotel Samrat Chanakya Puri New Delhi -21 India ************************************************************** NATIONALRURAL LIVELIHOODS PROJECT (NRLP) Consultancy services as TechnicalSupport Agency for Providing Technical Management Business and Legal Consultancy for eNRLMS The Government of India has launched the National Rural Livelihoods Mission (NRLM)under the Ministry of Rural Development (MoRD). The mission aims at creating efficient andeffective institutional platforms of the rural poor enabling them to increase household income through sustainablelivelihoodenhancements and improved access to financial and selected public services. NRLM has set out with an agenda toreach out and mobilize 7 crore BPL households across 600 districts 6000 blocks 2.5 lakhs Gram Panchayats 6 lakhs villages inthe country into self-managed SHGs and federated institutions and support them for livelihoods enhancement and incomeaugmentation. The Government of India has availed a credit from InternationalDevelopment Association (IDA) towards the National Rural Livelihoods Project which aimsto support the National Rural Livelihoods Mission under the Ministry of Rural Development Government of India; andintends to apply part of the loan proceeds to make payments under the contract for the following services: Consultancy services as  Technical Support Agency for ProvidingTechnical Management Business and Legal Consultancy for eNRLMS under the National RuralLivelihoods Project (NRLP). The National Rural Livelihoods Project now invites eligible Consultants to indicate their interest inproviding the services. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the NRLMProcurement Manualwhich follows the Consultants Selection Guidelines of the World Bank dated January 2011. Interested Consultant/s may submit"Expression of Interest" in a sealed envelop clearly superscripted as Expression of Interest for " Consultancy services for NRLM". They may obtain further information about the requirements and proceduresfor submitting the EOI at: http://rural.nic.in/sites/advertisements-tender.asp & www.eprocure.gov.in Consultants may associate other Service Providers to complement theirrespective areas ofqualifications/expertise such that the agency can deliver the required management support to NRLM. Expressions of Interest mustbe delivered to the address below within 15 days from the date of publication of this advertisement. The Mission Director Ministry of Rural Development 6 th Floor Hotel Samrat Chanakya Puri New Delhi -21 India

column4: Selection Of Consultants For Carrying Out Study On Transit Oriented Development [tod] For Naya Raipur
column12: Near Mahanadi Dwar Mantralaya
column18: NAYA RAIPUR DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY NAYA RAIPUR GEF - SustainableUrban Transport Project Country: INDIA Project ID: P100589 Request for Expressions ofInterest Name of the Project: GEF-SUTP: Selection of Consultants for Carrying outStudy on Transit Oriented Development [TOD] for Naya Raipur (Technical Consultancy) Grant No.: GEF TF No.095549-IN EoI Notice No.: 885/121: CTPWW/9-CEP/NRDA/2011 1. This Request for Expressions of Interest follows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared in Development Business Issue Number 737 of October 01 2008. 2. The Government of India has received a grant from Global EnvironmentFund [GEF]/ International Bank for Reconstruction andDevelopment andintends to apply part of the proceeds of this grant to payments underthe contract for Technical Consultancy forCarrying out Study on Transit Oriented Development (TOD) in Naya Raipur.to beprocured by Naya Raipur Development Authority Chhattisgarh. 3. The broad scope of services would include: 3.1 Review Indian and International Best Practices in TransitOriented Development for Potential Application to the Naya Raipur Case 3.2 Review & AnalyzeThe Current Raipur/Naya Raipur Land Use Situation And Naya Raipur Development Plan 2031 (Master Plan) With Respect To Public AndNon-Motorized Transport Orientation And Consistency With TOD Objectives; 3.3 Development of Recommendations for Improvements in Naya RaipurDevelopment Plan 2031 (Master Plan) transport plans and design guidelines to better facilitate sustainable transport and minimizevehicular travel. 3.4 Conduct Capacity Building in TOD through study tours andworkshops. The project period is 36 weeks. 4. The Naya Raipur Development Authority now invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing theServices. Interested consultants must provide information indicating that theyare qualifiedto perform the Services (brochures description of similar assignments experience in similar conditions availability ofappropriate skills among staff etc.). Consultants may associate to enhance theirqualifications. The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (with joint or several liability) or of a subconsultancy. 5. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by BankBorrowers May 2004 revised October 2006 and revised May 2010. 6. Interested Consultants may obtain further information at the address given below from 11:30 AM and 5:00 PM. 7. Expression of interest must be delivered to the address below by no later than 4:00 PM on April 4 2011. Chief Executive Officer NAYA RAIPUR DEVELOPMENTAUTHORITY Near Mahanadi DwarMantralaya Raipur - 492001. Chhattisgarh Ph: 0771 # 4066011 Fax:0771 # 4066188 Website: www.nayaraipur.com E-mail: ceo@nayaraipur.com/ psc@nayaraipur.com.

column4: Project Management Consultant (pmc) For Construction Of (1) Cycle Track And Walkway At Naya Raipur And (2) Bus Depot Control Centre Bus Shelters Pick Up Points Etc. At Raipur And Naya Raipur Under Sutp
column12: Naya Raipur Development Authority In Front of Mahanadi Dwar of Mantralaya
column18: Request for Expression of Interest India GEF - Sustainable Urban Transport Project (GEF-SUTP) Consultancy Services for Project Management Consultant (PMC) for construction of (1) Cycle track and walkway at Naya Raipur and (2)Bus Depot Control Centre Bus Shelters Pick up points etc. at Raipur and Naya Raipur under SUTP GEF Grant No.:TF095549 - IN This Request for Expressions of Interest follows the generalprocurement notice for this project that appeared in Development Business Issue Number 737 of October 01 2008 The Government of India has received agrant from the Global Environment Fund (GEF) through International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and intends to applypart of the proceeds of this grant to payments under the contract for Project Management Consultancy for monitoring and supervising the construction works under SUTP - NayaRaipur. In this project the consultant willcarry out the Project Management Consultancy for monitoring and supervising the construction of the following works under SUTP - NayaRaipur: a) Cycle Tracks and Pedestrian Walkways in NayaRaipur b) Bus depot and Control Centre at NayaRaipur c) Bus shelters in Naya Raipur d) Pick up points in Raipur Rail station and existingMantralaya at Raipur The objective of the present consultancyare as follows: Effectively monitoring and supervising theconstruction activities which will include day to day supervision quality control taking measurement at site for billing etc. forthe execution and development of cycle track pedestrian walk way bus shelters bus depot control centre and bus terminal/pick upterminals in Raipur and Naya Raipur. The duration of the consultancy services is expected to be 15 months from thedate of award of the contract. Naya Raipur Development Authority nowinvites eligible consultants toindicate their interest in providing the services. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out inthe World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by Bank Borrower May2004 and revised in October 2010 available at www.worldbank.org/procure. Companies/Consultants may associate to enhance theirqualifications. Submission Requirements: Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they arequalified to perform the Services. This should include the following: I. Company Profile and financial strength Provide a briefdescription of the background and organization of your firm/entity and each associate along with audited financial statements oflast three years. II. column4: Selection Of Consultant For Carrying Out Study And Preparation Of Regional Mobility Plan For Greater Raipur Region
column12: Naya Raipur Development AuthorityNear Mahanadi Dwar Mantralaya
column18: Expression ofInterest India SELECTION OF CONSULTANT FOR CARRYING OUT STUDY AND PREPARATION OF REGIONAL MOBILITY PLAN FOR GREATER RAIPURREGION Technical Consultancy Grant No.: GEF TF No.095549-IN 1. This Request for Expressions of Interestfollows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared in Development Business Issue Number 737 of October 312008. 2. The Government of India has received a grantfrom the Global Environment Facility (GEF)/ International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and intends to apply part of theproceeds of this grant to payments under the contract for Technical Consultancy for Study and Preparation of Regional Mobility Plan(RMP) for the region of Greater Raipur Area (GRA) which primarily constitutes of the urban agglomeration of Naya Raipur RaipurBhilai and Durg. 3. Naya Raipur Development Authority (NRDA) is aSpecial Area Development Authority constituted under C.G. Town & Country Planning Act 1973; by the Government of Chhattisgarhfor planning and development of a green field city "Naya Raipur" for its capital functions. 4. Under the GEF India Sustainable Urban TransportProgram being implemented by the Ministry of Urban Development Government of India NRDA has availed funds to provide urbantransport infrastructure and services between Raipur and Naya Raipur and within Naya Raipur. These investments are expected topromote environmentally sustainable transport and reduce green house gas emissions in the city. As part of reforms forimplementingthe Program NRDA the implementing agency is required toprepare of the Regional Mobility Plan. 5. NRDA intends to hire Consultants for Study andPreparation of Regional Mobility Plan (RMP) for the region of Greater Raipur Area (GRA). 6. The objectives of the Study on the Regional Mobility Plan (RMP) is to provide a long-term strategy for the desirable mobility pattern ofcities populace and that of movement of goods caused therefrom within the delineated region. To achieve this following are themain objectives: i. To provide a long-term vision(s) and goals for desirable urbandevelopment in each city with more emphasis on the development of planning area of Naya Raipur and its impact on the regionalmobility in terms of land use and traffic generation; ii. Toillustrate a basic plan for urban development and include a list of proposed urban land use and transport measures to beimplemented within a time span of 20 years; iii. To identify the prime nodes of origin and destination of passenger andgoods traffic iv. To find out the optimized routes for travel of passenger and goodsconsidering existing the travel pattern and their modes v. To recommend the most appropriate sustainable and cost-effectiveimplementation program that may be undertaken in the urban transport sector 7. The duration of the consultancy for preparation of the Regional Mobility Plan is expected to be 9 months from the date of award of thecontract. 8. The Naya Raipur Development Authority nowinvites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested consultants must provide information indicating that theyare qualified to perform the Services (brochures descriptionof similar assignments experience in similar conditions availability of appropriate skills among staff etc). 9. The consultant will be selected in accordancewith the procedures setout in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by Bank Borrower January 2011 available at www.worldbank.org/procure. Companies/Consultants may associate to enhancetheir qualifications. The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of a subconsultancy. 10. Interested Consultants may obtain furtherinformation at the address given below: Name of officer: Chief Executive Officer Name of office: Naya Raipur DevelopmentAuthority Telephone number:(0771) 4066011 Facsimile number: (0771) 4066188 Email: ceo@nayaraipur.com / psc@nayaraipur.com Website: www.nayaraipur.comwww.sutpindia.com Duringoffice hours: 1100 Hours to 1730 Hours on all working days from Monday to Saturday except on Sundays and Holidays ofNRDA. 11. Expression of Interest superscripted with thetitle "Sustainable Urban Transport Program - EOI for Selection of Consultants for carrying out study and preparation of RegionalMobility Plan for Greater Raipur Region" must be delivered to the address indicated below not later than12/12/2011. Chief Executive Officer Naya Raipur Development Authority Near Mahanadi Dwar Mantralaya Raipur - 492001 Chhattisgarh

The Government of India has received a grant from Global Environment Fund [GEF]/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this grant to payments under thecontract for Technical Consultancy for planning and implementationof Intelligent Transport System (ITS) as an integrated componentof Bus Rapid Transit System under SUTP Naya Raipur. Town & CountryPlanning Act 1973; by the Government of Chhattisgarh for planning and development of a green field city "Naya Raipur" foritscapital functions. Project: Under the GEF India Sustainable Urban Transport Program (SUTP) beingimplemented by the Ministry of UrbanDevelopment (MoUD) Government of India Naya Raipur Development Authority (NRDA) has availed funds to provide urban transportinfrastructure and services between Raipur and Naya Raipur and within Naya Raipur. These investments are expected to promoteenvironmentally sustainable public transport which are efficient reliable and user-friendly. NRDA intends to apply basicInformation Technology enabled Services (ITeS) to its bus operations with the following objectives: i. Optimizing transit travel times ii. Improving responsive time forincidents iii. Improving accountability and enhance transit userconvenience iv. Creating data collection analysisarchiving v. Applying the data for improving fleet managementbus service planning performance monitoring incident management vi. Providing a platform for BRT system stakeholderinteraction. The ITS consists of following components focused on providing efficiency andreliability thereby promoting use of the mode public transport: i. Establishing a centralised control centre tohandle the operational requirements of the services ii. GPS services in city bus fleet to monitor the busmovement iii. Passenger information system iv. Public information system (announcementsystem) v. Ticketing system vi. Availability of information of routes busschedule and ETA (Estimated Time of Arrival) through website Broad Scope of Services for the Project ManagementConsultant (PMC) would include: i. Planning finalizing the architecturespecification cost estimate project implementation plan of the Intelligent Transport System (ITS) and preparation ofcomprehensive plan for operations and management and prepare a detailed report for all ITS components ii. The PMC shall prepare tender documents and shallassist the Client with procurement of vendors etc. iii. Supervision & Monitoring during and afterimplementation iv. Training Duration of Consultancy i. Duration for this consultancy is expected to be42 months. The Naya Raipur Development Authority now invites qualified experienced and eligibletechnical consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Services with all supporting documents substantiatingqualification to perform the services experience in similar assignmentsand skills among staff for carrying out study. column4: Implementation Of Electronic Toll Collection (etc) On National Highways
column12: G-5/6 Sector 10 Dwarka
column18: Addendum: The last date for submission of EOI has been extended to April 15 2014 (16.00 hrs.local time). The responses to queries received from potential applicants are available on e-procurement website. Apre-EOI meeting will be held on March 20 2014 11.30 hrs. (local time) at NHAI office. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- INDIA Date : 22/01/2014 NHAI TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROJECT Expressionsof Interest CONSULTANCY SERVICES FOR IMPLEMENTATIONOF ELECTRONIC TOLL COLLECTION (ETC) ON NATIONAL HIGHWAYS IN INDIA (Loan No. 7980-IN) This requestfor expressions of interest follows the general procurement notice forthis project that appeared in UN DevelopmentBusiness of July 14 2010. The NHAIhas received a loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) and intends toapply part of the loan proceeds to make payments under the contract for Consulting Services for implementation ofElectronic Toll Collection (ETC) on National Highways in India. National Highways Authority ofIndia (NHAI) is an autonomous agency of the Government of India responsible for management of a network of over 70000 kms. ofnational highways in India. The authority is a nodal agencyof the Ministry of Road Transport of Highways (MoRTH). At present thereare around 220 Toll Plazas operational on Indian national highways. Given the Indian Governmentsexpansion plan for national highways there is an underlying need to transform the currently functional manual toll collectionsystems across the country into a unified Electronic Toll Collection (ETC) system. Considering user convenienceand ease of implementation Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) technology was recommended by a Committee constituted by Ministryof Road Transport & Highways. The report may be accessed from the website www.nhai.org/ETC%20report.pdf. Aconcept note on ETC is enclosed at Annexure-A. The NHAI nowinvites On-line expression of interests from eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Consulting Servicesfor implementation of Electronic Toll Collection (ETC). Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they arequalified to perform the services (description of similar assignments experience in similar conditions availability ofappropriate skilled manpower etc.). Consultants may associate other firms in the related field to enhance theirqualifications. A consultantwill be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by World Bank Borrowers - May 2004 Revised October2006 and May 01 2010. TheShortlisting criteria are enclosed at Annexure-B. Applicants should score minimum 70% mark on each of the shortlisting criteria to be shortlisted and top six applicants fromthe shortlisted applicants will bequalified for the RFP Stage. Instructions for electronicEOI: The EOI is available onlineat NHAI web portal (http://www.nhai.org)/ "www.tenderwizard.com/NHAI" on e-tendering mode to the registered consultants for e-tendering only. Forparticipating in e-tendering process registration for e-tendering is mandatory for all consultants. The consultants not registeredfor participating in E-tendering mode earlier are requested to register themselves first. The consultants are required to registeron this website to have user ID and Password whichhas to be obtained by submitting an annual registration charges of INR 2247 (inclusive of all taxes to M/s ITI Ltd. and prior tothe submission of proposals. The online payment facility for the submission of registration fee (Rs. 2247/-) and tender processingfee (Rs. 13483/-) only inclusive of all taxes shall be paid to E-tender service provider i.e. M/s ITI Ltd. which has been enabledon E-tender portal http://www.tenderwizard.com/NHAI. The tender processing fee has to pay only once i.e. at the time ofapplication. In absence of submission ofTender Processing Fee the Expression of Interest will not beconsidered. The Tender Processing Fee must be paid one day prior to the last date andtime for submission of bid i.e. 4 PM on 03.03.2014. The consultant shall pay registration charges and tender processingfee through E-payment gateway of Punjab National Bank either using Credit / Debit Card ( Master Card and Visa Card) or net banking (PNB account holders only) which is payable toe-tender service provider. The validity of onlineregistration is One year. Consultant is also required to have a Class-III Digital Signature (DSC) [both signing and encryption] inorder to submit a proposal on line at the web address indicated above. The list of the authorized Certifying Authorities can befound www.cca.gov.in. For trainingclarificationqueries and registration on e-Tendering process all consultants may contact [(i) Mr. Krishna at 08800900127 (ii) Mr. Mithun Ghoshat 0882604002 Mr. Rajesh Kumar at 09868123587] Interested consultants mayobtain further information at the address below from 1100 to 1600 hours. Expressions of Interest(EoI) shall be delivered to the address below by 4 PM on 03/03/2014. Schedule of events is enclosed atAnnexure-C. General Manager(P & IS) NHAI G-5/6 Sector10 Dwarka NewDelhi Tel:011-25074100 Ext 1272 E-mail:pramod@nhai.org Annexure-A Electronic Toll Collection System In India tolling onNational Highways started in a big way with the National Highways Development Project (NHDP) launched by the Government in the year2000. As on date nearly 220 Toll Plazas are operational on National Highways and more sections are being added at regularintervals. Currently the tolloperations are mainly manual whereby the receipt and collectionof money is done manually and the receipts are issued with the helpof computers. In view of the fast-growingtraffic on national highway network in the coming years Govt. of India has decided introduction of Electronic Toll Collection inIndia. Electronic payment apopular mode of toll collection worldwide processes the financial transactions without human intervention at the toll plaza. ETC in India Presently ETC systems areoperational at very few toll plazas in stand-alone mode. India has distinct advantage in adopting ETC system as there are no legacy systems unlike other developed countries. Thishelpedin selecting a simple and robust ETC technology which is scalable reliable inexpensive to the road users and inter-operableacross the country. Selection of ETC technology With that objective theGovernment constituted a Committee under Shri Nandan Nilekani Chairman Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) toexamine all technologies available for Electronic Toll Collection and recommend the most suitable one for implementation inIndia. The Committeesubmitted itsreport recommending RFID based on ISO 18000-6C Standards for Electronic Toll Collection on National Highways in India. System Architecture It is essential to networkall the toll plazas for seamless data communication between toll plazas and the Central Clearing House. The entiretransactiondetails of all the Tag accounts will be stored in the Central Database. CentralClearingHouse Point of Sale Bank/ Financial Institution Regulatory Authority Web Portal / User Interface TollPlaza System Operation : Before issuance of RFIDTags the road users need to register with the agency with the basic details like Name Address Vehicle type Vehicle registrationno. etc. This information will be stored in the central Database along with the unique identification code of Tag. Each ETC lanewill beequipped with Automatic Vehicle Classification (AVC) system for cross verification of vehicle categories to avoid any misuse ofTags. The ETC management software will compare the class of vehicle as per the Tag account and the AVC class. In case ofdiscrepancy the system triggers the Camera fitted in the lane and captures the image of thevehicle along with the number plate. CENTRAL TOLL CLEARING HOUSE (CCH) A centralized back office operation or Central TollClearing House is mandatory for theoperation of interoperable ETC systems. The Central Clearing House concept is a transactionmanagement system which will enablemultiple Toll Collection Agenciesto share toll transaction data and revenue reconciliation. Irrespective of the tollplazas being operated by NHAI or BOT concessionaires the Tag information along with the Plaza ID will be sent to the CentralClearing House. The CCH system debits the applicable amount from the account of road users and credits to the Toll Operator. The CCH runs an end of daysettlement and sends details to every toll plaza operators for their receivables for that particular day. The financial settlementswill be done through a Bank. ETC Implementation NHAI got a new Company "Indian Highways Management Company Limited IHMCL)" incorporated with equity participation from NHAI(25%) Concessionaires(50%) andFinancial Institutions (25%) primarily for implementation of ETC inIndia. Further bidshave beeninvited for the following: (i) Empanelment of agencies for Toll Plaza ETC Systems. (ii) Selection of agency for provisioning Central Clearing HouseServices on Pan-India basis. Broad scope of the consultancy services ETC being a new concept in India NHAI seeks the services ofconsultancy firmfor assistance in the following activities/areas. (i) Preparation ofOperations Plan functional and performance requirements Test PlansMaintenance Plan SuccessionPlan and Transition Plan. (ii) Project Supervisionduring ETC implementation (iii) System AcceptanceTesting (iv) Technical and Operationalassistance during operation period (Post-commissioning support for 2 year) Duration of Consultancy Services Three Years ( 1 Yr for ETC implementation & 2 yrsfor Post-commissioning support) Annexure-B Expression of Interest for appointment of Consultant for consultancy services for implementation ofElectronic Toll Collection (ETC) on National Highways in India EVALUATIONCRITERIA Table 1: SUMMARY S. No. Criteria MaximumMarks Forms 1. Average Annual Turnover of the Firm during the last 3yearsi.e. F.Y. 2010-11 2011-12 20012-13 should be Rs. 20 crores 25 T-1 2. Minimum 2 completed projectsin the last 5 calendar years ending 31 st Oct. 2013 in the areaof epayment / Tolling / IT in Transportation / IntelligentTransport System (ITS) / IT consulting related to Infrastructure / Banking. 65 T-2 3. Profile of the experts of the firm who are having expertise inthe areas of Electronic Toll Collection epayment/Tolling Solutions IT Consultancy in Transportation Sector / Banking. 10 T-3 Table 2: Break up of criteria(Sub-criteria) S. No. Criteria Maximum Marks Break up of criteria (Sub-criteria) Break up of Marks 1. Average Annual Turnover of the Firm during the last 3yearsi.e. F.Y. 2010-11 2011-12 2012-13 25 Rs. 20 Crore 18 [1 mark for each additional 1 Crore subject to a maximumof25 marks] 2. Minimum 2 completedprojects in the last 5 calendar years ending 31 st Oct. 2013 in the area of epayment / Tolling / IT in Transportation /Intelligent Transport System (ITS) / IT consulting related to Infrastructure / Banking. 65 Minimum 2 completedprojects in the last 5 calendar years ending 31 st Oct. 2013 in the area of epayment / Tolling / IT in Transportation /Intelligent Transport System (ITS) / IT consulting related to Infrastructure / Banking 46 [1 mark for each additional project of similar nature asmentioned subject to a maximum of 65 marks] 3. column4: Feasibility Study On Highway Traffic Patrol And Subsequent Preparation Of The Draft Act In This Regard
column12: G-5/6 Sector 10 Dwarka
column18:
INDIA NHAI TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROJECT Expressions of Interest CONSULTING SERVICES FOR"FEASIBILITY STUDY ONHIGHWAY TRAFFIC PATROL AND SUBSEQUENT PREPARATION OF THEDRAFT ACT IN THIS REGARD" (Loan No. 7980-IN) This request forexpressions ofinterest follows the general procurement notice forthis project thatappeared inUN DevelopmentBusiness of July142010. The NHAI has received a loan from the International Bankfor Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) andintends toapply part of theloan proceedsto makepayments under the contract for Consulting Services for FEASIBILITY STUDY ON HIGHWAY TRAFFIC PATROL AND SUBSEQUENT PREPARATION OF THE DRAFT ACT IN THISREGARD. National HighwaysAuthority of India (NHAI)is anautonomous agency of the Government of India responsible for management ofa network ofover 70000 kms. of national highways in India. The authorityis a nodal agency oftheMinistry of Road Transport of Highways(MoRTH). Asthe implementation ofNational Highway DevelopmentProgram (NHDP) progresses the NHAI recognizes that its operations need a stronger focus on the safe useof its network and the establishment ofa dedicated National Highway Patrol (NHP) toassurethis.As well as assessing the feasibilityof NHP options the proposedservices shall include developing a draft NHPact to be passedby the Parliament preparationof an NHP implementation plan for NHAI andcapacity building activitiesin this area. As part of theseservices consultants shall also review existing Highway Patrol models in developedcountries andin thestates of Andhra Pradesh Gujarat andMaharashtra. Theconsultants shouldbe expert in preparation of thedraftAct and the agenda notefor the approval from theGovernmentof India. Theconsultancy contract periodshall be aboutsix months. The Concept Noteandtherequirement areannexed at Annexure-I. The NHAI now invites On-line expression of interests from eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Consulting Services for "Feasibility Study On Highway Traffic Patrol and subsequent preparation of theDraft Act in thisregard". Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they are qualifiedto perform the services (description of similar assignments experience in similar conditions availabilityof appropriate skilled manpower etc.). Consultants may associate otherfirms in therelated field to enhance their qualifications. A consultant will be selected in accordancewith the procedures setout inthe World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employmentof Consultantsby World Bank Borrowers -May2004 Revised October 2006 and May 01 2010. The Short listing criteria areenclosed at Annexure-II. Applicantsshould score minimum 70%mark on each of the short listing criteria to be shortlisted and topsixapplicants fromtheshortlisted applicants will be qualified for the RFPStage. Instructions for electronic EOI: The EOI is available online at NHAI web portal (http://www.nhai.org)/ "www.tenderwizard.com/NHAI" on e-tendering mode to theregistered consultants for e- tendering only. For participating ine-tendering process registration for e-tendering is mandatory for allconsultants. Theconsultantsnotregistered for participating in E- tendering mode earlier are requested to register themselves first. The consultants are required toregister on this website to have user ID and Password whichhas tobe obtained by submitting anannual registration chargesof INR 2247 (inclusive ofall taxes to M/sITI Ltd. and priorto the submission of proposals. The onlinepayment facility for the submission of registration fee (Rs. 2247/-)and tender processing fee (Rs.13483/-) only inclusive of alltaxes shallbe paid to E-tender service provider i.e. M/sITI Ltd. whichhas been enabled on E-tender portal http://www.tenderwizard.com/NHAI. The tender processing feehas topayonly once i.e. at the time of application. In absence ofsubmission of TenderProcessing Feethe Expressionof Interest will not be considered. The Tender Processing Fee must be paidone day prior to the last date and time forsubmission of bid i.e. 5 PM on 06.02.2014. Theconsultant shall pay registration charges and tender processing fee through E-payment gateway of Punjab National Bank either using Credit / Debit Card ( Master Card and Visa Card) or netbanking (PNB account holders only) which is payable to e-tender service provider. The validityof online registration is One year. Consultant is also required to have a Class-III Digital Signature (DSC)in order to submit a proposal on line at the web address indicated above. The list of the authorized CertifyingAuthorities can be found www.cca.gov.in. For training clarification queries and registration on e-Tendering process all consultants maycontact [(i) Mr.Krishna at 08800900127 (ii)Mr. Mithun Ghosh at 0882604002 Mr. Rajesh Kumarat 09868123587] Interested consultantsmay obtain furtherinformation attheaddress below from 1100to 1600hours. Expressions ofInterest (EoI)shall be delivered to the address belowby 07.02.2014 (4:00 PM).The proposal shall be opened on line at16:30 PM (07.02.2014) Shri Pankaj Gupta General Manager (CM)-II G-5/6 Sector 10 Dwarka New Delhi Tel: 011-25074100 Ext1525 Fax: 011-25074100 Ext 2468 E-mail: pankajgupta@nhai.org Concept Note Proposed National Highway Patrol (NHP) for India Transport underpins sustainable nationaleconomic development. India has the secondlargestroad network in the world whichcarries 85% ofits passengertraffic and 60% of its freight.National highwaysconstitute just 2% of this network but incur36%of the more than 140000 people whodieannually fromroad crashes. While the National Highway Authority of India (NHAI) is thenodal authority for the building maintaining and safety of thesehighways many agencies engage intraffic control and enforcement and highway securityleaving the scopeof organizational road safetyresponsibilities broadly defined. Various activities are performed by differentauthorities: e.g. vehicle fitness is checkedby State Transport Authoritiestraffic rules are enforced by the State Traffic Policeencroachment and other such matters aredealt by State Police/Highway Administrations. ExistingHighway Patrolsnormally termed RoutePatrols areprovided by either BOT/OMT Concessionaires orO&M contractors and lack statutory powers to prosecuteoffenders. Consequentlyforenforcement andotherrelated activitiesNHAI depends upon Local Police/Administrations whichunder the Highway Prevention & Regulation Act? 2002 can takeaction againstoffenders through theDistrict Courts. However in the absence effectivePolice highway enforcement this is non-operative. There is no empowered road policing of national highways in India along the lines ofRPF in Railways andCISFin Airports/Civil Aviationandthis conceptnote outlines therequirements for aproject to assess thefeasibility of implementing a NationalHighway Patrol (NHP). WhileIndia is successfully upgrading itshighway infrastructure from two-lane tofour-lane and four-lane tosix-lane it is equally important to improve their safety as well as their trafficcapacity. The specific goal ofthe proposed NHPis to enhancethe delivery of sustainableroad transport by reducing the economic and social burden of serious and fatal injuries caused by roadcrashes on national highways. In order toachieve thisgoalit will be important to formulate a practical organizational structure forthe proposedNHP which coordinates withthe many local and national agenciesresponsible for administration enforcement building and maintenance of roads and highways. Suchan agency should incorporate the needs and responsibilities ofconcessionaires who have been given obligatory agreements by the NHAI. Therefore the proposed NHPshould have a broad-based inclusive and collaborative strategy toguideits effective andefficient operational delivery. In developing the proposedNHP considerationmust be givento goodpractices being adopted incertain Indian states those being implemented in developed countries and those in countries of theAsian Regionwith similar traffic environments. Duties of theproposed NHP The proposed NHPwouldbe a pro-active organizationgiving ultimate priorityto the safetyof national highway users to ensure theprevention of road fatalities andinjuries. Key duties wouldinclude: 1. Enforcing specific roadsafety laws andregulations governing unsafe behaviors such as speeding; non-wearing of safetybelts childrestraints and helmets; and drunk and druggeddriving; and commercial vehicle safety requirementssuchasdriver hours; weight limits; unsafe loading; and the carriage of hazardous and dangerous materials. 2. Securingthe scene ofroad crashes aswell as providingfirstaid to the injured and mobilizing emergencyservices to ensure rapidstabilizationof victims injuries and transport to appropriate hospitals. 3. Preparing traffic crashreports and creating a relateddatabase recording precise crash locations all relevant contributing factors (including driver passenger vulnerable road user vehicle and road factors; time of dayandweek;and weather conditions) andfatalities andnature of injuries incurred. 4. Conducting investigations offatal roadcrashes to assesscontributing factors. 5. Undertaking periodic surveys oftraffic speeds and safetybelt/child restraint and helmet wearing toassess enforcement effectiveness. 6. Providing education information and assistanceto all road users. 7. Curtailing unauthorizedoccupation or encroachmentof the highways. 8. Liaising with all responsible agencies for thesafe and efficient movement of traffic as well as maintenance of the highway. 9. Responding tothe occurrence of crime in thevicinity of highway corridors and reporting itto local policestations. 10. Safeguarding roadway assets including the road furniture. 11. Supporting safe VIP travel. Challenges At present some of the National Highwaysbeing maintained by NHAI areunder Public Private Partnership (PPP) arrangements: viz. BOT/ OMT; and it will be necessary to gain consentfromthese stakeholders forthe proposed NHP. It is likely that Concessionaires wouldalso agree tothe creation of the proposedNHP as in addition to improving road safety performanceit would also safeguard their interestsin the proper functioning of TollPlazas trafficmanagement andO&M operations. National highways run through the states and a StateSupport Agreementwill have to be implemented for the smooth operationof the proposed NHP. Theroles of State Transport Authorities StateTrafficPolice /State Policewill need to be defined vis--vis the proposed NHPtoavoid the overlapping of duties/actions. Scope of Proposed NHPFeasibility Study A feasibility studyof the proposed NHP will be conducted to: 1. Evaluate existing traffic law enforcement mechanismsregulationsand identify shortcomings. 2. Conduct official study tours to selected best practice jurisdictionsto assess options and deliberate uponproposals beingmadefor the proposedNHP. 3. Identify and suggest systems tools and tacticsforeffective andefficient highway patrolling. 4. Analyze options fortheparent/host Ministry of the NHP and recommenda preferredapproach. 5. Make recommendations on defining the functionsresponsibilities duties and authority of the proposedNHP and other concerned stakeholders suchas highway concessionairescontractors PWDs local police and civic agencies. 6. Make recommendations for powers to be given to the proposed NHP for traffic enforcement control and regulation emergency response crash investigation and identify areas where roles responsibilities and duties require legal definition. 7. Suggest an institutional structureandassociated tasks for theproposed NHP and assessrelatedmanpower requirements and trainingneeds. 8. Define workingmechanisms and command structurefor the delegation of powers at HQ zonal andsub-zonal level in the proposed NHP and the reporting relationships with theparent/host Ministry and key partner agencies. 9. Outline a three-phaseimplementationstrategyfor the proposed NHP for years 1 3 and 5 which includes human resources (staff and trainingneeds) equipment promotional activities andfinancing requirements (initial and recurrent). 10. Draft enabling legislation for the proposed NHP based upon the above findings and recommendations. Consultants shallbe required tohave various interactions with Stakeholders/ State Police/ StateTransport Department/ Safety Consultants/ RPF Railways/ and CISF Airports/CivilAviation. column18: INDIA KARNATAKAMUNICIPAL REFORMS PROJECT [KMRP] CONSULTING SERVICES Loan No. 4818-IN No.UMC/Map 11 (ph-3)/2011-12 Date: March 17 1010 EXPRESSION OF INTEREST FORPACKAGE - 3 This request for expression of interest (EoI) follows the general procurement notice forthis project that appeared in UN Development Business No. 744 of January 27 2009. The Government of India has received a loan from the International Bank for Reconstructionand Development (IBRD) and intends to apply part of the loan proceeds to make payments under the contract for h iring of consultancy services for preparation ofmaps of the 11 places using satellite images and augmenting with utilities contours and spot heights by Total Stationsurvey. The outline of the services includes: Feature extraction in 2D from 0.61 mresolution Quick Birds satellite images (SI); and preparation of preliminary map at scale 1:2000 Establishing net-work of primary surveycontrol points (PSCPs) by adopting GPS technology and spirit leveling for heights; Establishing net-work of secondary surveycontrol points (SSCPs) by using Total Station traversing and using GPS where feasible and spirit leveling for heights; Carrying out detailed survey for utilitiesseen on ground and for contours and spot heights using Total Station; Feature extraction in 2D from 0.61 mresolution Quick Birds satellite images (SI); and Preparation of 2D final maps at basicscale 1:2000; Preparation of maps at 1:500 for utilitiescontours and spot heightsusing Total Station surveyed data. Preparation of hybrid maps at 1:2000 fordetails from SI and utilities contours and spot heights using Total Station surveyed data The list of 11 places with an area of about 1264 sq km are as follows: Gadag Betageri 4. Bagalkote 7. Yadgir 10. Rabakavi Banahatti Gokak 5. Ilkal 8.Sindhanur 11. Basava Kalyan Nippani 6.Jamakhandi 9. Wadi-Shahabad Organisation: Department of Town & Country Planning (DTCP) Government of Karnataka. Period for completion of consultancy : 21 months. The DTCP the client now invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest inproviding the services. Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified to perform the servicesas listed above along with the details of financial status turnover in similar projects for the last three years experience in similar assignments availability ofappropriate skills among staff availability of survey instruments etc. Consultants may associate with other consultants to enhancetheir qualifications. The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of a subconsultancy. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the WorldBanks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrower May 2004 (revised October 2006). The consultant must demonstrate having experience and resources sufficient to meet theaggregate requirement to carry out the assignments if such similar assignments are already on hand. Interested consultants may obtain further information including detailed terms ofreference at the address given below from 10.30 to 17.30 hrs on working days or by visiting the website www.dtpkar.in . The information required for evaluation of the EoIs shall be furnished in the formats givenin the Website. Expressions of interest must be delivered to the address below by11.04.2011 17.00 hrs. Joint Director of Town& Country Planning Urban Mapping Cell Office of the Director of Town & Country Planning MS Buildings Stage 4 Dr. B. R. Ambedkar Veedhi Bangalore 560001. Tel: 91-80-2235 3973/ 2235 3976 Fax: 91-8-2238 9519 E-mail: dtp.umc@gmail.com

column12: Karnataka Health Systems Development and Reform Project [KHSDRP]1st Floor Public Health Institute BuildingSeshadri Road
column18: GENERAL PROCUREMENTNOTICE INDIA-Karnataka Health System Development andReform Project [KHSDRP]-Additional Financing Credit:5161-IN Project ID :P130395 The Government of India has received financing in the amount of US $70million equivalent from the World Bank toward the cost of the KHSDRP. The mainobjective of the Project is to increase utilization of essential Health Service i.e. curative preventive promotive andrehabilitation health care particularly in the underserved areas and among vulnerable groups and to accelerate the achievements ofhealth related Millennium Development Goals. It intended to utilize part of theProject funds towards payments for goods works related services and consulting services to be procured under thisproject. The project will include the followingcomponents: (a) StrengtheningExisting Government Health Programs (b) Innovations inService Delivery and Health Financing (i) Innovations inservice delivery (ii)Innovations in health financing (c) ProjectManagement Monitoring and Evaluation. The approved Procurement Plan includes thefollowing ICB Procurement: (1) Procurement ofInspection Vehicles (35)-Estimated cost US $0.4million (2) Procurement offabricated ambulance vehicles (550)-Estimated cost US $10.3 million (3) Procurement of equipment for Trauma Care-Estimated cost US $1.0million All the other Procurement of WorksGoods & Consultancy services would be under NCB and Shopping procedure Procurement of contracts financed by the WorldBank will be conducted through the procedures as specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDACredits [January 2011] and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in the guidelines. Consulting services will be selectedin accordance with the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers [January 2011]. Specific procurement notices for contracts tobe bid under the WorldBanks International Competitive Bidding [ICB] procedures and for contracts for consultancy services will beannounced as they become available in UN Development Business and dgMarket and in leading National EnglishNewspapers and will also be posted inthe website www.karhfw.gov.in. Interestedeligible bidders who wish to be included in the mailing list to receive Invitation for Bid (IFB) under ICB procedures or thoserequiring additional information should contact at the address given hereunder : Mr.Satish Kumar Deputy Director [Procurement] Office of Project Administrator Karnataka Health Systems Development and Reform Project[KHSDRP] 1 st Floor Public Health InstituteBuilding Seshadri Road Bangalore 560 001 Karnataka INDIA Telephone : +91 80 22291670 22277390 22276357 E-mail: ddprockhsdrp@gmail.com Website: www.karhfw.gov.in

column18: INDIA ANDHRA PRADESH WATER SECTOR IMPROVEMENTPROJECT Consultancy (NGOs) services for Fostering and Capacity Building of Water Users Organizations (WUOs) onefor WUOs under Nagarjunasagar Jawahar Canal (NSJC) and One for WUOs under Nagarjunasagar Lal Bahadur Canal (NSLBC) ofNagarjunasagar Scheme LoanNo: 7897 ? IN NOTIFICATION NO: PD/PPMU/APWSIP/2/2011-12Dated January 31 2012 REQUESTFOR EXPERSSION OF INTEREST 1. This Request for Expression of Interest follows the general procurement notice for this project that appearedin Development Business issue no. 719 of January 31 2008. 2. TheGovernment of India has received a loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and intends to apply part oftheproceeds of this loan to payments under the contract for Consultancy services for enagaing a Non Governmental Organisation (NGO)for fostering and Capacity building of Water Users Organizations (WUOS) of Nagarjuna Sagar Scheme under Andhra Pradesh Water SectorImprovement Project (APWSIP). 3. TheServices include: The NGO has to i) to facilitate capacity building WUO members to discharge their roles and responsibilities asenvisaged in Andhra Pradesh Farmers Management of Irrigation Systems (APFMIS) Act 1997 and amended from time to time. It isexpected that this would promote effective functioning of WUOs and achieve desired benefits from the improved irrigation system.ii) to improve interaction among WUOs Competent Authorities (CA) and other functionaries of I & CADD. iii) to provide feedbackabout the functioning of WUOs at all levels to the Project Preparation and Management Unit (PPMU) in the agreedformat on a regularbasis. NGO will beresponsible for facilitating continued interaction among the WUOs at all levels (WUA/DC/PC) and also with CAs of these associationsand with the I & CADD staff. The NGO would facilitate effective functioning of WUOsand would monitor and provide the feedback about their activities and functioning to the irrigation authorities and to the PPMU.One of the important activities of the selected NGO will be to focus on capacity building /fostering of WUOs in distribution ofallocated water and operation and maintenance of the system. It is the intentof the I & CADD to engage one NGO for WUOs of each of the two canals. NGOs may wish to give preferences for canals or expressinterest in either as they wish since no NGO will be considered for both. 4. TheProject Director PPMU for APWSIP Irrigation and Command Area Development Department (I & CADD) Government of Andhra Pradeshnow invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested consultants must provideinformation indicating that they are qualified to perform the Services (brochures description of similar assignments experiencein similar conditions availability of appropriate skills among staff etc not exceeding 50 pages). 5. Aconsultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by Bank Borrowers May 2004 revised in October 2006. 6. Interested consultants may obtain further information at the address given below from 10.30 to 17.00hours. 7. Expression of interest must be delivered to the address below by 3.30pm no later than February 22 2012

column2: IN: AP Water Sector Improvement Proj
column4: Wbr 46-consultancy Services For Conjuctive Use Of Surface And Groundwater Management Pilot
column12: Project Preparation & Management UnitAP Water Sector Improvement Project4th Floor Jalasoudha BuildingErrummanzil
column18: INDIA ANDHRAPRADESH WATER SECTOR IMPROVEMENT PROJECT CONSULTANCY SERVICES FOR CONJUNCTIVE USE OFSURFACE AND GROUND WATER PILOT Loan No: 7897 ? IN NOTIFICATION NO: PD/PPMU/APWSIP/1/2011 DatedJanuary 31 2012 REQUESTFOR EXPERSSION OF INTEREST This Request for Expression of Interest follows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared in DevelopmentBusiness issue no. 719 of January 31 2008. The Government of India has received a loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and intends to applypart of theproceeds of this loan to payments under the contract for Consultancy Services for conjunctive use of surface and groundwater pilot under Andhra Pradesh Water Sector Improvement Project (APWSIP). The Consultants services include i) Conduct SocialAssessment to develop a socio-economic profile of the water users in the pilot areas (Khammam and Guntur districts) establishbaseline information on the availability of canal water and groundwater pattern of water (both surface and ground water) use including cropping pattern and irrigation practices adopted in the pilot areas ii)Prepare an Action plan for promoting conjunctive use ofsurface and ground water iii) Develop Information Education andCommunication (IEC) strategy and material and campaign using mass media and print media iv) Mobilize the local community forconjunctive use of surface and groundwater in the pilot areas and organize the WUAs within the pilot areas into a pilot levelWater Users Organizations (PLWUO) and enhance their capabilities to take up various activities envisaged under the pilot v)Facilitate implementation of the action plan and community based regulatory measures for conjunctive use of canal and ground watervi) Continuously monitor the implementation of actionplan progress made identify problems encountered and measures takentoaddress them vii) Prepare reports as detailed out in this ToR inaddition to the reports that would be required to be prepared andsubmitted to PPMU. The Project Director Project Preparation and Management Unit (PPMU) for APWSIP now invite eligible consultants (only firms) toindicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they arequalified to perform the Services (brochures description of similar assignments experience in similar conditions availability ofappropriate skills among staff etc.). Consultants may associate to enhance their qualifications. The association may take the formof a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of a sub-consultancy. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection andEmployment of Consultants by Bank Borrowers May 2004 revised in October 2006. Interested consultants may obtain further information at the address given below from 10.30 to 17.00 hours. Expression of interest must be delivered to the address below by 3.30pm no later than February 23 2012.
