column4: Hiring An Individual Consultant For Institutional Strengthening Action Plan (isap) Facilitator
column12: O/o EIC (Civil) Orissa Nirman Soudha Unit - V
column18: OFFICE OF THE ENGINEER-IN-CHIEF (CIVIL) ODISHA NIRMAN SOUDHA KESHARI NAGAR UNIT ? V BHUBANESWAR ? 751001 No. PMU ? WB ? 62 / 2012 / 21752 Dt. 04.07.2012 INDIA ODISHASTATE ROADS PROJECT EXPRESSION OF INTEREST FOR HIRING AN INDIVIDUAL CONSULTANTFOR Institutional Strengthening Action Plan (ISAP)Facilitator 1. This Request for Expressions of Interestfollows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared in Development Business issue of 29th September2005. 2. The State Government of Odisha(GOO) through the Government of India hassigned a loan agreement with the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (World Bank) amounting to US$250 millionequivalent for implementation of Odisha State Roads Project and intends to apply a portion of this loan to finance technicalassistance and advisory services for institutional development support to assist GOO to improve its road sector policyinstitutional and legal framework to align it with the rapidly changing environment and context. 3. The project consists of a Institutional Development Component whichincludes modernization and institutional strengthening by inter alia the following components. development of a modern Road Asset ManagementSystem strengthening the Odisha Works Department (OWD)capacity in core business functions including environment and social management road safety road asset management and PPPtransactions; revision and update the PWD codes and manuals toimprove contract management and procurement practices in OWD; and training and core skills development of OWD staffetc. OWD now wishes to engage an experienced andqualified IS Implementation Facilitator. The ISAP includes clear monitorable targets and milestones for a planned range of policycapacity and/or resource improvements in the following fields. a. Road Sector Strategy (Regulatory &Strategic Context b. Core Processes in Roads Management c. Organizational Structure & Management d. Financial Management Audit &Administration e. Information & Communication Technologyand MIS f. Human Resources Development & Capacity Building g. Procurement reforms h. Construction Industries skill developmentetc. Consultancy services have already been procured to assist Odisha Works Department (OWD) in meeting various targets set in the ISAP forthe Road Sector Institutional Development (RSID). In the above backdrop OWD now wishes to strengthen its capacity for high-levelmonitoring and steering of the overallIS process with the help of an IS facilitator who shall be advising the Chief Engineer inmonitoring of ISAP and its results to help the OWD to ensure that the various ISAP activities and resources can achieve effectivewell-integrated and timely IS outputs. Detail informationon the project can be accessed through the project website www.osrp.gov.in . Required qualifications &Experience:- The qualification and experience requirement for the proposed position of IS Implementation coordinator shallpossess i. Degree in Civil Engineering with minimum 20 years ofexperience; ii. Significant experience at senior management level inroad infrastructuredevelopment and management functions preferably in the Government set up; iii. Proven capacity for the formulation and execution of complex andchallenging strategies for institutional development/ strengthening; iv. Sound knowledge of the current Government policies in the Center andState level administrative and finance frameworks and process for road infrastructure development and management; and v. Effective oral and written communication and briefingskillsinter-personal and presentational skills and proven capacityfor mobilizing effective teamwork. . 6. Period of Service :- The period of services for the proposed position will be requiredinitially for 24 months. This may be extended for a further period of six months by mutual consent if required at least one monthbefore the end of the contract period depending on the stratus of the ISAP implementation process then. Physical presence of theConsultant at Bhubaneswar is required for a period of minimum fivedays per month besides attending various review meeting during World Bank missions/ visits as and whenrequired. Interaction / guidance on the project related matters during the serviceperiod other than those time period as referred above shall be made either electronically or telephonically. 7. The Chief Engineer World Bank Projects Odisha on behalf of the Government of Odisha now invites eligible IndividualConsultants to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultants must provide information indicating thatthey are qualified to perform the Services (experience of similar assignments undertaken with combination of most of the above listed fields etc.) by submitting thefollowing information: a) curriculum vitae of the consultant with contact details and PAN number; b) Expertise for theproposed services c) If a firm authorization for the assignment and audited and/or certified Financial statement for thelast three years; and d) Statement of some of the major RSID assignments undertaken in the last five years 8. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of theWorld Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants] byWorld Bank Borrowers (Selection and Employment of Consultants by Bank Borrowers of January 2011) setting forththe World Banks policy on conflict of interest. 9. Interested Consultants may obtain furtherinformation at the address given below from 10.00 to 17.00 Hours on all working days. 10. All communications including request for proposals andconsultants contract for the proposed assignment will beissued in Englishlanguage only. 11. Expression of interest must be delivered to the address below by no later than 30 th July 2012. Sd/-Nalinikanta Pradhan Chief Engineer World Bank Projects Odisha Office of the Engineer-in-Chief (Civil) Odisha Nirman Soudha Keshari Nagar Unit ? V Bhubaneswar ? 751 001 Odisha INDIA Tel : 0674 ? 2396783 ; Email : pmuosrp@gmail.com

column18: ORIGINAL EOINOTICE : OFFICE OFTHE ENGINEER-IN-CHIEF(CIVIL) ODISHA NIRMAN SOUDHA KESHARI NAGAR UNIT? V BHUBANESWAR ? 751 001 No. PMU- WB-14/2013- 13197 March 302013 INDIA ODISHA STATE ROADSPROJECT EXPRESSION OF INTEREST FOR HIRINGAN INDIVIDUAL CONSULTANT FOR FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT SPECIALIST 1. This Request for Expressions of Interest follows the general procurement notice for this project that appearedin DevelopmentBusiness issue of 29th September2005. 2. The State Government of Odisha(GOO) through the Government of India has signed a loan agreement with theInternational Bank for Reconstruction and Development (World Bank) amounting to US$250 million equivalent for implementation ofOdisha State Roads Project and intends to apply a portion of this loan to finance the engagement of an experienced and qualifiedFinancial Management Specialist (FMS) for internal control and audit to strengthen its capacity on financialmanagement. 3. The primary objective of the assignment is toprovide consultancy services and assistance for the financialmanagement aspects of the project such as maintenance of books of accounts internal control and financial discipline as per theaccounting policies procedures preparation of financial reports project monitoring auditing guided by the Odisha Public WorksDepartment Code Central Public Works Accounts Code and guidelines of the World Bank as well as instructions and circulars issuedby the Government of Odisha from time to time. 4. The broad scope of the services include two aspects broadlyi.e. (i) financial management like advising the client on financial management issues relating to the project preparation ofMaster Plan andannual plan and budget estimates and (ii) internal control like periodic review and monitoring of works/ contractswith respect to time andcost over-runs statutory payments and reconciliation of the status of disbursement. Requiredqualifications & Experience:- Thequalification and experiencerequirement for the proposed position of Financial Management Specialist shall possess i. Bachelors Degree in any discipline. ii. Experience in OdishaPublic Works System of Accounting for twenty years including experience in handlingfinancial management aspects of projects funded by loan/aid from external agencies such as Asian Development Bank JBIC World Bankfor at least three years. iii. Sound knowledge of the currentGovernment policies in the Centerand State level administrative and finance frameworks and process as required for road infrastructure projects. iv. Effective oral and written communication and briefing skills inter personal and presentational skills and capacity for mobilizing and guiding teamwork. v. Skills such as knowledge of Procurement Procedure for the World Bank Aided Projects Contract Management ofFIDIC contracts and legal side of Contract Management and Dispute Settlement Mechanism shall be given additionalpreference. 6. Period of Service :- The contract for engagement of the proposed Financial ManagementSpecialist shall be for a period at 24 months and may be extended for a further period of 12 months on mutual consent if requiredat the end of primary 24 months. Physical presence of the consultant in Project Management Unit at Bhubaneswar is required at leasttwo weeks in a month besides attending various World Bank Mission/Reviewmeetings/ DB Meetings as and when required. 7. The ChiefEngineer World Bank Projects Odisha on behalf of the Government of Odisha now invites eligible Individual Consultants to indicate their interest in providingthe Services. Interested Consultants must provide information indicating that theyare qualified to perform the Services (experienceof similar assignments undertaken with combination of most of the above listed fields etc.) by submitting the followinginformation: a. curriculumvitae of theconsultant with contact details and PAN number; b. Expertisefor the proposed services c. If from afirm authorization for the person for the assignment and audited and/or certified Financial statement for the last three years; and d. Statementof some of the major assignments undertaken in the last five years. 8. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines:Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants] by World Bank Borrowers(Selection and Employment of Consultants by Bank Borrowers of January 2011) setting forth the World Banks policy onconflict of interest. 9. The selection of the consultant shall be made as per the provisions ofSection V of World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employmentof Consultants [under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants] by World Bank Borrowers (Selection and Employment ofConsultants by Bank Borrowers of January 2011). 10. Interested Consultants may obtain further information at the address given below from 10.00 to 17.00 Hours on all workingdays. 11. All communications including request for proposals and consultants contract for the proposed assignment willbe issued in English language only. 12. Expression of interest must bedelivered to the address below by no later than April 30 2013. Sd/- Nalinikanta Pradhan Chief Engineer World BankProjects Odisha Office of the Engineer-in-Chief(Civil) Odisha Nirman Soudha Keshari Nagar Unit? V Bhubaneswar ? 751 001 Odisha INDIA Tel : 0674 ? 2396783 ; Email: pmuosrp@gmail.com CORRIGENDUM NO-1 TO EOI: OFFICE OF THE ENGINEER-IN-CHIEF (CIVIL) ODISHA NIRMAN SOUDHA KESHARINAGAR UNIT ? column18: OFFICE OF THE ENGINEER-IN-CHIEF (CIVIL)ODISHA NIRMAN SOUDHA KESHARI NAGAR UNIT ? V BHUBANESWAR ? 751001 Letter No. PMU ? WB - 45 / 2010 - 5189 Dt. 22.02.2012 INDIA ODISHA STATE ROADSPROJECT EXPRESSION OF INTEREST For Hiring of NGO for theImplementation of Social Safeguard Instruments For Jagatpur-Chandbali Road 1. This Request for Expressions of Interest follows thegeneral procurement notice for this project that appeared inDevelopment Business issue of 29th September 2005. 2. The State Government of Odisha (GOO) through the Government of India hassigned a loan agreement with the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (World Bank) amounting to US$250 million equivalent forimplementation of Odisha State Roads Project and intends to apply a portion of this loan to finance technical services for Social Safeguard Instruments(SSIs) support to assist GOO to implement SocialSafeguard Instruments(SSIs) in Jagatpur - Chandbali Road Corridor(SH-9A-106km.) for improvement widening and strengthening of roadsector. 3. Inthe roads sector the GOO is aiming for more effective capabilities and performance to provide improved services to road users andassist the States socio economic development. The institutional strengthening (IS) strategy being followed by GOO in this sectoris based on Resettlement Action Plan (RAP) and Terms of Reference(ToR) in which the scope of services are carefully matched withStates priorities circumstances and resources. Accordingly a Rehabilitation Action Plan (RAP) has been endorsed by the StateGovernment to guide implementation of SSIs activities and to facilitate monitoring of SSIs progress by the GOO and theBank. TheSSIs fully comply with the requirements of the Resettlementand Rehabilitation Policy of Government of Odisha 2006 strategyandAction Plan for prevention of HIV/AIDS transmission indigenous peoples development strategy and the need to educate and makethe people aware about road safety. Consultancy services are now required to assist Odisha Works Department (OWD) in meetingvarious targets set out in the SSIs for the proposed Jagatpur ? Chandbali project as indicated above. The duration of theConsultancy services will be approximately 36months. 4. The Chief Engineer World BankProjects Odisha on behalf of the Government of Odisha now invites eligible Non Governmental Organizations (NGO-Consultants) toindicate their interest in providingthe Services. Interested NGOs must provide information indicating that they are qualified toperform the Services by submitting the following information: (1) Name address e-mail telephone ownership and organizationalstructure of the consulting firm; (2) Audited Report for the last threeyears; (3) Expertise available with the organization for the proposedservices particularly in the World Bank/ Government Assisted Community Development Projects at least for two years (4) Experience in implementing Rural/Tribal Development (5) Experience in implementing HIV/AIDs Awareness Project (6) Experience in implementing Roads Safety AwarenessProject (7) Availability of skilled personnel in the fieldof R&R/Community Development /HIV-AIDS Awareness / Road Safety Awareness. (8) Copy of valid registration of NGO with competent authoritydully attested by authorised representative to be submitted with technical proposal. (9) Copy of declaration of APIO PIO and Appellateauthority withname and address in respect of NGO to the RTI act Act 2005 duly attested by authorised representative. (10) Power of Attorney/Authorisation letter to the NGO functionaryauthorised to submit E.O.I. (11) Consultants are to submit affidavit to the effect that beingNGOs they have not been black listed by CAPART Government of India any State Government and/or other financial institutions. (12) In order to ensure sustainability to work in the local areawith regards to proficiency in Odia language language of local area and experience of working in conflict situation includingR&R the farm from outside Odisha is encouraged to have a tie-up with local NGO based in Odisha having requisite andcommensurate experience as expected in this assignment. The MOU between the outside farm and the local NGO the experience and theproposed staff with qualification of the local NGO demonstrating the capability of handling the system in Odia language shall besubmitted. (13) A statement indicating basic infrastructure and whether thesame can be deployed at the work site (14) A Self assessment report in maximum 400words. 5. NGOs may associate with otherorganizations to enhance their qualifications. [The "Association" maytake the form of a joint venture (with joint and severalliability) or of a sub-consultancy]. 6. AnNGO willbe selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by Bank Borrowers of May 2004 ( Revised October 2006 and May 2010). 7. Interested NGOs may obtain further information at the address given below from 10.00 to 17.00 Hours on all workingdays. 8. Request for Proposals the Proposal and consultantscontract for the proposed assignmentwill be issued in English. 9. Expression of interest must bedelivered to the addressbelow by no later than 20th March 2012. Chief Engineer World Bank ProjectsOdisha Office of the Engineer-in-Chief (Civil)Odisha Nirman Soudha Keshari Nagar Unit ? V Bhubaneswar ? 751 001Odisha INDIA Tel : 0674 ? 2396783 ; Email : pmuosrp@gmail.com

CORRIGENDUM No. 2 TO BIDDING DOCUMENT FORPROCUREMENTOF COMMERICAL OFF-THE-SHELF (COTS) SOFTWARE FOR ODISHA ROAD ASSET MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (O-RAMS) CORRIGENDUM No. 2 TO BIDDING DOCUMENT FORPROCUREMENTOF COMMERICAL OFF-THE-SHELF (COTS) SOFTWARE FOR ODISHA ROAD ASSET MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (O-RAMS) CORRIGENDUM No. 2 TO BIDDING DOCUMENT FORPROCUREMENTOF COMMERICAL OFF-THE-SHELF (COTS) SOFTWARE FOR ODISHA ROAD ASSET MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (O-RAMS) CORRIGENDUM No. 2 TO BIDDING DOCUMENT FORPROCUREMENTOF COMMERICAL OFF-THE-SHELF (COTS) SOFTWARE FOR ODISHA ROAD ASSET MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (O-RAMS) Sl. No. Section & Clause No. Section & Clause description as per the BidDocument Modification as per Corrigendum No.2 1 Section VI Clause 2.3.4 (Page 75) 2.3.4 Database Software and Development Tools: The O-RAMS shall operate using a relational database management system(RDBMS) developed using fourth generation language (compatible with either Microsoft SQL Server OR Oracle latest versions or byboth). The COTS software supplier must specify the RDBMSplatform (and version supporting full use database license) of his choice on which the software will operate and provide cost oflicensing the same for financial evaluation. The Client may require the COTS supplier to supplythe license for theRDBMS. 2.3.4 Database Software and Development Tools: The O-RAMS shall operate using a relational database management system(RDBMS) developed using fourth generation language (compatible with either Microsoft SQL Server OR Oracle latest versions or byboth). The Client intends to have a full license of the RDBMS along with the COTS software and to be used as theunderlying technology for all O-RAMS applications. It may also be used for developing anyother application in future by Client. The COTS softwaresupplier must specify the RDBMS platform (and version supporting full use database license) of his choice on which the softwarewill operate and provide cost of licensing the same for financial evaluation. The Client may require the COTS supplierto supplythe license for the RDBMS. 2 Section III Sl. No. 4. Postqualification Requirements (ITB 38.2) (b) Experience and TechnicalCapacity (Page 38) (b) Experience and TechnicalCapacity The Bidder shall furnish documentary evidence from the Purchasers to demonstrate that it meets the followingexperience requirement(s): (i) In last 10 years COTS Software (with RIS PMS andBIS) must have been supplied to and implemented in at least five road agencies. (ii) Amongst road agencies at least three must be using the COTS Softwaresatisfactorily till the date of bid submission; or Amongst road agencies at least three must have renewed AMC for at least 3years after implementation and acceptance of the COTS software. The documentary evidences shall include the following: (i) Name of all agencies and address including contact number and details onnumber and type of licenses withmention of year in which system were accepted in respective agencies.A certificate from purchaser/agencies is required confirming implementation year; (ii) Documentary evidence such as support agreement /Annual Maintenance Contract etc. to fulfill requirement of 4.b (i) & (ii) (b) Experience and TechnicalCapacity The Bidder shall furnish documentary evidence from the Purchasers to demonstrate that it meets the followingexperience requirement(s): (i) In last 10 years COTS Software (with RIS PMS andBIS) must have been supplied to and implemented in at least five road agencies. (ii) Amongst road agencies at least three must be using the COTS Softwaresatisfactorily at least for last three years; or Amongst road agencies at least three must have renewed AMC for at least 3years after implementation and acceptance of the COTS software. The documentary evidences shall include the following: (i) Name of all agencies and address including contact number and details on number and type of licenseswith mention of year in which system were accepted in respective agencies. Acertificate from purchaser/ agencies is requiredconfirming implementation year; (ii) Documentary evidence such as support agreement /Annual Maintenance Contract etc. to fulfill requirement of 4.b (i) & (ii) 3 Section VI Clause 1.1.1 (Page 63) 1.1.1 The components of O-RAMS will be implemented at all Divisions Circles andHeadquarter offices of OWD. There are approximately forty (40) Division offices throughout Odisha which are managed by Circles thelatter expected to number up to about ten (10) in the near future. The main server running theapplication and database will be housed in the Data Center at Department of IT or National Informatics Centre (NIC) locatedoffsite from the OWD Headquarters. It will have adedicated link to the O-RAMS management unit at OWD Headquarters to access the full functional version of the application. Theconnectivity will likely to be either via OSWAN (Odisha State Wide Area Network) or through a leased-line service the modality ofwhich will be decided at a later stage. The web-version will be hostedthrough a web server. It will be accessible to all Division and Circle offices through a user ID and password. The user ID andpassword will also be used to authenticate the user for accessibility to various functions and levels of O-RAMS. A schematic representationof the proposed configuration/ architecture at various levels/ offices in the OWD is shown in Figure 1. { For Images please visit http://osrp.gov.in/Goods_Tenders.html } Figure 1: Proposed O-RAMS System Architecture 1.1.1 The components of O-RAMS will be implemented at all Divisions Circles andHeadquarter offices of OWD. There are approximately forty (40) Division offices throughout Odisha which are managed by Circles thelatter expected to number up to about ten (10) in the near future. The main server running theapplication and database will be housed in the Data Center at Department of IT or National Informatics Centre (NIC) locatedoffsite from the OWD Headquarters. It will have adedicated link to the O-RAMS management unit at OWD Headquarters to access the full functional version of the COTS application. Allfunctions related to PMS and administrative operations such as managingrights for user role etc. will be performed in HQ accessingdatabasethrough dedicated leased line. The connectivity will likely to be either via OSWAN (Odisha State Wide Area Network) orthrough a leased-line service the modality of which will be decided at a later stage. The web-version of the COTS software andbespoke systems (GIS TIS and RMMS) will be hosted through a web server separately. It will be accessible to all Division andCircle offices through a user ID and password. The user ID and password will also be used to authenticate the userfor accessibilityto various functions and levels of O-RAMS (COTS andbespoke applications). It is required that the remote users will access COTS software through a webbrowser to perform selected functions such as view edit query print data/ reports. Aschematic representation of theproposed configuration/ architecture at various levels/ offices in the OWD is shown in Figure 1. { For Images please visit http://osrp.gov.in/Goods_Tenders.html } Figure 1: Proposed ORAMS System Architecture 4 Section VI Clause 2.5.1 (Page 76) 2.5.1 System Integration: The geographic locationof all road assets will be defined in external GIS being developed separately by the Implementation Consultant. This will be linkedto the O-RAMS database containing network definition and attribute data. The integration requirements will be jointly undertaken bythe Implementation Consultant and the COTS software supplier. 2.5.1 System Integration: The geographic locationof all road assets will be defined in external GIS being developed separately by the Implementation Consultant. This will be linkedto the O-RAMS database containing network definition and attribute data. The integration requirements will be jointly undertaken bythe Implementation Consultant and the COTS software supplier. The integration of the TIS and RMMSwith the COTS software will entail as a minimum a read-only access of the data contained in the COTS database by the externalapplication for purposes of referencing the locations of external data against the road network entities that are managed by theCOTS software. Data that is generated by the externalapplication and subsequently to be populated in the COTS could be done through an import process. Any changes to the network entities that have occurred by time of importing this datashouldbe tracked by the COTS software through a log file and the data in the external systems will be correctedmanually." 5 Section VI Clauses 1.4.5 and 1.4.6 (Page 68 & 69) 1.4.5 The RIS data model shall be capable ofmanaging data recorded as both point (e.g. km stones) and linear elements (e.g. roughness data) and as well be able to accommodateoverlapping locations for certain types of attributes (e.g. roughness data recorded against lanes more than one traffic sign atone location etc.). It should also allow for interface with a geographic information system (GIS) for mapping purposes. 1.4.6 The Client is in the process ofestablishing a Geographic Information System (GIS) using ESRI tools including ArcMap client software and ArcGIS Server. The COTS software should be able to link seamlessly to thegeo-database for integration of attribute and map data to display GIS thematic maps. The COTS softwareshould have capability to provideattribute data of roads in a user-configurable interface. It should have the following capabilities for:  Integration with road culvert bridge R-O-W feature and relateddata;  GIS data export feature to external application(s);  GIS map plotting/ thematic map preparation capability;  Dynamic segmentation capability (to be able to show the attribute(s) of asegment or group of segments as needed);  A mechanism to compare the depicted length of the graphical representationwith the defined length as stored in O-RAMS in order to ensure correspondence of data and to highlight anomalies for userinvestigation;  From the O-RAMS while reviewing a particular roadsection the user shouldbe able to view and highlight that road section. The interface should highlight if there is any missing GIS representation for agiven road section;  Selected attributes of the road section as storedin O-RAMS should beable to be viewed. These attributes should include all section-wide attributes including section identifier road identifierdefined direction of the section road classification etc.;  The GIS interface should enable viewing of video data as stored or referencedby the COTS software according to the direction and chainage of the video lookup tables stored in the database. 1.4.5 The RIS data model shall be capable ofmanaging data recorded as both point (e.g. km stones) and linear elements (e.g. roughness data) and as well be able to accommodateoverlapping locations for certain types of attributes (e.g. roughness data recorded against lanes more than one traffic sign atone location etc.). 1.4.6 The Client is in the process ofestablishing a Geographic Information System (GIS) using ESRI tools including ArcMap client software and ArcGIS Server. The COTS software should have capability to provide attributedata of roads in a user-configurable interface to external GIS. 6 Section VI H. Attachments (Page 86) H. ATTACHMENTS This bid document has noattachments. H. ATTACHMENTS 1. Bridge Inventory Data Format 2. Bridge Condition Data Format { For Images please visit http://osrp.gov.in/Goods_Tenders.html } CORRIGENDUM No. 2 TO BIDDING DOCUMENT FORPROCUREMENTOF COMMERICAL OFF-THE-SHELF (COTS) SOFTWARE FOR ODISHA ROAD ASSET MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (O-RAMS) CORRIGENDUM No. 2 TO BIDDING DOCUMENT FORPROCUREMENTOF COMMERICAL OFF-THE-SHELF (COTS) SOFTWARE FOR ODISHA ROAD ASSET MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (O-RAMS) CORRIGENDUM No. 2 TO BIDDING DOCUMENT FORPROCUREMENTOF COMMERICAL OFF-THE-SHELF (COTS) SOFTWARE FOR ODISHA ROAD ASSET MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (O-RAMS) CORRIGENDUM No. 2 TO BIDDING DOCUMENT FORPROCUREMENTOF COMMERICAL OFF-THE-SHELF (COTS) SOFTWARE FOR ODISHA ROAD ASSET MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (O-RAMS) Sl. No. Section & Clause No. Section & Clause description as per the BidDocument Modification as per Corrigendum No.1 7 Section VI Clause 2.5.2.1 (Page 76) 2.5.2.1 The COTS softwaresupplier will train O-RAMS core group (Implementation Consultants staff and selected Client staffof Asset Management Cell) duringconfiguration of the software at Bhubaneswar for three (3) weeks. 2.5.2.1 The COTS softwaresupplier will train O-RAMS core group (Implementation Consultants staff and selected Client staffof Asset Management Cell) duringconfiguration of the software at Bhubaneswar for three (3) weeks. It is expected that about 10 members will take part in the COTSsoftware training. This training will focus on atrain-the-trainer type syllabus so that they can carry forwardconfiguration work with support from COTS software supplier.Trainingon System use to OWD staff is the responsibility of Implementation Consultant. 8 Section VI Clause 2.4.2 (Page 75) 2.4.2 User andusageadministration: The Client requires unlimitednamed users. A maximum five (5) concurrent userswill access the system of which two (2) concurrent users will be able to use analyticalfunctions. The dataediting/importing will be initially performed at OWD Headquarters. This function may be shifted to the remote offices as implementation and roll-out progress in future. Thereforeadditional licenses for the COTS software will likely be required allowing data editing/importing from offices across the State.The COTS software supplier should indicate a unit price for such additional licenses. 2.4.2 User andusageadministration: The Client requires unlimitednamed users. Analytical functionsconcerns to all functions related to PMS and administrative operations such as managing rights for user roleetc. The dataediting/importing will be initially performed at OWD Headquarters. se to the QuestionRaised 1 Section I Clause 2.2 (Page 5) Payment made under thecontract shall be inaccordance with the terms and conditions of the financing agreement between the purchaser and the bank and willbe subject in all respects to the terms and conditions of loan agreement. What are those terms & conditions? Does it mean that ifpayment from bank not made to purchaser by bank payment to bidder shall withhold if this is so we should not accept such type ofconditional payment clause. Kindly clarify. The Loan Agreement and the Project Agreement is available inhttp://www.osrp.gov.in/ The Contract Agreement with the supplier shall govern theterms of payment. Payment to the bidder will be made by the "Purchaser". 2 Section I Clause 3.2 (Page 7) / Section VII GCC Clause 11.1 (Page 100) Bidders shall permitthe Bank to inspect any accounts and records and other documents relating to the Bid submission and contract performance and tohave them audited by Auditors appointed by the Bank. Please ensure that the audit rights under this clause shallnot include access to theSuppliers profit margins or overheads associated with any obligationunder this ContractAgreement. Also ensure that cost of such auditand inspection shall be borne by the purchasing entity. No change to General Conditions of the Contract isacceptable. 3 Section I ITB 4.1 (Page 8) A Bidder and allparties constituting the Bidder may have the nationality of any country subject to the restrictions specified in Section VEligible Countries. A Bidder shallbe deemed to have thenationality of a country if the Bidder is a citizen or is constituted incorporated or registered and operates in conformity withthe provisions of the laws of that country. Thiscriterion shall also apply to the determination of the nationality of proposed subcontractors or suppliers for any part of theContract including Related Services. Please clarify the norms for determination of nationality ofbidder. The clause is self-explanatory. 4 Section I ITB 14.1 The prices anddiscounts quoted by the Bidder in the Bid Submission Form and in the Price Schedules shall conformto the requirements specifiedbelow. Can we include discount in the price quoted instead ofgiving discount separately Please refer to"Bid Submission Form" in Section IV which isself explanatory. 5 Section I ITB 14.6 (a) (page 12) For Goods manufacturedin the Purchasers Country: (i) the price of theGoods quoted EXW (ex works ex factory ex warehouse ex showroom or off-the-shelf as applicable) including all customs dutiesand sales and other taxes already paid or payable on the components and raw material used in the manufacture or assembly of theGoods; (ii) any PurchasersCountry sales tax and other taxes which will be payable on the Goods if the contract is awarded to the Bidder; and (iii) the price forinland transportation insurance and other local services required to convey the Goods to their final destination (Project Site)specified in the BDS. Please clarify your norms to identify the location ofmanufacturing for the COTS products offered by the bidders. Please refer toSection III. Sl. 1 Domestic Preference (ITB35.1) which is self-explanatory. 6 Section I Clause 21.2 (Page 16) BidSecurity How many days should the Bid Security be valid for? Please refer toSection I ITB Clauses 20.1 21.2 (f); whichare self-explanatory. 7 Section I Clause 21.2 (Page 16) Bid security validity to be 90 days or 118 days Please refer toSection I ITB Clauses 20.1 21.2 (f); whichare self-explanatory. 8 Section II ITB1.1 Lot 1 Part 1 (Page 29) Licensing Please advise the how many unlimited named users therewill be and whether these are internal Odisha staff and / or whether external access (e.g. by the public) may be required to someinformation held within the COTS product. Please refer toITB 1.1. which isself-explanatory. 9 Section II ITB1.1 Lot 1 Part 1 (Page 29) Could OWD provide an estimate of how many users with haveread-only edit and administrative permissions? Please refer toITB 1.1. which isself-explanatory. 10 Section II ITB1.1 Lot 1 Part 2 (Page 29) Purchase of a full useRDBMS license. Refers to the Purchase of a full use RDBMS license. Is thislicense required in the underlying technology of theCOTS application (e.g. Oracle SQL*Server) ? Please advise on the need for a full use RDBMS license. Hasthis been specified solely in order to ensure that the bidders include all underlying technology costs. Is there an intention touse this license for development purposes ? If the latter is the intention to undertake local development around the COTS productor is this license being sought for purposes unrelated to the COTS product ? Are you able to provide examples of thetype ofdevelopment work you intend to undertake (if any) ? This willhelp us cost the most effective license for Odisha. Please refer Sl. 1 of Corrigendum No. 2 to this bid document. Yes  for full use RDBMS-Server license 11 Section II ITB1.1 Lot 1 Part 2 (Page 29) Is it necessaryfor the bidder to quote for RDBMS? Please refer Sl. 1 of Corrigendum No. 2 to this bid document. Yes  for full use RDBMS-Server license 12 Section II ITB13.1 (Page 30) Alternativebids ITB 13.1 Page 30 Alternative bids ? Is it possible topropose alternate methodologythat is superior to the TOR requirements. The Clause is self-explanatory. 13 Section II ITB14.5 (Page 30) Does OPWD provide customs and duty exemption certificatesfor software. This is a clear hindrance in our and other prospective biddersability to provide ou an open scalable and cost effective COTS solution...... It is understood that ArcGIS does not use extremelyproprietary and Non-interoperableGIS format. It follows Openmechanism for information exchange betweengeodatabases and other external systems. Sharing data is greatly simplified using the geodatabase XML specification where Externalapplications can receive XML data streams including exchange of complete lossless datasets; Interchange of simple feature sets (similar to shapefileinterchange); Exchange of change-only (delta) record sets using XMLstreams to pass updates and changes among geodatabases and other external data structures. In-built GIS functionality of COTS software is optionalprovided it comes without additional cost burden to client. column4: Independent Social Safeguards Review
column12: O/o EIC (Civil) Orissa Nirman Soudha Unit - V
column18: OFFICE OF THE ENGINEER-IN-CHIEF (CIVIL)ODISHA NIRMAN SOUDHA KESHARI NAGAR UNIT ? V BHUBANESWAR ? 751 001 No. PMU ? WB ? 37 / 2012 / 23805 Dt. 21.07.2012 INDIA ODISHA STATE ROADSPROJECT EXPRESSION OF INTEREST FOR HIRING AN INDIVIDUAL CONSULTANT FOR INDEPENDENTSOCIAL SAFEGUARDSREVIEW. 1. This Request for Expressions of Interest follows the general procurement notice forthis project that appeared in Development Business issue of 29th September 2005. 2. The State Government of Odisha (GOO) through the Government of India has signed a loanagreement (Loan No. 7577-IN) with theInternational Bank for Reconstruction and Development (World Bank) amounting to US$250 millionequivalent for implementation of Odisha State Roads Project and intends to apply a portion of this loan to financeservices forIndependent Social Safeguards review in the four road corridors under OSRP. 3. The project consists of broadly two components- Road corridor improvement and aInstitutional Development. The implementation and monitoring of the project is being carried out by the PMU headedby Chief Engineer(World Bank Projects) and assisted by professionalsin Engineering Finance Land Acquisition Resettlement and RehabilitationEnvironment etc. Detailed information on the project can be accessed through project website (www.osrp.gov.in). The Project Authority wants to carry out anindependent review of the social management plans and their implementation for the phase-I and phase-II roads. These include:Berhampur-Taptapani (41 kms); Bhawanipatna-Khariar- (68 kms) Anandpur-Chandbali (95 kms) and Jagatpur-Chandbali 106 kms. Thisreview is intended to help the Project authorities assess and ensure that safeguard measures are properly implemented with livingstandards of affected people restored or improved. Independent evaluation of OSRP-social management plans including RAP TDP andHIV/AIDSPlan are to be carried out at the mid- and end-term. OSRP was approved in 2008 and has completed 3 years of implementationtherefore a mid-term review is being proposed. In this context the OWD is looking for anexternal social development consultant to carry out an independent review of social safeguards management including of RAP TDPand HIV/AIDS and Road Safety plan implementation and determine whether stated goals were achieved and suggest corrective measuresif necessary. The Consultant will review and verify the related aspects of Social Safeguards. . 4. Required qualifications & Experience:- Thequalification and experience requirement for the proposed position : 1. The Consultant should have at least five years of relevant experience inmonitoring and evaluation of social dimensions ofinfrastructure/development projects and significant experience in resettlementpolicy and implementation aspects. Further work experience and familiarity with all aspects of resettlement operations would bedesirable. The consulting firm or NGO or any agency involved in any aspect of the project will not be eligible for theapplication. 2. The consultant should have a higher degree in sociology anthropology politicalscience development studies human geography planning or other relevant social sciences with practical experience inresettlement and in monitoring and evaluation. Preference shall be given to a candidate experienced in infrastructure project withsocial mobilization aspects with intensive field visits. Previous experience of work with ADB or WB projects will be a plus. Womencandidates are encouraged to apply. 5. Period of Service :- 2months. 6. The Chief Engineer World BankProjects Odisha on behalf ofthe Government of Odisha now invites eligible Consultants to indicate their interest in providing the above Services.Interested Consultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified to perform the Services (experience of similarassignments undertaken with combination of most of the above listed fields etc.) by submitting the followinginformation: a) Name address e-mail telephone  CV PAN No of theindividualconsultant b) Expertise for the proposedservices c) Statement of major assignments undertaken in the last fiveyears d) If the individual consultant is seconded by a firm theauthorization of the firm along with audited and/or certifiedFinancial statement for the last three years. 7. The selection of individual consultant shall be made in accordance withthe procedures set out in the World BanksGuidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by Bank Borrowers of May 2004(Revised October 2006 May 2010 & January 2011). 8. Interested Consultants may obtain furtherinformation at the address given below from 10.00 to 17.00 Hours on all working days. 9. Request for Proposals the Proposal and consultants contract for the proposedassignment will be issued in English language only. 10. Expression of interest must be delivered to the address below byno later than 8 th August 2012:- ChiefEngineer World Bank Projects Odisha Office of the Engineer-in-Chief (Civil) Odisha Nirman Soudha Keshari Nagar Unit ? V Bhubaneswar ? 751 001Odisha INDIA Tel : 0674 ? 2396783 ; Email : pmuosrp@gmail.com

column4: Consulting Services For Provdiding Technical Assistance To Road Safety Cell (rsc) Nhai
column12: National Highways Authority of India 1st Floor MTNL Building Sector 19 Dwarka
column18: INDIA NATIONAL HIGHWAYS AUTHORITY OF INDIA CONSULTING SERVICES FOR PROVDIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO ROAD SAFETY CELL (RSC)NHAI EXPRESSION OF INTEREST Loan/ Credit/Grant No. LMNHP (Loan No.4764-IN) This request for expressions of interest follows the general procurementnotice for this project that appeared in UN Development Business of 1 st June 2010. The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) is engaged in thedevelopment of National Highways entrusted by the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways Govt. of India. NHAI has created the Road Safety Cell (RSC) at Headquarters which has specific responsibility toestablish safety policies and procedurescarrying out Safety Audit during design construction and operation stages of Highwaysmonitoring of Safety performance during construction and operation organizing training programs on Safety and taking allactionsnecessary for ensuring safety on the NHAIs Highway network. The Govt. of India has received a loan from the International Bank forReconstruction and Development (IBRD) in the amount of US$ 620 Million equivalent toward the Lucknow - Muzaffarpur National HighwayProject and it intends to apply part of the loan proceeds to make payments under the contract for consulting services forproviding technical assistance to the Road Safety Cell. The overarching objective of the Consulting Services would be tostrengthen the capacity of the RSC to deliver its mandate and subsequentlyfulfill NHAIs responsibility for road safety in all ofits operations. The service will include providing a team comprising of a Road Safety Advisor (RSA) and technical support staff tobe stationed at RSC and Regional Office of NHAI full time for two years. The RSA should be a Road Safety Expert with a workexperience of minimum 15 years out ofwhich at least 8 years of exclusive international experience on Road Safety Aspects either asa Road Agency staff or consultant. The consultant must demonstrate international experience in Road Safety policy and strategydevelopment and implementation. Experience in human resource development and institutionalcapacity building on Safety in the Highway transport sector will be preferable. The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) now invites eligibleconsultants to indicate their interest in providing the services. Interested consultants must provide information indicating thatthey are qualified to perform the services (i.e. brochures description of similar international assignments on either strategy/policy advise on roadsafety or institutional strengthening and/or technical assistance services on road safety undertaken by thefirm and availability of Road Safety skills among staff etc). The experience of carrying out Road Safety Audit will not beconsidered relevant experience for this assignment which has institutional strengthening and policy/strategy advisory focus.Consultants may associate with individuals/firms to enhance their qualifications. The Association may take the form of a jointventure (with joint and several liability) or of a sub-consultancy. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set outin the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrower (May 2004 revised October2006). Interested consultants may obtain further information at the address below from 0930 to 1800 hours. Interested consultant may obtain furtherinformation from NHAI at theaddress below from 1600 hours to 1700 hours on working days. Expressions of interest must be submitted to the same address by04.04.2012 up to 1700 hours. P.C. Arya General Manager (Tech) Road Safety Cell National Highways Authority of India 1 st Floor MTNL Building Sector 19Dwarka New Delhi-110075 Tel: +91-11-25074100 Ext. 1753 Mobile No. +91 9999953433 Fax: +91-11-28042382 E-mail: pc.arya@nhai.org

column4: Wbr 18-third Party Construction Quality Control And Technical Examination Of Rehabilitation & Modernization Works In Upwsrp Phase-ii
column12: PACTUPWSRP IDUPWALMI Bhawan UtrethiaTelibagh
column18: India: Uttar Pradesh Water Sector RestructuringProject Phase II Credit no.52980-IN Consultancy services for "Third Party Construction Quality Control and Technical Examination of Rehabilitation & Modernization Works in UPWSRPPhase-II" Request for Expressionof Interest No.15/PC/PACT/UPWSRP/IIIrd Party/Ph-II/2013-14 This Requestfor Expression of Interest follows the General Procurement Notice for this Project that appeared in Development Business on10-02-2013. The Government of India(GOI)/Government of Uttar Pradesh (GoUP) has applied for a credit from the International Development Association (IDA) to financethe UP Water Sector Restructuring Project (UPWSRP) Phase 2 and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this credit to paymentsunder the contract for hiring services of consultancy firm for "Third Party Construction Quality Control And TechnicalExaminationOf Rehabilitation & Modernization Works in UPWSRP Phase-II" The scope ofservices would include: (i) Analyzing project activities and developing methodological framework of Quality Management System (QMS) andputting it in place for ensuring fulfillment ofthe whole range of quality control and quality assurance requirements includingworkmanship on the execution of rehabilitation & modernization works as well as the execution of any new works. QMS will include efficient well equipped &well staffed laboratory system comprising base laboratory ground laboratories and proper mobilelaboratories. (ii) Monitoring Contractors adequacy of safety measures put in place on the construction of variousworks. (iii) Monitoring quality management on all key aspects of works covering quality of materials inputs & outputs; constructionprocedures; quality of works and workmanship as well as the environmental and social relatedaspects. (iv) Evaluating the adequacy of laboratory system established by the contractors and the capability of their personnel inconducting quality tests. (v) Evaluating the adequacy of Contractors deployment of men materials machinery (3 Ms) on the works essentially needed for fulfillment of quality control/quality assurance requirements as well as theones needed for implementation of sound construction procedures for achieving goodconstruction quality and workmanship. (vi) Conducting independently at least 75 %of specified quality tests on materials inputs and outputs for respective items ofwork and also verifying at least 25 % of quality tests conducted by the contractors to ensure their accuracy and correct testingprocedures. Consultant to also design Concrete Mixes whenever required. (vii) Maintainingactive functional and result-oriented co-ordination with UPID and PACT on a continuing basis. (viii) Manage a system throughwhich wherever the work is inconsistent with the specifications or drawings at site the information is communicated to theconcerned controlling officer/engineers. (ix) Build the internal capacity of the UPID for quality control and quality assurance. The Chairman (PACT) UPWSRP Lucknowinvites eligible Consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Consultancy Services for the aboveassignment. Interested Consultants must provide the following information indicating that they arequalified to performthe Services: Brochures Description of Similar Assignments Availability of Skills among Staff with experiencein civil engineering irrigation and construction quality control and quality assurance. 5. The consultant may associate with other firms toenhance their qualification. The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of asub-consultancy and this should be stated clearly in the submission. 6. The criteriafor short listing of the Consulting firmsshall be as follows: The firms should have been in business for at least ten (10) yearsinThird Party Construction Quality Control and Technical Examination ofCivil construction works (in terms of for example sizeactivitiesgeographic scale) including at least one (1) Water Sector-related project. Should have at least three (3) experiences during the last ten (10)years in the Construction Quality Control and Technical Examination in large canals constructions & Rehabilitationworks. Should have expertise in developing web-based quality controlmanagement information systems in using state-of-the-art Mobile-based field data recording technology and in GISuse. Shall be financially sound with an average annual turnover of morethan INR 60000000 (US$ 900000) during the last five (5) years (2008-09 to 2012-13); and  Availability of skills mentioned above among core staff of the firm. 7. A consultant will be selected inaccordance with Quality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) procedures set out in the World Banks "Guidelines: Selectionand Employment of Consultants Under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers- January 2011". The Guidelines are available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 8. Interested Consultants may obtainfurther information at the address given below from 10.00 ? 17.00 hours (IST) on all working days. This notice for Expression of Interest has also been posted on UPID website http://irrigation.up.nic.in/project.htm. 9. Expression of Interest with all relevantinformation and documents must besubmitted and subscribed "Third Party Construction QualityControl And Technical Examination Of Rehabilitation & Modernization Works in UPWSRP Phase-II" on top of a closed envelope and be delivered to the address below by not later than 15:00 hours (IST) on November 11 2013. Inthe event thislast date being declared as holiday by the State Government due datefor submission of above EoI will be the nextworking day up till the same appointed time. Chairman PACT UPWSRPIDUP WALMIBhawan Utrethia Telibagh Lucknow226026 UttarPradesh INDIA Phone : + 91 522 2441631 (539) E-mail: prexpactiduplu-up@nic.in Website : http://irrigation.up.nic.in/project.htm

column18: DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS ? GOVT.OF MIZORAM REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST: CONSULTING SERVICES-FIRMSELECTION COUNTRY: INDIA NAME OF PROJECT: Mizoram State Roads II Project. Construction Supervision with full compliance to Engineering Designand drawings technicalspecifications and other contract document within the specified time schedule. ii. To monitor the preconstructionactivities. iii. To assist in taking remedial measure to ensurequality avoid slippage cost overrun and delays by the contractor. iv. To ensure safety during construction andadherence to all the Environmental Management prescribed under the contract. v. Effective contract administration duringtheconstruction period. Detailed TOR is available on website www.mizorampwd.etenders.in The MizoramPublic Works Department now invites eligible consulting firms ("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing theServices. column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES? SELECTION OF CONSULTING FIRM) INDIA UTTARAKHAND DISASTER RECOVERY PROJECT (UDRP) Credit No.5313 - IN Assignment Title: Design Consultancy (BridgeWorks) Reference No .UDRP/PWD/B/DSC/01 The Government of India has received financing from the World Bank toward thecost of the Uttarakhand Disaster Recovery Project(UDRP) and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consultingservices. The consulting services ("the Services") shall broadly include providing design consultancy service and preparation of DetailedProject Reports (DPRs) related to World Bank projects initially for one year period and will be extendable based on theperformance. The scope of works include preparation of DPRs including the detailed design and working drawings for nearly 105numbers of proposed new suspension type/steel bridges for pedestrians nearly 2 numbers of proposed new motor bridges preparationof DPRs including assessment of strength of nearly 94 numbers (pedestrian-85 & motor bridges-9) of existing damaged bridgesand to prepare detailed design & working drawings of the repair works of those bridges including the technical specifications.The firm will be collecting all the technical social and environmental and other related information required with the help ofother project team members and or consultant in the respective field. The PIU- UDRP (Roads and Bridges PWD Dehradun) now invites eligible consulting firms (hereinafter called "Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing theServices. Interested Consultants should provide information demonstrating that they have the requiredqualifications and relevantexperience to perform the Services. The short listing criteria are: 1. The firm should have experiences of completing detailed design of at least two suspension type bridges having span length of100m asdesign consultant (costing not less than one crores in same or different contracts) in assignments related to civilengineering projects such as design and supervision of bridges. The firm should also have experience of at least 2 projects inrehabilitation or restoration (costing not less than one crore in one contract). 2. The firm should have prior working experience of design work for the bridges in similar geographical conditions (i.e. inmountainous regions); 3. The firm should demonstrate that they have enough capacity (including personnel) in handling civil engineering projects suchas roadsand bridges; ? 4. The firms should be in existence for at least 10 years and havean average annual turnover of at least INR 5.0 crores in thelast 3 years; and 5. Experience in handling externally aided projects such as the World Bank and ADB will be an advantage. Expressions of interest (EOI) must include: ? Introductory letter on letter head (with complete contact details ? name of contact person mailing address telephone faxemail etc. ) explaining how the firm is best to deliver the task ? Organization profile ? Two years annual report (Yr 2011 and Yr 2012) and 3 years financial statement(Yr 2010 to 2012) ? Short note on the similar projects implemented by the firm pertaining to the short listing criteria ? The EOI should contain sufficient supporting document to substantiate the claim of the Consultant towards their qualificationas per the short listing criteria . The Terms of Reference and detailed short listing criteria will beavailable on the website http://pwd.uk.gov.in The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loans and IDACredits & Grants] by World Bank Borrowers January 2011 ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forththe World Banks policy on conflict of interest. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the Quality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) method set out in the ConsultantGuidelines. Further information can be obtained at the address below during office hours from 1000 hrs to 1700 hrs. Expressions of interest must be delivered in a written form to theaddress below (in person or by post) by 24 January 2014up to 17:00 Hrs. PIU-UDRP Roads and Bridges Third Floor Commercial Tax Building Culvert No. 6 Mussorrie Bypass Road Jogiwala Nathanpur Dehradun Pin 248001 Attn: Dilip Jawalkar/Progrmme Manager PIU-UDRP Roads and Bridges Third Floor Commercial Tax Building Culvert No. 6 Mussorrie Bypass Road Jogiwala Nathanpur Dehradun Pin 248001 Tel:+91135-2669815 (O) Fax: +91135-2669815 E-mail: pwd.wb.uk@gmail.com

column4: Invitation For Attending Meeting On Issues Pertaining To Availability Of Repair And Maintenance Facility In India For 765kv Transformers And Reactors
column10: Power Grid Corporation of India Ltd.
column12: Power Grid Corporation of India Ltd. Plot No. 2 Sector 29
column18: Invitation forattending meeting on issues pertaining to availability of repair and maintenance facility in India for 765kV Transformers and Reactors Date:16/05/2011 POWERGRID is in the process of procurement of 765kVTransformers and Reactors underWorld Bank Funding. 765kV Transformers and Reactors being critical components of the system andconsidering reliability of the transmissionsystem it is felt necessary that manufacturers of 765kV Transformersand Reactors shouldhave repair and maintenance facility in India so that these equipment could be repaired in India itself to avoid delay due tooverseas transportation. To discuss above issue and other procurement aspectsPOWERGRID is holding a meetingwith the suppliers of 765kV Transformers and Reactors as below: Date 23rd May2011 Time 11.00hrs Venue Power Grid Corporation of India Ltd. Fifth Floor Conference Room "Saudamini" Plot No. 2 Sector-29 Gurgaon-122001 Haryana India. Telephone: +91(0124)-2571700-19 Extn. 3311/2320/2350/3318; Fax No.: 0124-2571831. Interested manufacturers of 765kV Transformers andReactors make it convenient to attend the same. Please confirm participation through email to sudhir@powergridindia.com. Query if any can also be emailed to aforesaid emailaddress. POWERGRID : INTEGRATING THE NATIONTHROUGH WIRE AND PEOPLE

(ii) 400kV Bays - 400kV bays for 7 numbers of 500 MVA (765/ #3) / (400 / #3) / 33 kV single phase auto transformers to be used as two numberbank of 1500 MVA 765/ 400/33 kV three phase auto transformers with one number unit as spare. - 400kV line bays for termination of 1XD/C (Quad)Raichur - Raichur (Existing) transmission line. - 400kV line bays for termination of 1XD/C (Quad)Raichur -Gooty transmissionline. The above scope of work is indicative and the detailedscope of work is given in Part-2: Employers Requirement of the Bidding Documents which are available for inspection and sale asstated herein. column18: INVITATION FORBIDS (IFB) INDIA Reactor Package for the supply erection testing & commissioning of 7 x 80MVAR 765/?3 single phase shunt reactors at Seoni Substation associated with SystemStrengthening in Western Region for Mundra UMPP (INTERNATIONAL COMPETITIVEBIDDING) DATE OF ISSUANCEOF IFB : 21.02.2012 SPECIFICATIONNO. : CC-CS/125-WR1/RT-1564/1/G6 LOAN NO. : 7787-IN (PSDP-V Loan of the World Bank) 1.0 This invitation for bids follows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared in dgMarket on 5 th April 2009. 2.0 Power Grid Corporation of India Ltd. (POWERGRID) had invited sealed bids from eligible bidders for Auto Transformer Package-A and Reactor Package-B associated withMundra Regional System for WR under International Competitive Bidding as per Invitation for Bids dated 26.03.2010. Pursuant tochanges in the requirement the AutoTransformer Package-A has been deleted and 10x80MVAR 765/?3 kV Single Phase Shunt Reactors atWardha S/S have been deleted from the scope under Reactor Package-B as detailed in the Bidding Documents. Accordingly thisrevised (fresh) invitation for bids for "Reactor Package for 7X80 MVAR 765/?3 kV Single Phase Shunt Reactors at SeoniSubstation associated with Mundra Regional System for WR" is hereby issued. PowerGrid Corporation of India Ltd. POWERGRID has received a loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and itintends to use part of the proceeds of the loan for eligible payments under the Contract for subject Reactor Package associated with System Strengthening in Western Region for MundraUMPP. 3.0 POWERGRID now invites sealed bids from eligible bidders for the following package under revised (fresh) Invitation forBids: Reactor Package for Supply erection testing & commissioning of7X80 MVAR 765/?3 kV Single Phase Shunt Reactorsat Seoni Substation. (Specification No. CC-CS/125-WR1/RT-1564/1/G6) 3.1 The scope of work covered under the subject Reactor Package is givenbelow: Supply erection testing & commissioning of single phase Shunt reactors alongwith all fittings accessories including Marshalling box for each reactors common marshalling box for a bank of 3(three) 1-phaseunit cables terminal connectors road cum rail track associated civil foundation works fire protection walls foundation boltsetc. and mandatory spares as per Technical specification for Seven (7) numbers of 80 MVAR 1-ph 765/?3 kV Line reactor along with NGR (rated impedance 942 Ohm) and 120 KV surge arresters neutral CT to make as two(2) banks of three number of 1- ph 765/?3 kV shuntreactor along withNGR (rated impedance 942Ohm) and 120 KV surgearresters neutral CT with one unit as spare for abovementioned bank at 765/400 kV Seoni Sub station. 765 kV and neutral auxiliary buses for connection of spare unit for reactors being suppliedunder this package is shown in drg no. C/ENGG/SR765/WR/Seoni/01 Rev.0 attached with Technical Specification. Formation ofauxiliary buses and connection arrangement for use of spare unit of reactor in place of faulty unit without physically shifting itfrom its location is in the scope of this package. The above scope of work is indicative and the detailedscope of work is given in Part-2: Employers Requirement of the Bidding Documents which are available for inspection and sale asstated herein. The completion period for Reactor Package is Eighteen(18) months from effective date of Contract. 4.0 Bidding will be conducted through the international competitive bidding procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits and is open to all biddersfrom eligible source countries as defined in the Guidelines. 5.0 The detailed Qualifying Requirements (QR) are given in the bidding document of the subject package. The completebidding documents including tender drawings are available at our website http://www.powergridindia.com. (POWERGRID) has received a loan from theInternational Bank for Reconstruction and Development and it intendsto use part of the proceeds of the loan for eligible paymentsunder the Contract for Tower Packages P224-TW01& P224-TW02associated with Eastern Region Strengthening Scheme-V. 3.0 POWERGRID now invites sealed bids from eligible bidders for the following packagesunder Transmission System associated withEasternRegion Strengthening Scheme-V: 1. Tower Package-P224-TW01 for (i) 400 kV D/C (Triple Snow Bird) Rajarhat -Purnea Transmission Line (Part-1) (approx. 200 kms); and (ii) LILO of 400kV S/C (Twin Moose) Subhasgram-Jeerat Transmission Line atRajarhat (approx. 4 kms). 2. Tower Package-P224-TW02 for (i) 400 kV D/C (Triple Snow Bird) Rajarhat -Purnea Transmission Line (Part-2) (approx. 235 kms); (ii) LILO of one circuit of 400kV D/C (Triple Snow Bird) Rajarhat-PurneaTransmission Line at Farakka (approx. 3 kms); and (iii) LILO of one circuit of 400KV D/C(Triple Snow Bird) Rajarhat-PurneaTransmission Line at Gokarna (approx. 15 kms). 3.1 The scope of work covered under the Tower Packages P224-TW01 & P224-TW02 associated with Eastern Region StrengtheningScheme-V is given below: (i)detailed survey including route alignmentprofiling tower spotting optimisation of tower locations soil resistivity measurement& geotechnical investigation (including special foundation locations viz pile foundation locations); column12: Uttar Pradesh Water Sector Restructuring Project Phase IIWALMI Campus Telibagh
column18: GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE INDIA-UTTAR PRADESH WATER SECTOR RESTRUCTURING PROJECT PHASEII C redit No: Applied For Project ID No.P122770 The Government of India has applied for financing in the amount of US$ 360 Million equivalent from the World Bank toward the cost of the Uttar Pradesh Water Sector Restructuring ProjectPhase II and it intends to apply part of the proceeds to payments for goods works related services and consulting services to beprocured under this project. The project will include the following components; modernization andrehabilitation of selected irrigation and drainage infrastructure covering about two million ha strengthening irrigationdepartment and apex water institutions agricultural productivity enhancement through participation of stakeholders. The Project involves the design and construction of various civil works and consultancyservices associated with these other consultancies for monitoring and evaluation third party supervision basin assessment andplanningreal time data acquisition systems and technical assistance goods and equipments related to irrigation servicesimprovement to be procuredunder ICB procedures. Procurement of contracts financed by the World Bank will be conductedthrough the procedures as specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement of Goods Works and Non-consultingServices under IBRDLoans and IDA Credits and Grants by World BankBorrowers (January 2011) and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in the guidelines . Consulting services will be selected in accordance with the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits and Grants by World BankBorrowers (January 2011). Specific procurement notices for contracts to be bid under the WorldBanks internationalcompetitive bidding (ICB) procedures and for contracts for consultancy services will be announced as theybecome available in UN Development Business and in leading National English/HindiNewspapers and U P Irrigation Department Website : www.irrigation.up.nic.in Interested eligiblebidders who wish to be included in the mailinglist to receive invitation to bid under ICB procedures or those requiring additional information should contact the addressbelow: Mr Desh Raj Procurement ExpertPACT Uttar Pradesh WaterSector Restructuring Project PhaseII WALMI Campus Telibagh Lucknow 226 025 INDIA Phone : +91 522 2441625 Email: prexpactiduplu-up@nic.in Website : www.irrigation.up.nic.in

column4: Wbr 7-consultancy For Monitoring Management Information System And Evaluation Of Upwsrp Ii
column10: Project Activity Core Team [PACT] UP Irrigation Department
column12: UPWSRP IDUPWALMI Bhawan Utrethia Telibagh
column18: INDIA ? Proposed Uttar Pradesh Water Sector Restructuring Project PhaseII Request for Expressions of Interest[EOI] Consultancy Services for Monitoring ManagementInformation System and Evaluation of UPWSRP PhaseII Project Identification Number : P122770 1. The Government of India(GOI)/Government of Uttar Pradesh (GoUP) intends to apply for a credit/loan from the InternationalDevelopment Association(IDA)/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) to finance the UP Water Sector Restructuring Project (UPWSRP)Phase 2 and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this credit/loan to payments under the contract for hiring services ofconsultancy firm for "Monitoring Management Information System and Evaluation of UPWRSP Phase 2". 2. The scope of services would include: (i) development of a comprehensive Monitoring and Evaluation framework(ii) development of a user-friendly interactive web-based Project Management and Monitoring Information System (iii) Input/output/ intermediate outcome monitoring making use of state-of-the-art tools and periodic reporting (iv) Process monitoring andregular feedback on lessons learned during implementation (v) Impact assessment (vi) Learnings dissemination and (vii) Trainingand capacity building of the Project Activities Core Team (PACT) and Project Implementing Departments (Irrigation DepartmentAgriculture Department Groundwater Department) etc. The Consultant is expected to use the latest monitoring technologies inparticular Mobile-based field data recording equipment web-based approaches and GIS systems. The duration ofthe assignment shall be for 7 years. 3. The Chairman (PACT) UPWSRP Lucknowinvites eligible Consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Consultancy Services for the aboveassignment. 4. Interested consultants must provide the following information indicating that they are qualified toperform the Services: Brochures Description of Similar Assignments undertaken in the past Availability of Skills among Staff(including but not limited to Monitoring and Evaluation and web-based Management software) and Financial statement for the last 3years. 5. The consultant may associate with other firms to enhance their qualification. The "Association" maytake the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of a sub-consultancy and this should be stated clearly inthe submission. 6. The criteria for short listing of the Consulting firms shall be asfollows:  The firms should have been in business for atleast ten (10) years in Monitoring and Evaluation with at least three (3) International assignments on Monitoring and Evaluation ofcomparable projects (in terms of for example size activities geographic scale) including at least one(1) Water Sector-relatedproject.  Should have at least three (3) experiencesduring the last ten (10) years in setting up Project Management Information Systems.  Should have expertise in developing web-based management informationsystems in usingstate-of-the-art Mobile-based field data recording technology and inGIS use.  Shall be financially sound with an averageannual turnover of more than INR 40000000 (US$ 745000) during the last five (5) years (2007-08 to 2011-12);and  Availability ofskills mentioned above among core staff of the firm. 7. A consultant will be selected in accordance with Quality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) procedures set out in the World Banks "Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants Under IBRD Loans andIDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers- January 2011". The Guidelines are available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 8. Interested Consultants may obtain further information at the address given below from 10.00 ? 17.00hours (IST) on all working days. This notice for Expression of Interest has also been posted on UPID website http://irrigation.up.nic.in/project.htm. 9. Expressions of Interest with all relevant information and documents must be submitted and subscribed"Expression of Interest for Monitoring ManagementInformation System and Evaluation of UPWRSP Phase 2" on top of a closed envelope and be delivered to the address below by notlater than 15:00 hours (IST) on January 252013. In the event this last date being declared asholiday by the State Government due date for submission of above EOI will be the next working day up till the same appointed time. Procurement Expert [PACT] UPWSRP IDUP WALMI BhawanUtrethia Telibagh Lucknow 226025 UttarPradesh India Phone : +91 522 2441631 (322) Email: prexpactiduplu-up@nic.in Website: http://irrigation.up.nic.in/project.htm

column18: Expression of Interest (EOI) for consultancy services of "Construction supervision consultant" For Gujarat State Highway Project- II. 1. The Government of India on behalf of Government of Gujarat (hereinafter called"Borrower") has applied for financing from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) (hereinafter called"WB") in the form of a ("loan") (hereinafter called "loan")toward the cost of Gujarat State Highway Project - II.
