column18: India GUJARAT STATE HIGHWAY PROJECT-II(GSHP-II) Assignment Title: Consultancy Services for"Project Managementconsultant"of GSHP II Roads in Gujarat Reference No. (as per Procurement Plan):___________________ The Governmentof India on behalf of Government of Gujarat (hereinafter called "Borrower") hasappliedfor financing from the World Bank toward the cost of Gujarat State Highway Project - II. The Borrower intends to apply part of the proceeds for consultingservices. The consulting services of ("the Services") include: The Project Management Consultant will be broadly be responsible for ????????..[AKK1] Gujarat State Highway Project ? II involves mainly three components namely civil works institutional-Governancestrengthening and road safety. Civil works This component aims at improving @ 1016 km of state roads through different modes ofexecution. PPP mode: It involves four lane widening of 2 corridors of aggregate length of @ 195 km roads on BOT(toll) and BOT (annuity) basis each. DPR for annuity corridor is ready while feasibility study for toll corridor done earlier isbeing updated. Both civil work procurement would be on ICB basis and would involve services of IE. Traditional Item rate: The rest improvements i.e. in respect of @ 821 km are on item rate basis and would involve services of at least supervision consultants. The Government of Gujarat has prepared / got prepared DPRs and bid documents for @ 430 km ofroads (Phase I). Thebids for construction for improvement of these roads are being shortly invited. The construction of targetimprovement involve improving existing State Highways including geometric improvementsand realignments Widening to 2l2L+HS2l+PS+HS4L and strengthening and rehabilitation. The construction works are to besupervised by the supervision consultant and offer for which is being invited. This consultancy would be for about 72 months. DPR preparation for @ 425 km of roads is yet to be taken up. Consultancy service would be hiredfor the same. There are associated requirements in respect of civil works such as pre and post construction users perception /satisfaction surveys human resource assistance to employer for environment socialand financial monitoring of project. Institutional ? Governance strengthening: Four major and a couple of minor consultancies are envisaged under this component. TOR formajor consultancies has been prepared and is in different stages of approvals. These consultancies would run for almost entireperiod in series with some overlaps. Road safety: Road safety management capacity review of the state wascarried out by the WB. A batch of actions has been identified. These actions involve policy reforms and demonstrating how conjoinedactions of road transport Police Health and Education / Media /Awareness can bring out effective road safety. Conjoined actionswill be deployed on a demonstration corridor which is identified in form of 2 sections aggregating length of 30 km of Dahej ? Valiaroad. Base line surveys on these corridors are in progress and would be completed in couple of months. Policy reform whichinteralia also involves training and good purchase will deploy a couple of consultancies. Detailed EOI and the Terms of reference (TOR) and the short listingcriteria are available 0n www.rnbgujarat.org The Superintending Engineer On behalf Governor Of GujaratProject Implementation Unit Gujarat State Highway Project -II now invites eligible consulting firms ("consultants") to indicate their interest in providing theservices. Interested Consultants should provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevantexperience to perform the services. The attention of interested Consultants is drawnto paragraph 1.9 of the above said World Banks Guidelines selection and employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits &Grants] by World Bank Borrowersof world bank (January 2011) setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict ofinterest. Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a joint venture(JV) or sub consultancyto enhance their qualifications. Kindly indicate the type of association clearly in the EOI submission.However JV shall have not more thanthree members including lead member. No Consultant can submit EOI for this assignment simultaneously as sole Consultant and as a member of any jointventure. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the QCBS selection methodset out in consultant guidelines. Further information can be obtained at the address below during officehours on working days between11:00 to17:00 hours. Office of the Superintending Engineer Project Implementation Unit Ground Floor Nirman Bhavan Sector10/A Gandhinagar. 382010 Gujarat Tel.: + 91 079 23252986 Fax: + 91 07923251915 e-mail: se-piu-rnb@gujarat.gov.in Expressions of interest must be delivered in a written form to the address below on or before date21/03/2013 up to 12:00 hours (on working days). Office of the Superintending Engineer Project Implementation Unit Ground Floor Nirman Bhavan Sector10/A Gandhinagar. 382010 Gujarat Tel.: + 91 079 23252986 Fax: + 91 07923251915 e-mail: se-piu-rnb@gujarat.gov.in Short Listing Criteria a. 1.Annual Turn over 1. Annual turnover of any one of the last five financial years i.e. from 2007 -2008 to2011-2012 updated to the current financial year shall be more than Rs 100crores. In case of JV the lead member shall have morethan Rs 80crores of annual turnover (updated) of any one of the last five financial years. This threshold for each other membershall be Rs 40crores. 2. For arriving at updated value turnover of any financial year shall be multiplied by theenhancement factor corresponding to that year. b. Experience Consultant must have as prime consultant successful experience as follows: 1. At least one Similar Project involving civil construction of not less than 400 km of road work. ForJV qualifying length for lead member would be 320 km and for other partner / s it would be 160 km. 2. Such Project must have been completed within last ten Calendar years including2012. 3. A Project would qualify assimilar Project if it meets with following: a. Project Management / Project coordination of highway project(CSCIEQA-TA will not be counted) b. Project must involve civil execution on FIDICconditions c. Project must involve not less than 3 other consultancies at leastone should be involving subject of institutional and/or policy reform / strengthening. [AKK1]Kindly include the broad scope of this consultant.

column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES? SELECTION OF CONSULTING FIRM) INDIA UTTARAKHAND DISASTER RECOVERY PROJECT (UDRP) Credit No.5313 -IN Assignment Title: Design and Construction Supervision Consultancy(RoadWorks) Reference No. UDRP/PWD/C/DSC/02 UDRP/PWD/C/DSC/03 UDRP/PWD/C/DSC/04UDRP/PWD/C/DSC/05 The Government of India has received financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Uttarakhand Disaster RecoveryProject (UDRP) and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consulting services. The consulting services ("the Services") shallbroadly include providing design and construction supervision consultancy service and preparation of Detailed Project Reports(DPRs) related to World Bank projects initially for one year period and will be extendable based on the performance. The design andsupervision services are to be provided forthe other district roads(ODRs)/ Village Roads(VRs) and Bridle roads of Uttarakhandcategorized under different packages as below.The description of job is to prepare the DPRs of the proposed damagerestorationworks supervision of works as per specifications overall project management at the site co-ordination among clientcontractor and otherstakeholders involved in the project and to ensure quality of works as per specifications. The firm will becollecting all the technical social and environmental and other related information required with the help of other project teammembers and or consultant in the respective field. The packages for which design and supervisionconsultancy services to be provided are as follows: S.No. Package Name Districts covered Length of Roads Damaged (KM) 1 UDRP/PWD/C/DSC/02 Haridwar and Dehradun 423.51 2 UDRP/PWD/C/DSC/03 Tehri and Pauri 581.00 3 UDRP/PWD/C/DSC/04 Champawat and Pithoragarh 238.70 4 UDRP/PWD/C/DSC/05 Almora Bageshwar NainitalUdhamsinghnagar 484.64 The PIU- (Roads and Bridges ) UDRPnow invites eligible consultingfirms("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultants should provideinformationdemonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevantexperience to perform the Services. The shortlisting criteria are 1. The firm should have at least 2 similar experiences as design and supervisionconsultant (costing not less than 5 crores in same or different contracts) in assignments related to civil engineering projectssuch as roads and bridges. Experience in rehabilitation or restoration projects will have advantage over general experiences. 2. The firm shouldhave prior working experience in similar geographicalconditions; 3. The firm shoulddemonstrate that they have enough capacity (including personnel)in handling civil engineering projects such as roads and bridges; 4. The firms should have an average annual turnover of at least INR 7 croresin thelast 3 years; and 5. Experience in handling externally aided projects such as the World Bank and ADBwill be an advantage. A firm can apply for anyor all packages separately. Expressionsof interest (EOI) mustinclude:  Introductory letter on letter head (withcomplete contact details ? name of contact person mailing address telephone fax email etc. ) explaining how the firm is best todeliver the task  Organization profile  Two years annual report (Yr 2011 and Yr 2012) and 3 yearsFinancialstatement  Short note on the similar projects implemented by the firm pertaining to theshortlisting criteria  The EOI should contain sufficient supporting documentto substantiate the claim of the Consultant towards their qualification as per the shortlisting criteria. TheTerms of Reference and detailed shortlisting criteria will be available on the website http://pwd .uk.gov.in. column18: Government of Rajasthan Rajasthan Agricultural Competitiveness Project (RACP) Second Floor Academic Block SIAM Campus Durgapura Tonk RoadJaipur-302018 (Rajasthan) Phone: 0141-2554215 Fax : 0141-2554214 Email : pd_racp@rediffmail.com CORRIGENDUM TO REQUEST FOREXPRESSIONOF INTEREST (EOI) No. ( F()/RACP/MPA/2012-13 The Notice for Expression of Interests(EOI) for selection of consultant to provide individual experts for support serviceswas published in this newspaper. The due date for submission of EOIs is hereby extended up to1500 Hours on January 15th 2013. Allother terms and conditions shall be the same. Project Director Rajasthan Agricultural Competitiveness Project-Jaipur ============================================================ Rajasthan Agricultural Competitiveness ProjectManagement & Implementation Society [RACP MIS] Rajasthan Agricultural Competitiveness Project[RACP] No.F()/RACP/MPA/2012-13/ Date: Credit No.5085-IN Expressionof Interest for Selection of Consultant to provide Individual Experts for Support Services The Rajasthan Agricultural Competitiveness Project Management& Implementation Society has received credit from the World Bank towards the cost of theRajasthan Agricultural CompetitivenessProject and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consultancy services. The Project aims toestablish the feasibility of sustainably increasing agricultural productivity and farmerincomes through a distinct agricultural development approach by integrating agriculture water management and agriculturaltechnology farmer organizations and market innovations in selected locations across the about ten agro-ecologicial zones ofRajasthan. The Society will require individual expertsfor support services through this consultancy to cover Project management Unit [PMU] at Jaipur Project Implementation Units [PIU]at the line departments at Jaipur and in District Project Management Units [DPMU] in about ten districts. The Society will contract the Consultant firm to provide the individualexperts. The firm will be responsible forsatisfactoryperformance of the individual experts and will provide suitable replacement if required. The requirements of the individuals Experts will be need based as determined by theSociety from time to time. The State Project Management Unit [PMU] invites Expression ofInterest from the eligible consulting firms [Consultants] to provide individual expert Support Servicesregarding: (1) Environment SocialDevelopment MIS Monitoring and Evaluation Chartered Accountant Agribusiness and Marketing at PMU; (2) Agriculture HorticultureLivestock Watershed Ground Water and Surface Water at PIU; and (3) Agriculture HorticultureLivestock Watershed Ground Water Surface Water Environment Social Development and Agribusiness and Marketing at DPMUlevel. The assignment would be initially for three year which may beextending for further project period. The agencies must provide information proving that they arequalified and competent to perform the services. Theproposals should also contain information along with details in the format as provided in the website as mentioned below the broadshort listing criteria are also provided in the website. The Agencies will be selected in accordance with the proceduresset out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection andEmployment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers [January 2011]. The attention of the Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the Guidelines setting forth the World Bankspolicy on conflict of interest. Consultants mayassociate with other firms in the form of a JointVenture or a Sub-consultancy to enhance their qualification. The interested Consultants may obtain further information fromour website http://www.krishi.rajasthan.gov.in/Departments/Agriculture/Details of RACP.htm or at theaddress mentioned below between 9:30 AM to 6:00 PM on any working day. Expression of Interest must be delivered to the address mentioned below by December 26 2012 by 6:00PM Project Director RACP Jaipur Address: Project Director Project Management Unit [PMU] Rajasthan Agricultural Competitiveness Project[RACP] 2 nd Floor Academic Building SIAM CampusDurgapura Tonk Road Jaipur Tel. No.: 0141-2554215 Fax No. 0141-2554215 E-mail: pd_racp@rediffmail.com

column18: INDIA-ANDHRA PRADESHWATER SECTOR IMPROVEMENT PROJECT [APWSIP] Loan No :7897?IN REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONOF INTEREST FOR CONSULTANCY SERVICES FOR PROJECT MANAGEMENT OF INTEGRATED COMPUTERISED INFORMATION SYSTEMS (ICIS)OFAPWSIP NOTIFICATION NO : PD/PPMU/APWSIP/2012-13/1 1. This Request for Expression of Interest follows the general procurement notice for thisproject that appeared in Development Business issue no. 719 of January 31 2008. 2. The Government of India has received a loan from the International Bank for Reconstructionand Development and intends to apply part of theproceeds of this loan to payments under the contract for Consultancy Services forconjunctive use of surface and ground water pilot under Andhra Pradesh Water Sector Improvement Project (APWSIP). 3. Main objective of developing IT solution is to provide the right information to rightstakeholders at right time to enable informed decision making for operations of NSP system and improvement of irrigated agricultureproductivity. Project Management of the ICIS implementation comprising of development of a) an Asset ManagementSystem to support O&M b) development of a Real-time Operational Decision Support System (Focusingon NSS operations in aKrishna Basin Context) c) development of a Water User Information Support System for WUAs and d) Information Management Systemfor Irrigation and CAD Department (I&CADD) & APWRRC. The consultant shall be technical advisor for the ICIS to I&CADD and work in collaborative mode with the PPMU to successfullyimplement ICIS in I&CADD. The Consultants services comprises of identifying Business Process improvements conceptualization of the ITStrategy and includes identifying Business Process Improvement Requirement Developing a High-level "IT Solution" develop animplementation Road Map and estimating sizing of each component including Hardware Software Networking Training Data Entry andmaintenance for all listed activities. The consultant would also responsible to providetechnical support for Bid preparation and Vendor selection for implementation of developed solution supervision and monitoring ofimplementation and system audit. 4. The Project Director Project Preparation and Management Unit (PPMU) for APWSIP now inviteeligible consultants (only firms) to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested consultants must provideinformation indicating that they are qualified to perform the Services (brochures description of similar assignments experiencein similar conditions availability of appropriate skills among staff etc.). Consultants may associate to enhance theirqualifications. The association may take the form of a joint venture (with joint andseveral liability) or of a sub-consultancy. Also the Consultant selected for this assignmentwill not be eligibleto bid for any of the downstream components or any other procurement under ICIS. 5. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World BanksGuidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by Bank Borrowers May 2004 revised in October 2006. 6. Interested consultants may obtain further information at the address given below from 10.30to 17.00 hours. 7. Expression of interest must be delivered to the address below by 3.30pm no later than June22 2012. column4: Consultancy Services For Project Management Consultant
column10: PUBLIC WORKS DEPARTMENT GOVT. OF ASSAM
column12: Chandmari
column18: India: Assam State RoadsProject (ASRP) (P096018) Consultancy services for Project Management Consultant Expression of Interest No. CE/ASRP/46/2011/ 4 Dated: September 19 2011 1. This request for expressions of interest followsthe General Procurement Notice that appeared in UN Development Business/ dgMarket online on November 4 2010 for this project. 2. The Governmentof Assam has applied for a US $ 200 million loan from the International Bank forReconstruction and Development (IBRD) for the Assam State Roads Project. The projectwould include improvement for about 500 km of secondary roads pilots on new technologies institutionalstrengthening measures to improve the road sector and management. GOA intends to apply a portion of the loan for the project management services (PMC) to assist ineffectivelyimplementing various activities under the project with a special focus to introduce best practice industry examples in theroadsector in Assam. 3. The PMC consultant is to provide high qualitytechnical advice and implementation support (through a small team of experts) to PWRD in (i) project preparation and implementationof road improvement works (ii) introduction of best practice examples for sectorpolicies strategic planning and project and asset management and building capacities and skills in the public and private sectorto use those (iii) operationalization of an asset management system and innovative methods of maintenance contracts (iv) implementation of a road safety strategyand (v) overall project performance audits. 4. The ChiefEngineer (ARIASP & RIDF) Public Works Roads Department Assam now invites highly qualified consultants with proven record ofrelevant experience to indicate their interest in providing the above services. Interested consultants must provide detailedinformation about their past experiences and qualifications to establish their suitability for the proposed assignment (brochuresdescription of similar assignments undertaken in the past availability of appropriate skills among staff and other relevantinformation). Consultants may associate toenhance their qualifications. The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability or of asub-consultancy]. 5. A consultant will be selected in accordance withthe procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by Bank Borrowers January 2011 available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 6. Interested Consultants may obtainfurther information at the address given below from 10.00 # 17.00 hours on all working days. Expression of Interest must bedelivered to the following address not later than October 10 2011. Sd/- (K. C. Hazarika) Chief Engineer PWD (ARIASP & RIDF) Assam Chandmari Guwahati-3 Telephone No.: +91.361.2665745 FaxNo.:+91.361.2661879 E-mail: cea.apwd@nic.in

column4: Wbr 15-project Management Consultant [pmc] For Rajasthan
column12: Jacob Road
column18: EXPRESSIONS OFINTEREST PMGSY Rural Roads Project Project ID: P124639 Credits 4848-INand 4849-IN/Loan and Loan 7995-IN Consultancy Services for Project Management of Rural Roads Construction Works in Rajasthan This request for expression of interestfollows the General ProcurementNotice for this project that appeared in Development Business on September 132010. The Government of India Ministry of RuralDevelopment has received a Credit/Loan of US $1500 Million from the International Development Association/International Bank forReconstruction and Development for above project supporting rural roads development under the Prime Minister Rural Roads Program(PMGSY). The project will support rural roads construction/improvement of about 24000 Km rural roads in states includingJharkhand Himachal Pradesh Meghalaya Punjab Rajasthan Uttar Pradesh and Uttarkhand. The project will also include a technicalassistance program to build capacity of the implementing agencies improve their business procedures and improve overallmaintenance management. The National Rural Roads Development Agency (NRRDA) under the Ministryof Rural Development GoI is theagency responsible for overall management and supervision. The programme is being implemented through therespective StateGovernments. The Government of Rajasthan through theChief Engineer (PMGSY) PWD Rajasthan intends to apply part of the proceeds ofthis credit to payments under the contract for Project Management Consultant. The PMC consultant is to provide highquality technical advice and implementation support (through a small team of experts) to the implementing agencies to effectivelyimplement the Project. This will include assistance in (i) preparing sound quality and cost-effective engineeringdesigns includingtheir related safeguard documents (ii) effective implementation of PMGSY business procedures for management of social andenvironmental issues procurement quality assurance contract management monitoring and evaluation (iii) improving overallmaintenance management including innovative maintenance contracting methods and (iv) implementation of technical assistanceprogram including capacity building of implementing agencies. The Chief Engineer (PMGSY) PWD Rajasthannow invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested consultants mush provideinformation indicating that they are qualifiedto perform the Services (brochures description of similar assignments experience insimilar conditions availability of appropriate skills among staff etc.) Consultants may associate to enhance theirqualifications. [The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of asub-consultancy.] Aconsultant will be selected in accordancewith the procedures set outin the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers May2004 revised October 2006 revised May2010. Interested Consultants may obtain furtherinformation at the address given below from 1000 hours to 1600 hours on all working days. Expressions of interest must be delivered tothe address below by not later than November 16 2012 up to 13.00 Hours. If the office happens to be closed on the date of receiptof Expressions of Interest as specified the Expressions of Interest shall be received on the next working day at the same time andvenue. Mr. S. S.Singhvi Chief Engineer(PMGSY) Public Works DepartmentRajasthan Jacob Road Jaipur 302006 Rajasthan INDIA Phone & Fax +91 1415110543 Email: pmgsyrajasthan@rediffmail.com

column4: Consultancy Services For Modern And Innovative Bridge [design] For Assam Public Works Roads Department [pwrd]
column12: ChandmariGovernment of Assam
column18: INDIA-Assam State Roads Project [ASRP] Project Identification Number : [P096018] Consultancy Services for Modern andInnovative Bridge [Design] for Assam Public Works Roads Department [PWRD] Request for Expression of Interest Ref No. : CE/ASRP/9/2011/3 1. This request for expressions of interest follows theGeneral Procurement Notice that appeared in UN Development Business/dgMarket on-line on November 4 2010 for this project. 2. The Government of Assam has applied for a US $ 200million financial assistance from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development [IBRD] for the Assam State RoadsProject and intends to apply a portion of this loan to the payments under the contract for technical assistance to introducemodern innovative cost-effective easy to construct and environment friendly bridge designs which can be easily implemented bythe local construction industry. The designs are to be used to replace a large number ofexisting timer bridges [more than 3000] and constructing new bridges under various road development programs. 3. The Bridge Design Cell of the Public Works RoadsDepartment [PWRD] has already developed some standard bridge designs using pre-cast technology which have also been used on pilotscale. However these designs need further refinements to facilitate their casting andtransportation at site and improve their cost-effectiveness. The PWRD now proposes tosubstantially modify its bridge design and construction practices based on the modern bridge design and construction experiencesavailable in advanced countries specifically to reducetime and cost of construction and to facilitate ease of constructionandmaintenance suiting to the local construction industry. The services will includesignificant capacity building of the Bridge Design Cell and local construction industry including technical assistance for a pilotproject involving construction of some improved bridges demonstrating the efficacy of the improved designs. 4. The Chief Engineer [ARIASP & RIDF] PWRD Assam nowinvites eligible consultants with proven experience in bridge designs and construction involving use of new technologies. Interested consultants must provide information that they are qualified to perform the servicesand their past experience and available expertise [brochures description of similar assignments undertaken in the past experiencein similar conditions availability of appropriateskills among staff description of CAD software used and other relevantinformation demonstrating their suitability for the proposed assignment]. Consultants mayassociate with other consultants to enhance their qualifications. [The "Association" maytake the form of a joint venture [with joint and several liability] or of a sub-consultancy]. 5. A consultant will be selected in accordance with theprocedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines : Selection and Employment ofConsultants under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers January 2011 available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 6. Interested Consultants may obtain further information atthe address given below from 1000 to 1700 hours on all working days. 7. Expression of Interest must be delivered by 1500 hours tothe following address not later than June 14 2011. K.C. Hazarika Chief Engineer PWD [ARIASP & RIDF] Assam Chandmari Guwahati 3 Telephone No.: +91 361 2665745 Fax No.: +91 361 2661879 E-mail: cea.apwd@nic.in

column18: Request for Expressions of Interest [EOI] Consultancy Services for Engagement of Non Governmental Organization [NGO] for Capacity Building Promoting EffectiveFunctioning and Fostering of Water User Associations for Neera Left Bank Canal Neera RightBank Canal and New Mutha Right BankCanal INDIA-Maharashtra Water Sector Improvement Project [MWSIP] Loan Number : 4796IN Project Number :P084790 1. This request for expressions of interest follows the General Procurement Notice forthis project that appeared in Development Business issue No. 712 of 16 October 2007. 2. The Government of Maharashtra has received a loan from the International Bank forReconstruction and Development [IBRD] and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan to payments under the contract forConsultancy Services for Engagement of Non Governmental Organization [NGO] for Capacity Building Promoting Effective Functioningand Fostering of Water User Associations for Neera Left Bank Canal Neera Right Bank Canal and New Mutha Right BankCanal. 3. The services include capacity building and promoting effective functioning andfostering of WUAs to enable them to discharge their roles and responsibilities and developing its effective partnership with WaterResources Department [WRD]. As per the policy of Government of Maharashtra the entire work under MWSIP for the purpose ofconsultancy has been divided in six regions viz. (1) Konkan (2) Nashik (3) Amrawati (4) Nagpur (5) Pune and (6) Jalgaon. For eachregion one NGO was appointed and NGOs were allowed to work in more than one region. The consultancy services for engagement of NGOunder this consultancy are specifically for capacity building promoting effective functioning and fostering of Water UserAssociations for Neera Left Bank Canal Neera Right Bank Canal and New Mutha Right Bank Canal. These services are not covered inthe scope of previously appointed NGOs under MWSIP. 4. The Superintending Engineer Pune Irrigation Circle Pune now invites eligibleconsultants to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultants[NGOs] must provide information indicating that they are qualified to perform the Services (brochures description of similarassignments experience in similar conditions and availability of appropriate skills among staff etc.) Consultants may associatetoenhance their qualifications. [The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (withjoint and several liability) or of a sub consultancy.] The interested consulting firms are requested to furnish following information inEnglish [in four copies] : Nameaddress facsimile number email address of the firm core business area and number of years in the business with enclosure of lastthree years. Annualreport of the company/firm. Ownership and organizational structure of the firm. Clientreferences for consultancy assignment for engagement of NGO. Detailsof assignment of similar size successfully completed in the last five years. Also original time and cost of the contract andactualtime taken and final cost of the contract in each shall be given. Experience of having worked on projects funded by international multinational/ bilateral sources. Anyother details to establish technical capabilities of the firm. NGOs will be short-listedbased on their qualification and experiencein carrying out successfully similar assignments. 5. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the Fixed Budget Selection [FBS]procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines : Selection and Employment of Consultantsby World Bank Borrowers May2004 [Revised October 2006]. 6. Interested consultants may obtain further information at the addressbelow duringoffice hrs [10.00 to 17.00]. 7. Expressions of interestmust be delivered to the address below by June 28 2012 up to 17.00 hrs. : Superintending Engineer Pune Irrigation Circle Pune Maharashtra INDIA Phone : 91 20 26126941 Fax: : 91 20 26126289 Email : Sepicidpune@vsnl.net

column2: IN: Punjab State Road Sector Project
column4: General Procurement Notice
column12: SCO 61-62 Sector 54 Phase-IIMohali
column18: INDIA PunjabState Road Sector Project GENERALPROCUREMENT NOTICE The Government of Punjab (GOP) has applied for a loan from theInternational Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) in the amount of US$ 250 million equivalenttoward the cost of the Punjab State Road Sector Project and itintends to apply the proceeds of this loan to payments for goodsworks related services and consulting services to be procured under thisproject. The project will include thefollowing: Road Upgrading Rehabilitation and periodicmaintenance The project shall fund a combination of road upgrading/widening rehabilitation and periodic maintenance.Broadly these elements are : Up-grading of roads (US$ 180million) Rehabilitation/strengthening of roads (US$80 million) and Periodic maintenance of about 400 km (US$20 million) The project shall be implemented in two phases. Under Phase I works comprise of about 118 km of up-gradation 239 km ofrehabilitation and 400 km of periodic maintenance. Works procured under this project would comprise of approximately eighteen(18) packages (valued at US $ 155 millionapproximately). The procurement for allworks will be done using the Banks Standard Bidding Documents (SBD) or those agreed with(or satisfactory to) the Bank. Specific procurement notices are likely to be issued from third week of May 2006onwards. Phase II comprises Rehabilitationand upgradation works of approximately 500 km of roads which shall be selected on the basis of ongoing feasibility studies. GOP intendsto use Performance based contracts for some of the works in this phase.The consulting services for this phase shall consist ofpreparation of detailed project reports and construction supervision services during implementation phase. Other components under the project shall include the following although these may be revisedbased on the findings of the Institutional Development Studies which are currently underway. E-governance and e-procurement(US$2 million). This is likely to include setting up of WANproviding necessary hardware and software and subsequent implementation. Design and operationalisation of Geographical informationsystem and traffic data collection systems.

column18: Invitation for Bids (IFB) Computerization of PWD B&RPunjab Number:PSRSP/WB/ICT/1/ICB 07.02.2014 Computerization of Public Works Department(B&R) Punjab 1. This Invitation for Bids (IFB) follows theGeneral Procurement Notice (GPN) for this project that appeared in UNDBonline on 27/07/2013. 2. The Punjab Roads &BridgesDevelopment Board has received a loan from the World Bank toward the costof Punjab State Road Sector Project and it intends to apply part of the proceeds ofthisloan to payments under the Procurement of Contract for Computerization of PWD (B&R)Punjab. 3. The Punjab Roads and BridgesDevelopment Board serves as the implementing agency for the project and now invites sealed bids from eligibleBidders for design and development of package-based integrated IT Solution procurement of hardware and software testing ensuringsecurity deployment and commissioning training to end-users post implementation Warranty and Operation & Maintenance for aperiod of three years for Computerization of Public Works Department (Building & Roads)Punjab. 4. Bidding will be conducted using the International Competitive Bidding(ICB)procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits and is open to all Bidderseligible as defined in these Guidelines that meet the following minimum qualificationcriteria. 5. Interested eligible Bidders may obtain further information from Punjab Roads andBridges Development Board from 09:00 to17:00 hours. A pre-bid meeting of the potential bidderswill be held on 4 th March 2014. 6. A complete set of bidding documents in English may be obtained from the Office ofPRBDB from 0900 to 1700 hours during working hours from 7 th February 2014 to 3 rd April 2014 on a payment of INR 15000 ( US $ 300 ) and also can bedownloaded from the website of PRBDB i.e. www.prbdb.gov.in.Thetender fee of the bid document downloaded from the website of PRBDB is to be paid to PRBDB at the time of submission of the bid.The hardcopy of the bidding documents obtained from the office of PRBDB and anyaddenda to it will be the binding one. 7. Bids must be delivered to the address below at orbefore 12:00 Noon on 4 th April 2014. Bids need to be secured by a Bid Security. The amount of Bid Security requiredis INR 2 Million ( US $ 40 000). Late bids will be rejected. Bids will be opened in the presence of Bidders representatives who choose to attend at the address below at 12:30 PM on 4 th April 2014. 8. column18: INDIA Punjab State Road SectorProject REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST CONSULTANCY SERVICES FORMONITORING/SUPERVISION OF OUTPUT AND PERFORMANCE BASED ROAD CONTRACT (OPRC) FOR SANGRUR ? MANSA ? BATHINDA AREA INPUNJAB(INDIA). Loan No. : 4843?IN Project ID : P090585 This request for expression of interest follows the GeneralProcurement Notice for Punjab State Road Sector Project (PSRSP) that appeared in Development Business of October 5 2009. The Government of Punjab through Government of India hasreceived a loan from the World Bank toward the cost of PSRSP and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan to finance theconsultancy assignments for MONITORING/SUPERVISION OF ASSET MANAGEMENT PROJECT TO BE IMPLEMENTED UNDER THE OUTPUT AND PERFORMANCEBASED ROAD CONTRACT (OPRC) FOR SANGRUR-MANSA-BATHINDA AREA IN PUNJAB (INDIA). The Punjab Roads & Bridges Development Board (PRBDB) theimplementing agency of PSRSP now invites Expression of Interest from eligibleConsultants with proven track record of satisfiedbeneficiaries on similar asset management assignments under OPRC methodology to indicate their interest in providing the aforesaidservices as Monitoring/ Supervision Consultant for implementation of Sangrur-Mansa-Bathinda Contract Area. The Civil WorksContract of a network of 203 Km State Roadsis likely to be procured by last Quarter of 2012. This contract forMonitoring/Supervision shall initially be of 3 years duration which maybe extended further for 2 years and shall include theconstruction ofimprovement works (Up-gradation/Widening Rehabilitation and Resurfacing); the maintenance works for upkeep of Roadsin the Network and theassociated Network Management. The Monitoring/Supervision Consultant shall be responsiblefor the administration of the Contract and for the verification of works and services to be performed by the Contractor for thisOPRC Contract. Some of the responsibilities involve: (i) the review and recommendations related to the detailed designs and otherproject documents prepared by the Contractor; and (ii) checking and recommending payment certificatesduring the construction/rehabilitation/ up-gradation and maintenancephases based on verification of the works done and measured by various testingequipment such as profile-meters and FWD. For successful execution of OPRC Contract it is requiredthat the Consultant fully understands the concept of OPRC designed as Design Build Maintain Operate and Transfer (DBMOT) type ofContracts and the requirements of the services to be provided as Monitoring/ Supervision Consultant. The particular knowledge andexperience to be documented relates to the knowledge of operating and managing the road works based on output methodology verifiedby various Level of Service indicators of qualitative and quantitative nature risk management network management and othersimilar requirements. Interested Consultants must provide information indicatingthat they are qualified to perform these services (brochures description of similar assignments experience in similar conditionsavailability of appropriate skills among staff etc.) along with information in the prescribed format as per Information Sheet.Consultants may associate to enhance their qualifications for this assignment. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with theSelection procedures based on Quality and Cost Based Selection Method (QCBS) as set out in the World Banks Guidelines; Selectionand Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers May 2004 (Revised October 2006). Interested Consultants may obtain further information at theaddress below from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM on any working day till July 9 2012. The blank format of the information sheet can be downloaded at http://prbdb.gov.in or requested from the PRBDB office at the address given below as per the followingschedule: i Bypost/courier : up to 1500 hours on July 2 2012 ii By e-mail : up to 1700 hours on July 6 2012 iii Byhand : up to 1700 hours on July 9 2012 Expressions of interest and further information as requestedin the prescribed Information Sheet must be delivered to the address below by 1500 hours on July 10 2012. AlternativelyConsultants can submit their complete Expression of Interest electronically to eoi.oprcmc@prbdb.gov.in by due date. (Yogesh Gupta) Project Director (PSRSP) Punjab Roads and Bridges Development Board SCF 61-62 Phase 2 Sector 54 Mohali Chandigarh India ?160 055 Tel. : + 91 172 6626620 Fax : + 91 172 6626640 Web site: http://prbdb.gov.in Email: office@prbdb.gov.in

column4: Consultancy Services To Prepare Feasibility Reports To Supply Surface Water In The Six Districts Of The State
column10: Punjab Rural Water Supply & Sanitation Project

column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST INDIA Punjab Rural Water Supply & Sanitation Project ConsultancyServices to prepare feasibility reports to supply surface water in the six districts of the State Credit No.4251-IN Project ID No. P 090592 1. This Request for Expressions of Interest follows the General Procurement Notice for thisproject that appeared in Development Business on August 13 2006. 2. The Government of Punjab (GoP) has received a credit from the International DevelopmentAssociation and intends to applypart of the proceeds of this credit to payments under the above contract for consultant services. 3. The services under this consultancy contract include fool-proof method to reduce dependenceon ground water for human consumption by making available surface water as independent source or in-conjunction with the groundwater to bring the chemical contaminantswithin the permissible limits for drinking purposes for distribution in the villagesthrough existing water supply systems by suitably modifying them. The focus of the study is on feasibility to transfer treatedsurface water to villages through a network of supply mains in bulkquantities enabling conjunctive use of ground and surface waterin the six affected districts of Punjab State namely Ludhiana Jalandhar Hoshiarpur Sangrur Barnala and Moga. Consultant wouldassess drinkingwater demand and identify water sources in the six districts where quality of Ground water is affected withcontaminants. 4. The State Programme Management Cell Mohali now invites eligible consultants to indicatetheir interest in providing theServices. Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified toperform the Services (brochures description of similar assignments experience in similar conditions availability ofappropriate skills among staff etc.). Consultants may associate to enhance their qualifications. [The Association maytake the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of a sub-consultancy] 5. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World BanksGuidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by Bank Borrowers "May 2004 revised Oct 2006 revised May 2010". 6. Interested Consultants may obtain further information at the address given below from 9.00AM to 5.00 PM on working days. 7. Expression of interest must be delivered to theaddress below by no later than 31.5.2013. column18: India Assam State Roads Project (ASRP) (P096018) Consultancy Services for Institutional Development and Strengthening of Assam State RoadsBoard (ASRB) Request for Expression of Interest No.CE/ASRP/10/2011/4 Dated: September 19 2011 1. This request for expressions of interest follows the General ProcurementNotice that appeared in UN Development Business/ dgMarket online on November 4 2010 for this project. 2. The Government of Assam has applied fora US $ 200 million loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) for the Assam State Roads Project and intends to apply a portion of this loan tothe payments under the contract for institutional development and strengthening of the Assam State Roads Board (ASRB) which wasestablished in 2003 as an independent Society registered under the Societies Act 1880. 3. The Government of Assam intends to elaborate the functions to be carriedout by the Board and design and define its rules and regulationsto improve transparency efficiency road user participation andoverall management of the sector. The intent is to elevate the status of the Board to a high level body consisting of majorstakeholders including road users to take major policy decisions on the sector including (i) investment decisions between variouscategories of roads and between fresh construction and maintenance (b) effective and regular monitoring and evaluation of variousroad development programs (c) long and medium term sector policies and plans (d) mobilization of necessaryfunds for the sectorespecially for road maintenance (e) coordination of various programs funded by various sources and inter-agency issues and (f)operationalization of asset management system and the road fund. This would also include suitable restructuring of the Boardand significant strengthening of the current planningfunctions of the Public Works Department Assam; the agency responsible for the management of the road network in the state. 4.The Chief Engineer(ARIASP & RIDF) Public Works Roads Department Assam now invites eligible consultants with provenexperience on the functioning of Road Boards to indicate their interest in providing the above services. Interested consultantsmust provide detailed information about their past experiences and qualifications indicating that they are qualified to perform the services (brochures description ofsimilar assignments undertaken in the past availability of appropriate skills among staff andother relevant information).Consultants may associate with other consultants to enhance their qualifications. [The "Association" may take the form of a jointventure (with joint and several liability) or of asub-consultancy]. 5 . A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in theWorld Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by Bank Borrowers January 2011 available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 6 . column4: Consultancy Services Of ?project Management Consultant? (pmc)
column12: Jacob Road
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OFINTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMSSELECTION) THE STATE OF RAJASTHAN - INDIA RAJASTHAN ROAD SECTOR MODERNIZATION PROJECT (RRSMP) Credit No.: PPA No. IDA Q8470 AssignmentTitle: Consultancy Services of "Project Management Consultant" (PMC) Reference No.: CF/RRSMP/02 This request for expressions of interest follows the general procurement notice forthis project that appeared in Development Business December 2012. The Government of Rajasthan has applied for a Credit from International Development Association (IDA) toward the cost of the RajasthanRoad Sector Modernization Project and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of this Credit to payments under the contracts for provision of services of ProjectManagement Consultancy to assist the implementation of the project. The consulting services ("the services") include assisting the Public Works Department (PWD) of Rajasthan toefficiently manage the project such that each and every envisaged activity of the project is completed within the planned timelinecost prescribed standards of quality and in full compliance of the WB guidelines and applicable Employers acts rules andregulations. The PMC will be responsible in advising assisting and acting on behalf of the PWD when so authorized for theeffective management of the Project. The scope of the PMCservices shall also include but not limited to:  Assist PWD and PIUs in the overall aspects of project management.  Review of Engineering design prepared by Consultants review of technical andprogress reports from Supervision Consultants Technical Auditors.  Assist PWD & PIUs in the procurement of works goods andservices;  Assist and closely advise PIUs in the management of rural road contracts closelymonitor performance of supervision consultant and civil works contracts of the state highways/MDR. Identify gaps and advise PWD& PIU on globally-tested appropriate improvement measures.  Oversee the various consulting services financed under the project including but notlimited to: Road Financing Study the development of Asset Management System Business Processes Re-Engineering and Capacitybuilding and Training Programs etc.  Coordinate the collection of data carry out the necessary analysis monitor andupdate on the progress ofoutput and outcome indicators laid in the projects M&E framework; . The assignment would last for about 64 months. The Government of Rajasthan through the Chief Engineer (PMGSY) PWD Rajasthan nowinvites eligible consulting firms ("consultants") ")to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultants should provide information demonstrating that theyhave the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services. The shortlisting criteriaare: a) General experience in Project Management consultancyservices b) Experience in the design/supervision of infrastructure project in thelast five years c) Experience in highway/rural roads/bridge projects in the last fiveyears d) Experience in South Asia region (Indias experience is an addedadvantage) Consultants should provide information such as their roles in executing the aboveservices whether a sole provider or a partner in a joint venture; inthe latter case indicate percentage by value of its share ofservicesprovided; provide details of scope of work of each assignment to demonstrate suitability for present assignment. Statementof related assignments completed five years (in joint venture for each firm) supported with completion certificate of theEmployer of the services in theformat that can be downloaded from http://pwd.rajasthan.gov.in/eoipmc.pdf. Theattention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loansand IDA Credits & Grants] by World Bank Borrowers January 2011 ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict ofinterest. Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a joint venture or asub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the Quality and Cost BaseSelection(QCBS) method set out in the Consultant Guidelines. Further information can be obtained at the address below during office hours i.e. 0900 to 1700hours. Expressions ofinterest must be delivered in a written form to the address below (inpersonor by mail or by fax or by e-mail) by 23 th September 2013. ChiefEngineer (PMGSY) PWDRajasthan Jacob Road Jaipur ? 302006 Ph. +91 ? 141 ? 5110543 Fax: +91 ? 141 ? 5110517 e-mail ? rrsmpwb@rediffmail.com ChiefEngineer (PMGSY)

PWD Zone-Udaipur Total 41936.71 1227.24 43163.95 Bid documents can bedownloaded from Web site http://pmgsytendersraj.gov.in. Bidders submitt their bids in electronic format on Web site http://pmgsytendersraj.gov.in Note : There is noprovision of negotiation for these works Class of contractors for Bid: Any Amount : AA ClassContractor Up to Rs. 300Lac : AA and A Class Contractor Up to Rs. 150Lac : AA A and B Class Contractor Up to Rs. 50 Lac : AA A B and C ClassContractor Up to Rs. 15 Lac : AA A B C and D ClassContractor 1. Earnestmoney (For part A and B) 2% of estimated cost of work asshown in NIT. 2. Perod of completion of work will be 12 months (TwelveMonths) Downloading period for biddocuments will be fromMonday 18 Feb. 2013 9:30 AM to Wednesday 20 March 2013 10:00 AM 3. a) Bidding documents must be uploaded in electronic format on web site http://pmgsytendersraj.gov.in up to Wednesday 20 March 2013 10:00 AM. All the received bidswill be opened in electronic format on web site http://pmgsytendersraj.gov.in on Friday22 March 2013 11:00 AM in the concerning office written in front of name of work in NIT. If the office happens to be closed on thedate of receipt of the bids as specified thebids will be received on the next working day at the same time and venue. In cas
 allthe bids could not opened on the scheduled time the work of opening of bids will be continued on the next workingday. b) Bidding procedure will be online. c) Reply and required clarifications to all the questions received on web site up till Monday 04 March 20139:30 AM will be uploaded. d) The pre-bid meeting will be held on dated Monday 04 March 2013 at 11.00 AM in the concerning Additional Chief Engineeroffice. If the office happens to be closed on the dateof pre-bidmeeting as specified the bids will be opened on the next working dayat the same time andvenue 4. The site for the work is available. 5. Bid Documents can be seen by bidders in the office of the concerning office as mentioned in above table on any working day between Monday18 Feb. 2013 9:30 AM to Tuesday 19 March 2013 upto 4:00 PM. Bid documentsconsisting of qualification information and eligibility criterion ofbidders plans specifications drawings the schedule ofquantities of the various classes of work to be done and the set of terms & conditions of contract to be complied with by theContractor. 6. Tender Fee/ EMD must be deposited in the form of Demand Draft or any other form as mentiond in bid document bythe bidder (1) In the Office Where tender is to be opened from Wednesday 20 March 2013 10:00 AM to Friday 22 March 2013 11:00 AM or (2) in One higher or one lower office to the office where tender isto be opened from Wednesday 20 March 2013 10:00 AM to Thursday 21 March 2013 11:00AM 7. The earnest money will have to be in any one of the forms as specified in the biddingdocuments. 8. The bid for the work shall remain open for acceptance for a period of 90 days from the date of opening ofbids. If any bidder/ tenderer withdraws his bid/ tender before the said period ormakes any modifications in the terms and conditions of the bid the said earnest money shall standforfeited 9. A bidder shall not be permitted to bid for works in the Circle responsible for award and execution ofcontracts in which his or his spouses near relative (defined as first blood relations and their spouses) is posted as DivisionalAccountant or as an officer in any capacity between the grades of Superintending Engineer and Assistant Engineer(bothinclusive). 10. No Engineer ofgazetted rank or other Gazetted officer employed in Engineering or Administrative duties in an Engineering Department of the StateGovernment is allowed to work as a Contractor for a period of two years after his retirement from Government service withoutGovernment permission. This contract is liable to be cancelled if either theContractor or any of his employees is found any time to be such a person who had not obtained the permission of the Government asaforesaid before submission of the tender or engagement in the Contractors service. 11. Non-registeredbidders can also participate in the bidding. However the successful bidder must apply for registration in appropriate class withappropriate authorities with a view to obtaining the registration before signing the contract. 12. Bidder have tosubmitt his priorty for successfull bids in case he particiaptes in more than one bid/ tender. 13. Directions to thebidder for e-tendering:- a) Bid documents can be downloaded from web site http://pmgsytendersraj.gov.in by the bidder who wants to particiapte inbidding. b) Bidders have to register him self on web site http://pmgsytendersraj.gov.in to participate in bidding. Digital Signature Certificate(DSC) as per IT Act-2000 has to be obtain which will used to sign the bid electronically. Bidders can obtain the DSC from approvedagencies by CCA. Bidders who have valid DSC already does not need to obtain new DSC. c) Digitally signed Bid documents in Electronic format has to submittby the bidder. The proposals which arenot Digitally signed will not be accepted. No any proposal will be accepted physically. d) Online bids will beopened as per sheduled date and time as mentioned inS. No. 3 (a) above. e) It should be confirmed by the bidder before submitting the electronic bid online that scane copy ofdocuments required as per bid document have been attached. f) If any tender could not sumitted electronically due to any reason the department will notresponsible for it. g) Submitt all the required tables of bid document after fillingcompletely. (A. K. Sanghi) Chief Engineer (SS) PWD Rajasthan Jaipur

column4: Selection Of Consultancy Services For The Implementation Of Cluster Agricultural Competitiveness Plan [cacp] - Mokhampura Watershed Cluster In Jaipur District
column12: Project Management Unit Rajasthan Agricultural Competitiveness Project (RACP) 2nd Floor Academic Building SIAMCampus Durgapura Tonk R
column18: Government of Rajasthan Rajasthan Agricultural Competitiveness Project(RACP) Second Floor Academic Block SIAM CampusDurgapura Tonk RoadJaipur-302018 (Rajasthan) Phone: 0141-2554215 Fax : 0141-2554214 Email : pd_racp@rediffmail.com CORRIGENDUM TO REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST (EOI) No. F ()PROC/EOI/03/2012dated 12.12.12 TheNotice for Expression of Interests (EOI) for selection of consultancy services for the implementation of Cluster Agricultural Competitiveness Plan (CACP) of Mokhampura Cluster was published in thisnewspaper. The due date and time for submission of EOIsis herebyextended up to 1500 Hours on January 31st  2013. All other terms and conditions shallbe the same Project Director ============================================== Rajasthan Agricultural Competitiveness Project Management &Implementation Society (RACP MIS) RajasthanAgriculturalCompetitiveness Project (RACP) No.F3() Proc/EoI/03/2012 Date: 12.12.2012 Credit No.5085IN Expression ofInterest for selection of Consultancy Services for theimplementation of Cluster Agricultural Competitiveness Plan (CACP) The Rajasthan Agricultural Competitiveness Project Management& Implementation Society (RACP-MIS) has received credit from the World Bank towards the cost of the Rajasthan AgriculturalCompetitiveness Project and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consultancy services. The Project aims to establish thefeasibility of sustainably increasing agricultural productivity and farmer incomes through a distinct agricultural developmentapproach by integrating agriculture water management and agricultural technology farmer organizations and market innovations inselected locations across the about ten agro-ecological zones of Rajasthan. The CACPs shall beimplemented through community based organizations in Mokhampura cluster district Jaipur. TheRACP-MIS requires Consultancy Services for implementation of ClusterAgriculture Competitiveness Plan (CACP) of Mokhampuracluster district Jaipur for the services cited above. The Project Management Unit (PMU) invites Expression of Interestfrom the eligible Consultancy firms to provide the services mentioned above. Name ofCluster along with predominant water source. EligibilityRequirements Mokhampura Watershed Cluster in Jaipur district. 1) Successfully implemented integrated Watershed management projects including market access program; 2) Experience in designing of Watershed management related hydraulic structures. 3) Experience in watershed hydrology. 4) Experience in community mobilization group formation capacity building and groupfederation; 5) Experience in crop-water budgeting; 6) Experience in linking producers/federations to the markets; Consultancy firms may associate with other firms in the form ofa joint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualification. The contracts will be signed with the Consultancyfirms/JVs/Consortiums for the Package/Cluster. The Consultancyfirms must provide information proving that theyare qualified and competent to perform the services. column18: Rajasthan Agricultural Competitiveness Project Management & Implementation Society (RACP MIS) Rajasthan Agricultural Competitiveness Project (RACP) No .F3 (32 )Proc / EoI /02/2013-14 Date: CreditNo.5085 IN Expression of Interest forselection of Consultancy Services for the preparation andimplementation of Cluster Agricultural Competitiveness Plan (CACP) The Rajasthan Agricultural Competitiveness Project Management &Implementation Society (RACP-MIS) has received credit from World Bank towards the cost of the Rajasthan AgriculturalCompetitiveness Project and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consultancy services. The Project aims to establish the feasibility of sustainably increasingagricultural productivity and farmerincomes through a distinct agricultural development approach by integrating agriculture watermanagement and agricultural technology farmer organizations and market innovations in selected locations across tenagro-ecological zones of Rajasthan. Project activities will be undertaken in some twenty selected areas calledclusters across the ten agro-ecological zones of Rajasthan. For each of these clusters the project will prepare a detailed ClusterAgriculture Competitive Plan (CACP) centered around the key components of the project (i.e. water & agriculture markets &value chains farmer organizations). The CACP will have a defined objective and proposedinterventions and their monitoring. CACPs are to be prepared through a participative process involving a broad range ofstakeholders including private sector. The CACP planning process will result in a detailed project report including implementationplan for the selected cluster. The RACP-MIS requires Consultancy Services forpreparation and implementationof Cluster Agricultural Competitiveness Plan (CACP) for the services briefly cited above. The Project Management Unit (PMU) invites Expression of Interest from theeligible Consultancy firms to provide the services mentioned above. Name of Cluster (District) along with predominant watersource Eligibility Requirements 1) Phoolasar Distributary District Bikaner 2) Kheruwala Distributary District Bikaner/Jaisalmer 3) Orai and Bassi Irrigation Project DistrictChittorgarh 4) Jakham Project District Pratapgarh 1. Successfully planned design andexecuted Surface Water Irrigation (Canal) Projects including irrigationmanagement; 2. Experience in crop-water budgeting andwater-auditing; 3. Experience in agriculture livestockhorticulture related activities and market access program; 4. Experience in community mobilizationworking with water user organization capacity building and group formation; 5. Experience in linkingproducers/federations to the markets. Consultancy firm may associate with other firms in the form of a jointventure or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualification and competency. Separate contracts will be signed with the Consultancyfirms for each ofthe cluster. Consultancy firms may apply for one or more clusters separately provided they meet the eligibilityrequirement cited above andhave adequate manpower for each of the cluster applied for. The consultancy firms must provide information proving that they arequalified and competent to perform the services. The proposals should also contain information along with details in the format asprovided in the web-site as mentioned below. The Consultancy firm will be selected in accordance with the procedures setout in the World Banks guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (January 2011).The attention ofthe consulting firm is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the Guidelines setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict of interest. The interested Consultancy firms may obtain detailed information from ourweb-site http://www.krishi.rajasthan.gov.in/Departments/Agriculture/Details_of_RACP.htmor at the address mentioned below between 9.30 AM to 6.00 PM on any working day. Expression of Interest must bedelivered to the address mentioned below by February3rd 2014 by 3.00PM. column4: General Procurement Notice
column12: 6Nirman Bhavan opposite Jaipur club Jacob Road
column18: INDIA : RAJASTHAN ROAD SECTOR MODERNIZATION PROJECT GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE Loan/Credit No. Not YetAllotted The Govt. of India has applied for a loan/credit from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development(IBRD)/International Development Association (IDA) in the amount of US$ 325million equivalent towardthe cost of the RAJASTHAN ROADSECTOR MODERNIZATION PROJECT and it intends to apply the proceeds of this loan/credit to payments for goods works relatedservices and consulting services to be procured underthis project. The project will include the following components: Rural Network Quality and Connectivity Improvement (a) Construction of about 3200 km rural roads through strengthening of existingMNREGA roads to provide all weather road connectivity to smallerrural habitations (b) Rehabilitation/improvement of about 1000 km of priority section of SHs/MDRs within existing right ofway. (c) Construction of Model State of the Art State Highways (about 100km) (d) Standaloneroad safety engineering and management measures. Road Sector Modernization and Performance Enhancement (a) Improved Policy Frame work (b) Modernization of Engineering Practice and Business Procedures (c) Sustainable Assets Management (d) Institutional and Human Resource Development (e) Governance & Accountability Action Plan 3 RoadSafety Management Procurement of contracts financed by the [loan/credit] will be conducted through the procedures specified in the WorldBanks Guidelines: Procurement of Goods Works and Non-Consulting Services under IBRD Loansand IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers January 2011 and is open to all bidders from eligible source countriesas defined in the guidelines. Consulting services will be selected in accordance with the World Banks Guidelines: Selection andEmployment of Consultants under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers January2011.Some bids for new road construction works under National Competitive Bidding are going to be invitedshortly. Specific procurement notices for contracts to be bid under the World Banks international competitive bidding (ICB)procedures and for large-valueconsultants contracts will be announced as they become available in UN Development Business http://eprocure.gov.in/cppp/ www.pwd.rajasthan.gov.in www.pmgsytenders.nic.in and national and local newspapers as perguidelines. A. K. Sanghi Chief Engineer(SS) 6Nirman Bhavan opposite Jaipur club Jacob Road Jaipur (Rajasthan) Tel: 0141-5110520 Fax: 0141-5110542 E-mail: pmgsyrajasthan@rediffmail.com

column18: INDIA Second National TuberculosisProject - Additional Financing (P118832) Sector: Health Nutrition andPopulation (HNP) GENERAL PROCUREMENTNOTICE The Ministry of Health & Family Welfare (MoHFW) Govt. of India has applied for financing in the amount of US$ 100 Million equivalent from the World Bank toward the proposed additional financing ofthe Second National Tuberculosis Project and it intends to apply part of the proceeds to payments for goods works relatedservicesand consulting services to be procured under this proposed project. This project will be seperately financed by the GlobalFund to fight AIDS Tuberculosis and Malaria (under single steam funding) to the amount of US $ 107.739 million till March2013. The project will include the following components (i) Pharmaceuticalsfor treatment ofTuberculosis i.e Rifampicin Isoniazid Ethambutol Pyrazinamide and Pyridoxine in prescribed Blister calendar combipack and inloose numbers Rifabutin and Injection Streptomycin and Levofloxacin Ethionamide Cycloserine Ethionamide NaPAS & InjectionKanamycin I.P or equivalent and Moxifloaxacin Clofazimine Linezoid Clarithromycin Amoxicillin Potassium Clavulanate &Injection Capreomycin (ii) Laboratory and other equipments and (iii) some consultancyservices etc. Procurement of contracts financed by the World Bank and GFATM will beconducted through theprocedures as specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans andIDA Credits (current edition) and is open to all eligible bidders asdefined in the guidelines. Consulting services will be selected in accordance with the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (current edition). Specific procurement notices for contracts to be bid under the World Banks internationalcompetitive bidding (ICB) procedures will be announced as they become available in UN Development Business and in local newspapers apart from the project website ( www.tbcindia.org) . Interested eligible bidders who wish to be included on the mailing list to receive invitations to bid under ICB proceduresand interested consultants who wish to receive a copy of advertisement requesting expressions of interest for consultancycontracts or those requiring additional information should contact the address below. column2: IN: Integrated Coastal Zone Mgmt Project
column4: Consultancy Services For Conservation Of Vembanad Lake System & Its Environment
column12: No. 9 First FloorInstitutional Area Lodhi Road
column18: Society of Integrated Coastal Management(SICOM) Ministry of Environment andForests Government of India Request for Expression ofInterest Consultancy Services for Conservation of Vembanad lake system & itsenvironment. 1. The Government of India has received a credit (4765-0 IN) from theInternational Development Association towards the cost of Integrated Coastal Zone Management (Integrated Coastal Zone Management)Project and intends to apply a part of the funds to cover eligible payments under the contracts for which this Request forExpression of Interest is issued. 2. The objective of this REOI is that under the CRT-2011 notificationof Ministry of Environment & Forestsamongst critically vulnerable Coastal areas Vembanad Lake has also been included for a plan of action as the lake has beenaffected by unrestrictive anthropogenic activities and under severe stress from a series of human interventions. 3. Society of Integrated Coastal Management (SICOM) of Ministry of Environment & Forests (MoEF) invitesExpression of Interest from consultants for compilations of all information including from stake holders to finalize a plan foreffective Conservation of Vembanad Lake & its environment. 4. Interested Consultants who shall respond to this REOI may please provide the following: a) Name address e-mail telephone ownership and organizational structure of the consultingindividual/firm/agency/organization. b) Expertise available for the proposed services description of similar assignments experience in similarconditions availability of appropriate skills among staff their qualification andnumber. c) Audited and/or certified financial statement for the last three years. Consultants may associate to enhance their qualifications. 5. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out inthe World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers May 2004 and Revised October 2006andMay 2010. 6. Interested consultants may obtain further information at the address belowfrom 10:00 Hrs to 16:00 hrs on working days. 5. Interested consultants may submit their expression of interest by July 29 2011 upto 5 pm. at the following address : National Project Director SICOM No. 9 First Floor Institutional Area Lodhi Road New Delhi- 110003 Ph.No. 011-47397777 Email-proc.sicom@gmail.com

NATIONAL COMPETITIVEBIDDING IFB No.: Proc/SICOM/SOI/2011/01 Date: 19/10 /2011 . 1. The Government of India has received a credit from theInternationalDevelopment Association (IDA) towards the cost of ICZM Project and intends to apply a part of the funds to covereligible payments under the contracts for Provision of Ground Controls and Digital Photogrammetric Work of approximately 7km. wide coastal belt of Indian mainland including major deltaic areas and back waters using digital stereo aerial photographs of 9cm GSD for delineation of hazard line as detailed below in the TABLE 1 of IFB. Bidding is open to all bidders from eligible sourcecountries as defined in the IBRD Guidelines for Procurement. Bidders are advised to note the minimum qualification criteriaspecified in Clause 4 of the Instructions to Bidders to qualify for the award of the contract. They are also advised to getconversant with the Mapping Policy of Government of India. The guidelines regarding National Map Policy is available in SOIwebsite www.surveyofindia.gov.in 2. The National ICZMProject Director SICOM Ministry of Environment and Forests New Delhi invites bids for the work divided into 8 (eight) Zonesas detailed in the TABLE 1 of IFB. The bidders may submit bids for any or all of the worksdetailed in Table 1 of IFB. The bidder may offer cross discounts while quoting fortwo or more Zones in which case award of workwould be decided in a manner which is financially beneficial to the The National ICZM Project Director. 3. Bidding documents (and additional copies) may be purchased from the office of National ICZM Project DirectorSICOM Ministry of Environment & Forest No. 9 First Floor Institutional Area Lodhi Road New Delhi -110003 f rom28/10/2011 to 07/12/2011 for a non-refundable fee (three sets) of Rs. 2000 (RupeesTwo Thousand) in the form of Demand Draft on any Nationalized/Scheduledbank payable at New Delhi in favour of Accounts Officer SICOM. Interested bidders may obtain further information atthe same address. The bidding document can also be downloaded from MoEF website www.moef.nic.in  in which case while submitting the bid a demand draft for Rs.2000(Rupees Two Thousand Only) towards the cost of bid document shall be enclosed alongwith the bid. The Bidder who downloads the bid documents should regularly access the same website for clarifications amendmentsand pre-bid meeting minutes. Bidding documents requested by mail will be despatched by registered/speed post on payment of an extraamount of Rs.500. The National ICZM Project Director will not be held responsible for the postal delay if any in thedelivery of the documents or non-receipt of the same. 4. Bids must be accompanied by Bid security of the amount specified forthe work in the TABLE 1 of IFB below drawn infavour of Accounts Officer SICOM. Bidsecurity will have to be in any one of the forms as specified inthe bidding document and shall have to be valid for 45 days beyondthe validity of the bid. 5. Bids must be delivered to National ICZM Project DirectorSICOM Ministry of Environment & Forest No. 9 First Floor Institutional Area Lodhi Road New Delhi -110003 on orbefore 10:30 HOURS on 08/12 /2011 and will be opened on the same day at 1100 HOURS at the Conference HallSICOM Ministry of Environment & Forest No. 9First Floor Institutional Area Lodhi Road New Delhi -110003 in thepresence of the bidders who wish to attend. If the office happens to be closed on the dateof receipt of the bids as specified the bids will be received and opened on the next working day at the same time andvenue. 6. A prebid meeting will be held on 11/11 /2011 at 1000 hrs at the Conference Hall SICOM Ministry ofEnvironment & Forest No. 9 First Floor Institutional Area Lodhi Road New Delhi -110003 to clarify the issues and toanswer questions on any matter that maybe raised at that stage as stated in Clause 9.2 of Instructions to Bidders of the biddingdocument. 7.
