column18: REQUESTFOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMSSELECTION) Country:India Name ofProject: Financing Energy Efficiency at MSMEs ProjectID: P100530 GrantNo.: TF 010422 Assignment Title: Agency for carrying out Capacity Building of MSME units on Environmental & Social(E&S)Issues. ReferenceNo. CS-7 The MSME EEProject is part of the GEFProgrammatic Framework project for Energy Efficiency in India. The Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) has received financing from the Global Environment Facility(GEF)towards the cost of increasing the demand for energy efficiencyinvestments in five micro small and medium enterprise clusters andto build their capacity to access commercial finance. One of the objectives of the project is to identify vendors whose productsmeet the current technology requirements of the MSMEs in five target clusters associated with the forging foundry limekilnschemical and mixed industry sectors centred around the Indian cities of Pune Kolhapur Tirunelveli Ankleshwar and Faridabadrespectively. The primary goal wouldbe to develop an outreach mechanism for these vendors in order to facilitate the earlyinduction of appropriate technologies in the MSMEs of these identified clusters. The projectis being co-implemented by SIDBIand the Bureau of Energy EfficiencyGovt. of India Ministry of Power. SIDBI intends to apply a part of the proceeds for consultingservices as outlined below. This Request for Expressions of Interest(REOI) is to short list Consulting Firmsfor carrying out capacity building of MSME units on Environmental & Social (E & S)issues. These MSMEs pertain to the five target clustersof forging foundry limekiln chemical and mixed industries (comprising light engineering/sheet metal fabrication die castingforging foundry heat treatment / electroplating textiles etc.) located in and around the Indian cities of Kolhapur PuneTirunelveli Ankleshwar and Faridabad respectively. The Consulting Firms would berequired to create awareness among the MSMEs aboutthe current acts rules & regulations as laid down by the Government of India (GOI) in its environment policy as well socialsafeguard policies of the GOI as applicable to industries. The Consulting firms would be required to liaise closely with otherfirms that have been awarded contracts bySIDBI for carrying out various activities under the Project. While executing the projectthe Consulting firm will also work in coordinationwith SIDBI. The above activities would be implemented in a phased manner between December 2012(tentatively) and November 2014 The Small Industries Development Bank of Indianow invites eligible Consulting Firms ("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultantsshould provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform theServices. The EOIs should be duly supported by (a) submission of brochures (b) experienceacrossvarious industry segments in Energy Environment & Social Sectors (c) experience in the MSME/SMEsegments in Energy Environment & Social Sectors (d) experience in awareness outreach & capacity building of industries on Environmental & Social issues(e) core business of the firm indicating the business model (Commercial Not-For-Profit NGO etc.)(f) educational and professional qualifications of key personnel (g) experience of key personnel(i) in Energy/Environment / Social sectors across various industry segments and (ii) in Energy / Environment / Social sectors across MSME/SME segments(h) technical and managerial organization of the firm (including the number location and size of establishmentsin India) (i) turnover of the firm for the last 3 years (or of each of the Joint Venture partners if the EOI issubmitted as a Joint Venture) etc. The shortlisting criteriaare indicated below: EvaluationCriteria for REOI (Package No.CS - 07) EvaluationCriteria for REOI (Package No.CS - 07) EvaluationCriteria for REOI (Package No.CS - 07) EvaluationCriteria for REOI (Package No.CS - 07) EvaluationCriteria for REOI (Package No.CS - 07) S.No Criteria Max.Marks Max.Marks 1 Experience 50 Experience across various industry segments in Energy Environment &Social sector -- 50 % 25 1 Experience 50 Experience across various industry segments in Energy Environment &Social sector -- 50 % 25 1 Experience 50 Experience across various industry segments in Energy Environment &Social sector -- 50 % 25 1 Experience 50 Experience in the MSME/SME segments in Energy Environment & SocialSector-- 30 % 15 1 Experience 50 Experience in awareness outreach & capacity building of Industries onEnvironment & Social Issues -- 20 % 10 2 Key Personnel 30 Educational and Professional Qualifications 5 2 Key Personnel 30 Experience in Energy/Environment/Social sectors across various industrysegments -- 50 % 15 2 Key Personnel 30 Experience in Energy/Environment/Social sectors across MSME/SMEsegments 10 3 Organisation 20 Turnover (combined turnover of the J.V. partners in the case of a JV)---75% 15 3 Organisation 20 Turnover (combined turnover of the J.V. partners in the case of a JV)---75% 15 3 Organisation 20 Number and size of establishments in India - 25% 5 100 100 Note: The top 6 ranked firms in accordance with the above criteria would qualifyfor the short listing subject to securing a minimum of 60% of the total marks assigned to each of the criteria as listed at serialnumbers 12 & 3 above. Thiswould however also be subject to the provisions as stipulated in the Guidelines of the World Bankon the Selection and Employment of Consultants (Edition of May 2004 revised October 1 2006). The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection andEmployment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (Edition of May 2004 Revised October 1 2006) ? ("Consultant Guidelines")setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict of interest. Inparticular it is to be noted that Consulting Firms in which SIDBIor any of its subsidiaries holds stakes would not beeligible to submit EOIs in response to this Request for Expressions of Interest. Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of ajoint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications. The Consulting Firm should indicate whether the EOI is beingsubmitted as a Joint Venture or otherwise. In the caseof Joint Venture a copy of the MOU for the partnership arrangements as wellas information as at (a) to (i) above may be given separately in respect of each partner in the J.V. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the QCBS method set out in the World BanksGuidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (Edition of May 2004 revised in October 2006).The method of selection would however be subject to the provisions under Paragraph 2.8 of the ConsultantGuidelines. Interested consultants may obtain further information at the address below during office hours (10.00 AMto 5 PM Monday to Friday excluding public holidays). The response to this REOI is to be submitted in Original + Four copies. Expressions of Interest mustbe delivered in a written form to the addressbelow {in sealed covers superscribed with "Expression of Interest forFinancing Energy Efficiency at MSMEs (CS-7) - due by August 29 2012 (1700 hrs)" or by fax or by email} by August 29 2012 (1700 hours). The Deputy General Manager ENERGY EFFICIENCY CENTRE Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) Ground Floor Block-"E" NSIC Admin. Building Gate No.-3 NSIC Complex Okhla Industrial AreaPhase-III New Delhi-110020 Phone No: 011-26382034 Fax:011-26382298 Email ID: eec_credit@sidbi.in

column18: REQUEST FOREXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) Country: India Name of Project: Financing Energy Efficiencyat MSMEs Project ID: P100530 Grant No.: TF 010422 Assignment Title: Agency for developing Green Rating Modelsfor Micro Small and Medium Enterprises and to create awareness about green rating amongst MSME stakeholders Reference No. CS-11 The MSME EE Project is part of the GEF Programmatic Framework project for Energy Efficiency inIndia. The Small Industries Development Bank of India(SIDBI) has received financing from the Global Environment Facility (GEF) towards the cost of increasing the demand for energyefficiency investments infive micro small and medium enterprise clusters and to build their capacity to access commercialfinance. One of the objectives of the project is to develop green rating models for MSMEs that could be integrated with theexisting models of rating agencies and also to create awareness amongst MSME stakeholders about green rating and its relevance tothe current global energy scenario. The awareness drive is to be focused on the MSMEs in five clusters associated with the forgingfoundry limekilns chemical and mixed industry sectors centred around the Indian cities of Pune Kolhapur TirunelveliAnkleshwar and Faridabad respectively. The project is being co-implemented by SIDBI and theBureau of Energy Efficiency Govt. of India Ministry of Power. SIDBI intends to apply a part of the proceeds for consultingservices as outlined below. This Request for Expressions of Interest(REOI) is to short list Consulting Firms for developing green rating model(s) for various industries in the MSME sector with a viewto integrating the model(s) with the rating system of one or more credit rating agencies in India associated with the SME / MSMEsector. The ConsultingFirm selected for the assignment would also be required to carry out a study on the present level ofawareness amongst Banks / FIs MSMEs and allied stakeholders on the utility of incorporation of green rating into the existing systems of credit rating agenciesand thereafter to develop suitable strategies to enhance the awareness and capacity building of such entities on the importance ofadoption of clean production methods and the emerging role of green rating vis--vis credit worthiness of an industrial unit.These awareness drives would cover MSMEs and allied stakeholders in the five project clusters of forging foundry limekilnchemical and mixed industries (comprising lightengineering/sheet metal fabrication die casting forging foundry heat treatment/ electroplating textiles etc.) located in and around the Indian cities of Kolhapur Pune Tirunelveli Ankleshwar and Faridabadrespectively. The Consulting firms would be required to liaise closely with other firms that have been awarded contracts by SIDBIfor carrying out various activities under the Project. While executing the project the Consulting firm will also work in closecoordination with SIDBI. The above activities would be implemented in a phased mannerbetween March/April 2013 (tentatively) and November 2014. The Small Industries Development Bank ofIndia now invites eligible Consulting Firms ("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the Services. InterestedConsultants should provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to performthe Services. The EOIs should be duly supported by (a) submission of brochures (b) experience indevelopment of credit rating models as well as in carrying out credit rating (for SMEs / MSMEs) (c) experience inenergy and environment related assignments for various industries (preferably SMEs / MSMEs) (d) experience in building awarenesson energy and environment for variousindustries (preferably SMEs / MSMEs) (e) educational and professional qualificationsof key personnel(f) experience of key personnel in (i) development of credit rating models as well as in carrying out creditrating (for SMEs / MSMEs)(ii) imparting training / capacity building on energy environment and allied areas (g)technical and managerial organization of the firm (including the number location and size of establishments in India)(h) turnover of the firm for the last 3 years (or of each of the Joint Venture partners if the EOI is submittedas a Joint Venture) etc. The shortlisting criteria are indicatedbelow. This would however also be subject tothe provisions as stipulated in the Guidelines of the World Bank on the Selection and Employment of Consultants (Edition of May 2004 revised October 12006). The attention of interested Consultants isdrawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (Edition ofMay 2004 Revised October 1 2006) ? ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict of interest. Inparticular it is to be noted that Consulting Firms in which SIDBI or any of itssubsidiaries holds stakes would not be eligible to submit EOIsin response to this Request for Expressions of Interest. column18: REQUESTFOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMSSELECTION) Country:India Name ofProject: Financing Energy Efficiency at MSMEs ProjectID: P100530 GrantNo.: TF 010422 Assignment Title: Agency for carrying out Monitoring & Verification of EE measures as implemented in selectedMSMEsin India ReferenceNo. CS-6 The MSME EEProject is part of the GEFProgrammatic Framework project for Energy Efficiency in India. The Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) has received financing from the Global Environment Facility(GEF)towards the cost of increasing the demand for energy efficiencyinvestments in five micro small and medium enterprise clusters andto build their capacity to access commercial finance. One of the objectives of the project is to identify vendors whose productsmeet the current technology requirements of the MSMEs in five target clusters associated with the forging foundry limekilnschemical and mixed industry sectors centred around the Indian cities of Pune Kolhapur Tirunelveli Ankleshwar and Faridabadrespectively. The primary goal wouldbe to develop an outreach mechanism for these vendors in order to facilitate the earlyinduction of appropriate technologies in the MSMEs of these identified clusters. The projectis being co-implemented by SIDBIand the Bureau of Energy EfficiencyGovt. of India Ministry of Power. SIDBI intends to apply a part of the proceeds for consultingservices as outlined below. This Request for Expressions of Interest(REOI) is to short list Consulting Firmsfor carrying out Monitoring and Verification of energy consumption / saved in selected MSMEunits that have implemented energy efficiency measures. These MSMEs pertain to the five target clusters of forging foundrylimekiln chemical and mixed industries (comprising light engineering/sheet metal fabrication die casting forging foundry heattreatment / electroplating textiles etc.) located in and around the Indian cities of Kolhapur Pune Tirulelveli Ankleshwar andFaridabadrespectively. Additionally select clusters from the BEE National SME Program may also be included in this exercise. TheConsulting Firms would also be required to critically analyse the outcome of the M & V exercise and to recommend suitablemeasures for further enhancement of savings as and where feasible. The Consulting firms would be required to liaise closely withother firms that have been awarded contractsby SIDBI for carrying out detailed energy audits and implementing themeasures asrecommended thereof at the MSME units to be identified bySIDBI for the M & V activity. While executing the project theConsulting firm will also work in coordination with SIDBI. The above activities would be implemented in a phased manner between December 2012(tentatively) and November 2014 The Small Industries Development Bank of Indianow invites eligible Consulting Firms ("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultantsshould provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform theServices. The EOIs should be duly supported by (a) submission of brochures (b) experience inimplementation of EE technology projects across (i) various industry segments in India  and (ii) in the MSME/SME segment in thefive target industry sectors / clusters in India (c) experience in providing consultancy services in the energy/environment sectors (d) experience in carrying out detailedenergy audits (i) across various industry segments in India and (ii) inthe five target industry sectors / clusters in India(e) core business of the firm including the business model (Commercial Not-For-Profit NGO etc.)(f) educational and professional qualifications of key personnel (g)experience of key personnel in carrying out detailed energy audits (i) acrossvarious industry segments in India and (ii) in the five target industry sectors / clusters in India (h)technicaland managerial organization of the firm (including the number location and size of establishments in India)(i) turnoverof the firm for the last 3 years (or of each of the Joint Venture partners if the EOI is submitted asa Joint Venture) etc. The shortlisting criteria are indicatedbelow. column18: REQUESTFOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ?FIRMS SELECTION) Country: India Name of Project: Financing Energy Efficiency at MSMEs Project ID: P100530 Grant No.: TF 010422 Assignment Title: Agency for carrying out Training / Capacity Building ofFinancial Institutions / Banks in India on appraisal of EE projects for MSMEs Reference No. CS-10 The MSME EE Project is part of the GEFProgrammatic Framework project for Energy Efficiency in India. The Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) has received financing from the Global Environment Facility (GEF)towards the cost of increasing the demand for energy efficiency investments in five micro small and medium enterprise clustersandto build their capacity to access commercial finance. One of the objectives of the project is to identify consultants who couldundertake training of professionals in Financial Institutions / Banks at any of the existing Bank Training Institutes in India onthe appraisal of EE projects of MSMEs in five target clusters associated with the forging foundry limekilns chemical and mixedindustry sectors centred around the Indian cities of Pune Kolhapur Tirunelveli Ankleshwar and Faridabad respectively. Theprimary goal would be to facilitate financing for enhancement of EE technologies by these MSMEs. The project is being co-implemented by SIDBIand the Bureau of Energy Efficiency Govt. of India Ministry of Power. SIDBI intends to apply a partof the proceeds for consultingservices as outlined below. This Request for Expressions of Interest(REOI) is to short list Consulting Firms for carrying out training and capacity building of Banks and Financial Institutions (FIs)on the appraisal of Energy Efficiency projects with particular focus on MSMEs with the objective of facilitating investments fortechnology upgradation for enhancing energy efficiency in this industry segment. The target MSMEs pertain to the five project clusters of forging foundry limekilnchemical and mixed industries (comprising light engineering/sheet metal fabrication die casting forging foundry heat treatment/ electroplating textiles etc.) located in and around the Indian cities of Kolhapur Pune Tirunelveli Ankleshwar and Faridabadrespectively. The selected Consulting Firm would be required to assess the current uptake of loans from Banks /FIs by MSMEs inthese clusters and to coordinate with other Consultants (already appointed under the project for training of energy professionals)for identification of the barriers faced in appraisal of applications for loans and to devise strategies to bridge the gaps. TheConsultant would be required to develop training modules customized forthe Banks / FIs in the five target clusters and to conducttraining programs for these institutions at any of the existing Bank Training Institutes in India with the end objective ofaugmenting the sanction of loans to these MSMEs. The Consulting firms would also be required toliaise closely with other firms thathave been awarded contracts by SIDBI for carrying out various activities under the Project. While executing the project theConsulting firm will also work in close coordination with SIDBI. The above activities would be implemented in a phased manner between January 2013and November 2014 (tentatively). The Small Industries Development Bank of Indianow invites eligible Consulting Firms ("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultantsshould provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform theServices. The EOIs should be duly supported by (a) submission of brochures (b) experience in theEnergy & Environment sectors in preparation of DPRs & in facilitation of loan syndication for various industries (c) experience in the Energy & Environment sectors in preparation of DPRs& in facilitation of loan syndication for MSMEs (d) experience in conducting training / capacity building programs for Financial Institutions / Banks on theappraisal of projects (preferably EE projects) for various industries (including MSMEs) (e) core business of thefirm specifically indicating the business model (Commercial Not-For-Profit NGO etc.) (f) educational andprofessional qualifications of key personnel (g) experience of key personnel in (i) appraisal of EE projects forvarious industries (including MSMEs) and (ii) training / capacity building of Financial Institutions / Banks on appraisal of EEprojects for various industries (including MSMEs) (h) technical and managerial organization of the firm (includingthe number location and size of establishments inIndia) (i) turnover for the last 3 years of the firmsubmittingthe EOI (or of each of the Joint Venture partners if the EOI is submitted as a Joint Venture) etc. The shortlisting criteria are asunder: S. No Criteria Max.Marks Max.Marks 1 Experience 50 Experience in Energy & Environment sectors inpreparation of DPRs & in facilitation of loan syndication for various industries - 30% 15 1 Experience 50 Experience in Energy & Environment sectors inpreparation of DPRs & in facilitation of loan syndication for various industries - 30% 15 1 Experience 50 Experience in Energy & Environment sectors inpreparation of DPRs & in facilitation of loan syndication for various industries - 30% 15 1 Experience 50 Experience in Energy & Environment sectors inpreparation of DPRs & in facilitation of loan syndication for MSMEs - 30% 15 1 Experience 50 Experience in conducting training / capacitybuilding programs for Financial Institutions / Banks on appraisal of projects (preferably EE projects) for various industries(including MSMEs) - 40% 20 2 Key Personnel 30 Educational and Professional Qualifications -20% 6 2 Key Personnel 30 Experience in appraisal of EE projects for variousindustries (including MSMEs) - 30% 9 2 Key Personnel 30 Experience in training / capacity building of FIs /Banks on appraisal of EE projects for various industries (including MSMEs)- 50% 15 3 Organisation 20 Turnover (average of last 3 years) of firmsubmitting EOI (combined turnover of the J.V. partners in the case of a JV) - 75% 15 3 Organisation 20 15 3 Organisation 20 Number and size of establishments in India -25% 5 100 100 Note: The top 6 ranked firms inaccordance with the above criteria would qualify for the short listing subject to securing a minimum of 60% of the total marksassigned to each of the criteria as listed at serial numbers 12 & 3 above. This would however also be subject to theprovisions as stipulated in the Guidelines of the World Bank on the Selection and Employment of Consultants (Edition of May 2004 revised October 12006). The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the WorldBanks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (Edition of May 2004 Revised October 1 2006) ?("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict of interest. In particular it is to be noted thatConsulting Firms in which SIDBI or any of its subsidiaries holds stakes wouldnot be eligible to submit EOIs in response to this Request for Expressions ofInterest. Consultants mayassociate with other firms in the form of a joint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications. The Consulting Firmshould indicate whether the EOI is being submitted as a Joint Venture or otherwise. In the case of Joint Venture a copy of the MOUfor the partnership arrangements as well as information as at (a) to (i) above may be given separately in respect of each partnerin the J.V. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the QCBS method set out in theWorld Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (Edition of May 2004 revised inOctober 2006). The method of selection would however be subject to the provisions under Paragraph 2.8 of the ConsultantGuidelines. Interested consultants may obtain further information at the address below duringoffice hours (10.00 AM to 5 PM Monday to Friday excluding public holidays). The SmallIndustries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) has received financing from the Global Environment Facility (GEF) towards the cost ofincreasing the demand for energy efficiency investments in five micro small and medium enterprise clusters and to buildtheircapacity to access commercial finance. One of the objectives ofthe project is to identify consultants who could (a) undertakeactivities to raise the awareness of MSMEs on various financing schemes of Banks / Financial Institutions (FIs) in order to triggerthe uptake of financing by such MSMEs for enhancement of EE and (b) develop new products for EE financing and coordinate withBanks / FIs for their adoption. The project is being co-implemented by SIDBI and the Bureauof Energy Efficiency. SIDBI intends to apply a part of the proceeds for consulting services as outlined below. This Request for Expressions of Interest (REOI) is to shortlist Consulting Firms for carrying out activities for uptake of various schemes of Banks / FIs for promotion of Energy Efficiency.The end objective would be to increasethe level of investments for enhancement of energy efficiency in the MSMEs with support fromBanks / FIs. Additionally the Consulting Firm selected for award of contract would also be required to develop new EE financingproducts for MSMEs in coordination with Banks / FIs. The target MSMEs primarily pertain to the five project clusters offorgingfoundry limekiln chemical and mixed industries (comprising light engineering/sheet metal fabrication die castingforging foundry heat treatment / electroplating textiles etc.) located in and around the Indian cities of Kolhapur PuneTirunelveli Ankleshwar and Faridabad respectively. The selectedConsulting Firm would be required to assess the current schemes of Banks / FIs for MSMEs and the status of their uptake toidentifythe barriers faced in availing of the schemes as presently availableand to devise strategies to overcome such barriers.The Consultant shall undertake various activities aimed at overcoming the barriers and thereby leading to improved uptake of EEschemes of Banks/FIs. The Consultant would also be required to develop new products aimed at financing of EE projects for MSMEsand to coordinate with Banks / FIs for their adoption and launch in the market. The Consulting Firm wouldalso be required to liaise closely with other firms thathave been awarded contracts by SIDBI for carrying out various activities under theProject. column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OFINTEREST (CONSULTANTSERVICES) Country: India Name of Project: Financing Energy Efficiency at MSMEs (MSME EE)P100530 Sectors: District Heating& Energy CONSULTING SERVICES Project ID No.: P100530 The MSME EE Project is part of the GEF Programmatic Framework project for Energy Efficiency inIndia financed by the the World Bank with the support from Global Environmental Facility (GEF) and to be co-implemented by Small IndustriesDevelopment Bank of India (SIDBI) and Bureau of Energy Efficiency (BEE). The objective of this project is "to increase demand for energy efficiency investments in targetmicro small and medium enterprise clusters and to build their capacity to access commercialfinance." The objective of present assignment is to increase demand for energy efficiency investments in5 target Micro Smalland Medium Enterprise (MSME) clusters (comprising around 3800 MSME units) in the sectors of forging foundrylimekilns chemical and one mixed industry cluster centred around the Indian cities of Pune Kolhapur Tirunelveli Ankaleshwarand Faridabad respectively. The focus would additionally be to build the capacity of the MSME clusters to access commercialfinance. This Request for Expressions of Interest (REOI) is to short list Consultants/Agencies thatwould be invited to submit proposals for this assignment associated with increasing the investments in energy efficiency projectsin target MSME clusters by undertaking various activities aimed at preparation of the required number ofbankable Investment GradeDetailed Project Reports (IGDPRs) for individual MSME units willing to invest in energy efficiency projects and facilitatingsanction of loans on these IGDPRs from local banks if so required and desired by the MSME units. This assignment wouldinter-alia include undertaking preliminary and detailed energy audits; demonstrating the most appropriate EE technology and thebenefits of the same to the MSME units by way of a demo project or any other mechanism and to motivate them to take up EE projects;guiding them with regard to the vendors supplying various EE equipments; providing advisory services to MSME units taking up EEprojects throughout the implementationof project till commissioning or end of contract period; setting up asuitable mechanism tocollect & provide M&V data to SIDBI about the reduction in fuel consumption and electricity consumption and subsequentreduction in the GHGs emissions achieved by MSME units implementing the EE projects and its contribution to the sustainabilityaspect. The above activities would be implemented in a phased manner during2011-2014 (tentatively) andwith the final approval of SIDBI. Small Industries Development Bank of India now invites eligible Consulting Firms/Agencies toindicate their interest in providing the services. Interested consultants may provide information in brief (preferably limited to10 pages excluding CVs) indicating how they are qualified to perform the services and duly supported by (a) submission of brochures(b) description of similar assignments undertaken including the number of years of such experience in the Energy / Environment/Power sectors across various industry segments in India (including the MSME / SME segment) (c) core business of the firm (d)qualifications skills and experience of key personnel (e) technical and managerial organization of firm (including the number ofestablishments in India) (f) turnover of the firm for the last 3 years (g) experience of working with international agenciesetc. Interested consultants should alsoindicate their choice of one of more cluster/(s)i.e. Pune Kolhapur Tirunelveli Ankaleshwar and Faridabad in whichthey arewilling to work. The experience & expertise in specific industry / sector / cluster and performancecontracting would be preferred. Consultants may associate with each other to enhance their qualifications local tie-ups shall beencouraged. The consultants will be selected inaccordance with the procedures set outin the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World BankBorrowers (Edition of May 2004 revised in October 2006). Interested consultants may obtain furtherinformation at the address belowduring office hours (10.00 AM to 5 PM Monday to Friday excluding publicholidays). The response to this REOI is to be submittedin original plus three copies(if possible). Expressions of Interest must be delivered to the address below in sealed coverssuperscribed with "Expression of Interest for Financing Energy Efficiency at MSMEs: Cluster work at Pune / Kolhapur / Ankaleshwar /Faridabad / Tirunelveli Cluster - due on TuesdayAugust 23 2011 by 1700 hrs": PLEASE VISITWWW.SIDBI.IN FORFURTHER INFORMATION The DeputyGeneral Manager ENERGY EFFICIENCYCENTRE Small Industries DevelopmentBank of India (SIDBI) Ground Floor Block-"E" NSIC Admin. Building Gate No.-3 NSIC Complex Okhla Industrial AreaPhase-III New Delhi-110020 Phone No: 011-26382034 Fax: 011-26382062/26382298 Email ID: eec_credit@sidbi.in

column4: Reoi For Shortlisting Of Consultants For Selection Of An Agency For Vendor Outreach Activities For Msmes
column10: Small Industries Development Bank of India/Energy Efficiency Centre
column12: Block-E Ground Floor NSIC Admin. Building NSIC-NTSC Complex Okhla Industrial Area Phase-III
column18: REQUESTFOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMSSELECTION) Country: India Name of Project: Financing EnergyEfficiency at MSMEs Project ID: P100530 Grant No.: TF 010422 Assignment Title: Agency forAttracting Vendors of Energy Efficiency Equipment to Participate in Capacity Building of MSMEs Reference No.CS-13 The MSME EE Project is part of the GEF Programmatic Frameworkproject for Energy Efficiency in India. The SmallIndustries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) has received financing from the Global Environment Facility (GEF) towards the cost ofincreasing the demand for energy efficiency investments in five micro small and medium enterprise clusters and to build theircapacity to access commercial finance. One of the objectives of the project is to identify vendors whose products meet the currenttechnology requirements of the MSMEs in five target clusters associated with the forging foundry limekilns chemical and mixedindustry sectors centred around the Indian cities of Pune Kolhapur Tirunelveli Ankleshwar and Faridabad respectively. Theprimary goal would be to develop an outreach mechanism for these vendors in order to facilitate the early induction of appropriatetechnologies in the MSMEs of these identified clusters. The project is being co-implemented by SIDBI and the Bureau ofEnergy Efficiency Govt. of India Ministry of Power. SIDBI intends to apply a part of the proceeds for consulting services asoutlined below. This Request for Expressions of Interest (REOI) is to short listConsulting Firms for : (i) identification of the cutting edge Technologies/EE-Equipments/Energy Savings Equipments implemented insimilar units/clusters within India (ii) identification and listing out themajor manufacturers / vendors (local national and international) manufacturing / supplying EE related equipments / technologies asmay be required by the MSMEs in the five targeted clusters; (iii)identification of the gaps & barriers if any (actual or perceived) in the marketing / sale of EE equipments / technologies by such manufacturers / vendors to the MSME units; (iv)devising and implementing appropriate outreach mechanisms (which could include conducting surveys organizing workshops / focusedgroup meetings / exposure visitshighlighting energy saving potential in the technical brochures of equipment etc.) for attractingthese manufacturers / vendors for manufacturing and supplying the required EE equipments / technologies to theMSME units in thefive targeted clusters; etc. The desired outcome ofthe proposed assignment would be a wider range of product availability andsupport for the MSMEs more competitive pricing of such products etc. as compared to the current scenario. The above activities would be implemented in a phased manner between September 2012 and November 2014 The Small Industries Development Bank of India now invites eligibleConsulting Firms ("Consultants") toindicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultants should provideinformation demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services. The EOIsshould be duly supported by (a) submission of brochures (b) experience in (i) working in similarassignments undertaken in the last five years including (ii) marketing of technical products & solutions (related to energyefficiency) (iii) marketing of technical products & solutions (MSMEs) (c) Experience in the Energy /Environment sectors across (i) various industry segments in India (ii) MSME segment in India (d) Experience ofworking with international/multi-lateral agencies (e) core business of the firm including the business model(Commercial Not-For-Profit NGO etc.) (f) educational qualifications and experience of key personnel in (i)Energy / Environment sectors across various industry segments in India (ii) Energy / Environment sectors in the SME / MSME segmentin India (g) technical and managerial organization of the firm (including the locations and size of establishmentsin India) (h) turnover of the firm for the last 3 years (or of each of the Joint Venture partners if the EOI issubmitted as a Joint Venture) etc. The shortlisting criteria are indicated below. column2: IN: TA to Enhance Financial Access
column4: Pilot For Design Development And Implementation Of Vo Ms And Zs Accounting Covering All Vos In One Mandal Each In Three Districts
column10: Society for Elimination of Rural Poverty (SERP)
column12: III floor HUDA-Hermitage Office ComplexHill Fort Road
column18: Request for Expression of Interest India Enhance Financial Access to the Poor through Technology inAndhra Pradesh" under "Consultative group to assist the Poor (CGAP)" "Pilot for design development and implementation of VO MSand ZS accounting covering all VOs in one Mandal each in three districts" Grant No.TF097375 1. The Government of India has received a grantfrom the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development/International Development Association for Consultative Group toAssist the Poor and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this grant to payments under the contract for"Pilot for design development andimplementation of VO MS and ZS accounting covering all VOs in one Mandal each in threedistricts" 2.The Services include: (a) Brief Description of Organisation: Since its inception SERP has been strivinghard to build a unique structure of community based organizations by organizing 1.11 crore rural women into SHGs VillageOrganizations (VO) Mandal Samakhyas (MS) and Zilla Samakhyas (ZS). There are 1.11crore members in 10 14926 SHGs exclusivelyforwomen. A total of 39495 Village Organizations(VOs) 1098 Mandal Samakhyas (MSs) and 22 Zilla Samakhyas have come into existence in 22 districts. As on today the total Savings and Corpus of SHG Members are Rs.3383.10 croresand Rs.5070.51 crores respectively. (b)Need and Background ofAssignment TheCBO Federations i.e. VO MS and ZS are involved in both financial and non-financial activities viz. savings mobilisations lendingto member organisations micro-insurance and pension livelihood activities health etc. Currently they are dealinglarge volumes of financial transactions and maintainingmanual books of accounts. As the accountingpractices and treatment varyacross various livelihoods financial and social development activities the manual accounting systembecame more complex for CBOs. The literacy among CBO members and the functionaries is very limited. As a result of thismaintaining accounts in an accurate and up to date manner became challenging task to the CBOs and their staff. Inmanual system there is a little scope for standardisation and bringing in uniformity in accounting systems. Manual records areeasier to be falsified modified altered or vanished as compared to computerized records which become very safe when usingpasswords firewalls and back-ups. Dueto manual accounting system SERP is not able tomonitor and provide effective facilitation and nurturing support to CBOs. Computerised Accounting Systems in CBOs address theabove said deficiencies in manual system besides providing for greater transparency standardisation and application ofaccounting standards consolidation of data analysis and interpretation. It also enhancescredibility of CBOs in their members andexternal agencies and help in improving their performance. Thegeographical scope of the project is: AdilabadDistrict: All (33) VOs and MS in NirmalMandal WestGodavari District: All (30)VOs and MS in Chagallu Mandal Chittoor District: All (37) VOs and MS inPoothalapattu Mandal (c)Objectives Theobjectives of this consultancy services are to design develop robust accounting systems for VO MS& ZS and pilot test in thespecified locations. The solution must meet the CBOs need comprehensive coverage of transactions accuracy adherence to accountingstandards and legal compliances. Thesoftware will be developed on central server forgeneral MIS. The software will enable CBOs carryout accounting on dayto daytransaction basis in double entry system for all their activities relating to savings credit borrowings insurance CIF andotherborrowed funds trainings and capacity building activities commoditytrading activities other social development programmesunder education health etc. Thereports shall include Cash Book Bank Books General Ledger Sub-ledgers Trial BalanceStatement Trading Account Profit and Loss Account and Balance Sheet etc besides other MIS reports both consolidated andportfolio/project wise. The software application facilitates seamless integration of inter and intra transactions among tiers ofCBOs. (d)Expected Results Improved financial literacy among CBO members andfunctionaries Improved financial transparency at VO MS and ZS Level Improved financial planning and management skills amongCBOs Improved financial sustainability of CBOs Existence of effective internal control mechanisms On-time accomplishment of legal compliances by CBOs Availability of information on Web for monitoring of CBO performance. Integration of accounting data with SHGs and across other CBOentities Using accounting data to generate financial reports Adherence to accounting standards with online auditingfeatures. (e) KeyPerformance Indicators Real-time and accurate online data availability at all VOs MSs and ZSs Web-based MIS and decision support system for all the CBOs Electronic Books and records in printable form online/offline Audit Ready Financial Statements and Records at any given point of time for each VO ZS and MS Functional and technical evaluation of existing software Availability of CBOs Reports portfolio wise Loan disbursement and repayment analysis (including aging analysis) report Automated generation of performance rating for eachCBO. (f) Implementation Period: TheTotal duration of the Consultancy Services will be 30 weeks for development and maintenance. 3. TheSociety for Elimination of Rural Poverty now invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing theServices. Interested consultants must provideinformation indicating that they are qualified to perform the Services (brochures description of similar assignments experiencein similar conditions availability of appropriate skills among staff etc.). Consultants may associate to enhance their qualifications. [The "Association" maytake the form of a joint venture (with joint and severalliability) or of a sub-consultancy]. 4. A consultant will be selected inaccordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by BankBorrowers May 2004 and October 2006 5. Interested Consultants may obtain further information at the address given belowfrom 11:00 to 17:00 hours on all working days 6.Expression for Interest must be delivered to the address below by no later than 03/06/2013 Address: Director(Procurement) Society for Elimination of Rural Poverty (SERP) IIIfloor HUDA-Hermitage Office Complex HillFort Road Hyderabad ? 500 004 Phone: 040-23 2989 81; Fax: 040-23 21 18 48 E-Mail:spmproc@gmail.com ________________

column4: General Procurement Notice
column10: Society for Elimination of Rural Poverty (SERP)
column12: III floor HUDA-Hermitage Office ComplexHill Fort Road
column18: GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE COUNTRY:INDIA NAME OFPROJECT: Andhra Pradesh Rural Inclusive Growth Project(APRIGP) Sector: Rural Development GENERAL PROCUREMENTNOTICE Loan No./Credit No./TF No./Grant No. : Applied Project ID No.: Project IN-TBD-01 - AP Rural Inclusive GrowthProject The Government of Andhra Pradesh India has applied a loan for the amount of US$ 150 millionequivalent from the World Bank toward the cost of Andhra Pradesh Rural Inclusive Growth Project (APRIGP) and it intends to apply part of the proceeds to payments for goods works relatedservices and consulting services to be procured under this project. This project will be jointly financed by the Government of AndhraPradesh India . The project will include the following components: Society for Elimination of Rural Poverty (SERP) is Society under RuralDevelopment Department and is implementing Indira Kranthi Patham (IKP) in all the 22 rural districts of A.P. There are 104.10 lakhsmembers in 1.04 lakhs SHGs exclusively for women. A total of 38300 Village Organizations (VOs) 1099Mandal Samakhyas (MSs) and 22Zilla Samakhyas have come into existence in 22 districts. As on today the totalSavings and Corpus of SHG Members are Rs.3383.10 Crores and Rs.5070.51 crores respectively. The primary goal of Indira Kanthi Patham (IKP SERP) is to promote CBOsand self-managed institutions of the poor. SERP has been striving hard to build a unique structure of community based organizationby organizing 1.04 crore rural women into SHGs Village Organizations Mandal Samakhyas and Zilla Samakhyas.SHG membership inAndhra Pradesh is the largest in the country with around 30% of total SHG members in the country. SERP has launched many Rural Livelihoods interventions. The interventionsaims at creating efficient and effective institutional platforms of the rural poor enabling them to increase household incomethrough sustainable livelihood enhancements and improved access to financial and selected public services. SERP has set out anagenda to reach out and mobilise POP & BPLhouseholds into self-managed Self Help Groups (SHGs) and federal institutions andsupport them through livelihoods collectives. In addition the poor would be facilitated to achieve increased access to theirrights entitlements and public services diversified risk and better social indicators ofempowerment. Presently SERP focused on achieving inclusive growth built on 3 key pillars namelyLivelihood Promotion through avalue chain approach in key livelihood sectors Life cycle approachto the achievement of MDGs inHealth & Education and leveraging the existing institutional platforms of the poor to ensure reliable anduniversal access toentitlements. It was also agreed that the projectwould leverage on innovations best global/national experiences and technologiesthrough technical assistance. As part of the Implementation arrangements the project would include dedicated human resources forthe three key pillars spearhead teams for specific interventions andpartnerships with technical agencies and Proposed Andhra Pradesh Rural Inclusive Growth Project (APRIGP) to WoldBank. Procurement of contracts financed by the World Bank will be conductedthrough the procedures as specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits January 2011 and is open to all eligiblebidders as defined in the guidelines. Consulting services will be selected in accordance with theWorld Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers . Specific procurement notices for contracts to be bid under the WorldBanks international competitive bidding (ICB) procedures and for contracts for consultancy services will be announced as theybecome available in UN DevelopmentBusiness and dgMarket and Local News Paper and in SERP website www.serp.ap.gov.in. Address :- Director (Procurement) Society for Elimination of Rural Poverty (SERP) III floor HUDA-Hermitage Office Complex Hill Fort Road Hyderabad ? 500 004 Phone: 040-23 29 89 81; Fax: 040-23 21 18 48 E-Mail: spmproc@gmail.com

column18: REQUEST FOREXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTINGSERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) India Bihar IntegratedSocial Protection Strengthening Project Assignment Title: Development and Maintenance of Transactional Management Information System for the Social Security Pension The Government of Bihar has applied forfinancing from the World Banktoward the cost of the Bihar Integrated Social Protection Strengthening Project and the State Societyfor Ultra Poor and Social Welfare under the Department of Social Welfare intends to apply part of the proceeds for consultingservices. The consulting services ("the Services")broadly include the following tasks:  undertake system analysis of current process roles andresponsibilities of stakeholders and status of beneficiary and benefit delivery data;  develop System Requirement Specifications;  carry out detailed design of the transactional ManagementInformationSystem (MIS);  develop and implement the MIS  prepare all procurement documents related to the hardwaresystem software database and other tools to make the MIS operational and support the Society in the procurement process and thedeployment process including technical evaluation contract design certify due installation for payments to the hardwarevendors;  deploy and pilot the MIS in 2 districts;  roll out to all other districts after satisfactory completionof the pilot;  train the end users initially at the field level at blocksub-division district and state level and provide training modules for futuretrainings at the district level;  provide complete support for operation and maintenance of theMIS;  assist the Society and the Department to monitor the status ofthe overall system and transfer knowledge and capacity to the e-Gov unit of the Society. Adraft Terms of Reference is available at www.socialwelfare.bih.nic.in The Society now invites eligibleconsulting firms ("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consulting firms should provideinformation demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services. Theshortlisting criteria are:  The Consulting firm must be in the business of IT System Integration andSoftware Development for the last 3 years;  The Consulting firm shall have average turnover of minimum Rs. 3 Crore duringthe last 3 financial years with positive net worth;  The Consulting firm shall have experience of handling large volume ofdata in atleast one project in the last 3 years in which minimum 50Lakhs data records have been created after data entry;  The Consulting firm shall have experience in handling government projects;  The Consulting firm shall have required skill and capacity in-house tosatisfactorily implement the required services; Note that the Consulting firm shall notbe involved in any major litigation that may have an impact of affecting or compromising the delivery of services as required underthis contract. The attention of interested Consultingfirm is drawn to paragraph 1.9of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loansand IDACredits & Grants] by World Bank Borrowers (January 2011) ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth theWorld Banks policy on conflict of interest. Consulting firm may associate with otherfirms in the form of a jointventure or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications. A Consulting firm will be selected in accordance with theQuality Cost Based Selection (QCBS) method set out in the Consultant Guidelines. Further information can be obtained at the address below duringoffice hours from 10.00 to 18.00 hours Expressions of interest must bedelivered in a written form and should include your firms demonstrated capacity toprovide the required expertise as well as your firms previous experiences with similar projects preferably in similardemographical regions and preferably those provided for similar assignments Also you are kindly requested to submit thefilled up information inthe format available on the website www.socialwelfare.bih.nic.in to the address below through Registered Post/Speed Post/ Courier/ By Hand by 12 th September 2012 till05.00pm. State Society for Ultra Poor and Social Welfare (SSUPSW) 2 nd Floor Apna Ghar Behind Lalit Bhawan BaileyRoad Patna 800023 Attn: Chief Executive Officer SSUPSW 2nd Floor Apna Ghar Behind Lalit Bhawan Bailey Road Patna Bihar India Tel: +916122546511 Fax: +916122546510 E-mail: ssupsw@gmail.com

column4: Consultancy Services To Provide Customize And Implement A Road Accident Data Management System (radms) In The State Of Himachalpradesh
column12: HPRIDC NirmanBhawanNigam Vihar
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) [INDIA] [HIMACHAL PRADESH STATE ROADS PROJECT] LoanNo:81990-IN Assignment Title: Consultancy Services to provide customize and implement a Road Accident Data Management System (RADMS) in the State ofHimachalPradesh. ReferenceNo.: PW-SRP/RIDC/Procurement-RADMS/2013-1. The Government of Himachal Pradesh hasreceived financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Himachal Pradesh State Roads Projectand intends to apply part of theproceeds for consulting services. Theconsulting services ("the Services") include development of Road Accident Data Management System in the state of HimachalPradesh (i) To provide and implement a GIS-basedcomputerized software system for accident recording storage analysis & dissemination (ii) To assist inestablishment of a centralized Accident Data Management Cell(ADMC) and set up an acceptable database (iii) To provide one year operationalsupport after full rollout of the system in the state (iv) To conduct training amongst thepolice highway engineers and other stake holders and establish an on-going stakeholder driven training program for sustaining theRADMS implementation. These servicesare expected to be delivered over a 24 monthsperiod. The Himachal Pradesh Road and Other InfrastructureDevelopment Corporation (HPRIDC) now inviteseligible consulting firms("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the Services. InterestedConsultants should provideinformation demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services.Theshortlisting criteria are: Turnover figure of last three years Net Profit Figure Past Experience of work of similar natureOverall Experience of Firm Experience as Lead Consultant in similar consultancy etc. The attention of interested Consultants isdrawn to paragraph 1.9 ofthe World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loans and IDACredits & Grants] by World Bank BorrowersJanuary 2011("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict ofinterest. Consultants may associate with other firms inthe form of a joint venture or a subconsultancyto enhance their qualifications.The type of association should be clearly stated inthe submission if it is JV or sub consultancy. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the Quality-And Cost-Based Selection (QCBS) methodset out in the Consultant Guidelines. Further informationcan be obtained at the address below during officehoursi.e1000to 1700 hours. Expressions of interest must be delivered in a written form to theaddress below (in person or by mail or by fax or by e-mail) by February 15 2013. State Roads Project HPRIDCNirmanBhawan Nigam ViharShimla-171002(H.P) Attn: Naresh Sharma ChiefEngineer-cum-Project Director State Roads Project HPRIDCNirmanBhawan Nigam Vihar Shimla-171002 HimachalPradesh India. column4: General Procurement Notice
column10: State Society for Ultra Poor and Social Welfare (SSUPSW)
column12: 2nd Floor Apna Ghar Behind Lalit Bhawan Bailey Road
column18: GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE INDIA Bihar Integrated Social ProtectionStrengthening Project Human Development GENERAL PROCUREMENTNOTICE CreditNo. Project ID No. P118826 The Government of India has applied for financing in the amount of US$ 84million equivalent from the World Bank toward the cost ofthe Bihar Integrated Social Protection Strengthening Project andit intends to apply part of the proceeds to payments for goods works related services and consulting services to be procuredunder this project. Thisproject will be jointly financed by the Government of Bihar. The project will include the following components: Component 1:Strengthening social protection systems and capacity; and Component 2: Strengthening outreach and social protection servicedelivery. The first component will strengthen core systems and capacity of Bihar Rural Development Society (BRDS) and State Societyfor Ultra Poor and Social Welfare (SSUPSW) at thestate and district levels by introducing clarity transparency and consistency inpolicy-making and operations; strengthening roles and responsibilities and introducing performance incentives; andestablishingcontrol and accountability mechanisms for bringing transparency and enforceability in the system. The second componentwould supportstate-wide coverage of social care services by establishing 101 Social Care Service Centers (Buniyad Centers) in allsub-divisions of the state as well as small-scale pilots testing innovations for improved social protection services financed froman "Innovation Window". The two implementing agencies namely BRDS and SSUPSW will procurethe following goods works and consultancy services in support of efficient and effective projectimplementation. Works: Construction of 101new Buniyad centers at sub divisional level;renovation of about 20 existing buildings to serve as Buniyad centers Goods: 38 mobile outreach and therapy vans; equipment for rehabilitationservices; office equipment and furniture Consultancy Services: Staff fixed and mobile social care service provision centers;undertake training needs assessments; design communication strategy and materials; undertake review of HR and performancemanagement systems; design management information systems; assess existing facilities for Buniyad Centers and design and superviseconstruction of new Buniyad Centers; and conduct internal and external audits Procurement of contracts financed by the World Bank will be conductedthrough the procedures as specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans andIDACredits (current edition) and is open to all eligiblebidders asdefined in the guidelines.Consulting services will be selected in accordance with the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (current edition). Specific procurement notices for contracts to be bid under the WorldBanks internationalcompetitive bidding (ICB) procedures and for contracts for consultancy services will be announced as theybecome available in UNDevelopment Business and dgMarket and national newspapers and websites with wide circulation. Furtherinformation can be obtained at the addresses given below during office hours 1000 to 1800 hours. State Society for Ultra Poor and Social Welfare (SSUPSW) Department ofSocial Welfare 2nd Floor ApnaGhar Behind Lalit Bhawan Bailey Road Patna800023 Attn: ProjectDirector BISPS SSUPSW Tel: +91-612-2546511 Fax: +91-612-2546510 E-mail:ssupsw@gmail.com Bihar Rural Development Society (BRDS) Department ofRural Development Old SecretariatPatna 800023 Attn: ProjectDirector BISPS Bihar Rural Development Society Tel:+91-612-2217496 Fax:+91-612-2217857 E-mail:brdshrd@gmail.com

column4: Package Cs-5 : Development Of An Advocacy And Communication Strategy And Design Of Iec Materials
column10: State Society for Ultra Poor and Social Welfare (SSUPSW) Dept of Social Welfare
column12: 2nd Floor Apna Ghar Behind Lalit BhawanBailey Road
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) INDIA-BIHARINTEGRATED SOCIAL PROTECTION STRENGTHENING PROJECT Project No.:P118826 Assignment Title : Development of an Advocacy and Communication Strategy and Design of IECMaterials ReferenceNo. (as per Procurement Plan) : CS-5 The Government of India on behalf of Government of Bihar has appliedfor financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Bihar Integrated SocialProtection Strengthening Project andintends to apply part of the proceeds for consulting services. The State Society for Ultra Poor and Social Welfare now inviteseligible consulting firms("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the Services. The consulting services ("the Services") would broadly include thefollowing scope of services (Communications Agency) and will support SSUPSW in : - undertaking a participatory communications needs assessment forvulnerable groups in Bihar comprising Persons with Disabilities (PWDs) widows and older persons; - developing a communicationstrategy for the project based on thefindings of the communicationsneeds assessment with the objective of raising awareness among thesevulnerable groups comprisingPersons with Disabilities (PWDs) older persons and widows and caregivers on their rights and entitlements under national and stateprograms as well as on issues related to self-care preventive health care disease management and productiveageing; - developing an advocacy strategy for the project based on the findingsof the communications needs assessment with the objective of advocating the rights of Persons with Disabilities (PWDs) olderpersons and widows among policy makers government officials functionaries communities and otherstakeholders; - developing a communicationplan for identified internal and externalaudiences to address the proposed advocacy and communications strategy; - designing appropriate Information Education and Communicationmaterials in support of the advocacy and communications strategy; - supporting deployment of the IEC materials developed in line with thecommunications plan; - establishing a user friendly mechanism for communication internal toSSUPSW encompassing all levels state district and sub-divisional; - establishing a system for routine external communications withrelevant stakeholders; and - building capacity of SSUPSW to effectively monitor efficientdeployment of the communication plan. The Communications Agency will be retained for the period of one yeareffective from thecontract signing date. Abroad draft Terms of Reference for theRecruitment Service Agency is available at www.socialwelfare.bih.nic.in Interested Consultants should provide information demonstrating thatthey have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services. The shortlisting criteria are : - The firm should be in business for the last fiveyears. - The firm should have an average annual turnover of at least INR 1.5Crores.in the last three years. - The firm should have at least two prior experiences in designing anddeploying communications strategies for social programs or rural livelihood programs preferably with experience in reachingvulnerable populations. - Established track record in designing and deploying high qualitysocial campaigns in India. - The firm should have previous experience and proven ability to workclosely with government departments and coordinate with diverse agencies including electronic andprint media social welfareagencies and communities. - Experience in communications training and research includingmonitoring and evaluating campaigns. - Availability of experienced senior-level staff comprising creativedesigner editor copy writer DTP operator and client servicing personnel to lead the proposed work. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 ofthe World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants byWorld Bank Borrowers (January 2011) ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict ofinterest. In addition please refer to the following specific information on conflictof interest related to thisassignment : conflict between consulting activities and procurement of goods works or non-consultingservices; conflict among consulting assignments; and relationship with Borrowers staff. Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a jointventure or a sub consultancy to enhance their qualifications. The submission should clearly indicate the type of associationwhether a JV or sub consultancy A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the QCBS method setout in the Consultant Guidelines. Further informationcan be obtained at the address below during officehours 1000 to 1800hours. Expressions of interest must be delivered in a written form to theaddress below through registered post/speed post/courier/ by Hand by November 18 2013 till 1700 hrs. Attention : The Project Director State Society for Ultra Poor and Social Welfare(SSUPSW) Department of Social Welfare 2nd Floor Apna Ghar Behind Lalit Bhawan Bailey Road Patna 800023 Bihar INDIA Telephone : +91 6122546511 Fax : +91 612 2546510 E-mail : ssupsw@gmail.com Website : www.socialwelfare.bih.nic.in

column4: Wbr 3-pkg Cs-1-design Development Implementation Operation And Maintenance Of: Transactional Management Information System For The Social Security Pension (sspmis)
column10: State Society for Ultra Poor and Social Welfare (SSUPSW) Dept of Social Welfare
column12: 2nd Floor Apna GharBehind Lalit BhawanBailey Road
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) INDIA-BIHARINTEGRATED SOCIAL PROTECTION STRENGTHENING PROJECT Project No.:P118826 Assignment Title: Design Development ImplementationOperation and Maintenance of: TransactionalManagement Information System for the Social Security Pension (SSPMIS) ReferenceNo. (as per Procurement Plan) : CS-1 The Government ofBihar with financing and technical support from the World Bank is implementing a project titled "Bihar Integrated SocialProtection Strengthening (BISPS) Project". The objective ofthis Project is tostrengthen institutional capacity and delivery systems to deliver social protection programs and services and expand outreach ofsocial care services for poor & vulnerable in Bihar. The State Society for Ultra Poor and Social Welfare (SSUPSW) underthe Department of Social Welfare (DoSW) is one of the implementing agencies of the project. The scope of work ("the Services") for the SSPMIS project broadly include the followingtasks:  Development and implementation of a transaction management SSPMIS system and operateand maintain the system for the period of the contract  Monitor manage support operate the hardware to be procured byDoSW  Undertake system analysis of current process develop functional and system requirementspecifications roles and responsibilities of stakeholders and status of beneficiary and benefit deliverydata  Prepare/modify all procurement documents related to the hardware other tools to makethe MIS operational  Pilot and rollout the SSPMIS and provide training to end-users  Manage the SSPMIS system as per the Service Level Agreement The Agency/Consultant will be retained for the period of three yearseffective from the contract signing date. Any change in the period of assignment willonly be made after mutual review by both the parties. The draft Terms of Reference forthe Recruitment Service Agency is available at www.socialwelfare.bih.nic.in The State Society for Ultra Poor and Social Welfare now inviteseligible consulting firms("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultants should provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications andrelevant experience to perform the Services. The shortlisting criteria are: - Prior experience in designing implementing and operating e-governanceprojects in India and proven ability to work closely with government departments and coordinate with diverse agencies handlinge-governance projects. - A registered company in India belonging to one of the followingindustries viz. Software/ Hardware & Networking/IT Services. - Certified for at leastCMMi or its equivalent Level 3 with a currentlyvalid certificate. - Experience in designing and implementing large database managementprojects and system integration projects in last five years. - An annual turnover of Rs.3.00 Crores or more in the last threefinancial years. (Audited financial statements of lastthree years should be attachedto EOI). - Availability of requiredsoftware development and IT Project managementskills and capacity tosatisfactorily implement the proposed work. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 ofthe World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants byWorld Bank Borrowers (January 2011) ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict ofinterest. In addition please refer to the following specific information on conflictof interest related to thisassignment : conflict between consulting activities and procurement of goods works or non-consultingservices; conflict among consulting assignments; and relationship with Borrowers staff. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the QCBS method setout in the Consultant Guidelines. Further informationcan be obtained at the address below during officehours 1000 to 1800hours. column4: Package Ncs-1 : Recruitment Support Agency
column10: State Society for Ultra Poor and Social Welfare (SSUPSW) Dept of Social Welfare
column12: 2nd Floor Apna GharBehind Lalit BhawanBailey Road
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) INDIA-BIHARINTEGRATED SOCIAL PROTECTION STRENGTHENING PROJECT Project No.:P118826 Assignment Title : Recruitment Support Agency ReferenceNo. NCS-1 The State Society for Ultra Poor and Social Welfare under theDepartment of Social Welfare Government of Bihar has applied for financing from theWorld Bank toward the cost of the BiharIntegrated Social Protection Strengthening Project and intends to apply part of the proceedsfor consulting services. The State Society for Ultra Poor and Social Welfare (SSUPSW) nowinvites eligible consulting firms ("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultantsshould provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experienceto perform the Services. The shortlisting criteria are: - Availability of qualified experts in fieldsrelevant to staffing positions on selection panel. - Experience of having successfully managed asimilar assignment in Bihar. - Two similar contracts for hiring ofprofessional or administrative staff (at least 1000 professionals) in the any of the last five years which includes screeningapplicants and deriving long and short list and conducting verification / reference checks of selectedcandidates. - An annualturnover of Rs.2.00 Crore or more inthe last three financial years. (Audited financial statements of last three years should be attached toEOI). - Absence of litigation which may adverselyimpact delivery of services in the state of Bihar. The consulting services ("the Services") include those of aRecruitment Support Agency (RSA) which will support SSUPSW in contracting administrative technical and support personnel for 101Social Care Service Centers (Buniyad Centers) and 38 mobile outreach and therapy vans to be located at the district andsub-divisional levels throughout the state. The expected numbers are around 836personnel at the district level and 816 personnel at the sub-divisional level. Note that at least 25% of the personnel must be competitivelyrecruited by July 2014. The remaining 75% of personnel must be competitively recruitedin two phases i.e. 30% by June 2016 and remaining 35% by December 2016. The RSA will be retained for a period of three years effective fromthe contract signingdate. The contract end date may further be extended for next one yearsubject to the client requirement andsatisfactory performance of theagency. Any change in the period of assignment willonly be made after mutual review by both the parties. The draft Terms of Reference forthe Recruitment Service Agency is available at www.socialwelfare.bih.nic.in and www.ssupsw.in The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 ofthe World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants byWorld Bank Borrowers (January 2011) ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict ofinterest. In addition please refer to the following specific information on conflictof interest related to thisassignment: conflict between consulting activities and procurement ofgoods works or non-consultingservices; conflict among consulting assignments; and relationship with Borrowers staff. Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a jointventure or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications. The type of associationshould be clearly stated in the submission. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the QCBS method setout in the Consultant Guidelines. Further informationcan be obtained at the address below during officehours 1000 to 1800hours. Expressions of interest must be delivered in a written form to theaddress below through registered post/speed post/courier/by Hand by November 15 2013 till 1700 hrs.
