column4: Independent Third Party Construction Supervision For Quality Assurance Of Batch-3 Rural Water Supply Schemes
column12: 01 Bhagirathipuram Doon Vihar Jakhan Rajpur Road
column18: INDIA Uttarakhand Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Project Reinvitation for seekingExpression of Interest (EoI) for Independent third party construction supervision for quality assurance of Batch 3 Rural WaterSupply Schemes Credit No. 4232 IN This request forExpressions of Interest follows the General Procurement Notice for this project that appeared in the UNDB/dg market on line dated31 st October 2011/29 th October 2011. The Govt. ofUttarakhand through the Govt. of India hasreceived a credit from InternationalDevelopment Association and intends to apply part of the proceeds of the credit to payments under the contract for "Third PartyConstruction Supervision for Quality assurance of Batch III Water Supply Schemes" The consultants shallwork as an extended arm of State Water and Sanitation Mission (SWSM) for qualityassurance covering implementation of various project related construction activities by all three implementing agencies i.e.Uttarakhand Peyjal Nigam (UJN) Uttarakhand Jal sansthan (UJS) and Project Management Unit-Swajal (PMU) and providing necessary technical support to User Water Supply and Sanitation Sub Committees(UWSSCs) and as the third party to carry out the supervision of construction activities and review the field processing of variousconstruction activities of the implementation phase schemes in hilly region; and timely intimating implementingagencies for corrective actions. The services include conducting Construction Supervision for quality assurance in Batch 3 ruralwater supply schemes in all the districts of the State. Chief Engineer SWSM now invites eligible consultants to indicate their interest in providing theservices. Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified to perform the services (brochuresdescription of similar assignments experience in similar conditions availability of appropriate skills among staff etc.).Consultants may associate to enhance their qualifications. [Such an "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (with jointand several liability) or of a sub-consultancy]. More specifically such consultancyfirms must provide information pertaining to (A) Name address fax/ email of Consulting Firms along with ownership andorganizational structure of the firm; (B) List of major assignment/ studies undertaken withspecial emphasis on similar studiescompleted in recent years. A consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines;Selection and Employment of Consultants byBank Borrowers May 2004. Revised October 2006. Interested Consultants may obtain further information at the address given below from 10:00 AM to 5PM. TheExpression of Interest with the accompanying material should be submitted for the assignment super scribed with theName of the assignment and should reach Chief Executive Officer State Water & SanitationMission Cell 01 Bhagirathi PuramDoon Vihar Jakhan Dehradun Uttarakhand by 15:00 hours on 6 th August  2012. Further information if any may beobtained from Chief Engineer State Water &Sanitation Mission. Alldocuments including the Request for Proposals the Proposal and consultants contract for the proposed assignmentwill be issued in English. ChiefEngineer State Water & Sanitation Mission Cell (Uttarakhand Rural Water Supply & Sanitation Project) Department of Drinking Water Government of Uttarakhand 01 Bhagirathi Puram Doon Vihar Jakhan Dehradun -248001 Uttarakhand India Tel:91-0135-2734053 Fax:91-0135-2733728 E-mail: swsm.uttarakhand@gmail.com swsm_uttarakhand@rediffmail.com

column4: General Procurement Notice
column12: 01 Bhagiratipuram Doon Vihar Jakhan Rajpur Road
column18: GENERAL PROCUREMENTNOTICE INDIA UTTARAKHAND RURAL WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION PROJECT (SECTOR PROGRAM) GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE Credit No.: 4232 IN TheGovernment of India has received a credit from the International Development Association (IDA) in the amount of US$ 120 millionequivalent towards the cost of Uttaranchal Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Project (Sector Program) and it intends to apply theproceeds of this credit to payments for goods works related services and consulting services to be procuredunder this project. Theproject is being jointly financed by the Government of Uttarakhand Government of India & International Development Association(IDA). The project includes following components: Project description Component A: RWSS Sector Development (US$5million) will support the states sectorreform process by establishing and enhancing its institutional capacity to implement manage and sustain the states medium-termsector development program through thefollowing subcomponents: (i) capacity-building and strengthening programs; (ii) informationeducation and communication; (iii) sector information system water quality and water source discharge monitoring programs; (iv)modernization of public procurement and procurement reforms; and (v) sector studies. Component B: RWSS Infrastructure Investments (US$197 million) aims to improve serviceand sustainable access to RWSS services by financing the following investments: (i) new investments in water supply schemes andcatchment-area protection works; (ii) community mobilization and development activities; and (iii) sanitation programs. Component C: RWSS Program Management Support andM&E (US$22 million)will support: (i) operational and administrative costs associated with the implementation of the sector-wideapproach basket of the statesmedium-term sector program; and (ii) Monitoring and evaluation. Part proceedsof the credit are proposed for hiring suitable consulting firms for Construction Supervision for the Implementation phaseactivities of Batch-3 Schemes covering all districts of Uttarakhand. Total number of Schemes tobe supervised are about 180 whichare 10% randomly selected Schemes of Batch-3 in the State. The consultants shallwork asan extended arm for quality assurance for the Implementing agencies i.e. UJN UJS and PMU for providing necessary technicalsupport to UserWater Supply and Sanitation Sub Committees (UWSSCs) and as the third party carry out the inspection of constructionactivities of the schemes in implementation phase in hilly region; and timely intimate implementing agencies for corrective actions. Procurement ofcontracts financed by the credit will be conducted through the procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines: procurementunder IBRD Loans and IDA Credits May-2007 and is open to all bidders from eligible source countries as defined in the guidelines.Consulting Services will be selected in accordance with the World Banks guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by theWorld Bank Borrowers-May 2007. Specific procurementnotices for contracts to be bid under the World Banks international competitive bidding (ICB) procedures and for large-valueconsultants contractswill be announced as they become available in Development Business and newspapers English edition of"Times of India" and Hindi edition of "Dainik Jagran". Prequalification of suppliers and contractors willbe required for theIndependent Third Party Construction Supervision for quality assurance for Batch-3 Water Supply Schemes. All payments shall be made in Indiancurrency. Interested eligible bidders who wish to be includedon the mailing list to receive an invitation to prequalify/bid under ICB procedures and interested consultants who wish toreceive a copy of the advertisement requesting expressions of interest for large-value consultants contracts or those requiringadditional information should contact on the address below. Chief Executive Officer StateWater & Sanitation Mission Cell (Uttarakhand Rural Water Supply & Sanitation Project) Department of Drinking Water Government of Uttarakhand 01Bhagirathi Puram Doon Vihar Jakhan Dehradun Uttarakhand Tel:91-0135-2734053 Fax:91-0135-2733728 E-mail: swsm.uttarakhand@gmail.com

column4: Development Of River Basin Assessments And Plans For All Major River Basins In Uttar Pradesh
column12: WALMI Building Utretia
column18: India: Uttar Pradesh Water SectorRestructuring Project Phase II Request for Expression of Interest for Consultancy on the "Development of River Basin Assessments and Plans for All MajorRiver Basins in Uttar Pradesh" No. 13/PC/PACT/UPWSRP-Ph-II/SWARA/2012-13 dated January 182013 1. The Government of India (GOI) has applied for a credit/loan from the International Development Association (IDA)/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) to finance the UP Water SectorRestructuring Project (UPWSRP) Phase 2and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this credit/loan to payments under the contract for hiring services of consultancyfirm for "Development of River Basin Assessments and Plans for All Major River Basins in Uttar Pradesh." 2. The scope of services wouldinclude: (i) develop the planning framework and knowledge base of wateravailability and use/demand for each sub-basin in the 8 major basins in Uttar Pradesh (Yamuna Rapti Ganga Ghaghra Sone Gandak Ramgangaand Gomti) (ii)undertake water balance assessments of each basin atdifferent time steps and time horizons (iii) develop comprehensive knowledgeproducts such as web enabled interactive water atlas for eachsub-basin and basin and administrative units such as district andblock (iv) identify current and future key water availability and demandissues (iv) develop simple system-based water allocationand entitlement models for different availability/demand scenario (v) analyze and identify possible development and managementsolutions supported by structured stakeholder consultation processes (vi) providetraining on systems modeling approaches to water management planning (vi) Institutional capacity building covering allplanning stages processes and tasks with particular focus on transfer and institutionalization of all planning procedures toolsand facilities for continued and sustainable post-project plan update applications. The consultant is expected to use the latest web-based open-source modelingapproaches and to provide the knowledge base in a GIS web-based platform. The duration of the assignment shall be for three years. 3. The Chief Engineer StateWaterResources Agency (SWARA) invites eligible Consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Consultancy Services forthe above assignment. 4. Interested consultants mustprovide the following information indicating that they are qualified to perform the Services: Brochures Description of SimilarAssignments successfully completed in the past Availability of Skills and pastexperience among Staff (including but not limited to Flood forecast/Inundation modeler hydrologistGIS/remote sensing and databasespecialist) and financial statement for the last 3 years. 5. The criteria for short listingofthe Consulting firms shall be as follows:  The firm should have been in consulting businessfor at least 10 years.  The firms shall be financially soundwith anaverage annual turnover of more than US$ 1500000 (INR 7 50 00000) during the previous fiveyears.  The firms should have successfully completedat least two similarstudies in basin level water resources availability and allocationmodeling and planning of comparable magnitude which inter alia includescost of study duration and man months for keypersonnel during the previous five years.  Availability of skills and national andinternational experience among key staff ((basin planner surface water/ground water/environment/water qualityspecialists sociologist resource economist knowledge base specialist etc.). 6. The consultant may associate with other firms to enhance their qualification.[The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of a sub-consultancy]and this shouldbe stated clearly in the submission. 7. A consultant will be selected in accordance with Quality and Cost BasedSelection (QCBS) procedures set out in the World Banks "Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants Under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants byWorld Bank Borrowers- January 2011". The Guidelines are available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 8. Interested Consultants may obtain further informationat the address givenbelow from 10.00 ? 17.00 hours (IST) on all working days. This notice for Expression of Interest has also been posted on UPIDwebsite http://irrigation.up.nic.in/ 9. Expression of Interest with all relevant information and documents must besubmitted and subscribed "Expression of Interest for Development of River Basin Assessments and Plans for All Major River Basins inUttar Pradesh" on top of a closed envelope and be delivered to the address below by not later than 15:00 hours (IST) on February262013. In the event this last date being declared as holiday by the State Governmentdue date for submission of above EoI will be the next working day up till the sameappointed time. Senior Staff Officer (SWARA) State Water Resources Agency (SWARA) WALMI Building Utretia Lucknow 226025 Uttar Pradesh India Phone: 91 5222443973 Telefax: 91 5222440863 E-mail: anilvidy@gmail.com

column4: Wbr 6-consultancy To ?develop A Flood Forecast And Inundation Mapping Model For Rapti River Basin In Uttar Pradeshstate
column12: WALMI Building Utretia
column18: India: Uttar Pradesh Water Sector Restructuring Project PhaseII Request for Expression of Interest for Consultancy for the "Development of a FloodForecast and Inundation Mapping Model for Rapti River Basin in Uttar Pradesh State" No. 14/PC/PACT/UPWSRP-Ph-II/SWARA/2012-13 dated January18 2013 1. The Government of India (GOI) has applied for a credit/loan from the InternationalDevelopment Association (IDA)/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) to finance the UP Water SectorRestructuring Project (UPWSRP) Phase2 and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this credit/loan to payments under the contractfor hiring services of consultancy firm to Development of a Flood Forecast and InundationMapping Model for Rapti River Basin in Uttar Pradesh State. 2. The scope of the consultancy would include: a) Provide comprehensive review ofcurrent global approaches to flood forecasting for flood management and disaster risk reduction in Uttar Pradesh state; b) Selectand develop appropriate suite of models and integrated hydrologic forecast systems to provide flood forecasts at any location withlonger lead-time (at least 72 hours before) and improved accuracy (compared to current status) and inundation maps of likelyaffected areas in Rapti river basin; c) Implement customized forecast and inundation modeling system including i) dynamicinterfaces to other databases and information systems ii) front-end modules and tools for selectable input data and modelparameters and to display model results spatially (i.e. inundation areas time of arrival duration and depth; current andforecasted flood levels along the river etc); and iii) Develop tools for disseminating model outputs to public institutions andtargeted communities; d) Develop plan and protocols for sustaining and upgrading model when better data (topographic hydrologicand hydraulic) becomes available; and e) Provide operations and user manuals model upgrade/recalibration protocols and hands-ontraining on the flood model to build a team of flood forecasting professionals within SWaRA and Uttar Pradesh Irrigation Department(UPID). This will be a 24 months consultancy. 3. The Chief Engineer State WaterResources Agency (SWARA) invites eligible Consultants to indicate their interest inproviding the Consultancy Services for the aboveassignment. 4. Interested consultants must providethe following information indicating that they are qualified to perform the Services: Brochures Description of Similar Assignmentsundertaken in thepast Availability of Skills among Staff (including but not limited to Hydrologists GIS specialists Waterresource management specialists) and Financial statement for the last 3 years. 5. The criteria forshort listing of the Consulting firms shall be as follows:  The firm should have been in consulting business for at least 10years.  The firms shall be financially sound with an average annual turnover of morethan US$ 750000 (INR 3 75 00000) during the previous five years.  The firms should have successfully completed at least two similar studies of comparable magnitude in flood forecast and inundation modelingand sub criteria inter alia (cost of study duration and man months for key personnel used in the previous assignments inIndia or other Asian countries experiencing frequent floods etc ) during the previous five years .  Availability of skills among keystaff (Flood Forecast/Inundation modelerHydrologist GIS/Remote Sensing and Database specialist etc.). 6. The consultant may associate with other firms to enhancetheir qualification. [The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of asub-consultancy] and this should be stated clearly in the submission. 7. A consultant will be selected inaccordance with Quality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) procedures set out in theWorld Banks "Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants Under IBRD Loansand IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers- January 2011". The Guidelines are available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 8. Interested Consultants may obtain further information at the address given below from 10.00 ? 17.00 hours (IST)on all working days. This notice for Expression of Interest has also been posted on UPID website http://irrigation.up.nic.in. 9. Expression of Interest with allrelevant information and documents must be submitted and subscribed "Expression of Interestfor the Development of a Flood Forecast and Inundation Mapping Model for Rapti RiverBasin in Uttar Pradesh State" on top of a closed envelope and be delivered to the address below bynot later than 15:00 hours(IST) on February 26 2013. In the event this last date being declared as holiday by the State Government due date for submissionof above EoI will be the next working day up till the same appointedtime. Senior Staff Officer (SWARA) State Water Resources Agency (SWARA) WALMI Building Utretia Lucknow 226025 Uttar Pradesh India Phone: 91 522 2443973 Telefax: 91 522 2440863 E-mail: anilvidy@gmail.com

column18: Technology DevelopmentBoard Department of Science& Technology Government ofIndia Expressions of interest for Project Management Unitfor the Facility for Low Carbon Technology Deployment (FLCTD) Project The Technology Development Board (TDB)Department of Science & Technology Government of India with the help of World Bank intends tocreate a Facility for Low CarbonTechnology Deployment (FLCTD) which will aim at promoting and adopting increasing use of new technologies which shall require lowerconsumption of Energy to deliver required performance especially in the three focus areas: a) Industrial Low-gradeWaste HeatRecovery; (b) Pumping; and (c) Heat transfer in HVAC coldstorage etc. The TDB seeks Expression of Interest (EOI)from eligible Agencies/ Firms/ Consortium Groups/ Parties to indicate their interest to act as Project Management Unit (PMU) forthe Facility for Low Carbon Technology Deployment (FLCTD). As this project is being implemented with thehelp of World Bank procurement of contracts financed by the World Bank will be conducted through the procedures as specified inthe World Banks Guidelines: Procurementunder IBRD Loans and IDA Credits (current edition) and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in the guidelines. Consultingservices will be selected in accordance with the WorldBanks Guidelines: Selection and Employmentof Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (current edition) and also the World Banks policy on conflict ofinterest. Terms of Reference (ToR) containing thesalient features of the Project eligibility criteria for the selection of PMU and Application Form for submission to this EOI canbe accessed at the website of Department of Science and Technology at www.dst.gov.in. The interested Agencies/ Firms/ Consortium Groups/ Parties arerequested to submit their Expression of Interest in the prescribed application form on or before21 st March 2014 by 17:00 Hrs. at the address mentioned below: Director Technology Development Board Wing-A Ground Floor Vishwakarma Bhawan Shaheed Jeet Singh Marg New Delhi- 110016 Ph.: 011-26535049 / 26540115 Email: niraj.kela@gmail.com

column4: Selection Of Media Consultant For Development And Implementation Of Communication Strategy For Thdc India Limited
column12: Pragati Bhawan Bypass Road Pragatipuram
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONSOF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ?FIRMS SELECTION) INDIA VISHNUGAD PIPALKOTI HYDROELECTRC PROJECT Loan No.: 8078 IN Assignment Title:Expression of Interest (EOI) for Selection of Media Consultant for Development andImplementation of Communication Strategy for THDC India Limited. Reference No:THDC/RKSH/CC-312 THDC India Limited (THDCIL) is a Mini Ratna Company under theMinistry of Power with a growing portfolio of power generation projects in India and abroad. Since the commissioning of its firstProject the 1000 MW Tehri Dam & Hydro Power Plant in 2006-07 THDCIL has been a profit making organization withanticipatedTurnover & PAT for 2011-12 at 1934 Cr. and 574 Cr.respectively. THDCIL has received financingfrom the World Bank forimplementing the 444 MW Vishnugad Pipalkoti Hydro Electric Project on River Alaknanda and intends to apply part of the proceeds forsecuring consulting services in a few areas key to its corporate development strategy. One of these include hiring the services ofa professional well ? established communications / public relations agency to (i) help develop a Communication Strategy for THDCILand (ii) provide initial Implementation Support to THDCIL for the same. The two phased consultancy is expected to be carried outover a period of approximately 24 months. The work will include conducting a diagnostic study of theexisting public perceptions vis a vis THDCIL among various stakeholder groups and their communications needs. Based on the findingsof this diagnostic Communications Needs Assessment the Consultant is expected to draw up a communication strategy which wouldinter-alia include an effective mix of mass communications general and targeted advocacy media engagement etc. In the second andfinal phase the consultant will provide strategic communication support to THDCIL for 18 months in implementing the agreedcommunication strategy. THDCIL invites eligible firms/ agencies ("consultants") toindicate their interest in providing theservices outlined above. The short-listing of agencies will be based on demonstratedprofessional skills and staff experience with implementing similar assignments and the financial profile of theagency/firm. Interested consultants should provide informationdemonstrating that they have therequired qualifications and relevantexperience to perform the services (brochures description of similarassignments experience insimilar conditions availability of appropriate skills among staff etc.). Consultants are encouraged to associate with other firmsin the form of a joint venture or a sub consultancy to enhance their qualifications. A consultant will be selectedin accordance with the proceduresset out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (current edition) and onthe basis of the Quality- and Cost ? Based selection (QCBS) method. Detailed Terms of Reference (TOR) is available inwebsites www.thdc.gov.in & www.eprocure.gov.in Further information can be obtained at the address below duringoffice hours (from 10:00 to 16:00). Expressions of interest must be delivered in a written form tothe address below by 02.01.2013 and clearly marked "Expression of Interest (EOI) for selection ofMediaConsultant for Development and Implementation of Communication Strategy for THDC India Limited". THDC India Limited Attn: N.T.Ravindran Addl. General Manager (Contracts) Pragati Bhawan Bypass RoadPragatipuram Rishikesh- 249201 Uttarakhand (India) Tele: 91-135-2430721/ 2473210. Fax ? 91-135- 2438379 / 2436592 E-mail: corpcontract@thdc.gov.in Website : http://thdc.gov.in

(A MINI RATANACOMPANY) SPECIFIC PROCUREMENT NOTICE Re-Invitation for Prequalification ?INDIA VISHNUGAD PIPALKOTI HYDRO- ELECTRIC PROJECT EPC PACKAGE FOR ELECTRO - MECHANICAL EQUIPMENT WORKS LOAN NO. : 8078-IN This invitation for prequalification follows the general procurement notice for this projectthatappeared on January 05 2007in DevelopmentBusiness online. THDC INDIA LIMITED intends to executeVishnugad Pipalkoti Hydro Electric Project (4X111MW) in the state of Uttarakhand India. International Bank for Reconstruction andDevelopment (IBRD) has approved the loan of US $ 648 million( US DollorSix Hundred and Forty Eight Million) towards the cost ofthe project and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan to payments under the contract for Engineering Procurement and Construction (EPC) forElectro-Mechanical Equipment Works. The scope of work of this EPC Package is as under: EPC contract coveringall Electro - Mechanical Equipmentworks. Electro- Mechanical equipment Works:- i. Electro - Mechanical works- Design manufacture testing before dispatch supply transportation insurance storage andpreservation security erection testing and commissioning of all Electro-Mechanical equipment and coordination among varioussuppliers for supply of the items and its erection including but not limited to 04 nos. Generating Units including Francis Turbineseach of 111MW & Generators; Single phase 40 MVA 420 kV transformers; 420 kVGas Insulated Switchgear Computerized control& Monitoring system Spherical Valves Butterfly Valves and 420 kV XLPE Cables etc. on an EPC basis. ii. Assistance in Successfuloperation ofplant for 6 months. THDC INDIA LIMITED (THDCIL) intends topre-qualify contractors and / or firms for the above EPC Package. it is expected that invitations for bid will be made in June/July2012. column4: Skill Gap Analysis And Initial Diagnostic For Capacity Building And Institutional Strengthening (cbis) To Thdc India Limited
column12: Pragati Bhawan Bypass Road Pragatipuram
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) INDIA VISHNUGAD PIPALKOTI HYDRO ELECTRICPROJECT Loan No.: 8078 IN Assignment Title: Skill Gap Analysis andInitial Diagnostic for Capacity Building and Institutional Strengthening (CBIS) to THDC India Limited Reference No. : THDC/RKSH/CC-299A THDC India Limited (THDCIL) a Central Public SectorOrganization under the Ministry ofPower has received financingfrom the World Bank toward the cost of the Vishnugad Pipalkoti Hydro Electric Project (444 MW) and intends to apply part of theproceeds for consulting services. The services include assistance to THDCIL in implementing the Capacity Building and InstitutionalStrengthening Component of the Project to be carried out in three phases over a two-yearperiod. The consulting services ("the Services") include technical assistance toTHDCIL to improveits institutional capacity in the context of the expansion of its role in a dynamic business environment to effectively implementand develop hydro power projects across the globe in an economic environmentally and socially sustainable manner and to expandinto other areas of power generation where appropriate. The "Skill Gap Analysis and Initial Diagnostic for Capacity Building and Institutional Strengthening" assignment will also help in benchmarkingTHDCIL with other key national and international hydropower developers on different parameters. The study will also sensitize the management of THDCIL to the challenges that may exist in various functionalareas with special emphasis on human resources and energize the organization across all the levels to take up new challenges thatarise in connection with the changing profile of the utility. Broadly the work will include Review of the Vision andMission of the company benchmarking process review organization structure human resources planning including manpower planningsuccession planning key HR policies etc. Based on the above findings the Consultantis expected to critically review the Skill Gap Analysis carried by THDCIL and draw up a detailed training and skill developmentplan for the Organization. In the final phase the Consultant will assist THDCIL inthe implementation of the plans developed. THDCIL now invites eligible consulting firms ("Consultants") to indicatetheir interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultants should provide information demonstrating that they have therequired qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services. The shortlisting criteria are: extensive experience inmanagement consulting; International Hydropower utility experience with Management consultant arm or in consortium with amanagement consultant/ Hydropower consulting in an international context; engineering and power sector. Interested consultants must provideinformation indicating that they are qualified to perform the services (brochures descriptionof similar assignments experience insimilar conditions including experience outside India availability of appropriate skills among staff etc.). The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of theWorld Banks "Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by World Bank Borrowers" dated May 2004 revised October 2006 and May 2010("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policy on conflict of interest. Consultants are encouraged to associate with other firms in the form of ajoint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications. Firms who had participated in the earlier EOI may resubmit applications withadditional information and with suitable tie up if anyin pursuant to the short listing criteria broadly mentioned in theREOI. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the Quality-and-Cost-Based method set out in theConsultant Guidelines. Detailed Terms of Reference (TOR) is available in websites www.thdc.gov.in & www.eprocure.gov.in Further information can be obtained at the address below during office hours (from 10:00 to16:00). Expressions of interest must be delivered in a written form to the addressbelow (in person or by mail or by fax or by e-mail) by 15.01.2013 and clearly marked "Expression of Interest for Consultancy Servicesfor Skill Gap Analysis and Initial Diagnostic for Capacity Building andInstitutional Strengthening (CBIS) to THDC India Limited". THDC India Limited Attn: N. T. Ravindran Additional General Manager(Contracts) Pragati Bhawan Bypass Road Pragatipuram Rishikesh- 249201 Uttarakhand (India) Tel ?91-135 ? 2430721 / 2473210 Fax ?91-135- 2438379 / 2436592. E-mail: thdccontract_cbis@yahoo.in

Project ID: P107649 Notification No: KSHIP-II:Annuity:IE:2011-12/ Date:??????. Request for Expression of Interest For Appointment of Independent Engineer(s) for four numbers of DBFOMTannuity contracts under KSHIP- II withWorld Bank Loan Assistance The Government of Karnataka (GOK) has received a loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank)for an amount of US$350 million towards the cost of improvement of existing State Highways under Karnataka State HighwaysImprovement Project-II (KSHIP-II) and intends to apply a portion of the proceeds of this loan to the eligible payments under thecontract for which this Request for Expression of Interest is being issued. The Chief Project officer Project Implementation Unit Karnataka State Highways Improvement Project now invites expressions ofinterest for "Appointment of four Independent Engineer(s) for each of four projects being taken up under Design Build FinanceOperate Maintain and Transfer (DBFOMT) on Annuity basis. Pre-qualification ofconcessionaires is under progress. It is expected to sign the concession agreements by April-2012 following acompetitive bidding process. The Government of Karnatakaintends to appoint Independent Engineer for each of the 4 contract packages for the period of construction of the respectivepackage and part of operation period. The services of Independent Engineer(s) are expected to commence from July-Aug 2012. TheIndependent Engineer(s) will be selected as per the "World Bank Procurement Guidelines Selection and Employment of Consultants ? January 2011". Brief details of the packagesare as below: Project Code Project Name Length in Km Concession Period Estimated duration of service of the IE* WAP 1 Design Build Finance Operate Maintain and Transfer of the existing state highway (SH33 & SH3)from Malavalli to Pavagada on DBFOMT (Annuity) Basis in the state of Karnataka. 190.356 10 Years (including 30 months construction period) 42 months WAP 2 Design Build Finance Operate Maintain and Transfer of the existing state highway (SH18) from Mudholto Maharashtra Border on DBFOMT (Annuity) Basis in the state of Karnataka. 107.937 10 Years (including 24 months construction period) 36 months WAP 3 Design Build Finance Operate Maintain and Transfer of the existing state highway (SH1 & SH57)from Shikarapura to Anandapuram (NH 206) and Shimoga to Hangal DBFOMT (Annuity) Basis in the state of Karnataka. 153.667 10 Years (including 30 months of construction period) 42 months WAP 4 Design Build Finance Operate Maintain and Transfer of the existing state highway (SH61) fromManagulli to Devapur on DBFOMT (Annuity) Basis in the state of Karnataka. 109.953 10 Years (including 24 months of construction period) 36 months * 3 months in development period + construction period + 9 months in O&M period. The Independent Engineer (IE) s duties andfunctions shall include but not be limited to review of designsprepared by the Concessionaire including drawings and specifications superintendence of the Concessionaires performanceunder theConcession Agreement progress monitoring technical and quality control evaluations of construction certification and completionof the works by the Concessionaire  certification ofpayments and duties related to taking over and theoperation and maintenance period. The IE shall be present at all times duringthe day-to-day implementation of the Design and ConstructionPeriods and as required for the fulfillment of its assignment duringthe Operation and Maintenance Period. The scope of services will be more detailed in the RFP document which will be issued to theshortlisted consultant s . Interested consultants must provideinformation indicating that they are qualified to discharge the said services (brochures description of similar assignmentsexperience in similar conditions availability of appropriate skills among staff etc.). The information shall include details ofcompleted or ongoing services to any public and private entities. The EOI also shouldinclude a briefpresentation of the enterprise(s) including number of staff turnover years in business Firm/Company Contact information (full name and address country telephone and fax numbers e-mail addresswebsite); Contact Person Information (name designation address for communication e-mail address telephone number FAXnumber). The Consultants may form Joint Venture s with other firms to enhancetheir qualifications to be shortlisted for one or multipleprojects. The authority will make four shortlistsconsisting of not more than six consultants in each project. Howevert he Authority reserves the right to limit the award of not morethan one project to any shortlisted firm or joint venture of firms . Interested Consultants may obtain further information if requiredat the address given below during office hours onworking days. Further details on the project can be accessed by prospective consultants on our website www.kship.org. Submission of EOImust be in sealed envelopes clearly marked " Expression of interest for Appointment of Independent Engineer(s) for four numberof DBFOMT annuity contracts being taken up under KSHIP II" and delivered to the address given below by 17:30 hours (localtime)on or before 15 th Feb 2012. The Chief Project Officer Project Implementation unit Karnataka State Highways Improvement Project 1st Floor PWD Annex Building K.R.Circle Bangalore-560001 Karnataka India. Tel.: + 91 80 2212 6758/59/61 22226262 / 22230510 Fax: + 91 80 2222 9666/22230510 e-mail: piukship@gmail.com sd/- Chief Project Officer PIU KSHIP Bangalore

column18: GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE INDIA KARNATAKA URBAN WATER SUPPLY MODERNIZATION PROJECT(KUWSMP) WATER SECTOR GENERAL PROCUREMENTNOTICE The Government of India has applied for financing in the amount of US$ 190 million equivalentfrom the World Bank toward the cost of the KARNATAKA URBAN WATER SUPPLY MODERNIZATIONPROJECT and it intends to apply part of the proceeds to payments for goods works related services and consulting services tobe procured under this project. KUWSMP will support the Government of Karnataka(GoK) and all the three participating ULBs to achieve the project development objective to "Improve water service quality to acontinuous supply (24x7) across the three project cities of Hubli-Dharwad Belgaum and Gulbarga in the state of Karnataka throughthe establishment of institutionally and financially sustainable service delivery arrangements at ULB level". The project will beimplemented on behalf of GoK by the KUIDFC. The key project activities include financing goods and services to improve water supplysystems in these three cities to 24X7 by investing in improved capacity to meet water demand reduced non-revenue water networkexpansion setting up of city level water institutions (SPV) and hiring an operator to strengthen and manage the systems for alonger duration. The operator will also strengthen the city level institutions. The project will support the state in strengtheningthe urban water sector. The World Bank will finance about 70% of total project cost. The projectis expected to be implemented forover 6 years. The project will include the following procurements Works relating to production (raw water supply and treatment)transmission facilities and distribution system. Goods relating to production (raw water supply andtreatment) transmission facilities and distribution system. Consulting services Services of Operator(s) for Cost effective and sustainable upscalingof Continuous (24x7)Pressured Water Supply which also include studying existing systems designs developing methodology to scaling up servicesprocurement of contractors for capex and its implementation supervision and Operation and Management of systems developed todeliver desired service levels in Belgaum Gulbarga and Hubli-Dharwad cities of Karnataka India. Procurement of contracts financed by the World Bankwill be conducted through the procedures as specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDACredits (January 2011) and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in the guidelines.Consulting serviceswill be selected in accordance with the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by World Bank Borrowers (January 2011). Specific procurement notices for contracts to be bid under the World Banksinternational competitive bidding (ICB) procedures and for contracts for consultancy services will be announced as they becomeavailable in UN DevelopmentBusiness and WorldBank External Website. Prequalification of Operators will be required forthe following contracts: a) "Services of Operator(s) forCost-effective and sustainable upscaling of Continuous (24x7) Pressured Water Supply its Operation and Management in Belgaum cityof Karnataka India". b)"Services of Operator(s) for Cost-effective andsustainable upscalingof Continuous (24x7) Pressured Water Supply its Operation and Management in Gulbarga city of KarnatakaIndia". c) "Services of Operator(s) forCost-effective and sustainable upscaling of Continuous (24x7) Pressured Water Supply its Operation and Management in Hubli-Dharwad city of Karnataka India". Interested eligible bidders who wish to be included on the mailinglist to receive invitations under ICB procedures and interested consultants who wish to receive a copy of advertisement requestingexpressions of interest for consultancy contracts or those requiring additional information should contact the addressbelow. The ManagingDirector Karnataka UrbanInfrastructure Development and FinanceCorporation Ltd. 2nd Floor SilverJubilee Block Unity Building Annexe 3rd Cross MissionRoad Bangalore ? 560027. India. column18: Karnataka State Highways Improvement Project-II Public Works Ports and Inland WaterTransport Department Government of Karnataka India Project ID:P107649 No.KSHIP: Road Data Collection/12-13/2405 Date:19.11.2012 Request for Expressions ofInterest Consulting Services for Collection ofNon-CRN Road Condition Data for population and operationalisation of Road Information System andPavement Management System The Government ofKarnataka (GoK) has received loan from the International Bank for Reconstructionand Development (IBRD) for an amount of US$350 million towards the cost of the Karnataka State Highways Improvement Project-II(KSHIP-II) aimed at improving the states major road infrastructure and the institutional capacities available to the GoK formanagement of the roads sector. The new KSHIP-II will be managed primarilyby theGoK Public Works Ports and Inland Water Transport Department (PWP&IWT Department) through its Project Implementation Unit(PIU). The project includes an InstitutionalDevelopment and Strengthening component that seeks to facilitate reform of the PWP&IWT Department through implementation of anInstitutional Development and Strengthening Action Plan (IDSAP).The IDSAP includes actions to restructure the department and torevise its operating procedures to conform to modern quality management principles. In that context the Government of Karnatakaintends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan to eligible payments for out-sourcing of network-wide roadcondition datacollection and management services to fully populate and commission the PWD Road Asset Management System to support MaintenanceBudget Planning and Management. The elements of the state road network managed by the Karnataka Public Works Ports & InlandWater Transport Department (hereafter referred to as KPWD and/or the PWD and/or the Department) are outlined in the followingtable. CATEGORY Length inkm NATIONAL HIGHWAYS(NH) 4490.71 STATE HIGHWAYS (SH) 20769.78 MAJOR DISTRICT ROADS(MDR) 49958.93 TOTAL MANAGED BY PWD 75219.42 Within the overall road network the Government of Karnataka has identified an initial Core RoadNetwork (CRN) of approximately 25000 km. This CRN encompasses the road links considered most important for the economic and socialdevelopment of the State. The CRN comprises a mix of National Highways (NH) State Highways (SH) Major District Roads (MDRs) andothers. The CRN will be extended over time toinclude more roads as existing roads are brought up to standard. The PWD has established a Planning and Road Asset Management Centre (PRAMC). The PRAMC will institutionalize the overall Road Asset Management System in PWD for CRN Roads. The data required for the RoadAsset Management System (RAMS) for CRN roads (approximately 25000 km) will be collected by the PRAMC Consultants. For the remaining non-core network of SH and MDR (approximately 50000 km under PWDcontrol) the PWDcurrently uses simplified processes and procedures for data collection planning and programming of road works.The PRAMC Consultant shall review these processes and procedures in relation to the non-Core network and make recommendations forimprovement. The Department requires the services of a qualified and suitable Consultant(s) to conduct a RoadCondition Survey for the non CRN Roads for an approximate length of 50000 kms and incorporate the resulting data in the RoadInformation System established for the Non-CRN Roads. The servicesshall include thefollowing tasks.  Identify the features and types of measurements or observations needed toestablish a complete inventory of allmaintainable roadway assets of the Department and their condition.  Conduct office and field training in data collection procedures for road maintenance personnel who will carryout thetask of data updation after the completion of the assignment by the consultants.  Collect measurements and observations in the field and record the data.  Collect data that currently exists in office records.  Establish a database to maintain the data in a readily retrievable format.  Provide reporting tools to summarize data on existing roadway assets.  Establish and follow procedures for keeping the inventory data up-to-date.  Toenforce appropriate and industry standard data collection procedures.  Toensure appropriate calibration validation and quality procedures are followed.  Toestablish a road and pavement condition database to use with Road Information System.  Toestablish state-level industry standard systems and processes for pavement inventory and condition data.  Tomonitor network condition status. The Project Implementation Unit (PIU) KSHIP now invites eligible Consultants/Agencies to submitan Expression of Interest (EOI) for the provision of these services. The firms shallsubmit the proposal along with the following proposals. 1. Qualification of the firm to discharge the said services. 2. Similar completed or ongoing services rendered. 3. Services rendered to Government organizations. 4. Consultant Firms financial situation including fee income of last fivecompleted financial years 5. Availability of Key Professionals with the firm. Consultants may associate as joint venture to enhance their qualifications which shall be supported by a written commitmentfrom the associates. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the World Bank Guidelines:Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers latest version of January 2011 based on Quality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) criterion. It is anticipated that requestsfor proposals will be issued in the month of February 2012. InterestedConsultants may obtain further information if required at the address given below from 10.30 to 17.30 hours on workingdays. The organization details can be accessed on our website www.kpwd.gov.in & www.kship.org by the prospective consultants. Submission of EOI must be in hard form in sealed envelopes 5 copies clearly marked"Expressions of Interest for Consultancy Services for Collection of Non-CRN Road Condition Data for population andOperationalisation of Road Information System and Pavement Management System" and delivered to the address given below by 1600hours (local time) on or before 26.12.2012. The Project Director Project Implementation Unit Karnataka State Highways Improvement Project 1 st Floor PWD Annexe Building K.R. Circle Bangalore ? 560 001 Karnataka India. Tel: +91 80 22126758-61 Fax: + 91 80 2222 9666 E-mail: piukship@gmail.com -Sd/- Project Director PIUKSHIP

column18: Karnataka State Highways ImprovementProject-II Public Works Ports and Inland Water TransportDepartment Government of Karnataka India Project ID: P107649 No.KSHIP: ISO:9001/11-12/4861 Date: 15-02-2012 Request for Expressions of Interest Consulting Services for Implementation ofInternational Standards of Quality Management System 9001 to Public Works Ports and Inland water TransportDepartment The Government ofKarnataka (GoK) has received loan from the International Bank for Reconstructionand Development (IBRD) for an amount of US $350 million towards the cost of the Karnataka State Highways Improvement Project-II(KSHIP-II) aimed at improving thestates major road infrastructure and the institutional capacities available to the GoK formanagement of the roads sector. The new KSHIP-II will be managed primarily by the GoKPublic Works Ports and Inland Water Transport Department (PWP&IWT Department) through itsProject Implementation Unit(PIU). The project includes an InstitutionalDevelopment and Strengthening component that seeks to facilitate reform of the PWP&IWT Departmentthrough implementation of anInstitutional Development and Strengthening Action Plan (IDSAP).The IDSAP includes actions to restructure the department and torevise its operating procedures to conform to modernquality management principles. In that context the GoK intends to apply part of the proceeds of the IBRD loan topayments for consulting services required to assist the GoK PWP&IWT Department to obtain certification for ISO 9001-2008. Consequently a consultant was selected for preparation of the manualsand training thePWP&IWT Department Engineers. The assignment wascompleted. The selected 21 offices of the PWP&IWT Department are presentlycertified for ISO 9001:2008. Presently Government of Karnataka through KSHIP intends to seek the certification for QualityManagement System ISO 9001-2008 to the remaining 60 PWP&IWT Department offices by revising the current manualscapacitybuilding and training the Department Engineers. The Department has 7 Zones namely Communication and Buildings (C&B) South Zone(C&B) North Zone and National Highways KarnatakaRoad Development Corporation Limited Karnataka State Highways ImprovementProject Sustainable Coastal Protection Works and Ports Zone. First three Zones are headed by Chief Engineers fourth by ManagingDirector fifth by Chief Project Officer sixth by Project Director and the last by Director. The specific objectives of this service are to: Assess the current Quality Management System in operation inthe PWP&IWT Department; and Assist the PWP&IWT Department to achieve ISO 9001:2008registration at remaining 60 offices through preparation of documentation training and undertaking an initial complete internalaudit at all the offices. The Project Implementation Unit (PIU) KSHIP now invites eligible Consultants/Agencies tosubmit an Expression of Interest (EOI) for the provision of these services. The firms willbe short-listed based on the following criteria: Qualification of the firm to discharge the saidservices. Similar completed or ongoing Advisory servicesrendered. Services rendered to Government organizations. Consultant Firmsfinancial situation including fee income of last five completed financial years Availability of Key Professionals with thefirm. Consultants may associate as joint venture to enhance their qualifications which shall be supported by a writtencommitment from the associates. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the World Bank Guidelines:Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers latest version of January 2011 based on Quality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) criterion. It is anticipated that requestsfor proposals will be issued in the month of May 2012. Interested Consultants may obtain further information ifrequired at the address given below from 10.30 to 17.30 hours on working days. The organization details can be accessed on our website www.kpwd.gov.in & www.kship.org by the prospective consultants. Submission of EOI must be in hard form insealed envelopes 5 copies clearly marked "Expressions of Interest for Consultancy Services forImplementation of InternationalStandards of Quality Management System to Public Works Ports and Inland water Transport Department" and delivered to the addressgiven below by 1600 hours (local time) on or before 15.03.2012. The Project Director Project Implementation Unit Karnataka State Highways Improvement Project 1 st Floor PWD Annexe Building K.R. Circle Bangalore ? 560 001 Karnataka India. Tel: +91 80 22126758-61 Fax: + 91 80 2222 9666 E-mail: piukship@gmail.com Sd/- Project Director PIUKSHIP

column18: No. KSHIP:QM-QC/2013-14/3914 Date:18.01.2014 Bangalore Request for Expressions of Interest India Karnataka State HighwaysImprovement Project-II Public Works Ports &Inland Water Transport Department Government ofKarnataka ProjectID:P107649 Consultancy Services for Quality Management and Quality Control - Capacity Enhancement in Karnataka Public Works Ports & Inland Water TransportDepartment Reference No. 9 The Government of Karnatakathrough the Government of India has received financing from the World Bank towards the cost of the Second Karnataka State HighwaysImprovement Project (KSHIP-II) and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consultingservices (" the Services") for Quality Management and Quality Control - Capacity Enhancement in Karnataka Public Works Ports& Inland Water Transport Department (KPWP&IWTD). The KPWP&IWTD(Department) is having three zonal offices Two at Bangalore (One each for NH & PWD) and one at Dharwad headed by ChiefEngineers. There are subordinate Superintending Engineers (SEs) each of whom is responsible for different functional units whocontrol some administrative and technical responsibility including Registration of Contractors. The National Highway wings of theState looks after the construction and maintenance of theNational Highways. Quality Control Circles of KPWP&IWTD look after thequality Control functions. The Karnataka Road Development Corporation Ltd. (KRDCL) and Karnataka State Highways ImprovementProject (KSHIP) look after the external aided and projects on PPP. The overall objective andscope of therequired services are as follows. The overall objective isachieving effective and sustainable KPWP&IWTD capacity for performance of theQuality processes required to ensure conformanceof works and resulting assets with applicable requirements. This shall include advising onand facilitating QM/QC planningassisting in staff training on-the-job guidance and support providing supervision monitoring and reviewof selected QCactivities and establishing/updating policy and technical documentation and user manuals for the KPWP&IWTDs various QM/QCrequirements. The scope of the services shall include but not be limited to the following: - Study the As Is operation and existing processes in QM/ Quality Control & Quality Monitoring in the KPWP&IWTD. - Undertake an off-site review of functions ofsimilarorganization(s). - Develop a detailed 5 year Strategy and Implementation Plan for strengtheningof QM/ Quality Control functions and operations in the KPWP&IWTD. - Finalize plans for distribution and accessibility of QC equipment and othernecessary infrastructure in and between KPWP&IWTD offices and units. - Assist the Department in acceptance and deployment of QC Equipments being acquired by the KPWP&IWTD underKSHIP-II. - Develop plans for staff training change-management and capacity-buildingwithin the Department in alignment with the commissioning of new system(s) equipment and facilities and impart various specifictrainings identified as necessary and appropriate. - Prepare necessary policy technical and user-support documentation and manualsfor QM and QC responsibilities and operations. - Assist the department for a period of approximately 14 months in the use ofthe equipments as per the new / updated QM and QC policies operatingprocedures and manual(s). - Work with and develop sustainable capacity inthe KPWP&IWTD Quality ControlWing for its responsibilities as the lead unit in QM/QC functions and operations in the Department. The Project ImplementationUnit (PIU) KSHIP now invites eligible Consultants/ firms to submit an Expression of Interest (EOI) for the provision of theseservices. The firms will be short-listed based on the following criteria: 1. Qualification of the firm to discharge the said services like ISOcertification etc. 2. Similar completed and or ongoing services rendered in the past five years. 3. Services rendered to Government organizations. 4. Firms Financial Standing: Audited Income Tax Statements of the last fiveyears. 5. Availability of key professional staff with thefirm. Consultants may associate aswith other firms in the form of joint venture or a sub consultancy to enhancetheir qualifications which shall be supported by awritten commitmentfrom the associates. A consultant will beselected in accordance with the World Bank guidelines: Selection and employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers latestversion of January 2011 based on Quality and Cost Based Selections (QCBS) criterion. Interested consultants mayobtain further information if required at the address given below from 10.00 to 17.30 hours on workingdays. The organization details can beaccessed on our website www.kpwd.gov.in & www.kship.org by the prospectiveconsultants. Submission of EOI must be inhard form in sealed envelopes 5 copies clearly marked "Expressions of interest for Consultancy Services for Quality Managementand Quality Control Capacity Enhancement in KPWP&IWT Department"and delivered to theaddress given below by 1600 hours (localtime) on or before 24.02.2014 The ProjectDirector Project ImplementationUnit Karnataka State Highways ImprovementProject 1 st Floor PWD Annex Building K.R.Circle Bangalore- 560001 Karnataka India Tel: + 91 8022126758-61 Fax: + 91 80 22229666 E-mail: piukship@gmail.com Sd/-Project DirectorPIU KSHIP.Bangalore

column18: INDIA-COASTAL DISASTER RISK REDUTION PROJECT (CDRRP) GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE Project ID : P143382 This General Procurement Notice [GPN] is for the Tamil Nadu Component of the Coastal Disaster Risk Reduction Project. Theproject is implemented by the State of Tamil Nadu and the Union Territory of Puducherry and the GPN forPuducherry Component of the Project was published on UNDB Online on March 25 2013. The Government of Tamil Nadu has applied for financing in the amount of US $272.40 million equivalent from the World Bank towardthe cost of the Coastal Disaster Risk Reduction Project [CDRRP] and it intends to apply part of the proceeds to payments forgoods works relatedservices and consulting services to be procured under this project. The project will include thefollowing components : Vulnerability Reduction: ? Construction of multi-hazard resistant permanent houses[ongoing] ? Evacuation routes with signages [on going] ? Construction of multipurpose evacuation shelters [partly ongoing] ? Provision of 439 Early warning systems[ICB bids under finalization] ? Resilient electrical net worki.e.replacement of over head electrical lines with under ground cables in Cuddalore Town and part of Nagapattinam Town [newwork] Sustainable Fisheries: ? Fisheries infrastructure works 13 on going and bids to be invited for 4works ? Fisheries new works Fishing harbour at Mallipattinam in Thanjavur Districts and Permanent Stability ofThamiraparani river coastal inlet at Punnakayal in Thoothukudi district ? FIMSUL activities such as Implementation ofMarine fisheries co-management Improved capacities and knowledge management fisheries livelihood support managementsupport ? Providing wireless communication facilities to ensure safety of Tamil Nadu marine fishermen Strengthening Risk Reduction and Response Capacity ? Setting up of Tamil Nadu Disaster Management Agency[TNDMA] ? Setting up of comprehensive GIS platform and GIS cell in TNDMA ? CBDRM curriculum development fordisaster risk reduction in schools andtraining institutes ? ICZMP [on going] ? Implementation support includingengagement of consultancy services for various tasks Procurement of contracts financed by the World Bank will be conducted through the procedures as specified in the World BanksGuidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits [January 2011] and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in theguidelines. Consulting services will be selected in accordance with the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by World Bank Borrowers [January 2011]. Specific procurement notices for contracts to be bid under the World Banks International Competitive Bidding [ICB] proceduresand for contracts for consultancy services will be announced as they become available in UN Development Business and dgMarket andin the English news papers having nationwide circulation in India and in local [Tamil Nadu] newspapers. Prequalification of suppliers and contractors is not provided for any works under this project. Interested eligible bidders who wish to be included in the mailing list to receive invitations to bid under ICB procedures orthose requiring additional information should contact the address below : Mr. Ashish Chatterjee Officer on Special Duty [RR] and Project Director Tsunami Project Management Unit O/o TheAdditional Chief Secretary/Commissioner of Revenue Administration Disaster Management and Mitigation Department 5th FloorEzhilagam Annex Chepauk Chennai 600005 Tamil Nadu INDIA Phone : +91 44 2841 1552/2841 4553 Fax : +91 44 2855 0867/2859 2921 E.mail: tn.relief@gmail.com Website: www.tn.gov.in/tsunami

column18: INTERNATIONAL COMPETITIVE BIDDING (ICB) U.P. SODIC LANDS RECLAMATION III PROJECT Credit no.: 4640 IN Bid Number 04/2011-12 Procurement of Zinc Sulphate with Zinc not less than21% conforming to IS: 8249-1994 with latest amendment or equivalent standard ThisInvitation for Bids follows the General Procurement Notice for this Project that appeared in Development Business on 30 March 2009. The Govt. of India has received a credit from the International DevelopmentAssociation toward the cost of U.P. Sodic Lands Reclamation III Project and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of this credit to payments under the Contract for procurement of Zinc Sulphate. The Managing Director Uttar Pradesh Bhumi Sudhar Nigam now invites sealed bid number 04/2011-12 from eligible and qualified bidders forprocurement of Zinc Sulphate with Zinc notless than 21% conforming to IS: 8249-1994 with latest amendment or equivalent standardin six (06) schedules as per following details. Schedule I (Aligarh Etah Mainpuri) - 73 MT Schedule II (Etawah Ramabai Nagar  Kanpur Nagar) # 83 MT Schedule III (UnnaoFarrukhabad Kannauj Hardoi) # 99 MT Schedule IV (Raebareli Sultanpur Pratapgarh) # 70MT Schedule V (Azamgarh Ghazipur Jaunpur) # 92MT and Schedule VI (Allahabad Bhadoi Fatehpur) # 53 MT. The delivery period - 25-31 October 2011 Qualificationsrequirements include: (a) Experience and Technical Capacity The Bidder should be a manufacturer or producer of Zinc Sulphate TheBidder should be a manufacturer or producer of Zinc Sulphate or duly authorized by manufacturer/producer of Zinc Sulphate. Thebidder should have been in the business of manufacture/produce and sale of Zinc Sulphate for a minimum period of 5 years (2006-07to 2010-11). 2. The annualproduction capacity of the producer or manufacturer should not be less than 146 MT for schedule I 166 MT for schedule II 198 MTfor schedule III 140 MT for schedule IV 184 MT for schedule V 106 MT for scheduleVI.. 3. The Bidder musthave successfully manufactured/produced and supplieda minimum of 219 MT for schedule I 249 MT for schedule II 297 MT for schedule III 210 MT for schedule IV 276 MT for schedule V 159 MT for scheduleVI in anyone oflast five years MT (2006-07 to 2010-11) and a minimum quantity of 73 MT for schedule I 83MT for schedule II 99 MT for schedule III 70 MT for schedule IV 92 MT for schedule V 53 MT for schedule VI in each year of the last three year(2008-09 and 2010-11) .A certificate to this effect from sucha Purchaser should be attached with the bids. Bids for more than one schedule should satisfy the aggregate of the qualifying requirements. The Bidder shall furnish documentary evidence todemonstrate that it meets the following experience requirement(s): (i) Name of purchaser to whom the goods supplied andsatisfactory report from the purchaser (ii) Copy of purchase order. (iii) Authoritative evidence of annual production capacity (iv)evidence of annual supply of Zinc Sulphate for last five years (v) evidence of being manufacturer or producer with documentaryproof with required annual production capacity and supply criteria. The Bidder shall furnish documentary evidence todemonstrate that theGoods it offers meet the following usage requirement: (i) Supporting document who proves quality of ZincSulphate is as per required specification of Zinc Sulphate. (b) Financial Capacity The Bidder shall furnish documentary evidence that itmeets the following financial requirement(s): The bidder must have turnover of minimumRs. 2.30 million multiple thereof each schedule for each year of last two years. Bidding will be conducted through the International Competitive Bidding (ICB)procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDACredits and is open to all bidders from Eligible Source Countries as defined in the Guidelines. Interested eligible bidder may obtain further information from and inspect the biddingdocuments at the office of Managing Director U.P. Bhumi Sudhar Nigam at the addressgiven below from 10.00 AM to 5.00 PM Acomplete set of Bidding Documents in English may be purchased by interested bidders on the submission of a written Application tothe address below and upon payment of a non refundable fee of Rs. 1500/- "(orRs. 1700/- if required within India or Rs. 2000/- ifrequired out of India by courier or an equivalent amount in US dollars or any other convertible currency)" by demand draftin favour of the Managing Director UPBSN or in cash in Indian Rupees. The bidding document shall be made available for sale fromSeptember 6 2011 to October 19 2011. The Schedule of Requirements for all the schedules are contained in a single biddingdocument. Bidders need not purchase more than one document even if they want to bid for more than one schedules. Bidsmust be delivered to the address below at or before October 20 2011 at 3.00 PM.Electronic bidding will not be permitted. Late bids will be rejected. Bids will be opened in the presence of the bidders representatives who choose to attend inperson at the address below at October 20 2011 at3.30 PM. All bids must be accompanied by a bid security of Rs 42000 for Schedule I Rs 48000 for ScheduleII Rs 57000 for Schedule III Rs. 41000 for Schedule IV Rs. 53000 for Schedule V Rs.31000 for Schedule VI or an equivalent amount in a freely convertiblecurrency. 6. Pre bid conference would be held on 26.09.2011 at 3:00 P.M to the addressbelow. 7. The address referred to above is: ManagingDirector U.P. This Invitation for Bids follows the GeneralProcurement Notice for this Project that appeared in Development Business on30 March 2009. 2. The Govt. of India has received a credit from the International DevelopmentAssociation toward the cost of U.P. Sodic Lands Reclamation III Project and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of this credit to payments under the Contract for procurement of Agriculture Grade GypsumPowder 3. The Managing Director Uttar Pradesh Bhumi SudharNigam now invites sealed bids from eligibleand qualified bidders as mentioned in the bidding document for procurement of Agriculture Grade Gypsum Powderwith minimum 70%CaSO4 2H2O fineness of 100% passing through 2 mm and 50% through 0.25 mmsieve conforming to IS : 6046-1982 with latest amendment or equivalent standard in eight (08) schedules as per following details: Schedule I (Aligarh EtahKashganj Mainpuri Ferozabad) - 32500 MT Schedule II (Etawah Auraiya Kanpur Dehat Kanpur Nagar) ? 19500 MT Schedule III (Unnao Hardoi) ? 22700 MT Schedule IV (Farrukhabad Kannuaj) ? 25500 MT Schedule V (Lucknow.Raebareli Amethi) ? 23800 MT Schedule VI (Sultanpur Pratapgarh) ? 18500 MT Schedule VII (Azamgarh Ghazipur Jaunpur) ? 40500 MT and Schedule VIII(Allahabad Sant Ravidas Nagar Fatehpur) ? 15500 MT. Qualification requirement includes: A) For Manufacturer or Producer Bidders (a) Financial Capability The Bidder shall furnishdocumentary evidence that it meets thefollowing financial requirement(s): The bidder must haveturnover of minimum Rupees 50million multiple thereof each schedule for each year of last two years. (b) Experience and Technical Capacity 1. The Bidder should be a manufacturer or producer of Agriculture grade gypsum powder and should have beenin the business of manufacturing or production namely and sale of Agriculture grade gypsum powder for a minimum period of 3 years(2009-10 to 2011-12). If a bidder is only a manufacturer or producer then heshould have legal mining rights or firm tie-up eitherwith mines owner or organization which has mining right. 2. The annual production capacity of the producer or manufacturershould not be less thanthe quantity being asked for each schedule for Agriculture Grade Gypsum quoted for and the manufacturer or producershould havelegal mining rights or firm tie-up either with mines owner or organization which has mining right for corresponding amount. 3. The Bidder must have successfully manufactured or produced andsupplied quantity ofAgriculture grade gypsum powder equivalent to the quantity being asked for respective schedule in anyone year of the last threeyear (2009-10 to 2011-12) and half of the quantity of respective schedule in remaining two year of last three year (2009-10 to2011-12). If bidder apply for more than one schedule the qualification requirement in respect of manufactured or produced andsupplied of Gypsum should be aggregate of respective schedule. A certificate to this effect from such a Purchaser should beattached with the bids. Bids for more than one schedule should satisfy the aggregate of the qualifyingrequirements. The Bidder shall furnishdocumentary evidence to demonstrate that it meets the following experience requirement(s): (i) Name of purchaser to whom the goodssupplied and satisfactory report from the purchaser (ii) Copy of purchase order. (iii) Authoritative evidence of annual production capacity (iv) Evidence of annual supply of Agriculture grade gypsum for last 03yars (v) Evidence ofbeing manufacturer or producer with documentary proof of legal miningright or firm tie up either with minesowner or organization which has mining right with required annual production capacity (c) The Bidder shall furnish documentary evidence todemonstrate that the Goods it offers meet the following usage requirement: (i) Supporting document which prove quality of Gypsum isas per required specification of Agriculture Grade Gypsum Powder. B) For Non-Manufacturer or Non Producer (orDistributors) Bidders Inthe case of a Bidder is offering Gypsum Powder under the Contract that the Bidder does not manufacture or otherwiseproduce the Bidder should be duly authorized by the manufacturer of the product as per authorization Form in Section IV. The Manufacturer of the offered product should meet the qualification requirements listedunder A) above. Inaddition the Bidder must have successfully supplied 25% of the quantity of Agriculture grade gypsum powderequivalent to the quantity being asked for respective schedule in anyone year of the last three year (2009-10 to 2011-12) and thedocumentary evidence wil be submitted with the bid to support the same. If bidder applies for more than one schedule thequalification requirement in respect of Gypsum supplied should be aggregate of respective schedule. 4. Bidding will be conducted through theInternational Competitive Bidding (ICB) procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines:Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits and is open to all bidders from Eligible Source Countries as defined in theGuidelines. 5. Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information from the office of Managing Director and inspect the Bidding Documents at the address given below. 6. Qualifications requirements are indicated in Section III of the biddingdocuments. A margin of preference for eligible national contractors "shall" beapplied as appropriate. Additional details are provided in the Bidding Documents. 7. A complete set of Bidding Documents in English may bepurchased by interested bidders on the submissionof a written Application to the address below and upon payment of a non refundablefee of Rs. 1500/- "(or Rs. 1700/- if required within India or Rs. 2000/- if required out of India by courier or anequivalent amount in US dollars or any other convertible currency)" by demand draft in favour of the Managing Director UPBSN or incash in Indian Rupees. The bidding document shall be made available for sale from 27.10.2012 to 09.12.2012. Bidding document canalso be downloaded on UPBSN website-www.upbsn.org from 27.10.2012 to 09.12.2012 and at the time of submission of bids the price of the bid document (Rs1500/) will required to be paid. The Schedule of Requirementsfor all the schedules are contained in a single bidding document.Bidders need not purchase more than one document even if they want to bidfor more than one schedules. 8. Bids must be delivered to the address below at or before10.12.2012 at 3.00 PM. Electronic bidding will not be permitted. Late bids will be rejected. Bids will be opened in thepresence of the bidders representatives who choose to attend in person at the address below at 10.12.2012 at 3.30 PM. All bids must be accompanied by abid security of Rs 845000 for Schedule I Rs 506000 II Rs 589000 for Schedule III Rs. 662000 for Schedule IV Rs. 618000 for Schedule VRs. 480000 for Schedule VI Rs. 1051000 for Schedule VII and Rs. 402000for Schedule VIII or an equivalent amount in a freely convertible currency. 9. column4: Wbr10-non Consultant Services ?icb Packages Uphssp/cleaning Services/2014-15- Out Sourcing Of Cleaning (housekeeping) And Gardening Services In 40 Government District Hospitals
column12: Department of Medical Health and Family Welfare
column18: Invitationfor Bids (IFB) InternationalCompetitive Bidding (ICB) Contract Identification No: UPHSSP/CLEANING SERVICES/2014 World Bank Credit No:5033-IN 1. The Govt. of India has receiveda credit(Credit No.: 5033-IN) from the International Development Association (IDA)towardsUttar Pradesh Health Systems Strengthening Project and it is intendedthat part of the proceeds of the credit(US$ 152 Million) will be applied to eligible payment under the contract for which thisinvitation of Bid is issued. 2. TheProjectDirector UPHSSP now invites sealed bid for performance based(Clause 6 section V) outsourcing of Hospital Cleaning (Housekeeping)and Gardening Services as per given schedule (Five Clusters consistingof 40 Government District Hospitals (Clause 5 IFB) from eligible Bidder. 3. Bidding will be conductedthrough International Competitive Bidding (ICB) procedures agreed with World Bank and the provisions specified in the World BanksGuidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits. 4. The initial contract periodwill be for one year and renewal for further two years shall be based on satisfactory performance on same terms and conditions withan average increase of cost by 5% every year. 5. The 40 district hospitalsare clustered into 5 schedules as mentioned below in Table no. 1 based on geographical proximity no. of beds case load andestimated project cost per schedule. The following information such as no. of bedsno. of outpatients no. of inpatients and no. of major surgeries for each hospital is mentioned in the table to estimate the volumeand cost of the services required in each hospital. The bidder may quote for oneschedule or more than one schedule. Qualifying Annual Turnover from similar type of services and Bid Security of services is alsoindicated in the table for the schedule for which the bidder is quoting. If the bidderquotes for more than one schedule the amount of annual turnover and Bid Security will be summed up accordingly. However if abidder applies for more than 03 schedules the minimum qualifying turnover shall be taken as Rs.6 crores for allschedules. Table no. 1 Cluster/Schedule No. Name of the Hospital Bedded No. of Outpatients (Year 2012) No. of Inpatients (Year 2012) No. of Major Surgeries (Year 2012) Bid Security (3%) (INR) Qualifying Annual Turnover per schedule (INR) 1 District Hospital (Female) Unnao 60 62219 18695 1525 598500 19950000 Dr.Shyama Prasad Mukherji Hospital Lucknow 324 459286 21333 5443 598500 19950000 District Hospitals (Female) Raebareilly 100 113411 21415 2457 598500 19950000 Veerangna AvantiBai Hospital Lucknow 226 116628 74924 2700 598500 19950000 Balrampur Hospital Lucknow 656 601223 33566 8478 598500 19950000 District Hospital (Female) Hardoi 64 77563 33516 1770 598500 19950000 2 UHMHospital Kanpur 416 330719 18087 5979 540000 18000000 District Hospital (Combined) Kannauj 100 153796 11744 105 540000 18000000 District Hospital (Combined) Etawah 90 232039 12712 1356 540000 18000000 District Hospital (Male) Hamirpur 68 195062 8621 290 540000 18000000 District Hospital (Male) Fatehpur 118 237700 11068 993 540000 18000000 District Hospital (Male) Banda 100 211417 15637 991 540000 18000000 District Hospital (Male) Jhansi 156 429959 18720 10215 540000 18000000 District Hospital (Female) Agra 210 96885 57580 5733 540000 18000000 District Hospital (Male) Mainpuri 86 235850 11191 615 540000 18000000 Pt. Each bidder has to provide prices for all thehospitals separately which arelisted under a specific schedule. The price bids will beevaluated schedule wise. The contract will be awarded to the bidder quoting the lowestprice per schedule. However the lowest bid price will be evaluated onthe basis oftotal cost per month worked out for each cluster schedule on the basis of rates quoted by the bidder X by the indicative areaspecified in the bid. (See Price Activity Schedule Section V for details). The contract with lowest evaluated responsivebidder of the cluster schedule will be signedby the in charge of each hospitals based on actual computed area of the hospital X by the rates of the hospital. 7. Bidders shall meetthe minimum eligibility criteria as mentioned in Clause 4 of Section I and the eligible bidders shall meet the following qualifying criteria (Section II): (a)Experience as prime contractor in the provision of at least two service contracts ofa nature complexity and value equivalent or more than the value of jobsmentioned for schedule/schedules which is/are being appliedfor by the bidder; over the last five years. (b) Experience ofrendering mechanized services of similar nature and complexity for the last five years. (c) Bidder should provideexperience certificate for mechanized cleaning/housekeeping /gardening (or mechanized services) from any reputed institutions/organizations/hospitals where they provided similar services. (d) Bidders musthave experience of rendering similar type of services in rural areasand in countryside areas (e)Bidders must havewell developed MIS system for electronic monitoring andreporting. 8. The Bidders are requestedtovisit the hospitals in the cluster schedule they are quoting to assess the Building space and Gardening Area of each hospital asmentioned in the Bidding Document in Price Activity Schedule. The Project will not bein any case responsible or liable to pay the cost incurred during the assessment of area by the Bidder. However the Employer will notify in advance the respective authorities in district hospitals regarding the visitsof bidders in all 40 hospitals. 9. Bid document can beobtainedfrom the office of the Project Director on any working day between 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM w.e.f. February 25 2014 to April10 2014 on payment of Rs. 3000/- (Rupees Three Thousand Only) (non-refundable) throughDemand Draft from Scheduled Bank drawn infavour of Project Director UPHSSP payable at Lucknow. Bid document will be received up to April 11 2014 @ 3:00 PM & shall not be accepted beyond this time. The bid shall be opened at 3:30 PM on April 11 2014 in the presence of biddersrepresentatives who choose to attend on the specified date and time atProjects office.
