UPHSSP will not be responsible for postal delay if any in the delivery of the document or non-receipt ofthe same. 11. Bid document can also be downloaded from the websitehttp://uphealth.up.nic.in anduphssp.org. However a BankDraft payable at Lucknow of Rs. 3000/- (Rupees Three Thousand Only) (non-refundable) in favour of Project Director UPHSSP towards the fees of each bid document must also be submitted inseparate envelop attached to the submitted bid along with other required documents at the time of bid submission failing which bidwill be rejected. 12. The amount of Bid Security shall be as mentioned in table given above in the form of either a bank guarantee/FDR from anationalized/scheduled bank in favour of Project Director UPHSSP payable at Lucknow UP valid up to 150 days from the date of theBid submission submitted and attached to the bid envelope. 13. column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OFINTEREST FOR Technical AssistanceProvider (CONSULTANCY SERVICES) INDIA Proposed UTTAR PRADESH HEALTH SYSTEMS STRENGTHENINGPROJECT (UPHSSP) Sector: Health Nutrition and Population Project ID No. P100304 The Government of India has applied for a Credit (amounting to US$ 152 Million) from the World Bank towards supporting the proposedUttar Pradesh Health Systems Strengthening Project (UPHSSP) for a period of five years. This project will be implemented byDepartments of Medical Health and Family Welfare Government of Uttar Pradesh India which intends toapply part of the proceedsfor this consultancy services. The services include functioning as Technical AssistanceProvider (TAP) to provide a support team of key expertise in the Project Support Unit (PSU) to ensure that the DG (M&H) and PSUare equipped to deliver on milestones in their respective areas. The underlying key objective is to transfer skills and capacity tothe DG (M&H)-Cells and PSU to implement strengthening and reform program. Typical tasks of theTechnical Assistance Provider(TAP) Support Team will include:  Identification of technical assistance needs inagreement with the Project Coordination Team PSU & Cells.  Provide short term technical inputs on an ongoing basisto support the designing and implementation of project interventions in different area as mentioned in the PIP and achievement ofproject milestones of UPHSSP.  Support the PSU/DG(H&M)/Cells and Government of UPfor strategy development and activity planning ensuring capacity building of the Directorate/PSU/Cells staff itself.  Identification co-ordination and providing support ofnational and international consultants with relevant expertise as required.  Drafting ToR contracting management and qualitycontrol for technical assistance assignments contracted by the TAP/PSU.  Ensuring smooth flow of information between all keystakeholders about the procurement design and contracting of consultant/TAP.  Dissemination ofreports information on best practice and lessons learnt In addition the consultant will also be responsible forthe capacitybuilding of the PSU/Cell of the Directorate for quality improvement in the hospitals of the State. The Government of Uttar Pradesh now invites eligibleFirms/Consortiums to indicate their interest in providing the above services. Firmswilling to participate are required to furnish their particulars including name address e-mail telephone numbers profile ofkeypersons information indicating that they are qualified to perform the services (brochures description of similar assignmentsexperience in similar conditions availability of appropriate skills among staffetc.) Firms may associate with other firms to enhance their qualifications. The initial duration of the contract will be 3 years withannual review and the contract could further be extended up to a period of 2 years. Incase the performance of the consultant is found to be unsatisfactory during the annual review the contract maybe foreclosed. A consultant will be selected in accordance with theprocedures set out in the Words Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (currentedition). Expressions of Interest must be delivered to the addressbelow by 3:30 PM on August 31 2011. The name of the assignment must be mentioned on the envelope containing the expression ofinterest. The Project Director Uttar Pradesh Health Systems Development Project (UPHSDP) TRAINING BLOCK-2 SIHFW CAMPUS SECTOR-C INDIRA NAGAR LUCKNOW - 226 016 (UP) INDIA Email: pd_uphsdp@sify.com Website: www.uphealth.up.nic.in Telephone No and Fax No.: +91-522-2310397

The consultantwill also provide technical support in strengthening procurement systems processes documentations computerization of CMSD andProcurement Supply-Chain Management Capacity of the entities i.e. CMSD/proposed UPMSC of the Medical & Health Directorate andfield units handling the health sector procurement in the state of Uttar Pradesh. The consultant will also be responsible forintroducing e-procurement systems in the Department/Project. The duration of the assignment will be for initially 3 years subjectto satisfactory performance of the consultant which can be extended further as per the Projects need. column4: Selection Of Consulting Firm For Project Management Consultancy (pmc)
column12: SIIDCUL BUILDING29 IIE (IT PARK) SAHASTRADHARA ROAD
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OFINTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMSSELECTION) INDIA Uttarakhand Disaster Recovery Project (UDRP) CreditNo.5313 - IN Reference:GPN dated 21/9/2013 Assignment Title: Selection of Consulting firm for Project Management Consultancy (PMC) SPN Reference No.:UDRP/PMU/PMC/2013/0002 Date: 11 November 2013 The Government of India has applied for financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the UttarakhandDisaster RecoverProject (UDRP) and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consulting services. The consulting services ("the Services) shall broadly include: 1. The objective ofthe proposed consulting servicesis to provide technical and managerial support to the PMU and PIUs in implementing monitoring and management of UDRP activities inthe state of Uttarakhand. In addition the consultants will help PIU/PMU in reviewing physical and financial progress and assist inmeeting with the World Banks compliance requirements and agreed procedures for implementation of the project. 2. The PMC will assist the PMU/PIUs primarily on:  Issues on disaster management including early warning remotesensing assessments etc. as and when required;  Planning and Design issues related to vulnerability reductionand risk mitigation infrastructure;  Social and environmental safeguards issues;  Procurement and contract management aspects;  Designing and supervision of civil works especially roadsbridges and buildings under the PIUs; and  Implementation monitoring. 3. To provide theseservices the PMC will be staffedwith multi-disciplinary experts with in depth knowledge and experience in project management and monitoring particularly with theexternally aided projects such as World Bankfunded projects. Theengagement of the finally selected firms shall be for an initial period of one year with provision of extension. The PMUUttarakhand Disaster Recovery Project (UDRP) now invites eligible consulting firms ("Consultants") to indicate their interest inproviding the Services. Interested Consultants should provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualificationsand relevant experience to perform the Services.The shortlisting criteria are: 1. The firm should have prior working experience in similar geographical conditions; 2. The firm should have at least 2 similar experiences as PMC and preferably one for an EmergencyRecovery Project; 3. The firm should demonstrate that they have enough capacity inhandling civil engineering projects suchas roads bridges and buildings; 4. The firm should have average annual turnover of at least INR 50 million (5 crores) in the last 3years; and 5. Experience with externally aided projects Expressions of interest (EOI) must include:  Introductory letter on letter head (with complete contact details ? name of contactperson mailing address telephone fax email etc ) explaining how the firm is best to deliver the task  Organizationprofile  Three years annual report (Yr 2011Yr 2012 and Yr 2013) and audited Financial statement to meet criteria No. 4above  Short note on the similar projects implemented by the firm pertaining to the shortlisting criteria  The EOI should contain sufficient supporting document to substantiate the claim ofthe Consultant towards theirqualification as per the shortlisting criteria. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants [under IBRD Loans and IDACredits & Grants] by World Bank BorrowersJanuary 2011 ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Banks policy onconflict of interest. Firms (Consultants) may associate with other firms in the form of a joint venture or a sub-consultancyto enhance their qualifications. The submission shouldclearly state the nature of Association (JV or sub-consultant). Firms(Consultants) will be selected in accordance with the standard Quality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS) method set out in theConsultantsguidelines. Furtherinformation can be obtained at the address below during office hours between 1000 hours to 1700 hours. Expression of Interest must be delivered in a written form to the address below (in person or by Post) by 02December 2013 at 1700 hours to: PROJECT MANAGEMENT UNIT The World Bank assisted Uttarakhand Disaster Recovery Project (UDRP) INDIA Attn: Shri.Amit Negi IAS Program Director SIIDCUL BUILDING 29IIE (IT PARK) SAHASTRADHARA ROAD PIN:248001 DEHRADUN ? Uttarakhand INDIA Tel: +91-135-2708100 Fax: +91-135-2708109 email: amitnegi.gov@gmail.com Website:dmmc.uk.gov.in

column18: Government of Bihar Water ResourcesDepartment Flood Management Improvement SupportCentre 2nd Floor Jal Sansadhan Bhawan Anisabad Patna #800002 India: Bihar Flood Management Implementation Support ProjectII Expression of Interest No: FMISC/EoI/03/2010-2011 Dated: 25.03.2011 The Flood ManagementImprovement Support Centre (FMISC) Water Resources Department Govt. of Bihar has received a Grant [DFID Grant No. TF096841]from the International Development Association and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this Grant to payments under the contracts for "Designing Developing and DeployingEmbankment Asset Management System for Bagmati-Adhwara Basin". 1. The objective of thisconsultancy is to prepare a comprehensive Embankment Asset Management System (EAMS) for Bagmati-Adhwara basin supported by detailedmodern river/embankment surveys including visual and scientific inspection of the embankment status in the Bagmati-Adhwara basinthat is partially embanked and where substantial investments fornew embankments are planned. The EAMS would support floodmanagement functions including maintenance and strengthening of existing embankment anti-erosion works and flood fighting worksetc. and planning of new flood control structures. The development of community participation for embankment surveillance and toupdate embankment safety information in the EAMS will be piloted. 2. The Consultancy serviceswill involve: (i) Design and development of Embankment Asset Management System (ii) Preparation of database managementfunctional modules and integration in EAMS (iii) Development of Users Manual Technical Reference and Training and iv)Recommendations for sustainable effective use of EAMS 3. The FMISC inviteseligible Consultants to indicate their interest in providing the Consultancy Services for the above assignment. 4. Interested Consultantsmust provide the following information indicating that they are qualified to perform the Services ( Brochures description ofsimilar assignments availability of skills among staff etc ) 5. Consultants may associateto enhance their qualifications. [The "Association" may take the form of a joint venture (with joint and several liability) or of asub-consultancy]. 6. A consultant will beselected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks "Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants Under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers- January 2011". TheGuidelines are available at www.worldbank.org/procure. 7. Interested Consultantsmay obtain further information at the address given below from 10.00 # 17.00 hours (IST) on all working days. This notice forExpression of Interest has also been posted on websites http://www.fmis.bih.nic.in http://wrd.bih.nic.in http://www.prdbihar.gov.in and http://tenders.bih.nic.in. 8. Expression of Interest with all relevant information and documents must be submitted and subscribed"Expression of Interest for# "Designing Developingand Deploying Embankment Asset Management System for Bagmati-Adhwara Basin" on top of a closedenvelope and be delivered to the address below by not later than 15:00 hours (IST) on Wednesday 11 th May 2011. In event thislast date being declared as holiday by the State Government due date for submission of above EoI will be the next working day uptill the same appointed time. Er. A. K. Samaiyar Joint Director Flood Management Improvement Support Centre 2nd Floor Jal Sansadhan Bhawan Anisabad Patna- 800002. Telefax : +(91)612-2256999 E-mail: fmisc_bihar@yahoo.co.in

column18: SPECIFIC PROCUREMENTNOTICE INVITATION FOR BIDS INDIA TAMILNADU IRRIGATED AGRICULTUREMODERNISATION &WATER-BODIES RESTORATION AND MANAGEMENT PROJECT (TNIAMWARM) Procurement of Computer&Peripherals IBRD LOAN NO. 4846 ?IN IDA CREDIT NO. 4255?IN Contract/BidNo.55/IAMWARM/ICB/WRO/Computers/10-11 This invitationfor bids follows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared in Development Business No. issue no. 695 Vol. 30 of31.01.2007. The Government of India has received a loanfrom the International Bank forReconstruction and Development (IBRD)and a credit from International Development Association (IDA) towardsthe cost of the TamilNadu Irrigated Agriculture Modernization and Water-bodies Restoration and Management Project (TNIAMWARM) and it intends to applypart of the proceeds of this loan/credit to payments under the Contract for (1)procurement of Computer& Peripherals. The MANAGING DIRECTOR ELECTRONICS CORPORATION OF TAMIL NADU LIMITED (ELCOT) CHENNAI 600 035 TAMIL NADU INDIArepresenting The Engineer-in-Chief WRD PWD for and on behalf of The Governor ofTamil Nadu now invites sealed bids from eligible and qualified bidders for the supply and installation of Computers & Peripherals-Desktop-225 Nos Laptop-55Nos Printer B/W-140 Nos PrinterB/W N/W-2 Nos Printer color A3-2 Nos UPS 600VA-209 Nos UPS 5KVA-3 Nos MS office-150 Nos. The delivery and installation to be completed in 120 days after signing of the Agreement at the locationsspecified in the annexure-I of the Bid document. Bidding will be conducted through the International Competitive Bidding (ICB)procedures specified in the World Banks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits January 1995 (revised January and August 1996 September 1997 and January 1999) and is open to all biddersfrom Eligible Source Countries as defined in the Guidelines. Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information from and inspect theBidding Documents at the office of The Managing Director ELCOT at the address below from 11:00 hours to 16:00 hours or downloadedfrom ELCOTs website www.elcot.in or www.tenders.tn.gov.in at free of cost. A complete set ofBidding Documents in English may be purchased by interested bidders on the submissionof a written application to the address below and upon payment of a refundable fee of INR Rs.5000/- (Indian Rupees Five thousandonly) or in a freely convertible currency.The method of payment will be by cash or a bank draft payable at a Scheduled/Nationalized Bank in favour of ELECTRONICSCORPORATION OF TAMIL NADU LIMITED payable at CHENNAI in local currency. The Bidding Documents will be sentby Speed-post or may be collected in person. Bids must be delivered to the address below by 15.00 hrs on 31.03.2014. All bids must be accompanied by a "Bid Security" for an amount of INR Rs.316500 (Rupees Three Lakhs Sixteen Thousand Five Hundred only) or in a freely convertiblecurrency. Electronic bidding will not be permitted. Late bids will berejected. Bids will be opened in the presence of the bidders representatives who choose to attend inperson at the address below at 15.30 hrs IST on 31.03.2014. column2: IN: Uttarakahand Decen Watershed Dev II
column4: Recruitment Of Field Ngo (fngo) Garhwal Division
column12: Indira Nagar Forest Colony
column18: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) INDIA UTTARAKHAND DECENTRALIZED WATERSHED DEVELOPMENT PROJECT (UDWDP) PHASE ?II Credit No.: P131235 Assignment Title: Recruitment of Field NGO (FNGO) GARHWAL DIVISION Reference No.05/UDWDP/2013-14 The Government of India has applied for financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Uttarakhand Decentralized WatershedDevelopment Project (UDWDP) Phase II and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consulting services. The consulting services ("the Services") shall broadly include facilitating/implementing the project as per the guidelinesagreed and asprescribed in the Project Operation Manual Financial Manual GP Manual Procurement Manual & the Guidelines asprescribed in the Environmental and Social Management Framework (ESMF). The objective is to develop an alternative approach tomainstream project implementation. The important implementation strategies under the project is Community Participation. Theresponsibility of the FNGO will be to undertake social mobilization of the communities and facilitate evolution of Self HelpGroups User Groups and other village level institutions along with Multidisciplinary Team (MDT) of the Project. The initial period of consultancy service is for the duration of five years and may be extended on year to yearbasis during the project period. The Watershed Management Directorate (WMD) IndiraNagar Dehradun Uttarakhand India under Watershed Management Department now invites eligible consulting NGO firms ("Consultants") toindicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultants (NGO) should provide information demonstrating that theyhave the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services. The shortlisting criteria are but not limited to: 1. Prospective FNGOs demonstrate that they have requisite capacityto perform the services (i.e. personnel and theirqualification/ experience number of supporting staff; the NGOs previous/ongoing experience of similar assignments in Himalayanregion and other places NGO registration etc.). 2. The FNGO has to be a registered NGO in India of repute and sound standing having relevant experience of executing WatershedManagement/ Rural Development projects preferably in participatory project/ externally aided project / hilly areas. It has to havean established infrastructure (physical/ human resources) having audited balance sheet for at least the last three years. The Terms of Reference (ToR) for the assignment detailed shortlisting criteria and other additional information related to thisprojectare available on our website atwww.wmduk.gov.in /www.gramya.in The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants[under IBRD Loansand IDA Credits & Grants] by World Bank Borrowers January 2011 ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the WorldBanks policy on conflict of interest. Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a joint venture or a sub consultancy to enhance their qualifications.The submission should clearly state the nature of Association (JV or sub-consultant). A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the Quality &Cost Based Selection (QCBS) method set out in the ConsultantGuidelines. Further information can be obtained at the address below during office hours i.e. 10:00 AM to 05:00 PM. Expressions of interest must be delivered in a written form to theaddress below (in person or by post) by 30th November 2013. Chief Project Director Watershed Management Directorate (WMD) Indira Nagar Forest Colony Dehradun Uttarakhand India Tel: +91-135-2768712 2760170 Fax: +91-135-2762839 2761002 E-mail: wmd-ua@nic.in Website: www.wmduk.gov.in/www.gramya.in

column2: IN: Uttarakahand Decen Watershed Dev II
column4: General Procurement Notice
column12: Indra Nagar Forest Colony
column18: GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE COUNTRY- INDIA NAME OF PROJECT-UTTARAKHAND DECENTRALIZED WATERSHED DEVELOPMENT PROJECT(GRAMYA)-II SECTOR- AGRICULTURE GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE- Loan No./Credit No./TF No./Grant No. Project ID No.-P131235 The Govt. of Uttarakhand has applied for financing in the amount of US$100 million equivalent from the World Bank towardthe cost of the Uttarakhand Decentralized Watershed Development Project(Gramya-II) with a total project cost of about US $ 150 Million andit intends to apply part of the proceeds to payments for goodsworks related services and consulting services to be procured under this project. This project will be jointly financed by theGovt. of Uttarakhand and World Bank. The project will include the following components A. Watershed Planning B. Watershed Treatment and Source Sustainability C. Rainfed Agriculture Development D. EnhancingLivelihood Opportunities E. Consolidation of Gramya ?I Activities F. Institutional Strengthening G. ProjectCoordination. The project will involve procurement of expert services for social mobilization of community members at the villagelevel project implementation as Partner NGOs technical support for Agribusiness External Monitoring and Evaluation and FinancialReview. These procurements will be carried out by WMD in accordance with the World Banks procedures and guidelines. Procurement of contracts financed by the World Bank will be conducted through the procedures as specified in the WorldBanks Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits (January 2011) and is open to all eligiblebidders as defined in the guidelines. Consulting services will be selected in accordance with the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment ofConsultants by World Bank Borrowers (January 2011). Specific procurement notices for contracts to be bid under the World Banks international competitive bidding (ICB)procedures and for contracts for consultancy services will be announced as they become available in UN Development Businessand dgMarket and widely circulated National and International technical magazines newspapers and trade publications. Prequalification of suppliers and contractorswill be required for the following contracts- 1. Field NGOs (2 No.) for social mobilization services 2. Partner NGOs (2- 4Nos.) forproject implementation 3. Agribusiness Support Agency(4- 6 Nos.) 4. External Consultant for Monitoring and Evaluation 5. Financial Review Consultant. Interested eligible bidders who wish to be included on the mailinglist to receive invitationsto prequalify/bid under ICB procedures and interested consultants who wish to receive a copy of advertisement requesting expressions of interest for consultancy contracts or those requiring additional information should contact the address below. Chief ProjectDirector Watershed ManagementDirectorate Indra Nagar Forest Colony Pincode-248001 Dehradun. Uttarakhand.India. Tel: 0091- 135- 2761002 27687122760170 Fax: 091-135-27628392761002 Web site: www.wmduk.gov.in www.gramya.in Email: wmd-ua@nic.in

column12: WB_ADMI Project Block-14/2 CIT Scheme-VIII(M) ICMARD Buildings 8th Floor Ultadanga
column18: INDIA West Bengal Accelerated Development of Minor Irrigation Project(WBADMIP). Consultancy Services for recruitment of human resources forDistrict Project Management Units (DPMUs) of WBADMIP (Assignment No. WBADMIP/DPMU/01/11-12) Loan No. 8090-IN / Credit No. 5014-IN Expressions ofInterest 1. This request forexpressions of interest follows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared in Development BusinessNo. WB2036-775/10 of May 102010. 2. TheGovernment of West Bengal through the Government of India has received aloan/credit from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD)/International Development Association (IDA) forthe Accelerated Development of Minor Irrigation Project and intends to apply part of the proceeds of this loan/credit topayments under the above mentioned Consultancy services. The project is intended to enhance the agriculturalproductivity of small and marginal farmers by providing adequate and dependable irrigation facilities round the year andintroducing multi-cropping systems and improved farming practices. The projectimplementation period is proposed for a period of six years. 3. The services include assistance to the18 District Project Management Units (DPMU) of the state in recruiting required staffselecting from the open market in the disciplines of Institutional Development Environmental Safeguards Procurements Project Evaluation & Monitoring and General Administration. This staff will be recruited to enable efficient management andimplementation of the project as per Terms of Reference (ToR) to be collected from the Project Director WBADMIP at the addressgiven below. 4. The ProjectDirector WBADMIP now invites eligible consultants/recruitment agencies to indicate their interest inproviding the above services in the prescribed format to be collected from the Project Director WBADMIP at the addressgiven below. The format and the ToR may also be downloaded from the website www.wbadmip.org. Interested consultants must provide information indicating that they are qualified toperform the services (with brochures description of similar assignments experience in similar conditions availability ofappropriate skills among staff etc.). Consultants may associate toenhance their qualifications. 5. Aconsultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines on Selection and Employment ofConsultants by World Bank Borrowers January 2011. 6. Interested consultants may obtain further information at the addressbelow on working days between 10-00 and 15-00 hours. 7. Expressions of interest must be deliveredto the address below by 10 January 2012 15-00 Hrs. The Project Director WB_ADMIProject Block-14/2 CIT Scheme-VIII(M) ICMARD Buildings 8 th Floor Ultadanga Kolkata-700067. Tel:+91-33-23567546/48/49 Fax: +91-33-23567547 e-mail: pd@wbadmip.org.

column10: West Bengal Accelerated Development of Minor Irrigation Project (WBADMIPP
column12: WB_ADMI Project Block-14/2 CIT Scheme-VIII(M) ICMARD Buildings 8th Floor Ultadanga
column18: INDIA West Bengal Accelerated Development of Minor Irrigation Project(WBADMIP). Outsourcing services of NGOs to the District Project Management Units(DPMU) of WBADMIP (Assignment No. WBADMIP/SO/01/11-12) Loan No. 8090-IN / Credit No. 5014-IN Expressions of Interest 1. This request forexpressions of interest follows the general procurement notice for this project that appeared in Development BusinessNo. WB2036-775/10 of May 102010. 2. TheGovernment of West Bengal through the Government of India has received aloan/credit from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD)/International Development Association(IDA) for the Accelerated Development of Minor Irrigation Project and intends to apply part of theproceeds of this loan/credit to payments under the above mentioned NGO services. The project is intended to enhance the agricultural productivity of small andmarginal farmers by providing adequate and dependable irrigation facilities round the year and introducing multi-cropping systemsand improved farming practices. The project implementation period is proposed for a periodof six years. 3. The major objectives of the NGOservices is to facilitate community mobilization and participation assist in formation of Water Users Association (WUA)strengthening through training and support programs ofthe community based institutions for successful implementation andsustainability of the irrigation schemes that will be constructed with assistance of the project andcapacity building for project staff and other relevant functionariesto be better able to provide long-term support to andmonitoring of WUAs in 18 districts of the state. A successful NGO will work in oneor more districts and for a specific number of years the number of districts and the contract duration depending on the number ofWUAs to be supported in a district. 4. The ProjectDirector WBADMIP now invites eligible NGOs to indicate their interest in providing theservices as perTerms of References (ToR) that are available from the Project Director WBADMIP at the address given below. The letter of interest by the NGOs should accompany the informationasked in Annexure-1 of the ToR. The ToRand other documents are also available in the project website www.wbadmip.org. 5. The NGOs will beselected in accordance with the World Banks Guidelines on selection and employment of Consultants and Guidelines for Procurementunder IBRD Loan and IDA Credit. 6. Interested NGOs mayobtain further information at the address below on working days between10-00 and 15-00 hours. 7. Expressions ofinterest must be delivered to the address below by 10 January 2012 15-00 Hrs. The Project Director WB_ADMI Project Block-14/2 CIT Scheme-VIII(M) ICMARD Buildings 8 th Floor Ultadanga Kolkata 700067. Tel:+91-33-23567546/48/49 Fax: +91-33-23567547 e-mail: pd@wbadmip.org.

column18: State Project ManagementUnit Integrated Coastal Zone Management (ICZM)Project West Bengal Institute of Environmental Studies &Wetland Management Department of Environment Government of West Bengal Invitation for Expressionof Interest Credit no. # 4765 ?0 IN Consultancy to provide Techno-Economic Feasibility and TransactionAdvisory Services for Integrated Solid Waste Management (ISWM) at area under Digha Sankarpur Development Authority EoI. No. 003 /2011-12 Date: December XX 2011 1. The Government of Indiahas received a credit from the International Development Association towards the cost of Integrated Coastal ZoneManagement Project (ICZMP) in India and intends to apply a portion of the funds to eligible payments under this Contract for whichthis Expression of Interest is issued. 2. Digha Sankarpur DevelopmentAuthority (DSDA) is one of the coastal tourism destinations in West Bengal with a population of 31000 and average annual touristfoot fall of 25 lakhs. The Additional Project Director State Project Management Unit (SPMU)ICZM Project West Bengal now invites proposal to provide "Techno-Economic Feasibility and Transaction Advisory Services forIntegrated Solid Waste Management (ISWM)" at area under Digha Sankarpur Development Authority under ICZM Project WestBengal. 3. The objective of thisConsultancy is to:  Prepare a techno-economic feasibility study for an ISWM covering Action Plan; and analyze and finalizeimplementation options such as EPCDBO and other PPP options  Provide Transaction Advisory services for implementation of selected options of ISWM includingassistance for bidding process 4. SPMU ICZM Project WestBengal now invites eligible Consultants to indicate their interest in providing these Services. Interested consultants must provide information indicating that theyare qualified to perform the Services [brochuresduration of the firm qualification and experience of consultants description of similarassignments undertaken as detailed aboveand skills of key personnelfinancial capability and availability of facilities with the firm. 5. Consultants may associate to enhance their qualifications. The EOI submitted by consultants in associationor consortium should clearly indicate the name of the lead firm [The "Association" or "Consortium" maytake the form of a jointventure (with joint and several liability) or of a sub-consultancy] and nature of association or consortium. 6. A consultant will be selectedin accordance with the procedures set out in the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by BankBorrowers May 2004 Revised October 2006 and May 2010. 7. Interested Consultants mayobtain further information from the Contact Person between 10 AM And 5 PM on all working days. 8. Expression of Interest mustbe delivered to the above-mentioned address by no later than 5 PM on or before January 2 2012. column12: PROJECT MANAGEMENT UNITODISHA STATE ROADS PROJECTO/O THE ENGINEER-IN-CHIEF(CIVIL)ODISHANIRMAN SOUDHABHUBANESWAR
column18: OFFICE OF THEENGINEER-IN-CHIEF (CIVIL) ODISHA NIRMAN SOUDHAKESHARI NAGAR UNIT ? V BHUBANESWAR ? 751 001 Letter No. PMU ? WB ? 9 /2012 - 24946 Dt. 31.07.2012 REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES ? FIRMS SELECTION) INDIA ODISHASTATE ROADS PROJECT Loan No.: 7577IN Construction Supervision of Jagatpur ?Chandbali Road The State Government of Odishathrough Government of India has received financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Odisha State Roads Project andintends to apply part of the proceeds for consulting services. The consulting services ("theServices") include construction supervision services as "Engineer" for one of the Construction Package of Phase 2 of Projectextending about 106 kms of strengthening and widening of a major district road from Jagatpur to Chandbali. The duration of thesupervision consultant services will be about 48 months. The civil works for the abovecorridors will consist mainly of strengthening and widening of the existing single or intermediate-lane width to double lane widthwith paved / soft shoulders. The work will also consist of construction rehabilitation and replacement of a number of crossdrainage structures including some major and minor bridges and roadside drains. Certain road stretches may also require roadsafetyprovision such as sidewalks pedestrian crossings parking etcwith social & environmental safeguards. The Chief Engineer World Bank Projects Odishaon behalf of the Government of Odisha now invites eligible consulting firms ("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providingthe Services. Interested Consultants should provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications andrelevant experience to perform the Services. The short-listing criteria are: i. Experience of Construction Supervisionas "Engineer" in Highway Projects of similar complexity ( at least 150 lane-km) in developed countries (one project) and developingcountries (three projects) from 2006 to 2011-12; ii. Experience in undertaking Social &Environmental Assessment of Highway Projects of similar complexity ( at least 150 lane-km) for at least two projects from2006-2011-12; iii. Annual turnover of more than INR 300Million for each of the FY 2008-09 2009-10 and 2010-11 as per audited financial statements. iv. Number of Key Supervision Staffs ( Highway Engineer Contract Management Specialists SocialDevelopment Specialist Environment Specialist Road Safety Specialist BridgeEngineer Material Engineer and Quantity Surveyor ) on companyspayroll The attention of interestedConsultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Banks Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants[under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants] by WorldBank Borrowers January 2011 ("Consultant Guidelines") setting forth the World Bankspolicy on conflict of interest. Consultants may associate withother firms in the form of a joint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications. A Consultant will be selected inaccordance with the Quality and Cost Basedselection method set out in the Consultant Guidelines. Further information can be obtained at the address belowduringoffice hours. Expressions of interest must bedelivered in a written form to the address below (in person or by mail or by fax or by e-mail) by 17:00 Hours on 27 th August2012. Sd/- N K Pradhan Chief Engineer World BankProjectsOdisha Office of the Engineer-in-Chief (Civil) Odisha Nirman Soudha Keshari Nagar Unit ?
